reviewText: $15.00 a bag! Can't be beat. For 40 pounds of cat litter you get AMAZING quality for such a low price with Precious Cat. I absolutely love this litter. Let me start by saying it's natural and it's 100% safe for cats. The soft texture gives cats the perfect place to do their much needed pre-bathroom digging and after-bathroom burying. It's even great for poor declawed cats that develop arthritis and have issues using the litter box. This litter is usually soft enough for cats with those kinds of issues.I've tried a few different kinds of litter. Some have horrible additives (baking soda = no no! That can dry out your poor kitties skin). Others have really strong odors (cats have much more sensitive noses than ours and those strong fragrances can be overwhelming). And then there's the ones with horrible textures that no cat enjoys using the bathroom in.This is a win on all accounts. There are no ridiculous fragrances and no strong additives. It's natural clay litter with a texture that cats ENJOY using. My feline children genuinely get upset when I change their litter box- they don't want me taking this digging stuff away! Of course they're much more grateful when they see I've replaced it with new and cleaner digging stuff. This litter has an amazing ability to block odors. Using it with three cats and changing after about five days- there is virtually no smell in my bathroom. Amazing- very few other litters have accomplished such a feat.It is clumping litter and does it's job very well. I don't sift out the clumps, I simply just change the entire litter box every 5 days. Works fine for me. Some people have complained about pee clumps sticking to the bottom. This only happens with me when I haven't changed the litter often enough and then very large lumps of pee occur and the have no were to go- so they stick to the bottom of the box. A quick way to get rid of them is to use a litter scoop and scrape them off the bottom. Then add just a bit of clean litter, use it as an abrasive to rub the bottom, it will pick up the leftover pee clumps, and then you can dump out that litter- wah lah a clean box!Overall I just LOVE the quality of this stuff! It doesn't stink and my cats LOVE it! I had a small panic attack when I tried to order and it wouldn't ship to Alaska! Luckily that changed about a week later and we're back to ordering more. This is my ONLY choice for litter.
summary: Three Cats, My One Go-To Litter

reviewText: This is an excellent cat litter. I've been using it for years and it works just as promised. Highly recommended.

I must admit I've only tried two other litters since I got my two cats (approximately 3 years ago), but this is the best litter I've tried so far and I think my hunt is over. This isn't super cheap, though it's still as cheap as a grocery store brand like Scoop Away, but it's more economical as it seems to take less to absorb my kitties' dirty business. I had tried World's Best litter and though it smelled nice, it was expensive and the cats went through it like the little divas they are with no respect for my budget. This stuff clumps great, the smell is nonexistent, even World's Best wasn't as effective at neutralizing odor, and one bag lasts me quite a while. And not to mention the awesomeness of Amazon prime and the money/time I save not having to hoof it to the store, lug a heavy bag, wait in a line, gas up the car, etc. Amazon Prime is the best.

I have one mom cat and 5 kittens. I use 2 litter boxes, both which get cleaned twice daily. I started out using fresh step, which did well at controlling the odor with the addition of baking soda but was excessively dusty, to the point of coating my entire dining room (where the kittens live and the litter boxes are located) and inducing constant sneezing in my cats.I put out fresh step and precious cat at the same time to see which my cats preferred. There was a clear preference, with the Precious Cat litter box much fuller than the other. My cats vote was for Precious Cat!I was pleased at the lack of dust with precious cat. I also like the strong clumping properties. The clumps are tight, dry, and do not break apart too badly.However, I have been very disappointed at the lack of odor control despite the addition of baking soda. The smell of ammonia is overwhelming regardless of how frequently I clean the litterbox. I should clarify that I used this in an open and closed litter box. My intention was to use it permanently in the enclosed one, which it did very poorly at controlling odor versus other litters. In the open box it wasn't so bad, obviously the odors dissipated better.If you have an open box it's probably adequate.The search for the perfect litter continues.
summary: Great Clumping, Dust Free, But No Odor Control

reviewText: While this litter is just a little bit on the dusty side (but not to the point of being a problem for us), it clumps really well. Our cats have so far seemed to like it (though maybe a little too much, since they sometimes dig for a whole minute before deciding their work is done).I don't have all that much experience with cat litters because I've really only used this stuff so far. It's worked for us to the point of not needing to try anything else, so I'd say that, all-in-all, it's a great product.

My cats love that litter (One of them has asthma and allergies), no perfume or die. This litter may be a tad more expensive, but it last longer than traditional litter. It is has no odor and hardly any dust.

I've been looking and looking for better litter. Litter that actually clumps and stays clumped. I've tried many other brands, but was really unsatisfied. Finally I tried Precious Cat because of other reviews here and wow! This litter is simply the best. Clumps don't break when scooping and litter boxes are very easy to clean. Do yourself a favor and get this litter, you won't be disappointed.
This is a great litter. It clumps hard, low on dust, no obvious scent, and the odor protection is great. The price is on par with other quality brands. Only issue is it tracks pretty bad.
summary: Great litter but tracking an issue.

reviewText: ok but doesn't clump as well as others, the clumps separate some. Just used Tidy cat and was amazed and I have tried everything.
summary: there are betters out there...but one of the tops

reviewText: No dust, no stinky fake perfume smells my cat hates that are also awful for her.  Use this with the litter box (sold on Amazon) that you roll to the left, roll to the right and pull out the drawer, disposing of the cat droppings, and your life has just been MADE!

So I've tried many different litters.  There's the easy scoop sandy stuff that clumped well but got stinky fast and tracked everywhere.  Then there were pine pellets which did a great job on urine odor but left a pine stink all over the house and did not clump.  Decided to switch after that to a wheat litter (Swheat Scoop).  That one clumped great and neutralized urine odor pretty well, but the litter itself stank!  And after a few loads of urine, a smell all it's own was created (like rancid flour/puke/stench) that crept along at floor level and would tickle our noses.  It also did not mask fecal odor very well at all and contributed to that rancid smell.  Also dusts significantly and the cat was always doing that cough/wheeze.Enter Dr Elsey's Ultra Precious Cat:  I did not expect much.  It completely destroys urine odor.  The litter is just about scentless and has very low dust (although a little when you pour it in).  The cat is already doing the cough/wheeze much less.  Once he covers the turds, the litter takes care of the odor.  It does track a bit near the box, but I keep a dustbuster nearby for that.  NBD.Gone are the days of walking in the door and being punched in the face by the smell of poo and/or dirty litter stench (or even clean litter as far as pine and wheat are concerned).  Just ordered a second bag for the other box.  This was just a test run but it has turned into a success.

I would recommend this product to all cat-lovers who accept the 2-3 times a day task of "cleaning" their precious pets litter box.  It looks like the brand I was currently purchasing from Sam's Club, but there is a definite difference in reduction of "dust" created, both from kitty and myself---also "clumping power" is best yet---what more could we ask??  I'm "sold" on this brand of litter, plan to continue ordering it, and would recommend to ANY of my cat-lover friends.
hand's down, this stuff is the best. I've tried everything you can find at the grocery store, and nothing compares. Literally no dust, clumps quick and the best odor control ever!
summary: Better than any other cat litter I've tried.

reviewText: Agree with everyone else, this stuff is great. Clumps so well, and is easy to scoop. It also manages to keep odour out as much as possible - it will always smell of course, nothing is perfect. However, this does as well getting rid of scent as Arm and Hammer and clumps far better, so I'm sold!
summary: Love this stuff! Never going back

reviewText: This litter clumps really well. Never gets stuck to the bottom of the pan. Not too dusty either. Only problem is, our cat tends to track it a little on his paws, but not too far. usually that means having to vacuum around the pan regulary.
summary: Great price on a great product

reviewText: This has become a favorite cat litter.  I find it tracks less than most and it does what it's intended to do.

We have been using this clumping litter for six months, with excellent results:  no dust, no odor, secure clumps, cat is happy.  For the last two weeks we have used it with the omega-paw rollover box, and are pleasantly surprised at how little it takes to work perfectly.  This makes it an even better buy.

This is the best clumping litter I've ever used. Not only is it cheap, but it's saved us money purely because it clumps and reduces waste. We used to dump the whole litter box and start fresh every couple of weeks, but now we can just clean out the clumps and add litter instead of dumping the whole box.

the first purchase was the cat attract litter and my cats lterally played in it. they love it! then, i bought the sprinkle stuff attractant. it was ok, i cannot tell if it worked, really. then, i purchased this. not too much dust when i poured it in. the cats don't mind the litter at all. urine clumps at top and doesnt go all the way to the bottom, puddles, then clumps. it appears to be working beautifully after 3 days - no smells.
summary: this is not my first purchase from the brand

reviewText: I have always though cat litter was all the same. This stuff is magic, I think. Even if I don't get to cleaning out the litter box as quickly as I intend, there is no smell. My cat has fairly smelly urine for some reason - however this stuff has taken that away completely. Also, this litter clumps great! Cleaning out is super easy as it clumps enough to get the waste out, but not too much where litter is wasted. I don't think I will ever try another kind of litter now. This stuff has done wonders! I recommend it to everyone. Even if you don't have a cat, buy this stuff.

I have a regular, slightly skiddish one year old cat. He is not picky about his litter box or what kind of litter it has in it. Seeing as how I have yet to train Mr. Kitty to do his business outside (if anyone has tips on this please let me know), I am forced to make do with a gross litter box. For the past year I have used Tidy Cat (the blue one). It is okay, not great, but it works. There is always a smell after he does his business, but it goes away eventually. The clumps sometimes hold together, sometime don't.Wishing I didn't have to use the litter box at all, I am searching for a way to make it as less of a problem as possible. I use a round Booda litter box with a lid and two liners to prevent tearing. I have a large rubber mat to prevent tracking. The Tidy Cats does an alright job with tracking. I vacuum the laundry room every day still.I decided to try this new litter, after reading great reviews and it being worth the extra money. $7 more for about the same amount of litter (give or take). The clumps are hard which I like. No more little bits that go through the holes of the sifter. I do think the smell is reduced too. Maybe a little smell after use, but for the most part not nearly as bad smelling as before. I would say the tracking is the same. Or I'm starting to think Mr. Kitty just throws it out the box for fun. Nevertheless I'm still vacuuming daily.Overall is it worth the extra price? I really don't think so. I'm kind of cheap, and just want something that gets the job done. If I saw a significant difference I would keep buying it. But I think I'll keep searching.
summary: Good, but is it worth the price?

reviewerName: MeandMy Baby "Peace is the only way."
reviewText: Litter is expensive and good litter is gonna be expensive, this is good litter but per pound not at all as expensive as others. I will say, Amazon has had issues delivering this on time despite having the "prime" membership. So far so good here! It clumps well, is far from dust free, but our cats seem to like it. We were using the cat attract, have seen once of twice a regress back to her previous peeing on mat in front of box, but keeping the box clean is key... which includes waiting til it is very low in litter, emptying it ALL the way out, and we use simple green to soak the box, then wipe with a paper towel, and let dry for a moment... fill it back up. When/if it begins to clump hard on bottom of the box, that needs to be removed or it will continue. Hope this helps you.
summary: Litter is expensive and good litter is gonna be expensive

reviewText: I like this litter and kitty has been using it for a few months now . However , with urin clumps little pieces break off and I spend countless minutes scooping little bits out of the litter. My cat tends to urinate against the side of the box which causes bits to break off when I clean the box. I even switched to the Omega Paw box , which works as advertised, but I still have to go in and scoop out all the little bits that break off the urine clumps.All the review ranted and raved about how easy and clean this litter is and while I agree with most of them, this issue has me looking for a different litter. I would give it 5 stars if it clumped better!
summary: No litter smell or dust ...... but there is a down side

reviewText: I am not impressed with this litter. It's extremely overpriced. I can buy regular clumping litter from the store for 1/4 of this price for 20 lbs. and it will last longer and still do the job. It's also very messy. It's all over my floors, whereas other litters don't seem to make it all over the place. I will not buy this again.

I am at a complete loss for words, when it comes to writing a product feedback review for this litter! As I search for words to describe this product, I can only come up with MAGNIFICENT!! I am not very familiar with ownership of a cat, therefore I only can rely on my personal experience with my mother's cat we have here at home. I 1st noticed that the litter he was using never clumped up and the bottom of the litter pan was soaking wet when we went to change the litter.. So wet, that one day when I tried to take it out all of the litter felt out the bottom of the bag. I do not have that problem ANY MORE! This product is so terrific that it makes large clumps when our cat urinates, anywhere in the litter box! Making it very easy to clean the litter box and not having to clean it as often as I used to. I now can clean the litter box every other day and I've noticed that it doesn't have to be changed as often nor does it have any odor. We do plan on slowly transitioning him to this litter alone from Fresh Step Crystal litter. By the way, I am not being paid, endorsed or persuaded to say any of the words I have stated. This is just my honest opinion of a Very Well-Made product, and I would not HESITATE TO BUY IT AGAIN!

I like other's read the reviews on this litter , and it has got to be the most over-rated one on the market...I'm truly not trying to be harsh , but after I saw what came out of the bag , a massive amount of dust { I suffer from Asthma } , the feel is terrible { like cement or clay } After just one pee, It felt like I was digging up a hard clump of it , it was that hard and heavy in the scoop..We are clean freaks when it comes our fur babies boxes..This , however was not only a waste of $$$ , but it caused some distress as well...I had to buy an extra bag of our normal brand { we did not have any problems , just thought from reviews this  might be a better option } I'm not going to do that again, when I have a tried and true product , going to stay with it..~!~October 2 , 2013 : I finally found a litter ,that I'm extremely happy with , it is ground walnut shells by Blue ,called Naturally Fresh ...It is dark { brown } in color , and with the usual 3 inch level , it has no odor , and clumps really well..We clean it out 3-4 times a day { if needed } and at no time can you smell anything ..It to me , has a mild sweet smell..We bought the largest bag available, I put a 2 cup measuring cup in the bag and as we clean out the boxes , if needed we add a few scoops..So far this is the best...We get it at Pet-Co...It may run a little bit more, but it's a large bag 26 lbs..  It can last up to a month , as long as you clean and fill to the 3 inch level..So far these last 4 weeks have been wonderful for us and our girls..It being natural walnut shells { maybe they enhanced the color } but I'm truly loving it..Little to no tracking , and when they clean their paws , I don't freak out over potential chemicals putting them in harms way..~!~

Most cat litter contains 1 to 2% dust.  So with a 40 pound bag, that is 6 oz to almost a pound of dust per bag!  Think how much dust that adds up to in a year!  I love the 99.9% dust free.  It really is.  When I pour this bag into another container, there is no cloud of dust billowing out like I had with the other types of litter.

Have been using this litter for about 2 weeks. The clumping action is VERY strong. No litter odor at all, w/o the annoying masking odors that other cat litters use (scoop away). Also hardly any dust while cleaning the litter box.Have used scoop away (very very very dusty, strong deodorant smell), tidy cats (not bad, some deodorant smell, more dust than this brand) and feline pine (does not clump, cats don't like it- peed on my bed instead) and so far, this one is our favorite. It's a bit more expensive, but worth it for having less dust, less smell and better clumping power.
Best cat litter I've found so far. Holds together decently, not too messy, our cat has no problems with it. Isn't wonderful at containing smell though.

I've gone through so many different brands of cat litter that it was becoming ridiculous. I could not find a brand that wouldn't overly clump, absorbed oder, and was easy to clean up.I found this product and gave it a try, and man is it amazing!Pros:- Easy to clean up- Cats seem to enjoy it- Absorbs oder- Clumps very nice.

Scented perfumes are not the kind of things you want getting on your kitties paws I suspect. They lick their paws and that means those perfumes are now in their bodies. I don't think there is any impact from a few dips of the little paws. But imagine months of this and then years of this.If you are cleaning your litter box regularly you won't need the scented stuff anyways and frankly I'm not willing to take chances with my cats.It clumps great. I don't know what else you need from litter? You'll like it.

I have a kitten for the first time in YEARS.  I forgot how smelly cats can be if you don't have the right litter.  I tried 3 or 4 different brands from amazon and my local pet store, but based on the many positive reviews I went with this one.  I'm so happy that I did!  The price is excellent compared with other brands for the quality.  Speaking of quality - I haven't found anything better than this yet!  I had to set a reminder on my phone to remind me to clean it out regularly, because there is no smell if you use enough of the stuff.  Very highly recommended!
summary: Can't believe I didn't know about this sooner

reviewText: Precious cat is on par with arm and hammer and tidy cats in terms of odor control and tracking. all three brands do an okay job in their non deodorized versions, but let's face it, cat byproducts are pretty stinky. i think it's inherent in litter to track, and precious cat doesn't track more or less than the national brands. i would choose a litter based on price - bought this because it was price competitive and in the future would purchase on these terms.
summary: No better or worse than other clay based litters

reviewText: I have to use clay litter against my will; I have one cat who refuses to use anything else :-(  If I have to use clay I choose this brand as it is low dust and clumps great.

I have used many different types of cat litter over the years, this one tops the list. All of the litters I have used in the past have some tracking, dust issues. Not this one, I get up in the morning and there is very little litter on the floor, the dust really is a non-issue with this one. It does clump very well holds it shape so you can scoop it out. No smell or very little, one problem is it is rather heavy.

I bought this because of the rave reviews on it, not to mention it's a pretty good price for the amount of litter you get.  My cat tracks this stuff all over the house.  I find litter everywhere! Ugh.  It seems to clump well, but every "clumping" litter I've ever bought seems to clump well.  I didn't think I'd mind the fact that this is odorless, but I do.  It doesn't cover up the bad smells that come out of my cat in the form of waste!  I guess I just need to buy scented-litter from now on.  Also, if your cat tends to urinate in one place in the litter box- beware.  This stuff cakes onto the litter box and it's really hard to get off.  It smears on and you have to scrape it over and over again to remove it- not to mention you inhale ammonia the entire time you're doing it.  Ugh- just not super pleased with this stuff.  Two stars because it doesn't totally suck and also because it was delivered to my front door and I didn't have to carry the 40-lb bag from the store.
summary: Not sure what the hootin' and hollerin' is about.....

reviewText: Biggest reason for me choosing this, I got free shipping with my Amazon Prime.  Well worth it to me, 40 lbs shipped to my door for free. Helps me out a lot since I have ms.  Seems to work great with the cat box you roll side to side to clean...love them both!

The litter clumps when it is supposed to, not much else to say. My only issue is with the product packaging when purchasing from Amazon which around 20 - 25% of the time arrives with a rip in the litter bag, which means a huge mess when trying to take it out of the box. But I've left packaging feedback and can only hope for the best, does not make sense to take down a star on the product just because of the packaging. Cat has not expressed any issues with it, and that's good enough for me.
summary: Great product.. does what it is supposed to

reviewText: I switched from a very expensive corn litter that smelled bad after a week. I have 2 cats and scoop my one LARGE litter box morning and night. One of my kitties is a raker and he would get in and break up what clumps there were in the old litter. With Precious Cat, the clumps form instantaneously and they are like rocks! Kitty has stopped raking for lack of results. Because I'm now scooping up so much more, the litter is lasting much longer without odor! I never thought an unscented litter could control odor so well. I have never wanted my cats to be exposed to the fragrance chemicals, so I just put up with the odor. Until now!I do not find PC to track less, but for me that is not a big issue - they all track. In addition to this new litter, I picked up a Litter Genie to scoop into and I highly recommend the two products to completely odor-proof you cat box area.

My little Mocha Latte came home from the shelter with a virus. She was sneezing like crazy. I dusted and vacuumed so she'd breathe better. Then I thought about the litter. I had gotten plain clay litter because I didn't want perfume, but I noticed a big cloud of dust came up when I poured it in.I looked online and chose this litter. It is very low dust so she doesn't kick up dust every time she goes. It doesn't really smell like anything. I like the finer consistency. Because it gets more "coverage" she doesn't feel like she has to keep covering until she kicks it out of the box.It clumps up on urine well, too, so I can just remove the poops and urine clumps with a scooper from both her boxes twice a day, baggie it and throw it away.Glad I found this. It's a good bargain. Be sure to get a large container to put all 40 pounds of it in.
This litter didn't work well at all!  It didn't clump, it was dusty, and it didn't do anything for covering up the smell.

Wow, I'm sold.  This stuff is great.  I'm tired of getting a nose full of heavly scented dust when I empty the litter boxes filled with other name brand litter.  Precious Cat lives up to all claims on the package.  I will buy again.  No smell from litter box used by two cats.

This stuff is amazing!Our 12 year old cat has eschewed ALL litter types when it comes to pooh......But NOT Dr. Elsey's!It claims to attract cats, and it DOES!  No more little, brown piles near the box....but never IN the box.HOORAY!And one more, very important plus:  there is almost NO gravel dust.  I kid you not!  No cloud of particulates to contaminate my cats eyes and lungs....OR mine!  None.  Zip.  Nada.Good stuff!  I'm slowly converting all the litter boxes over to Dr. Elsey's.Maybe you cat-people out here should think about doing this, too!

Best cat litter ever. There's no dust that comes up when you scoop, it clumps exceptionally well, and is odorless. Best of all, it gets delivered straight to my doorstep so I don't have to haul it around PetSmart, to my car, and then to my house.My only complaint is that the price is inconsistent. When I first started purchasing this product, it was around the $21 price range. It then went up in price for a few months to full MSRP ($29.99). I continued to purchase it, because that's how much I like a) having cat litter delivered with Amazon Prime and b) this particular cat litter. I guess I can't really complain because now at $16 it's significantly cheaper than when I first started purchasing, but it'd be nice to only ever see the price go down.
summary: Best Cat Litter. Can't Beat Prime.

reviewText: Precious Cat is well worth the expense if you want a litter that does not have a lot of dust.  I did see a noticeable difference between this and Tidy Cats.  Added bonus is it gets delivered right to my door step!

Does not minimize feces odor at all, urine turns into a block of cement. I rake the litter box at least 3x daily-my 2 cats will not tolerate a mess except for overnight-they've trained me well.Worlds Best is the only litter I can truly say lasts, masks any odors until I get to clean up and is actually flushable-though where I currently live, this cannot be done, plumbing is very old.A 34lb bag of Worlds Best Litter lasts me 4-5 weeks for 2 cats in a jumbo box, using about 15 lbs per 2.5 wks.

This is an excellent product. I have two cats. Purchase this product online and was so satisfied I decided to buy more.  Found it at Petsmart and elsewhere for only $15.00 for the same 40 Lb bag. HALF the price. So glad I found it but seriously disapointed I paid double that amount the first time.  Highly recommend product.
summary: The best but buy at Petsmart for cheaper

reviewText: Next to no dust is what I was looking for. Great clumping. Never going back to the industrial respirator needing "dust bowl" days.

This may be a good cat litter if your litter box is out in the garage or shed. This stuff does not hide any odors. I figured I'd give it a chance with all the good reviews I've read. This stuff does not really clump up either. I've been using Fresh Step for the last 15 years. Now I know why. Hope this helped.

Very happy with this litter. Cat accepted it without problem. Dust practically nonexistent, almost no tracking, very good clumping, no scent but still does great job with odor control. Definitely a value in every way. I feel no need to try anything else.
summary: Litter does a terrific job at a great price.

reviewText: After reading the reviews for this product, I wanted to give it a try.  The review that did concern me was the one with the cons about sodium bentonite.  I did my google research on it and read the many uses for this clay and still feel it is as good as it gets.  It is totally dust free which is a huge factor for my cats. Seriously, when you clean the box, there is NO dust.  It also has the best odor control of any I've found and the clumping power is amazing.  The one issue I did not like was how it turned into cement on the bottom or sides of the litter box after my cats urinate.  I have found a great solution for that, at least we like it.  After I clean the 3 boxes I have set up, I spray them with criso non stick cooking spray and then wipe off any excess.  It makes the litter box virtually non-stick and the clumps come out of the litter without any problems.  We have tried just about every litter out there from corn to wheat and ground walnuts to recycled newspaper even to pine and this seems like the best option for us.  Plus, our cats agree without any of them having a problem with it and ours don't eat the litter so that's a good thing.  So in conclusion, for us, this one is the keeper.

I have to disagree with most of the reviews of this product. One of my cats won't even use the bathroom in the box. I ended up buying Arm & Hammer's Super Scoop and OMG! It's so much better! My cat uses it, the smell control is better, the texture is softer and it doesn't leave that mess on the bottom of the pan that you have to scrape up! I will never use anything else again.
summary: Not as good as everyone says

reviewText: My two precious cats poop.  All.  Day.  Long.  Seriously.  I can't get over the amount of bodily waste that comes out of my two beautiful kittens on a daily basis.  It is astounding.Thankfully there is Precious Cat litter to save the day.  I live in a small one bedroom apartment with all of this cat poop, but it doesn't smell one bit.  This is by far the best litter I have ever used.  It clumps wonderfully and absorbs the smell completely.  Unless one of these rascals decides not to cover, I never smell anything.I order the 40lb bag from Amazon about every 6 weeks and the Prime service is amazing.  It saves me so much effort from having to go out and buy a heavy bag and carry it up 2 flights of stairs.So get this litter and get you cats pooping in no time!  No smell, no mess, no carrying a huge bag up the stairs!
summary: Two precious cats and their poop

reviewText: My kitten did not like it and refused to use this litter. I had to switch back to her old one because she really did not want use this one. I did however purchase the Dr. Elsey's kitten attract to mix with this one and hope that she will like it in the future because throwing it away would be a waste.

I have four cats, one of which does NOT use the litter box--an issue that has plagued me since she was a kitten. After getting a clean bill of health from the vet, I set out to try and find a litter that might entice her to use the box. Clay based, natural, clumping, non clumping; I tried them all. I had been using a natural corn based litter for the past few months and was relatively happy with it--except that Lola was still not using the box, instead going both pee and poo around the box area.I recently was laid off from one of two jobs and realized that I had to cut back on litter expenses. The corn based litter was a bit pricey and, with four cats, a 10 pound bag last maybe 3-4 weeks. I decided to check out Amazon to see if I could snag a good deal with my Prime shipping. Am I glad that I did! A 40 pound bag of litter for $17 and some change? Yes please! Even better, it's natural and perfume free.It's been almost two weeks since I received this litter. It's one of, if not the, best litter that I've used thus far. The clumps don't fall apart when you're scooping them, it covers odors reasonably well, and so far I've used maybe 1/4-1/3 of the bag (including what is currently in the box). Best of all, Lola has started using the litter box! Not all the time, but I'd estimate that her box usage has gone from 5-10% to 60-70%. Not perfect but certainly better than nothing! Just a note that I haven't used any additionally litter attractant, just the plain litter from the bag.I will probably need to order another bag in 3-4 weeks and I will do so gladly.

I've been using slightly more expensive ones (lately, Arm & Hammer and Ever Clean, both with odor control), and decided give this cheaper option a try, and looks like I'm here to stay.ODOR CONTROL: Weirdly enough, this product is certainly not smellier than the aforementioned ones (even though it does not boast odor control), If anything I have less of an odor problem now.CLUMPING: As other reviewers, said, the urine clumps tend to stick to the bottom and form giant clumps (more like a clay layer), but you can break those in 3-5 seconds into smaller clumps and put them away, Honestly, I don't see how this ended up being a big deal for some.DUST-CONTROL: Yes, this is probably a primary reason why I I'm intending to stick with this litter, this is the least dust-producing litter I've used.PACKAGING: I prefer this products packaging to others too, especially to the flimsy cardboard covers. It is very thick plastic that does not arrive damaged, and you can cut a small hole to easily pour controlled amounts each time.
summary: Not perfect but certainly a viable option

reviewText: We usually purchase another brand of litter but recently they changed their scent. I never had asthma before but had a hard time breathing when handling that brand. Our cats also developed sneezing and itching, so I searched for an unscented brand. I had used the Precious Cat Attract Litter for a cat that had a relapse in using her litter box after a urinary tract infection so I decided to give this a try. I am glad I did. The litter is not quite as fine texture but that doesn't effect it's clumping ability. The clumps stay firm even when the cats dig around and there is a lot less dust. The cats are no longer sneezing and I can breathe too! Even though this product is unscented, it does a great job with odor control too.

This litter is horrible.  It starts stinking immediately but, even worse, it is SO difficult to scoop.  Pee combines with the litter to turn into a paste that sticks to the scooper and litter box.  I have switched back to World's Best Cat Litter and appreciate it so much more after trying this.  I have a whole bunch left and don't know what to do with it.
summary: I don't know why this litter has such good ratings!

reviewText: After reading reviews I decided to try this since I had been using crystal litter for the past year which starts to smell really bad after a week.This is great.  Clumps well and works great with our rolling Omega Paw litter box.  Sometimes the clump sticks to the back corner when I roll it - probably because our cat always goes in the same exact spot and I only roll it once a day.  I just use a scooper to knock it free.  No smells and absolutely no dust.
summary: Works great with the Omega Paw

reviewText: This litter is very low dust, clumps hard, like bricks! And works so well in my LitterMaid that I almost never smell feces. Never smell the urine at all. I'm disabled, and this litter does such a good job of self cleaning the LitterMaid pan that I only have to empty the hopper every other day. No bits and pieces left behind in the tray. Even if there are, they are rendered odorless. Now the only problem is that the cats have to use the box at least twice each after I put new litter in. I swear, its like a kitty poopy relay race.

Literally.I used this litter for the first 3 months of having my cat. I had never had a cat before him. I thought the unbearable stench was normal. He eats Wellness grain free wet food. Every time he would use the litter box, it would stink up the entire downstairs. We started calling it his 'super power' - able to repel the bad guys! All jokes aside, it just plain stunk. I was scooping all the time. And the clumps for Precious Cat Ultra Premium would fall apart when I scooped (that meant little 'stink balls' would mix in with the clean litter). My cat's urine would end up as a flat pancake on the bottom of the litter box that I would have to scrape off, and then it would fall to pieces (yes, I used several inches of litter).The bag was heavy, and I didn't like using clay litter in general. But I bought into all the 5 star reviews here. What a mistake.I finally complained to my friend, who has had cats on-and-off her whole life. She told me to tryWorld's Best Cat Litter, Multiple Cat Clumping Formula, 7 lbs.. I even bought their formula for multiple cats, even though I have just one.Finally some relief!His 'super power' has lessened considerably! Now I only need to scoop once or twice a day. And the clumps are solid as a rock.I am so glad I switched litters to World's Best.

Wow. yes, believe the positive reviews here.This litter is awesome.  I have used brand names and even feline pine and the natural 'corn feed' from the feed n' seed stores.  they all dont hold a candle to this litter.Pros:-very minimal litter scattering.  I am amazed how little litter is tracked outside.  I think this is so b/c the texture of this litter is like the non-clumping clay.  unlike most clumping litter out there, this isnt fine fine granules, nor dust. (only dusty when you pour the litter but very minor compared to other clumping litter out there)-no perfumes.  Hate when companies add this thinking this will mask the stench.  I also hate the thought of my Mocha licking her paws with that perfume too.-no scent. No scent as in no perfume, and as in no stench of feces/pee.  My nose isnt so sensitive but i really dont smell much with this product compared to the rest.  Of course if kitty doesnt bury her poop all the way, you will smell it.  ;)  i've used this one week already (i do get rid of litter everyday) and i dont smell ammonia on the litter box, unlike other brands out there which leave that lingering pee-smell.-clumps nice and hard!  yes, this clumps hard!  love it.  It doesnt fall apart even if your kitty pees at the litter box corner like my Mocha does.  I like that i can pick up the litter pee clumps with my cheapie walmart scoop and it doesnt break apart easily.(very minor) Cons:-bag is heavvvvy!  it is 40 lbs of fine pebbles.  it can be hard to fill the box with it.  I snip a small part of bag out as to make small opening to pour out the litter (pour it out like cereal....LOL).  in a large litter box, i use about half a bag.-refill litter box often.  something i am kind of noticing with this compared to other fine fine clumping litter is that i have to refill box often with litter.  I'd say i refill about once a week.  I think b/c this litter clumps so hard that it uses more litter that way?  Not a big deal just a little inconvenience i noticed.conclusion:  awesome product.  i wish amazon would consider subscribe and save.  I'd use my free amazon gift cards to get this.  definite re-buy b/c of no perfume, no  urine scent even after one week's use, and clumps beautifully even in the corners making cleaning easy.

We like it and, more importantly, the cats like it, but we found a litter we like better (as previewed on Animal Planet's "Must Love Cats"), Cat's Pride Fresh & Light(tm) Premium Clumping Litter.  It isn't as dusty, clumps better and controls odors better.
summary: Precious Cat Ultra Premium Clumping Cat Litter, 40 pound bag

reviewText: It is a brand that I like to use in our multi-cat house that I've been using for years.  There is virtually no dust when pouring the litter from the bag (or a container) into the litter boxes.  Easy to work with!!
summary: I always use this brand of cat litter!

reviewText: Finally.  At last.  A litter that is truly dust-free!  I am so happy right now that I ordered two of these 40 pound bags based on a recommendation from one of my favorite cat blogs (Floppycats.com).  Yay!This schtuff is great!  Clumps are tight and solid and don't crumble apart (like the dusty ol' Tidycats formula I used to use).  I have NO PROBLEM scooping this litter at all.  Odor control is great.  I can't detect any odor at all and neither can my hubby (and he has a very sensitive nose when it comes to litterbox odor).Our Ragdoll kitty, Pink Sugar, had no problem switching over to this litter either.  I just dumped all the old Tidycats dusty litter and then washed and dried the litterbox and filled it up.  She used it right away without any issues.I will be a repeat customer for sure!  And, I think our small apartment will be far less dusty now!  :)
summary: Best Litter I Have Ever Used!

reviewText: one of my cats was not peeing in his litter box and i was just about ready to head to the vet with him but decided to try this first and see if it was related to the litter i was using.  he has not peed on the floor once since i got this!!  i don't know what it is but this cat litter is great.  it also clumps really well and isn't dusty.  i love it!!

I call myself the litter box queen - I have a shelter for special needs cats, and have tried a lot of different litters.  This is the VERY BEST as there is no dust (except for very little when you are pouring it into the boxes); in fact, I used to have an air purifier in my litter box room to take away the dust, but after I found this litter, I got rid of that.  It also clumps very well, even immediately after a liquid deposit.  This litter also comes in 20 pound bags.  If you are buying the 40 pound bags, you would do well to have a plastic bucket to put it in when you get home.

I recently got a kitten and had previously ordered this for my mom's cat. She liked it and will be re-ordering it soon. Being in the metro of the city having a car to get around is not needed. I don't like to carrying the heavier or bigger packages on the public transit, so I took to ordering this on Amazon. It clumps up hard and I never smell the cat box, unless the kitten didn't quite get her specimens covered all the way. This will be my brand for her. She doesn't seem to have any problems when she uses it. I know I've had some cats that would sneeze from the dust, but it doesn't make any reactions.

I am so glad I bought this cat litter. There is nothing comparable that I have previously bought. It truly is scent free. It clumps well and what I find so amazing is, there is little to no urine smell after the cats use it. I also like that it is truly scent free. So many litters claim to be scent free, but is still scented.Just one word of warning:Do not flush it down your toilet. It is not made for that.I will certainly buy this litter again.
This litter clumps well. Has no scent and is vitually dust free. In my opinion this makes for healthier cats.

The litter works well but does have some dust.  It seems to be a little heavier than the littler we were using.  It would be better if it was packaged in a box because the sack tends to close on itself when pouring into the litter pan.  Our only qualm is that the packaging makes it hard to pour.
summary: Litter is great but packaging hard to handle.

reviewText: UPDATE: Wow, this litter is now over $10 more than what I originally paid! Nearly $30 for a bag of clay litter is way too much, especially considering I go through it so fast with just one cat. One 40 lb. bag lasts me two months (my cat has two litter boxes). Because the litter clumps so well, you end up scooping a lot of it out. I ordered Pestell clay litter to replace this brand, which other reviewers said is comparable. What in the world could cause this litter to now cost $28?-------------------Like a lot of cat owners, I feel like I've tried every litter on the market. The last litter we used was Swheat Scoop (the wheat-based litter that's flushable) but it tracked horribly and had almost no odor control. Prior to that, we used crystals. My cat is really picky and wasn't very fond of either one (leading to the occasional potty outside of his box). So far for about 2 months, we've had luck with Precious Cat. It doesn't track as much as other litters I've tried, and really does control odors well. It also clumps well so pieces are easy to scoop. Also, it has no obnoxious scent which a lot of clay litters do. I think we'll be sticking with this litter.
summary: Feel like I've tried every litter, maybe this one will work for the long haul

reviewText: This is hands down the best litter I've ever tried as far as clumping. The clumps are dry, rock solid and rarely crumble or stick to the sides of the litter box. Unfortunately this litter's odor absorbing ability is not up to par, and there has been a noticeable increase in odor compared to the litters I've used in the past, despite the boxes being scooped regularly.
summary: Great for clumping, odor control not so much

reviewText: Obviously this litter's great advantage is it's price.  And it clumped well.  But I found it really had to be changed frequently or you had to spend money on odor products (making it not so cheap) to hide the ammonia smell of cat urine.  I have switched to Arm and Hammer clump and seal and am happier even though it is more expensive.
summary: Cheap, clumps well, Doesn't hide ammonia smell well

reviewText: I do prefer the Arm & Hammer Ultra Last to this, but I can't turn down the convenience of having litter delivered to me.  This is very good quality.  The granules seem a little larger and courser than the Arm & Hammer, but overall the litter is highly effective at clumping.  I like to sprinkle on some baking soda after every cleaning to ensure it will last as long as possible.

For the price this isn't bad litter, I've ordered it twice now. I do miss having some scent to the litter and this doesn't cover odor as well as others I've had. The litter itself is nice as far as absorption, it's a pretty fine litter with very little dust.

I have a long hair (Ragdoll) and a short haired cat (japanese bobtail) and they LOVE this litter. Very little dust, little tracking (and my cats can track any litter-- they have a gift for it, it seems), and clumps beautifully. It will sometimes stick to the bottom of the litter pan if very wet, but clumps come off easily with a paper towel or by really scraping with the litter scoop.I recommend this to everyone. It is VERY heavy litter, so carrying it up 3 flights of stairs is a huge pain, but worth it!
summary: the BEST litter in the world

reviewText: I have been using Scoop Away litter from Costco since forever.  I have always hated it, it's SOOO dusty and leaves a film of dust on everything within 20 feet of the litter box.  Not to mention, when scooping and pouring it, I end up inhaling buckets of dust, and I'm sure it's not good for the cats either.  I finally decided cheap isn't a good reason to keep using it, and started looking for a dust free product.  I found the great reviews on this Precious Cat litter, and made the switch.  NO dust when I pour or scoop, it clumps and scoops out easily, it's unscented, and controls the litter box odors, and although it's not as cheap as the scoop away, it's quite reasonably priced.  I'm am thrilled to have made the change, and looking forward to not having to clean that stinky dust off everything anymore!  And my three cats made the adjustment to the new litter without any problem.  They are probably thrilled to not have to breath that dust anymore.
summary: SOOOO glad I found this cat litter!

reviewText: We have 2 cats & they're on a wet tuna/pumpkin food because of bladder problems, so their feces smells awful. We used to use Fresh Step Multi-Cat & it seemed to work okay - but the perfumed dust covered everything.  Even thought the litter box was behind a door in the laundry room, the dust got through the cat door & covered our kitchen. If we wiped up a spill with a damp sponge, it made the room smell like litter.  Ugh.So I researched like crazy & read lots of reviews & they led me to this. It's THE BEST. It has VERY little dust and no odor, but it somehow covers the smell.We love it.  In fact, one time we ran out & had to buy another dust-less, perfume-free litter & I asked my husband what he thought.  He pretended to be a scientist & gave that 2 stars compared to Precious Cat Ultra's 5.  I'd give it a 10.I only wish it was on a subscription plan.
I really like this litter. It traps in smells better and is much less dusty than our previous brand. I plan to reorder.

I've been using with my one cat for over a year now and I've had no complaints.  Now I'm using it with her and her six kittens.  I've learned my lessons about kitty litter...this one works.  Low dust, great clumping, no fragrance and great odor control!  The best part is...wait for it....it is delivered to my front door!!  UPS has a love hate relationship with me: they love the business but hate the half mile road to my house.  Less trips to the store buying products that don't work half as well as this one does.  Worth every penny.

I've been involved in rescue for 30 years, and have mourned the loss of original No-Track Scoop Away for years. Nothing else ever compared. So I went with Scoop Away's other products, sometimes being disappointed by others.Recently, I decided to try a few brands from here, and ordered several. This week, I began with this product and I won't even bother trying anything else.Clumps are SOLID and don't crumble, dust is minimal. There might be some sticking to the box, but I use no-stick cooking spray on the boxes before filling (safe and works well...essentially fish oil), powder with Arm & Hammer deo powder, then fill and no sticking issues.Over the years I have had many cats, both fosters and my own, as many as 30 at once (but not all staying). Now, after a fire and some other things, I have only 2 cats. However, my judgement is sound. I wish I'd found this years ago.

This litter does the job of clumping, but it has a horrible smell.  Plus, it is terribly dusty!  Every time my cat comes out he is sneezing!  And the odor is awful...and that's because my cat is only twelve weeks old!  I am definitely not using this one again.

My cats have never been fussy about litter and I usually buy scented but I worry what's in that litter sometimes when it's highly scented.  This is my second bag and it seems to take care of the odor pretty well.  There is a small amount of tracking out of the litter box, but not very much.  It's a big bag at a decent price that is delivered - I will keep buying it.
summary: My cats seem to like it

reviewText: I bought this litter because it had great reviews, but it was one of the worst clumping litters I've ever tried. Urine turns into a clay clump I can hardly scoop out. The clump smears when you try and remove it, and I have to put a lot of effort into removing it. Arm and Hammer was the same way for me. Tidy Cats has been the best clumping litter to date and I won't try anything else again. The one thing I can say that was good about the litter was the lack of dust when pouring it into the box.Amazon didn't ship the litter very well either. They put it in a giant box with my other items, and at the post office the bottom of the box was ripped out completely.

I was very excited about this litter after reading all of the positive reviews, but I've been disappointed so far with the odor control. Yes, it has excellent clumping (the urine cakes are like rocks!) and yes, it has very little dust, but is that really worth the terrible odor control and increased tracking? I have tried a few other litters for my still-young kitten and have seen an increase in stray litter all over the house ever since switching to this brand. Further, it has taken on that terrible acrid smell that unmistakably screams "CAT HOUSEHOLD!" I likewise hate those over-perfumed litters that make everything smell artificial, but even that is preferable to this smell. I will continue to use until I run out but I won't be buying again.  I hope you have better luck than me if you decide to purchase this litter.
summary: No dust yes, but foul smell

reviewText: This is the best litter I have ever used as far as its clumping ability, meaning it really clumps and doesn't break apart when you're cleaning out the box. A+ on that part! The only reason I am giving it four stars instead of five is because it doesn't do anything to keep away the smell. It isn't worse than others, but it was t anything special in that regard, and that's an important part of litter, so I didn't give it the full five stars but I will definitely buy it again and it is an excellent litter.

while this did provide rock hard donuts, its not worth the trouble.my experience:my cat's urine was rock solid, so was it's adherence to the bottom of the litter box. took some chiseling to remove it.there is dust. minimal, but dust is dust. the only way i know the dust exists is the dried stuff in my cats noes. this was so-o-o-o hard to remove...i could only wonder what is staying in his lungs.whatever moisture the litter finds, it clings to unmercifully. use caution!tidy cat immediate control scoop-able is better. does the trick!about the odor control: ultra premium did erase box odor BUT in the trash can it was horrid. i put the waste in a lunch brown bag before tossing it, this didnt help.tidy cat mentioned above works on odor control and you dont smell it every time u open the trash can.my advise, dont buy ultra premium.

I never thought that there could be this much difference in cat litter, but I will never go back to my old brand after using this!  It's literally dust-free--which is great for my poor kitties and me!  No more litter dust all over the place!  I'm sorry for their sakes that I didn't try this sooner (but actually, I didn't hear about it till lately).  Well, at least from now on the poor old guys won't have to breathe in all that dust when they're doing their business!  : )

This is the best cat litter I've ever used that is almost dust free. It's not 100% odor free but it beats all of the other "odor free" unscented litter I've used. Great value and beats having to carry this home from the store.

I used to use Ever-Clean cat litter. When I would pour that out, it would send dust everywhere. It was so bad, the moment I poured out a new bag- I had to shower. All the while, closing my mouth because if I opened my mouth, licked my lips, or breathed wrong- I would get a taste of the nasty dust.Precious-Cat is HALF the price of Ever-Clean. And there's no dust. Even though it's a clay litter, there is no dust. How is this even possible? I have no idea.It works just as good as the best cat litter I could find at Petsmart (Ever-Clean). That stuff, just like this, clumped, never had any smell even if it was a day later with an unchanged box,  lasts forever, and is easy to clean with no disintegrating clumps or anything like that. But with no dust, no odor, no bad taste in my mouth...and HALF the price? Oh, and did i mention it is half the price?Best cat litter I have ever had. And with Amazon Prime shipping? I don't even go to Petsmart anymore. It's all Amazon and Chewy.com for my pet needs, and they get only THE BEST!
summary: Half the Price of the high quality stuff at Petsmart, with no odor, no dust.

reviewText: This is ver low on dust - actually I get zero dust when pouring it into the box. Us humans in the house are not allergic to it (like we were of other allegedly dust free litters) and it clumps well. My only complaint is that it is a tad more expensive and it doesn't cover the smell of feces at all. Then again no litter I have tried covered it to perfection. Poop will never smell of roses. This is a good alternative to chemical ridden litters though and the cats had no problem switching to it from FelinebPine :)
summary: Cats like it, clumps well, more natural. Zero dust!

reviewerName: R. J. Raveling "for the love of music"
reviewText: I really hope they never discontinue this product!  It works SO well- we have tried every single litter on the planet it seems!  Every natural kind, every toxic kind- cheap to expensive and this stuff is the BEST!  And, its good for the kitties!  It doesn't have any smell at all, which is good for everyone- it covers over their odor really well- it clumps really well- and there is no tracking and no dust, so good!  I don't mind the price at all because its finally what I've been looking for and heck, I don't have kids...so spending extra on the kitty boys not a big deal!  Delivered to my door...can't beat that.
summary: The only litter I will ever buy again

reviewText: We use this litter because of it's low dust which is true!  It clumps okay but some little pieces split off.  All in all, we will continue to use it.

The quality of this litter was as good if not better than any I've previously purchased.  The cats willingly use it.  It clumps firmly and doesn't create as much dust as some litter.  It was a treat to me that I could have a heavy pkg delivered to the front door since I'm recovering from surgery, but it was a little more costly than going to the brick and mortar store and buying it.

This is when being an Amazon Prime member pays off.  Would you rather lug 40 pounds of cat litter off the shelf, into the cart, into the car, out of the car, and into the house?  I'm not Hercules.  Let the UPS man do the lugging.  Sure, I still have to lug it from the front door to the litter box, but that's a lot less lugging than going to the store involves.  The little clumps well, no dust clouds, and the cats like it just fine.

In my many years of buying name brand litter claiming to be the best, I've found this brand beats them all and for an amazing price! This 40lbs bag lasts about 5 weeks for my 4 cats, so imagine if you have one. It's a bargain especially if you're on a tight budget like I am!!Clumps better, holds the odor better...it's just better than anything else I've used. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
And doesn't deal quite well enough with the odor, but with a little baking soda, it's just fine, and now I've got 40 lbs of it so it's fine.
summary: Doesn't clump as hard as I'd hoped

reviewText: This cat litter tracks very little, controls odor well, my cat loves it, and it clumps perfectly. My cat had horrible allergies, I tried every type of litter, nothing cured it except this. You can get it a few bucks cheaper in a store, but with prime it's well worth it to have the heavy bag shipped to your door!

I have disliked all of the cat litters I have tried from stores, they either are too perfum-y or get up into the air too much.  My cats don't seem that picky, either way so this review is about my reaction to the litter.I ordered Precious Cat after reading the Amazon reviews and I am very happy with it.  When I pour it, I don't feel like I am breathing it in.  It clumps very well. I find these perfect little spherical clumps maybe 2/3 the size of a tennis ball every day.  This litter masks the smell well without having an obnoxious perfume scent.I have Amazon prime so to get a 40 pound bag of this litter delivered in 2 days for free, without having to go to the store and carry it to the cash register and then to the car and then from the car into the house is an incredible value for me.However, as a small woman, it is still a pain to lift this 40lb bag from the shipping box and pour it into the litter box.  Sometimes it is so heavy and big for me that I spill a little. I have started ordering the 18lb bags but this is such a good value I might just try to tough out the 40lb bags again.

As the title says!  My only complaint with this litter is that it is perhaps *too* good at clumping, as it tracks right out of even the fully enclosed litterbox and makes a mess on the (presciently acquired) mat in front.  When cleaning there are always several clods of urine-soaked litter stuck firmly to the bottom of the box, which can only be removed by scraping, and even with sponge and water, little specks of litter will stubbornly stick to the box, the sponge, and the bathtub after several rinsings.  Otherwise, this is an ideal litter: totally olfactorily unobtrusive and effective at what it's designed to do.
summary: Clumps well, doesn't smell at all, but is a little sticky

reviewText: The cats and I both like this litter.  We have two cats and this litter clumps very nicely for scooping and contains the smell a lot better than other brands we have tried.  The bag is a bit trick to pour litter from (it all wants to dump out), but that's a minor inconvenience.  I noticed that the price of this item fluctuates frequently, but when it's under $20 I order one, then I don't need to go to the store and carry home a heavy bag of litter.

After years of wasting money on brand name clumping litters that never fully clumped, I finally found a litter that clumps perfectly. Having three cats, I need a litter that will clump, but other litters will only half clump. Every litter cleaning done with the other brands, I found that urine clumps will fall apart when scooping or some parts are clumped, the other still wet. With this, I can pick up three 'balls' of urine clumps with no breakage or crumbling when putting it into a disposal bag. Even the feces clump! My cats love it (and so do I) because there is no litter trail when they leave their boxes. This litter is cost-effective because of the clumping effectiveness, I do not waste as much litter when refilling. Plus, do the math compared to the weight and cost of name brands. This far outweighs any cat litter on the market.UPDATE 3/18/14: Did an experiment (based on some of the negative reviews) with a pail of TC Multi-Cat & Precious Cat for 1 week. Filled 2 boxes, 1 w/TC, other PC. As I said, PC is more cost effective & cleaner than other 'clumping' litters. TC had dust, left paw trails & wedged into kitty paws. PC little dust, no trails & no wedgies. On day 3, of 2-a-day cleanings (definitely not the norm for me, only an experiment), the TC pail had less than 1/4 left, and I used less than 1/4 of PC. Why do I like this? My cats are diggers & if they can't bury their business or have room for more, they will knock the clumps out of their boxes, creating a mess for me to clean. With PC it clumps so tight they can move the clumps to the sides and have plenty of room. Less trail mess, less refilling of boxes, and less time for me to clean the boxes because of urine clumps breaking. I have not had a problem with odor as others wrote and, as a matter of fact, I always bought scented litter and with PC I see no difference in odor control. If you want to use this and want to add an unnecessary scent, try a sprinkle of baking soda. I did that first and after my 2nd fill, I decided I/they didn't need/want their boxes scented.
summary: It clumps perfectly! Best deal for the money!

reviewText: So far so good with the litter.  Let me tell you a funny story:The not so funny part:  So it looked like they kicked this box from the warehouse all the way to my door, and when I opened the box, the litter bag had busted open and a quarter of it was in the bottom of the box and throughout the packaging material.  Much litter was flung around the room as I tried to carefully remove the packaging material to get to the "meat" of the problem.The funny part:  After removing both the packaging material and the busted open bag of litter (and let's keep in mind that a quarter or so of the litter is still in the shipping box), my cat, Jack (who has cerebellar hypoplasia) strolls/flops in here and pees right in the litter scattered in the box, buries it, and leaves.  So I guess he's a fan?
summary: Litter seems to be good.  Packaging needs improvement.

reviewText: After months of using various supermarket-bought big name litter brands, I got fed up with my cat tracking litter all over the house and the strong ammonia smell my last brand was creating.Pros:-Clumps very, very well-Tracks drastically less compared to common brands-No offensive chemical odorsCons:-I didn't buy the scented version, and the litter won't really hold down the smell sometimes after cat leaves some... solid waste behind. If you've a ventilated room instead of my tiny apartment bathroom then you may not even notice.
summary: Pretty good, but I'll try the scented version next

reviewText: Great stuff, no dust, regular cat litter is so, dusty, no dust when you clean the boxes out.  GREAT STUFF........Sandi
summary: Precious Cat Ultra Premium Clumping Cat Litter, 40 Pound Bag

reviewText: Low dust, no odor … lasts a long time.  I have a large cat and thus use large boxes.  I used nearly an entire bag to fill the box.

After introduction to this litter I have found that my rug is heavily saturated with litter now so I have to vacuum a lot.  It is difficult to tote around 40 pounds also so guess I will go back to smaller bags.

I was using Tidy Cats Power Blend (the kind you can get at Walmart in a tub with the dark blue lid), but my entire apartment always smelled like a litter box, no matter how much I cleaned it.You can get a bag of this litter at PetSmart for about 15 dollars (which is how much I was spending on my old crappy litter), and it works amazingly well. I've already recommended it to all my cat-owning friends.No harsh smells, no dust, hard clumps, and unparalleled odor control. I'll never bother with any other litter.
summary: No more litter box smell in my small apt

reviewText: Very disappointed in this litter.  Very heavy. Sticks to the bottom. I'm convinced it's just downright dangerous to humans and cats alike!  I will stick with my World's Best.  You get what you pay for!

I've tried sever different name brand kitty litters and this is by far the best.  There is no perfume, almost no dust what so ever, and it covers smells way better then other brands. Obviously no litter will cover smells instantly, but I'd say within 5 minutes, any smell is gone. And as a bonus, one of our cats has allergies, so when we switched to Precious Cat, it made a huge difference for her.  A 40 lib bag lasts us about a month with 2 cats. And though it's a little harder to find than other brands, the price is pretty reasonable.

I have always been a huge supporter of the Fresh Step scoopable litter. However, it seems in the past year the litter has become dustier and dustier and the non-fragrant kind is harder to find. I don't want powdery fragrance in the litter. So based on the reviews of this I took a chance. I like it a lot. It's not perfect, but probably no litter will be. But there is a very low dust level to this. Also, the gravel is just a tad larger so the tracking is a little less (but still substantial). There is no fragrance at all. So as long as I can order here at Amazon (you know how you tend to count on things and then they just disappear or run out of stock??) and get it shipped for free, I will continue to purchase it. If you scoop this once daily--you will never have to clean your litterbox--just keep topping it off with more litter. (Yeah, I know we should clean them sometimes, but I have gone months and months w/o having to clean with no offensive odors...is that TMI?)

This litter is now the only stuff we use in our house. Not completely dust free, but close enough if you're comparing it to the usual big box store fare. Another A+++++ for NO PURR-FUMY additions that (IMHO) are completely unnecessary (and unhealthy to inhale) - if you take 2 minutes out of your day (every day) and scoop out the box there is no smell. Cat and kittens love it and it clumps SOLID! Does track a bit (how could it not?) but if you use a litter mat it's a non-issue.The 40lb bag was heavy but I managed to fill 2 empty 20lb plastic litter jugs with only a bit of spillage.
summary: Three cats in a box - no problem!

reviewText: This is really good litter with little dust which causes me breathing issues.  It clumps up well and lasts a good while.
This litter seems to be working just great with the two kittens here.  Easier to maintain the litter boxes with this type of litter and am pleased to have purchased it.

GREAT odor control, doesn't smell perfume-ey, the cats seems to like it and it clumps really well.  I little pricey (unless you can catch it when shipping is free) but you don't go through it nearly as fast as more common brands of clumping litter.  Don't plan to use any other cat litter... EVERY!!  :)
summary: This is the best litter I've ever used!

reviewText: I have been using this cat litter for over a year and I will tell you I wont use anything else. it keep the smell out of the room and no dust to clean up . Very happy with this!

For the last 9 years I have been looking for a clumping litter that clumps well, is acceptable to my cat, and leaves no dust.  I have tried everything from cedar pellets to plain lay litter.  I won't say that this litter is entirely dust free, but it is pretty darn close.  It isn't great in the odor control department, which is why I have given it 4 stars instead of 5.  I'm having to use baking soda an addition to the litter to help with the odor control.  Generally speaking, though, I am quite happy with this litter.

I have tried many different brands of litter and this is the one that I now MUST have.  Other litters are dusty (world's best for example) and messy, or don't clump properly, or my cats don't like them.This litter clumps very well.  The litter does track but I find the amount of product tracked on the floor to be lower than any other litter I have tried.Also, the odor control is very very good.  Sometimes I take the odor control for granted -- if I have to use another litter from the bodega while I replenish my Precious Cat I am instantly reminded just how good odor control is.I made an honest effort to use the corn based litters because of the reduced environmental impact - but neither I nor my little furrballs liked any of the brands we tried.  I live in a small NYC apartment and making compromises on odor and messy dust are out of the question.YAY for Precious Cat!  It makes sharing cramped quarters with my little companions easy!
summary: Great litter - excellent clumping and odor control

reviewText: Cleaning the cat box has never been easier!  And the cat box has never been less smelly!  We went from regular, non-clumping litter to this.  WHAT A DIFFERENCE!  Yes, this costs a bit  more, but it is so worth it.  It cuts the stink down to almost nothing.  Easy to scoop and clumps great.  It does track quite a bit, though, so I leave out my stick vacuum and vacuum every day or two.  My cats have also stopped having "accidents" on the carpet when I used this litter in conjunction with their other product, the Cat AttractantPrecious Cat Ultra Litter Attractant, 20 OuncesMy cats haven't used the floor once since pairing these two together.  I have only gone through a bag and a half of litter in about a month between two cat boxes, and have barely put a dent in the container of cat attractant.  I am SO happy to have made the switch.  One of my cats wanted to use this litter so badly he tore apart the bag that was still half full of litter and spread it all over the tile floor, little stinker.  He is also the one that used to use the carpet as his litter box, so the fact that he loves this litter so much speaks volumes!

Love that this 40 lb bag is delievered to my door and such a good price.  I was purchasing 15 lb bags at a local pet store and it was difficult for me to lift and carry from car to house.  When it arrives, I open the bag on my porch and scoop into containers that I can comfortably lift and carry.  This is enough litter for more than a month for a 2 cat household.  This litter clumps the tightest, there is no perfume, and my cats took to it right away.I recommend this product, and by all means, have it delivered to your door.  Especially great deal if you have Amazon Prime.
summary: Best Clumping Litter for my cats

reviewText: This is the one. I've had multiple cats for 20 years and currently have 3. I have literally tried every cat litter on the market. For years I defected from the clay-based litters because they are not as environmentally friendly as many others. Non-clay litters just do not clump as well as clay. It's never going to happen. Non-clay clumping litter is fine if you have one or maybe two cats. I used and LOVED Feline Pine (non-clumping) for a long time like this: cats whiz and poop in it all week long and then you toss it at the end of the week (there is a high tracking factor, on the downside, as kitty paws track the broken-down sawdust all over the house). For the price and low-maintenance (no scooping) factor, it can't be beat. But this requires cats that aren't so picky about having a tidy litterbox, which I had until my Persian passed away in January. My new cat is more picky so I switched to this litter after trying World's Best, which was not up to the task for multiple cats. There is absolutely NO urine odor with Precious Cat. None (Feline Pine controlled odor awesomely well also; World's Best did NOT). The urine clumps in this litter like a rock, meaning the rest of the litter stays clean and usable for a long time. This litter is also low-track, as litters go. One bag works for two boxes for three cats for about two weeks (then add a little more to replace what's been scooped). There is a reason why this litter is rated so highly, it works!

I've been looking for a truly unscented litter. Not for floofertails but for my own over-perfumed world. Seriously the best 40 punds of litter out there for $20 bucks delivered to your door. What could be better? Nuttin honey.

The best kitty litter I've tried to date!  With the use of my Van Ness CP7 Enclosed Litter Boxes, with application of a good 3" of litter, the odor is non-existent, even after a whole night of additions!  There's no breakdown into health-hazard dust, either!!!!  It's offered in sizes, too, for everyone to be able to handle!
No dust, clumps well. Kittens don't get pieces stuck in paws. They dig like maniacs in it, so I guess they like it too.  Very convenient to get this heavy bag delivered to my doorstep!

When this cost $14 it was worth it. The company saved money by selling a huge 40 pound bag - passing the savings on to you. Meanwhile the name brand companies had a better quality product and better containers but at double the price.Now, it's definitely not worth it. The price is $30 for 40 pounds which is exactly the same as the name brand companies which have far better packaging and - in my opinion - higher quality litter which doesn't make as much of a mess, clumps easier, and covers odors better.

I read all the reviews and I agree with it providing good odor control. However, when the cats dig through and the urine bleeds down to the bottom of the litter box, the clay cements itself to the litter box. I suppose I could line it with plastic but I have tried other litters and none of them were as much like cement as this stuff is - Johnny Cat, Cat's Pride, Arm & Hammer. I actually like Arm&Hammer pretty well but it was really dusty. Cat's Pride seems to be the best that I've tried so far though I'm going to give World's Best a try. What's cool about Cat's Pride is that even if you aren't able to scoop the urine (which can be hard to do since it's so fine), if you break it up, the litter dries out and still doesn't smell. It also provides the best "wrap" for the poop making it the easiest to scoop #2s. However, I'm not sure about the healthiness of most of the clumping litters, which is why I'm going to try World's Best. I wish finding a healthy, effective solution were easier!

This has no smell, no dust, clumps very well, and comes in a 40 lb bag delivered at my door in 2-3 days after ordering.  What could possibly be easier other than Momma Kitty pouring it in her box..."not going to happen".  I really don't use as much litter because I clean her box on a daily basis.

Ok.  I never thought I would be so happy with cat litter that I would write a review about it but this is very good litter.  We were buying Tidy cats clumping litter because it smells kind of nice and clumps pretty well.  This, however, takes the cake.  This litter has very little scent and it clumps really solid.  It also REALLY has no dust.  All other litters I've ever tried have had dust and you kind of wonder just what kind of stuff you are breathing in.  This is nice and fresh even after 2 weeks (with regular scooping).  It's a little course, but our cat doesn't mind walking on it and she is declawed.
summary: OMG.  This is the best litter ever.

reviewText: I normally use the Respiratory Relief (R&R;) formula in this line for my sniffley kitty, but when I decided to foster a pregnant cat and eventually her 4 kittens (bringing the grand total to 6 cats and granting me Official Crazy Cat Lady status), I realized I needed a harder working litter. I didn't want a heavily scented litter, so I went with this one instead of the Ultra Scented Multicat in the purple bag. Granted, I've never tried the purple bag formula, but I don't like the way scented litter just masks odors.To reiterate what I wrote in my R&R; review, I needed a low-dust litter and found that most people went with either World's Best or Precious Cat. I used World's Best for a while and I loved the litter itself, but I didn't love the price tag. After a few months on R&R;, I decided to never look back. I love that I don't have to sacrifice quality to save money on the equivalent of toilet paper for cats. I have a black litter mat in front of the box and tile floors, so it's easy for me to see (and feel, because I walk around barefooted) if it's actually working or not. Dust and tracking is pretty much as nonexistent as you can get with 4 very curious and rambunctious kittens.My kitty is pretty chill so she didn't have a problem with the switch and the kittens went straight from their non-clumping to this one without any litter-munching issues (at first, I kept a layer of non-clumping litter on top of the Precious Cat litter, just in case, though). I don't think there's too much difference between this one and R&R; besides the lack of herbal essences. I haven't had any issues with odors unless the kittens forget to cover their poo. The only thing I've had a problem with is that it seems to have a few clumping issues when the description clearly states that this litter "prevents moisture from reaching the bottom of the litter box, while providing a clump that will not break apart". Maybe it's just because the litter boxes have so much traffic or maybe I'm not using enough litter, but moisture does reach the bottom, resulting in a bunch of cement blobs. I have to really scrape with the scoop to get them off and the clumps break apart in the process. Mild annoyance = -1 star. I haven't tried any other brands because I trusted Precious Cat to deliver, so I don't really have anything to compare to.
