I deal with it because it might just be my problem since I didn't have this issue with the R&R;, which I'll be switching back to after all the kittens go to their forever homes.
summary: A litter for a litter of kittens

reviewText: I have tried many litters. I tried using the worlds best cat litter. and though it was more expensive, it worked great. Then they must have changed their formula and cheaped it up, as it no longer worked and was not the world's best cat litter. So far Precious cat ultra is working great and is cheaper, I hope they don't change their formula.
Love the litter because it clumps and keeps odor controlled very well and this bag is really, really big and heavy!
It did the job better than Arm and Hammer. I eventually switched to the Walgreens brand and it worked about the same. But this is good stuff too.
it was ok I was trying to not have to go to store to drag it homebut it was just ok nothing great
The best cat litter.  My asthmatic cat uses it with no issues. Wish I could afford it for my other cats

I was using Arm and Hammer and Fresh Scoop, till the dust got so bad I started to notice it everywhere. The smell of cat litter was even on my pillows in the bedroom. I bought this strictly because the reviewers say there is zero dust. I agree, it's as dustless as cat litter can get.My only complaint is that it could have better odor control. I feed my cat raw, so there is never an odor even if I don't clean the box out for 2 days. However, when I'm away my sitter feeds commercial canned food like wellness or innova. When she's fed that junk, the box smells like hell and I would gag every time I went near it even if I just cleaned it out a few hours before. I can absolutely understand why people complain about the smells. It could also clump better.Overall I still recommend this compared to other clumping litters, because I don't have to wipe down my hallway everyday from the cat litter dust. Who knows what that stuff was doing to her lungs.
summary: Best of what is out there, still could be better

reviewText: Really, I can't complain. The kitty likes it. She poos and pees on it, that's what I really appreciate. It also doesn't smell chemically or weird, that's also nice. What I don't appreciate is that the litter goes everywhere. That's not the companies fault. It's the cat's fault. She has a tendency to literally fly out of the litter box when she is done and it just goes everywhere. I give up cleaning my kitchen (yeah weird, I know, litter box in the kitchen. That's what happens when you live in NYC size apartment!) The furball is also long haired, so it gets stuck to her tiny furry paws more often too.Anyone know a trick to limit flying litter? Let me know!
summary: Can't complain, doesn't smell, cat poos on it, all is good

reviewText: With 4 cats, I have tried a lot of litter, and I can tell you this is best. I have tried World's Best, but I think that stuff stinks! Precious Cat Ultra is the only clay litter I have found that is really "dust free." So many other brands claim to be, but when you pour it into the box, a cloud of dust hits you in the face. That doesn't happen to me with Precious Cat. It is also very hard clumping. However, like others have said, the price for this stuff on Amazon is way more than you will find it at your local pet store.

I ordered 2 of these - with free delivery it was a no brainer.  And I didn't have to carry 80 lbs of cat litter up the stairs!  This litter works great for multiple cats (I have 2).  It's a bit dusty but less so then other brands I have tried. Clumps well with great odor control.
Was a really good price, but tidy cat is still my preference.

I mean, if a person is going to write a review on kitty litter... This stuff is the (censored)! No dust, no kidding. So when I am filling little fat and spoiled Esme Pyewacket's litter box, I don't have to immediately follow that up with a shot of albuterol. It's amazing, it traps every bit of smell, it tracks less stuff onto the little mat outside of her ladies room, and I find less of it under my toes while I am waddling around her area. It's worth the money, and the fact that the stuff weighs like... a BILLION POUNDS. I am a lifer and a true believer in this stuff.

I love that this cat litter is pretty much dust free. It makes a big difference when you have allergies or not! The price is a bit high on this cat litter, but you can't beat having it delivered due to it weighing 40lbs.
summary: QUALITY MAKES YOU THINK TWICE.. PRICE NOT SO NICE!

reviewText: Tried Swheat Scoop, World's best, etc. because I was trying to avoid the clay litter due to dust until I read Dr. Pierson's article on Litterbox at Catinfo.org. I agreed with her that in the end, it should be a litter that makes your cat want to use and are happy to use it. I find my cat liking this litter the most maybe also because of the texture. It's not super fine, but the grain aren't super large either. The other corn/wheat ones smell quite bad when wet and doesn't clump as well as Precious Cat. I think if you have an open litter box, they are not really breathing in that much dust. My last cat lived to be 21 years old using this litter. I have an open litter box and another one that's half closed which ishttp://www.amazon.com/Catit-Jumbo-Hooded-Cat-Litter/dp/B003RQVGKC where I lift the whole front up (the door and the top area with filter opens up unlike most regular cat litter with flap door).
summary: Best cat litter. I've tried many

reviewText: I found this litter to have better odor control than the corn based litter, however it was a bit dusty and the corn based was not. Clumps well, good price, nice to ave the 40# bag delivered right to my door.

I use this product in conjunction with theOmega Paw Self-Cleaning Litter Box, Pewter. It works fantastically. I got this litter after reading all the reviews for my two new kittens. The first time I cleaned the litter box, I was surprised by how well the litter hid the smell! The clumps well and works well with my litter box. It doesn't turn into mud and is easy to scrape off the walls of the litter box for those clumps that stick a little bit. Another pro is that is really is mostly dust free! This was great as I had shelter kittens that were coming home with upper respiratory infections - extra dust from the litter probably wouldn't do them much good.The only issue that the litter does track a little bit like others have stated. This problem is mostly solved by using a litter mat (thePurr-fect Pet Purr-fect Paws Litter Mat for Catsworks well) and sweeping the floor. For the pros of this product, sweeping my floor a little more frequently is a small trade-off.Recommend.
summary: Tracks a little, but no smell!

reviewText: This is a very low dust cat litter. Compared to all the other brands of cat litter that I bought over the last 7 years, this one has probably the least dust.The individual clay clumps are much larger than your regular cat clumping clay litter, and I suspect that's how dust is reduced. One of my finicky cat decided to poop outside on the second day in protest of the larger particles, but she quickly got used to the litter and now uses it normally without attempting to guilt people.People are saying this does not have odor control, which is true. I leave a container of baking soda next to my litter box and I sprinkle some in every time I change the litter. It seems to work for me.All in all, I think having this 40-lbs bag of litter shipped to my address for as little as $17.50 (including tax) is fabulous. I do feel sorry for the UPS delivery man so I might have to leave out some cookies for him every time this is being delivered.
summary: Nice low dust litter. I use this with baking soda.

reviewText: It last 3 times longer than anything else I have used and I have used all of the major litters.There's less dust flying around. It is not dust free but is anything? I have 5 cats in the house and believe me they can stir up anything.Sue Taylor
This litter works very well at containing odors. My vet recommended it, and it clumps quickly. Plus, I have not noticed any dust.

MUCH less dust even than the Ever Clean.  Adequate odor control (3 cats) even with unfragranced litter.  Having it delivered to my house is awesome.  No more wrestling the 40 lb bag in and out of a cart and my car trunk!!Update Oct 2013:  still very happy w dust level (very low), but odor control not fabulous.  We scoop regularly and rarely feed cats fish (one cannot digest it and there's no litter that could handle the side effects there!)....and the room w the litter boxes smells rather poopy sometimes (not like cat urine thankfully).  Considering mixing in something for odor.  For this I dropped to 4 stars.If anyone knows something with this kind of dustlessness and better odor control, please let me know!
summary: My new litter (previously used Ever Clean), love having it delivered

reviewText: PRECIOUSCat Ultra Premium Clumping Cat Litter, 40 pound bag - It is not Clumping!  The description and the photo of the bag says Clumping; but when it came it just said Scoopable.  So I did not open it but returned it.  I know it has many, many, great reviews and it is natural and dust free, which is great!  But I like only Clumping.  Most reviewers said it did clump; but just the fact that the  actual product did not say CLUMPING but SCOOPABLE was enough to send it back.  I like big, solid clumps when I am scooping.
summary: Precjious Cat Ultra Premium Clumping Cat Litter, 40 pound bag -  It is SCOOPABLE but NOT Clumping; just so you know...

reviewText: First off this product is NOT hypoallergenic. I have allergies and everytime i clean this i start sneezing, something i didnt do with other litters that are not hypoallergenic. It is less dusty which is great!if i close my cats hooded litterbox the smell is horrendous, i've had to keep her box open for the smell to dissipate.i which i could find the perfect litter- dust free- great clumping-great odour controlbut it seems you need to pick which is important. if you just need something with low dust, then this is for you. for now, it is the best that i have tried. i tried tidy cats in a yellow jug (too dusty), i tried arm and hammer, again too dusty and too much perfume. i tried another i cant remember the name, but the clumps were awful, they fell apart. i cant seem to find anything that quite works for me.

One of my cats was struggling with a respiratory problem and the other cat, when the previous litter was changed, went and urinated on a pile of clothes (or somewhere else). We finally figured out that the cat having "accidents" only had them immediately after the previous litter was changed. We suspected it was because the litter had quite a lot of scent/perfume in it. It was overwhelming even for the humans. And, any time the litter was scooped, all the dust came up.So, we bought this product: "Precious Cat". It's pretty much dust free. There is no perfumy smell. The cat that wheezed when she slept has stopped wheezing and the cat that had "accidents" when the litter was changed has not had an accident since we started using this product.We did a trial run with the first bag. We filled one litter box with Precious Cat and the other one with the old litter. The cats preferred this one and did 90%+ of their business in this litter. We have since disposed of the old litter and ordered three more bags of this product.
summary: Low - No Dust, cat's respiratory problem all but gone

reviewText: I have tried many litters and this one seems to be the best. I have tried mostly non clay litters due to reports of health hazards but have now switched back to using clay. The 2 main concerns with clay litter is blockage if the cats eat it, and lung problems if they breath it in. After trying this out for about a week, I am not as concerned as I was before. There is hardly any dust in this product, which is good for both the cats and owners. Pouring the bag into the box does not produce a dust cloud like many other litters. Also, this litter is not a fine powder. It is more coarse which prevents the litter from sticking to the cat's legs and paws. No need to worry about them digesting this stuff when they clean themselves.As far as clumping I think it does a really good job. Some people might say that it doesn't clump properly but I think you need to give the liquids time to absorb. Also, if urine is making its way to the bottom of the pan make sure you are putting enough litter in the box.Overall, I am really surprised by this litter. At the moment Amazon has a fairly good price for the 40 lb bag. My local pet stores sell this for about $18-19 plus tax so the Amazon price is either about the same or slightly cheaper depending on the store.

This is the BEST cat litter I have ever used!  There is no waste, no smell and NO DUST!!  Which means no more tracking and messes to clean up after the cats leave the box.  I can not believe the waste that came with the other leading brands that I have used in the past.  A MUST TRY!!  After you do once you will never go back to any other cat litter!!

I only ordered this cat litter because i had a free coupon. This cat litter barely lasted me a month for some reason, when my usual littler will last me at least 2-3 months. This is supposed to be dust free or very little, and it was horrible with the dust. I would get it again if i had another free coupon, but other than that, especially with the high price, i would not recommend it

This clumps the best of any cat litter I have tried.  I have two Omega cat litter boxes that depend on clumping cat litter to work, and I have used several bags of precious cat, and so far the quality has always been first rate.
I was primarily looking for something less dusty, and this was slightly less than my previous brand.  I probably won't buy again.
This is the best cat litter I have ever used.  It is very low dust, well priced, and unscented.  The scent is for people, not cats.

Great cat litter for NO DUST! However, when urine seeps to the bottom or side of the litter box it clumps like CEMENT!It tracks like ALL cat litters. The CEMENT quality it has when stuck to plastic is a nightmare! The 40# bags are much heavierthan other 40# bags I have purchased in the past.Also since there is no fragrance at all, which is great it does leave room for poo smell..I am going to continue my quest for a better litter.
summary: No fragrance and No DUST but clumps like CEMENT.

reviewText: I experiment with litter tirelessly mainly because one of my cats is asthmatic.  One of the reviews of this litter suggested that it was nearly dust free which is why I bought it.  It's not.  It's dusty, heavy, and cements itself to the box.  My cats were okay with it, but I wasn't.

I've tried several different kinds of kitty litter. This is one of the, if not the best I've tried. Dust doesn't kick up when I change the litter. Seems to keep the smell down. I'll definitely buy this again.

Where to start! I am so glad we finally went with this exact brand! I purchased two bags from Petsmart in December because the reviews were so positive regarding the 99% dust free. We have tried so many different brands and kinds of cat liter and could not find one that had a huge reduction in dust in the air! This is the ONE! Finally! I ordered 4 bags from Amazon(40 lb. bags) and as long as they carry it with the free shipping over the $25 I will be purchasing it from here! I tell you I have two liter boxes and the dust has not only made me sick but my cats sneezing all the time. My husband has a low form of asthma. Well, he has not had to hardly use his inhaler once since we switched to this. It also covers up the smells, clumps wonderfully. I can tell my cats love it. I don't smell all the perfumes in their hair anymore like the others. I don't have to dust every 2 days like I had. Seriously I am not lying about this liter. The others just left a white dust film everywhere including my cats hair! My husband who cleans the boxes most of the time was unsure when I bought it, but he looked at me and said, get on amazon and order 4-40lb bags this is the best we have EVER had! I could not agree more with him(thats hard to do sometimes, lol)! We ordered the metal scoops and they are great as well! Thanks Amazon, thanks precious cat!
this is the replace order. Box is torn on every side. But cat litter is ok. They must throw boxes every which way.
summary: Precious cat ultra Premiun clumping cat litter 40 lbs

reviewText: This is great cat litter-- much better than popular scoopable brands found in stores.  I was so satisfied that I was planning on ordering it again, but the price has gone up by about $10 for Amazon Prime, so I guess I'll have to buy another.

This litter is FANTASTIC. It has NO dust and is incredibly effective at trapping odor and waste. Our old Tidy Cats Multi-cat formula released clouds of dust and the scented version was quite strong. This litter clumps more better than Tidy Cats too.

Not too bad for the price, but the "granules" are pretty large, and you may want to consider that there's no odor protection / control at all. My cats were fine with the new litter, but the stink affected them too. I noticed that they'd walk over to the litterbox and stop and look at it as if they were thinking "Do I really want to use this now, or maybe wait until Mom puts some fresh litter in here again"!! Ok, that was my interpretation of course, but they were hesitant to use it after a couple days of the litter being in their litterbox (although I scoop at least twice a day). I'm still giving this product 3 stars because I found somewhat of a solution - I add Arm & Hammer litter to it, and mix both (1/3 A&H to 2/3 of this product) and it works a lot better. Not as stinky, and cats seem to like it better.

Clumps beautifully without falling apart when you go to scoop.  No scent is great and it holds the smell in perfectly. I occassionally add some baking soda if it does get a little musty, but that's usually only during a humid summer. Between this and my litter locker I've had friends ask where the litter box is because they know I have cats but they don't smell anything.

I loved this litter when I first ordered it no dust and minimal tracking of the litter. Then it went out of stock for a week or so. When I ordered it this last time the litter seems to be smaller and the cats are tracking it all over the house again. I am not sure what happened but I noticed it the minute I poured it into the litter box it looked different. No dust still but the actual grains of litter are smaller and now I am sweeping all the time again. I am so disappointed especially since I recommended this litter to 3 friends and my Mom. Can someone tell me if they are noticing the same thing because if this is the case I am not ordering it again. :(

I originally ordered this so I wouldn't have to haul a big box of kitty litter around a store to the car and to my house (wow, you'd think I was totally lazy if it wasn't because I'd had surgery and wasn't supposed to lift things).I was not expecting what a great job it would do to minimize odor and have no 'dust' residue. I hate the fake flowery chemical smell that a lot of cat litters have. the 'natural' ones don't clump right and get gross and disgusting.This has no smell, no dust and clumps well... plus it's delivered to my doorstep!

We use the Dr. Elsey's litter with the largeOmega Paw Self-Cleaning Litter Box, Pewter. Two bengal females. Before and after neutered. From about five months old. Introduced to the house and the litter simultaneously. From the same breeder. Trained by the breeder. They share the litter box fine.We empty the box twice a day on most days, not less than once a day. Cats seem to take it for granted (good thing if you ask me). Go through 40lb bag of this litter in about six-eight weeks. It clumps really well to chunks which filter nicely by the Omega Paw's sand screen. It is hard to comment on odors as we noticed that odor control really varies depending on what cats eat.If you can't get cheap or free shipping on this cat litter (Amazon stocks it irregularly for Prime delivery, shop around for total cost with delivery), it is easier to pick it up in a local store. Local PetSmart ordered it when we called ahead.

Like most other reviewers, PRECIOUS CAT ULTRA PREMIUM CLUMPING CAT LITTER gets five stars from me. After years of using regular, non-clumping clay litter preferred by three older indoor/outdoor cats, I got tired of constantly hauling it from the store for my current brood, three young indoor-only cats. I decided to start trying clumping litters and PRECIOUS CAT ULTRA PREMIUM CLUMPING CAT LITTER was the second brand I tested. I love it, and the cats prefer it, too.Pros- No dust!- HARD clumping. The first clumping litter I tried created fragile clumps that tended to break apart when I shook the scooper to separate the clump from the clean litter. Although I haven't tried it, I think I could play stickball with these clumps. :-)- The litter is unscented (I hate the perfume-y smell of some clumping litters), but does a great job of controlling odor with my one-scoop-per-day habit.- Minimal tracking. This was a problem with the first clumping litter I tried. The cats tracked it all over the house. With this litter, the "grains" are heavy enough that they tend not to cling to cat fur.- The cats love it. I had one box with this litter sitting next to a box with the non-clumping litter for over a month. The cats began using this litter more and more and the non-clumping litter less and less. By the end of the day, the PRECIOUS box would be too full of waste while the non-clumping litter was barely used. Even though I wasn't quite finished with the last bag of non-clumping litter, I got rid of it and put this litter in both boxes. From day one, the cats began to use both boxes equally.Cons- For me, the only con is the packaging. A 40-pound bag of this litter is actually smaller than the 25-pound bag of non-clumping litter I used, and it lasts much longer. But it is difficult for me to carry from the store to the car to the house. The slick plastic bag the litter comes packaged in doesn't help. I don't want to pay the high shipping charges for this product, and I can't find the smaller 18-pound unit at the store. It's definitely not a deal-breaker, and in fact, the litter's density is probably responsible for its hard-clumping, non-tracking traits. It's just something to note.Second time's a charm, and my clumping litter tests are over. I found a clumping litter I can live with!
summary: A clumping litter I can live with!

reviewText: Product is as good as any others that we have used.  It is dust free and controls odor well.  Cat seems to take to it with no problem.  Would recommend to friends with cats.  Only complaint is bag is a little heavy (40 lbs.).  Perhaps 25 punds would be more convenient, especially for women to carry.
summary: Product works well for purpose intended.

reviewText: There's not even the tiniest bit of competition, this is THE BEST clumping, clay cat litter available. If you have a preference for clay and clumping litters, you can't do better than this. If you use an automated litter box, like the litter maid brands, you should really consider switching over because this litter is going to hold up so much better to that mechanical arm than other brands. Even if you don't have one of those, and you use clay based litters, you should still switch over right away!Cleaning out litter, which is always the least pleasant part of owning an indoor cat, was made so much easier when we made the switch to Dr. Elsey's. Now, there's no need to worry about clumps breaking as you're scooping or inhaling litter dust as you clean out the kitty's box. The low dust baseline is also excellent for your cat, and a must if you have a kitty with respiratory problems. This is an unscented, clay litter which is great, as it wont turn off cats from using it (due to their much more highly developed sense of smell, cats are often offended by scented litters). If you did want something to absorb the odors a bit better, you could always sprinkle a little bit of baking soda on the litter after you clean it out and add more.So now, what used to take so much time because you had to be so incredibly careful in scooping, lest you break up clumps, cleans up in just a minute or two. This litter's also cut back drastically on how often I need to toss out the entire box of litter, saving on money. Because the clumps don't break up, there's no real residue or broken, stray pieces dirtying up the remaining litter. As a result, the litter really doesn't need to be changed all the frequently. From what used to be a weekly thing, now it's a once a month chore. And if you're really diligent about regular, daily box cleanup, and maintain a sufficient height of litter (~3.5-4 inches) you could probably even get away with not tossing it ever (see amazing online articles on litter and litter boxes by Vet, Lisa A. Pierson on catinfo.org).I've also noticed less tracking, I think because it's such a dense litter, though some still occurs. I think that's just the nature of clumping litter though and easily addressed with a good mat or tray in front of the litter box entrance.Honestly, there's not enough good things to say about this litter. I've found it to be great for my cats and the foster home my last kitty came from also used this brand and they had some 10 cats living there. They swore by this litter and couldn't rave enough about it. I strongly recommend switching, if you're even slightly considering it! You wont regret it.
summary: Hands down best clumping litter EVER!

reviewText: I previously used Tidy Cats clumping litter and Fresh Step clumping litter, and even I thought the perfumes were overpowering. They lost their clumping ability over time, and even new boxes were extremely dusty and it only got worse as time went on. I figured this was just the way clumping cat litters worked. But then my cat began to lose most of the hair on his belly and I wondered if maybe the perfumes and dust in his litter were compelling him to overgroom. I did a lot of research and decided to try this litter to see if it would help.I know it sounds silly to say that my eyes were opened to a whole new world of cat litter, but they were! The first thing I noticed was how much less dust there was. There was a little bit, but nothing compared to the noxious clouds that come from Tidy Cats or Fresh Step. It clumps incredibly well, and doesn't turn to dust over time. Not only does this help you keep the box cleaner, but the clumping also helps reduce how much litter is tracked outside. Of course, there is still some litter that escapes the box, but much less than before.I'm extremely happy with the odor control too. It has no perfume smell at all. Despite this, I never notice a smell from the litterbox unless I actually stick my face into it. Since it's not perfumed, the clumped clay smells faintly like, well, wet clay when it's been used. Some people might be put off by the different smell but I find it much better than heavy perfume.My cat used to obsessively wipe his paws on the floor and the wall for 5-10 minutes at a time after using his box, and I figured it was just a weird quirk of his, but after switching to this product, he now wipes them maybe five times and then stops. I feel awful about how dirty he must have felt while using the old litter. Best of all, his fur is finally starting to grow back!I highly recommend spending a few more dollars to get a litter that's not only more convenient for you, but better for your cat. You'll appreciate having it delivered to your door, too!

My cats have gone through one bag so far and I purchased 3 bags.Pros1.  Not much dust2.  the bag is plastic that is industrial strength and will not bust open.  It holds tight.  I used a knife to cut the bag and poured it into an empty Tidy Cat plastic litter container.3.  Great priceCON:1. The urine sometimes sticks to the bottom of both my cat's cat boxes and is like scrapping off sticky wet cement.  I used Scoop Away,  Tidy Cat and a Wal-Mart boxed brand that acted like Scoopable before and those 3 products did not wetly cling to the bottom of the cat box.  Those litters must absorb the wet quickly and not settle on the bottom and harden.  You cannot just easily scoop out the urine clumps because they have to be seriously scrapped off the bottom of the box which takes time and is gross and never comes completely off.  Also as the scooper scrapes the urine soaked lumps off off bottom of pan, the clumps fall apart spreading their stench amongst the clean litter and the clumps are now too small to scoop out.  Both my cats' litter pans are very very deep and filled high with litter because I have a cat that digs and if the litter is shallow, he leaves his bundles of joy uncovered.  Plus I don't like picking up heavy litter and try to pour as much in the pans as possible and refresh the litter as it goes down.2.  It does not clump as well as Scoop Away, Tidy Cat Mutliple Cat or that Kitty WalMart boxed brand.  The urine clumps sometimes break up.3.  It does not contain smells.  I have 2lb bucket with twist off lid I put the cat litter in.  This Precious Cat Litter reeks after a day or 2 when I untwisted the lid to add more clumps to it.  My bucket has a tight sealed top so the smells don't escape until I open the lid so this is not a problem.Wal-Mart Miss Kitty (or whatever the Kitty name on their litter is) is cheaper and better but if you don't like to drive and face the crowds at Wal-mart because they won't ship their Kitty litter...then this is a good 2nd choice.

This stuff became musty and stinky after the first few uses.  In my case that was under half a day.  Does clump well and if it works for you that is wonderful.  I respect this company and have heard success stories from others.I use a deep litter box. But the cats did not like the litter at all
summary: Nope.  Stinky and did not absorb the odors

reviewText: I'll get right to the point:PROS:Hardly any dust, I stopped sneezing as well as my cats.Firm clumps that don't break apart when the cats are digging and burying their "treasures".As inexpensive as store-brand litter since I buy it locally with no shipping.Easy to vacuum out of the carpeting.CON: The bag is heavy and cumbersome. When I get it home I pour it into a 5 gallon plastic bucket making it easier to handle.
summary: We all stopped sneezing (me and the cats too)

reviewText: Based on the reviews, this is not what I expected at all. I had originally been using World's Best Cat Litter until I started reading what people had to say about the 2 products and decided to give Precious Cat a try. This litter has its' pros and cons but I don't find it works as well as World's Best nor does it feel nearly as natural. Precious Cat does clump better, but that's about it (and the clumping for World's Best is fine as well, just doesn't feel like cement like Precious Cat does). It looks and smells like the typical clay cat litter and does not cover up the smell of poop. It also creates WAY more dust particles than World's Best and that's the main issue I'm trying to avoid. Simply put, World's Best Cat Litter stands head and shoulders above Precious Cat.

This is the best litter I have tried.  Originally I thought to myself "All cat litter must be the same" before I tried this brand.  Now I know better.It has the least dust of anything I have ever used for my cats - you can dump the bag out and see almost no visible dust anywhere.  Of course it has some dust owing to the nature of the product but it is negligible.  I used to hold my breath when adding more litter to try to avoid breathing in vast clouds of particulates.It will not make a filthy box smell clean but it does trap odors better and hold odors less than other litters I have tried.  I really like the scented version of this that comes in a purple bag.If you think there is no difference between cat litters, think again.  You have to try this at least once to see the difference.  Also, be sure to shop around, some of the automatic reorder pet sites around the web can have incredible deals on these massive 40 pound bags.
No complaints. I like the way it smells. My long haired kitten used to get runny poop stuck on his tail and bottom and had to give him baths all the time, this is what we used. NO issues with it.

My cat had very oily fur and after a nice bath with this he came out so nice and fluffy that I wanted to pet him forever!it doesn't foam up very much and you don't need a lot. I was careful to make sure it was all out by doing multiple rinses but it didn't feel soapy at all. works great.
After reading reviews, I knew not to use too much, and to keep adding water to make a sufficient suds. It smells great and is not heavily scented. Helps hair to be less likely to tangle.
Dimtri (my cat) comes out clean, soft and not overly perfumed; just a hint of cherry.  The only thing that would make it better is if it were made with Organic ingredients.

reviewerName: P A "Walking is man's best medicine. Hippocrates"
reviewText: Best natural cat shampoo for cats. We have been using it for years and recommend to everyone! Love it. Bought it from heartypet.

It actually smells like cherry candy.  Strange smell to put on a cat, but now my cats smell delicious.  So I suppose that's... good?  I like it.It doesn't lather very well, but seems very very mild.  I was taking care of  kitten with severe cerebellar hypoplasia, and he had a tendency to accidentally scoot through his poop (poor guy), and wasn't really capable of grooming himself.  This shampoo was gentle on him, left his coat soft, cleaned him off nicely, and of course had him smelling tasty.I recommend this if you want something mild that gets the job done (though you have to use more of it than you'd initially think, as it doesn't spread well), that makes your cat smell edible.

Love this stuff!  Lathers easily and quickly, rinses easily and quickly.  Both these attributes are important because while my cats tolerate baths patiently (for the most part), they do not like to luxuriate in the suds the way I do.  The faster bathtime is over, the better.  This stuff smells great and the clean scent lasts for many days.  Best of all, their long Persian fur is clean and bunny soft.

I took in a dumped 5 week old kitten and although this product says it's best not to use on kittens under 6 weeks of age, I had no choice because she was so filthy and smelly  from being left outside. My vet said it was important with such a young kitten to get something that would not strip her natural oils and was super gentle so we luckily found this at our local small town pet store. The smell is amazing, the ingredient list very minimal and it works very well. I plan on buying more products from this company.
Had 4 rescued Hairy Kids, cats :). Had another kitten show up on Aug. 22, now have 5. They like this food and I think it's one of the better ones after doing the research.
I did extensive research on good and healthy cat foods, and this one fit my price level and my expectations for healthy food. You could also get it a little cheaper at wag.com.

I purchased this food because it's a larger bag at a cheaper price compared to the California Naturals I usually buy. The only real drawback to this cat food is it contains more grains, I believe. And it would be preferable for it to just have whole grain brown rice over white. But it does have a variety of meat sources, which makes it unique.The bag I got had a bit of an unpleasant smell when I opened it. It smelled more like grocery store cat food than other high-end kibbles I've bought. The cats seem to like it fine, though not all of them were crazy about it. I think part of that is because this food is crunchier than what they had before. They are all used to it now, but I think they may prefer their other food. This is a pretty good deal, though, so I will probably alternate this with other brands.If you're looking for a higher-end, nutritious cat kibble at a pretty good price this definitely isn't a bad choice. How many cat foods have chicken, salmon, turkey, duck, flax, kelp, and herbs with no byproducts or low grade ingredients?

I try to avoid buying pet food that doesn't specify the animal's meat in it. Some petfoods say "animal" by products and this can be stuff from rendering plants that can include other dogs, cats, roadkill, plastic bags, flea collars etc.

I use this brand of cat food and the dog version too.  Very healthy, cats and dogs love this stuff, and it's affordable.  The results of your animals eating this food (including the canned) is very visible when petting my cat.  Her fur is silky smooth, healthy looking, etc.  I highly recommend this food to anyone with a cat or dog.  Don't be fooled by brands like Science Diet, Purina, Ol Roy, etc.  Read the ingredients of your current brand, and the there shouldn't be an beet pulp, corn, or by products.

My cats love this food.  They turned up there noses at other cat food, like friskies, science diet and others.  This food also does not have an over powering and offensive smell.  Won't kill you if your cat breathes on you!!!

Really for the price you can't beat the quality ingredients. I got lucky and my cats actually like the taste. Its quite a bit more expensive than what I was feeding them, but also much better for them. Just make sure you transition it slowly, I added a bit too much into the mix one of the days and my cat felt a bit sick for a day, but has been fine since.Edit: I have been feeding this to my cats for over a month now and have noticed they seem much more energetic.Edit 2: This review was written during the old formula. My cats actually prefer the new shape but I don't like the new ingredient list.. they really reduced that salmon. Hopefully they compensated with more chicken but no way of knowing. My cats have seemed a bit less energetic since the switch to their new formula so doubting it is as healthy. I'm guessing the formula was to reduce production cost yet the price has gone up.. so I'm taking off a star.

The cats love this.  My older guy with the protein allergy usually has a problem keeping kibble down, but he does pretty well with this.  The only thing - the product description says "X" shaped kibble.  They're actually round - if that makes a difference.

this is my current secondary go-to food listing meats as primary ingredients, regular meats further down the list, not alot of grain fillers (it does have barley in it, but thats further down the ingredient list also so not that concerned with it). i use this along with merrick before grain which is also about $2 / lb and has a nice ingredient list.price per lb is good, though when wellness / blue buffalo are on sale with free shipping their ingredients are better for almost the same price as this and i would get them instead at that point.
summary: good food listing meats as primary ingredients, regular meats further down the list, no corn fillers

reviewText: We had a problem with this cat food. All of my cats but one developed loose stools on this cat food. It took me several bags of cat food to figure out that it was this cat food that was causing the problem because it did not kick in right off the bat. I had been mixing this with their old dry food and I was supplementing with canned food during the transition, so it took a bit to narrow down this new food as the source. The smaller cats developed the diarrhea before the larger cats did. I believe there is just a bit too much fiber in this formulation or perhaps it is the berries in the ingredients that trigger the loose stools. I would not have a problem mixing this with Iams or Science Diet if I could figure out the threshold where the loose stools starts. For now, I'm just going to stick to supplementing with canned food, which has almost no filler in it. On a final note, the cats were not thrilled with this. They would eat it but would go for any other food in the house before they would eat this, if given a choice.
summary: We had a problem with this

reviewText: After doing tons of research I settled on this food to feed my 1 year old cat I recently adopted at the shelter. The shelter had her on a corn filled grocery store food--can't fault them for saving resources though. I have been feeding  Chicken Soup to her for six months and I have nothing but good things to say! She loves the food. She begs for it at meal times. Her coat has improved so much. It is glossy and she sheds so little it's incredible. She has no dandruff or skin issues. Also, our vet said she was "ear wax prone" at her first appointment--this quality food has reduced the overproduction of earwax in her ears to zero--clean ears for Penny!! :)  When it comes out the other end, it is firm and not too smelly.I must caution--don't make the same mistake I did and give your cat too much of this food. It's premium food and they don't need a lot of it!! My cat gets 1/2 cup per day which still is too much. She is being weaned down to less at the advice of the vet.

Did a lot of research online to find a reasonably priced quality cat food.  Most supermarket brands and pet shops carry food with lots of grains, which is not good for pets.  Peek at the ingredients and you will probable see corn or corn by-product high on the list.  This food got several high ratings.  I unfortunately bought the large bag without first testing it on my 2 cats. One cat did fine, but the other cat developed watery stools and rash around perineum 3-4 weeks after switching over.  Loose stools and rash continued another week before I switched to a different food and they both cleared up shortly.  Too bad, this is a good quality food at a reasonable price. I'm feeding them California Natural dry food  with good results.

After doing much research to find the best food for my cats I decided on this one. The ingredients are far more superior for cats than many that proclaim their products to be premium. Cats need meat, not a bunch of cheap grain fillers. [...]*Note* There's never been a recall on this food.The price is lower than most of the "premium" foods, too. My cats all look great & eat it very well.
summary: Premium food at a great price!

reviewText: I want to feed my cats high-quality food, and CS lets me do that without going broke. My cats love it and it gives them the nutrition they need and supplements to keep them healthy.
summary: One of the most affordable high-quality foods

reviewText: I have two older cats (10+ years) and one had been throwing up every day which was very worrisome.  I was really afraid one of them was dying, but many comments said the vet had no idea what it was.  While trying to figure out what the problem was I stumbled upon all of the info on how bad most of the big brand dry cats food are and all of the nasty stuff that's in them - including euthanized animals (ew!).  Apparently, the best thing for cats is real meat but I have my cats on a timed feeder which is awesome and they don't hunt me down for every meal.  So, I compromised and switched to one feeding of wet (Friskies) and went looking for a good dry because I just can't commit to being stalked all the time when they want to be fed.  Chicken Soup was pretty highly rated and not as expensive as the very top brands - although I think it's still pretty expensive at $28+ a bag (and it started out as a prime item - that helped).  Anyway, the food is pretty big and "X" shaped which did concern me because my cats were used to much smaller bits.  They did transition to it well and the throwing up stopped immediately - and they rarely throw up at all now.  I would say after a few months they started to lose interest and were leaving a lot in the feeder every day.  I would usually cover the wet with it at dinner and then they would finish it.  Not sure if they are just getting old and it was too tough on their teeth or not, but I switched to the Blue Buffalo Wilderness Salmon and they gobbled that right down.  It's much smaller little bits so hopefully that's going to help.  It's only been a day so I'll update after a few weeks.
summary: My Cats Liked it For a While

reviewText: have had to wean my 5 cats off fast food dry food & thought this would be a good start, but... not so much. they loved it the first day & have snubbed it since. so much so that i bought a bag of friskies to mix it with so they will eat it til it's gone. hate the thought of throwing money out the dumpster so they're picking thru it & eating but can really tell they're not happy!!! won't buy it again. will try harvest moon ingigo gold & see how that goes. finicky cats for sure!!! but they love their mashed spuds hehe.
summary: great first day, hate it after!!

reviewText: Ingredients have changed.  Disappointed.in present quality.  Used to be better. Lower quality and cats do not like as much.  They used to love it.  Now they don't.
summary: Ingredients have changed and are disappointing and lower quality.

reviewText: The photo's are not current - the shape of the food is now more like a little circle rather than an x and my cats like it a lot better!

reviewerName: Shawna T. Live Healthy & with Compassion :) "...
reviewText: UPDATE>July 28th, 2012>This food was RECALLED due to salmonella earlier this year. I googled the recall & Diamond foods and was shocked at what I learned! This food is manufactured by DIAMOND, which has been know to manufacture many brand names and who are know for RECALLS for bad pet foods!!!!  Because of the recipe change and then the recall, I WILL NO LONGER FEED ANY FOODs MANUFACTURED by Diamond!  I would not feed a human child any foods made by a company known for repeated recalled foods and I will not feed my furbabies it either!I have been feeding Chicken Soup to my dogs(fur babies)for years, great food! I didn't realise they're was a Chicken Soup cat food..I was tired of coming home or waking up to find puk on my carpets from one or all of my 3 cats (other fur babies). I tried to find a food they would not throw up, but....Meow Mix=PUK, Purina Cat chow=PUK, Purina one chicken and rice=PUK...I finally found this on amazon and for the HIGH quality and reasonable price I bought it...My 3 cats love it, and NO MORE PUK!!!! Yeah!!! Been 8 mnths now and not a single throw up...I will always feed this to my cats, and recommended it to others..
summary: RECALLED, March 2012, FOOD MADE by DIAMOND!!!

reviewText: I have alot of experience with various dry foods.  Started out with Deli-cats from Costco which gave my cat struvites and almost killed him when he couldnt pee any more.  Scared the hell out of me and after a $2000 vet bill for the animal hospital decided it was not prudent to skimp on food quality.  So went to the highest end food Evo which costs about twice as much as Chicken Soup.  While it is really a high-quality food I started noticing that my cats just gulp down the kibble without chewing.  The kibble is too small for adult cats.  This causes 2 problems: bad for tooth and gum health if they dont chew, and eating too fast which can cause vomiting.  So I went thru small batches of about 8 premium brands looking for a good sized kibble.  None of them qualified until I found Chicken Soup.  The kibble is X shape - not round like the rest - which kind of forces them to chew.  Ingredients look fine.  Price is actually reasonable compared to the others.  So I have been feeding it about a year now.  The only thing I can say negative is, like some others have noted, that it causes loose stools in my 11 year old cat.  However my 2 younger cats seem to have normal bowel movements.  Maybe she needs a senior cat formula - if it keeps up I will have to look to feed her something else.

My cat had been pooping outside the litterbox for some time, and the vet finally decided he had some sort of digestive issue, possibly IBS or Crohn's, that was making defecation painful for him. They gave him some medication, recommended dietary changes, and suggested getting a new litterbox with different litter, because even once the symptoms cleared up, the cat would probably still have negative associations with his old boxes.I picked this up at the pet store because I was desperate to get him to stop pooping on the carpet ASAP. It's possible any new litter would have done the trick. But thankfully, this worked. I still have his two old litterboxes, with his old brand of litter, which he will deign to pee in, but he will only poop in the new box with the Cat Attract litter. After months of pooping everywhere but the litterbox, he used the new one, with this litter, almost as soon as I put it in, and has used it consistently ever since. I bought a second bag on Amazon because the price, even with Prime shipping, was about the same as the pet store, and it was more convenient to have it delivered.My biggest complaint--and the reason I've kept the old litter around too--is that it clumps a little too well. Before, I was using the World's Best Cat Litter brand, which is corn-based, and which does a very good job of sticking to itself without sticking to the box or the scoop. Cat Attract is incredibly sticky when wet; it has the consistency of freshly poured concrete and it sticks to the scoop and the bottom of the litter box a little better than it sticks to itself, so scooping up after pee is a bit of a hassle. My plastic scooper bends  when I force it against a clump; I have to dig at it with the corner of the scoop, as that's the most structurally sound angle. Then I have to wipe out all the little crevices in the scoop with a paper towel. I've found that the problem can be partly ameliorated by sprinkling a thin layer of baking soda on the bottom of the litter box before putting in the litter; that keeps it from sticking to the box as much. I would also recommend a metal scoop.
summary: Worked on my cat, I but wish it weren't so sticky!

reviewText: My 1-year-old male cat started urinating next to his litter box about six weeks ago.  I tried crystal litter, shredded pine litter, Tidy Cat, etc.  Nothing was working and I was getting really frustrated.  I saw this litter on Amazon and since it had gotten mostly great reviews, decided to try it.  I had to laugh because while I was closing the top on his litter box, I looked behind me and he was digging in the litter left in the bag!  We haven't had the problem since I started using this litter and it has been almost two weeks.  He also now buries his poop which is better!

Tried the smaller bags at first. They work. They had pawed  a pile from the box onto the floor and even went on that. I've since gotten rid of the smaller boxes and they just use litter maid self cleaning pones which are much deeper.

I heard nothing but great things about this product, it is wonderful. I used it when i first moved into my home so my cats would use the litterbox well, didn't have any issues while I was using this product.

This, is the best litter around for cats that resist going in the box.  It is perfect in general.  Not a complaint.The 20 pond bag costs almost as much as the 40 pound bag, so if you are able go for the 40 lb.  if your cat doesn't haveany resistance to going in the box you might want to go with something cheaper.
I've been using this for years now.  I am afraid to try something different.  It's expensive, but my cat no longer pees outside of the litter box.
summary: Best cat litter to guarantee that your cats won't do it elsewhere

reviewText: I didn't see any difference with the use of this product.  It didn't help with the problem with my cat.
summary: Didn't seem to work at all.

reviewText: Only one of our cats really seemed attracted to this litter. I guess it is like catnip - some cats like it and some don't. It was a good quality of litter and clumped very well.

I cannot yet comment on whether this particular litter has kept the cat from urinating elsewhere, but I believe so. This cat has territorial issues, and I let one of my cats in her upstairs area which must have upset her. A very helpful booklet on training and cleaning is included in the bag. Dr. Elsey developed this litter, and there are other specialty litters in his line: for long-haired cats, for cats with urinary tract problems, for kittens, etc.I can tell you that this litter has a very nice texture, and it controls urine smell. It does this despite the fact that it does not seem to have any fragrance at all. The particles are small and feel soft which may help because my cat had been declawed when I got her.I was using a rough clay litter before that also seemed to control urine odor. But I wouldn't always change it as often as I should have because the odor was controlled from my standpoint. But because this litter does clump, I have to discipline myself to remove the clumps. I cannot use it in all my litter boxes because downstairs I have dogs, and one of them will eat cat feces (a common thing with dogs).I believe it controls urine smell because to save time I have been putting the urine clumps in my bathroom wastebasket which has no cover. I have a pretty sensitive nose, but have smelled no cat urine odor in the bathroom. (I dis get a small step trash can for the waste, and I have been impressed.) Amazon has some good ones reasonably priced but I got a cheap one at a family dollar store.
summary: Without fragrance it does control urine odor, nice texture

reviewText: Great product and does the job

My cat's are very picky about their litter and I like to mix a cup of this product to their litterbox. We travel alot and sometimes they do not want to get in the litter box easily, I add some of this product and like magic... they go!

It's lousy at odor control, and seems to use up a lot of litter when it clumps, so I feel like I'm constantly running out.  It also turns to concrete on the bottom of the litter box, and is hard/gross to scrape up.  It claims to be 99% dust free, but I haven't really found this to be true at all.But it does exactly what it guarantees:  It brings errant eliminators back to the box, and therefore it gets five stars in spite of its shortcomings.

Some of my monsters LOVED this stuff; in fact, 3 of them were peeing in it at the same time as soon as I rigged the box! Sadly, though, the one that our Fairy Godmother bought it for didn't care about it one way or another. Admittedly he's severely brain damaged, but he's mentally and physically capable of box duty, but he doesn't have a clue about it. Because he was a holdout, I give it 4.5 stars, but the rest give Cat Attract paws up!

I really like this litter (see my review for the 40 lb bag of this same litter). Best clumping litter I've ever seen. This 20 lb bag is great if you have just one cat, a small litter box, or if you live on the ground floor and don't have to walk up stairs with this litter. If you have a big litter box, try going for the 40 lb bag, or else you'll find yourself buying kitty litter every couple of weeks.
summary: Awesome litter! But get the 40 lb bag

reviewText: I wanted to bring my old gal (14, arthritis) back into a litter box. She started peeing just outside the box. Thought that with a small step for her, and cat attract litter, she'd go back. Everybody else went nuts for this stuff...it definitely does attract. So much so that one of my kittens (1 yr) decided that it'd be nice to ROLL in it...yuck. LOL Still have half a bag and afraid to put it out.Ah, but did it attract the old girl? Noop.Fastidious cleaning, a couple of small steps, and a lot of encouragement (phew) got her back into regular Dr. Elsey's. But she still misses now and then. She's sweet, pretty and purrs. So "we" tolerate it. Periodically I just put her in the litter box...especially if I see she hasn't gone in a while (She doesn't cover her stuff...good clue). And if she does it in the box, she gets a lot of praise, some brushing, and a few crunchies. Cats CAN be trained, as long as their owner gets trained too! :)4 stars for "general" attraction, but difficult to use in multi-cat household.
summary: OMG, everyone went for this stuff

reviewText: Kitty had some litter box problems.  I tried Earth's Best Cat litter and it worked beautifully.  However, I decided that I wanted to move the litter box and I wanted to make certain that kitty didn't revert to old habits. I added a second box in the spot where I wanted the litter box to be while initially keeping the old box where it was.  I used Cat Attract in the new box as I wanted to make sure that kitty really took notice of the new litter box.  It worked perfectly. Kitty was immediately attracted to and curious about the new box.  In fact, he loves Cat Attract so much that he sort of abandoned the old box.  Problem is that Cat Attract is difficult to locate locally and it is a little bit of a pain to have to order the litter online because it is difficult to arrange for someone to be home for delivery.  Also, Cat Attract is expensive!  Whereas 7 lbs of Earth's Best lasts a really long time, I ran through almost 20lbs of Cat Attract in a week.  It seems more compact than other litters.  I am still scratching my head as to why this should be so.  Anyway, as much as I do like this product (and more importantly kitty likes it), I am going to try to switch back to Earth's Best, if possible.

Unfortunately, this product did not make a difference with our situation. But nothing seems to be working for my cat who is spraying and squating outside (and inside) the litter boxes. However, he is a unique one as both vets have mentioned.

My 5 year old tortie-point Siamese has been a chronic carpet pooper since she was a kitten. If the litter box had 1 lump in it, she'd poop next to the box. I've been using this now for a couple months and its amazing - she's not pooped on the floor since, even after I was in the hospital for 5 days and my brother refused to clean the cat box.

reviewerName: Kat A. "Reading in the beautiful Santa Cruz m...
reviewText: So we've used this brand off and on now and we are switching back to it for good. What can I say, there are a million cat litters out there and none are perfect. But when we brought our kitten home from the shelter she took to it immediately. Some people have reported that this doesn't work and their cat urinates outside the box or elsewhere, but this is not a fault of the litter. Many cats have behavior problems and we had a cat for years that would go everywhere but in his box, regardless of the brand of litter. So people need to be realistic. I like this brand because it's low dust level and I like that it's clay. I was using a corn based litter but with all the GMO stuff I took my cat off corn based litter (they do get it in their paws and do ingest some of it). Works great for us.

i originally purchased this for a traumatized kitty who was peeing on the floor. she adjusted to her new environment and i no longer need this product as she now uses a " normal" less expensive brand.  however, the litter is wonderful, makes cleaning the litter box a snap.  i can't say that the litter made a difference in changing her habit.she just needed time to adjust. also i learned to use a minimum of 3 inches so she has plenty of digging space.

refused to use litter box. Ok, make it two. One was a stray cat so I give him a little bit of a break. I took them to the vet, they were perfectly healthy... So it wasn't that. Frustrated, I tried this litter. It's far far more expensive than my regular litter (hence the 4 star review vs 5) but I thought I'd give it a try. It worked. At first, no, it didn't. After 3 or 4 days of rubbing their paws in it, it worked. Both cats seem to be attracted to it, and they have constantly been using the litter pan. Another thing that I like about this litter is... It really is practically dust free which reduces my asthma attacks a lot while changing litter. I just recently got the Litter robot II bubble unit, and was frustrated because they wouldn't use it... 3 of the 4 cats are using it now, perhaps due to this litter, not sure. :).
The best litter on the market. Never smells. Cats use it. Lasts a long time. I tell everyone to buy this...they resist due to cost, finally buy it and thank me soon after!

i was having trouble with other clumping cat litter but from the first time I used it I was able to scoop the clumps better without breaking my arm getting it out.  I really like this litter and so do my cats.  This is my 3rd order.  Am really pleased I found this litter.
summary: Very good cat litter, can't go wrong

reviewText: We were nearing the end of our rope with a senior cat peeing everywhere but in her box. This product has saved the day. Truly, worth trying if nothing else has worked for you. In conjunction with daily cleaning it simply works.My only suggestion for the manufacturers would be to provide a resealable bag.

For years I have had a cat that would go to the bathroom in numerous places, most of them not in his box. Suitcases, area rugs and bathmats, plastic or bubble wrap, nylon fabric, athletic shoes and flip flops were his favorite things to pee on. A few years ago we rescued two kittens and his issues got even worse. He hated sharing any of the three boxes we have and didn't even like using "his" box when he had already used it once before. I just couldn't clean the boxes out frequently enough, especially when I wasn't home. He also started pooping on the floor beside the litter box. This was an almost daily occurence. Over the years I have tried several of the eco-friendly litters. Feline Pine eventually made my house smell like a damp wood shop, scattered everywhere, and sometimes I would get a splinter in my foot from it. World's Best is corn based and smelled like a farm and my cats hated it. Swheat Scoop was OK -- until I got a few bags infested with moths. I was desperate to find a new litter, even it wasn't environmentally the best choice. I just wanted something that all my cats would use and controlled odors without an overwhelming perfumed scent. Last week I bought two bags of Precious Cat and replaced all the litter with it. I know it's best to introduce a new litter gradually, but I decided it was do or die time, so to speak. They all seemed very interested at first and just started by smelling. Over the next 24 hours they all began testing it out. It has now been one week and I am thrilled to report there has not been a single accident or present left outside the box! This morning I even discovered the old cat using one of the boxes normally used by the other cats. I have never seen him use it before, and it had been used several times before he hopped into it. That is just unbelievable after all these years and problems. Life has gotten a lot easier for all of us thanks to Precious Cat! It is worth the price!!!Update 11/11/11: The success has continued to be impressive overall. I have been buying this locally at Petco for $21.99. Stopped in Petsmart today and discovered they are selling it for $14.99 a bag! Guess where I am shopping from now on?! Petsmart does sell a stainless steel litter box, if you are looking for something besides plastic. It has a modern look, very high sides, rubber feet and is $24.99. They also sell the herbal mix that you can sprinkle in, I got some to add in for boost of encouragement. We had a minor relapse recently with our old cat when house guests disrupted his routine. I am hoping that the stainless steel litter box, the herbal mix and some coaxing will get him back on track. Even with his current issue, he is still using the box more frequently thanhe ever did before I switched to Precious Cat. It has really made a huge difference for our household.I would like to address a few comments left by other reviewers. I was skeptical about the dustless claims. I am sure there is some dust eventually, but I haven't seen it. No dust cloud when you pour or sift through the box. I completely agree with comments about the smell of the litter. There is virtually no smell to the litter itself, other than a faint herb smell that is almost undetectable unless I am inches from it. Odor control of cat waste is excellent, especially if the waste is covered by the cat. Tracking is minimal and stays close to the box. I used to find Feline Pine and Swheat Scoop on my couch, in my bed, everywhere. Precious Cat clumps very hard, but the longer it sits the better. One of my cats pees in a line pattern, so his clumps break up more than the others. And sometimes it does stick to the box. However, if I tip the box and gently bang on the outside of it, the clump will disloge without breaking and I can easily scoop it up. There is no such thing as perfect, but this litter is a lifesaver for our household.
summary: Magic in a bag and worth every penny!

reviewText: Love this litter. I purchase the kitten attract as it is lighter and my cats like it. My one cat likes it so much she sits by the bag and rubs against it. Almost no dust. EXPENSIVE. My one cat was urinating in house because of feral cats outside. After I switched to this (kitten Attract), she used box. Even after getting a kitten and move she has always used her box with either this or kitten attract. My husband complained about price because I have three indoor cats and was using six bags a month at about 17 each. So I switched to the same brand (precious cat), for about the same price with twice the litter. To keep my cat using I mix the kitten attract in with the less expensive. Either one works except, like I said, the kitten one is lighter. A very very good product. Anyone with new kitten or urinating cats should try this. Bag broke in mail. Amazon, sent me another, that one also broke a little. Will not buy on line unless a sale.
Yup, this product works.  I use it to litter train feral cats and kittens.  If you work with domesticating ferals, this is a must.

Was at the end of my rope with my old guy. Rugs were a mess even with machine cleaning and pet urine remover. (see review on UV blacklight flashlight) Vet couldn't help. If you know what male cat urine smells like, well, you know the problem. Same litter, clean box four times a day, same litterbox, no medical problems, no new stress. Urinating everywhere. So, I gave this litter a try. What did I have to lose? Put a scoop on the top of his regular litter. He walked past me while I was closing up the bag and peed in the box. Seriously. Wow. No "misses" since then. The vet who developed this should get a medal.

Just got 8 week old kittens last night, and it only took them about 5 minutes in the bathroom before using it. I just plopped them in the litter and rubber their paws in it to show them it was theirs. I noticed that my local Petco sells this for $17 so I will be going there to get this there and save some money next time.

I don't know if my cat just got bored with the litter that I used, or if the product was changed to something he hated, but he decided that the floor was his litter box.  For a long while I was able to get him to use dog training pads, I think he was being spiteful and ruining my stuff so I gave him something to ruin and made sure that he knew I really enjoyed these pads.This is something that he had done off and on for years, do his business on the floor or on those pads and then mix it up by going where he was suppose to for months.  Usually to get him back into using the box I had to switch it out for a new one.This time though none of those tricks were working for him, so I decided to try this litter after reading all the reviews here and on other sites when googling this problem.He started using the box immediately.  Very happy with this product and will buy more in the future.  Yes it cost more then regular litter, but I rather pay more for litter that is used then just have a box of slightly cheaper stuff sitting around while my cat decides the carpet needs a new stain.

My mother's cat started straying from the litter box after a bout with kidney disease. Even though she's being treated for her symptoms and is on a prescription diet, the feline kept returning to her old 'spots' outside the box to relieve herself. We started using this litter and she now uses the litter box all the time now, just like she did before she got sick. We are also using an enzyme action formula to remove the smell of the urine from the floors - the enzymes 'consume' the urea particles and become inert when they've had their fill. This combo has removed any and all cat pee smell from the house.

This litter saved my cat from being euthanized! My cat has diabetes and my husband and I were getting into fights about him peeing all over the house. I didn't want to get rid of him or euthanize him so I tried everything I could think of. This was one of my last resorts because it is more expensive than regular litter....BUT it is SOOOOO worth it! The first day, he decided to pee in it 100%! I only saw one pee spot the next day but I think this is because I need to clean the old spots more thoroughly. I will update once there has been more time.

This litter works very well. I have a 1year old male feral cat that started urinating outside of the  litter box.  Cat Attract has totally resolved this issue.I found it was great to have the litter delivered to my door -but I found that I was paying a lot more for the litter that way.  I still use cat attract. But I now buy it at petsmart
Enough said. It's hard to find chinchilla food - all the big box stores sell the sugary junk that my vet says are unhealthy for chins. Amazon makes my life so much easier by shipping it to my door.
summary: The only food my vet recommends

reviewText: Doesn't have all the fattening seeds and fruits and nuts that other mixes have. Pretty much all pet chinchillas are going to be over weight, so this is the best option for a balanced diet combined with timothy hay for a chinchilla.

I've been feeding my chinchilla Oxbow for 5+ years and she really seems to do well with it. On a side note, because this food is alfalfa-based, chinchillas need timothy hay in addition. Also, lots of things to chew.As a warning though, my dog seems to love this and always gets sick if she gets into it.

My chinchillas love this chin food! It smells so fresh and is very nutritious. I got a great price on these pellets and the shipping was fast! I recommend this brand to people who have chinchillas as pets and wants to keep them happy and healthy!
I was able to integrate this food with my chinchilla and he seems to enjoy eating it more than his older food. He seems just as hyper and excited as ever eating this.
my pet chinchillas love this brand, will have to buy more in the future. food smells fresh and healthy. thanks
My chinchilla loved this food. It smelled like grass and didn't have all the colorful, "gimmicky" fillers. It's a pretty solid and healthy pet product.

My dog was always a good walker but when he changes his mind he is too big for me to control so I LOVE this gentle leader as it just keeps us in check.  He walks even better than he did and I feel secure that if another dog starts him off I'll be able to control him.

My puppy was a 60 pound pulling machine. It took two of us to take him for a walk, each of us with a leash, to insure our safety.  I had heard of head harnesses and really thought they were for dogs that were untrained and allowed to be wild. And were cruel. How wrong I was.  When my trainer suggested one--I ordered it the next day.  It truly works like a charm.  Now walks are now walks, not a pulling contest.  I ordered another one just now to make sure I am never without of one. Do watch the DVD for proper fitting directions.
summary: I didn't believe it till I tried it myself

reviewText: no matter what level your dog is at walking this is a great collar due to it does give the dog a much more comfortable experience and also a great training aid for pullers, jumpers, dogs that try to run off, dogs that try to refuse and sit on their haunches and or lay down...well they'll only try that a couple of times at most and will have a completely new attitude about walking and listening...you won't be unhappy with this purchase.

This isn't the total solution to our problem of our dog pulling when being walked but it certainly has helped!  It took her a few days to get used to it but now she sits still for us to put it on her.  We would never go back to the harness.
summary: Really helps when walking our dog

reviewText: Really like the gentle leader for training my German Shepherd rescue dog. There's no way i could control her with a regular collar!
summary: Fast delivery and high quality product

reviewText: this collar works great.  my dog (a 100 lb lab) always pulled on walks, now she doesn't.  i go on more walks now.

Last year I rescued a 9mo old pit mix with no history who barely knew how to sit, and must have watched too many movies about dog sledding because she pulled like a sled dog everywhere she went. We used the Easy Walk harness for the first few months, but it was clear she wasn't really listening to the leash signals. Choke chain was a joke. Her neck is as thick as my thigh and she never cared about choking herself. Found the Gentle Leader 6 months into neck and chest harness experiments. Took two weeks to really break her in to it (and even now she will rub her face on anything or anyone any chance she gets), but now we never go outside without it. Even keeping a careful eye on the adjustments each time we go out she will pull against it when she wants something bad, but controlling her and leash communicating with her now is INFINITELY easier (at now 65lbs). Most of the time she walks right where I want her to, and as she's progressing in training, she lunges at strange dogs far less frequently. I think this leash has helped her to listen to me better in high stimuli situations. We've definitely made the most progress while using this leash (although she never really rushes to put it on to go out like she does with the martingale collar). Gonna keep using it. Usually the people who mistake it for a muzzle (even with her mouth wide open and panting), I don't want to chat with or introduce my dog to anyway (us being deep in the hood) and I'm happy they give us a wide berth without her having to act aggressive/protective of me.

...and the dogs like it, too!  The dogs will try to sneak in a few nibbles of this food when we are not looking.This is currently one of the better deals price-wise on Amazon for upscale catfood.  It contains no corn, which I try to avoid feeding my animals.
summary: It's a hit with our cats

reviewText: This dry food is a good quality at a price lower than other brands with similar qualities. I recommend it.
summary: Good quality food and better price than anywhere else

reviewText: I'd prefer to not give my cat grains, but he pukes up the grain free stuff, so this is at least whole grain. I love how the ingredients are natural and that it provides balanced nutrition for my kitten.
summary: healthy and the kitty loves it

reviewText: I love this item for my cats. They seem to enjoy the taste, plus it is high in nutritional value.

I have 2 adult cats and 2 kittens.  I have a gravity feeder with adult kibble and they all get a can of wet food a day.  Despite that, I can't seem to keep the bowl with this kitten kibble full.  Even the adult cats like it.  They've gone through 1/2 a bag in about 3 weeks.
Bella, my kitten, loves the food. I'm happy that she is getting a good quality food so she will grow up healthy and happy.
summary: Chicken Soup for the Kitten Lover"s Soul

reviewText: They are growing at a good rate and looking very healthy.  I recommend this product.It's a good price too.

When I started buying this for my kittens it was $23/bag.  When I returned a couple of months ago to purchase again and saw the HUGE price spike I took my biz elsewhere.  The food itself, at least from the west coast plant which is where mine came from, is excellent quality and I fed this to my kittens and fed the dog food to my dogs.  However I won't be buying it anymore since the price hike and I actually ended up switching to a local brand where I know exactly what is going into my "kids'" food and I'm getting the same amount for $1.50 more.  Better deal all the way around.I suggest looking elsewhere for a different food.  Chicken Soup is becoming more and more scarce.

I was looking for a Good Wholesome Dry Food for my Two kittens and I think I found it in "Chicken Soup for the Kitten Lover's Soul Dry Food Chicken Formula" My Kittens like it and eat it all the time even though they have other choice of Dry Food, but this one they go through it very Fast. I like the fact that is made with Wholesome Ingredients No Meat-By-Products or Chemicals and Flavorings. The List of Ingredients is very Long and Complex,  all Good and all supposed to be Good for Kittens, with all kinds of Nutrients, Vitamins, Minerals so many different Proteins, Chicken, Salmon, Turkey Duck and even all kinds of different Vegetables, Enriched with Antioxidants, Omega Fatty Acids and a Healthy Balance of the Major Food Groups. I like the Size of the Dry Food Pellets/Bits small enough for them and not that Big as others. Chicken Soup Dry Food is Made with Natural simple Ingredients to help my kittens Grow into Happy and Healthy Adult Cats! ...Thank You D. D.
summary: ~ MADE with NATURAL and SIMPLE INGREDIENTS ~

reviewText: We've tried numerous collar types and harnesses but no matter what, our dog constantly pulled us on walks. Training works temporarily but it's constant reinforcement and doesn't make for a pleasant walk. The first time we used the Gentle Leader though, she was a new dog! While she tried to pull, it is a fifth of the force since she is pulling with her muzzle and not her chest or neck. She quickly understood that when she walked with us, she could stay facing forward; once she gets distracted or starts walking fast, this collar redirects her head back towards us and slows her right down. She tries to take it off with her paws, but she only messes with it when we stop walking, otherwise she'd rather walk than try to fight the collar.
summary: Instant change in my dog's manners

reviewText: I love this product. I watched the CD that came with the gentle leader, it was super helpful with the correct fitting. This has made walking enjoyable with my lab! She used to just pull and it would feel like my shoulder would come out of the joint. Now I can hold the leash with my pinkie finger.

Absolutely amazing. We bought this for our 66 pound hound who is a crazy strong puller and after the first use with the gentle leader my wife is able to walk the 2 dogs together without any hassle or concern. The collar itself is easy to use and adjust. Have had no issues with that.

For those that are confused with the sizing for your dog, below is the sizing chart from Petsafe.Consider your dog's weight based on the chart below. Next, look at the shape of the dog's head and snout. Breeds with long slender heads may take a smaller size than other dogs of the same weight. Breeds with wide muzzles may need a slightly larger size.
