When in doubt, choose the next larger size.Petsafe Fitting Chart--------------------------------------------------------------------------------Size --------------- Pet Size-------------- ----------Sample BreedsPetite------------under 5 pounds-----------Chihuahua, teacup and toy breeds, puppiesSmall------------5-25 pounds--------------Beagle, Sheltie, ShihtzuMedium--------- 25-60 pounds------------ Border Collie, Bulldog, PugLarge------------60-130 pounds ---------- Boxer, German Shepherd, Labrador RetrieverExtra Large-----over 130 pounds----------Great Dane, Newfoundland, Saint Bernard--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------I bought this for my aging mother, who just got a puppy after her long time companion Belgiun Tervuren past away. Now that she is getting older, having a pulling puppy seems to be very hard on her when they walk, so I decided to get this gentle lead for her, since I had great experience with this lead, when my Newfoundland was a young ball of energy. Everyone was complementing on how she would take me on walks.This lead did wonders, worked like a charm. It was almost funny to see her and what the lead would do. Every time she would try to pull, her face would turn to her side so she ends up looking back, then she couldn't walk forward. It would stop her immediately.The lead may take time for some dogs to adjust to, just because it goes over the muzzle.With my Newfoundland she did not like the lead on her face and she would try to take it off while walking sometimes but eventually she did get used to it.For some you may have to be very patient, but you will get there. If anyone is wondering will it hurt your dog? No it will not. it really is gentle on you and your dog.Best product I have ever used for pulling dogs, stops them before they can even pull.If your dog is a squirmish I also recommend having a additional regular collar on for back up,(HOLDING IT VERY LOOSLEY SO THE LEAD CAN DO IT'S JOB) in case of slip offs (sometimes it does happen) until you know it's OK.

Before I got this, my dog would pull me into trees. She weights about 45 Lbs and has an untrained mind and body. While she is wearing the head collar, she does not bark at other dogs and does not pull me. I love it.
My dog would not walk in this no matter what we tried. We followed the recommendations on the instructions and everything.

Huskies are pullers, yep, we all knew that, so the gentle leader is the ONLY thing we can use that helps.  We tried all kinds of harnesses, but the leader is the best cause he just can't pull AS HARD.  Granted, he still pulls, and he probably always will, he's bred and born to, but this keeps it manageable for us.
summary: a must have for a husky owner

reviewText: My Beagle mix HATED this collar.  I watched the entire CD and followed their instructions but she would not become acclimated to this new type of collar.  She would just shut down before we even began our walks by laying down and would try to run away when she saw me with the collar.  When I did have it on her she would try to pull it off almost the entire time we were on our walks. The CD claims to have the answer for every type of negative dog reaction but none of them ever worked for my pup.  I tried for a month but it was just too sad to see my dog hate going out on walks.  It now sits on one of the coat hooks in my hall.  I went with no-pull harness and she now loves going for walks again!
It's an interesting concept and a well-designed, durable toy, but my dog is simply uninterested. He is generally unpicky when it comes to toys, but this one just sits there, unused and unloved.
summary: Would be good if my dog liked it

reviewText: my little destroyer has not been able to take off any chunks of the rubber as she has been able to with every other toy, that being said though, she does not chew on it for extended periods of time, it is not a very fun or appealing toy.
Not lasting for my dog but he had a toy and that made him happy.  I would not buy it again.

We don't let him have it all the time but only when we can tell he's up for chewing on something, usually at night when he gets tired. He doesn't chew to destroy things just to chew for his teeth and jaws and any excess energy. Big enough for an 80lb mastiff puppy, we still watch him when he chews but not remotely a choking hazard.

My dog chews...actually it's more like shreds average toys, but this one he can't destroy and be loves the bendy, springy nature of the bone.  He takes it to bed with him, which means its a keeper.  Dense, but flexible and virtually indestructible - highly recommended for dogs that normal toys won't do

I'm giving this 2-stars because my dog loved it; however, by no means should this toy be considered for aggressive chewers. I have a 1.5 year old lab/shepard mix and she torn threw this like it was a piece of styrofoam. Pieces were everywhere within 5 mins. Completely ridiculous, will never buy again.
summary: For Aggressive Chewers my Aunt Fanny!

reviewText: very cool toy. My dog can't figure it out since she is used to very hard nyla bones. This is good since she has chewed and ended the life of most of her major toys of interest. She will graduate later to enjoy the chewy bone of the zooflex. It's good toy to fall back on when all is lost, very tough and fun to throw around, it's bouncey. Good fetch toy and chewy too. Good to keep lots of toys around like this to stop your dog from eating your cell phone, pens, $95.00 sandals, toilet fixtures, toilet paper, hair ties, socks, sticks, rocks etc.

My 2 labs make it their personal mission to field test any dog toy that comes through the door. Though their unrestrained love of toy destruction provides me with a lot of laughter, it can be challenging to find a toy that can survive their strong jaws and desire to chew, toss, and tug. This toy, and all of the other West Paw products I've brought them, is truly a winner. They have one in green (indoor use) and one in blue (easier for them to spot outside). They play fetch and tug with them, and neither toy shows ANY tooth marks. Incredible! Normally, when the older guy settles in to chew on something, it is in pieces within 15 minutes. Not so with this toy. When he curls up in front of the fireplace with one of these, I know that there won't be a toy mess to clean up! If you have a chewer, buy this and see my other reviews for dog toys.
Bought this for my 2 year old 90 pound rott. She loves this toy, it quickly became her favorite. Have had this for 6 months now, it is chewed on everyday, and product is still fully intact.

My dog and foster dog loves this toy!  So far, very study and he hasn't been able to damage it (despite his ability to destroy most toys...even KONG extreme).  Great material, and highly recommend this company for tough chewers.
summary: Tough stuff and tons of fun!

reviewText: I was looking for a durable chew toy for my dog (an under 40 pound shepherd mix), and after finding out about the money-back guarantee offered by West Paw Designs, decided to give the Hurley a try.My dog has chewed on it just about every day for the last month, and it still looks the same as the day it arrived in the mail.
summary: One month in, still looks brand new

reviewerName: Chitina M. Schatz "Been there, Read that"
reviewText: This is the only chew toy that my Aussie/collie mix didn't have in pieces the first day. As of yet, it's still in one piece. And we're talking about a dog that chewed the handle on a craftsmen screw driver. Well worth buying.

I bought this for my 15 lb Bichon Frise and 8 lb Maltese dogs to play with in the house. They don't play with it as much as I'd like to see, but when they do they seem to enjoy it. It also seems to be good quality.

My dog is a determined, power chewer. It takes him no time at all to ruin some very expensive toys. I was intrigued by this toy because it comes with a guarantee that they will replace it once for free. I figured I'd give it a shot. I haven't needed to replace the toy yet though! I've had this toy for a week and my dog is constantly chewing on it. There is no dent yet! I'm amazed I really am. I'm definitely going to look into more west paw toys.

This toy is just ignored by our three dogs. They seem to like chewing on harder plastics, or on balls that spring back as they chew. Odd that a small terrier, a lab mix and a Great Dane all think it's boring. Usually one of the three like a toy - and then, of course, all of them want it!
My 8 month old lab pup has not been able to chew this one up!She is a very active chewer!
My 22lb poodle who is an aggressive chewer immediately chewed off chunks of this toy. I would not recommend this for even a mildly aggressive chewer.
Dog loved it for his birthday.  He loves to chance it we havent gotten to see about the durability yet since its only been a few days... and the floating.
Fits in mouth like real bone; sturdy and durable.  If your dog is a chewer, these are great toys.  Also floats.
This stuff is good. My dog just love it. Usually he destroy stuffs in like minutes but this one is still ok. Let's see or how long.

I bought two of these for our 8 month old Golden Retriever who can destry an "indestructable" toy in 20 minutes.  She has been chewing on one of them for over a month now, and it still looks like new. This,the Gonut, and black Kongs  are the only toys she seemily cannot destroy.  They are worth every penny.

I have a 1 year old Australian Cattle Dog.  She DESTROYS toys.  I think she enjoys trying to see how fast she can tear up a toy.  I ordered this Hurley after reading the reviews.  I had already bought some of the Zisc frisbees and liked them--they held up quite well too.  I liked that I would be able to get a replacement for this toy if my dog tore it up.  I've had it for 6 months and it's still all in one piece.  She pulls on it, shakes it, catches it, chews it and it's still hanging on.  There are teeth holes all over it but no pieces have broken off or anything like that.  I give it 5 stars!
summary: Has Held Up for 6 Months So Far...

reviewText: My dogs broke this in half within a few minutes so that was that. I can toss the two halves to them and let them chew on it but they will surely break it up into tiny pieces that I'll have to clean off the carpet. To be fair, one of my dogs is a 65lb pit mix that is really strong and will chew the most sturdy of toys into bits. I still haven't found something that can withstand abuse, other than the Nylabone, which has lasted quite a while.
I have gotten my sister's pit bull this large Hurley bone two years ago, and she still has it!  It's amazing because the dog, Yuki, can chew through anything!
summary: It can stand an aggressive chewer!

reviewText: Seems to be a good quality product. However, our dog never plays with it.  Lots of other toys he enjoys just not this one.

Jedi is a year-old Pit Bull mix with a young dog's need to chew.  There are remnants of more than a dozen dog toys scattered around his Igloo.  The first thing he did when he got this was try to destroy it.  After hours of devoted chewing, he managed to get a small scrap of the material loose.  After that, he quit trying.  Now, if he's not tugging or fetching it, he just chews and chews.  It's his favorite toy, possibly because it's the only one that has lasted more than a day.  I take that back.  One large Kong is still standing, but the medium and smalls are just debris.  I am not as fond as he is of that old Kong.  He wants to play tug-o-war with it, but it's too darn close to those power-chewer teeth for me.  This Hurley is perfect.Over the past month, he has managed to get another scrap loose from this thing.  But I wouldn't dream of returning it.  He is happy with it.  He goes through toys so fast that he doesn't have anything familiar from one day to the next.  After a month, this is practically his binkie.  He takes its with him wherever he goes.  Plus, as long he's chewing this, he isn't chewing lawn furniture, power receptacles, loose pieces of the foundation, roots, fencing, his Igloo....It's hard to keep a power chewer from getting bored.I feel bad for people whose dogs tore this up.  The only thing I have found that's more durable than the Hurley is large rocks.

Toy is big and looks well done/good quality. Unfortunately, it's not appealing to my puppy -- it's just a rubber bone, with no smell and nothing fancy. It's also too heavy for my 20lb Aussie to play with. I guess I'll wait until he's holder and I'll keep it inside a dog food bag so eventually with time it gets some flavor ;). If it's for your puppy, wait. Otherwise this could be a very good indestructible toy for your older dog.
I would have been better off just throwing my money in the trash, as this did not withstand the dog's chewing for more than 10 minutes.

I wanted a couple of toys that I could keep outside for my 3 dogs. Most toys are not easily washable or fall apart after a few play/chew sessions- but not this one! It's really great. A hard, durable, toy that isn't so heavy the smallest dog won't carry it around with him. All of the dogs love chasing it, chewing on it, and carrying it around and I have yet to see any tooth marks. These are dogs that destroy "indestructible" dog toys in a matter of minutes- so that's quite a feat for this thing.This is definitely worth the $$ and is great for large dogs that are heavy chewers, or medium dogs who just love to play.

My lab/pitt loves this and hes a monster chewer. Its great for fetch in the water and a tug toy as well. It took him about 5 months to break through this toy which is pretty much a miracle with his record and then  bought another one =)
summary: great for wet and dry fun

reviewText: Very disappointed.....will cost almost as much to mail product back for replace or refund...  Not for hearty chewers..  They offer a guarantee, but because of shape and size, it's too expensive to mail back.  Requires a trip to post office to get mail for $6.  Not good.
summary: less than 40 min.....but what gets one star is return policy

reviewText: Our lab / border collie mix has had this toy for almost a year now and there is not a single bite mark in it, even though it's been heavily chewed on. This dog is Mr. Destructo and he can chew his way through anything! However, he hasn't been able to destroy the Hurley. He loves it so much we bought another so he can have one outside. We also bought him aWest Paw Bumi.I originally bought the Hurley because of the guarantee. If your dog destroys a West Paw brand toy, they will replace it. I felt like I would at least not be totally wasting my money if it succumbed to my dog's aggressive chewing. It turns out I haven't ever needed to send it back as it's been almost a year and the thing looks practically new despite being "well loved".The neat thing about the Hurley is that it's got a little give to the material and yet it doesn't puncture (at least ours hasn't). Our dog enjoys chewing on it and you don't ever hear that scraping sound on his teeth like you would a "real" bone. Sometimes we do hear a little "squeak squeak squeak" sound when he nibbles on the little ridges on the ends.Another great thing is that this bone FLOATS. We took it with us to the local reservoir when we taught our dog to swim. You can toss it out in the water and it bobs up to the surface. We tied a rope to ours to make it easier to pull back in. During last summer threw it into the kiddy pool in the backyard and our dog was in heaven splashing around to retrieve it. I think it was extra fun for him since it doesn't sink to the bottom but instead rides the crest of the waves and splashes he makes in the pool.While the West Paw Bumi is his favorite toy, he does love the Hurley bone and gets it when he wants a good chew. Sometimes he tosses it around, probably because it bounces a little when it hits the ground and for whatever reason he thinks that's pretty fun. ;-)I highly recommend you giving the Hurley a try if you are looking for a sturdy toy that is rugged and can withstand heavy chewing. I've really gotten my money's worth out of this toy since I haven't had to replace it and it's still looking good (not all ratty and nasty like some dog toys can get).One last comment: When his Hurley from outside has gotten dirty over time, I've just brought it in the house and given it a quick wash in the sink and it comes out looking great again. I consider that another plus. These toys are a great investment!
summary: Almost a year and still intact despite Mr. Destructo Dog!!

reviewText: I don't know why my Carolina dog loves this so much, but he does. I think it might be the easy-to-carry design and the material. He love to fetch his Hurley, chew it, and eventually cuddle with it at night. 5 months down the line, the toy is amazingly STILL in perfect condition, and he still loves it! The price might seem high to some people, but this is really a quality product, and I have no problem spending a little extra to get him something that he'll actually play with for more then a day. I highly recommend this to any dog owner!
have an olde english bulldog. a great chewer. picked up one of these chew toys on vacation in dec. still has not been destroyed yet. bought two more. planning ahead. great lasting power
This is a favorite for our pet, she loves it!  It's very durable and good for any pet that chews - -it's practically indestructible.

very much indestructible.  finally found a product that I don't have to worry about leaving out and my dogs love to chew on.  they never really liked chewing on the kong toys, so it was nice ti find one that they would chew on for longer periods of time.  very affordable, which is also nice compared to kong products.  definitely recommend for those strong chewers!

My pit bull destroys everything I ever give him. He ate through West Paw's tux ball, which I was still pretty pleased with, as it lasted more than the 5-15 minutes I expect a Kong to last. This bone is incredible. He has been able to rip small chunks off the sides, but overall chewing this bone to pieces has been wholly unsuccessful. He chews it every day and loves it, and I have to buy more sooner than later. This is GREAT for outrageously aggressive dogs with giant teeth who just want to rip their toys to shreds. It does not SOUND pleasant when they are chewing on it, but the material is perfect for aggressive chewers.
summary: The BEST... the only toy that lived.

reviewText: I love West Paw toys.  They last a long time and give my 4 dogs much happiness.  Every one I've purchased has become the favorite toy so I've had to buy more than one because dogs don't like to share.

our two Goldendoodles have three stages of interacting with dog toys: play, chew, consume.  Most toys we have to throw away between chew and consume.  West Paw Design Zogoflex is the ONLY BRAND so far (not even Kong!) that they haven't been able to chew up.  This Hurley toy is especially great because you can fetch with it, and they can proudly carry it around in their mouth like a bone, and  they tug of war with it.  I think they really like the texture because they chew on it like crazy, but it never flakes or breaks off.  A great investment for active hard core chewers.  We bought another one.
summary: fantastic durable toy for active chewers

reviewText: Do not throw this in the house if you have hard floors and anything breakable.  It bounces unpredictably.  I almost killed the microwave.  The dog loves to chase it, but doesn't chew on it.

Yes, Hoss eventually destroyed it, that is what he loves to do, but it took months instead of minutes which make it great in my view.  My dogs favorite thing is to chew chew chew and he can do this on this toy without making a mark for months.  I will be buying more I am sure as it also is a great toy to throw.  He loves it.  Hoss is a bulldog/boxer mix, extreme jaw power.
summary: Lasted a long time for my aggressive chewer

reviewText: My German Shepherd likes this toy.  She is a heavy chewer and this toy has endured her rough play.  I also like the color of this.  I would purchase more toys from this company.
summary: Good quality, pretty color, good for a heavy chewer

reviewText: This bone is super sturdy.  The dog (6 months old 50 pound lab mix)chews on it, we bend and tug on it and it still looks almost new.  Definitely the best chew toy out there.

I do in home board and train dogs, and perhaps we need to clarify this toy. I rate chewing dogs from 1-10, this is a toy suitable for 1-7 chewers, not 125 lb mastiffs, or pit bulls, those dogs have jaws of steel and belong in another class. this works fine on the mid size chewers, 50 lbs, not pit-bull mastiffs. I have had one for over  a year with 1-7 dogs, pick it up when 8 9 10 dogs arrive, use some sense.

My 1y/o chocolate lab power chewer loves the Hurley.  We had previously bought the hulk and he loves that too. The hulk has lasted several months and is still going strong which is quite the accomplishment in our home.  I'm hoping this one hold up as well as the hulk.  So far, so good.  We've had this about a week and he loves it and it shows no signs of damage despite his affections.
summary: Holding up very well and he loves it

reviewText: I bought this toy for my dog to use for dock dogs and wouldn't you know it, the dog who refuses to play with any toys instantly snatched it and has been happily chewing away ever since! This toy has held up very well considering I have two labs. I don't think I'd give this to a Rottweiler or Great Dane and we're really pushing the limit with giving it to my labs but the awesome thing about this company is that they will replace this toy once for free if you dog chews it up. A win-win in my book! I also love that its made in the USA and that when you return a damaged toy they recycle them a make new toys out it. Would definitely recommend and will obviously be buying more! :)

I have a 4 year old 100 lb. male Weimaraner who is a VERY aggressive chewer. It has become very frustrating to find toys that he does not destroy within the first hour. I was a skeptic of this toy in the beginning, but the other reviews were good, so I went ahead and ordered it.Needless to say I am so happy I did. He has had it for nearly a month now and it is his absolute favorite toy. There are no signs of wear and tear. He spends hours a day chewing on it. I highly recommend it. My dog tears up Kong balls/toys, tuff toys, and other "indestructible" toys within a matter of minutes. I am very impressed with this toy and will be ordering a second as back up, I know it will probably eventually get lost for as much as he plays with it!!!!

My dog is a VERY aggressive chewer and although this says it cannot be destroyed, our experience was the opposite of that.  She had chewed up half of it within 2 days.  This included her eating (yes, digesting) those blues pieces and my finding them all over the floor.  And now this is a "parental guidance" toy.

I bought this based on the great reviews, and my puppy loves to play fetch with this toy!  He also used this as a chew toy when he was teething, and overall it has held up great in comparison to his other toys.The only thing I wasn't thrilled about is that we recieved the green toy, versus the blue one.  The seller does make it clear that the colors vary, but it would be nice to have a choice of color.

My puppy went through so many toys before I found this.  Very durable.  He gnaws on it constantly with no signs of tearing or falling apart.  Great for fetch too.  I will definitely order more from this manufacturer!
This is my second dog toy by this company and so far I have been impressed. Holding up well to a Labrador that likes to chew.

I am the owner of 2 large dogs.  The first dog is very hard on toys, the second dog, there are no words to describe what he does to toys.  If I gave him the opportunity and enough time, he could eat my entire couch.  With that said, I received this toy in the mail today and gave it to them immediately. 20 minutes later, the toy was still intact.  If you have dogs that destroy everything, then you understand that if 20 minutes goes by, and the toy is still in one piece, then it is a good toy. The toy has survived the last 5 hours with both dogs taking turns chewing it.  I read the reviews before I bought this and was thinking "it's worth a try, but I highly doubt that my dogs will not be able to destroy this in 5 minutes," I was wrong. This is a very durable toy, it is really hard to find a toy like this, so I suggest that you buy this one.
summary: Owner of a Professional Toy Destroyer

reviewText: Seems like a good product but my border collie puppy doesn't really like it. It's been in her toy bin for a couple months and she's only played with it a couple times. Perhaps the rubber material isn't for her. It's quite heavy so maybe as she gets older she will like it more. She likes the Kong rubber material and she likes bone shapes so we thought this would be a sure thing but for some reason it doesn't appeal to her.

We have a pretty spoiled dog who "appreciates" his toys a bit too violently, so when I saw the reviews here about how crazy other dogs were about this toy and how practically indestructible they were, I figured I'd take a chance. Our 100-pound dog goes through toys at a pretty quick rate, so only the Kongs and Nylabones tend to last more than a week (or hour) or so. Well, add this toy to the list of successes. It's been almost 6 months, and he still plays with it ... and it's still intact. I don't know what they made this thing out of, but it doesn't even have any divots out of it like the Kongs do. It might have something to do with the way he plays with it: He's much more gentle with this toy than his other bone-like things. He doesn't chew on it so much as nuzzle it and lick it, but he obviously likes it quite a bit, and he'll choose it out of a pile of other toys. He also loves the way it bounces, and he'll throw it around sometimes himself if he can't get me to do it for him. Would definitely recommend this toy.
summary: Don't know why, but our dog loves this toy

reviewText: I purchased this dog toy many months ago, and I purchased a second one recently. This toy is one of the few that lasts and lasts. My dogs even use it as a pull toy between them. NO DAMAGE AT All!!! Amazing. And, they still like it which is great.
My dog LOVEStis toy.  I don't know what it is, but she is totally crazy about this thing.  I'm going to buy one for my boyfriends dog.  Hours of play time!!

My pit bull / whippet mix likes to pick this up when she wants to greet someone at the door and such because it easily fits in her mouth and it's one of a very small subset of dog toys she can't destroy in 5 minutes, but as far as things to play with, she really prefers things that squeak, chasing regular balls, and playing tug of war with wubbas.

The Hurley is fantastic. It's the perfect fetch toy and we love that it floats. West Paw makes very high quality toys that I can't rave about enough! They're pricey but so, so worth it! I'm a very happy and loyal customer. :) My pooches are happy too!
summary: West Paw toys make us happy!

reviewText: My dog chews and destroys everything!  This toy is excellent.  We have now had it for over a week (a record in our house)!  He loves it and has tried to destroy it but no luck.  My kids even commented that we will need to buy this one again.  Great purchase for dogs like mine!

We have a 60 lb pit bull that looooooves to chew!  He pretty much destroys everything.  We've had to stop buying stuffed, squeaky toys because they last about 15 minutes.  We were constantly giving him raw hides, but that can get expensive, especially since it only takes about an hour for him to finish one.  So we gave this a try.  Best decision ever.  He will chew on it, we play fetch with it, we play tug of war with it, and it still looks brand new.  We are amazed.  We purchased the Bumi after this one last two full weeks & that is also a hit.  They are his go-to toys.  Plus, other toys now last longer because he has this to distract him.  I couldn't be happier with it.

I have a 60lb pitbull puppy who seems to tear through every toy I've gotten her.  This one has definitely stood durable through the ultimate test of time.  I've just bought a few more of these.  For destructive dogs..this is it, this has stood up better than our Kong toys.  The best part, is no annoying squeakers!

Quite durable - This toy has held up well with our aggressive chewer, in part because she doesn't spend a lot of time chewing on it and it doesn't have seams, ears, etc. for her to pick at.  She likes to play tug and fetch with it.

My 8-month goldendoodle is a serious chewer, and this has held up really well... which is probably why he has lost interest in it.  He just likes to destroy things, and he has (so far) been unable to find a weak point in this toy from which he can pick it apart.  He really liked it at first, but I think since it has no real edges for him to pick at, he got bored pretty quickly.  So... this a good review in that the toy is holding up!  But minus one star, since it's just not keeping his interest (since it holds up too well - a catch-22?).
summary: Holds up well... too well for my dog

reviewText: Our Jack Russell loves to swim and retrieve toys but she also tears them up rather quickly. This one not only floats but after two weeks of trying, I can't tell she has even managed to put a scratch on it. Orange one shows up in the water the best. Highly recommend this product.

Got this toy a couple days ago, my Aussie is loving it. It's the perfect size to carry around, bounces pretty good when he throws it, and he seems to enjoy chewing on it. I can see bite marks on the material, but no chunks yet. He's a pretty aggressive, smart chewer and other toys like this from other companies usually only last a couple hours once he figures out the weak spots.This isn't too textured and he can't get a super great hold on it so this one might actually last awhile! But I wouldn't be surprised if we take advantage of the one time replacement some day! :)

We lost our Kong and Tux in the woods somewhere, so I went to get another Tux and saw this.  Our 15 mon. old Retriever is a chewer since she's still a puppy, but wanted to chew the kids toys instead of hers.  The Tux was a great throw/retrieve toy, since it would bounce in all sorts of directions and keep her guessing.  However, this Hurley one she not only retrieves well, but then she'll bring it back into the house and chew it for a while...without damaging!  She loves sticks, so maybe she thinks it's one???  Maybe it's the newness??? At this point, I don't really care why...ha ha...I am just glad it isn't a real stick (as they are SO messy) and that she enjoys it!  I'll probably buy another in another color for Christmas.
Good, durable dog toy. My pup loves to play fetch with this toy and chew on it. She regularly destroys toys, but she has not been able to make a dent in this one.

My newly adopted dog is a heavy chewer so I wanted to find some good tough toys for him to chew on. He isn't interested I'm this at all. If I pick it up and play with it, he will chew on it and he hasn't even put a mark on it... but he rarely chews on it or grabs it himself.

This toy is still going strong after several months! We bought the large for our 25lb terrier (since larger toys seem harder for him to chew apart). He chews it constantly and he hasn't made a dent in it, yet. We've become big fans of West Paw products due to their ability to outlast most other toys on the market. I love that they are made in the USA, float, and come with a guarantee (They will send you a one-time replacement or a refund if your dog damages it). If your dog likes this toy I would also recommend you check out Bumi, the Tux, and the Huck. Our pup was able to destroy the Zisc and Twiz.

My dog destroyed the Hurley in less than a minute.  The company let me return it and sent me a new Tux as a replacement.  It has lasted, but my dog does not like it much.  He generally ignores it.  It seems strong and sturdy, but not very appealing to my dog for some reason.
summary: Great customer service!  Ok dog toy.

reviewText: This is one of 3 hurley toys I purchased for my pitty.  The other 2 lasted less than 10 minutes.  This one has limped along for a few weeks now...which is impressive considering that she obliterates all of her other toys.  Pretty sure my dog is a freak but so far only the kong toys seem to have a reasonable life expectancy in my home.
summary: Pit Bull hasn't completely destroyed yet...

reviewText: I, as well as my puppies, love everything West Paw.  We started with a Zisk, which we have been happy to replace when our pit bull finally rips the center out of it and wears it like a necklace.  We have some avid chewers on our hands, and they don't seem to like the Kong toys.  They just can't get enough of the West Paw toys, and we love that they aren't destroyed five minutes after they are taken out of the package.

Another great product from West Paw! This is the only dog toy line I have found that is durable enough for my 1 1/2 yr old yellow lab. The Hurley, Chuck & Zogo flex are indestructible! Other than the original Kong, my dog destroys all other "tough" toys quickly. I highly recommend any of their products

My dog destroys most toys in seconds, and gets toys that say they are specifically for aggressive chewers almost exclusively.  This product holds up surprisingly well to my dog's attempts to destroy it and we've had it for over a week (this is huge!!!).  She has chewed it quite a bit but you can't even really see teeth marks on it.  For some reason, my dog isn't that interested in this toy though, and only plays with it sparingly or if I present it to her.
summary: Holds up well to aggressive chewer

reviewText: Has a semi rubber texture and enough weight dog seems proud of herself for lifting it up.  Does not shred this like a stick.

Our 2 Labrador retrievers love to rip toys apart.  Many so-called tough toys have fallen to their persistence.  Not the Zogoflex toys.  We have several and they have all withstood the best our dogs can give them with no damage.  On top of that, the dogs love to play with them. Nothing they like better!
Strong Chewers and this is VERY durable. Dogs play chase and tug with it.  Fun for fetch as it bounces erratically.I would recommend

This is a great toy for my hard chewer.  It is soft enough to give when gnawed on which keeps the interest, but remains stable.  We play tug and fetch with this every day.  She loves it. Their offer to replace it once if it breaks is not even needed.
summary: Best Dog Toy ever for chewer

reviewText: I have German Shorthair Pointers that are very active and a bit hard on toys.  They love these toys.  The shape is perfect for them to grab and chase each other around with.  The biggest plus is that they really hold up.  If you have a dog that is tough on toys this really holds up well.  I've been using them for over 6 years.

I bought one of these and a Tux to see if a) my boys would like them and b) they'd hold up to my furry weapons of mass destruction. The answer to both is yes. They really seem to like both toys although they have a definite preference for this one (they're wrestling over it behind me as I type) and not a tooth mark on either one so far after a few weeks of heavy play. I've had to toss out a ridiculous number of toys in the last year because of damage (Kong toys included) so to find something that holds up ... that they actually like playing with ... yay!

I was really hoping this would stand up to what it says it would do. I have a 2yr old black lab, he is the sweetest fellow but he can chew up a storm. I thought this would be the answer. He had a chunk out of the end in just 5 minutes. Do not get this product if you have an agressive chewer it is just money lost.
summary: Not for heavy chewers as listed

reviewText: Alright. Let me start off by saying I've bought a ton of toys for my dog (she's a lab mix) who ends up destroying them after a couple hours!!! She is a chewer and after some research, came across the Hurley. A couple months later - this toy is still perfectly in tact! GREAT purchase!!! Definitely recommend to anyone who has a power chewer.
summary: Yes!!! Finally a toy my dog won't destroy!

reviewText: I bought this for our 5 month old large chocolate lab puppy who had destroyed many petsmart toys in a matter of hours.She hasn't been able to put a dent in it, even playing tug o war with our older labs.Great toy
This toy was never interesting to our dog. It just lays there. But when it comes to a toy like this, different dogs like different toys. For ours it was wasted money.

This is one of my favorite dog park toys.  We have a 3 year old lab and she loves chasing this toy in the water at the dog park.  it is nice and easy to carry for owners and unique enough at a busy dog park to know where the toy is.  We have it in orange to make it even easier to find.
It was great for about a week until my 8 month Lab got a little piece off... the rest is history.  So far only black kong and Planet Dog Orbee Tuff can survive.  Poor Hurley is on his way back. :(

After months of loose stool, I switched to another brand and her loose stool practically disappeared over night.  (I didn't know what was causing her loose stool and thought it might have been treats but after weeks off the treats I finally gave this brand up.  It is too bad because the ingredients looked to be quality.
summary: This didn't agree with my dog's stomach.

reviewText: Very good ingredients, puppies do well on it, seem to like it and the price is excellent for the quality. We have a dog rescue, have used this to raise several litters of initially unhealthy pups and their moms and have had great success with it. It's given 4 out of 5 starts by Dog Food Advisor and is one of the few commercial brands endorsed in the Whole Dog Journal.

I started my litter of puppies on this food because of the ingredient list.  No fillers!  I have become a fan of this brand and now purchase the adult formula for my labs.  They love the kibble and maintain a healthy weight.  I can't say enough about this product; I now use their canned food as well to supplement the kibble.  I like to eat only wholesome food myself, and after reading, "Food Your Pets Die For," I am committed to feeding my dogs only holistic food like the Chicken Soup brand.  Some major brands of pet foods, like Iams, also does lab testing on animals.  A cruel, unnecessary method of testing new ingredients.My last lab died of cancer and I believe most commercial pet foods with the GMO fillers and meat by-products are a major contributor to her death and the increase in pet cancers overall.  Do your pet a favor and stay with foods with real meat as their first ingredient, an NO CORN!  Wild canines would never touch an ear of corn!
summary: Great product at a great price!

reviewText: When I rescued my puppy he had conjunctivitis, fleas, and internal parasites. The rescue group was feeding him a cheap store-bought food. I did research and chose this food because it had good reviews and was more affordable than some other high-end brands. I slowly transitioned him to this food and kept him on it until he was a year old. Since I kept him on it for so long, obviously I felt he was doing well. However, he still had some digestive issues and occasional flare ups of conjunctivitis. My vet said he had a sensitive digestive system, and the eye issues might be something he deals with forever, or he might grow out of it. Once he turned a year old, I decided to put him on Merrick adult dog food. He's been on it for two months, and it is only now that I see what a difference paying a little more makes. His coat was never in bad shape, but now it's softer and shinier. He hasn't had any issues with his eyes and his stools have been normal. I wish I had put him on Merrick puppy food from the beginning...which is exactly what I've done with my new rescue puppy.
summary: Superior to store bought, but you can do better.

reviewText: This the well balanced food for puppy. Our beagle absolutely loves it and even trains on them. My vet recommended this and as it says it keeps her coat shiny and smooth.

The vet wants Baron to lose a little weight, but I also want him to enjoy his food. I've tried some that I had to add other ingredients to or he wouldn't eat. That defeated the purpose of getting quality food and giving him less of it. He's also showing signs of aging, for very good reason. He's old. I keep reminding myself of that so it won't hurt so bad when I wake up some morning and find him gone. I want to keep him healthy and happy as long as possible.  He seems to be doing very well on this food. A few minutes ago he was bouncing around like a puppy. He looked happy. That's all I can base my review on. Others have discussed the ingredients. I just judge the bounces.
summary: My Dog Has Been "Bouncier" Since Starting This Food

reviewText: Diamond foods had a voluntary pet food recall in Spring 2012.  This order included Chicken Soup for the Pet Lover's Soul products (dog and cat food) that both were involved in the recall.  I took both back to a local store where the exchange was made.  It is incredible to me that your supplier would not have checked their stock and submitted claim for bags involved to Diamond foods.
My 11 yr old boxer has been on this food for 5 years and LOVES it. It's so reasonably priced and great quality compared to others
I've been feeding all my dogs and cats the Chicken Soup brand for so many years and so far none have been sick.  It has good wholesome ingredients, no corn or by-products.
Great dog food....rates very high and it's a great price.  My dog loves it and his coat never looked better.
summary: love this....and my dog no longer has skin issues...

reviewText: I have reviewed this previously, and continue to recommend both the 5 stars and the product.  In addition to the rating and personal recommendation, the price is very competitive, and delivery service using Amazon Prime is just outstanding.  All in all a win for us and our senior pets.
summary: Chicken Soup for Dog Lover's Soul Dry Food for Senior Dog

reviewerName: I like what I like gal
reviewText: I decided to switch my dog from Blue Buffalo to this brand about a week ago. He was suffering from itchy skin and bladder infections. He never used to have these problems before. I had chalked it up to him being nine years old. But after going through 3 rounds of infections and subsequent antibiotics, my vet didn't seem to be much help as to what it could be. (have since switched vets) After much research, I found many pet parents were having the same problem with Blue Buffalo. This food seems to be better for him. He likes it.  He doesn't itch like he did, he's not licking himself like he was, and generally seems better overall. I started adding 250 mg of vitamin c to help balance the PH of his urine to help with fighting infections. If I find even better results, or if he does not continue to do well on this, I will update.

Of of my dogs is starting to show signs of age - limping, joint pain.  I started researching things I could do to help him and one of those items is diet!  I'd always fed Iams and thought it a great food and it wasn't until I did research that I realised how wrong I was.  Just like people prefer unhealthy food - animals do also.  Most comercial dog food brands know this and so they put all that bad stuff in it to get your pet to like it and in turn makes you think you are doing a wonderful thing!  This pet food is made with quality ingrediants and doesn't cost much more than Iams.  I've already noticed my dogs eat less so the price evens out.  And thanks to the Senior formula my older dog is benefiting from not only much better and greater nutrition but also from the joint supplements added.  I'm SO GLAD my large dogs like this food!  THANK YOU CHICKEN SOUP!!!  I have also changed my cats over to the cat food.  This way all my loving pets get the best!
summary: Excellent food for your loved one!!  Can't beat it!

reviewText: My three dogs,two are seniors, love this food. I'm happy their getting the nourishment they need to keep them happy and healthy.
summary: Chicken Soup for the Dog  Lover's Soul

reviewText: I would give this food 5 stars, but because of the past history of recalls, I am hesitant.  I used to buy this product all the time and my dog flourished on it, but during one of the recalls, the bag I purchased was part of the recall and I had to throw out the entire bag.  Luckily, I hadn't opened it yet.  Chicken Soup has a lot of great ingredients and I hope that all the issues with recalls is over.

and that she likes it makes it worth every cent i pay for it. she comes now when called and chows down. those instances before hand were few and far between. they was one she refused to eat at all, would have starved to death, i think, before touching it. my neighbor's dog, loved it.
summary: it took until my dog was older to find a dog food she likes

reviewText: I am very pleased with how the Andis clipper has worked.  It cuts smootly through matted hair and fine hair.  I could handle it with or without the various combs.
summary: The Andis made hair trimming and cutting easy for my short and long hair dogs.

reviewText: I groom our cocker spaniel every few weeks with it for about a year now and LOVE IT!!!  I do clean it and oil it up often to make sure it stays in good shape but other than that it's super easy to use.  Check out YouTube for helpful grooming techniques and you will be a pro in no time flat!

The ceramic blade DOES get very hot! Besides that, it is quiet and moves like going through butter on my Goldendoodle's curls and thick fur. As long as you have a plastic cover in place, I suppose it protects the dog from the hot ceramic plate. Don't buy if you need it for shaving without a plastic part.

The clippers work like a charm! I have a chymic Manx cat(a tailless wonder with a coat a husky would be proud of!) He is 10 years old and hasn't been doing such a great job of grooming lately, which has resulted in a bunch of mats way-y-y deep in his coat. They were so tightly wound I couldn't brush them out. I decided I would just shave him down and start over. I know you are supposed the bathe the pet before clipping...but he's a CAT...need I say more? The other problem is that many cats won't sit still for grooming...like my Rambo! Sooo, right now he looks like a half shorn sheep, but where he is clipped he is as soft as calfskin! These clippers sailed through his dirty, snarled pelt without a snag! When I get the majority of the hair off, I'll give him a bath (he hides his face in my armpit while I lean over the tub to scrub him)and even everything out.Love the clippers...love 'em! I've had Wahl and ConAir before and they didn't hold a candle to these clippers!

I was sooooooo looking forward to receiving this clipper kit for my shih tzu, but it worked once and that was it! I have never been so disappointed in a product before especially since I followed the directions etc. to a tee. It was an absolute waste of money.
summary: Worked once and that was it :(

reviewText: bought this for our goldendoodle who is really curly and so far so good. didn't get to hot and not as quite as advertised but not to bad. we had to buy more attachments to get the size we wanted.
We have 2 yorkie poodle mix dogs and buzz their hair during summers to keep them cool. This clipper works well on their unique hair type and gets a nice even cut.

It is over $200 a pop when I take my 3 large dogs to the groomer so when this went on sale on Amazon I decided to give it a try. I have my dogs shaved down several times in the warmer months so going to the groomers gets costly quickly. This is a very quiet clipper so it didn't bother my dogs at all. It did a good job of clipping them but it does get somewhat bogged down on really heavy coats, which is why I gave it a "4" and not a "5". One of our Rotties has a super heavy coat and it took almost an hour of working through her hair to get it trimmed properly. Not complaining, its a whole lot cheaper than taking them to the groomers, but just be prepared for a little slow going with really thick coats. My dogs have short hair and I used a #3 blade on them and it gave a nice clip that wasn't too short. The blade got hot after about 10 minutes or so of use, but the Andis Coolant did a quick job of cooling it. In retrospect, I suggest that you spend a few extra dollars and get the ceramic blade which stays much cooler. Be sure to oil your blade and let the clipper run for about 10 minutes prior to use to avoid snagging and pulling. The clipper itself is well weighted in your hand and not difficult to use at all. If you are a novice, you might want to find a demo video on line about grooming if you have any questions. Overall, I am very pleased with my purchase and would recommend it to anyone who wants to clip their own dogs.
summary: Even a novice can use this!

reviewText: I have a medium wired haired mutt, and several cats, one a super long hair.  I struggled for years with a cheap clipper that I had purchased at Walmart.  This cuts about 20 times as well, and I am not exaggerating. 50 times as well.  A million times as well.  Now my long hair cat from hell does not send me to the emergency room for stitches after attempting to cut her hair.  I deliberated on whether to get the 5 or 7 FC blade as well.  I chose the 7FC, and think that is the sensible choice...you really probably need something other than the 10 supplied with the unit.  The blade guards are useful with the 10, however I would not advise cutting the entire animal that way.  Lastly, this unit is the same as the other unit with the steel 10 blade, for all practical purposes.  Andis verified this to me.  I am a very happy customer.

I didnt give it a five star bc this is the first clipper i ever use. I dont know how loud other clippers is. In my opinion, this clipper is still loud but bearable since my dogs don't freak out when i use it. Usually, they are scared of loud noise. This clipper does it job...cut hair! :D I can finish trimming one dog before the clipper gets too hot.

This is a really good dog clipper. It mowed right through my Golden Retriever Mixs' long hair, dense, dense undercoat, and a few small mats, like hot knife through butter! The end result was nearly as good as a professional groomer, and it was only my first time! I also shaved my lab mix that has skin issues. Now I can apply topical medicine more effectively. It is much easier to bathe shaved dogs, and I have a lot less hair in my house. Neither of them were afraid of the clippers, and didn't seem to mind being shaved. They are definitely happier being shaved during the hot summer. This clipper really does a great job and appears to be very well made. I expect I'll get a lot of use from it for years to come. I have saved more than the cost of this clipper in just two uses. You can do it yourself at home with these clippers, and it is fun to do.

So far I've been using it to cut my mini schnauzer's hair. Had for 6 months and 6 haircuts later, it still does the job.  My only complaint  is that it gets hot really fast.  I keep one of those ice gel packs close by to rest the clippers on to cool it down.  Hopefully I'll become fast enough to complete the haircut before the clippers get too hot.
summary: It does the job but gets hot fast...

reviewText: use them to shave a small dog. they do a good job of that no problems and quieter than most.
This is louder than I was expecting.  The dogs aren't too bothered by it but it's a lot noisier than what my barber uses on me.

The Andis 21420 is the third model of dog clippers I've used in my Cairn Terrier's 15 1/2 years of life and it's superior to the others.  Actually the first tool I used was a Wahl marketed for humans and that didn't last very long.  I like the length of the power cord, the hard plastic storage case, the assorted clipper combs and the durability of the clipper.  I do not like the loud sound it makes, especially when the comb slips out of the housing which has happened on several occasions.  Even with the comb securely fastened, the motor is rather loud.  Since my dog is now nearly deaf, it's not an issue, but it does get me nervous nevertheless.  As with all others I've used, when used for more than a few minutes, the clipper gets hot.  I simply turn it off for a few minutes and while taking a little break from the grooming, comfort the dog.  It is important to not only oil the blades but to clean them out completely of little hairs that become entrapped.  I use a little stiff brush and even follow up with the blow dryer.  The shape of this clipper is very comfortable to hold in the hand and the weight of it is very balanced.  I imagine that it would be a nice model to use for multiple grooming sessions without tiring the hand or wrist.  With care, this should last for many more years and other dogs.
summary: Not the quietest but it does the job well

reviewText: UPDATE 8/9: After using this clipper for a while now, I'm very happy with it (despite the price dropping).  It took a few times but now I can do both dogs very quickly in one sitting.  I don't have a professional grooming table so I do this in the laundry room with the dog on top of the washer.I would highly recommend using a disposable wee pad under them instead of a towel... the cut hairs are very tough to wash out (they seem to just weave themselves into cloth!)ORIGINAL REVIEW:These were the questions I had before buying this clipper:*Does it really work that much better than human clippers? YES*Is it quiet enough that it won't freak out my dogs? YES*Will I be able to handle it well even though I have no professional grooming experience? YES*Is it worth the price tag?  YESWith two small dogs, I found that it managed to cut through their differing types of fur perfectly.My Papillon mix has a double coat and it sliced through without any problems!And the number #1 guard was the perfect length to use on my Maltese for that "puppy" cut.I have no prior grooming experience so I just watched a bunch of online videos.  This clipper seemed to work easily and fit into my hand just fine.  It has a ceramic blade and it didn't feel like it got hot for a while (I managed to groom both dogs in one sitting).  But since I was using a guard, it wasn't much of an issue.This also has a quiet motor so it didn't freak the dogs out.  And unlike the inexpensive human clippers, it doesn't make an abrupt noise when you first turn it on.I received the item exactly as pictured: a purple cutter with 4 guards, small tube of oil and a black case everything fits into.For my two small dogs, I don't feel like I need to buy other blades as the one that comes with it, along with the guards, seem to fit all of my needs right now.  Again, I say this with inexperience...just relying on my satisfaction with the end result.Overall, I would definitely recommend this clipper!

I'm a licensed beautician here in Michigan and have always wanted a set of clippers for my dogs. Well, I splurged and finally bought the Andis 21420. I didn't waste anytime in giving my Peek-a-poo COCO a trim. I was surprised at first to notice that the kit DID NOT contain any oil. Fortunately, I already had some on hand. The clippers cut okay, but for the price, you can't ask for any better-trust me!Marcia G
This clipper worked great. It's very quiet. Very easy to hold and use and never got too warm. I'm very pleased with this product. My dog looks great!

This is used to trim my Papillon/Chihuahua.  I use it mostly to trim her feet hair.  The significantly reduced noise from my old electric trimmer is wonderful.  My dog is much less nervous when I use this.  I do minimal cutting though so not sure how a professional cutter or someone with a lot of fur to trim would find it.  Recommended.
Cuts great and it is quiet. Only if my dog would stop sitting down every  time I try to trim him underneath.  LOL

The biggest issue that I have had with clippers is the durability, so I waited 2 1/2 years to review this one.  I use it on a monthly basis to trim my 2 Havanese.  It works well and has not given me any issues.  I paid under $60.00 for it, including shipping, and I have saved hundreds in grooming. If needed, I recommend also getting the Andis 8 piece comb set.

We wanted to use this to shave our long haired cat in the summer time so he wouldn't have to shed and would be cooler during hot weather.  It will not cut the cats hair at all.  Hard to describe.  Just stops and doesn't go through the hair to cut it.  Very poor product for what we needed.  I also have never found anything to replace it, though we have had our cat shaved by a pet groomer.

I got this for my son to groom his little Shih Tzu girl and he's been quite happy with it.  Andis is a good company and I've had one of their professional models that has lasted me for decades.  No complaints on this and he's used it for a couple of years.  If you're a professional groomer doing many dogs a day I'd get the professional model which is more expensive.  But for a pet owner this is great and it accepts the Andis or Oster professional blades.

This pet trimmer is exactly what we were looking for. It is small enough to work on my small dog, yet powerful enough for  a big dog, It the job quickly so she doesn't get jumpy. Also it holds its charge for when we need it, we are very happy with it.
summary: Cool and quiet, not stress stressful on our pet

reviewText: I have a standard Pembroke Welsh Corgi who needs no haircut except around her rearend to prevent clingons and dingleberrys...But I also have a long haired PWC and she gets so hot in the summer even though they have a pet door and can stay in the cool A/C while I'm at work, the long haired still prefers to be outside until she can't stand it any longer...The clippers went right thru her long thick hair as slick as snot on a door knob...And it didn't get hot real fast like the cordless one I had to return for a lot of reasons...It was also very quiet in comparison to several others I have tried...

My regular groomer moved away, so I decided to invest in a pair of clippers and take matters into my own hands. I have a rescued flat coated retriever, so her hair ends up being about 3" long. It is very dense, which is wherein the problem lies for these clippers. The included blade is a size 10, which is a very short clip. The kit comes with the four plastic standard sized attachments for the blade. However, my dog's hair is so thick, that the plastic attachments really don't lift her hair to cut it. I'm now looking at getting the metal blade for 1/2" cut, which is another thirty bucks. And then I'd need the finishing blade in the same size.Overall though, because of the problem, it takes me a long time to cut her hair. It never has any overheating issues and runs very quietly. Overall it is a well made product, just needs a further investment to bring it up to the level some users will require.

Much faster hair cut for the my cat with 3 inch long hair then regular clippers. Love the detachable blades for cleaning. Cuts through hair like butter is you go the right direction. Would buy again. Blades do get hot with long use so either take a break or try some cooling spray.
I love and use this product regularly for my dog. We cut her hair and home and these are easy to use!!

I bought this clipper because I wanted something that was a little quiet.  It did not have to be near silent or anything...just somewhat quiet!It is not even somewhat quiet.  Maybe because it has the ceramic blade??  I don't know??  I have been using an inexpensive Wahl; and it is also very loud ( I think I got it at Walmart...it is not the good one ).  I have a Yorkie mix and an Australian Shepard mix.  My Australian can pretty much handle the loud Wahl I have, and my Yorkie tolerates it, but I feel bad for them, so I went on a hunt for something better and quieter.  Also, I am having some problems with the blade of my Wahl and it is not cutting as well...it may just need a new blade... but I want to get something better and quieter.  I clip them both at least once a month in the summer.I did a lot of researching and reading; not just here on Amazon, but on the internet as well.....just shows you can not trust a lot of internet reviews, especially when they all have links to the item they are reviewing; so they are probably getting a "kick back" when someone clicks the links and buys....sigh...Anyway, I plugged it in as soon as I got it and I could barely hear my own voice over the noise, and a LOT of vibration.  So, I oiled the blade to see if it made it any different...nope.  I checked to make sure it was adjusted property to see if that would help...nope.I put it back in its box and filed a return with Amazon.I did a little more reading and researching and ordered a Wahl 8786-451A ARCO SE Professional Cordless Pet Clipper Kit by Wahl Professional Animal; here from Amazon.  It says it is very quiet and has no vibration.  We will see how that one fares when I get it on Tuesday.I will leave feedback on that one too, and come back here and add to this review as well.ADDITION COMMENTS / FOLLOW UPOk!  I got the Wahl Professional Animal yesterday.  It is a cordless one so I let it charge overnight.  It is incredible!  It is very, very quiet, with very little vibration!  I shaved my Australian Shepard today and she was not even scared.  Normally, she would be upset and shaking.  She was so calm, it was almost like she was enjoying it.  It worked so well, like a knife through butter, it cut so easily.  I recommend the Wahl if you are looking for something really quiet that cuts very easily.  It is made well. Do not waste your time or money with the Andis.

We shave our lab/retriever mix twice a year, and this clipper proves itself time and time again. The ceramic blades work so much better than typical metal ones, and last much longer. This clipper model allows for easy blade changeout, which also make it easier to clean. The clipper blades do heat up, but not as fast as metal. We use the Andis Cool Care Plus Clipper Blade Cleaner and have no worry about the blades overheating and potential burns. Purchasing an extra blade to swap out during cuts is also a great idea to help minimize the risk of overheating and burns. The cutting motion is consistent and makes easy work of long hair and heavy undercoat. We don't have to make several passes over the same area like we did with prior clippers. I like that the noise level is so much lower than that of other models we've tried, as it helps keep our dog relaxed. I do wish the cord were longer, but that is a small inconvenience. A definite repurchase should our current clippers stop working (knock on wood!).

Best of all, it's a very quiet clipper - which is very good, since the old, noisy clippers we had were quite scary to my dog.  These are nice and sharp, and clip him very well; plus they are light in the hand and easy to use.

My female Wheaten Terrier has a VERY thick coat. While I can scissor cut my male Wheaten, my girl just looks horrible and uneven. Not to mention, the bad scissor cut takes forever with her coat. With the Andis Clippers, I had her trimmed down in no time and she looks worlds better. I have had difficulty with her legs, hence the 4 stars. It is likely "user error" and with time I'll get it figured out.As an added bonus, the Andis Clippers are made in the USA.

I have had this product for over a year. For 2 summers I have tried to trim the thick fur from my ragdoll cats during the florida super hot summers, and I don't feel like it does a good job. It clogs easily and the cats do not like something...maybe it is getting too hot on them or maybe it's the smell or maybe it pulls their fur, who knows. I end up using scissors to trim the hair and that makes me a nervous wreck. I was hoping for better results.
summary: Not good for ragdoll cat hair

reviewText: The hair on my Shih tzu is cut like butter when using this clipper.  The buzzer has already paid for itself as I buzz my own dogs now.  To think I use to try and trim my dogs with a normal every day buzzer is comical.  They simply do not work.  I highly recommend this buzzer.
summary: 1 year of use and still going strong

reviewText: I ordered this after much research and am happy with my purchase.  Since I am a novice at this, I was happy that the ceramic blades get hot slower.  One less thing to worry about.  I have used it three times and while my skills can certainly do with some improvement, the product itself has proven to be quite good.

I purchased the Andis 21420 Ceramic Clipper Kit on Amazon due to great reviews and am glad I did. We've been grooming our dogs at home for a year and a half and the savings are incredible. (Here's a plug for rescue dogs. We picked up a stray Shih Tzu three years ago from the side of the road, delivered a mini Schnauzer from a cruel owner and discovered a gorgeous Havanese at the local shelter - three amazing dogs that needed a good home. NO MORE PUPPY MILLS!)Back to my review: Our Shih Tzu and Havanese have VERY thick, coarse fur and the ceramic clipper works well. It doesn't get hot, which is great for my hand as well as our canines' skin. The vibration is not bothersome and it's more quiet than the last clipper I owned. I heartily endorse the Andis Ceramic Clipper.

These clippers get the job done. It is all about the blades when it comes to a good cut. Good blades make for a good cut. I like that these clippers can switch to different size blades easy. Don't think you can use the stupid plastics Comb things to make a good cut. For the price these are ok I would not want to use these to clip bigger dogs. For my 12lb Pom these work well.
summary: Good for my little Pom mix.

reviewText: I have two Cocker Spaniels, one of which is subject to seizures. Therefore I try to minimize anything stressful to her. She hates to go to the groomers and does not cooperate well during grooming. Amazingly, she sits still for me to use these clippers on her. Although I am not a professional at cutting her hair, it does allow me to cut the number of times she has to go quite a bit. The quiet motor is a blessing, and the snap on blades make it easy to adjust the length you want. Just be sure your dog has been combed out good when using the snap on blades.Update, as of July 9, 2010, these shears are still going strong and have served me well. No problems, will buy same when time for replacement.

I shave my (two) cats every year at the end of May because I'm a cheapsake who doesn't turn on the a/c until it's well past 85 degrees Fahrenheit. I was really intimidated at the idea of shaving my own cats. I wash them and brush them regularly but I send them out to get shaved and they always behaved badly. Well, this year I really needed to buckle down and save money, so I didn't want to dish out $90 per cat to have them shaved by professional groomers. I watched some Youtube videos on cat shaving, bought this shaver based on the awesome reviews, and went for it.The process was much smoother than I anticipated. My cats trust me more than the groomers so they didn't try to claw my eyes out. They did cry the entire time but otherwise they were pretty compliant. I use the Oster cooling spray to cool down the blades every once in a while and both of them were shaved in an hour or so. Then I tossed them in the bath, obviously.Tip: The blade is supposed to run along with the skin. I didn't know that so I was using the shaver upside down with only the tip of the blade on the skin. It doesn't work so well like that. Also, pull the cat skin tight so you don't accidentally cut them.

I have been using this clipper for my Standard Poodle for about 6 months now - I do his feet and face at least once a month - and it is great for all our needs.  I have never taken him to a groomer, and have had show dog friends and pro groomers tell me he looks great with just the clipping we do with this clipper.  All clippers will get hot - it's simply a law of physics: two pieces of metal rubbing together at high speed causes heat.  I have extra blades and a damp cloth nearby when the blade gets hot.  If you find the clipper "drags through the coat" it may be the same thing that happened to me when I first got it - the blade wasn't snapped down into position correctly and it wasn't clipping at all.  For my Poodle, this clipper is fabulous, and the price can't be beat!
summary: Excellent clipper for a great price

reviewText: I know dog owners will vote my review "not helpful", but I truly believe cat people should be informed too. So...I have a black Persian and I live in California, so my cat is comfortable probably about 4 months per year; the rest, he suffers from heat because of his very, very long and thick fur. Since most pet-groomers are actually dog-groomers, and the very few cat-groomers are either incompetent or/and charge a fortune, I was on the look out for a good clipper.Sadly, Andis 21420 was not it; no matter how hard we tried, and how many attachments we used, it would not do a good job. It either clipped the fur too close (almost like shaving) or it would leave streaks and result in an uneven cut. In addition, it was too noisy and the cat was stressed out. We tried in several different session, but the end result was so bad, that we gave up (my husband deserted about this time), so I had to use the scissors to give the maltreated cat a sort of decent cut.I should probably say that Persians are genuine "long-haired" breeds (2-3 inches long hairs) and the fur is soft as silk. If you have a Persian, any other long-haired cat, or even a silky-furred dog, then this clipper won't work.
have a large long haired dog, works good, needs to be cleaned a few times while being used, but like I said, I have a large dog

reviewerName: Y. R. Wu "The will to win is nothing without ...
reviewText: This review was originally for the Andis MGB2 clipper body mated to the stainless "ultra edge 10" blade.  For whatever reason, here at Amazon this combination is available in a multiplicity of model numbers based on included accessories and also many different vendors. The vendor for this review appears to have linked it to a slightly different clipper which appears to have the same body but a ceramic blade.  The Ceramic blade should in theory stay sharper longer than a stainless blade but I can't speak to it's performance on fine hair as I haven't tried it.Original review below:Animals vary greatly in temperment so if you can borrow a friends clipper to try on your animal first I recommend it before making the investment. We have two cats so this clipper more or less paid for itself the first year in use.We tried my sister's animal clipper the first year. The second year we tried two from Target and one from Petsmart. Finally bit the bullet and got this one from Petsmart. Pricier than the first we bought from them but worth it. (They were kind enough to let us return the first one)In hindsight, if we had the option of buying the clipper only we would have as we don't need all the combs, and if you don't need the extras you can get the clipper by itself for a lot less. The black plastic molded case ours came with is very convenient, however.Be careful when buying this clipper - the actual model of the clipper is MBG2 and it comes with a #10 blade. THERE ARE TWO ANDIS "PET PRO" CLIPPERS and the other one (The body is shorter, without the swoopy curve on the handle) doesn't get very good reviews.Himalayan cats are like Persians and have massive amounts of extremely fine hair. The other clippers we tried bogged down immediately and got very hot. This blazes through and is also quieter and cooler than the other ones which is good since our Siamese is jumpy.In terms of cat-trimming technique, we first trim all the nails (just in case) then sit on a chair on our deck, with a towel in our lap.Cat in lap on towel, pet for a few minutes until they purr, then start clipping. It helps to keep some tension on their skin with the other hand. Imagine you are petting with your left hand to your left, and the clipper is in your right hand moving to your right.My ratings: 1 star: Avoid! / 2 stars: Some merit but I can't recommend / 3 stars: Decent, nice / 4 stars: Recommended / 5 stars: Nearly perfect!If you found this review helpful, please let me know!
summary: Best of FIVE we tried - the only one that worked on our Himalayan

reviewText: There are some things I like about this litter: Flushability, strong clumping nature, and that it's corn based rather than a clay or some esoteric synthetic product.That said, there is one major downside: laughable odor control. Within a week of starting on this brand I had to buy another variety with strong odor control capability to mix with it just to keep the room where the cat box resides in any kind of bearable condition. If you have a cat with particularly benign droppings this might not be an issue. On the other hand if you have two or more I'd stay far, far away.An inquiring mind might consider purchasing aquarium zeolite (absorbs ammonia) or activated carbon on the side to mix in to improve the product. If I get around to such an experiment I'll update the review accordingly.

We adopted a rescue cat and during the home visit were told that the kitty had been using this litter. We were Fresh Step users before but decided to give this a shot. I was thrilled at the light, fluffy litter with no dust and when the kitty peed in the box, the clumping was great: no breakage and easily flushed away. That was the positive side.Poop is another matter altogether. Every time the kitty takes a dump, we can smell it. Our apartment becomes almost filled with the smell and if I look in the litterbox, you cannot see the poop so she is covering it up. One reason for this may be because we removed the flap door on the litterbox when we first got her. Now that she is almost settled in, I am going to put the door back on and see if that at least keeps the smell inside the box until I scoop it out and flush it away.I really hope that works. I'd love to continue using this litter but it would be very embarrassing to have people over and that smell in the air if kitty uses the box while they are here.I'm giving it three stars for the weight, environmental friendliness, and terrific clumping and smell removal of urine. I will update the review once I put the door back on the box.
summary: Mixed emotions about this litter. Pee clumps well, poop stinks though.

reviewText: I love this cat litter especially since its made of natural ingredients.  Would you rather (inadvertently) inhale or have your cats lick/inhale chemicals or something natural?This litter clumps exceptionally well.  I find that its still a little dusty but its minimal compared to the cheap and chemical-ridden clay formulas.I have 2 cats and the original formula works best for them!  The only difference I found with the extra strength formula is the scent which doesn't appeal to me.  I'm also sure the fragrance in the extra strength triggers one of my cats allergies and causes him to sneeze.

I too wanted my cats to have silica dust free litter, so I switched to this brand.  While it may be silica dust free it is NOT dust free.  It is full of corn dust, and I recently found out from a veterinarian that corn is an allergen that can cause chronic urinary tract/bladder inflammation. Guess what? My cat has chronic UTI with no known source...  Also this litter does not last the amount of time that they claim.  My cats track this dust all over the house and on our clothes if we are holding them(gross!)and it has no odor control. One of my cats eats some of it and then throws it up. After several years of using this I am at the end of my rope. Not only is this NOT the Worlds Best Cat Litter, if your cat is allergic to corn it may be harming them, and it is expensive. I recently switched over to Dr. Elsey's cat litter.  I am very happy with it.  It clumps well, no dust, some odor control, and far cheaper.

Using a natural litter made from renewable resources is very important to me, and I have a few brand including Feline Pine, Feline Pine Scoopable (does NOT clump!) and Swheat Scoop (urine clumps seems glued to the bottom and sides of the box). Out of these brands, WBCL is the best at clumping, and controls odor better than any litter I've tried (both renewable and clay, regular and scoopable). I do clean my litter box twice a day with theOmega Paw Self-Cleaning Litter Box, Pewter, so that helps I'm sure.My two cats also seem to like this litter! I think they like the feeling on their paws, since the granules are pretty small and seem soft. I like that the granules go through the slots in the Omega and a regular scoop very easily. I also like the smell of WBCL - kind of reminds me of a hay loft a little.This litter also lasts for a very long time, so I find it economical.

I HATE the smell of regular cat litter and I feel like my cats do too. I never liked them coming to cuddle on the couch and all I can smell is perfumed, chalky litter dust. Gross. This stuff is a life saver. It has a very mild grassy/hay smell, it coats and clumps beautifully and (as another reviewer mentioned) I can flush it! *que harps* I combined this litter with the Omega Paw Self-Cleaning Litter Box and kitty clean up has never been easier. It takes the edge of what is clearly the worst part of having a feline friend.

My cat is the kind of cat that once held his bladder for nearly two days because I had forgotten after a trip to take the litterbox out of the trunk and put it back in his closet. This cat isn't just litter trained, he simply WON"T go anywhere but his litterbox.I have used and reviewed various litter and litterboxes on Amazon through the years because my cat is not picky--you put litter in his box and he's good to go.I bought this litter and was shocked to find feces under the dining room table. I went to check the litter box and for the first time in my cat's 10 years, it was unused.i went to the grocery to replace this litter as that had been the only change. Although it was a new litter as well, he immediately jumped in and let out quite a bit that he had been holding, obviously.  I put a box with the rest of this litter in it and he TASTED it.  Perhaps corn litter is not a great option. It confused him I suppose.He has used the litterbox perfectly ever since.I know this is natural but I also know animals avoid things with GMOs, as they instinctively know they are bad for them (I have proven this with the yellow squash that the deer and raccoons bypass daily that has been on my side yard without rotting or bugs for 4 weeks) I have no idea if this has insecticides or GMOs but I can tell you my cat, the wonder litterbox captain, would rather step on his own pee on a rug than go anywhere near this stuff.It's not that it's new; he's fine with new litter--it's not that it's natural, we have bought many all natural litters before--he despises it.
summary: Like so many others--worst litter I have ever tried
