reviewText: Day 1: I just emptied out the cat box and refilled it with my first purchase of World's Best Cat Litter, multiple cat formula, clumping litter.  So far I am not at all happy. The smell is horrible, like stinky old tobacco. And my girl kitty started eating it right off the bat. I'm going to give it a day or two before I make up my mind, but I am not pleased with the first impression, and I'm not comfortable leaving my cats unsupervised with it until I see how the snacking situation goes. Tasty cat litter is the last thing on earth I want to worry about hurting my cats, so I'm a little miffed right now.Day 2: in less than 24 hours I bagged up all the litter and threw it in the garbage. This is the WORLD'S WORST LITTER. My mom came over for a visit and said my house smelled like a garbage can full of rotten corn husks. Not to mention she has allergies and the corn husky smell made her cough and wheeze.All day long my cats kept licking their paws, so I believe there is a smell or taste that they were trying to get rid of.I will never buy this again, and I wasted $18.99.I ended up buying something else called Dr Elsey clumping litter precious cat. Looked like the least of the evils on the shelf.So now for my two kittens, I have two breeze cat boxes, but since Breeze is not a good solo box, I keep a regular cat box filled with Dr Elsey's precious cat clumping litter.And I have a garbage can full of World's Best Cat Litter.

I gave it two stars because this litter is one of the best clumping litters I've used thus far as it doesn't break into little pieces from multiple cat use.  This product is made from corn and when you first pour it in, it smells like corn (a little weird but okay, it's natural.) It's been three weeks and I can't take the smell anymore. Not only does it not cover up the smell of the cat poo but also it's beginning to smell like rotten food. I wish they would come up with something that would clump this well that doesn't begin to smell over time. I won't buy this product again. In fact, I will be dumping both litter boxes tomorrow.

We've been using this litter for a couple of months now and are very pleased with it.  We had been using the "extra strength" version of this litter but found it a little too perfumed (though they are natural fragrances) for our tastes.  This litter does an excellent job clumping.I think the big advantage of this litter is that it is flushable, even on septic systems, and is advertised as so.  Since it's made of corn I don't worry about flushing since it's biodegradable, and I also don't worry about our cat ingesting it.I am going to try the other brand of litter on Amazon to see how that performs.  My friend who watched our cat said she thought the clay-based litters do a better job of odor control, but again I think this one does fine.  I don't notice any issue with the litter box as I'm walking into the bathroom where we keep it.Probably my biggest issue is cost - but again corn is expensive compared to clay, and I'm willing to pay for a flushable product.Update: end of February 2008, we have switched to Precious Cat Ultra Premium Litter, also sold by Amazon and available on Amazon prime.  Much better odor control, and my cat seems to be fine with either.  Now I just have to hold my nose and get through the rest of the bag!Also - it's half the price of "World's Best"!  Hope this helps!  Here's the link:Precious Cat Ultra Premium Clumping Cat LitterUpdate: end of March 2008 (guess you can tell I order cat litter at the end of the month).  Worlds Best stood behind their product and refunded me for two bags I had purchased.  We have switched to Precious Cat and are much happier.  I wish Amazon would let me reduce the number of stars but hopefully this review will help.

I love this litter. It doesn't stink, it clumps nicely and it is eco-friendly. The only thing I would have to complain about is that it seems to track a bit. We have mats, rugs and other obstacles between the litter and the couch with the intent of wiping off our cats' feet but we always end up with litter dust on our couch. Yuck. But still far better at odor control than any other one out there and less tracking than some of the other eco-friendly kinds.
summary: Best cat litter I have found

reviewText: I Love, Love, Love, this litter!!!!  I was extremely skeptical at first, but gave it a try since the company was offering it for free.  I have two cats and keep their litter box in my bathroom--which is rather large.  Sometimes our bedroom smells so awful that I cringe when I go in there--not too romantic needless to say!  Whenever I leave to go shopping or on trips, I close the cats in the bedroom to keep the dogs out.  You can only imagine the smells that greet me when I come back--especially from longer periods.  The real test came last weekend when my husband and I went away for 4 days.  I replaced the old litter with World's Best, closed the door and we went on our trip.  When we got back home and opened the door, you wouldn't even know that two cats were living in there.  Both my husband and I were sold on the litter.  From now on this is the only litter for us!  Give it a try--you will be amazed!

We came across this litter a while ago and have not bought any other brand or type since. Even though it is expensive, we think it is worth the price.For me, the secret is in the clumping - better than with any other product I have tried over the almost 25 years that I have had cats. It remains a clump and does not fall apart like so many other litter brands do if you remove it too soon or too late. It does not matter whether it is fresh pee or you are cleaning the litter box hours "after the deed" - the litter forms a firm clump and even shaking it on the scoop in order to get excess litter to fall back into the pan keeps the clump intact. Very neat and very economical, too, because no product is wasted.Odor control is very satisfactory. We have three cats and do not notice any bad smells. We think, in fact, this litter performs better than other brands in this department. No obnoxious artificial scenting needed.Lastly, I prefer the color and consistency of this litter to the regular greyish litter. The particles are smaller, grainier, kind of like coarse sand, and although it sounds weird I must say that cleaning the litter box is not as appalling when the color is sand-like. The old grey stuff always put me off more...:-)Although the price seems high, I feel that this is a great natural product with a lot of real benefits (like it lasting quite long) and would recommend it to anyone with cats.
World's Best.The odor is controlled very well.  The wet things clump and the dry things have their odor neutralized.Tracking is not an issue with this formula.
summary: It is what it says it is

reviewText: I started using this product a few years ago because I was allergic to all the other litters. It clumps ok, but is not very effective for controlling odor. But the manufacturers price is absolutely insane! If I'm paying a dollar a pound for something, it better at least be edible. I don't mind spending money on my cats, I only buy them premium food. But this corn litter has simply surpassed the amount I want to spend for litter. Luckily, I have found a cheaper alternative here on amazon that I'm not allergic to.

I do like that this managed to both clump and not be made out of clay, so in that regard it's great. But it seems corn is about the dustiest material you can make cat litter out of, because it is absolutely not dust free as claimed. A cloud of dust rises whenever the litter is slightly disturbed. In adition it smells "all natural" - like weird, food-y corn smell that then gets mixed with the smell of cat urine, which it's not very good at masking. It didn't track terribly and my cats used it readily. But I think the best clumping non-clay cat litter is Scientific Professional cat litter, so this one isn't the world's best after all.
summary: Not my choice for the world's best cat litter

reviewText: No scent. Clumps efficiently. Can get a little dusty if litter is not changed after a few weeks.

I thought I was ordering the multiple cat formula - my own fault - but hey - I love this brand of litter.  It's pricier than I like but it is so much lighter weight, clumps great, and doesn't produce endless amounts of dust.

Maybe this is the world's best cat litter for corn farmers because it's so expensive. But our biggest complaint is it's too dusty. When you shovel and rake it, you're going to inhale big clouds of dust that blow up a couple of feet into the room. I don't think the cats appreciated all that dust blowing up in their faces when they dug in it either, because they've been avoiding the box that has this litter in it, and it used to be the most popular box due to its location when it had cheap clay litter in it. We won't be trying it again.

I love this litter, even though I don't love the price.  It has its drawbacks, like any other litter- it tracks, it will smell if your cat doesn't cover their feces, and it's pricey.  But- I keep coming back for two reasons.  #1- it's the healthiest litter on the market.  Most people know that clay litters often contain asbestos and are carcinogenic to both humans and felines, and this is nothing more than ground corn.  Nothing to worry about there!  And those silicone beads just kept giving my cats HORRIBLE infections in their feet...I have no idea why.  #2-The smell! I can't stand scented litters, they make me want to gag when I'm cleaning out the litter box, and while the newspaper and pine litters are nice, they don't cover the smell AT ALL, so your house always ends up smelling like cat pee.  I've tried them all, and for a little extra money (this stuff actually lasts a long time- if you can get over the sticker shock it's worth it!) this litter is hands down the best there is.
summary: Great litter for smell and cat health!

reviewText: Thank goodness its flushable, and with a natural corn kernel compound I don't have to worry about the effects on the environment, and no plastic grocery bags to scoop the litter into TWICE a day. Clumps well, even the urine, Will never buy another kind again!

My 14 year old lady kitty has idiopathic polyuria, meaning she pees a LOT--meaning taking a five or six pound bag of used saturated clumped litter out to the trash daily--wearying for this 2nd story-dwelling little old lady.  A friend mentioned using World's Best for her cat and how much she liked it's being flushable--that was the first I'd even heard there was a flushable cat litter, so I tried it.  I mixed it in with her regular litter over a 10 day period, and she took to it fine.  My highest praise is for the ease of just flushing it away, of course, and also it clumps so well, and its odor control is the best ever.  It is helpful to let the clumps become saturated in the toilet bowl before flushing, but no big deal if you don't;  it simply will take an extra flush or two to get rid of it.I find the product smell actually pleasant--kind of a clean, grain/barn smell, which makes sense as it is made from corn.  GREAT product and now more affordable since I found it on amazon.com for $40 for 34 lbs--including shipping with amazon Prime!
I have tried all kinds of other litters and have found this stuff to be the best as far as no odor (including perfume), best clumping, most healthy for cat and human, least dusty cat litter ever.

I am so happy with this cat litter.... I have tried absolutely everything in my quest to find a silica free cat litter that isn't loaded with perfumes and that works well.  I think that World's Best delivers on their promises.  It clumps beautifully, is flushable, is not harmful to breathe, and is not harmful to my cats when they clean themselves.  A lot of people complain that this has absolutely NO odor control.  I don't agree, but you MUST clean your litter box AT LEAST once a day.  The heavily perfumed clay litters may be more forgiving with regard to daily cleanings, but really....do you want your cats to scratch around in a box filled with poop and urine for days on end??  They will track that all over your house!  People also complain about the price, but guess what?  That cheap clay litter throws off silica dust that YOU AND YOUR CATS breathe in.  Look up "silicosis" and then rethink using clay litters.  I've also tried pine litter and that stuff tracks all over the house and is a royal pain to clean up...and talk about no odor control.  Same problem with newspaper litter:  stinky.  Arm and Hammer has a "natural" pine litter that I recently tried and it was so strongly perfumed, it smelled like someone dumped a bottle of Pine-Sol into the litter box....that was the only time my cats ever refused to use their box due to a litter change and the couple of times they did urinate into the Arm and Hammer pine litter it REEKED of ammonia.  It was awful.  I know better now...I won't be changing brands again any time soon.So now I have been using World's Best for almost a year and I feel like it has great odor control as long as I clean it daily.  It has been my experience that once the litter gets stinky despite vigilant scooping, it is time to change it out for completely fresh litter.Great product, but people seriously need to develop better scooping habits.  It is awful that you would judge the effectiveness of a litter based on how lazy it allows you to be.  I feel sorry for the cats that have to live with people like that.
summary: Love this product!  Keeps everyone healthy!

reviewText: I have been usingPrecious Cat Kitten Attract Kitten Training Litterfor my kitten.  World's Best Cat Litter, Clumping Formula was free with purchase at the pet store.  It is something I've been intrigued with, so I got it to try out.I mixed some of it with her cat litter and she was not a happy cat.  She jumped in, to use her litter box but instantly looked upset.  She smelled it, tasted it, complained and then jumped out without ever using it.I switched back to Kitten Attract and she jumped in before I had a handful of it in the box and did her business.  Obviously, she was holding it in and couldn't wait.I guess if I ever wanted to switch, I would have to use a separate litter box next to her regular litter box until she decides to try it, but I don't think I'll do that.  She'd probably sicken herself eating it before she ever actually uses it.

I was skeptical of the "World's Best" name, but really this is the only litter that does not smell at all.  It clumps well and traps the cat pee smell.  I also love that it has no fake pine or wierd deodorant scent.  It does have an odd musty sour corn smell but I only smell this when I am cleaning the litter box.  My one complaint is that it does track quite a bit and the carpet I have in the room where the litterbox is has to be vacuumed constantly.  But the carpet doesn't smell at all, which is good.

First, let me state that I don't smell any difference between this standard variety of World's Best litter and the "extra strength" one. They add some kind of plant protein to the "extra strength" one, but both litters are very lacking in odor control. Either that, or my cat takes extremely smelly poops.However, if you don't mind the lack of odor control, this litter is great. It's just ground up corn. You can probably eat it if you had to, with GREAT DEPRESSION 2 coming (joking). But really, corn litter is better for the environment than strip mining it for clay litter. Since it's just corn, it's completely safe and healthy for your cat as well.Sometimes the urine clumps break apart. My cat loves to dig into this litter and kick it all over the place and it's annoying to sweep up off the floor. And yeah, it tracks. I see little yellow paw prints on the carpet sometimes.But I care about my cat's health and that's why I use this litter. Plus, he seems to like it. Though, to be fair, any litter I've tried with him in the past he's used without being fussy.
summary: Yeah, it's smelly, but it's good for your cat and the enviornment...

reviewText: This is only litter that I use and is very economical with having to buy only one bag a month.
summary: Economical purchase to keep cat and owner happy

reviewText: So... World's Best Cat Litter probably doesn't live up to the brand name. I liked the fact that it was corn and "natural" so the dust that is inhaled by me and the cats isn't full of chemicals. However, my cats' first reaction to this litter was the same as other reviewers - a temptation to eat it. One cat kept trying to chew thru the bag to get to it. Initially, the same cat wouldn't even cover his eliminations - because he didn't like the feel against his feet? It's hard to know. In any case, I did mix the finer Cat's Pride (which seems to be the first choice for the cats) with World's Best and it seems to be doing an adequate job. I don't know what I continue to torture my boys through various cat litters when they are happiest with Cat's Pride but I am still trying to find a "healthier" solution. So, I tried Dr. Elsey's Precious and wrote a review of that and that's definitely off the list and I'm not sold on World's Best so I will try SwheatScoop next. I've heard lots of good things about it but will probably always mix it with Cat's Pride. Cat's Pride seems to make my cats the happiest - they like the texture and it has great odor absorbing qualities - and I am reluctant to let them have it because it contains sodium bentonite. In any case, I wouldn't give World's Best 5 stars - I'll go 4 because it clumps well, doesn't seem to smell but the cats don't love it.
summary: still searching for the best litter

reviewText: I loved Swheat, but thought I'd check out the more-expensive alternative:  World's Best corn litter.Both are a natural resource that supports our farmers.The Swheat actually forms clumps that are as hard as rocks.World's Best Corn Litter had slightly softer clumps.The Swheat had an inert smell when new....but also never did start to smell for the 4 weeks it was in my two-cat's box.World's Best Corn Litter has a yucky sour corn smell when new....and after just 3 days...it began to stink in the litter box.  And yes, I'm at home all day so I scoop twice a day, sometimes more.  Imagine how it would smell if it wasn't scooped very often, like so many cat owners do.Swheat was $8.99 for a big box at Walmart.World best Corn Litter was $20 for a comparable sizeSwheat wins!

I was looking for a larger bag of litter for my cat as we had just purchased a huge litter box,  I was sold on this given that they claim that as long as you scoop daily one bag will last your cat an average of 72days.  Well that seems like a great deal.My cat went right up to the litter box, sniffed then started to eat the litter.  had to pull her away.  a few hours later I find her eating it again, same thing, then I notice that she has pooped outside her box on her litter mat luckly.  with in 24 hours however she is sick and vomiting. also has been producing very wattery stools.  Threw it out as we didn't want to risk any serious injury to our cat.I don't care how earth friendly this stuff is, or how great they claim it to be it's the worlds worst cat litter to us.

I was really hating the nasty, dusty clay litter that I have been buying for years. The end of the rope was the last time I cleaned house and was AGAIN trying to get that perfumey dust off of EVERYTHING. I had had it. I bought this and Worlds Best to put them to the test of my two cats. Worlds Best won hands (or paws!) down with me and my felines. This is by far the most esthetically pleasing of kitty litter -- the crushed walnuts look lovely in the litter pan and the smell is DIVINE. The Blue DOES NOT clump. I scooped soggy half-clumped messes out of the pan and one bag only lasted me a couple weeks if that. Worlds Best has lasted twice as long and there is no odor at all. The Worlds Best is the BEST cat litter I have found. I wanted dustless, it IS. I wanted clumping, it DOES. I wanted a litter that doesn't track, it DOESN'T. I wanted a litter that doesn't gag me with perfume when I cleaned out the pan, it DOESN'T. I wanted something that was ALL of these AND easy on the wallet. Buy Worlds Best cat litter and bring down your blood pressure and your litter costs. Oh, and both cats love it too!  I will only buy Worlds Best from now on.
summary: My cats and I LOVE LOVE LOVE this cat litter!

reviewText: I read a ton of reviews before switching up my dogs food, and this brand had the best ones. My dog had a little bit a little bit of a weight problem, not helped by her increased age and limited activity during the winter, but has slimmed down since i put her on this food almost 8mths ago. I expect she'll have even better results not that it's warmer out and we can take more extended walks.Also, I've never seen her so excited and happy to be feed. So it seems like she enjoys the flavor of the food. I'v had issues with other "healthy" dog foods, but she love this one.

When I first got my basset hound as a puppy, the breeder was feeding all the dogs at his kennel Canidae.  Over six years later, I am still feeding her Canidae and my other dog as well.  They do very well on this brand, it is wholesome, all-natural excellent dog food.  Finding it at a good price is always a challenge!
summary: Feeding my dogs this for years

reviewText: I switched my 14 year old yellow lab to this food from the regular Canidae.  She likes it just as much and it seemed to put a little pep back into her step.

I started to foster a 10 yr old overweight shep/lab mutt 2 weeks ago.I heard about Canidae and asked my local pet shop, who gave me a sample.  My dog ate it straight away.by itself.The Iams the shelter gave me he walked from as well as another premium, i bought.  Made him Br rice, sweet potato, etc with chopped meat or chicken and he walked away.  I needed a teaspoon of the cat food to interest him in any thing.I went back and bought a five lb  bag and a can of their senior wet food.  He has now eaten 2 meals with 3/4 cup of dry and a couple spoonfuls of wet mixed.  He promptly ate both bowls of food and no begging for more and didn't need the cat food to entice him.So I will continue to use this food and with long hikes hopefully more lbs come off.I will also say, my little pet shop is cheaper than most places who sell online, so check you local independent pet shop.
summary: My foster eat this by itself

reviewText: This is our first try with this product, purchased through Amazon under our Prime membership.  The dog's both gave it two paws up, and said "it's really quite good for diet food".  Personally I prefer people food, but our critters seem to enjoy the heck out of this.  Price was good, service was great, and it seems to be a real hit with the target audience; I recommend it highly.
I have three healthy dogs. My belief is if you feed your pets really good food ,they will enjoy great health. They have eaten Canidae food for years.

I have a 8 year old overweight Bichon Frise... he's a full 28 lbs! I just started him on this food about 2 weeks ago, and I already see a difference. People have commented that he has lost weight and I notice increased energy.  I also notice that he is not as hungry as he normally is.  So far, so good with this food. And, super convienent that it is dropped off at your front door!

Ok, to be fair LadyBug likes anything edible.  :)  Which was part of the problem....  Lady is a older (11-14 yr.) std. American Eskimo who loves to  eat that I inherited from my Grandmother.  She got up to 42 lbs on her previous diet dog food and the vet wants her to be 35.  That means she was overweight by 20%  <cringe>.  So I discovered this food and after <6 months, she is 36 lbs.  She likes the food and once she adjusted to the smaller quantity of food, found it to be quite filling.  Our Bear (6 yr. Great Pyrenees / Border Collie mix) sometimes steals Lady's food instead of eating her own.  I'll probably move Bear over to this dog food next year.  I should probably note that as old as Lady is, she acts like a young dog...  even though she is losing her sight slowly.
Meets my dogs needs and can recommend!No issues at all with Canidae.If you have senior dog, might want to consider this food.

I add water and hamburger and my dogs love it.  Dogs are 14 and 10 and no problems.  Recommended to my by a dog trainer.  I don't try anything else.  If you change to this product, I would recommend 1/2 this and 1/2 of the kind you currently use for a week or so before going to 100% this product.

This really wholesome dry dog food has been great for my slightly chunky Mini American Eskimo.  She absolutely LOVES this food more than anything else I've ever fed her. She even likes a couple pieces of kibble as a treat.  Check out the ingredients and you'll see there are no Corn products which, while being rich in protein and carbs, is also pretty fatty and is much cheaper to use.  I think you'll be pleased with your results with this food.
We have multiple age dogs in our home. This food feeds a multiple age range and body types of dogs. It has no by products and it is wheat and corn free. The dogs do not get gas anymore!
My dog has finally started to lose weight and he actually likes this food. I recommend for dieting and not just senior dogs.
My dogs don't seem to like it very much.  I think maybe because of the fish in it.  I will donate it to a local shelter.

Our vet recommended we go to a grain-free dog food when our dog was having skin issues. She loved the food, but unfortunately, changing her diet didn't clear up her skin :/She did have much less stomach upset on it.
Great food for skin problems for my German Shepherd large dog who loves it. He eats quite a bit of it!
summary: Good diet food ith no grains for skin problems.

reviewText: I wish someone would make a dog food without all the red dye!  I've got two maltipoos; one white and one black & gray, and the red dye keeps the hair around their mouths a nasty looking color.

My english bulldog had severe food allergies.  It would make him lick his paws until they were red, paw at his face, itch, and worst of all have very frequent messy poops!I tried many remedies and foods until I tried Natural Balance.  This formula has helped all the problems he had with food allergy.  And, he has hardly any smelly gas anymore!

I decided to purchase the Fish and Sweet Potato formula from Natural Balance when they inexplicably jacked up the price of their Bison and Sweet Potato formula.  Unfortunately, the fish formula doesn't work nearly as well as the bison (and venison) formulas do.  I own a Boxer and also a German Shepherd and both have noticeably softer stool with the fish formula.This is less an indication of the product's quality, but the fish formula also smells awful.  I guess this can't be helped given the nature of the ingredients, but it's worth mentioning at least.As a result of the price hike on their better products, I'll no longer be supporting Natural Balance or their products, which is a shame since I've been a loyal customer for over four years.
summary: Not as good as other Natural Balance formulas...

reviewText: This product arrived on time and it was in perfect condition. My dog loves this food, she has a really sensitive tummy and this does not bother her at all.  I would buy this product again and I would order from this seller as well.

My shelter dog, Sarah, is a long-haired shepherd-chow chow mix that is allergic to so many food ingredients and outdoor plants, that I just say "She is allergic to nature!"She was scratching almost non-stop, which was unpleasant and uncomfortable for her, and frustrating and distracting for me, so I decided to take her to a highly recommended veterinarian to perform allergy tests to see what was causing the problem.As it turned out, almost every food ingredient and outdoor plant (wild and cultured) was checked off the list as her being allergic to them."What to do?" I asked.  "She's got to eat something, and she's got to go outdoors."The veterinarian gave me a bag of this Natural Balance Fish and Sweet Potato dry dog food.  What a difference it made!  The scratching was reduced 90 percent and both Sarah and I felt much better for it.Highly recommended for any dog suffering from allergies.
summary: Recommended to me by a top-notch veterinarian

reviewText: My West Highlands White Terrier is very food sensitive and is hard to please on taste.  This brand and formulation has limited food allergy exposure (not sure yet how much it is helping) being "no grain" and "limited ingredients" .  As he eats only a little over a cup a day the large bag put me at some risk that he would decide to stop eating.  He is about half way though the bag and still likes, cleans his dish.  I use a splash of hot water which makes it easier for him to eat (he is missing several teeth) and I think the somewhat flat micro-pancake shape also makes the food easier to chew.

My English bulldog has extreme food and skin allergies.  We bought, what we thought, was the best food on the market only for her to still get chronic ear infections and constantly scratch.  We did an allergy test and sure enough she was allergic to majority of the main ingredients in other dog foods.  Natural Balance sweet potato and fish was the only food I found that I could feed her that wouldn't cause an allergic reaction.If your dog is experiencing allergies I would try this food before you spend the money on the allergy test.

Great dog food.  My 2.5 year old lab is at a healthier weight after a year on this (she was 90 lbs as a 1.5 year old pup, and she's slimmed down to 80.  But she's a very large lab, so she wasn't really fat to begin with).  Also, I don't wanna get too graphic, but there is evidence on our walks that she's digesting this better than the grocery store food I used to give her.(I started her on this because we suspected a food allergy, and then I liked the results.)But why is it going up in price?  I've been buying it off Amazon because, with Prime, it's cost effective.  But it was $50 in February, $55 in March, and now $60 in April?  What gives??  I might have to start buying it at the brick-and-mortar store again.  And that's a shame, because having a month's worth of dog food delivered to your door is pretty awesome.
summary: good, but why is it going up in price?

reviewText: I have been looking for 2 years for a grain free food for my senior dog (14).  He's had a messed up stomach since he was 12, so I switched him to grain free in hopes it would help.  This is the 3rd brand I tried and within 3 days his stomach was MUCH better.  The only thing I would say is I recommend you not keep it in the house.  IT's got a pretty potent smell, but that's probably because it's mostly made with meat and good ingredients.  Definitely worth the money.

We have 3 dogs, 2 of which have very sensitive GI systems.  This is the best food we have found that works well for both dogs.  The 3rd dog that has no GI problems eats this food everyday as well.  Our dogs are healthy, have pretty coats, and are happy when their tummies feel good...all thanks to this food.

My German Shepherd/lab/terrier mix really loves this food despite it smelling strongly of salmon.  This combined with a couple pumps of salmon daily really helps to reduce his excessive shedding.  I tried the chicken, lamb and LID versions of Blue Buffalo and my dog doesn't consistently do well as he does with the Natural Balance LID Fish and Natural Balance Chicken.  The Blue Buffalo may have been too high in protein because it made him randomly runny so I was mixing it with Nature's Recipe to balance it out.  I highly recommend Natural Balance.

I switched from another dog food to Natural Balance Sweet Potato & Fish because the proportion of protein was a little lower than the previous brand.  One of my (4) dogs was having a little tiny bit of tummy upset and the vet recommended looking for food with a little bit lower protein proportion.  All my dogs enjoy this food and no more tummy issues.
summary: My dogs are healthy & happy eating this.

reviewText: My 3 dogs love this grain free dog food with limited ingredients.  Their skin is better and less itchy and even the shedding is less.

On the quest to feed my dog better food with a slight allergy problem.I have tried different grain free food. Since she is a older Newfoundland she is mellow and non active and weight gain can be often a problem with this breed.I was hoping with this food it would help with her chewing her leg and lose some weight, but instead she started gaining weight and her skin problem was still there.I stuck with the food until the bag was empty and gave it some time to see if anything changed but she kept gaining weight.Thinking did the sweet potato cause the weight gain? Allergies are completely a individual matter so I can not say this product doesn't work. It just wasn't for my dog but I am not sure if sweet potato's are good for a diet food, it is carbs plus sugar because of the sweetness compared to regular potatoes. After doing some research other people were saying that dog food containing sweet potato or potato's caused weight gain in there dog too.I also found a website stating the cons of feeding your dogs white potato and/or sweet potato's. The website says, dogs who suffer from some health conditions, can be exacerbated by eating sweet potatoes or white potatoes. Because white potatoes and sweet potatoes are high in carbohydrates and sugar, they can aggravate canine candida. White potatoes feed yeast, and this can cause or intensify yeast infections and sweet potatoes are problematic as they have more naturally occurring estrogen than white potatoes. High levels of estrogen in sweet potatoes may trigger or worsen food allergies and can be detrimental to any dog with a hormone antibody imbalance.
summary: Caused weight gain with my dog

reviewText: My Golden is my heart.  And she has allergies, and with a Golden ear infections are very possible.  Switching to a limited ingredient dog food has been a huge positive.  And, she loves this stuff.  Give the option of a few dog foods, she'll go to this one and bark for it.  Her weight has remained consistent since the switch, btw.  I do recommend it.  For those on a budget, I would add: this flavor (as opposed to their Venison and/or Bison flavors) tends to be about five dollars cheaper; stalking the items price fluctuations tends to save another five.  This size bag is about a six week supply for us, I think.  The plus side to ordering is that you can get the bigger bag, and someone else carries it to your door.  However, if you have a local business in your area that stocks this (I don't, but my Mom does) they will probably load it for you.  And the local Natural Dog Food store actually gives samples.  Anywhoo, wherever you buy, I think this is a product worth trying.

Great Deal on Natural Balance. Shipping was so quick with Prime and I didn't have to lug this huge bag myself in and out of my car. I like buying the large bags of dog food on Amazon. Prime is the best too.
My girl has allergies and this is her only dog food she can eat.  She's been successfully eating it for several years - the shipping was super fast with Prime.

We discovered early in his life that our male German shepherd, now 6 years old, had food allergies.  After a lot of trial and error, we found that Natural Balance Fish and Sweet Potato was the best and only food for him.  He eats it with gusto and stays healthy.

I've been feeding this to my 7 year old collie for the last 6-7 months.  She has allergies and a vet recommended that I put her on a limited ingredient diet to help ease the symptoms.  She was originally prescribed a prescription Science Diet food made with fish.  For reasons I don't remember, I stopped that and eventually ended up with this food.  At first, my dog LOVED it. But I've noticed that with the last two bags, she seems to have lost interest. On the second to last bag, I end up throwing out several cups of kibble because she'd let it sit there for an entire day (and she's fed twice a day).  Though I store the food in a tupperware container, it seemed like my dog was snubbing it because it wasn't fresh.  With the next bag, she excitedly ate the first few bowls... and now we're back to the same thing. She'll let it sit there for hours. I sometimes have to put treats in it just to get her to eat it. Maybe this food doesn't keep well?As other reviewers have noted, this kibble has a noticeable fish smell which is detectable on her breath.  Also, I've noticed in the last month or so that my dog has had TERRIBLE smelling gas. Maybe that's just middle age catching up with her, but it's got to be at least somewhat related to what she's eating!So overall, I give this three stars.  My dog is one of the most food-motivated creatures you've ever met. Having food she won't eat is just frustrating!
summary: Dog isn't interested in it anymore; fishy smell; causes gas

reviewText: We have been struggling to find the canned fish and sweet potato recipe. Turns out Dick Van Patten sold the company to Del Monte in May and they are having production problems. I just opened the new bag of dry food and the color and smell is completely different from the last order. Knowing that the Van Patten's took pride in their food quality and not sure how Del Monte's quality control is, we are switching to the Blue Buffalo brand. I do not want to put my babies at risk if the Del Monte co. is already struggling. Blue Buffalo is also grain free and good for dogs with allergies. Hopefully this change will work out. I just feel that I cannot trust this brand and seeing already how different the food looks, scares me.Update: March 2014After being on Blue Buffalo for a couple of months, my poor babies had really bad stomach issues. They had gas all the time and their stomachs gurgled all night and my boy starting the constant licking on his paws like he did on Paul Newman's food. The vet said that the food had to much protein and that it is hard to breakdown plus it is hard on the kidneys. After much thought, and with the Natural Balance being back in stock, we did the whole weaning process off Blue and back to Natural Balance. I have to say that their stomach issues are gone, the mess I pick up in the yard is not has gross and runny and overall they just seem better being back on this food. Thankfully, the itching has stopped as well. Hopefully they will not have production issues again and we can stay with this brand since I know it works.

As we were supposed to, we continued to feed our eight week old blue brindle Cane Corso (Dante) the food that the breeder had started him out on.  It rapidly became obvious with his itchy ears, irritated butt, and skin rashes that he was allergic to that well-regarded and high priced food.  We also learned rapidly that he was allergic to grains, chicken and beef.  So we tried Natural Balance Limited Ingredient Fish and Sweet Potato.  BINGO!  No more allergic reactions.He gets two cups of dry in the morning, two cups in the evening, and often asks for a two cup snack just before bedtime.  At night he also gets boiled mutton and a sweet potato.  Now we have a four year old Cane Corso who weighs 170 pounds, has clear eyes, a beautiful coat, and no allergic reactions.  Be careful when buying a blue brindle of any breed and be sure to ask if his/her parents are allergic to anything.  Various dogs are allergic to various foods, but try some of the Natural Balance diets to avoid any grain allergies.
summary: What Can An Allergic Blue Brindle Cane Corso Eat?

reviewText: Only buying this food because I needed a limited ingredient food for a dog with allergies.  Do not like their production process as the food is made in a "gang" style manufacturing facility that makes multiple brands.  Higher chance of contamination.

My french bulldog developed SEVERE allergies at around 8 months.  Within a few weeks he was covered in bumps from head-to-toe, his hair fell out, he wheezed horribly, had really bad gas, went to the bathroom a lot and had loose stools.  I wasn't sure he would live, and the Vet said he had severe allergies, probably to his food, and put him on several months of prednisone and a prescription allergy food.  I was upset with the prednisone treatment as I knew it was dangerous and my dog hated the prescription food.  Two weeks later there was almost no change and he was still miserable, so I started researching my own solution for allergies, comparing food ingredients, and ideas to try.  I found that salmon/fish and sweet potatoes are not ingredients found in many other dog foods so an allergy to them would be more rare...and this food doesn't contain any grains or poultry products.  I started him on this and added a heaping spoon of canned pink salmon with it, and he still licks the bowl clean every time.  His breathing started clearing up within a week or so and I was able to stop giving him prednisone.  The bumps gradually went away after about a month and a half and his hair slowly grew back.  It took about 4+ months for 100% of his symptoms to go away, but he has been doing great for over a year now.  (For treats he is only allowed raw baby carrots, apple chunks, frozen green beans, or salmon jerky.)This food is an excellent option for dogs with both grain and poultry allergies as I can't seem to find another quality dog food that doesn't contain a little bit of chicken or rice, eggs, oatmeal, etc.  My only issue is that it is a bit low on protein, but since I add canned salmon to his food each day anyway isn't a problem for us.  The canned salmon and salmon oil are good for his skin so it works nicely, especially since he will eat the dry dog food just fine, but when I add the canned salmon he goes nuts for it.If your dog has allergies, try this!!  Don't let the vet sell you prescription dog food and put your dog on dangerous doses of prednisone.  My vet put my dog on the most common one sold; it was really expensive and I was so upset after I researched it and discovered that it has almost zero nutritional value.  (Look at petfoodanalysis. com as it does an amazing job of reviewing all foods and ranking them on quality ingredients, etc.)
summary: Amazing for grain and poultry allergies!

reviewText: I chose Natural Balance as my brand because they are the one dog  food company I found that had not had any recalls. They voluntarily recalled something that was not even out of spec after an inspection because even though it was good enough for the government, it was not good enough for Natural Balance. What company is going to cost themselves millions unnecessarily? My dogs love it and I love them!

My German Shepherd puppy has never had solid stool since switching him over to premium kibble.  The breeder had him on Science Diet which I've read is not a very good food.  I tried putting him on Blue Buffalo LBP but could never get consistently firm poops.  After reading the reviews I decided to give this brand a try.  Since switching, my pup has consistently good stool in the morning and afternoon, but for some reason by early evening, his stool is still soft (although not a runny as when he was on Blue Buffalo).  The reason I'm giving this a 3 star is that 1. This particular blend smells very fishy.  If you don't mind fish breath on your dog then its not a big deal.  2.  The first ingredient is not a protein thus the protein levels are lower than other premium dog foods.  This may be OK for an adult dog, but I'm not so sure if this is enough for a growing pup.  Which leads me to #3.  You need to feed almost twice the amount of food for growing puppies (probably to make up for the lower levels of protein).  In the end you are actually paying more since the serving size is larger for puppies; also larger serving size means more poop to scoop!  My dog is 8 months old so I might just weather out the next few months on this brand until his growth slows down then try to switch to Taste of the Wild.  I most definitely will not be getting the fish blend again, its too stinky. I may try the bison mix next.
summary: Seems to be a good kibble

reviewText: My dog is kind of picky.  She would prefer if I home-cooked her food, but sorry pup.  Right now, she is enjoying this food, let's see how long it lasts...
My dogs love it and can't wait for meal time.  Fantastic food for the price as well.  I would recommend this to everyone
Not bad, good deal on a big bag of food, especially for this kind of dog food, too bad the salmon one costs alot more
good quality product. cheaper and easier to get from amazon than local pet store. switched from merrick because dogs had terrible gas. this has a great ingredient list.
I really like this Life Stages food, I add warm water to it for the pups and they can continue eating it as adults without the problems of changing their diet.

I breed Labradoodles and this is the dog food that I feed to my dogs and the dog food that I highly recommend to all my puppy families. I also like it because I can feed this formula to all my dogs and puppies because it is an "all life stages" dog food.Some of my poodles can also be picky eaters but they really LOVE Canidae and I never have a problem with them turning their noses up at it.Read more: [..]

Good price and my senior dog is doing extremely well with this food. Coat has a nice gloss, her energy level is pretty high but she maintains her trim figure nicely.May 4, 2014 update: My senior girl had some major health issues this past summer, that have been resolved, but started having some skin issues and discovered she's become allergic to chicken so have had to switch foods. Finally found a food with Salmon that has been awesome for her. Not every food is going to be good for every dog...
Excellent quality dry dog food that all three of my dogs love.  Amazon offers it a great price but I have ordered the product several time the shipping quality could use improvement.

Since I started feeding this my 12+ dog has not scratched and appears to being doing very well on this food.I hope it last and I don't have to switch again. The price is high but worth it for her to be comfortable in her twilight years.

Although it took a short while for our dogs to become accustomed to Canidae, they now love it.  I add a little bit of warm/hot water, stir it and make a gravy.  Changing from one food to another isn't easy.  I normally mix the previous and new food together and transition slowly.  But I had run out of the old food.

We've been feeding our dogs this for at least 10 years, and that includes puppies and seniors. It's very well balanced, and we never have a weight problem with our dogs. Their stools are nice and firm, and really, isn't that what it's all about? Their coats are nice and shiny, they love the food, and no one has had any allergic reaction to it.It's medium-small sized dry bits are fine for our miniature schnauzers, and larger breeds. I think dogs smaller than 10 pounds might struggle with the size.To be honest, there was a recall on this food a couple of years ago. I did try another brand, and wasn't as happy with it. Our dogs gained weight on the same amount of measured food, and I had difficulty locating the same flavor two times in a row at the same store.We bought this food because it was in the "Whole Dog Journal" top ten food list and compared to everything there, it was the best price. We do add a big tablespoon of Wellness canned at mealtime. They all love it, and so do we.

After doing a ton of online research, I decided Canidae would be the best choice for our pup while not completely breaking the bank. There was only one problem- our dog wouldn't eat it. He would literally let a full bowl sit all day, only taking a small mouthful here and there. He wasn't fond of his old food (I think it was Iams large breed puppy) but he would eat most of it after a while. This one, I even tried adding water (nope), broth (he'd lap up any liquid, ignored food per usual if there wasn't excess liquid), and canned food (tried his best to eat around the dried food) and withholding food for several hours until I knew he'd be hungry. The best I got was a few small mouthfuls a day, when he had been eating about 1 1/2 cups of the previous food a day. He would always act starved (we even had some behavior issues with him grabbing food from the kids which he hadn't done while eating Iams) so I gave in and started adding canned food. I would not buy this again, it's unfortunately not such a great deal when you have to add canned food on top of it.The only upside, and the reason it's not a one star, is his coat while we were going through all of this became noticeably softer and more shiny. Even though he was losing weight because of his refusal to eat, he looked healthier overall. He gained the weight back and I will be very glad when this bag is gone.
Our 80lb German Shepherd eats about 4 cups of this a day and he loves it.  He is 2.5 years old and has been eating this dog food his whole life.  He is very healthy and happy.

My dogs line up for mealtime - this food is a big hit, and I like the big-sized bag, which means I don't have to order as frequently. It is a good quality dog food and the pieces are not large - nice, easy-to-chew sized. My dogs are not little dogs, but they are older dogs, and I think it's easier for them to chew this dog food.

When I rescued my dog he was very skinny, lethargic and had a dull coat.  After two months in a loving household and eating Canidae, he has incredible energy, muscle tone and a glowing coat.  He goes to the dog park at least four times a week and runs with boundless energy.  The vet is very happy with his weight now and everyone comments on how shiny he looks.  (He also gets a tablespoon of organic apple cider vinegar with his morning food.)

My dog loves this food.  I will say i was skeptical at first since everyone talked about a new formula that was terrible.  Well, maybe this is a new formula but my dog loves it.  He has no problems eating and i can use this food as treats.  He has a nice shiny coat and looks very healthy.  He did have diaeresis at first but that was because the breeder for feeding him cheap stuff and took a while for his stomach to adjust.

I have back problems so lugging big bags of dog food to my house can be difficult.  I have been purchasing this bag of dog food from Amazon for the past several months.  This is hands down the BEST bang for your buck when it comes to dog food.  This is a better price than any of the stores and it is extremely cheap.  It almost seems like the price is a mistake since the other flavors are so much higher per pound.That said, this is NOT the best brand around.  It is a 4 star dog food, but there are many better products.  I prefer grain free products such as Merrick or Blue Buffalo Wilderness.  Check out dog food advisor for a full review of all of those.  For the money, you can't beat it...and it is MUCH better than junk like Iams or Science Diet.
summary: BEST deal on dog food on Amazon, but it isn't the best dog food on the market

reviewText: I was very impressed with the formula in this food and the price was less than some other premium foods with similar ingredients lists.  My dog loves it (although he'll eat anything and is not discriminating!).  A good value for a premium dry food.

This is a very high quality food that I got for my German Shepherd. And she is doing great on it. She only eats 2 cups a day, and it maintains her weight perfectly. The price is awesome for the size bag, and it lasts us a good stretch of time. It has not irritated her allergies in any way. And she seems to love the taste. Ordering on Amazon is great. No local stores or vets carry this size bag, so I can order 3 or 4 bags at a time online and they're there on the porch waiting for me what I get home.
Not too expensive, but great ingredients for my dog.  I have been using Canidae for years, and would not switch.
summary: Best dog food I have found

reviewText: This brand was recommended as one of the better brands with good ingredients. My small terriers like it. I still supplement with a 1/4 cup unsweetened yogurt plus 1 tsp ground flaxseeds. Their shiny coats are a joy.

I switched to this after talking with a couple vets and doing a lot of research online about dog food and ingredients. My pups were on Blue Buffalo, but I chose to switch to a food that contains even less grain and ingredients that are more filler than nutrition. My Lab/Retriever mix is 11 years old, and I've noticed some good changes in him with this food. He has smaller stools, a LOT less gas, better breath, and no weight gain. There weren't any problems switching him over to this food, and he still enjoys it as much at the end of the bag as he did at the beginning. His latest vet checkup was great, so we will continue him on Canidae. While it is one of the more expensive foods on the market, what you pay for in better food is definitely offset by better health and lower and fewer vets bills.
I have a chihuahua and she hates dog food, she just wanted the people food, since i get the canadie she loves it :)
My dog is rescue and so I've been gradually easing him into this new dog food. He loves it! I treat it like a treat.

I read the reviews before i bought it and had some concerns. My dogs took to the food very well.I am still in the process of switching them from their old food and have not seen any problems. They like the taste and I like the price.I have two large dogs and the cost and ingredients are a big plus for me. It wwas delivered in just a few days. Unless I have any problems i will recommend thi food as a good nd eonomical food for multi dog households.1/23/14 I have been using this food for six months and have lately noticed a change in it. I soak my food to help prevent GVD and it smells awful. I will be going back to store food in the future.
summary: a good food for a decent price

reviewText: I have four dogs, 2 German Shorthaired Pointers, one German Wiredhaired Pointer, and a Russell Terrier, and they all eat Canidae dog food.  I discovered this dog food when my one GSP had food allergies to Purina products and would have terrible gas and very loose stool all the time.  I've been feeding this for 4 years now and I've never had any problems.  My dogs do great on it, they are at a healthy weight and have beautiful coats. This is a very high quality dog food and I almost never buy anything but this.

Amazon's price for 44lb bag is what I pay for a 35lb here abouts and I have to drive 30 miles round trip for the privilege of paying 25 percent more.THIS IS NO LONGER TRUE AS Amazon--IN THEIR INFINITE WISDOM NO LONGER OFFERS THIS WITH PRIME FREE SHIPPING--MAJOR BUMMER AND CHANGERS THE ENTIRE EQUATION [great price and delivered to my door for free thanks to PRIME.Great dog food but no longer the great deal--NO PRIME FREE DELIVERY--for the great dog food and the reason for changing the rating from 5 stars to 2 stars.update 7/12/14 thank you Amazon for giving me impetus to move my pup to Call of The Wild which the pup enthusiastically endorses with the added benefit of much healthier stool and the price has dropped $25 on a 30lb bag since November 2013.
summary: sadly no more  PRIME  free delivery to my door

reviewText: I have 4 dogs ranging in ages 13 years to 8 months, all are medium to large breeds ( Giant Schnauzer, Siberian Husky, 2 German Shepherd Dogs) and i have one with mild food allergies (no corn) and one with severe environmental allergies. I was looking for a food i could feed to all my dogs, or at least a brand, that was not going to cost me an arm and a leg to feed them--one 44lb bag lasts about 10-12 days-- I also wanted a food that listed meat first and all the other filler stuff last. Canidae has one of the highest ratings for dog food at non affiliated sites. Check out dogfoodadvisor.com to see how your dog food compares. All my dogs are healthy (the 2 GSD's are working dogs the other are retired) and active.
I have a picky dog and she loves this dog food.  I love it too given that it's made of good ingredients.  I'm a Canidae buyer now!

Oh my goodness...I have an 11 year old pug/beagle mix that has been lethargic for about 3 years, wouldn't really play, had a dull coat no matter how much I groomed her, and has had itchy paws and armpits for a long time. I never knew that all of that crap was in the big name brand dog foods. I had always had her on Purina of some sort until I started doing research. I was blown away by what I read and quickly became obsessed with finding a better food without paying an arm and a leg. I refuse to pay more for my dogs food than for our own food. After researching about 30 different dog foods and prices and brands on different websites, I went with Canidae All Life Stages (chicken, turkey, lamb, and fish)via Amazon with free super saver shipping for both my 11 year old Puggle and my new 10 week old labrador retriever puppy. I haven't regretted the change or the purchase at all! I am absolutely thrilled. My 11 year old isn't nearly as itchy, has a crazy shiny coat now, and has ALL KINDS of energy to keep up with the puppy now! Also, the breeder of my new lab had her on Purina Pro Plan Large Breed so I switched her right away and even her coat looks so much better now and it's only been about 3 weeks. I can't wait to see the difference in the two of them over the next 3 or 4 months. They both did get a little bit constipated during the transition period from their old foods to the Canidae, but a little bit of canola oil for a few days drizzled over their breakfast and dinner fixed that until their bodies adjusted. Both are regular now with no problems. Also, during the transition, I couldn't get either of them to eat even one piece of their old food. They would both pick out the Canidae and gobble it up and then leave their old food in the bowl until they were later famished! It was funny to watch!  Great product, great service, and will definitely continue to order the 44 lb bag via Amazon. The packaging was very very poor but that's a different issue. The box that the food was shipped in wasn't even big enough for the bag and the UPS driver brought me the food, with pieces of the box laying on top of the bag. Oh well, I'm still thrilled with the product!UPDATE:  SEVERAL MONTHS LATER, BOTH DOGS ARE STILL DOING FANTASTIC WITH THE CANIDAE FOOD! THE PUPPY'S COAT ACTUALLY SPARKLES LIKE I PUT GLITTER ON HER IN THE SUNLIGHT, IT'S CRAZY. THE PUGGLE IS ONLY SHEDDING A THIRD OF WHAT SHE USED TO AND THE ONLY THING THAT SHE EVER CHEWS ON IS ONE OF HER PAWS AND THE VET GAVE ME A SPRAY FOR THAT. I AM STILL THRILLED WITH THE FOOD AND WITH AMAZON'S PRICE AND THE FREE SHIPPING!
summary: I have a brand new dog!!

reviewText: Our vet suggested this food and we have been giving it to our lab/poodle mix for about nine months now.  Her coat looks great and her backyard business is pretty solid, what more could you ask for.

reviewerName: afrowoman "When the inmates are running the a...
reviewText: The dog loves them, they're healthier and safer than rawhide and these are the best deal, so everyone is happy.

My seven-year-old cocker spaniel is incredibly picky. I first triedRed Barn Red Barn 25-Pack Bull Springsand he loved them. But they are so expensive. Over $10 for three. So this month, I thought I'd try these. They aren't rawhide, so they don't bother his sensitive stomach. These are really longer and thicker than I anticipated and has hasn't finished it yet and it's been three days. (But he's almost there.) There are 17 in the package and they may last all month. 17 of the others, that he can eat in one day sometimes, would cost well over $50. These are great. I don't notice a smell from single ones, though I did notice a faint smell from the package.Fantastic product at a reasonable price.
My dog loves them and they keep him busy to longer than almost any other dog chews. Recommend them to anyone with an active chewer, they do give him some bad breath though

These are kinda stinky but the price is really good.. the ones in pet stores are usually stinky too except they cost more so i thought id give it a try. My dog ended up loving them so no regrets with this purchase.

The sizes vary - they are not all as large as I was hoping but there several large ones and oodles of small ones in this large bag.  Bully Sticks are an extra special treat for my pup...I pull them out when I need to distract her, calm her down, keep her occupied while I have company over, or as a reward for extra good behavior.  Compared to the pet store prices for bully sticks - these are a BARGAIN!  They are more expensive than rawhide...but they are gentler on your pup's tummy and more enticing...and to me that's worth it.

This is just as good, but better priced, then what you'd buy in the pet store. The qualitity is the same, size is the same...and my dog loves them just the same, but they are cheaper than the normal pet store!! Will buy them again.
summary: Same qualitiy you'd buy at a petstore

reviewText: Ever asked yourself where all these bull penises are coming from and how they are obtained?It is pretty crazy to kill animals artificially to feed their penises to other animals--guess that is the human species for you.

For the price this is the best company to order from. You get between 10 and 12 sticks in the bag, ranging in from small to large thinkness. I have a Great Dane puppy and these work so well to keep him busy during crated times. So far there was only one time where the smell seemed strong and that was during a car ride. But I'm assuming the small quarters and lack of good air circulation didn't help. Overall I would recommend this company and this treat to anyone who has a strong chewer and needs a healthy alternative to stuffed toys and furniture chewing.

These bully sticks are pretty stinky but my dog loves them.  Just have to remember to wash my hands after touching them.
Thicker ones are better. But price has gone up.We substituted raw hide lengths.Does the job well.Nice transaction and great seller.I would recommend this item to anyone who needs one of these.

These bull sticks weren't up to quality as some of the other ones.  But they were on par with the ones from your local pet store.  They did smell a bit, but my corgi loved it.  The price point is great, but quality could be better.

reviewText: My 11 lb. puppy loves these sticks and they keep him busy while I'm away at work during the day.  The smell goes away and is something I'll put up with as it makes him so happy.

reviewText: My dog really enjoys these, and - at least with her - they really don't make much of a mess when she is chewing them.  They also don't smell bad, though to be honest I've never really had a problem with bully stick smells like some people do.Downside: as a chew, they really don't last very long.  I mean I have a large dog, but still, I don't think these things last much more than an hour before they are chewed down so short that I have to take them away so she can't swallow the little stub whole and hurt herself.  It's a nice treat but would be too expensive to give all the time.Then again, how many other objects of this particular nature can last for a whole hour?
summary: My dog loves big hard penises

reviewText: My dog really loves these.  They last a good long time for her.  These are quite long so we do cut them in half (takes a bit of effort, these are tough mothers).  Good bang for your buck with these.  Again, these are tough mothers so be sure your dog has strong, healthy teeth!
summary: They last a good long time for her

reviewText: I have no idea what part of the animal they're using LOL, but my dogs go crazy for these!! Yes they do stink up a bit, just keep them away stored in a dark container. Yes they're pricey, and unfortunately because my dogs are big dobermans, they don't last as long as other people have stated, well the thin long strips anyway. The thick long ones, which are rare in these packs, last much longer. I have also purchased the small bully stick package (from the same company), and my chihuahua loves them!! I've also purchased the bulk 2 pound pack and saved a couple of bucks, it's just two 1 pound packages taped together.I've ordered these several times, never had any problems with maggots or anything, and the shipping is surprisingly FAST!! A+++ to the seller!!And they're made in either Brazil, or Paraguay, so for those of us former Petco shoppers, no, they're not from China!!
summary: My dogs love, love, love them!!!

reviewText: I've gotten these from my local pet store, and am very picky about getting the tallest, fattest one I can locate. Recently the price for one jumped from $2.99 to $4.99, which is ridiculous for a chew stick that lasts no longer than 24 hours, on a good day. I learned of this "economy package" and though there's many, many negative reviews, I thought I'd give them a whirl. Well, I am now in the market for new bull dicks altogether. Exactly half of them were 6" tall and the 12" tall ones were completely anemic. I myself, if this was my business, would be embarrassed to sell this product. There's clearly no quality control. I cannot speak to odor, as I've not opened the package yet, so I cannot comment on that. Maybe that would knock off the last star possible.

my 4mo german shepherd mix is teething like crazy, and loves chewing on these bully sticks.  one stick lasts him about 6 days.  i wish every stick in the pack were the same size, plus they're expensive (and pretty gross considering what they're made of), but it's a lot cheaper than buying new furniture!
summary: long lasting chew for my teething german shepherd puppy

reviewText: Dogs like them, but really the quality of others I've bought are a lot better. For example at bullysticks.ca. Saying that, it's a lot cheaper to buy these bull wieners online than in a pet store.Good for their teeth.
LOVED them!  They do have a bit of a smell as most bully sticks have, but these really were great!  They lasted quite awhile, and you really cant find a better deal on the price!

Recently, my local feed and grain store upped the price of their bully sticks so I've been searching for a cheaper online supplier. Everyone else seems to have similar prices, wanting 3.50-4.00 dollars per bully stick not to mention shipping so I was thrilled to find these on here. My dog loves them just the same as any others I've bought for her. There was an even mix of some skinny sticks and some thick ones and it works out to be much cheaper to buy them this way rather than by the price of a single stick.
summary: Finally found some reasonably priced bullies!

reviewText: ...but smells like death. We bought these for our 12 week old golden doodles at the recommendation of my MIL. Her 6 month old golden had a bad chewing problem and was destroying their furniture and shoes, and she found some of these "bully sticks" and said they did the trick. Because they are made from a bull's *ahem* nether parts, the dogs are super excited to chew them to bits. But because they are made from a bull's *ahem* ... they smell HORRIFIC. I can't even express how disgusting these smell. I only let our puppies have them outside (they are inside dogs), and I give them a breath-freshening snack when they come inside. They've kept our puppies from chewing any of our belongings for the month that we've had them, so we'll probably continue to buy them - but seriously, I wouldn't recommend letting your dog have it in the house!By the way, this was the cheapest price we found for them. Most pet stores sell them individually for 5-10 bucks, so a full bundle at this price was awesome.
The pups will chew on the Bull Sticks for hours, keeping themm out of trouble.  I don't like the smell of them, but the pups seem to think they are wonderful.

Although my dog is a lab, and they tend the be chewers, he is pretty picky.  Over the years I've purchased several "chew" items, which he ignored.  He loves these.  The best part is they last for a long time. This will keep him occupied for hours. He'll finish other chews in a matter of minutes.  Highly Recommended

I am very happy with the Cadet Bully for many reasons. My Havanese needs a very, very hard chew, and Cadet lasts the longest. Our dogs LOVE themI I am very happy with the cost and the consistency of the Cadet Bully in this 1 pound package. I have occasionally had one or two thin bullies but this is no problem at for me. Chewing truly relaxes our dogs and I do enjoy spoiling my sweet boy!The shipping and packaging were excellent in this order of Cadet Bullies.
summary: This is the 4th bag for us!

reviewText: I bought one of these locally and then accidentally came across an article printed in 2013 about the danger of these bully sticks, which you may or may not know are raw bull penis. Dehydrated, yes, but still carry bacteria and other dangers that can make  your dog very sick. I don't want to be a spoil sport!! I really loved the idea of these, but please take a look at this article. Even over 50% of veterinarians are clueless to the safety of these sticks. And, the article tested many brands, so I'm not just including this this particular brand, but since it has many reviews, I hope many others will get this warning. Copy this address into your browser and read for yourself:  [...]
Been buying bull sticks from Cadet for about 6 months now.  I've tried other brands and none compare to Cadet.  5 Star for sure!
summary: My Beagle loves Cadet Bull Sticks.

reviewText: The value was there.  but my dog barely touches these, which is rediculous.  the pet store versions seem more desirable to him for some reason.

My vizsla cant get enough of the bull penis...ooops  Yeah these are a good size and keep her occupied for at least a few minutes. Much less expensive here than what I was paying at the local pet supply store.
My dogs do like them, but not as well as other brands. These had a strong smell and stained their paws.
I did what another reviewer suggested, and cut these in half to 6" lengths. It's an excellent value this way and the size of the chews are thick and my dogs just LOVE em!

We recently adopted a very adorable JRT mix puppy and she is a HUGE chewer. I ordered a single one of these for her to try which she ADORED but they don't last her very long (30-40 minutes tops). Still it's a great thing to occupy her time when shes being a little crazy and harassing my older Cavaliers. Our dog is about 35 pounds at 8 months old and these sticks are about 7-8 inches long.
summary: My JRT mix is in love!

reviewText: My dog loves these Pizzle Sticks.  I wish I would have found them or had them recommened to me sooner.  My Pittie can and will chew any type of chew practically within seconds.  I needed to find something that would last longer because I wanted something that would help keep the tartar off her teeth.  She is going to be 6 years old this year, and the tartar is starting.  Even though I brush her teeth, and give her a couple different types of Dentel Chews, this was not helping.  Then a friend of mine whose dog will also be six years old this year, and is the same breed, has the most sparkling, white teeth.  I needed to know what she gives him to help keep his teeth so nice.  She told me about the Pizzle Sticks.  I read up on them, and although I found what they are made of a strange item for a dog to chew on, I gave it a try.  And yes, she had her first one today and she chewed on it, for about 35 minutes.  I was delighted that I found something that she can actually chew on for more than a couple of minutes.  She finished her Pizzle Stick and was so happy.  I looked at her teeth later, and I was amazed that the tartar is almost gone.  Really it is.  So these will be the Dental Chew of choice from now on.  Pizzle Sticks are expensive, but so are all the other Dental chews that I have found available.  And, the Pizzle Sticks from Amazon is one of the best buys of them than anywhere else I have checked.  I highly recommend these Pizzle Sticks.
summary: My dog loves these and after one Stick, her teeth look better already !

reviewText: I thought these would be like the ones at Costco. Unfortunately, they were not. Severely inconsistent widths in the same package. Some were like tooth picks and others regulsr stick size like half inch. They smell the same and appear to be composed of the same material. Dogs still really like them.
Dog loves them, they last a long time (some almost a week, which is great for a terrier) but they are so stinky I have to open the bag outdoors while holding my breath - I store them double wrapped!
summary: Very stinky but apparently taste good

reviewText: First off let me start with saying I wish I had read some of the negative reviews before I selected these bully's.  I assumed all bully's were the same.  I have purchased several different brands from several stores.  All have been virtually identical in size both length and diameter from store to store.  Additionally, I have never notice any overly strong smell to go with those bully's either.We received the bully's (it was delivered to my office) the smell was so strong I had to take it out to my car.  That was a horrible idea.  My car ended up smelling horrible despite the box being in my trunk.  I almost threw up from the smell; luckily I have a 10 minute drive.  When I got home I pulled a bully out of the package.  It was thinner than I had ever seen before.  I took a closer look at the bag and was surprised to the differences in sizes within the bag.  I assumed it would not last as long as the normal sticks we get because of the diameter but it was twice as long as I normally buy so I thought that might even out.  I was wrong.  She had it finished in less than 15 minutes instead of the usual 2-5 days.  Well about 3 hours later she started getting sick.  I research a bit and found out that poorly processed bully sticks can be loaded with bacteria.  Our dog has been sick for 3 days as a result of the single bully stick.  I should have know based on the smell.  We are converting to dried sweet potatoes.  Those don't make her sick.Bacterial contamination information relating to Bully or Pizzle sticks: The researchers further found that 27 percent of the bully sticks were contaminated with Escherichia coli (E. coli), with at least one stick contaminated with an antibiotic-resistant strain. Another stick was contaminated with Clostridium difficile, and another contained the superbug methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA).The findings emphasize the need for people to wash their hands after handling any pet treats made from raw meat, the researchers said. Such treats should not be handled by pregnant women, the very young, the elderly or the immunocompromised.
summary: Poor Quality and made my dog sick

reviewText: I have a male Siberian husky and a female malamute lab mix. They both love the bully sticks. The sticks may not smell too great which hubby hates, but as long as my babies are happy, I'm fine with it.It really helps with keeping their teeth clean so I didn't have to brush their teeth everyday.

My bulldog loves bully sticks more than anything. These sticks are a good value, and last quite a long time, but I must say these are probably the worst smelling bully sticks I've ever purchased. My dog sits beside me in the evenings while I watch TV or read, and I gag at the smell of these when she's near me. Will be looking for "odorless" sticks next time around.
summary: Good value, but the smell is horrendous

reviewText: My dog used to love these and would chew through an entire piece in less than an hour. With the new one, it's been over a week and there's still 3 inches left. They seem to be thinner, but they don't stink as much. However, if that's what my dog wants and I am buying it for him then I rather it be something he wants to chew even if it stinks.
summary: Not as good as it used to be

reviewText: I was less than impressed by the quality of these bully sticks. The ones from Costco are much better. They are longer, thicker, and much more robust throughout the length of the shaft. These also had a peculiar odor. Nonetheless, my dogs loved to chew these up.

Well, no doubt an acquired taste, but my pup's acquired it in about 4 seconds. They would crawl across a mile of burning sand just to sniff the empty package! Having said that, they do worship these things. I take a pruning snipper and snip them in half and give them each a half, and they are in canine nirvana for 15 minutes. Great treat.

My dog LOVES these things, and this was the best price I found. Seriously, my dog is manic over these things. My only complaint: They are STINKY. Like really stinky. So prepare yourself. Or invest in some Febreeze. You've been warned.Tip: I cut these in half using a branch cutter to make them go farther/last longer. (Also works well to size them for little dogs)

Our dogs love these and they are safe for them as I watch for recalls to make sure.  It helps our dog has needs to chew and keeps her from chewing on objects that could cause her harm. I love to see what a calming effect it has on them to have them as a treat.
summary: Best price and Best Bully Sticks

reviewText: Unfortunately I threw away the brand of the last bag of bully sticks I bought at an awesome price. I am trying to look in my order history to try and track the brand down. My dog would chew those sticks for hours and it would last a couple of days. He is an older rescue, and an ex rock chewer so his teeth are not as sharp as other dogs.These do smell but you can't have it all. I was shocked when my dog finished it in under five minutes. Upon closer inspection of the sticks it seems that they are hollow/seem to be filled with something while other sticks he has chewed in the past are a complete hard chew in all layers. They do vary in size/shape and I am guessing they are sold like that since it is labeled as a 1-pound bag.If you are looking for a brand with consistent high quality (I read the good reviews) then I suggest you look elsewhere.
My dogs love it but there were only a few sticks that were thick, most of them were really thin so my dogs would chew it up very quickly.
Good product. dog loved it. durable and you can always cut in half if you have a small dog. beware though...it stinks like something else!

I was very pleasantly surprised when I received my package today. I have been paying $20.00 for 3 bully springs that are half the size and 1/3 the thickness of these. I only give my Danes these treats on Sundays - and they love them. These treats will last 7 weeks (there were 14 in the package).

I have a medium-sized 60 lb dog who is not an aggressive chewer. He can go through one of these in under 10 minutes, however. He seems to enjoy them quite a bit, so I keep buying them. I've bought several packages so far and I've noticed that in every package, there is a stick or two that smells absolutely AWFUL. The smell for most of the sticks is usually pretty unoffensive but occasionally you get one that stinks to the high heavens. The stinky ones don't seem to give him digestive issues so I guess they're fine, but it is a little weird....Can someone please comment and tell me why bully sticks are so expensive?
