Is there a reason or is it because pet companies know owners will pay through the nose for their dogs' enjoyment? Bully sticks are just cow penises after all!
summary: My dog enjoys them, but not very long lasting

reviewText: My Siberian Husky, Jack loves these treats.  Yeah, they smell.  But to him it's like prime rib.  Music to my ears.

...but they do. These are by far my dogs' favorite chew treat. Unfortunately, these are not the "no smell" bully sticks Cadet also makes. That said, the price here is REALLY good and the smell is a small price to pay for something that keeps my dogs from getting into trouble on rainy days when they can't go out.
summary: If only my dogs didn't love them so much...

reviewText: Both German shepherds love them keeps them busy and out of my hair when I need time. But if you do let them have their bull stick I recommend outside they smell HORRIBLE but then again  who am I to judge I'm not a dog, so here is my dogs review WOOF WOOf WOOf 2 paws up.
Dogs love them, No bugs no problems.  I don't care for the smell, open a window and all is good.

My puppy was recovering from a hip surgery and was restricted for his daily activity. I was very happy reading all the good reviews about the bull sticks. For the last couple months, we went through 4 bags of this 1 lb large bull sticks. Though my puppy is always in heaven when he has one to chew on. The quality of the sticks is, sadly as other reviewers mentioned, going down hill.  I just received the latest bag from UPS today, and the majority of the sticks are like pencil size. No kidding, PENCIL SIZE!I'm glad that I always add items to the cart first. This way, you'll be reminded any price change. Though I'm not happy about the size of the sticks, my puppy does love them. So I'll keep my eyes open for better options. At the mean time, guess he'll just do with pencil thin bull sticks!

These ones were exactly what I expected them to be. They arrived on time, and in good packaging. My dogs got excited the minute that they smelled them. I would purchase them again, and recommend them to anyone.
summary: My dogs have a crazy obsession with these Bully Sticks

reviewText: The mailman left the package on my porch.  Our neighbors dog snagged the box, chewed the corner off and chewed into the plastic bag before being grabbed by her owner.  The smell of the sticks was so "bad" I had to put them on a high shelf in my garage.
summary: Smelly but loved by all dogs!

reviewText: both of my dogs got allergies from these bully sticks. Both dogs are itching like crazy, first started with the shaking of the ear then scratching all over. Took them to the vets and finally got it narrowed down to these. Not good at all.
summary: caused my dogs to have allergies

reviewText: I really should have known better since the small size in the same brand made my yorkies sick to their stomachs.  Especially one of them.  I had to switch brands.
summary: I still thought these might be ok for my yorkies.

reviewText: You would think that a bull pizzle is created the same, right?  Right?! I have been procuring bull pizzle for my puppy for the past 6mos.  I have bought odor free [read: less odor than full stink] bullies, regular odor bullies [read: first and last 5min is barf-inducing], and then these Cadet bullies [read: ability to make a human pass out while sealed in the bag]. Apparently, not all bullies are created alike and these bullies are not for my lil miss pittie mix.  She'll chew on them for a few minutes and leave them.  With other bullies, she would chew forever.  Maybe it was just this batch.In the bag that I got, there were about 9-11 bullies of different lengths and thicknesses.  There were about 5-6 6" fairly thick bullies; 2 or 3 thin (like a reed) bullies; and some others.  I am sure each bag has a different variety, but they were definitely not all large.  Unless large has multiple meanings, such as small, short, thin. They somewhat do the job for now, but I will go back to other vendors.
The price for the bull sticks matched the weight and density of the product.  I was satisfied with the quality and the price.
One star because my dogs loved them. BUT, 13 sticks in the package and 6 of them were thinner than a pencil!I usually feel that I can depend on cadet for both quality AND price- not in this case.

Exactly as described,plenty in the pack.Some thin some thick, perfect for my 2different sized babies. Though not made in the USA I think these are the best. Recently tried a different brand ( USA made )and they made my dog sick. Will be sticking to these from now on!!!!!!

Have been buying 1 bully stick at a time in Pet store.  Product from this seller was about half price per stick by buying in a 1 pound package (about 10 sticks).  Ordered and found quality of product to equal that of the higher priced pet store sticks.  Puppy loves them.  Would order again.
My dog loves them, but they do tend to stink. You might want to put a towel underneath, on the couch or carpet if the dog chews there. Altho they don't last that long, usually.

My dog loves these!  Great deal when the price drops to the low $20s.  It does looks like these were the irregulars in the batch, some thin, some thick, but my dog doesn't care if it looks perfect.  Some reviews have mentioned maggots but I've purchased these at least 3 dozen times and have NEVER found maggots.
summary: Great deal, dog loves them, have purchased dozens

reviewText: Dogs got diarrhea everytime I gave them one of these, threw them out,  will not try them again, sorry for the dogs.

There aren’t many things my dog can chew on for a long time before he gets bored or finishes – except these! He loves them and goes crazy when the amazon box comes in the mail. The only thing is… they kind of smell. But he doesn’t seem to mind and I guess it makes it ok? Just be wary that if the dog lays down on a blanket and chews the sticks, it *could* smell up the blanket.
summary: My corgi goes crazy for these!

reviewText: First, let me say that this is not a bad product, and extremely reasonable at the price. Our local pet store sells single bully sticks of this size for minimum of $5-6 each.All that said, i believe anyone's level of satisfaction with this product will to some extend depend on how much experience one has had with bully sticks in general, and what you are using the basis for comparison.I have two dogs, pitbull and lab mix, who are both seriously  accomplished chewers. Over the last 7+ years i have spent what amounts to a small fortune on a variety of bully sticks from numerous different vendors. I am not adding it up because i think the total would scare me.. anyway i digress.One of these keeps my dogs occupied for at  most 15 minutes. i have given them other sticks that lasted 2 -3x as long, but again at double the price. A couple of other points to note, especially if you're new to the world of bully sticks.These are NOT odor free (not that they claim to be - but be warned, they be stinky)Take it from an old hand here, store these in a ziplock bag that seals. the packaging that they are sold in will not suffice. Trust me on this one..reallyIn my experience if i need something that is going to last for awhile, i'm usually better off going to an online merchant who specializes and sells different sizes and shapes in bulk. They usually have deals if you buy a certain minimum amount.Also, no matter how safe they seem, don't leave dogs unsupervised  in or out of a crate when theyre chewing on one of these.
summary: Not for the Professional Chewer in your life

reviewText: i buy these on a regular basis because my dog is a chewer. for the price, it's worth it, even if they aren't considered THE original bully stick, by name brand only. they last quite awhile, depending on the thickness. in this batch i had a great many pencil thin sticks, which, needless to say, don't last as long, so she goes through twice as many. that's the only disappointment i've had. you never know what the thickness is going to be. the product itself does have an odor, so when you get the bag and open it the first time, don't be surprised. it will air out and go away within a day or so. for the price, it's still worth not knowing what size you'll get. great for the price.

I have two small dogs (6 pounds each) and they love these and they are the perfect size for such small dogs. They have an unpleasant odor. It's not too strong but I smell it on my hands after I touch them. It's a small price to pay to keep my dogs from chewing up everything else in my house!

I use to get my dogs bully sticks at a local pet store but they moved. The other pet stores that carry them charge more and they didn't like them very much. I just ordered these for the first time and they were delivered yesterday. I have seen some that are extremely thin so I was glad to see that these were a decent size. They did smell pretty bad when I first opened the package but since then they have aired out and I don't notice them much. I've bought other ones that have smelled far worse. My dogs liked these ones so I would definitely recommend.

Yes, they smell and require air-tight storage..but my food-motivated canine units love them.  Hence the five stars on their behalf.  They are small, more appropriate for dogs the size of my Cavalier King Charles spaniel.
summary: Good Dog Chews for Occasional Use

reviewText: Charlie Sheen is all about this.  If he was a dog and had to endorse one bone this would be it.On a more canine related note, my dog loves them and these are available at a great price.  I'm not an expert on bull stick quality, but they seem good.  I will report back after I try one.

These bully sticks stunk so badly that after I gave two of them to my 70 pound dog, he almost smelled like the sticks!  Needless to say, I gave the remainder of them to a man whose dogs live outdoors.  The price wasn't worth it as I went to a local store and paid three times as much for some bully sticks, but they didn't smell.

I have purchased this product at least a dozen times. I have a 90+ pound german shepherd who goes through these like candy. I like that the package has a variety of sizes. I've seen sticks thinner than a pencil and as thick as a 1" diameter. It's nice to get 1 pound no matter what, rather than a certain number of sticks. The smell is no better or no worse than other brands I've tried.My dog absolutely loves these.

I have a small dog, approximately 10 lbs.  She LOVES bully sticks, so I thought I was getting a good deal on Amazon with this product.  However, most of the sticks in the pack are anything but "small" and not an appropriate size for small dogs.  Out of this 1lbs bag, there are literally only 3 bully sticks that aren't too large for my dog -- the rest I'll have to give away or trash.  Very disappointed.  Next time, I'll avoid this brand of bully sticks.
summary: I can't write this with a straight face, but here goes

reviewText: My Dogs really like them but they certainly don't last for a very long time or how long a "real" bully stick should. Smelly. Very smelly. Be prepared to smell them on your dogs fur, etc. even days later.

I had no issue with these bully sticks.  The odor wasn't bad, my dachshunds enjoyed chewing them, and it would keep them busy for a while.  My problem is that the dogs would chew the sticks about half way, then then when it got down to about 2 inches, they would swallow it.  I became concerned about choking, or bowel obstruction, so we had to stop getting them.
Great product and service as usual...my boxer, Moses, loves these!!  I will continue ordering these bully sticks as long as I have dogs.
I purchased these before and was very happy, but the pack I received this time was very dry and brittle.

My dog goes crazy whenever he sees this bag. These bully sticks are his favorite treat, ever.  I even started giving them to my Dad's puppy to distract her from chewing on shoes and things... totally works. She loves them too. Can't go wrong with these. The price is great, the quantity is awesome. And dogs love them.

Several sticks of all different thicknesses. Good variety pack but some don't last very long. Bottom Line: German Shep puppy loved each one of them. A big dog would go through these quite quickly though.
LOVE THIS TREAT FOR MY SERVICE DOG AND MY OTHER LAB SO GLAD YOU MAKE THIS PRODUCT AFFORDABLE SO THEY CAN ENJOY WHAT THEY LOVE TO EAT.TY TY WOFF WOFFBOGY AND BUDDYWANDAS KIDS

My 10lb. eight month old puppy loves chewing on these sticks.  He's a busy guy and these sticks keep him happy for long stretches of time.  The only reason I didn't rate these 5 star is because of the smell which surprised me but won't keep me from buying again.
summary: My dog loves these bully sticks.

reviewText: We usually buy the True Chews, but they have gone up in price so much, we thought we would try these. The smell of ammonia is so strong that you know there is a bully in the room even if you can't see it! One dog was ill after eating too much of one of these sticks. We ended up just throwing the whole bag out.

We are the new proud parents of a very large German Shepherd.  Giving her treats which are healthy and beneficial is good for her and ultimately good for us.  She is eager to get her "reward" or "treat" with these sticks and they help reduce the need for brushing her teeth (which she hates).  They don't generate a crumbly residue as some dog treats do.  I would recommend them to anyone with a large or small canine.
summary: Snacks for My Dog Really Are Appreciated

reviewText: These are the small bullysticks.  Keep watching the website as the prices change considerably from week to week.  I will buy larger ones next time as my 35-50 pound dogs munch these down way too fast.  Dogs love bully sticks and these are a good brand.
summary: My dogs love these but I need to get a larger size

reviewText: These seem to be a quality product. Good size, with no broken pieces. They do have a strong odor, which I found to be the case with most bully sticks. My dogs loved them!

We have two Cavalier King Charles Spaniels.  One has allergies and digestive issues.  They both love these and only upset the one with digestive issues if they have one 2-3 days in a row.  For our dogs they provide entertainment for hours.  I can see how larger dogs would eat them very quickly!  Our dogs start them and chew for 30 minutes or so, then they finish them off over the next day or so.
Loved them!  they are now addicted to these sticks and since they are pretty good for them, I will continue to buy them!

My 5 month old Siberian Husky puppy Aesop loves theses. They last a lot longer than other rawhides. He slowly gnaws on them, and can't rip off large pieces like he does with rawhides/pigs ears. Unfortunately they do smell pretty bad, but when you think about what it actually is, what else could you expect? This is definitely the best price I have found for these. Most places its about $8 for two.

These are great little individual treats. Its something I can give my dog to chew on for a few minutes.  He cant swallow them whole.  Its also a great value in price.  I can buy the same treats at the pet store but they cost a great deal more.They also come in different thicknesses within the pack so depending on what he has already eaten I can give him a thin one or a very thick one.

My 3 dogs love these, mini dachschunds and chihuahua, they last half a day, no odor, no splinters, no stains on the carpet, nicely packaged, no problems with purchasing these several times, made in Brazil by[...]
summary: Made in Brazil steer pizzle very good

reviewText: These will keep your dogs busy for hours.  They smell really bad, but the dogs don't seem to mind.  Worth every penny.

I've ordered these a couple of times and I've noticed highly variable product quality in terms of sizes and odor. The most recently bag contained mostly smaller bully sticks that reeked terribly... so much so that I had to wash my hands after handling them. This is odd because I don't remember the previous bag being so smelly and, amazingly, the pack I just bought at a store (US-made) don't smell at all!Worst of all this most recent batch consistently gave my dog loose stools. I don't trust pet food and treat products made in China or South America any more. From now on I'm going to pay a premium for US and Canada made products.
Our French bulldog cannot get enough of these bully sticks!  One of these sticks will keep him busy for hours - I've never seen him more happy!
Although they have an odor which is totally normal, it does not stink up my furniture or home.  Keeps my dogs busy and they Love them.
summary: Dogs love the Cadet Bully Sticks.

reviewText: I've bought the 12" sticks from same company.  This time, I wanted to avoid the trouble of cutting them into small pieces for my small dogs.  You'd think the product would be the same, but surprisingly, these shorter sticks had a pungent odor.  Previous sticks had a very mild odor which would become a little stronger when my dogs started chewing on them.  These smell very strong.

The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the thickness of the pieces is so random. Some are a great thickness (permanent marker size), while others are more like a bamboo skewer. I've ordered several bags of these over the past year, and sometimes I get a really good batch of thick sticks, and other times I (and my dogs) are disappointed. Still, since it's based on weight and not number of sticks, a good deal. Do be warned, these smell something HORRIFIC. I only let my dogs eat them outside.

My two pups are crazy about these Bully Sticks and chew them into oblivion!  The Bully Sticks are sort of smelly, but maybe that is what adds to the appeal for them.  My dogs are both small.  One is 4 years and the other maybe one year. (I adopted her about 6 months ago from the shelter.)  They will spend hours chewing them - especially the younger dog.  She may still be getting her permanent teeth.
I order these on a regular basis for my dogs. They do smell, but my dogs are crazy about them. I have always been satisfied with the product and it does a great job keeping my dogs teeth clean.

I feel like the proverbial kid in such need for companionship that he hung a pork chop around his neck so all dogs would play with him.  I used Bully Sticks instead and now have over 400 dogs.  I'm kidding about the 400 but 2 of them think I am brilliant and they said they will keep me around for as long as I keep on buying these somewhat schtinky dog goodies.  They are a baby-sitter in disguise and permit free time away from the puppy and the old dog.  That's dog as in canine and not human.  There is little that can be done for the human.  Seriously, these sticks are just the right size for a good chew and have leftovers for later before removing them from the dog's room.  The cost per stick compared to other sellers is fantastically affordable and since sinew is generally considered generic it makes for a good comparison.  No choking and none expected.  Overall super product and even the modest odor does not bother dogs or humans.
summary: My Dogs Love Me for buying Bully Sticks

reviewText: Cadet Bully Sticks, especially when purchased in this 1 lb. pack, are both my dog's and mine all time favorite chew treat. I have spent a LOT of time and money, on behalf of my sweet playful and adorable Havanese, finding a chew that he likes, that lasts and that I feel good about feeding him. He loves to chew and is picky. I was buying very expensive single sticks sparingly. My daughter came over after picking up a one pound bag of Cadet Bully's at a chain pet store for her dog. My pooch had 3 of these over a period of a few weeks, loving every one. I will keep Cadet Bully's in stock in my treat drawer and not waste another penny on all the other sticks, and other chews that sat laying on the floor untouched.
summary: My picky Havanese LOVES Cadet Bully Sticks

reviewText: My puppy dog will be into this stick for at least 1 hour.  She thinks it's the very best and so does mommy!

I've purchased these bully sticks many times before but this last shipment is incredibly stinky! Stinky like something the dog pulled out of the cat's litter box stinky! I've only given one stick so far, hoping that they aren't all like this...

I was buying this brand of bully stick from a popular pet store, when I seen them on Amazon I was excited by the cheaper price &  assumed I would be getting the same quality. However, these bully sticks were so thin and pointed I was afraid to give them to my yorkie. Didn't even bother to send them back, they were just wasted. I just returned to spending a little extra buying them at my local pet store again!
My dog and friend's dogs love these things but they are really stink! I can't get over the smell to keep them in my house.

This is the best combination of low odor, high desirability, and long lasting dog entertainment. Lower odor than many other pizzle or bully sticks (you all know this is penis, right?). We feel good about using a part of the animal that used to be wasted. These also seem to be our dogs' favorite brand, so there must be a difference in flavor among the brands (someone else will have to do the actual taste testing as it will not be me). If all six of my picky dogs say these are delicious, your dog will probably agree.

I expected them to be a little hard, since I have bought bully sticks before to really last and occupy them a while. If you have a tiny dog or a dog that is a dainty chewer, these would be good. They love the taste and smell of them. I have a Chihuahua, Aussie mix and a corgi mix and they all eat it down in seconds. So, to me, they cost a lot to disappear that fast.
summary: small means for small dogs maybe but they eat quick too

reviewText: This is almost my 5th time ordering this for my dog. He LOVES them! I love seeing him trying to hide his bull stick. (note: he only hide things he LOVE) one time, he even hid it under my pillow! Warning* they do not smell good at all. Tip* put them in the freezer to avoid the nasty smell. My dog just can't get enough of this. Another reason I like this is because how long it lasts. He can play with it for about 2 hours!!!! Long lasting and keeps him being a good boy, will REORDER some more. :)
My dogs love them. They really seam to help clean their teeth... and the keep them busy for a while. My dogs are 14 and 17 pounds... I buy the 6 inchers and cut them in half with my garden loppers.
summary: I buy these all the time

reviewText: My dog likes them and they are much cheaper than pet people, pet smart, petco, etc etc. Only place that may be able to compete price wise is costco. It smells but not to the extent that would make me want to leave the area.
summary: Cheaper and my dog likes them

reviewerName: Michael T. Maring "I buy everything online"
reviewText: So I'm kind of torn on these...PROs:You get quite a few in a single pack, and each one lasts a long timeMy dog loves them and will sit there and work on the same one for hours over a couple daysCONs:The sticks themselves don't really smell, but they will make your dog's mouth smell - and if they have long-ish hair that hair will stink to high heavens, too. Ugh.I'll probably finish off the pack and just make sure to clean my little guy's mouth off when he's done with them, but I doubt I'll reorder.
summary: My dog loves these - but whew the smell!

reviewText: My Dog loves these!!!!  We use them as an extra special treat. Gave one to the neighbor dog and now they are hooked on them too!

My dog is slightly more than obsessed with these.  They last a while and keep him busy when I am trying to get something done and he keeps getting in my way.  They smell bad but it comes off if you wash your hands.
My maltese loves these bully sticks. She goes to bed chewing one while we read and everyone is happy. This is her favorite thing as snacks go and it keeps her busy for quite awhile.

I initially said I would not buy these again. But I'm back to revise my original review. The sticks smell pretty bad in the bag. You'll get a nice whiff when you cut the bag open. They smell worse when they're wet with dog saliva. Just my luck, the first one I gave my dog was so rancid and smelly, I had to wear rubber gloves and hold these for my dog to chew because I don't want his paws smelling like it afterwards. But then his breath smells awful afterwards, too, and he's not allowed to give anyone kisses. After the first stick, my husband concluded that he hates these. He says they smell awful. It's true--but at varying degrees. Some are awful and others are less smelly.However, my dog loved these from the first stick. So even though I swore after that first one that I would never buy them again...I'm back to buy more :) I think there were a couple of "stinkers" in the pack. But the rest smelled OK. I'd say 80% of the sticks were OK. Every once in a while, there'd would be a really smelly one. I'll just take it from my dog, throw it away and give him a new one. Even if I have to throw a couple of them away, the price is still better here at Amazon than buying them individually at the local pet store.If you want to try a natural, long-lasting, safer, and more digestible alternative to raw-hide, give these a try. Make sure to give your pooch a big fresh bowl of water to go with his bully stick.

These bully sticks are my new puppy's favorite chew toy.  She will chew other bones/toys for a few seconds but always comes back to these sticks which she spends significant time chewing.  Downside is they smell horribly.  Aired them out as another reviewer suggested but it did not seem to help.  Can't smell them from a distance which makes them worth it.

My dog LOVES these things, and this was the best price I found. Seriously, my dog is manic over these things. My only complaint: They are STINKY. Like really stinky. So prepare yourself. Or invest in some Febreeze. You've been warned.Good to know: These are the smaller, half sized bully sticks.
summary: Wish my dog didn't like these as much

reviewText: I have a 16 week, 17 lb whippet puppy who LOVES bully sticks. These seemed like a good deal for him. I had given him bully sticks before that each lasted him DAYS before they were finished up by another dog. I had read the reviews about the bad smell of this product but honestly, I think that's just what bully sticks smell like. My problem with it is that the bully sticks are not 4-6 inches in length. They are more like 3-4 inches, and my puppy somehow managed to swallow a skinny one whole right in front of me! Thankfully nothing terrible happened (we spent over a week worrying). But I will not be giving these to him on their own again. They are just too short to be chewed on their own. I do recommend these to people with smaller dogs. We gave one to a pug and he was fine with it. I have started securing them to a much larger chew toy before giving them to my pup. If I order from this company again I will definitely be going with the larger ones.
These are quite small. I think you get a better deal getting the larger pizzle sticks pack for a little more. Most are as short as short pencils.
The sticks vary in thickness and there is no consistency in the sizes. Good for something for the moment if you can't find better quality sticks. Has stinky odor but what do you expect?

My dogs don't really love sitting around chewing all that much, as they'd rather be running or playing fetch.  But when they do, I haven't found anything yet that beats bully bones.Only down side is that they do smell.  Not terrible, but it is something to note.  They do sell "non-smelling" ones, but my dogs really don't like them nearly as much.Unfortunately these are little pricey as well.

These are cheap because they aren't from the most virile bulls. It takes my lab less than one minute to polish one of these off. You get what you pay for not really a bargain. Amazon should post edible product prices by weight
CAUSE TEETH TO BECOME LOOSE AND THEN THEY NEED EXPENSIVE DENTAL SURGERIES TO REMOVE THE MISSING TEETH. ALSO CAUSE A DOG TO ITCH FROM ALLERGIES!!!!!!!!!!!
They smell so bad that they take your breath away when you open them.  I would still buy them for my yorkies but they make them nauseated.
summary: These bully sticks stink to high Heaven!

reviewText: This is the second brand of bully sticks we bought for our dogs. I like that they're pretty similar in size/thickness and unlike the other brand, they don't have random 'flaps' of who knows what. That said, these are awful smelling. The previous brand I purchased had an odor but not too bad. This brand is rather foul smelling.
MEAT IS FROM CHINA!!!I learned the hard way this brand and many others are MANUFACTURED here, but the meat is from China. A complete list is available from globalanimal.org
summary: NOT USA BEEF - MFG HERE BEEF FROM CHINA !!!

reviewText: my pup likes these but they get bored with them. i have to hide them for a while and take them out again

We use these bully sticks to keep our dog busy when she is alone or with someone in the house.  She has eaten TV romotes, DVD's,  books ...  If she has a bully stick around that gets eatan.  She likes them.  I have read some poor reviews from people buying this product.  We have no complaints.
Max, love them. After his dinner he sits and looks at me and tells me he is ready for his treat. Everynight
My dog loves them. They tend to stink so cover up the couch if he is going to be allowed to chew up there, or put a towel down to protect the carpet.
I have a German Shepherd and was worried that the 6 inch size might be too small, but they are perfect.  Great price for a bag this size.  My local boutique pet store sells one 6" stick for $5 each!
If you want a treat this is the one for you. It cleans teeth and dogs can't seem to get enough.
I got this for the salad I fix for my iguana daily, and it works great. Low enough that she doesn't flip it and can get in it easily, big enough to hold a full day of salad and easy to clean!

I ordered this bowl for one of my lizards, which has got quite chunky. Being low like it is she is able to crawl right in the bowl ifneeded. She seems to love it, and has solved my problem completely. A+++++++++++++++=

Our tortoise cleans this food bowl clean every meal. She walks all over it, kicks it around, and all kinds of stuff. It's durable and pretty easily cleaned. It's also not too shallow or deep. I highly recommend if you're looking for a food dish for your pet reptile.
My new baby beardies love this!  it's perfect because it's short sides don't make it hard for them to see and react to new food. Easy to clean and very well built.
I just love this ceramic food dish, and so does my red foot. Its just big enough without being to big, will last a life time.

I've had this dish for about 2 weeks and both me and my eastern box turtle seem to like it.  Her previous food dish was just as long, but half the width and had higher edges.  I feel she had outgrown it.  I tried a smaller round dish but the food went everywhere.  With this she can climb in it and walk all over like she seems to enjoy doing without spreading her little pellets everywhere.  I'm going to order another one to put my sulcata's fresh kale into.Edited 9/5/12: I did buy another one for my sulcata's fresh greens.  He's only the size of a softball at the moment, but has no trouble climbing over the small lip of this dish.  It seems to keep his greens together and out of his substrate (for the most part anyway).
summary: Good for Eastern Box Turtle & Sulcata

reviewText: I wasn't sure if I should buy this but I use it every day to serve my tortoise her food.  It is shallow and durable.  It is good for up to a 4 or 5 inch turtle but the next size up would be better for serving food to a larger tortoise.
the torts love this. it's easy to clean.. easy to get in/out of .. shallow and goes with the natural theme I have in their habitat..

I was expecting more to this filter than just the bio-mesh stuff. While it does a great job of maintaining a culture in my tiny tank (2.5 gal) and the lowest current setting doesn't really disturb my shrimp, I was fully expecting it to filter out the particulates as well. It's pretty nasty to see stuff flying around in the water and sticking to my plants because I can't nab it all with a gravel vacuum and the filter won't filter it out.I bought the filter because the bubble filter I was using previously wasn't doing a great job of filtering the tank; it isn't strong enough to cycle the water. Now I'm not sure what to do to filter the water of particulates.

shaped aquarium.  i inserted mine upside down, because when i turned the unit off and lifted it out in the upright position, the junk in the filter fell back into the aquarium.  in the upside down position, i turn it off AFTER removing it from the water.  also, i cut a piece of nitrate-filter pad to the shape of the filter compartment, and the filter easily gives way for fitting it in; it's only about 1/4 inch thick so the filter sponge can compress a little to fit in other filter things.  you could put in the polyesther ball from a new bottle of pills if you wanted.  rinse in dechlorinated water first though.  water is clear, so i guess it works.
summary: use it in my 1 gallon half moon

reviewText: I have been using this filter for the past 3 weeks in aKollerCraft AQUARIUS AquaView 360 Aquarium Kit with LED Light - 2-Gallonand have had no issues.  I do agree with others who have said that the current is too strong even at the lowest level, so I actually put a plastic hairgrass plant in front of the output valve and I find that this breaks up the current enough where my betta can swim through it without hindering the effectiveness of the filter. I also place a piece of HBH Enterprises Cut your own Carbon Filter Pad 10x18in on top of the sponge to help keep the water even cleaner.  I do partial water changes once a week and water has remained clear.

Just what the doctor ordered.  I have a 35 gal tank with shrimp, neons and 2 African dwarf frogs,  Horntwart, java moss, Anubias, and several other plants / pond invasive greens, and I used this pump to infuse CO2 into the water.A non invasive modification takes the big CO2 bubbles and chops them into teeny weeny bubbles that slowly float through the water, allowing maximum CO2 infusion.I took the modification and experimented with a couple different configurations, and the unit works perfect!

I bought this for my betta tank which is a 5 gallon.  Unfortunately I had to remove it because my betta kept getting sucked into the filter's ridges (even on the lowest setting).  With the strenght of this little filter I can easily see it being used for a 10 gallon tank that is not heavily populated.

i bought this for my Betta's 1 gallon bowl and it was too strong until i put a large decoration right in front of it and it made the flow perfect. Then the filter started getting slimy and it never did anything for the ammonia levels. I moved my betta into a fully filtered aquarion and put this filter away for a few months, but i brought it back out for another fish in a 1 gallon box shaped aquarium. This time not only did i block the flow with a decoration but i also took out the dinky little sponge inside and put in good quality activated carbon. Not only did the carbon slow down the flow of the filter so i no longer need to block it but it also does a fantastic job of keeping the aquarium chemistry balanced and the water clean and clear.Penn Plax Pro-Carb Activated Carbon 29 oz

i got this thing to use in my 4gal biorb. it fits fine but it sucks the fish around due to the strong current it creates.i put a sponge on the end but it didn't help--edit---after looking at a user submitted photo i saw a sponge on the end of the intake, with the tube removed.i did that myself and put rocks in front of the unit. it doesn't seem to be bothering the fish now, but i'm not so sureits effective as i have it now.

The filter produces a very strong current even when turned to the lowest flow setting. I'd recommend putting additional filter media (filter pads cut into 2 inch squares) into the filter to dampen the current.I have it in my 10 gallon aquarium and use it as a filter/Co2 diffuser
summary: It's a great filter, but the current bit strong for 2.5 or 5 gallon tanks

reviewText: hi...i used this in my beta tank and the filter was too strong for the beta, it created a current. So i did what other reviews suggested with blocking off with filter...it worked on cutting down the flow but made the unit heat up...my fish was slow cooking. I caught it in time and slowly reduce the water temp..my  little guy is fine but the filter is in the trash.

I think this would be a fine filter for a small tank but the flow output was not directionally adjustable right or left, only flowed straight out.  I need a filter that can be turned towards the wall to help buffer the output.  My betta was sort of blowing all over and hid out.  The nozzle can only be moderatly adjusted to flow upwards or downwards, and this is a stretch.  Other than than the motor was quiet and powerful.  I ended up with the Penn-Plex Cascade 170 (which says 10 gallons or less but I used both in my 3 gallon tank and Elite seemed a stronger flow).  My betta completely ignores the Cascade one with the nozzle turned to the back wall.  Sorry Hagen.  I also cut the top quarter off the sponge and added a section of charcoal pad to add chemical filtration on the Cascade so I think that would work for the Hagen Elite too.  Good luck!Penn Plax Cascade 170 Internal Filter for Aquariums
summary: Good but not for my Betta

reviewText: Awesome little filter. Very nice flow good enough that a betta can swim around the tank without the filter bothering him. Price is nice and worth it.

I have a two gallon take with two goldfish and I was looking for a filter that wasn't too expensive but would still get the job done because it is well known that goldfish create a lot of waste. I got this filter set up and I must say, just like the other reviewers, that this filter is powerful. I took the advice and put another filer over the cone now the flow seems much gentler. I am going to upgrade to a ten gallon tank soon and I believe that this filter would also be great for that size aquarium even though the box says up to 3 gallons. Great buy!Edit:After running the filter for a day with no fish then adding them, the fish seems to shy away from it, almost as if the intake is too strong. My smaller fish actually hides on the gravel at the back of the tank behind the bubbler. Perhaps further modification of the intake is needed.

I had one for a good while. Definitely good for smaller tanks; however, it could get a little noisy. I eventually upgraded to a larger tank and didn't have use for this anymore, so I use it for a CO2 diffuser. I just took the air intake tube out from the top and added the tube from my diy co2 to it, and the diffusion is GREAT !

This is a great little (and I mean LITTLE) filter for a small tank.  It's just a plastic cup containing a foam block attached to a small pump - not a lot to go wrong.  A lot of people have complained that the water flow is too much for a very small tank, but there IS a flow control on it; it's a small, green nub on the side.  So there's no excuse for all you guys with Bettas in small tanks to not have filters for them!
summary: Incredibly tiny for tiny tanks - no excuses now to not filter your Betta's tank!

reviewText: Not exactly a whole lot I can say about this. I've always used this brand and does the job each and every time. Price is what it boils down to and it's quite a bargain on Amazon.

When I first started keeping goldfish, I mysteriously lost several fish.  I know now I was making all kinds of mistakes common to amateurs.  One mistake I made was to assume that all water treatments that claimed to make tap water safe would do the trick.  After several of my kiddos died, I asked for help from the owner of my local pet store.  This is not a Petco or a Petsmart, but a real mom-and-pop place.  The owners really care about their animals.The store owner told me that years ago when he was first starting out, his fish kept dying.  He had a water sample tested independently, and the tester advised him that our local tap water was the second worst water sample he had ever tested.  The pet store owner advised me to use Amquel Plus along with NovAqua.  Since I have been using these products, I have lost no fish.  Since moving to a different place (one with better water quality, I am happy to report), I have continued to use these products as they have been perfectly effective and reliable.  During the move, in fact, my fantails became extremely stressed and began to show signs of "popeye."  I gave them an extra dose of the NovAqua along with a wee bit of aquarium salt, and their condition cleared up quickly.Take it from me: this product really works!

This is a very good aquarium conditioner that I can recommend without reservation. I like that this does more than just dechlorinate. NovAqua calls its product a "bandage in a bottle" for fresh and salt water fishes, pond fish and invertebrates. It has the additives I recommend everyone use to help a fish make and preserve their essential slime coat and adds electrolytes to maintain a proper osmotic balance for gill function. It also removes toxic metals like copper, stabilizes pH and balances alkalinity.The conditioner does not remove chloramines, but then, most chlorine conditioners don't either (Tetra Aqua's AquaSafe is an exception that does both). Kordon makes NovAqua, and they have a similar product called Amquel, which is specific for chloramines. The two products can be used in conjunction if your municipal water supply adds chloramine (you will have to call them to check - you can't tell at home).I would prefer the product come with a way to measure out larger dosages (rather than just drops), but I like that this product comes with an electrolyte enhancer.The 8 fl oz bottle is a good price for the size and comes with an nice squeeze top. Since all you need is a drop per gallon, it lasts a good long time. You can use it whenever you add or change water, add new fish or toys, or if your fish are experiencing any stressful conditions.Wonderful product!
summary: Excellent healthy fish protectant and all-around aquarium conditioner

reviewText: I use this at all my water changes and never lost a fish other than the occastional death here and there. I have a lot of chlorine in my water, so much that even my britta filer can barely remover the taste and smell but after I put this stuff in the water the chlorine smell goes away. While that is not scientific or proves anything as far as the fish goes it amazes me how a little bit of this stuff makes the water smell chlorine free.No complaints with this product as the fish are healthy, wather tests fine and decent price.

This is the stand-by for our water changes.  I have excellent fish health and I am sure this helps.  Our water smells like a pool when you get it out of the tap and the fish never seem to notice, all thanks to Novaqua!

I use two kinds of water conditioners when doing water changes.  I'm particularly careful to do this when having to do an aggressive water change.  So I use the Kordon amquel and novaqua.  I have 2 bettas, each in 5 gal. Tanks.  They take aggressive water changes well, but I notice they seem happier when they get both conditioners.

Another Excellent product from Kordon,I highly recommend using this with the Kordon Amquel Plus and I promise you will never have to use another product again.I am so happy that after years of searching I have found the best 2 products I have ever used.It does EXACTLY what it states eliminating ammonia,Nitrates,Nitrites and is harmless to all aquarium life,Works very quickly.I will never buy a different product.
Best one around as far ass my results keep telling me..
Exactly as advertised.  I only wanted a de-chlorinator/de-chloramine.  I didn't want the neutralizer like Prime.  This works great and my chlorine always tests zero.
summary: I didn't want the neutralizer like Prime. This works great and my chlorine always ...

reviewText: This product has saved my new sofa. This works well to keep my dogs off of my furniture. They are easy to use and store when not needed. I highly recomend these and would buy them again.
summary: Finally- Something that works as advertised!

reviewText: My dogs (two mid size mutts and one small rat terrier) will not get on the furniture when this is on the seat.  Easy to remove for humans.  Light - well made.  My rat terrier (Cloie) has learned to get around it by jumping on the arm of the chair and then up to her favorite spot on the back of an overstuffed chair but I don't mind.  Glad we got them (purchased 3) as the two mutts had ruined an expensive leather sofa by jumping around on it and because when they come in from outside they have some sand on their paws.  We replaced the sofa and won't have to worry about them ruining this one.
summary: Dogs will NOT get on furniture when this is on the seat.

reviewText: This is great does what it says. I just wish I could find longer one. I need 5 to cover my couch.
summary: Wish I could find longer one

reviewText: I found my kitty sitting on the X-mat rubbing her face on the spikes.  So apparently this isn't going to work for my kitty. :)  I'm sure it's great for the right pet.
summary: Not going to work for me...

reviewText: This works great to keep my three dogs (75 to 100 lbs) off the sofa. I have the bottom sofa cushions completely covered and it works perfectly when I'm not home.

One of many failed attempts to keep cats off of my counters and other surfaces I don't want them on. Two of the three are only mildly annoyed by the spikes and the third will hang out on them without a care.
summary: Whether or not it works depends on your cats

reviewText: Okay, here is the deal......this does work.  The nubs are not something any pet or person wants to walk on.  However, it covers only a small area, so there is nothing to stop your little furry family members from just dropping their presents around it.  Once they pick a spot they like to go, they tend to stick to it.  I was pretty upset that despite technically working, these were just squares of plastic that likely do not cost much to make.  I bought three of them and felt a little jipped.  I started thinking, and came-up with a similar concept that works-- only it is cheaper and covers a lot more space.  I bought a 6ft roll of clear rubber carpet runner for $3.99, and just laid it down upside-down so that the carpet grippers were facing up.  Exact same result---cats do not want to step on those uncomfortable nubs.  I was able to cut the runner down to the size needed and put it in a couple different places ( with lots to spare), and it actually is less obvious since it is clear. 6 feet instead of 18 inches for 1/3 the price.
summary: Works, but over-priced and small----I came-up with a better solution.

reviewText: So, for 10+ years my cats have walked down the stairs through a cat door into the garage to their litter boxes (they have a fenced in area there) and suddenly one (or both) decided to stop at the washing machine on top of the stairs to pee. At first I set up a litter box up there but the litter tracked everywhere and then someone decided to pee next to the box. At wit's end I remembered my old cat (long passed on) who walked down those stairs in his ancient old days and never missed the litter box (wonderful sweet Nikki!). So, I guess the current situation had become a war of wills that I was losing! I bought 4 of these mats and put them down along the walls leaving a path to the stairs (and moved the litter box back with the others to the garage). It's been a week now and no pee!! There's a downside of course: I probably have to put on shoes when I wash clothes :)

what can I say, nothing else worked to keep pooch off the couch...she curls up next to it if I leave enough room, so I've gotten clever about placement.  She does notice when it's not there though...so it's not actually training her not to go on the spot, unfortunately.only con: I have to remember to take it off when guests come, because they inevitably grab it the wrong way (ouch).
summary: ugly on couch but it works

reviewText: I have two of these placed on chairs to keep my cats off. Not because I don't like cats on chairs, but one of my precious princesses likes to stand on the chair and rake her nails down the top of it, ripping the cheap material that looks like leather but isn't leather at all and isn't even vinyl but a sort of leather looking fabric of uselessness.Said cat also likes to jump on sink and poop in it, so I had one placed there for a while. It worked, but had to move it to wash my hands so now I'm using another method of deterrence.
Have always loved these! I have multiple mats around the house wherever I do not want my cats to hang out on. Very effective without hurting the animals.
The idea of this product is excellent.  However, it doesn't deter my cats at all.  They seem to enjoy walking on it and laying on it.

This does not completely deter my cat. If she is able to step gingerly on it, she will, but there has to be something that she really really wants for her to brave it. I got them to keep my cat from peeing on the couch, and while she still jumps up there from time to time, she will not pee there anymore with these on it. Be very careful, though. I accidentally stepped on one, and it punctured my heel and led to bleeding, though my cat does not seem to have this problem.

I HAVE 3 CATS THAT ABSOLUTELY LOVE TO SLEEP ON MY RECLINER CHAIR OR ON MY VELVET SOFA SET. I WAS HAVING A HARD TIME VACUUMING ALL OF THE PET HAIR DAILY. I GOT THE X-MATS AND THEY AVOID THE SOFA AND CHAIRS TOTALLY. I FEEL GOOD THAT ITS A DETERRENT AND UNCOMFORTABLE IF THEY DECIDED TO "TEST" THE X-MATS AND SIT ON THEM, BUT IT CAN NOT HURT THE CATS.
my cats had no problem jumping on our counters around the mats. they didn't deter them, not even a little bit. but my cats are very naughty and sneaky. for well behaved cats they might work.
summary: might be good for some cats, but not ours

reviewText: I have 6 dogs, ranging from 13 pounds up to 115 pounds and 3 cats.  I tried 2 of these mats for my chairs to see if they would work and ended up buying 18 more.  Nobody, but nobody wants to sit on them.  The only thing they don't prevent is the cats jumping up on the top of the chairs to lay down.  That I can live with.  Occassionally the Jack Russell jumps up and tries to lay down but he eventually gives up and lays on the dog beds.
Very disappointed with all the mats that I bought hoping to train my cats not to jump on the kitchen counters.  My 3 cats will not only jump on the mats but will also sit and sleep on them as well.
summary: Has not helped with cats jumping on the counters at all

reviewText: My dog is constantly scratching at my back door.  I needed something that would deter her from sitting there.  The X-Mat works.  She doesn't sit or stand on it.  Nope.  She sits next to it.  That's the problem.  It's too small.  I need to buy multiple.Other than that, it's great.  The mat is hard plastic that folds in half for storage and has a handle for portability.  I like it.  My dog doesn't.  I just wish it was larger._____________UPDATE 8/23/13:  I bought a second one for my porch so the whole area in front of the door is covered.  Although the dog will stay off it most of the time, when she's determined, she will sit or stand right on it and scratch the door.  I guess it's good that it doesn't hurt her, but it's not enough of a deterrent.
summary: UPDATE: Doesn't Work When Dog is Determined

reviewText: Cats and dog do not want to step on this one!  Even the one who seems immune to everything else doesn't like this so it is effective.  My only complaints are that it is small, and expensive.

I bought these to help with training my cat not to get up on counters or on the chairs by the fireplace and it didn't work.  Several times I found her laying on top of them rolling around as if getting a massage.  I now use these for kneeling while gardening.  They keep your knees clean and airate the ground.
We got these and the beeping mats. I like these better because you can flip them up and sit down I stead of turning off the power on the mats and moving them.

My small (13lb) dog isn't fazed by this whatsoever...but my 35 lb dog definitely stays off of it. I cut it in half and use the halves in various spots such as in front of the baby gate, coffee table, sofa arm, etc, depending on the situation.
summary: Works for one of my dogs

reviewText: This is an absolute favorite of my 9 month old pup...loves to retrieve and it is easy for him to carry in his mouth...and he has not torn it up...

The KONG toys all survived my Golden's puppyhood (and our Aussie's, though we got him at 6 months versus the Golden that we got at 7.5 weeks). This is fun to stick some pieces of kibble in to, and let the dog go to town trying to pull them out - no rips or damage to the toy happens when my Golden goes to town on this toy!

My 10 year old, active German Shepherd likes this Kong Jump'N Jack in a size large.  He has a large collection of Kong toys.  This appears to be his new favorite Kong.  He licks it more than chews it; he likes to carry it around.  The shape is easy to hold and "different", which makes it fun and interesting to play with.  Lots of grooves to hide treats in.  So far, no pieces being chewed off, but I think it would be a little better if it were made of harder rubber, not necessarily the extreme version, but this does seem a little softer than the usual Kong toy.  I can see how some dogs would bite pieces off.  Might have been better, too, if the ends were tapered, instead of squared off.  But, as usual, a better than average dog toy from Kong!  Will buy again!

My golden puppy was able to destroy this toy in 10 minutes.  The grooves of the Kong made it too easy to rip apart.  The black Extreme Kong and red Kong ball have survived my puppy's wrath so far, but the red Kong's don't stand a chance.

Our dog is an aggressive chewer so he can destroy the average toy quickly. We became huge fans of everything Kong when he was a puppy.  This toy is no exception. While it does show some damage after a few days' worth of play, the damage is very minimal. The toy is a great work out for him as well because it bounces and rolls irregularly, which keeps his attention.  I would strongly recommend this toy, but would suggest monitoring play time with it if your dog is a strong chewer. Overall, the toy does not disappoint.

I bought this for my 50lb 2 yr old pit bull mix, Kevin, who is quite the chewer. The only products that hold up to his bite are Kongs and Nylabones. This Kong is no exception. he has had it since Christmas and has not chewed any chunks off. He likes the way it bounces in different directions because of the shspe. I don't use it for putting treats because he uses it to satisfy his chewing needs. I would recommend for anyone with a chewer like Kevin.
Great toy very hard to destroyBounces around and is lots and lots of fun for dogsVery heavy duty will take a lot to destroy

My dachshund, Rojito, is an aggressive chewer. Most toys don't last a half hour after I bring them home. We're on the second of these Kong jacks. Along with his Ultra Balls, this is his favorite toy. He gets it smeared with peanut butter in his exercise pen every morning when I leave for work. He begs to go into his pen so that he can get his toy! I would give it 5 stars, except that he has been able to break off small chunks of the rubber around the hole where you shove kibble into it. The pieces are small enough to be quite safe, so it's really not a big deal. Given Ro's track record, it's amazing that the toy lasts as long as it does!
summary: Another favorite for an aggressive chewer

reviewText: On a whim I decided to add this magnificently inconsistent bouncer to my order as a bonus for my pup. I like to have at least 2 dental toys in his rotation at a time, and he loves the ball version of this toy so I thought I'd give it a go. My dog was not impressed. No fault to the toy, it is well made just as you would expect from Kong, but apparently jacks are not balls. It bounces some, but not a ton, which is why I think he lost interest, he likes to chase. Balls roll, jacks don't.Unfortunately it's one of those things you won't know if your dog will like it until you try it.

Durable and safe chewing. Our puppy loves to bounce this toy all around and pounce on it. She even brings it to bed for nap time. We feel comfortable leaving this with her when we go out. Like all toys tho we check it daily. We've had it for months and so far its held up. There is a little tab on one end when we first got it that we cut off.
Ok very small

I bought these the same time I bought the detal stick - they are the same in everyway but different shapesso, it bounces well - has several chewable surfaces - has taken a lot longer to destroy and even when the dogs chew off one side there is still 5 more to keep them busyid buy this product again - as the girls have had so much fun with them - but they wont last long

Our 4 golden retrievers are power chewers and they love this chew toy.  It is a good size, large, nice excercize for their teeth and helps keep their teeth cleaned.  It lasts for several months at least, which is a good thing, compared with some other types of chew toys.  It bounces funny, but they love to just lay down and chew on it.
My lab loves to play with toys.  But she is a strong chewer so toys dont last long.  This toy has lasted, and she loves it!
My two dogs still chew and chase this toy. They love it! Very tough and has lasted them a long time.

I have a lab/pit mix and she loves this toy. She likes for me to through it because it doesn't bounce like a ball and is very unpredictable as to where it will land. She also loves it when I smear peanut butter into the grooves. She has had it for about 3 weeks and she has chewed off a small piece of one of the corners. She is a serious chewer. This would be perfect for moderate chewers.
Not bad, my dog didn't honestly care for it much. Slots weren't big enough for much food, wasn't really interested in chewing on it. Probably not a bad product, just not ideal for my needs.
I was told this toy was basically indestructible.  And it has proven to be so, but not very popular.  I will start sticking treats in it, and it will get the dogs' attention.

My dog LOVES this toy. We tend to stick with the rubber KONG toys since they seem to be the only ones that can survive!! We have a 20-25lb terrier that loves to chew!! At first I thought the large was going to be too big but I think the larger size worked out and he enjoys running around with it. If you are going to use this toy to play fetch I would recommend using it outside or in an area with a lot of space . . . it tends to bounce all over the place! I also love that the toy can be placed in the dishwasher for cleaning!!

The Kong Jump 'N Jack is a great product for the pet who likes to chase things.  When tossed, it will bounce around irregularly, which engages your dog in a wonderful game of "is it alive?"  The material, however, greatly disappointed me.  I expected more from Kong, but since the ends of the toy are meant to massage and clean the gums and teeth of the dog,they are very thin and when chewed, fall apart quite easilly.  Should be made without this feature.
This dog toy has overall stood up to my destruct a-puppy.  She pulled one arm off the jack the first night but it has held up since then.  Good toy for highly destructive dogs.

My dogs love this toy because it bounces in random directions. They toss it around and chase it. Stuffing treats in it isn't even necessary. Now, my Border Collie doesn't destroy it. The Rottweiler, however, can chew it up pretty fast. So if you have a large dog that knows how to do some damage, just be sure to keep an eye on them when they're playing with it. If left alone with it for long, you'll find it in their poo the next day. :/
summary: Fun toy for dogs, but maybe not for destructive chewers

reviewText: Fun to bounce around but I have to put up when we are done playing so my pooch doesn't chew to pieces.

While my 6 mo old GSD didn't destroy this one as badly as the other it too has had some nibbling done to it. Again wish it came in black. I had wanted something to leave in with her overnight, she wants to get up at 4am to play and was hoping this would keep her busy.
summary: good toy not for strong chewer

reviewText: My German sheherd loves this, I put treats in it, they were gone rather quickly but he continues to chew and play with this. Kong products are superior for tough chewers.  I have 4 dogs, 3 poodles and 1 GSD all of them love this toy. Many thanks to Kong for their awesome products!!!! Keep up the great work.

We have an Australian Cattle Dog that is a heavy chewer.  We love the Kong treat toy (KONG Classic Kong Dog Toy, Large, Red), but were very disappointed with this one.  Our dog loved it.  She would chew on it, bounce it around, and chase it.  However, after only a few minutes of time with it, we noticed small pieces were breaking off at the corners.  We chose this particular toy because of the reputation of the Kong brand.  This one just didn't seem as good as the other Kong toys we've tried.  If you have a dog that chews a lot, I would recommend not getting this product.
summary: Not a good as other Kong toys

reviewText: Lays on it all the time and will pull it around to his favorite spot.
summary: ... the time and will pull it around to his favorite spot.

reviewText: I am happy with this purchase. It is longer than I need for my cage so I cut it in half and saved one half for later. My bunny seems to like it and has now begun to chew on it. Overall I would purchase again
This mat was a sturday mat that allowed my rabbit to exercise but taking the punishment of hours of play each day. My rabbit loves to tear at this thing and scratch it.
summary: Great durable grass mat for months of enjoyment

reviewText: Got as a gift for a rabbit shelter.  It was part of their wish list.  Very well made thank you.

Maybe this Grass Mat was really invented for Rabbits, but we did not let that minor detail stop us when we decided we wanted to utilize this Grass Mat as placemats, for table coverings, for seating mats, to tie together for larget grass mat needs, or to cut into smaller sized portions for smaller needs, and our list of uses continues to grow, and for certain, these Grass Mats may well be loved by Rabbits along our various life roads, but we have found a number of other species and breeds and individuals within species who seem to think this Grass Mat may have value for them as well for beds, bedding and floor coverings. We find in our lives so many times in stores and the internet and other places, that many see a product name and very simply stop there. Done. Well, this is NOT true for Our Families and Friends, as we all tend to regularly see beyond the assigned names of products and right away see in our imaginative minds multiplicities of uses for any given item and reliably so, and our practice is also true of these Grass Mats. Thank you to our favorite Amazon for making these products available with good pricing, shipping and customer support when needed. Blessings.
summary: PETER'S WOVEN GRASS MAT FOR RABBITS --- AND ALL OTHER GRASS MAT NEEDS ---

reviewText: I've gone through 4-5 of these mats now because my buns love to play with them. Great for them to lay on and when they are getting anxious they destroy it with great madness, its a hoot to watch.

I have two bunnies, an English spot mix and a mini-Rex and they both love this mat. The girl really loves to sit and lay on it and this is where I normally get to pet her for extended periods of time. They both love eating the straw and I've had them for 2 months and the mat is still mostly intact. It's definitely a great addition to add to their pen to help provide them with entertainment when you're gone! I'm sure some buns might destroy it quicker but for the price I still think it would be well worth it!

These are wonderful.  My ND Buns love these mats.  They love to lay on them, that is where they prefer to sleep, on the mats.  They love to chew and nibble them.  They are a great addition.  I have a large hutch with wire flooring and so for some of the flooring I have the plastic mats with holes for the poop to go down, but on the other half of the floor I have these mats and they just love them so much.  This way their little feet are protected from those awful wires.

I use these to line the levels in my bunny's cage/condo. He tears them apart eventually (3-5 months) so then I just replace them. I secure them down with zip-ties. They are bunny safe and bunny approved!
summary: I buy these again and again

reviewText: Keep in mind that the rabbit in the picture is small, so if your regular adult sized rabbit wants to spread out he will probably be longer than the mat, but sitting it works just fine.My rabbit loves it. He sits on it and chews on it and it keeps him away from chewing on anything that he shouldn't.
Product is exactly as described.  My rabbits are very happy with this product.  They enjoy using it both for playtime and relaxation.
this took my angora house rabbit a bit to get used to and know what to do with it but once she did it was a hit.
My grand daughters rabbit loves this although he tears it apart and makes a mess .. but very much enjoyed
Our medium-large girl bunny like to chew on the grass mat and within a couple weeks she had it torn apart.  I will probably get her another one.
summary: Our bunny liked this a lot but it did not last long

reviewText: My rabbits love these woven grass mats.  They love to dig and chew them apart, then eat.  Fun to watch them.
Nice mat. My bunny chews on it and scratches at it. We attached it to the side of the pen, so it is more if a wall or privacy curtain.
Rabbits love to dig and tear. My rabbit loves to carry these around with him and tear it up where he chooses to plop down. Some bunnies will lay on it, this is what he chooses to do with it :)
Although the description says this mat is for rabbits, I bought it for my guinea pigs to try. It took them awhile to eat (a few weeks) and got in the way more than anything.
My rabbit loved this. He slept on it every night. In fact, he loved it so much that he even ate it. Time for a new one. But it's so neat to him lay on it so happily.
I bought two of these for my dwarf rabbit and they were gone in a week. The price is so cheap and it keeps my bun happy :)
perfect for the cage- he likes to chew it and sit on it - great price for something that wont last forever (not supposed to)

I bought 2 of these and both times my rabbit peed of them. I actually have the one now hanging on the wall next to the bunny litter box since he seems to think he needs to pee by it I figure that will encourage the box usage. He never really chewed or laid on it, just wanted to pee on it. It makes sense because this pad is essentially similar materials to his litter box food (hay/grass) where he pees while he eats. On the rabbit forums I have found that I do not have the only bun who pees on these mats so if this is a new product for your bun just keep your eye out for accidents.
summary: Great product but my rabbit just wants to pee on it.

reviewText: My bunny loves this!  She is very busily and happily working on chewing her way from one end to the other.Bunn Fun !

He loves these things and can go through them so quickly! These kinda mats are now are go to's when we want to give him something to keep busy, like if we go out of town we stock up. Totally worth it!
These woven grass mats are messy but are a great activity for small animals. My rabbits love chewing them up.

Thumper doesn't interact with it much, but she sometimes jumps over to it and nibbles off the grass.  I rarely see her play with it, but she dragged it off to her cage last time (I put it outside of her cage)!  At least she plays with it at all, so that's enough to please me.
Our dwarf lionhead rabbit loved digging and chewing on this little pad.  After a few months it was torn in two but he still uses both pieces.

My Holland Lop loves this mat. As soon as I gave it to her she started nibbling on it and was soon happily munching away. Nom nom nom.She's a rather destructive little bunny and has since taken to digging and dragging her mat around. I expect her to have it completely decimated within the week, at which point I'll definitely be buying another!Very satisfied customer here!

Got this for our rabbit and she loves it.  She's had it a couple of days and she has chewed on it a little, but uses it mostly to rest her little paws on.  I will be putting in a second order for this item.
Our rabbit loved it. We put it down, he laid on it very comfortably. When he felt like it , he was able to nibble, chew and eat his own mat hahaha. It's a very good product .
summary: Peter's grass mat for small pets

reviewText: My rabbit loved this. He loved it a little too much because it only lasted a day because they don't just sit on it like in the picture they chew and dig at it. If it was stronger I would recommend it but until then go find another product.
summary: Not as good as they make it seem...

reviewText: I buy one of these for my Mini Lop at least once a month. I put his hay on top of it so it doesn't fall through the bottom of the cage. When there is no hay on it he tears it apart and loves eating it! He doesn't use it to lay down on though but as long as it keeps him busy and happy I don't care what he does with it! Would definitely recommend this to a bunny owner. Both rabbits I have owned love them!
Bunny loves this thing. I've bought three already and she has destroyed them! Good price. It just gets everywhere like any hay would with a critter. Would definitely buy again.
Bunny loves to chew on this and toss it around, consuming much of it. Good price, since the single-mat is fairly large and takes a while for bun to destroy it. Good for training to cover dig areas.
summary: Something safe for bunny to destroy

reviewText: I bought this my 4 month old rabbit and he loves it!  Spends most of the day lying out on it like a puppy and chews on it from time to time for a snack.  Much better than just having him lay in the typical bedding crumbs.  It will eventually fall apart from chewing and jumping on, but I predict it will last about 3-4 months.  Good price for a 4 month bedding.
summary: Great bed/chew toy, rabbit loves it

reviewText: My bun has a bad habit of ripping out the carpet.  I put this mat over the carpet and now he rips at the mat.  He doesn't seem to really do it a lot though since the mat is there and so the mat is almost useless now.

My buns loved these mats! Digging on them, chewing on them, throwing them, and eating them. They last for a long time, even with my German Giant / Angora mix tearing these up daily. We bought several for him and they were always something we could buy we knew he would enjoy having in his cage or in his favorite spot to hang out.

I don't feel comfortable using mats in my rabbit's cage that don't specifically note that they're for rabbits, so this product is perfect! It usually takes my bunny about 3 weeks to crew through the whole thing. They used to be sold flat but are now folded in the package, so it takes the mat a bit to unfold which is annoying, but overall it's a great rabbit mat.
My bunnies at first kind of ignored this mat and even peed on it but after 3 months they for some reason decided that they love this mat and it is now gone, as in eaten. Not one piece remains LOL

9 times out of 10, although I have "mini" and "dwarf" rabbits, the products people merchandise for the buns are too tiny! I was NOT however disappointed with this item and I will be ordering this again! Very large mat that my largest dwarf bun (4lbs) can lounge on comfortably.  Excellent product!
this is well constructed, but like other grass items I have purchased for my rabbit, she will not use it.
Great product. Wish it was a little larger though. Shipped fast and on time. My bunnies loved using this and chewing on it.

I love this mat!!  And so does my meyers parrot.  He cannot go without a grate in the bottom of his cage, yet he spends a lot of time down there.  So, I thought I'd buy this to put down there for him.  He loves nesting on it, pooping on it, and tearing it to shreds.  What bird could be happier?  LOL
My rabbit prefers to play with other toys, but he does chew on this when he's bored. I was expecting it to be much larger, though. My bunny is a dwarf lionhead and he covers up most of it.

This thing is big and robust.  I thought it would be small because of the photo that shows a baby bunny on it.  In fact, it is plenty big enough for my adult Holland lop.Judging from the thickness and quality of this mat, I think it will last a long time even though he loves to tear up grassy things.  It's a great item for enrichment.I will buy more after he eats this one.  :)
summary: Bigger than you think it is!

reviewText: We got this for our rabbits new cage and it's the exact size we needed. She absolutely loves laying on it and munching on it from time to time. Perfect!

Arrived timely, seems pretty hardy, bunny likes it.  However, compared to photo, it's pretty small (would take 3 to cover bottom of rabbit cage), but shame on me for not reading the specs.  I found it for $1 more at PetCo; if I didn't have free shipping, I'd probably just buy it there next time.
Rabbit liked it too much... tore it to pieces... it didn't last very long... and he's a small dwarf rabbit!
summary: Peter?s Woven Grass Mat for Rabbits

reviewText: but he likes to chew on it and tear it up and in the course of a day alone in his cage while I'm at work, anything to distract him is useful.
summary: My rabbit doesn't really sit on it...

reviewText: These arrive quickly and in great shape. They will be folded, but they flatten out very quickly. I use many of them for my rabbit's run, and he lays on them looking as comfortable as on carpeting (I used to use carpet remnants). They are easy to clean with water and a scrub brush - not much scrubbing needed. I used to 'slap them' on something to knock off the hair my rabbit sheds, I would advise against this as they are not quite that sturdy. With reasonable care, these last a long time (many months) and through cleanings with plain water. I know they're safe for the rabbit to eat, however mine never does.

My Bunny seems to like this product very much.  She naps in it, moves it around in her cage, and spends a lot of time chewing on it.  The product seems sturdy and has already taken a lot of abuse from my rabbit.I was initially worried about what seems to be a coating on the woven grass but after watching my bunny chew on it for several weeks I have deemed it safe as my bunny has not shown any signs of an upset stomach after eating it.Anyway bottom line, I know a lot of people out here are rabbit purists and want safe sturdy products so I feel safe recommending this oneOne flaw, I'd like it a little bigger, if you have a large rabbit it will not fit.  Great for bunnies.

She practically lives in her bunny bed! Best buy ever; when it finally falls apart, I will be getting her a new one.Munching on it will not hurt them; they are made from all natural straw. Buy your baby one, she'll be sooo happy :))
Our bunny really loves this bed however she also loves to pee and poop in it.  I'd still recommend it but be prepared for the extras!

Although pictured as for rabbits, we purchased two of these pet beds for our "Bella" and "Hartz".  They LOVED these beds, chewed on them over several weeks to the point whereby finally we had to throw the two little remaining pieces away!!  We will definitely be ordering more of these for our guinea pigs!!!
summary: Bought two for our guinea pigs!!!

reviewText: I leave this basket where my bunny likes to hide when he's free roaming. My dwarf rabbit fits perfectly---I think the rabbit in the ad is definitely photoshoped in smaller because my tiny dwarf takes up the entire basket. :)
A bit messy but it's cute and my bunny loves to chew and sit in it.  He got very excited when I gave it to him.  I definitely recommend this for rabbits and probably guinea pigs too.
My rabbit used this as a bed and a snack. He loved it and it lasted a month before he completely ate it!

Real cute basket, but it is definitely for a small rabbit.  We were planning to get a Holland Lop, but we ending up getting an English Lop (4 months old, almost 5 lbs).  She has curled up and sat in it a couple of times, but she's too big for it.  I'm planning to cut the corners and spread them out to make a pad.  Real cute and will be PERFECT for a smaller bunny.

I purchased this for my rabbit, a small one year old male lionhead. He just fits in it, so the size is rather small but good for a guinea pig, chinchilla, or small rabbit. He loves this thing, he sleeps in it, chews on it, digs at it, and tosses it around. It is also made of fresh grass, it's green and smells lovely, my rabbit likes to eat it which is good as he is stingy about eating his hay. Overall I love this product for my rabbit but I feel that it is false advertising because most adult bunnies would be too big for it.
It has been made very well, but my rabbit wants nothing to do with it, she won't even chew on it

I bought two of these for my rabbits and they had no interest in the bed. I bought it more as a chew toy for them.  They haven't paid any attention to it.  It seems to be of ok quality but once a bit of chewing has been done the whole thing will likely fall apart.
I have bought 3 of these for dogs in our family.  They are well made and really stand up to tug of war abuse from sometimes 3 dogs pulling on it at once.  Would buy again.

My dog loved this toy the moment I showed it to him. He destroys a rope toy in about a week, and this has lasted long enough to be worth it without any visible destruction. I would recommend it for strong pullers as well since the nice fleece feels better on your hand as the dog is trying to tear it away from you. Rope tends to leave a bit of a burn when fighting my little guy.

If you want a toy to give your dog and leave him/her play to with it, this is NOT that toy.  In fact, that would probably be a recipe for a vet bill since it can be chewed into small pieces.  But, if you want a tug toy to play WITH your dog, this toy is wonderful.  Dogs have real preferences about what is comfortable to tug and I went through a lot of options before finding a toy that my ACD mix would tug consistently with.  This is that toy!  I also like that you can launder it for the "dog spit" occasionally. ;-)  But it's a toy that I control and I don't allow the dog to play with it unsupervised, and I suggest that be the way is appropriately used.
summary: Specific Use Dog Toy--for Supervised Tug Games

reviewText: My dogs favorite toy.  They last a long time but eventually get shredded... and then for some reason my dogs like the smaller pieces even better.
