The advantage of this tug over others is that it is soft on the hands, light, and can easily go through the washer. There are no bits to pull off like on rope toys that can be swallowed and then make for stringy poop that your dog may need assistance then with finishing his business.  Nicely made.
My 7 lb Chihuahua tore this thing apart in about a week! Small pieces of rubber all over the place. It would be fine for a light chewer however.
summary: Not for moderate or aggressive chewers.

reviewText: my dog has spent countless hours chewing on this thing.  1. he loves it; plays fetch with it too.  2. he has yet to make the slightest sign of wear on it; and he has some strong chompers, my friend.
summary: buy it, get the right size for your dog

reviewText: and ordered the larger size.  However, this size worked better for her, the bigger one was just too big.  This thing is virtually indestructible.  Great for putting treats in too to keep them busy!
summary: I had a medium size dog

reviewText: Putting some peanut butter in here with treats makes my beagle go crazy! He's not a hard chewer, so the bone has held up grear

Maggie does not chew so that isn't what I use the toy for - I hide treats in it and it'll keep her occupied for a while.  Another dog was 'visiting' and he just loved chewing on it - so it'd be great for any dogs that like to 'chew'.

This red Goodie Bone Small Dog Toy has been a great help too.  We also fill this with treats & put it in her kennel with her when we need to leave awhile. She loves getting the treats out and also just chewing on the bone.
summary: Kong Goodie Bone Dog Toy, Small, Red

reviewText: It's lasted and hasn't been destroyed by my Yorkie, so it's a winner in my book. The downside is finding treats that actually fit inside. The treats that I have fit, get stuck, and then my poor Yorkie comes crying for help.
Kong toy very hardy. Puppy has been chewing it and did not break into pieces. Highly recommended for any small dogs!

Our Westie puppy loves this when we put Zuke's treats in it. We give it to him in his crate when we have to go out, and with that as a distraction while we're leaving, he's learned to not fret when we leave. No more whining or barking. For that reason, we call it the Red Bone of Courage, or RBC. It's lasted over 3 months and still intact. We hand wash it with soap and hot water.
summary: We call it the RBC, the Red Bone of Courage

reviewText: Great toy for small or larger dogs I have both. I have had kong toys for years and they really hold up well.

I bought this for a 31 pound lab who was coming to visit.  It is huge!  I am returning it for a medium or maybe even a small.  I love KONG and always use them for my mini dachshund.  I stuff them with peanut butter and stick a piece of swiss cheese into the hole.  I heard of someone using cheerios and am going to try that.  Also, I have been washing them by hand for years and I heard of someone putting them in the dishwasher.  I was afraid they would melt but they came out beautifully.

I have found KONG products to be the most durable and the best ones for the money.  My Shih Tzu loves his Kong Chew Toys and doesn't get bored with them.  We use Peanut Butter and stuff the toys with them and freeze.  It will keep him busy for a long time!
summary: My 4 1/2 month old Shih Tzu LOVES THIS!!!

reviewText: I have a 1 year old cat who thinks he's a dog. She loves to fetch and chew on things so I hoped this would be perfect. It took a little training with treats, but now she loves these bones. And watching her fetch a bone is pretty hilarious.
Its given him hours of fun and keeps him busy trying to get the peanut butter or treat out of it.

My little monster loves this thing. It's one of the few toys she hasn't managed to figure out yet, so it's awesome.I don't know how it would do with larger, stronger dogs, but it's perfect for little ones (less than 15 lbs.). I recommend using Blue Buffalo's turkey jerky treats...just fold an entire treat in half length-wise, the cut it in half to stuff in either side.

I'm satisfied with this bone but my dog, Max, loses interest as soon as the treats are gone, I guess that's how it's supposed to work.  He seems to have a hard time getting all of his treat out, I usually have to push it out for him.  He's a 4 year old mini schnauzer, so I figured he'd enjoy playing with it more. On the other hand, it has held up well, it really is "indestructible".
These are the best. Whenever we leave our dogs, we fill these with treats for them. This chew bone holds up to the toughest chewer. Highly recommend these for any size dog.

reviewerName: Mary Ann "trying to be wise shopper"
reviewText: I have a rescue sheltie who is about seven years old. She recently had 7 teeth removed and needs to chew but has tender gums. This is perfect for her. I put tiny treats in the open ends and she chews for a while. She also plays with it, but has never been a huge chewer and needs to be encouraged with the treat and play time.
summary: Just the right size and firmness

reviewText: My dog love this and he is quite the chewer. For a small dog, he's pretty impressive on how quickly he can have a toy shredded to pieces in a sheer moment but this toy really holds up. It has turned out to be his favorite treat toy. He tosses it around like a ball, lol and gives chase then chews on it for a very long time. Could be the treats I store inside but either way my dog is happy. Great treat toy! Thanks
This has been a hit at our house with a bit of peanutbutter stuffed in the end.  My littlest likes to hold down with on paw while licking.
summary: A great addition to our KONG collection.

reviewText: My papillon is a chewer, a runner, a head tossing fun loving active dog. She's destroyed handfuls of toys in the last week alone. So far the Kong products are the only ones still going strong. I find the Extreme Kong products to be a little tougher for her. But she really loves working the treats out of the ends.
summary: Can't beat KONG for a papillon

reviewText: Our dogs loved this product they started tearing off the ends. If you have an adult dog whos not a big chewer, great bone.

I bought this for my corgi puppy and was disappointed because it didn't seem well suited to the Kong treats.  So, like many other toys, it got put aside and forgotten.He absolutely loves to chew on bully sticks (we feed him less kibble so that he can have a bully every evening).  In fact, he loves them so much, that one night, he forgot to chew the darn thing, and he swallowed, WHOLE, an 8 inch bully stick.  He spent the night at the emergency vet - fortunately he digested it fine, but it was really scary!So, I started putting bullies through the regular Kong toy, and it worked great - Puppy could chew the bully just fine, but there wasn't any danger of swallowing it whole.  But it was such a pain to clean.  There was always a little nub left in the toy and it was so g-r-o-s-s.Finally I remembered that I had this bone, and it's perfect!  Again, no danger of the dog swallowing the bully whole, and waaay easier to clean than the regular Kong toy.  The small is the right size for bullies.  Highly recommended!
This was a good toy and my dog has not destroyed it  -  A Good price and quality of product.

It's really just another rubber bone but with openings in each end.  I have not yet found a treat that works well - either they fall out quickly or the dog cannot get them out at all.  However, like all Kong products it is quality made.

My dogs love these! They get so excited when they watch me put their cookies inside the bone. It entertains them forever!  I feel comfortable leaving these out when I'm leaving them home alone.  Great product!

I wasn't sure if my little dog would like this or not, as I got her a bacon flavored nylabone she turnedher nose up at, maybe it was too hard for her.  My other dog loved them.Anyway, got this in the mail, cut one of her bully sticks in half,stuck a piece in each end, didn't fit well as the bully stick wasn't thick enough, but she was able tocarry the bone way, eating the treat as it dropped out.  I checked her a couple minutes later and she wasjust chewing on this bone out in the yard like crazy!  Running around with it in her mouth, having fun.  It isa perfect size for her, as she is an 8 pound Chihuahua or Chiweenie.  We played fetch with it for a good halfhour, with her chasing it and bringing it back each time, dropping it on my foot so I could toss it again!Not sure how well it will hold up, the part where you put the treats in seems it might be a bit easierfor her to chew pieces off, so, will just let her use it when we go outside for now.  I don't think I need toput any treats inside it for her, she seems to like it so much, but once in a while to surprise her I might!+++++UPDATE: Well my little dog absolutely still loves this toy, but as suspected, she quickly chewed pieces offon the ends where the stuffing treats go, so, I have to limit her time with it.  She likes the texture of it,so, now I have to find one that has the same rubbery texture, but maybe not the open holes on the ends, so shecan chew away but not into pieces.  Took one star away for that, but still will buy Kong products and more ofthis until I can find something that lasts a bit longer.
My dogs love it and haven't torn it to shreds like other toys. Great for stuffing treats.

I have an 11-month old lab mix who loves to destroy her toys.  Her best bud, a 10-year old husky/collie mix, is an absolute pro at destroying things.  When their other two dog friends come to visit, they COMPETE at trying to destroy things, and usually there is destruction everywhere in their wake.  So far, all four dogs have been unable to damage one of these balls ... and they all love them, whether there are treats inside or not.  I have lost two of these balls, but I have never seen one that looked even worn, let alone destroyed.  If I could keep track of them for more than a year, they would truly be everlasting fun.  Instead, I have to keep a secret stash or my pup goes bananas looking for her favorite toy after I throw it in the ocean or down a storm drain!
summary: Best ball we have ever found!

reviewText: This product was advertised for heavy chewers.  When I opened the box my heart dropped.  I thought that the soft, squishy material this was made of would be destroyed in a single chomp.  But, to my delighted amazement, my dog has not destroyed this ball.I put treats in the ball and have found it difficult for the dogs to get them out.  So, every once in a while, I'll pick it up, squeeze it and hope that a treat falls out for them.  Neither of my dogs, both of whom use interactive toys like this daily, have never been able to get all of the kibble out on their own.  But, they continue to try, and that's my goal!

my dog loves this thing. I have bought her two so far, just because the first one we lost while playing in the yard. She's not the kind of dog who goes for fetch, she mostly just wants me to throw the toy so she can catch it and play with it, but this is great. since it has the treats in it, i can throw it and she'll run across the whole yard for it which is great exercise, and when she's tired of running she just lays down and gets the treats out. she's not a really aggressive chewer (the way some peoples' dogs rip up kong extreme toys) but she loves this and has figured out just how to chew it to get the treats out. it's perfect. would definitely recommend this to someone who has a dog that loves food!

Everlasting Fun Treat Ball / B0009YD8NSI have several treat dispensing toys for my puppy, and I like this one the least. The design is very poor, in my opinion, at least compared to other treat toys we've used.To begin with, it is difficult to "load" the toy with food and treats because there are two identical loading holes, one opposite the other. This means that when I pour treats in, they pour right out on the opposite side. It's like filling a bucket with no bottom, and it's very frustrating. Eventually, you have to just find the biggest treats you can, and jam them in, which is a pain and a half. Not to mention the edges of the hole catch and grab at your fingers - fun!That brings me to my next point - you cannot put small treats or puppy kibble in here as they will fall out immediately. Only big fat treats will provide the dog a challenge, but fortunately the makers of this product make such treats and are more than willing to sell them to you. Which is fine, I guess, and I went ahead and bought some, but I prefer to fill my treat toys with at least some regular kibble so that the puppy doesn't just gorge himself on a bunch of rich treats all at once. Since this ball won't allow me to do this, it's now an occasional toy, not a reliable daily toy.Bottom line: I feel that this toy is difficult to fill, and can only be used for "treat gorging" and not for regular dinner time. If your fingers are less delicate than mine and you just want a treat ball, you may like this - my dog certainly likes the chewy rubber and he hasn't destroyed it yet (although he's not much of a chewer). However, if you want an easy to fill ball that can hold kibble and enliven dinner time, I recommend theOmega Paw Tricky Treat Ball.~ Ana Mardoll
We use these balls every day.We stuff the insides with small "Charlie Bear" treats.Both of our girls LOVE them.

My dogs are a little plump and easily bored. I place their food (1 cup) into the ball and give it to them twice a day. It takes them a good amount of time to figure out the best strategy to get the food out. Each of my dogs has a different method.It does not fit large kibble very easily. And, if you trim the little nubs to get the kibble in it will make it easier for kibble to fall out. It takes me forever to fill the thing every time but it is worth it to watch them troubleshoot their breakfast.

This is a fantastic toy and a favorite in our house, both with our pup and with the humans.I ordered the small as an alternative to a tennis ball (which my puppy likes to rip the covering off of and eat--bad for his tummy!).  I am so glad I did, cause it is a FANTATIC ball.Pup loves it cause he can chew it easily, it collapses in his jaws but immediately springs back to shape.  Outside we play fetch with it and I can bounce it just like a tennis ball to get him excited about it.  Plus it has a fun and unpredictable bounce--to keep him guessing. Since it is rubber-like, there is no lingering slobber and a quick rinse makes in indoor ready in seconds!  Quite unlike those tennis balls that are banished forever to the back yard.Inside, I fill it with large sized kibble and some broken up jerky treats, and let him have at it without fear of hurting my hardwood floors cause it is super soft (unlike many treat balls).  He can even use it as a chew toy when he settles on his bed in the living room, after weeks it still looks brand new--SUPER durable.Downside: it can be difficult to fill since the holes on both sides are identical and directly matched up (better design would have been to have the wholes offset from one another).However, for how versatile it is, I am happy to work around filling issues and will be ordering the medium/large size (which is new) as well as the Large.  We are HUGE fans of this toy both filled with treats and unfilled.
summary: GREAT ball and treat dispenser: Indoor and Outdoor--DURABLE

reviewText: My dog Phoebe, part Beagle and Hound can put bristles on a Nyla Bone in 3 days. She has had this for over 6 months and it is still in one piece. Loves to play with it w/o treats. My local Pet Smart stopped carrying this,glad I found it here.

When I read about this toy, looked at pictures, and read the negative reviews from people whose dogs have chewed it up, I got the impression that it's a flimsy thin rubber ball.  It can be hard to tell online, and I couldn't find one in any local stores to look at in person.  I eventually decided to just try the large size out anyway to see for myself.When it arrived, I was surprised to find that the rubber is actually thick and feels very durable.  I've mainly used it for treats so far to keep my puppy interested in playing with it.  At first, he tried laying down and chewing on it, but then he figured out that rolling it around and throwing it made the treats fall out, so he hasn't chewed on it much.I've had it almost 3 months now and it's undamaged.  So far, my puppy isn't a huge toy destroyer... he's only ruined softer toys and ones with horrible quality (Hartz "tuff stuff" I'm looking at you)... so it could just be a matter of time before he lays into it.  But for now, so far, so good.  It's held up well and he enjoys tossing it back and forth across the room.
summary: More durable than it appears!  (see updates in comments)

reviewText: After recently buying the "everlasting treat ball" from the same company and my 45 lb mixed dog tore it apart in 20 minutes, I was a bit disappointed. After contacting the company, they send me a replacement for my treat ball with this, the everlasting fun ball in large size. My dog LOVES this thing, and even though the plastic seems a lot thinner than a kong, she hasn't even made a dent in it yet, and she has had it for over a week and plays with it constantly! Seriously, this thing is great for heavy chewers and active dogs.We love to fill it with kibble (and bits of "Beggin Strips"), as the same thing with the treat ball, the dog rolls and plays with the ball until the treats come out. It just seems better designed than the treat ball, at least for dogs that want to actually eat the ball as opposed to just the treats, like my dog.*update* It has now been 3 months, and she still plays with it every day (as long as we keep it stocked with kibble) and there still isn't even any wear on this thing! Seriously this is a great toy!!*Another update* 6 months later, and this thing still doesn't even look like it has a mark on it, and she literally plays with it every day! Simply amazing... this toy has outlasted her beloved Kong! Awesome job guys!
summary: Large size great for heavy chewers!!!

reviewText: I have a 1 year old Border Collie Lab mix, who has endless energy and is too smart for her own good.  She will fetch a ball for as long as you are willing to throw it, but with tennis balls, loves to chew them as she is returning with the ball.  She can destroy a tennis ball in about an hour of playing fetch.  We try to keep her busy but there are days when the weather makes it hard to get out so I went looking for some interactive toys to keep her busy on those occasions.  I am so glad I found this!  It is made from silicone and is a little thicker than it looks in the picture.  She can (and has) chewed on it for hours and so far there isn't even a tooth mark in it.  She actually loves the ball in and of itself and will go and get it to bring to her bed to sit and gnaw on.  It looks like it gives her teeth and jaws a good workout and that feels satisfying to her.  But whenever she needs just a little something more, I get a treat and put it in the ball for her.  The opening is fairly large and flexible so kibble won't work too well - it would fall out too easily.  Instead I use treat sticks, jerky, and strips of dried chicken or duck - things that I can wedge in against the sides so she has to work at it for awhile to get them out.I can't imagine this is truly "everlasting" and at some point it will wear out but for the money, it is absolutely worth it, versus paying 50c for a tennis ball that is nothing but a strip of cloth in under an hour.
summary: Awesomely indestrible ball for a dog that loves to chew

reviewText: We got this toy a week ago and it is already the favorite, we'll have to order another so both dogs can have one.I have two small 15lb dogs, but both are extremely food-driven and will destroy a toy to get to the food if its not tough enough--ie the cap and rope on the tug-a-jug. I was watching one of the dogs really trying to chew/pull the little inner nubs (around the star-shaped opening) and was worried he'd destroyed them, but upon inspection, everything was totally intact.I think I already prefer this toy over the tug-a-jug, kong, discs, footballs--aka everything else we have tried. Its quieter than the tug-a-jug, more difficult to remove food from than the others, and I like that it can be played with/thrown as well and the food doesnt fly in all directions. So far this thing has held up great and the dogs have had loads of fun with it.I put my Chi-mix's dinner in it the other night while I trained with the other dog and it kept him totally occupied for 10-15 minutes which was perfect. I also put Charlie Bears in it as well and as they are bigger than the kibble, took longer for them to remove which was just fine too.Very highly recommended!

My dogs loves this thing. I'll stuff a few bits of chicken in here for him or her, and they'll be occupied with it for a good while. This is my second one now, only fitting that both dogs now have their own. They both enjoy these treat dispensing balls! Even when they don't have treats inside them, these balls are great for playing fetch, and they bounce well.
The makers claim it is nearly indestructible.  My dog had chewed it and swallowed it in mere seconds.  Don't waste your money.

My dogs love them and these are my second best treat balls.Had purchased almost every brand of treat balls and these are the only other ones that are surviving.I have two medium-sized chewers, and to survive them is a big deal.So far, they have destroyed almost every other brand except for this.The other two brands which survived were the Rogz Grinz ball, and the ones by Kong...Mini carrots fit into this perfectly, entertaining the dogs for a while, trying to get it out...The balls are showing signs of tear after a month... but it is still in one piece.

this ball is great!  put in treats and dog works to get it out!  my puppy is a havanese, 8lb.  Size wise it was perfect as she works w the ball.  she's not a major chewer, so i really couldnt tell you the durability.

We have so many of those, and unfortunately most of them are so noisy I can't stand them (Kong Wobbler/Buster Food Cube).  This one is a soft rubber, and has little nubs you can cut off with scissors if you want to make the hole larger for the treats to come out.  Also, being a chewable material, it still has some amount of entertainment value even after it is empty.
summary: Really Nice, Quiet Treat Ball - And it works!

reviewText: If your dog is a strong chewer, this is not for you.  Our 10 month old lab mix made quick work of this.  The first night she was able to chew a large chunk out of it.
Easy to wash and can be used as fetch toy! The material is soft and can be used as a chew toy! Simply loved!

I have a dachsund who has decided that anything soft and fuzzy must die.  Of course he decided this right after I bought about $50 worth of dog toys on clearance and made my carpet look like a puffy cloud.I had been looking for something I could play catch with and stuff treats in...this works perfectly!  It's about the size of a tennis ball and I can toss it fairly far, he runs after it and then takes him a few minutes to get the treat out, then repeat.  I cut up hot dogs or use pieces of pepperoni and they work very well.  I've had this for a couple years and the only evidence that he's been using it is one of the prongs has broken off and there's a tiny, but not growing, crack in it...still works excellent.  He gnaws on it, chews it, bites it, etc.For those who complain about the difficulty of putting treats in: it's soft rubber, not razor blades.  I can put uncooked hot dogs pieces in and there is no damage to the hot dog.  If you're using small kibble?  Eh, probably better choices since it will fall out, but for larger treats (think the size of a penny if it were a sphere - if that makes sense), excellent!
summary: Best toy I have...er, my dogs have

reviewText: Finding a toy that would withstand my Labrabulls monster chewing was an expensive trial and error. I guarantee you this will last. She loves this ball so I have bought a couple for the house and the yard. She chews on this and it shows no wear at all. I am still in awe. I have never used the treats to shove inside though im sure its a neat idea to keep em busy. My Labrabull is 93  pounds and chewed a real Firehose toy up in less than 5 minutes. GET THIS IS YOU HAVE A HEAVY CHEWER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
It's not a favorite, but it's a good size for a large dog, and it states it's VERY durable. I believe it may be. Shows no wear so far, just don't know why it's not a favorite?

I think it really all varies on the individual dog, but mine loves this ball.It's been difficult for me to find the perfect treat dispensing toy that dispenses the right amount at the right time. Most have been too easy or too hard for my pup-girl. Although she's becoming quicker at getting the treat out of this one so I might have to find larger treats or another dispenser...I wonder how come they don't make this ball in a small size? Or if anyone knows where I can find one, please let me know? My dog is small so a smaller size would work much better for her to carry around.
Hmm not sure if it's the treats I am using, but my dogs get very bored with this quickly!! Thinking it is a waste of $$$

My dog LOVES this ball.  In fact, it is one of her favorite toys.  She pushes it around the house for hours per day, picks it up and carries it to her bed, and even likes to sleep next to it.  It is definitely a favorite.Because it is made of a soft rubber/plastic, this toy doesn't damage furniture or walls when my dog slams it around, and it is also easy for her to pick up and move around.  Again, it is a favorite.But...The two identical X-shaped holes for filling have little "nubs" in them to help keep treats/kibble from falling out too quickly.  That's great in theory, but not in practice.  The holes are so "well-designed" that they don't allow most treats/kibble to come out AT ALL.  This is frustrating to my dog, as I am sure it will be to most dogs.  Therefore, I made a modification to the ball... I clipped two of the "nubs" out of one side of the ball, so the kibble/treats come out much more easily on one side.  I didn't want to do this to both sides because I didn't want the toy to dump things TOO easily.  One side was enough!The ball is a little larger than a softball, which means it is a great size for big dogs.  I'm sure small dogs can enjoy this, as well, but they might not be able to carry the ball.
summary: Great ball that my dog loves, but needs one small modification

reviewText: My mastiff-x loves to pick this thing up and bounce it around outside (she'd WRECK the house if we gave it to her indoors!).  The treat dispensing part is a little iffy - small treats sort of dump out, and larger ones get stuck, which frustrates her.  I hesitate to cut the holes larger because most of the treats I have are pretty small.  My dog isn't the brightest bulb in the pack, so it may be that she just hasn't figured out how to bite down on it so that it changes the dimensions of the holes and allows the larger treats to fall out, but at least she's entertained for a while!  The look on her face while she's playing with it is the reason for the 5 stars!
summary: Fun bouncy ball that is persnickety about treat size.

reviewText: I have two kong toys and another treat-dispensing ball, but so far, my 3-month-old Mini Schnauzer-Shih Tzu mix likes this one the best.  I think it may be because this one is not hard like the others...it's pliable so she can also chew on it and work the treats out.  It keeps her busy for quite a while.  I'd highly recommend it.  I don't think she will be able to tear it up, but she's a tiny dog.  I don't know if a bigger breed could chew it up or not.  But so far, so good for us.  I'm glad I bought it for her.Update:  I have to edit this review because I can't find treats that will fit this toy.  They are either too small for my tiny puppy and are too easy to get out or they are too big for her to get and she tires of it.  She now prefers the one that rolls...the IQ Treat Ball...she has more fun with it and doesn't get discouraged.
summary: My puppy likes this treat ball the best.

reviewText: Bought for my lab/pit mix when I saw it realized it would not hold up like the Blue treat toy does,  So I sent it back.  Could be good for a dog who is not not a heavy chewer.
summary: ... I saw it realized it would not hold up like the Blue treat toy does

reviewText: Bought for my Bull terrierPretty durable, great bounce to it. Hard to get treats in and out of it - better used for kibble.

Though pricey, I thought this ball was worth a try. I was also a bit hesitant as the material does not seem very durable. It is easy to fill with small kibble and treats, especially Zuke's Minis, and my dog immediately took to trying to get treats out. Unfortunately, she is a very, very strong chewer with sharp teeth (has gotten through red Kongs) and I noticed that after ten minutes, the ball was starting to have cracks in it.I am still waiting for her to rip/puncture it, but hopefully it lasts. I really, really like the idea of the toy, but again, would want something more durable.Important to note: the sizing of the toy is not very accurate. My dog is 20lbs, and the MEDIUM ball is perfect for her. The MEDIUM is just a bit larger than a standard tennis ball.

one of there favorite and most challenging toys to datethey love the soft chew of the ball - which they cannot destroy :)put treats inside the ball and leave them to itsafe to leave with them unattendedthey spend ages trying to get the treats out - its a real challengeFANTASTIC TOY

My dog seemed to sense it was hers from the moment the package opened. At first I made the mistake of putting treats that were a little too big in it, but then took them out after about 5 minutes and broke them up to be small enough to get out, but large enough to make her work for them. My dog is a ball fanatic anyways, but this kept her busy for 1.5 hrs. She rolled it, picked it up and dropped it and tried to break them up inside the ball. A great treat for any dog!
summary: Hours of fun for my wheaten!

reviewText: I have a collie / GSD / lab mix whose energy and intelligence can sometimes drive me batty, especially in the evenings when we're sitting at home (this is even after me walking 5 miles with him running off-leash the whole way).I got this ball a year ago, but didn't use it all that often because he didn't seem too into it and small treats fell out of it quickly.This year, I pulled it out again out of desperation after I'd baked some liver biscotti treats he really, really liked.  I broke the treats into small pieces that fell out of the holes easily, which motivated him to keep trying for the other larger pieces that eventually disintegrate due to drool.One liver biscotti (size of a regular biscotti), cracked and put into this ball, can keep him occupied for an hour or two, easily.I was trying to find a way to keep him occupied for longer and cheaper than his all time favorites, bully sticks (which even online are getting mighty expensive lately).Amazingly, when given a choice now between the "biscotti ball" or the bully stick, he'll choose the ball.By the way, this dog can chew, and the ball hasn't broken for me yet.  His jaws are so strong that he cracked deer antlers and pig hooves in a few bites, and even made short work of those everlasting Himalayan dog chews.  Yet the ball soldiers on.If you get this toy for your dog, I highly suggest starting with very tasty, easy to remove treats.  Then move on to larger pieces, but always keep a few small pieces in there for quick rewards.  Treats that disintegrate with drool are best for the large pieces so that eventually their work pays off.  Small treat pieces could include things like little chunks of hot dogs or carrots.Don't cut off too much of the treat dispensing prongs, because you can't put them back (but you can switch to larger treat pieces :0).
summary: Great way to keep smart dogs entertained

reviewText: My yellow lab loves this treat dispensing ball. We have had the hard plastic ball that you unscrew to add the treats/food, but it was, well, hard plastic and was heavier. This one bounces nicely on our hard wood floors and not all the treats come out at one time. For our family it is superior because it is a rough and tumble rubber. He is a heavy chewer and after having it for over 2 weeks you can't even see bite marks. We fill it with dog food...

My dog absolutely LOVES this toy!  I break Zuke's Super Beta treats in half and stick them in there so they're hard to get out (they're Z-shaped and break into two rectangles). Sliced low-fat mozzarella string cheese is also a great dispensed treat option.  The ball bounces for added doggy fun, it washes easily with soap and water and smells good, too.  A big thumbs up!  I will definitely buy it again if it ever wears out.  Also, Amazon seems to have the best price; I paid $13 in a boutique pet shop.

I saw this recommended on another site, and decided to splurge a little (I usually try to keep our dog toys to under $5). This was 100% worth it. Our 6 month old puppy has been playing with this for months. It's been through both puppy & adult teeth, and still looks like new. Since it's a ball -- and has some bounce to it -- it keeps her entertained as a fetch toy. And she also enjoys playing with it by herself trying to get the treats out.Would recommend to any dog owner.

So we first tried stuffing treats in this ball, Snausages and Milkbone pieces, but our dog couldn't get the treats out.  We even had to use chopsticks to try to get the treats out!  So.... we resorted to putting his dog food (Kirkland Signature and Nature's Domain) in it, and ha, that works so much better!  He shakes and drops the ball to get the food out and it keeps him occupied for a good amount of time.  It is just big/small enough to fit in his mouth (50-lb lab), but I think because he knows that he doesn't have to chew the ball to get the food out, so he doesn't chew it.  So durability-wise, it's withstood 9 months of play, but if your dog actually chews on it, that could be a different story.
summary: Dog Loves It, Great for Dispensing Dog Food

reviewText: I can honestly say that I've used this toy just about every day since purchasing it.  In the past, I'd give my young lab part of his breakfast in a "game" to keep him occupied while I got the kids off to school, usually using some clean recylclable container (eg, plastic water bottle).  The upside to that was that I didn't have to clean it when the dog was done.  The downside was that it was really noisy.  This everlasting fun ball keeps him busy and is QUIET!  It holds about 1/2 cup of IAMS kibble for large breed dogs, and cleans up beautifully w/ an easy rinse of water.  I've also used this toy to give my dog his meals when he was recovering from surgery and had to keep relatively quiet.  I know it's a ball, but he didn't end up batting it around like he did the water bottle.  He would lay down and hold it between his paws to work the kibble out w/ his mouth.  Amazingly, he has not ripped any part of the ball w/ his teeth yet, and we've had it for about 10-12 weeks.  I'm buying one for my sister's new puppy :)

My pup is a sweet dog. A mutt. A rescue. An aggressive eater. Compared to my past rescues, she's very food oriented and not too interested in anything else. This works in her favor with this treat ball. She'll drive me crazy bouncing around looking for food. So I clipped one tag on each end of the ball and filled it with treats or food. She rolls it around and loves finding food on the floor. She lived her first 5 years with another dog who was the alpha so she never got to play with toys unless the other dog allowed her to. Now that she's a single dog, she has discovered the joys of this treat ball. Right now, as I type, she is sniffing and figuring out the possibilities that this ball possesses. It's been 15 minutes and she is totally engrossed in the ball and is trying to strategize her way to more treats. I think I might use this ball to feed her kibble. Let's see how much it withstands her chewing on it.
summary: Good even for the most confused dog

reviewText: Got one of these for my pitbull when he was a puppy, he's almost 2 now and it's still going strong! Got a 2nd for my new pit puppy and she loves it too! It bounces a little and you can pretty easily put kibble inside of it. Their kibble is kind of disc shaped, so I have to put it in there kinda slowly by hand, but the Large ball will hold about a cup and keep my dogs busy. Happy mom here!

We have a lab who is a champion chewer so it's tricky to find toys that don't wind-up in 5 million little spit wads and then as psychedelic poop within minutes of opening the package, but this toy rocks!!!! First, it's an awesome ball for playing catch and because it's a soft, but SUPER durable rubber, if it hits anything, it won't break or ding it. We went through so many tennis balls, and our dog would skin them like an animal before proceeding to tear it up, but she loves playing ball, so this fit the bill perfectly. Second, you can tuck treats into it and keep your dog engaged for quite some time. Third, it lasts!! We had one for nearly three years (got lost on a backpacking trip) and it stood up to the most rough-house play imaginable.

We have two of these - one for each dog. Both of them really love the toy. If your dog is a chewer/ripper, make sure to supervise and always have food or one of the brand's treats in it. Our puppy has destroyed a ball after eating all the food from it. We stuff it completely full so it's more difficult to get the kibble out and it keeps him entertained for at least 30 minutes. We also have a similar item shaped like a fire hydrant that both dogs love.

My pup's trainer recommended this toy as well as the Everlasting Treat Ball.  I have used another type of treat ball to feed my puppy from, but he soon got bored with it.  This one is different though and he loves it.  My pup is a very destructive chewer and usually manages to tear off hunks of plastic from toys, but not this one!  He loves this toy.  The ONLY downside I found to this toy is the cookie inserts specifically made for it, which didn't last as long or as well as the ones made for the Everlasting Treat Ball.  I fill this toy with his kibble and he happily rolls it all over the house getting to its contents.  When it's empty of his food, he will bring the ball to me to fill with a treat or play catch with.  He loves the squishy texture of this toy and it is easy for him to pick up and carry around in his mouth.  Even after a month of chewing on it, it still looks new and he hasn't managed to tear off any part of it.

Pup approved, our pooch loves these tasty treat balls. She gets a mix of cookies and food in this one and it lasts about 3 hours of entertainment, but it was perfect for her. Very happy, would recommend, will buy again.

This is his favorite ball! It gives treats AND bounces. I use the beef stick dog treats, and cut them up in it. This toy is literally his bff. Right now he is 13 weeks old and a little over 20 lbs and has had the ball about 2 weeks and it show NO SIGN of wear. I think it will last.

My dog got this for Christmas and absolutely loves it - it bounces, it rolls and it will dispense treats with a little work from his jaws. I have been missing the talk to me treat balls that were made a few years ago as my last dog loved him but this one is even better. Easy of the walls and requires a little more work to get those treats. Toby generally destroys toys in minutes or hours but no damage at all to this so far! Keeps his occupied and active for at least 30-45 minutes with only 10 or so treats. Old Mother Hubbard bitz treats are working best so far. I had some star treats that were too small and just fell through the opening - though they worked great to show the poodle how to get her ball to work!
Great entertainment for the 16mos old puppies.  Our female is tenacious though and she managed to get the end of it chewed off after getting to the treat inside.  Still entertaining for them.

I use the ball without the everlasting treats- my dog is able to pop the treats right out which defeats the purpose. BUT this ball is amazing alone. He loves to play catch with it and chew on it. He is 210# and loves to chew and this ball is still with us after several months. I have also filled up the hole with dog food kibbles or other treats that can fall out as he's playing. Great toy.

Since Amazon was showing to buy the everlasting treats with the fun ball on the same page, I thought they went together. Read page carefully. There is no way to get these things in the ball! However, if you have the right kind of small treat you can put in there that won't get soggy or be too frustrating for them to try and get at, this can be a a satisfying chew toy for them. The rubber does hold up very well.

My dogs love this toy so much I bought one for each of them.  The ball is great for a dog who likes the rolling treat dispensers or a dog who likes chewing treat dispensers.  If you fill the ball with larger things (chicken jerky, sweet potato bits) it will take the dogs hours to get treats out and they don't fall easily out the other side.  We can only give these balls with treats for an hour or two at a time - once we left them on the ground overnight and our corgi played with it ALL NIGHT without sleeping.  Our GSD, on the other hand, likes to bring it to bed and cuddle with it.  This is a serious money saver when we otherwise might be giving them expensive dog chews to keep them occupied.
summary: A very tough and time consuming toy!

reviewText: Have had now for about 2 months and it's still intact and the dog still loves it.  Only will take small pieces of treats .

This is a great doy toy. It's soft and doesn't make any noise when my miniature dachshund chases it around. It has a pleasant smell and the outside is a bit textured so she can easily roll it with her paws as well as her nose. Both ends have holes for the kibble to come out of and the best part is you can trim the holes to better fit the kibble size. I do recommend trimming just one end at a time and just a little at a time until you get the result that works best for your dog.
summary: This is a great doy toy

reviewText: My dog tore this to pieces within an hour

It's difficult to rate dog toys because every dog is different. My puppy doesn't really like this, no matter what treat I put in it. She may like it when she gets older and is more into balls. She's a three-month-old golden retriever who finds it very easy to get the treats out, almost too easy. I don't want to rate this too low because I am sure it's perfect for some dogs, and I like the idea of the toy.
summary: My puppy doesn't care for it, but some may love it

reviewText: We have one dog who will not play with any other toy. This is his absolute favorite toy and I've paid as much as $18 in a pet store for it! It does break after awhile, but he's a big dog and likes to chew on it sometimes too, so it's worth it. We don't use it to dispense treats though. Those treat holes are great for flinging it though!
My dogs chewed this into pieces within 10 minutes of playing with it.  Not EVERLASTING, not worth the money.

This item was a gift, that I wasn't sure how to use at first. We used the StarMark Bob-a-lot, so I'm use to food dispensing tosy, this just didn't look like dispenser. Once deciding to put food in I realized kibble wasn't going to work as distraction, it was just too short lived. I buy those rawhid sticks that are all broken up and 'glued' back together. I'm sure it's some sugary adhesive that's edible. But hopefully you know what I'm talking about. I think the petco brand are called Rawhide Munchie Stixs. They're easy to bring and they are long and skinny so they are easy to get in the ball without shoving my finder in the hole and it getting 'grabbed' because the ball is round, they generally don't line up with the holes in the ball making them much more difficult to get out. I will break 5-10 of these up into 3rds and fill a decent portion of the ball. if it's too challenging add a bit of kibble. with the differing shapes the food doesn't dispense as quickly. There are some easy lower value (kibble) scores and some more difficult/less frequent higher value (rawhide) scores.I didn't give this five stars since I had to figure out how to use this toy. I wish this toy  company did what Kong does. they provide several treats that can fit the toy AND other receipes/products to use in a Kong at home. I make a mini omlette-filled kong all the time. My dog loves it, much better than the peanut butter filled kong.
summary: Great for a food distraction toy

reviewText: My dog absolutely loves this treat/kibble dispenser.  She even likes to play with it without the treats inside.  It is very bouncy when there are no treats.  I don't use this every day, because she doesn't eat breakfast until after I leave for work.  Sometimes she gets the ball stuck in corners or under things and doesn't like to try to get it, so I like to be there to help out.  She also gets either raw food or cooked meat and veggies for dinner, so I basically use this as a fun time toy on the weekends.  The brand of kibble I use (Nature's Variety) is small, so it is easy to fill and does come out somewhat easy, but it still takes her time to get it all out.  She is 30 pounds and I did buy the large size.  She likes teeny tiny toys or big toys.  This one she likes to carry by putting her teeth inside the hole (without kibble in it).I am going to purchase one of these for my mom's dog.  She has trouble getting him to eat a lot of the time.  When he comes to my house and "Jelly Ball" comes out, he gets excited.  However, my dog won't let him do the rolling.  He has to stay behind and try to snag any kibble she overlooks.  He's only 13 pounds, but I will probably also get him the large size.I'm very happy with this ball.  I have had it for well over 2 years, and you can't even see any marks on it.  I would definitely recommend this.

At first my dog was excited and tried very hard to get the treats out.  It was way too hard for him.  Then I cut some of the dohickeys out on one end, but by then he had decided it wasn't work the effort.  I've tried a couple more times, but so far he much prefers his furry beehive and his furry squirrel food toy.
I have a lab mix and she chews through everything! So far this toy has lasted the longest really great toy.

I have two weimaraners, both who love to chew (the male especially). This is one of the few toys that they can have and not destroy. We usually stuff carrots, celery or snausages in it and hide it when we leave. This occupies the dogs and helps reduce separation anxiety. As with any toy that gets a tremendous amount of chewing, over time the ball may crack and become less durable (which is to be expected). However, we can expect anywhere from 4-12 months of heavy usage from each ball. We currently have 3.We highly recommend this and the Nylabone Rhino (as well as the black and red kongs).
summary: Perfect for a Heavy Chewing Weimaraner!

reviewText: I have two huskies who inhale their food.  I use this chew ball for the younger and super hyper husky's evening meal.  I love it because it challenges him.  He, on the other hand, dislikes it... maybe even hates it now.  I had to snip a piece of the rubber on one side so the kibble would dispense, otherwise, it was nearly impossible to get anything out.  Having said that, the ball will only dispense on that one side and only if the kibble was properly aligned during the roll.  At first, he took to the challenge and would roll the ball around.  It would take about 20 mins for him to retrieve 1/4 cup of kibbles.  His brother gets the Kong wobbler which dispenses more easily.  After a few uses, the 'teenage' husky with a 2 second attention span, protests from using it all unless I roll it around and manually dispense the food for him.  Even with high value treats, he won't touch it.  He just lies there moping while watching his brother work the wobbler in envy.  It's the battle of wills.  He can do it, but he spends more time and energy on self pity.When not in use, I put it away.  Although my aggressive chewing huskies have not shown any interest in destroying it, I don't trust leaving it around unsupervised.

I have two German Shorthair Pointers who can be very destructive with their toys... this one they absolutely love even without putting any treats in it.  Eventually, they were able to tear it apart so it is not indestructible... i.e. not "Everlasting"... but it did last several months.

My German Shepherd puppy (9 months old) is still teething and is an aggressive chewer.  This toy was recommended to me by the owner of the local pet store.  At first, I had my doubts but ended up buying it for Schatzi's Shadow.  That was two months ago and she's still chewing and loving it.  I filled both sides with the liver treat and she can pick up the ball and it bounces and rolls, so she can chase it, catch it and have a good chew.  Not even the non-food part is ripped or torn.  I'd definitely recommend this to parents of teething puppies!
summary: Perfect for my 9-month old GSD puppy

reviewText: I love this ball! I fill it with my dogs food and his treats and he goes to town, i had a plastic one before this but he would try to chew the hard plastic. This one is very sturdy and the rubber is perfect for his chewing needs.

This is a great item.  As others have said, it gives hours of fun play as your dog tries to retrieve the treats from inside the ball-or just use it to play ball-it has a great bounce to it.  It's also extremely difficult to destroy no matter how  much of a chewer you have!  The medium size is the same as a tennis ball, so I can't imagine it not being OK for any size dog - even the big ones such as I have.
summary: Medium size is perfect for golden retriever

reviewText: This is a rubbery soft plastic but still hard enough none of our three 100 pound dogs have chewed it up while getting treats out of it.I push all kinds of stuff in there which gives them a treat and something different. One of the reviews had me worried that they would get their tongue pinched in the hole but it is soft so I am not worried about that.  I stuck my finger in it with no trouble. We had one dogs get his tongue stuck in a crack that developed in a REAL bone so I am more careful that ever with things they will be chewing.This is WAY too big to swallow but not so big they won't enjoy it.
summary: I love it, dogs love it, very sturdy

reviewText: I feel like I've purchased a small pet boutique's worth of treat/kibble dispensing toys for my dogs to play with to give them some stimulation. (If you read all my reviews, you'll see a bunch of them, but I have a bunch more.)  This toy is by far the easiest one to get the treats out of unless you invest in some seriously large treats. Even my dog that usually struggles to figure out how to dispense the treats can empty this ball quickly.  In truth, that's usually why I put it in circulation. Sometimes I feel bad that he can't figure out the other toys. Although this ball seems relatively sturdy, a tough chewer could probably still chew it open if s/he wanted to. I don't think that would happen just to get the treats out though, as they'll dispense easily enough on their own. If you're looking for a more challenging toy of this genre, I'd go with the blue Everlasting Treat Toy over this green Everlasting Fun Ball.  Due to the flat sides of the blue treat toy, it usually ends up stuck under my couch less frequently than this ball, too, which tends to roll into numerous complicated spots for the dogs to retrieve on their own. If you're looking for a ball to dispense dry kibble, this one won't work, as the holes are far too large. For that purpose, I'd suggest the larger, orange Tricky Treat Ball by another manufacturer. In short, this is a fun, but easy toy for dispensing treats. To make it stay fuller longer and amuse your dog for a greater period of time, you'll need to stuff it with larger treats than average, even larger than the ones StarMark sells for this ball, in my opinion.

I got this for my GSD and pit bull. Both destroy tennis balls fast. This ball is awesome it's been 6 months it still looks new. I love how the treats move around in the ball and fall out. I shove a whole small milk bone treat in there. My pup chews on it till the treat breaks up and falls out then she eats the treats. It keeps her happy for a long time. I love this ball for at night when my pup wants to play but I am busy or tired. This ball is awesome.I think this is a pct ball no problems at all but the price is a little high.  Only problem now is my dog took it outside and we got snow so I don't know where it is at the moment. If I can't find it I am getting another it's worth the price for me.

Holds up well and is a good treat dispenser. Had a hard time finding the interlocking treats to put on it until I discovered them here on Amazon. My dogs love them. It is a nice treat and something to keep them occupied if they have to be crated.
Thought this would keep my Border Collie busy. She quickly lost interest in it. Would have loved for it to have worked, great concept, just not for my dog.
Filling this thing with treats, that wouldn't fall right back out was a challenge.My dogs simply wasn't interested. good luck!

I got the medium size one for my beagle mix and she loves it. When I first started using it, I would put in soft treats and she would lick it out of the ball and was great because it would take her about 5-10 mins to go through it but then she figured out that by chewing the ball, the treats would break into pieces and will fall out so now it takes her seconds to get it all out. I do use this ball for peanut butter and I occasionally put soft treats in it. This ball is well made, she's chewed on it for almost a year now and it has not broken yet, I can see small tears around the holes but nothing serious.
summary: Great for soft treats and peanut butter

reviewText: The purpose of a treat ball is to keep your dog busy trying to get the treats out.  This ball failed miserably.1st the treats are so small that were recommend that they easily came out.2nd the ball is made out of a soft rubber which my dog decided to rip apart the first day.I have used other treat balls by kong which have much thicker rubber that lasts.  Sadly the Everlasting Fun Ball was a waste of money that lasted a day.  I will say my older dog was able to keep busy with her ball once we moved our puppy into the other room.

This has to be the best toy yet. I have a ADHD 10 month old 75 lbs puppy that get bored super easy . He LOVES this toy when I fill it up with stuff. I have used dog food, pieces of carrots and his favorite cheerios. This keeps him busy for hours and mommy can have some quite time alone. Thanks God for this great toy. When nothing is in it he still carries it around the house. LOVE THIS !!!

This cage is easy to put together. my rabbit is at home in it. I like the tray. I had to get some urine guards, but I expected that from a review I read before purchasing it. The only drawback for me is that my mini rex rabbit may grow out of it too soon, He is getting bigger than I expected him to grow.

I bought this for my 9 yr old daughter who we just gave a bunny for Christmas.  The cage is adorable and the size is nice, too, however the pan under the cage that is supposed to catch the pee and poop is not doing so!  Typically rabbits choose a corner and back up as far as they can to go to the bathroom.  Well, this pan does not reach the far corners so we now have pee puddles to clean up.  Not good!  I'm going to have to think of a way to block our bunny from being able to back up into the corner which stinks.  I'd also like to add that we have an additional bunny corner litter box in the cage with her, but she's still choosing the empty corners.  :(
summary: Love the look but doesn't function well.

reviewText: This was a really good price for an indoor cage.  It was a little smaller than I thought, but it was still good for my little holland lop.  It's a little cramped with his litter box, but when we bring him in, it's great.

I just got rid of my old bunny cage for this one and I love it! The tray makes it really easy to clean, there is plenty of room for my 7lb. rabbit, and it just snaps together with out any little pieces. Plus it is super cute! most rabbit houses are colorful and have plastic and just seem tacky. This is solid black metal (minus the tray) and looks so stylish.

I bought this to put my rabbits' litter box in so they have a "bathroom" and a hang out. My rabbits are house bunnies and they are not locked up, so I keep the door open and let them run in and out. It's great quality and has a nice little tray in it. It opens from the top and side, which makes it easier to put their hay in without making a huge mess. It fits 2 rabbits (mine are 6lbs each), but it would be too small to lock them in.
My bunny loves this cage! Very roomy inside and yet doesn't take up a lot of space! I can easily get her litter pan through the top opening. Very cute design as well.

We have a medium size rabbit and he likes the cage. We even have the litter box in one corner that he goes in all of the time. I took a bunch of carpet squares from work and cover about 3/4 of the bottom so it's soft on his feet. It also stops his hay from falling through
This item was exactly as described, super fast shipping and quality product. Perfect for our dwarf bunny, easy to clean feature with the slide out bottom.
the pan is great my lionhead bunny fits perfectly in it, i ended up using different litter and i think the scoop is useless because everything just falls through the holes.
My rabbit Haze seems to like it alot. He sleeps in it. he has never used it for a litter box like my intention was.

The litter that it comes with isn't very good but I like how it connects to the side of the cage. Also, the scooper that it comes with doesn't do its job very well. I would suggest this to anyone who doesn't mind the scooper not working and the litter not being very good.

I knew I definitely wanted this kit for everything it included for the price it was going for but I definitely didn't expect it to end up being as big as it was :P I have the SuperPet Medium My First Home  and the litter box takes about about 1/4 of the entire cage (an entire corner pretty much). With that being said, the scooper is also a tad on the big side, but the litter works well as far as being absorbent and...litter-like :PJust as a side note as well, I had bought a smaller version of a 'litter-box' (since my bunny is a baby and the included box seemed too big to use), put the litter in there  and my rabit urinated in there; but when I used the bigger litter box that comes with this package, I haven't sen any evidence that she's urinated in it :/ I've since run out of litter and plan to purchase more of the same kind tomorrow with hopes that she'll use it again, but I think overall, the usage by a bunny differs with each person's bunny :3 For the price, it's defintely worth a try I think ^^
this kit fit perfectly in our rabbit cage. It's so much easier that he jumps in their to do his thing. Clean up is a breeze!
Great for a puppy and loved by cats. So if you have both kinds of pets, I'd highly recommend this product.
summary: Great for a puppy and loved by cats

reviewText: My fiance brought these home with our new kitten and I thought "you gotta be kidding me." They didn't look fun at all. But the cat went nuts for them! She likes the little dangly things on the ends. My dog does too. He's a jerk and he snatches them away from her so he can gnaw on them. Between the two pets, we've had the same pair of these for six months and they're still hanging in there, even the fringy things on the ends. That's a miracle because my dog can't keep a stuffed toy for half a day without tearing out its guts.This is fun for kitty to fling around and chase around the house. I definitely recommend it.
summary: Surprisingly loved by cat and dog

reviewText: Not sure why they call this a dental chew as it didn't act as a teether or provide gum stimulation.  Cat wouldn't play with them either.
My cats LOVED these things for about,  3 hours. Then they never messed with them again. Should have just gave them the money to play with. The lil a holes LOVE friggin PAPER
My cat loves these dental chews.  It's been a month and she's still happily gnawing on them and batting them around.
It took quite a bit of persuading to get my cat to play with this chew toy. But once he got the idea, it was great.

I bought this because our cat has one just like it. The problem was my puppy kept stealing it from her room. So in order to be fair to the cat I thought buying another was the solution. I was wrong...the puppy now has 2 of them.

I bought this for my cat's teeth. IT works great. Although they are smaller than I thought they would be (they would be PERFECT for kittens), my cat still loves them. Chews them and brings it from area to area where he spends time chewing and playing with it. Definitely would recommend for people with kittens, cats too.
these are for cats and it wasn't really that clear when i bought them but our little dog just loves these things
My Cat LOVES these toys - and she is a picky cat!  They are easy for her to toss around and are her new "go to" toys.  Between these and her mint stick she has plenty to keep her active now!

My 3 cats will occasionally play with these, but not as often as they play with the hoard of little furry catnip toys they own.  I like the idea that these would help with dental health, but even when the cats play with these, they don't seem to chew on them.  They just throw the toys around and chase them-no chewing takes place.  I wouldn't buy again.

One of my cats loves these toys.  I've been buying them for him since he was a kitten.  Great for throwing and tossing around.  Easy for kitty to carry in his mouth and good for his teeth.  They are more durable than other toys but I do replace them every 6 months or so.  He also loves the Petstages chew mice made of similar material.
My cat won't have anything to do with these!  Nothing wrong with them, seem to be better made than some cat toys, he just has absolutely no interest in them.

I bought these dental health chews since one of my cats loves to bite plastic. I noticed his teeth weren't looking too great and wondered if that was the reason for his plastic biting. Needless to say he is not even remotely interested in these toys. Not even when they are covered with catnip. *shrug* Oh, well. No biggie.

Like any cat toy, these are small enough to get lost under furniture and such. But my kittens and cats love these! I have even washed them (in a lingerie bag so the washer doesn't eat them), and they seemed to wash up pretty well.

OK, if I'd read the description better I'd have figured this out. But I'd sorted the search for "dog toys", so I was disappointed when these came and were only 2 inches apiece. Choking hazard even for little dogs.
These look like a great idea and I wanted something to help clean my cat's teeth. The only problem is that he doesn't use them. They're sitting on my floor and I don't think he's ever picked one up.

My kitten loves this toy and plays with it constantly. However, I don't believe he chews on it as much as he should. Instead, he bats it around and flips it through the air. I think he likes that he can stick his paws through it. So, even though he doesn't chew on it all that much, I'm still happy with my purchase.
summary: Oh, they're supposed to chew it?

reviewText: My kittens will play with just about anything. I've tried over and over to interest them in these two toys but they cannot be coaxed into accepting them. I bought them as soon as I noticed them begin teething and now that they are 6 months old they still don't care for these toys. Maybe you will have better luck...

My puppies use this as a teething toy.  Especially good when teeth are coming out and are just too small for other types of toys.  Good for starting to train not to bite or chew on people feet and hands!
summary: Good for small puppies as well

reviewText: My cat especially loved these chew toys when she was a kitten.  I had to keep several around for her.  Now she plays with these, but she doesn't chew as much as she used to chew.  I love the Pet Stages designs.  They are very cool looking.

they are effective IF you can get your little princess interested in them. however i found an old piece of leather was more interesting for my own little one. but hey, a kitty can never have too little in the good toys dept. so i'd try them if i were looking for a dental chew toy anyway.
summary: they are fine if you can attract kitty to them

reviewText: Our 15 month old Snowshoe Siamese is constantly chewing on both, she has  a few teeth coming in.
Much cheaper than local stores, also my cats wanted to tear them off the card as soon as they arrived. They are a little small but I think my cats liked that. Looks like they would clean their teeth.
I've purchased several Petstages chew toys for my 2 indoor cats.  They love all of them and despite the boys being pretty rough with them, they are holding up great.

These solved the "What died in your mouth?" problem I was having with both cats. One loves them, and does chew them hard with her back teeth, and that is exactly what I wanted them for and her to do. She is younger, so it might depend on the cat, and the need to chew something so hard it makes horrible squidgey noises (that are good for her mouth)

I bought this little set at a local pet store chain. As other reviewers have commented, my kittens love the toys but not for chewing. They love to bat or carry them around. For some strange reason, neither of my kittens would play with the toy that has cloth fringe on 3 sides.  But when I snipped the fringe off two sides, my kittens immediately began playing with both toys equally.  Go figure...

I really don't know much about dental care for cats, but I got these in hope that they would be beneficial. I still don't know if they are BUT my cat looooves these, especially the orange loop one. She bats it around and bites it all the time. She likes them more than her catnip mice and playing balls. I recommend these as great toys. As for dental, I think it's too risky to rely on just these so I ended up getting her a toothbrush and brushing her teeth instead.
Nice toy!  The cats chew on them and play with them.  It isn't their favorite toy but overall it is a success.
I thought our cats would at least flip and play with these but they don't have any keen interest in these.

I always have to buy more of these! My cats love them so much they carry them up and down the stairs they also like to lose them somehow... So I am a pro at purchasing these and the mint stick ones. My cats are 3 yrs old.

My little kitty loves to show his affection with those little kitty love bites - but sometimes he doesn't realize how hard he bites me. So I use these when we are cuddling to keep his love bites under control. Package says the mesh won't fray. I've used them for 4 weeks and so far this is a true statement.

If i throw these she'll chase them, but once she reaches the toy she seems disappointed and not that interested. This contrasts with the "Pet Stages Cat Nip Chew Mice" which are by far the winner at around the same price, which get carried around and batted around, and are a better use of your dollar for a similar toy.
summary: There are better Pet Stages toys

reviewText: I have three cats and it seems one cat is always batting or carrying one of these around. They are a real hit with my siamese that likes to chew and destroy most cat toys. These are sad looking after heavy use, but they have held up much better than other toys. Since I discovered how well these lasted through the chewing, I almost only buy Petstages brand of toy. Most others are just made badly or of poor materials that fall apart in one day. The Cat Dancer is the only other must have in our house. We keep a stash of Petstages and Cat Dancers any time we need a replacement or something new for treatment of boredom!
summary: Great for cats that like to chew!

reviewText: I bought these for my teething kitten, but he never was all that interested in it. The chews are well made though, and other cats may like it. My cat is just a little fickle.
They love them run all over the place playing with them the chew on ThemHappy kitties in the house

My cat LOVES this toy. I tie it to a string and he goes crazy. I definitely bought it in hopes of helping clean his teeth but like other reviewers, this really doesn't do anything for his teeth. He occasionally chews it but I don't really see chewing a soft toy doing anything for his dental health. Still a fun toy to get your cat some exercise so can't complain about that.
summary: One of my cat's favorite toys, but not a dental chew

reviewText: these were supposedly the ultimate chew toy for cats. given that my 2month old kitten keeps on trying to bite me, and keeps chewing on EVERYTHING, i thought i'd give this a try. he was ZERO interested. turns out there is catnip in this, and kittens under 3 months cannot smell catnip yet. i do not know if he will eventually like it, but i will update if that is the case. right now, tho, he still tries to bite my fingers off.
I bought these because our 2 kittens are teething and I thought they would be a great chew toy for them.  Unfortunately, neither of our kittens has had any interest in them.

Yes, these toy have been on my pillow more than once, though mostly they reside in my cat's bed with his most favorite toys.  Reese loves to carry these dental toys around in his mouth and fetch them.What's great about the toys is the super-tough fabric.  I don't have to worry about Reese ripping the toy apart and choking on some bits.  They're tough enough to take him clawing, chewing and dragging and well, me pitching them off the bed, too.Rebecca Kyle, September 2009
summary: You know it's a favorite when it ends up on your pillow at 3:00 AM

reviewText: My cat didn't really care for this he batted them around a bit but would leave them in a corner and never touched again
Not sure of it's effect on my cats dental health but they did play with it and it did make me feel good about seeing them chew on it!
My cats love PetStages toys. This is one cat's very favorite toy in the whole wide world! This dental chew toy is durable, safe, fun, & healthy.
When you have kittens you need something safe like this for them to teeth on and ours love playing with and chewing on these.
I liked it cute my little boy would so enjoy theses very tough to so it's very much worth every penny
My girl loves these things!  she is forever rolling around the floor playing with them.  i would reccommend these to other cat owners.
My kitten loves to chew on the ends of this toy!  Perfect for teething kittens!  He also likes to bat them all around the tile floors... they spin really well!!
it fits into the toy we purchased for challenging his interests but he just does seem to care for the product.  We use kibble and others since he has give us "nose down" on this one.

StarMark Every Flavor Treats / B0009YF43UMy puppy is in treat training, so we have plenty of different treats on hand. I slice them thinly for training, so that he doesn't get too satiated in training and so that his weight won't become unhealthy. I really didn't need any new treats for training, and certainly not these treats that work out to almost a dollar an ounce! But we recently bought the Everlasting Fun Treat Ball and found out, after it arrived, that our regular treats would not fit in the new ball. These treats were recommended for filling the ball. I hate to throw good money after bad, but I thought maybe these would be a fun enough diversion that it would be a worthwhile treat for the puppy, so I went ahead and bought some.The good news is that these treats do fit in the Everlasting Fun ball - almost as if the ball were made with these treats in mind! The treats slide in between the "teeth" of the ball opening easily, and the teeth don't catch at the treat (and my fingers) as they had in previous attempts to fill the ball. The treats are also very pretty, the different colors and flavors are neat for us humans to look at. The bad news is that the colors and flavors seem lost on my puppy, who much prefers his Omega ball, with its puppy kibble and occasional freeze-dried liver piece. He'll play with the Everlasting Fun treat ball and these treats if I give it directly to him, but when left to his own devices, he'll go back to his liver-laced kibble. I was expecting these treats to be exciting enough to hold his interest, but he seems kind of bored with them, and he seems to eat the treats more because they are there and less because they entice him - definitely not like the four or five other types of treats we use.This 5 oz. bag will fill our Everlasting Fun ball at least twice and maybe three times, but the ball is small enough that this isn't terribly impressive. Since he doesn't seem terribly interested in the treats, I'm thinking about slicing them up and adding them to his food, just to keep them from going to waste.~ Ana Mardoll
All of our dogs love these treats. They are soft and easy to break in pieces to dole out during grooming and nail trims. They all line up for their turn as soon as they see the treat pouch come out!

These are the best treats for training and rewarding since they are so small in size.  I put some in my pocket and off we go for some sit, stay and heel lessons.  I give them 4 stars since I truly do not know how great they taste. :-)

I bought these for the everlasting treat toys that I bought my dogs.  They were cheaper than the only pet store that carries them around here.  However, the dogs seem more attracted to the larger treat on the other side of the toy and these sometimes just sit in the toy until I remove them.  I am trying other small treats to see if they work a little better in attracting their attention.
summary: Cheaper than at local pet store

reviewText: it has a great acceptance from my pet, but the bbag its just too small so there are very few treats

We trained our dog to sit, stay, and lay down with them so they did their job so far. Our puppy is about 8 months and 8 pounds. The treats are small enough that she doesn't get distracted eating it, and she always wants more of them.

I can only find 3 colors in there. But the dog likes them alright, and he's pretty picky. They're nice and small and can easily be broken in half. They're soft, which is good since he refuses biscuits.

these are probably good treats for the average dog, but my husky is the ultimate in pickiness and won't eat them.  they actually look good enough and tasty enough, he is just spoiled and likes people food so even though he doesn't eat them, they are probably good treats.

My dog loves these treats.  The only problem is that when I buy I like to buy in bulk.  The come in just 5 oz. bags.  I wish they came in larger sized bags so I do not have to keep ordering like 10-15 bags at a time.  Otherwise, my Scotty Ebony, just loves them to death and me even more when I give them to him.
summary: Best Dog Treat on the market.... Scottish Terrier Approved...

reviewText: I buy different types of treats for my dogs and keep them all in a large Rubbermaid container on top of the fridge.  The dogs go nuts every time I reach for that box.  I think they enjoy the variety because after I give them their treat they still look at me like "what else is she gonna give us" and sometimes I swear it's more like "but mom, I don't like that kind, I want the other one".I mix all kinds of mainly dental treats together in the box.  Rawhide sticks (all colors and flavors, not just green ones), Greenies, Dingos, CET and also use some rawhide bones.  These treats help scrape plaque from their teeth while chewing before tarter can form if given after meals or once a day.  My dogs do not get soft food or treats unless we are training.  Saving soft treats for training makes them want it all the more and the hard food is better for their teeth and digestion.I have a Miniature Pinscher and 2 Pomeranians that are prone to tooth loss so taking care of their teeth is very important to me.  My oldest Pomeranian is 6 years old and just had his first professional cleaning and that was mainly because it is hard for me to get his back teeth because his mouth is so tiny.They love when they see the bag of treats come out of the cupboard because they now it's the soft stuff or the small one bite treats and they are more receptive to training and their sessions go much faster.I would recommend these treats as part of a variety.  Mix it up so your dog doesn't get bored and use different shapes to get different angles on their teeth.[...] Thanks!
My dogs like these. The only I don't like is that the smell is so strong. I'm not sure if I would get them again.

My dog loves these treats!  I put them inside the Everlasting Treat Ball and he loves getting through the first cookie to get to the treats inside.  The flavors are varied and he doesn't get tired or bored with the tastes.  You can also divide the treats in half to make them smaller and I use them that way both inside the treat ball and as training treats.  This is a great product which comes packaged in a zip-lock foil bag so the treats stay fresh for a long period of time...if you can keep them away from your dog long enough!  I will buy this again because my dog likes them and because I like to vary his treats.

I tried these treats after the success I had with the Everlasting Treat Ball (made by the same company).  My dog goes crazy for them is the only reason that I didn't give them a Five Star Review.  The treats are so attractive that the dog has trouble concentrating.  They are a great size for Clicker Training and apparently pack a lot of "high value" punch in a small treat.  Try and put these in a treat pouch or zip lock bag to contain the aroma so you can get some training in along with the treating.I also thought they were a little expensive for the amount you get, but it is very good for motivating a dog.
I like these because they break in half and get smaller. Great for IQ toys and they are soft and chewy. My little doggies love these.

Bought these for training purposes and it has worked well because she really loves these treats.  She isn't overly particular, I guess, but she does like them. I like also that they have a line inthem to break them in half so they can be stretched farther, especially when training and they are recieving alot of treats.
summary: good price and she loves them!

reviewText: Not sure how to review a dog treat.  I can tell you my dogs love them.  I can tell you that they don't make them sick.  And they are a perfect size for the quick positive reinforcement you may need to use.
