My dog loves them!  They stay semi soft, don't smell bad, stay fresh.  They are fairly small but a decent size for training and can be broken into smaller pieces.
I bought these for the StarMark Bob-A-Lot and I can put these treats in most of the StarMark toys. I was skeptical if my dogs would like a couple of the flavors, but they like them all.

I purchased these treats to put in a little treat ball made by the same company.  The pieces were so small my dogs had no trobule getting them out and they lasted less than a minute in the ball.  The dogs did not appear to like one of the flavors which they seemed to turn their nose up to.  I use numerous treats in training and as day to day rewards.  I know when my dogs like a treat as they will try and knock each other over when I am handing out treats.  With the Every Flavor Treat they take them but dont get very excited.
summary: Too Small for the treat ball that they are sold with

reviewText: So simple, no ill fitting lids or fancy devices.  No problem cleaning at all, just wipe under the lid, that's all.  Like the purple color, too.  Does not spill in my car.
summary: This is it, simple works best.

reviewText: Works great, but it's hard to clean because it's so good at not spilling... we have another one like this but the top pulls off which makes it a bit easier to clean, but I liked how this one had pretty colors (ha).

Our new pup thinks he has to flip over his bowl, spill his food all over and then eat it up.  He's almost throwing a fit with this new bowl.  He can't get it flipped over and the way the rim is curved in at the top, he can't get the food spilled out of the bowl with his nose.  So far, I think the new bowl solved the problem.
summary: There are a lot of things in this world that doesn't work... and, this isn't one of them!

reviewText: Although it may not be as attractive as some other bowls, this is a must for your dog.  I used to have to clean up spilled water every other week or so but since I got the spill-less bowl, I never have to!  I've also taken this on car trips and there's no way the water can slosh out.  Love it.
It's spill proof, but better than its competitors. A little too deep, which is how it avoids spills. Still on the lookout for the perfect bowl.
I keep my new Chihuahua puppy in a doggy playpen and I let him have alittle water in this bowl and there has never been a mess to clean up for it!  Great design and wonderful product!
This product is not spill proof, plus is very difficult to empty out the last of the water, which makes cleaning it a problem.

I really like these bowls.  They are great for puppies and don't spill like it says.  The spill-less top is attached to the rest of the bowl, it is one piece.  Because of this, it makes it a bit harder to clean to get the soapy water out, but I would rather that than the other adult size bowl I have, which the top comes off, making it easier to clean because, if you have ever had puppie before, they will get the top off it somehow.  I really like the overall quality of the bowls, made very well, are very durable, and very easy to use.  I will continue to use these for my puppies.

The lip definitely controls spilling from normal lapping, but it also is something to grab a hold of in your dog's mouth so they can carry it around or flip it with their paws (both of which our dog has done).  It also is hard to get completely dry because of the no spill lip (but obviously it is doing its job).  Love that it is dishwasher safe.  Like it overall.
summary: Controls spills, but can be carried around in teeth.

reviewText: This bowl is not only great because it doesn't spill, it also doesn't tip over and comes in nice colors.

I love this collar.It's got a nice clasp, a breakaway type, but it's not so easy that one brush against a bush will lose the collar.This thing is so bright that I can see my kitty, even in the middle of the night when I get up to go to the bathroom in total darkness. It glows for hours. I think it's funny when I see GhostCat moving across the room and all I can see is a lime green line.

This is far and away the best cat collar I've found.  It has a safety release, in case the collar gets hung up.  It will release, but doesn't just fall apart, like some other collars I've tried.  It BOTH reflects and glows-in-the-dark.  This means that if your cat runs out of a lit-up house into the dark outdoors, you don't need a flashlight to see the collar.  It will be glowing.  It also means that if a lost and frightened cat runs away from your flashlight beam, you can still see where he is.  This is great!  To top it all off, although I was concerned because the collar seemed ever so slightly stiff to me, the cats actually seem to find this to be the most comfortable collar.  Even Firebolt, who hates collars, rarely bothers to scratch at this collar (that can't be said for any other collar he's worn).  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.  Please buy this for your cat.Please note that regardless of what color collar you choose, the overlay covers much of the nylon and the color of the overlay is always a glow-in-the-dark yellowish color with a silvery-white edge and stars in the middle.  (The color contrast between the 2 overlay colors is not very noticeable.)  The neon yellow and neon lime collar colors blend well with the overlay.  The other colors contrast.  Either can be nice, just depends on what you like.  Just be aware that if you select red, the whole collar will not be red.

It was okay the first day, but the material doesn't give at all, so when my cat grew and the collar needed to be resized it never really fit well again (the material is too dense to re conform itself).  The reflective material worked well though.  I wouldn't recommend the collar for a growing cat.
The collar glows in the dark to provide increased visibility.  We had a black out and at least knew exactly where the cat was.  This is also a breakaway collar!

reviewerName: Retired Navy Guy "Chief Cook & Bottle Washer,...
reviewText: I bought 3 of these collars, in different colours; first one came off in first two days and was lost along with rabies and I.D. tags.  I checked the other two, both opened with almost NO effort, less than 2-3 lb of effort.  Snap closure definitely DEFECTIVE.
Glows in the dark, reflective and good quality. Gave it 4 stars because my cat's long hair covers most of the collar. Wished the collar could be more thicker.
It's OK. I find it a little cumbersome to use. I prefer my smaller syringe and my feeding tongues though.
summary: Does what it is supposed to do, just not the tool for me....

reviewText: Works great and LOVE the extension! It also has a small red pick that also extends at the tip to poke shrimp on it for anemones, but if you don't need it you just push it in and only pull it out when needed. The only down fall is the cleaning. You can take the black pump off at the end, but its really hard to clean the small extension tube on the inside. I didn't clean it after 1 use and it has algae stuck inside, now I have to buy a really small brush to stick inside to clean. But other than that, its great!
I thought this would be great to spot feed my corals, but its really no better than my cheap dyi model (which I use more often)
summary: So So, my DYI one works better.

reviewText: I use this to spot feed mysis shrimp to my corals and some fish. Sometimes I have an issue with the mysis not fitting thru the tiny hole in the end of the seasquirt. That is the only downside to this. Otherwise its a great tool thats adjustable to whatever length you could possibly need for a tank.
summary: works great, wish the hole on the tip was just a tad bit bigger

reviewText: I have one that I cut the tip to be wider and one with the original size. I wish there was a way they can have interchangable tips like the julians thing.
Works well to feed brine shrimp or other liquid type foods! Have not used the tip to feed larger objects to this point!
Works well in my 55 gallon to direct feed corals and Anenome.  Would be much better if probe was thinner and a little sharper. Other then that I would recommend this product
Especially for the size of this thing! It's good for feeding very small plankton or tiny coral foods to corals but shrimp get stuck or won't suck up to put in the tank!
This thing is awesome! It's so easy to target feed without getting your whole arm wet. I haven't tried to prong part but it looks like it would work well.
Now this takes turkey basting to a whole new level.  It is great and extends to a really great length. I would DEF reccomend this for spot feeding your corals!
summary: Now this takes turkey basting to a whole new level.

reviewText: This thing is great! Good bye turkey baster! One of my tanks is 30" deep. It was always a task to reach corals near the bottom. Target feeding has become a breeze. The first reason didnt give it 5 stars is that when squirting the slightest release of the bulb pretty much fills the entire tube back up with tank water. Not that big of a deal but if you are feeding reef snow it dillutes it so the concentrate hitting the coral isnt as strong. I guess that should be expected considering the length of the tube but it is by far no reason to avoid buying this thing. I bought this over the flexible tube feeder simply because of the price. The second reason I gave it 4 stars is, the outlet is very small so you will have trouble spot feeding anything larger than mysis.

I haven't really used this for "target feeding" yet, but I will agree with the other reviews that the hole at the end is to small. I feed mysis (small) mixed with an algea blend and the shrimp plug up the hole leaving it pretty worthless. I have how ever found it very useful for turning over fallen Astra snails. I actually bought an eyedropper and used a knife to make the whole at the end bigger, it works much better to control the amount of food.

I'm using this to target feed my corals. I've also been able to use this feeder to feed my fish 1mm spectrum pellets and mini mysis shrimp. The hole is very small so sometimes the pellets do get stuck. Although I haven't tried it, other reviewers have modified the hole to make it just a little bigger.
Definitely helps target the coral better so fish don't steal the food. Well made nice to have around when you dont want to get your hands wet when feeding coral

I had a plain old turkey baster that i used but it was to short to reach my brain coral so i said why not and bought this only problem is the opening is too small and it gets clogged up when it sucks in pieces of food that are too big, long story short i went back to my turkey baster and only use this when I really need to or the frozen food thaws out fast enough. Good try but im not that happy with this purchase sorry
summary: Not too crazy about this one

reviewText: A must have for feeding coral; however, this does not work great and feeking shrimp or squid to fish but is perfect for coral.
summary: A must have for feeding coral.

reviewText: I love it! use it for my flame scallop and my corals. The only down fall is that the feeder can leak when i lift the feeder from my side table to the tank.
summary: Great for liquid feeding for corals and clams

reviewText: I would give this item more stars if I could.  Fast shipping, works great for feeding corals and fish and a great length. I have a 90 gallon saltwater tank and I prefer not to stick my entire arm in the tank when feeding and this does the trick, I'm a women and only have to put up to my wrist in the water.  Fast shipping, well packaged.

This is a useful feeding baster for deep tanks using fine-grained or liquid food for fish/corals.It's an easy way to dispense controlled amounts of Coral Frenzy, or similar products when target feeding corals.This uses a thin tube within a tube to allow up to 4 feet or so of reach.  Unfortunately, this leeds to feed getting stuck between tubes or in the squeeze balloon at the top.  It's hard to clean without totally dis-assembling.Docked one star because the feeding tube is so narrow, you can't feed mysis/brine shrimp easily with this.  $5 grocery store turkey baster is better for those foods.

I had bubble bars all over my 30 gallon tank - probably 3 10" bubble bars - but the pump was still so effective water was spraying into the air. Also, the vibrating buzzing noise didn't seem worth it and my fish have been just fine without. Generally I like the shape and will hang on to it in case I change my mind and need an air pump again.

I love this air pump, great pump for my 30 gallon long tropical freshwater fish tank and my 20 gallon tropical freshwater fish  tank. It executes the perfect amount of power and the bubbles produced are perfect for my tanks. I know the pump says 10 gallon but it works fine for my 30 and 20 gallon tanks and produces a lot of nice bubbles. It is nice and quiet. I love this product and the motor is nice and efficient. I have had this for several weeks now and no problems. Thanks Tetra!
summary: Quiet and efficient and perfect amount of power

reviewText: It's quiet, but its still an air pump and despite the rubber feet, its still has way too much vibration to put on top of a tank and too much noise to go unnoticed vs a small powerhead style filter for noise control.
summary: Quiet, but not whisper quiet. More like murmur.

reviewText: Every 2 months I had to replace the diaphragms which I can only find online in a kit which gives me extra parts I don't need. 1 kit costs about $20 when you include shipping its not worth it.  The design is poor and this model is fairly loud. I wish I had researched better before purchasing this but the price was right at the time.
works nicely to deliver air into the water and hooks up well to most airline tubes for proper water aeration
It does the job, but I am not using it for a fish tank. I bought it to make bubbles in my Halloween brain in a jar decoration for a mad scientist lab in my home.

I have had this in my aquaponics fish tank running non-stop for about 45 days with no trouble. I also have the Marina Deluxe Oval Bubble Disk, 4.75 inch hooked up and it is working great. Check out the product in the tank here - http://youtu.be/eY7ViXV7K6s

I have 3 small tanks, 10, 3, and 2 gal, with sponge filters. I bought my first Whisper 10 gal pump at the local pet shop, and bought two more here on Amazon. I tried the larger Whisper 20 gal and another small pump but found that these Whisper 10 gal air pumps work great with the sponge filters and make the least noise. The included valve makes it easy to throttle the flow to get the right bubbles. Highly recommend for small tanks.

Using this pump for my hydroponic system to pump air into a 55 gallon barrel. Working great, I use three 1 1/2 air stones inside the tank, appears to be enough for this system.It's not loud either, which is a plus.

Most air pumps are quite loud with that insistent humming. This air pump will also hum, but it isn't quite as loud or as noticeable. I added this to my Wish List to keep a tab on it if I needed it in the future. My girlfriend surprised me and bought it for me along with a Marineland Penguin 100 (don't like it). Really thankful, but I don't really need the air pump. Regardless, i'm glad the air pump is quiet and powerful.Make sure the pump is not in contact with any other surfaces and is sitting on an appropriate surface.
summary: It was a gift. I like it, but don't use it.

reviewText: I used this to run a sponge filter on my 29 Gal fish tank. it is pretty loud. plugging up one of the holes makes it considerably more quiet, however doing it this way makes it way less powerful and it is still not as quiet as the Fusion Air Pump 500 i got shortly after buying this.Maybe it needs a deeper/bigger tank with more water pressure to muffle the sound, im not sure.
Works great for my tank. provides plenty of air for my fish. would recommend for anyone setting up a large fish tank.

This is about the size of your palm.  After two weeks it's still quiet.  Other reviews state that some parts inside will make it loud over time, still waiting for that to happen so I can open it up as one of the other reviewers shared.  Only one air outlet, so if you want multiple tubes be sure to get a splitter.  Was easily able to get bubbles out of 2 one inch air stones at the same time.
summary: Small and does the job for started tanks

reviewText: This air pump is very quiet and efficient. I use it for acclimating new fish in an outside breeder box so that water drips slowly in it and I also use it for my 10gal breeding tank.
This pump works well, is relatively quiet, and it looks cool. I believe it is a good product for the money.

This air pump is more than sufficient for my 55 gallon freshwater tank and powers my 28" air stone very effectively. It should be noted that this pump comes with 2 valves and a splitter all of which make this pump more diverse. My only complaint is that it is kind of loud, this however is to be expected with most air pumps.

reviewerName: Big c "the big guy in the part"
reviewText: Ok so I needed a powerfull pump for my 29 gallon aquarium..why would I buy a pump for 100 gallon? Well once you have 40 years of fish keeping, you know that if you want strong bubbles coming out of 5 or so air stones and decorations a small pump will die a young, loud, vibrating death.PS..in the box was 2 in line air valves to adjust the air flow...nicePPS..place your air pump on top of a regular, new, dry kitchen sponge to keep it off the shelf..it cuts down on the vibrations of the pump and still  let's air flow into the pumpPPPS..use two rubber bands to attach the pump to the sponge
I love this air pump! just got it to replace my 10 gallon pump! works like magic :D woot woot!
For a pump that's pushing the volume of air it does it is extremely quiet! The look of the pump is such that you don't mind it being seen and the rubber feet eliminates any vibration.

I bought my first Whisper 10 to replace an old, noisy air pump driving an air stone that was deep in my 55 gallon. I had concerns about the 10 being able to operate at the 18-inch depth, but it has no problem at all. I actually needed to step it down some in order to get the look that I wanted.The Whisper 10 is almost dead silent. I have mine sitting on carpet in the cabinet below my tank and I can't hear it at all. If I open the cabinet doors I can hear the slightest little buzz but that's it. Just keep it isolated as anything resting against it will obviously cause it to get loud.

I've done controlled tests of power of Rena 60 airpumps vs Rena 301's & Rena 400's over the years. In the past, Whisper 60's used to provide the same power as those Rena models, yet Whisper was quieter.  But now new Whisper 60 right out of the box is much less power than those old used Renas.  What a waste. Based on that, I'll revert to buying Renas instead of this crap.
summary: Not as powerful as Whisper 60 used to be made

reviewText: I bought two of these as I have two aquariums.  I love that they have a control knob so I can adjust the amount of air that pumps into the water.  I have one small tank and the adjustable pump means my small fish are not pushed around by the air swirling through the water too fast for them.

I wanted an air pump to attach to a single air stone/disc just to add a little extra turbulence to my water surface.I didn't think I needed a very powerful pump, but I read some people said the 10-20 gallon pump wasn't strong enough to create bubbles in their +20 gallon tank, so I decided to go with the larger one.Well...it was entirely too strong, instead of just creating a slight amount of turbulence it created a tsunami in my 26gal bow front.  I immediately ordered the smaller one, which ended up being absolutely perfect.Both pumps are really very quiet, which was my #1 criteria. (Note: I'm also posting this review under the 10gal size.)
Whisper air pump is very nice for a 50 gallon tank.I used it with a 6 inch air stone.I would  buy the same one again.

Pump is about 8 1/2 long! "It's really big" and has great air flow!!! Comes with a triple connector and two connectors that you can adjust with the airline hoses. "That's a bonus"! It's so worth it and it's in my 55 Gallon fish tank. One little thing "It hum's but If you stay away at least six feet the noise won't matter. Still worth it!!!!!!!! The bigger the motor---The bigger the noise because of its magnets. You can always cover the pump with a heavy towl to cover the noise or put it in a empty cabinet.

I got this for my Tetra 3i filter.It is substantially more powerful than the motor that came with it.I can now keep the lip a bit higher over the water and the flow is strong enough to get a lot more use out of the filter and if it clogs up, it is strong enough to keep on flowing thus oxygenating the water, unlike the old motor, which nearly suffocated my fish.  The water flowing around the filter may not be filtered, but at least it is being oxygenated.

We've had our whisper air pump for about five months and it's still working well.  It's always been a little loud, but nothing to great and the noise level hasn't increased.  We use it on our 20-gallon tank and, with a splitter,  our 3-gallon tank as well.  I will buy another one of these when this finally breaks down as all pumps will eventually do, but the price is right.

Works as expected.  did seem to loose just a little pressure after it has been in use for a while but still does the job for our 40gal with all its accessories.  Quite enough but that is compared to the older 2 pumps it replaced.

I bought this 40 gl pump for two ten gal aquariums  with a total of 6 large air stones. It does work ok but I was expecting more air to be pumped and having to use a valve control to lower the amount of air (not the case).I am happy wth this pump and how quiet it is. I placed it behind the aquarium next to the wall (no noise at all)
This small pump does what it should do, and for a good price.  It's not completely quiet, but also not loud enough to bother me.

This is a grrrreeeeaaaattttt pump! At the pet store there charging twice as much. Totally recommend getting this for a smaller tank for maybe a air driven filter or an air stone. Works great no complaints.

Multiple air stones don't seem to get enough air with this guy, but, as it's for a small aquarium, that's to be expected. Works really great now that I'm using just one air stone strip under the gravel.
summary: Does great with one air stone

reviewText: I would have to agree with the other reviews on this, the pump can definitely work in larger tanks just fine. I have it in my 40 gallon tank and it works perfect. It can be noisy if its not sitting properly, had it happen a few times. I'm not sure how many bubblers this could power, but I know it can power a 10" stone just fine. Might consider getting a check valve just in case it loses power.Conclusion: I recommend this to anyone looking for a quiet, cheap, and reliable pump.
This is a fairly quiet motor, and works very well.  I had to tape it in place due to slight vibration/motion on the surface where it sits.

I've never had an issue with these.. I have purchased a few of these in my aquarium keeping hobby. I like the rubber feed on these because they tend not to fall off over time. very quiet and reliable.

Working great.  No problems with tubing and air stones.  Air valve that comes with it is VERY useful -- it's nearly required to use if you're just using a small air stone.  Very quiet, but of course you're going to hear the motor run, and otherwise it's silent.  Great motor and design.
Bought this after using the 10-gallon version.  Much louder.  Now I only use this for temporary purposes (fry tanks, bring shrimp, etc.).
summary: Bought this after using the 10-gallon version. Much louder ...

reviewText: Not much to say here. The pump works exactly as it should, creates good air flow and it's extremely quiet DEPENDING on what surface it is on. I have it sitting under the tank on the carpet (with a check valve installed to prevent back-siphoning) and it is quieter than the filter. The bubbles however aren't so quiet lol. Good buy.
Best and quietest pump I have owner to date! If it wasn't for my regular water changes I would forget it was there!!!
It works great and I love the design.  This is a beautiful piece of equipment.  The design fits any modern decor.
This pump is quiet, moves air like nothing and I will buy nothing but these pumps. I am a fish breeder an all of my pumps are Tetra whisper.

I read up on various pumps and decided to get this one.  I plugged it in once I got it and it was really loud, none of my other pumps make any noise but this one makes a hum I can hear in my basement (it's on the first floor).  I have two air hoses hooked up, one to a 48" flexible air tube and one to a 5" airstone.  I figured this would be more than enough to power those two devices and it was - for about a month.  Then the air tube had no bubbles but the disc was going great.  I figured out that one of the air valves on the pump itself doesn't work any more.  I'm going to a different brand completely and will sell this one with my smaller aquarium.  It's great for a small tank but horrible for anything over 20 gallons (I used it in a 55 gallon).

I have had this product for about a month and so far, it is pretty quiet. It's not silent (my search for the SILENT pump continues) but it isn't too bad. I have this in a 20 gallon tank so it is really overkill, but it does power a rather long bubble wand easily. I read a few reviews that said this product gets very noisy after a few months. I'll report back if that happens to me. So far though, so good.

I have two. The one running 100% free air flow without an adjustable valve is going strong and quite after 18 months. The other, connected to a common restrictor valve for a smaller tank, bit the dust in 3 months. The cheap internals can't handle the pressure.Only purchase IF you run it wide-open and do not restrict the flow output.

This pump drives a sponge filter on my freshwater planted aquarium.  It's quiet, and the included restriction valve controls the airflow precisely.  The feet have a soft rubber bottom to help reduce "walking" and prevent transmitted vibration.  Very happy with this purchase.
Maybe  needed for a bigger tank.  Not my betta's 5 gallon.  The Mignon 60 filter worked better and quieter for Benny the fish.
I bought this pump to use with the Marina Hang-On Breeding Box. Works great, very quiet. I can't comment on it's longevity, as I have only had it running for a couple of weeks.

The last thing you want when sitting back and relaxing in front of your peaceful aquarium is the buzz or hummm of an air filter.  We had and old (4 years) AQT 1000 which we had to unplug at night because of its peculiar humming.So I asked the guy at the fish store which of the many air pumps is the quietest. "The Tetra Whisper Air Pump"  he picked one up off the shelf and casually tossed it over my way.Wow not much of and introduction. So I bought a different  unit, well because I know better don't I? Sure.  Two days later I retuned that one because it was competing with the refrigerator in the hum contest.  And it was winning.Sure enough this 'Whisper" is a very quiet unit. Peaceful and unobtrusive.We have a 35 gal / 24" deep tank and the #10 gal Air Pump provides great bubble power.I would recommend trying the lower powered ones for your tank and if need be working up to a higher stength if necessary.  My friend has a #10 in his 50 gal tank and it pushes plenty of air for bubbles.Tetra recommends an optional check valve to prevent water from siphoning back in case there is a power outtage.  We just put a loose loop in the air hose behind the tank.  But you may be safer with the check valve.Quiet + powerful + reliable (We have had it for 9 months now) = Silencioso!

Pumps plenty of oxygen but has a noise problem. Not can't hear the TV type loud but constant background noisy. I have tried setting it on a piece of foam to stop vibration transfer and this helped but not a lot.
This is easy to set up and extremely quiet, I love this product I will let you know if I have any issues with it in the future.

I had another tetra pump (Tetra Tech deep water DW18) that I got for free from my LFS. It was dependable and the quietest pump I have had. Many other brands have proven to be quiet only for a short while or just plain loud.  Eventually after about 8 to 10 years it started to become a little more noticeable. The pump was sending a vibration to my sponge filter (pump is still quiet but a buzzing can be heard eminating from my sponge filter)that was noticeable but still much more quiet than when other pumps fail. I decided to buy a new pump and after much research I chose to stick with reliable old tetra pumps. I noticed that they upgraded the old Tetra Tech to the new Tetra Whisper Air and hoped it would remedy my problems or at least be just as quiet as my old tetra pump. To my suprise the upgrade is actually an upgrade! The buzzing is gone and this is now the quietest pump I have ever owned (I am hoping it will be just as reliable)! I was skeptical that the pump would reduce the vibration noise that was sent all the way to my sponge filter but it did! Thanks to my new Tetra Whisper 10 air pump my room is now again silent and good nights await!

Because of it's claw-foot design, this pump is really quiet. It also comes with a splitter which is nice (tubing not included). I did find it a bit too strong for my 20 gallon tank, now that could have been because of the air-stone i was using but I ended up using the splitter and having an air stone in my 20 gallon tank and one in m 10 gallon tank and it worked perfectly.
summary: Nice and Quiet, Really Strong Too

reviewText: I've had mine for a couple of weeks now and I've had absolutely no issues with it! It works great!
Its very strong, its makes lots of bubbles. It is nice and quiet, and it has rubber feet that keep it from vibrating its self into other stuff or off the table.
It is quiet and works great. This is the second one that I've bought and I'm very happy with them.

I have a fish tank in my bedroom and having used other, noisy air pumps I thought the "legs" on this one might help keep it quieter.I am happy to report they DO keep the pump quiet and unless my cats move it off the shelf, the noise is not even discernible across the room.The air is adequate and constant which also is nice.
I'd consider this air pump slightly better than average. Mine is kind of noisy. Does the job and have had good reliability with Tetra pumps. My latest purchase of Fluval Q2 is very quiet.
summary: Does the job, but kind of noisy.

reviewText: I wish they would put a T in with it but there is a regulator and you can change how many bubbles you get.  I like it.

I bought this for my 75 gallon to power my 36inch bubble wand. It works great, but since it has two outlets, I just plugged off the one not in use. So, when I am ready to put a bubble ornament..I can:) I have placed it underneath my fish tank where my external filter is and I cannot hear a thing, except for the sound of bubbles popping out of the top of my tank. Great product, great service and fast shipping.

What none of these reviews seem to mention is how crazy loud this thing is. It says WHISPER but there's nothing whisper about it. It's so loud that I can exit my bedroom at the end of a LONG hall and hear it going way down in the dining room. When I use my computer way across the room, the sound from the pump sounds like it's coming from my computer and I think something is wrong with my computer. It sounds like a pump for a pool or something. It should be outside.We have both inputs hooked up. There's nothing wrong with the filter to create the sound. I guess you like stuff that is louder in your houses than anything else beside the microwave or TV? We tried wrapping some noise muffling towels and crap around it. It's still so loud. So I have major regrets after buying this thing because it's so crazy loud. We don't turn it on very often. But as far as pumping air goes, it does a great job.
It does make a humming sound, like all air pumps of this type and in the price range, however, for the amount of air delivered, the humming is low.

I bought this pump so I could use some bubblers/airstones in my 29 gallon tank.After reading some of the reviews on the different sizes of pumps needed to do what I want, I almost bought a smaller pump, but logic prevailed and I bought this one instead. Thank goodness I did. I have one bubbler and two airstones which I wanted a steady current of bubbles emitting from them. This pump provides just enough air to serve my purposes, but the airflow is not firm enough to create a true bubble curtain with all 3 bubbler accessories running.  Even with only one accessory attached the flow is barely what I would call a bubble curtain. Its still a decent pump though, and the current airflow is more to my fishes liking.As far as noise level goes, this pump does make a hum, similar to the old computers of the floppy disk era. It's noticeable without some moderate white noise, but its no where near the drone of the 747 landing strip sounds the old pumps used to make. Unless you are listening for it, you likely won't even notice its there.The pump has rubber feet which keep it from wobbling around and may also help to deaden the sound a bit. There is only one air output on this one, but the box does include one T splitter. The pump also does not have an off switch, so if you are using for a purpose other than an aquarium, take that into account.  If you are planning on using lots of accessories (which require multiple airlines) you probably should invest in a pump with more than one output (again, this only has one). Or, if loss of airflow isn't an issue you can get a gang valve or some more splitters to connect your extra lines. Make sure to get a decent gang valve or check valves in case of power outage to protect your pump from back flow. Remember, every split off the main line will lessen your airflow with each addition.For now, this pump will suit my purposes. It seems built fairly well as pumps go. I would recommend this pump to users of small aquariums and casual hydro hobbyists.
Very quiet. it comes with 2  outputs so u can have more air flowing at once. I really like this

I'm only giving it 4 stars because for a 10 gallon tank, it was way too powerful. Otherwise, it works really well. But my Betta doesn't like the constant water movement. He's not able to perch and rest anywhere without getting pushed over by the current, even with an air stone attached to it.

Quiet pump able to create loads of air pressure and bubbles! There are two air outputs with no way to shut off one of the two, so you need to have two hoses. Price was way below local pet stores. Packaged well and shipped quickly. Would highly recommend.

We have a 50g show tank in the livingroom with the 60g pump hooked up to it . it is pumping 3 decorations and a large 12 inch air stone . Had to put in a 4 way valve to slow down the bubbles way to many ! it's been running for about three months now working perfect and very silent so far ,love it ! in our bedroom we have a 40g tank and the 40g pump hooked to it with a lighted air decoration it also works great runs quiet can hear the bubbles and the filter but not the pump . I'm a light sleeper and if I heard the pump it would keep me awake glad it doesn't. We are ready to set up another 40 g tank and will purchase another tetra air pump for it . Very happy with these products . I am very picky but can't complain about anything about these pumps so far .

Great little pumps for the money.I own multiple whisper models and really like them.They pump the air out great and are quiet.I also really like the case design which aids in keeping the noise down. You cant go wrong with this pump in my opinion.And for the people saying the pump is noisy...Its probably due to the surface you have it on.Most noise from the pumps are caused by vibrations.Even a small thing like a cord from your light resting on it will cause noise.Doing things like making sure the pump isn't touching anything and/or setting the pump on a sponge or rubber pad will help tremendously.
summary: Can't beat it for the price.

reviewText: I've been using this pump for over 6 months now. I have no issues with it. Just make sure not to let water reverse back into it and you shouldn't have issues. I've also found that if you're having noise issues that putting it on a towel will help with the vibration. It has to vibrate to create the air, but that helps it not make as much noise.
the pump is very basic it make very minimal noise and it has a free spliter  to divide the air in 2 ways
Whisper should not be its name.. silent is more like it!! you dont even here this pump I love it. Great buy.
Don't forget to get a water backflow protector and perhaps even a splitter, this pump can do multiple tanks.You WILL need an adjustable valve as it's pretty powerfulQUIET~~!!!
summary: Cheap and quiet! What more do you need for a 15 gallon and under air pump?

reviewText: Awesome ! Quiet! Best one I've owned.Just make sure to add a check valve just in case the power goes out.

These things are not whisper like, they are LOUD. I've even tried some at local pet store and they are still LOUD!The 40-60 gallon I have is quiet.However it does do it's job for what I needed it for. I ended up placing it in a both with foam and a top and some vents, it is now bearable.
This air pump works very well. I use it to run two sponge filters and an airstone in a 3 gallon.

i bought 2 of these. they're great.  one of them makes a little bit of noise but i put it on top of a few rags and it's fine.also they come with an adjustment knob which is GREAT for people with bettas.i did knot know this and i bought 2 metal ones at 7 bucks a piece. the tetra adjustment knob was better.
Bought to replace noisey pump powering sponge filter on my shrimp tank. This is one is extremely quiet. I do wish it didn't have the stupid legs sticking out increasing its footprint though.
Pumps plenty of air but is a little louder than I expected. It is running two 8 in bar airstones at a depth of 22 inches. It is definitely louder than the Whisper 60gal version.

This thing shouldn't even be allowed NEAR the word "whisper".  OMG, this thing is a humming night mare.  Yes, I have both ports hooked up and in a 75 gallon tank (I know they are all noisy when pumping right out the ports).  I even looked at trying to adjust the magnets and alignment as was mentioned in a couple other reviews, and everything is about as good as it is going to be, and now I'm just going to run it for a couple days and see if it "breaks in".  If it stays this loud, it will be going back.  No savings is worth putting up with this noise.
Extremely happy with this purchase. Very quiet compared to others I've had in the past. Would highly recommend  to anyone with more than one bubbler.

So far I am pleased with this purchase.  Produced LOTS of bubbles and is very quite.  The only sound it makes is when the pump itself vibrates on the shelf.  I don't know why it does that but if I just move it a bit it usually stops and then it is silent again. I've had it a few months and so far no issues.  Got it for a great price online too.

Let's get something clear first, no air pump runs 100% quiet, no matter what the manufacturer says. Now the review :After all the numerous mixed reviews, I decided to take a chance and get this air pump anyway, and I'm glad I did.This pump, as the title says, is surprisingly quiet, the sound of the bubbles and the waves in my tank are actually louder than this pump, and I'm not exaggerating when I say that. I have an old, square shape, Aquaculture pump that was bugging me it was so loud. The Tetra Whisper pump emits a very,  almost unnoticed hum. The pump has 2 outakes and comes included with the following:The pump of course, instructions , 1T-adapter; 2 knobs/valves that  help regulate the amount of bubbles you feed into the aquarium by increasing/decreasing air flow. This is actually perfect for those like me with a smaller tank,  even though I have a 50 GAL, I don't have to have bubbles at full blast.I had a problem with my wave maker stirring bubbles all over the place, but now with this new pump, I can have less bubbles in the area near the powerheads hooked  to my wave maker. I'm currently using this pump with these:Elite 1-Inch Cylinder Air Stone, 4-Packand so far, so good. Let the stones soak in your tank for at least 10 minutes before using them.Some people recomend keeping the pump above water level, but in my 12 years of keeping aquariums I've never done that; just make sure you create a "drip loop" for the power cord with a screw or a push pin, so if water for some reason finds its way down, it will hang and drip at the loop and not reach the AC plug. You may also want to get these:2 PCS Non-return Check Valves for Aquarium Air Pumpto keep water from going into the pump during water changes or power outages.If you ask me if I have any complaints about this pump,  I'd say its size, but that's a minor issue for me, the dome shape of the pump was intentionally designed to reduce the amount of noise it makes, and it works.The pump measurements are as follow:7.5 inches long, 4.5 inches wide and 3 inches high.Overall, I'm very pleased with my purchase, the pump is well built, high quality and made to last. The best feature of course, its almost silent operation, I don't have to crank the volume up on my TV anymore.One last tip, if you want this pump, or any other pump to make less noise, place it on top of a thick sock or an old fashioned mouse pad. That should absorb some of the vibrations.
I plugged this little guy in and haven't thought about it since.  It continues to run and so far has stayed super quiet.
Got this product in and the price was just great, has been my little workhorse staying on day and night with no problems at all and not noisy either.

Package arrived in a timely manner. I have a two sided tank (two forty gallon tanks hooked together) so I bought two Whisper air pumps. The work perfectly, whisper quiet. I realize no pump is 100% quiet, but these pumps are hardly noticeable at all. You barely hear them while being in the same room as the tank. I highly recommend this product for fish enthusiast..

this thing was quiet for one month.. Now it is as loud as the cheap $5 wallyworld pump I replaced it with..Very disappointed in this air pump. I am glad I waited to write my review. Its so loud now I just took it out and done with air pumps. I am 100% convinced that a quiet one does not exist, that lasts..This was barely detetable for the first month and then got LOUD.It's nice looking though...

Good airflow but a bit (not too bad) noisy. It comes with 2 air outlets so I use them to power a 47" air diffuser and a sponge filter. The noise is there, but not too bad. I'm going to be changing my setup to a sump filter so it'll be under the tank and hopefully won't be heard at all. But at this price, it's a great buy.
I've always used the Whisper line of airpumps. This is my 4th one. However, this unit was quite loud and I will be returning it as it might be defective.
SUPER CHEAP AND RELIABLE TOTALLY RECOMMEND THIS TO ALL MY TANK PEOPLE OUT THERE WAY CHEAPER THAN IN STORES .
Works great, real quiet nice price. I have it running last couple days and it is working just as I hoped it would.
I purchased this pump as a  back up unit for using with my brine shrimp program.  Works well.  Perfect for any small tank.

It's ok.Pros:Does what it supposed to doCan blow air though a bubble wandGood for freshwater tanksCons:I tried replacing it to different spots but it seems to have noises like hummmmmm. It's goes away when I turned it off so it's clearly not coming from my filter or powerheadsCan create air bubbles if you have saltwater tanks

I purchased this for my window farm setup (google it, they are pretty cool).  Unfortunately this is simply not strong enough to be used as an airlift for 4 feet.  Not the pump's fault though, just not what I needed.  The unit was quiet to operate and otherwise seemed pretty good.
summary: Quiet but not strong enough for windowfarm

reviewText: Works great.  It's a quiet little air pump for my 6 gallon tall cylinder acrylic tank on my desk at work.

I bought this to run a sponge filter on my 5 gallon betta tank.  I have used Whisper pumps for many years and they have always done a very nice job.  This one is no exception.  It works very well, is relatively quiet, and came with a valve which you add to the airline tubing so you can adjust the flow.  Due to this pump and the new filter, the tank is crystal clear, and Pinky the Betta is very happy!
summary: Works very well for a smaller tank

reviewText: This is a great little pump. in the time I have had it it works great and is very very quiet you can't even tell it is is running. That is exactly what I was looking for.

I love this little thing so far. It's small, and nice and quiet; just a little vibration you can hear. And it works great for the sponge filter I have it attached to.(Remember to get a check valve so the water doesn't flow back into the pump when you turn it off!)
This is not very powerful.  It barely runs two  small bubblers in a 3 gallon tank.  I'm quite disappointed in this pump.
Very quiet, I can't hear a thing while it is running. Not much more to say, it does what it should.
Works great. Too much power for a 3-5 gallon tank. Anything over, will be just fine.

This Aquarium Air Pump is so Quiet I have my 29 gallon aquarium in my big master bedroom. I can only hear the bubbles from the air-stone! I will use Whisper Air Pumps for both of my aquariums, because they are built really good and are Super Quiet! I recommend these aquarium air pump for all Aquarium Owners!
very quiet and nice looking tooI really liked this model and was looking for something that wasn't too big or cheap looking.This definitely gets the job done.
Most quiet airpump to me. Call me crazy but i actually turn it on only at night because i have a co2 system. My gf says i snore louder than this lol.

This pimp works great. I have it hooked up to an air stone in my 20 gallon with a valve so to restrict some of the air flow. Super quiet! Recommended for any small tanks. Also, better priced on Amazon than local stores.

I've owned this air pump for about 4 months now and tonight it died.  It started making a really loud rattle, so I unscrewed its case and found that a cheap piece of plastic was holding the vibration mechanism and this piece had broken and so the vibrator was rattling all over.  Basically it's now trash.  Pretty pathetic that this thing died so fast, it's clearly built cheaply inside.  It's almost as if it's designed to fail.  The broken part is very obviously in need of reinforcement.

This pump actually matches it's description.I have tried a large variety of pumps from the locals store. They all sound like lawnmower engines regardless of how many different places the word "silent" was printed on the box. I figured that was the way all air pumps were.The pump is not absolutely quiet of course, but it is quiet enough that I wondered if it had broken and checked it to see if that was the case a couple of times.
I am very happy with this tetra whisper ten gallon air pump. It works well and is nice and quiet.

I don't use this pump any more. It's too nosiy. Works okay, but I got sick of hearing it. I bought it on a whim--I really didn't need it as bad as I originally thought. My advice: Think it through and if you really need to make bubbles in your tank, get a quieter unit if you're going to be nearby often.

This pump works very well.  It also came with a flow adjustment valve, which was perfect because I have two bubble ornaments on this one pump and it allowed me to adjust the flow so that they both worked on one pump.  The price was fantastic as well.

This is an excellent pump for the 5-gallon aquarium which I set up for my niece.  It has sufficient power to run two air stones and is very, very quiet.  The refrigerator makes a sound louder than this pump.

i bought this pump for my DIY Phytoplankton reactor. So far i've had it bubbling for about 2 weeks non-stop and it works perfect. It's not too loud and has a constant stream of bubbles. If you are looking to build a phytoplankton reactor or raise brine, this will do the trick. Hope it helps you guys.
this is a nice pump at a great price. I'm very pleased with it! it has great air flow and it's quiet

This pump is great for my little fish tank.  It has sturdy rubber padded feet and make virtually no noise.  I purchased this with the blue rubber hose and my tank was setup and running within 2 minutes.  Very good product.  I tried to test its durability by clogging the line but the steady low flow pushed everything out no problem.  Looks like this is the last air pump I have to buy for my fish!  Well, unless I get a bigger tank!  :)
The first one we ordered was broken we had no trouble getting a return and the second none works perfect it has good pressure and is as quiet as it will be given the fact it is a pump
Worked great at first, slowly started to die over time, after 4 or 5 months it completely stopped functioning.  They don't make anything like they used to I guess.

So far, 5 stars.Its almost silent. At the end where the bubble is I can hear the 60 cycle hum but at the pump I cannot.The black bits on the legs are rubber to isolate it.I was really surprised by how much air it pumps. I expected less at this price.The power cord is about 5 fee long and not grounded.

I have it in my daughter's room, and it's quite loud.  The Whisper part seemed to play in for a couple of weeks, and then I couldn't put enough padding underneath it so it doesn't cause severe acoustics with the cabinet.  Now it's going quite loud and then quiet - alternates randomly.  I'm going to toss it and get some other brand :-(

I have bought 5 Tetra whisper pumps. 4 of them arrived louder than a fridge. The 1st one, a 20, quieted down after a year and I use it on a 25 hex. It still puts out the air even though it is as quiet as the Eheim filter now. The 2nd was a 60, which I do not use because it is too loud. The 3rd one was a 40, and it arrived whisper quiet--how about that? So I quickly bought another 40 and and I could hear it from every room in the house. Thought I'd try another 40, and it was just as noisy.I saw the recommendation one guy gave that made his pump quiet. Well, it doesn't work on any of my pumps. All my pumps have their L shaped magnets in their farthest right position, and there is plenty of space between the two magnets, but the vibration of the armature is just way too noisy. You can quiet the armature by putting your finger on it, but then you can't close the case! So I have 2 quiet pumps, 2 not in use, and one that drives me crazy!The 20 is enough for 30 gallons, the 40 is enough for 60 gallons, and the 60 can drive 2 separate lines in a 60 gallon. These pumps are made sturdier than most, and I haven't had anything break on them.I've tried all the brands, and the only ones close to quiet are Tetra and Marina--sometimes. I'm going to buy another Marina 100, which will work for a few months, get noisy, and break. It's really a shame that Tetra doesn't tweak their design and make them all whisper.
These are some of the quietest and best performing budget friendly pumps we've owned. Will definitely stick to this brand when we need more in the future.

I purchased this item for a air stone. I am very happy that I did! I have read the other reviews and have to disagree with the ones that say it is noisy. I have had this item for about 2 months and you can not even hear it running! Also I have peace of mind knowing that I will have a back up should something happen to my main filter system until I can receive a replacement. Would highly recommend!

Over the past 6 months since owning this, two of the rubber feet have fallen off, there is something rattling around inside of it, and now it makes a horrible noise. And that's all from sitting on a shelf and being left on.

Sorry this pump is Not silent, quiet or a whisper!! I have had aquariums for over 20 years and have had many air pump usually to get a Silent air pump you need to spend about $30-$40. I was in need of a new one & after reading on Amazon so many post about the Tetra whisper being so quiet & silent, I thought I'd give it a try. I should have know better you can't get silence for $10.I think the other post who said it is silent never had a high quality air pump before, that sounded like trucks running so yes this Tetra will seem a little quieter. Or they have so many other noise in the room that are louder then the air pump so it seems quiet. Take it from someone who has a very quiet house & who has had expensive air pump and many air pumps this Tetra whisper is NOT SILENT!! Yes it is a little quieter then the cheap free ones you get with tank kits but not that quiet or silent.
summary: Don't be fooled it's NOT Silent!!

reviewText: after seeing so many mixed reviews, i decided to take a gamble and buy it because of its cheap price. I think it's working fine with maybe a little bit of noise, but I just use a piece of towel to cover it in order to reduce some of the noise. it's being 1-2 months now, and it still works fine, and i hardly can hear the noise at all!
Your basic overall aquarium pump; this one is reasonable priced and quiet; seems reliable and I suspect it will last well, I have had it for about 2 years or so, it has done well and still working.
summary: basic aquarium pump seems reliable and quiet

reviewText: This air pump is a solid performer, and very durable. I have multiple pumps for various setups, and all are still running just fine. Noise level is decent, though some may actually believe that these are "whisper" quiet (they're not). They're worth the money, though - just make sure you properly size the pump for your application.

I like this pump a lot! It replaced two  smaller pumps I used for my fish tanks. It's a little louder than I had hoped but it is still a great value. I have to make sure I'm running both sides wide open to keep it relatively quiet, I'm still trying to figure out a way to muffle it. I would recommend this as it is a very good quality air pump.UPDATE!I resolved my noise issues by putting my pump farm in a separate room so noise really isn't an issue anymore. I wish the manufacturers would list these units by flow rate instead of tank size ....tank size means very little to me. I was a medical equipment technician once, so I decided to do a flow rate test on the whisper units I own and here is what I found:60 Gal: 2.3 LPM on one side and 2.2 LPM on the other side, for a combined total of 5.5 LPM40 Gal: 1.7 LPM10-30 Gal: 1.0 LPM I was able to tweak the magnets and get an extra .1 LPMI just purchased a 100 but haven't received it yet but I will test it and post the results when I do. I'm not knocking these pumps they're a good value for the money and are far superior to some of the others I have. The only thing I would suggest(since there's not a lot of difference in price)is going with the bigger unit, one can always put a valve in and turn it down rather that having a whole herd of pumps (like me) and taking up so much space. The pumps are easy to work on plus parts are cheap, that and the price is why I would recommend these pumps.

I use this for my 20g and I split the flow to 4 different sponge filters, all with their own gang valve. Because I don't push through much air flow I opted for the lower model.The machine itself seems to be quiet, but it is always rattling on whatever surface I keep it on. To keep it quiet I've had to wrap it in a towel and push the towel inside all of the legs to minimize any potential movement. Once you find a good spot where it doesn't rattle, it's very quiet, but getting there is a pain.

I bought the Whisper Air for my 10 gallon tank.  If I listen, I can hear it, but it really is quiet.  The bubbles it makes is louder than the pump.  This pump doesn't come with airline tubing or an air check valve, but it does come with an air control valve.  I appreciate that.  Not all pumps have it.

I've been a aquarium hobbyist for almost 20 years, and have bought many different air pumps over the years.  Some claim to put out a lot of air, but don't.  Others claim to and do, but they are so loud that you have to place them inside of an enclosure to dampen the sound.This pump puts out sufficient air to power myMarineland Ml90490 LED Bubble Curtain, Green, 6 LED, 8-1/2 by 1-1/8-Inchwithout much noise at all.  I have this running through a gang valve for future additions.  I have other pumps that were unable to put out enough air to power this bubble curtain, this one handles it without problems.Pros:Pumps a lot of air.Quiet operation.Actually looks nice, you could set this outside the aquarium base, heck in a way I want to!Cons:It's a big pump, larger than most, it's not too big for me though, and shoud not be a problem since it's marketed for a 60 gallon tank (although I've found you really need to cut the marketed capacity down by at least a third in real world use).No color options!  Not a biggie, but wouldn't it be nice?Overall this is the best pump I have bought for the price, highly recommended.
summary: Best air pump I have bought over the years.

reviewText: what a workhorse. this pump is strong & quiet (even quieter with a filter pad under it)i own a few & am making this my go to pump as the others fail.
I use all of these on my 10 gallon aquariums for sponge filters.  They work very well and are quiet.
Ok so an air pump isn't exactly glamorous or anything, but it's a pain if it doesn't work as expected.  No worries here...this thing is quiet, works great and I loved it so much I bought two of them!
summary: Loved this enough that I bought two!

reviewText: It works very well, however it does have a persistent hum/vibrating noise. Trying to find a way to deaden it, but for the most part i love this pump!
The only problem I have with it is the fact that it is too loud.I only run it for short periods because it is rather annoying when trying to watch TV etc.It works well though.
Tetra's Whisper Air Pump is very quiet, easy to set up and quite powerful for its size.  I've got it running both a bubble wand and an aeration stone in my 55 gallon aquarium.

I have a couple others and they work very well, plus last a long time. If they loose air power just change the rubber cup inside and that ussually fixes the problem.i'm not sure why some reviewers say it's noicey, they probably have it on something that causes it to vibrate and/or move.This was a good price compared to others, especially the pet shops. I was going to change the rubber cup but since it was a good price, I decided to just buy another.

I got this for my five gallon aquarium. Its quiet - quieter than an air conditioner and produces a low hum. I forget its there. Its perfect for attaching airline tubing and attaching it to an air stone.

Received the Tetra Whisper pump from Amazon, hooked it up to my undergravel filter on my 36 gal. fish tank five months ago and it's been working great. I took someone's advice and hooked a airstone to the gang valve that the air pump supplies air to so there wouldn't be back pressure on the pump. Hope that will help prolong the life of the pump. I was so satisfied I ordered another one for a backup. There's a little hum that comes from the pump, Ive got it sitting on a old mouse pad. It seems to help.
summary: The Tetra Whisper Air pump 60 Gal.

reviewText: I purchased this pump to add supplemental air into a 10 gallon tank.  I was surprised to find out that the noise was noticeable when turned on.  I wanted to be as quite as possible so this was not as I expected.  None the less, it works and appropriate to the price I paid.
summary: Not a quite as you would think, but good enough

reviewText: pretty big, but powerful and quiet.  as strong (maybe stronger) than the tetra whisper 150. although bigger, this one outpreformed my 150.  now i have two of these hooked up a gang valve feeding 4 airlines going to a 55 and 29 gallon.

reviewerName: Pixie Power!  "... flitting around here and ...
reviewText: Okay, live and learn.  It vibrated, making noise, and we were using it for a 5 gallon aquarium to run a sponge filter.  It was too underpowered for the job. I changed out the tubing to silicone, still the same issue.

i have bought the repair kit for this pump three times already.... every few months the rubber inside breaks and the pump gets real loud and the air flow cuts in half........ spend the money and buy a better pump.....after the initial 25 dollars i have spent 15 dollars on each kit bringing the total to 70 dollars in one year..... i should have bought a better pump to start....

I read the reviews from owners who said the pump was loud but many others said it was not. AT $15 I thought it would be worth the risk.It turns out, this pump is not only loud, it gets louder when I put it in the aquarium base. Lesson learned.One final note, it's not really enough power for a 42g hex tank either.
I have a 55 gallon preformed pond and this works great for me! It has 2 outlets for air and is powerful and quiet. It also is a heavy duty product that can take a beating and not break.

I have several hudroponic gardens, and grow tomatoes, etc during the winter inside. Unfortunately, after a couple seasons, the pumps that come with the 'gardens' quit working, and so the veggies don't grow well. By adding an external pump to each garden, they are once more producing well, and these small pumps are considerly less expensive that buying replacment parts sold by the 'Aerogarden'.

Its an alright air pump for what they charged , some $12.99 .  So far its been running just shy of three months wit no real problems, only it does seem to have gott'n a bit noisier since i first plugged it in , but over all its pretty good . As long as it doesn't get any noisier, any noisier and it'll drive a fellow mad.
I use this pump on my 400 gallon fish tank I have three of them they work well they go down 42 inches I love
Bought this about 5 months ago and it is still going strong..still quiet and able to power two bubble makers in a 30 gal tanks..also, way cheaper than PETCO..

These interestingly-styled air pumps are the most inexpensive and quiet of the "vibrating diaphragm" types that I've seen in 50+ years.  "Silent" is a very subjective judgement you have to make.  If there are moving parts, chances are that there is some noise generated.  These pumps are not silent, and you certainly can hear them in an otherwise quiet room, but they for their price, volume and pressure of air pumped, they are certainly a "best buy".  I always place my air pumps in something enclosed, such as under a tank in it's cabinet, where most of the noise vibrations can be absorbed by placement and a little experimenting. Also interesting is the frequency of the sound produced that makes that "hum or vibration" you hear.  It seems that these pumps produce a lower, less obnoxious vibration than any others of the same type.  If that's true, it may be due to the design has the internal mechanisms 'suspended' inside, somehow altering (reducing, lessening) the noise.  You can't expect miracles out of something this price, but for an inexpensive mass-produced item this would be hard to beat.

Late at night, I can almost make out the necromantic rituals this evil air pump is "whispering". Some day, I half expect the bodies of my long-dead pets to rise up and eat me in my sleep. But the joke's on them, I eat a whole garlic clove every night before bed. Suck on that, animal vampires!
Definitely one of the quieter air pumps I've come across; does make a low frequency rumble despite being on padded rubber feet, but it is very quiet for what it is.

I purchased this a while back to run my sponge filters on a 20 gallon.  it is working perfectly I even had to tone down the flow a little bit by installing valves.  However this pump is quiet and fairly reliable.I have had one same model that I purchased from another retailer and the glue let loos on the pump assembly.  I fixed with super glue and its been holding for months.
summary: Great air pump for the price.

reviewText: Quiet and works great. No real complaints.It's much uglier in person though, lol. I thought it was going to look exactly as it does in the photo. The color is actually much darker blue.

I have a 10 gallon tank at work and depended on the filter to circulate and aerate the water.  Having a pump circulates the water and helps the filter pick up more stuff, creating a cleaner tank.  It took the fish a few days to get use to all of the high speed bubbles.  But now they are use to it.
summary: Good but I wish it had a regulator.

reviewText: And quieter than my last one.  My last one also overheated and burned out after a few months.  Have had this one for 6 months or so now, and still working great.

For those of you that are interested, I use 2 of these pumps for my very simple AquariPonics setup (Indoor Aquarium Aquaponics plant growing)4 Black Home Depot buckets, some basic plumbing, some growing medium & supplies, heater, pumps and one large fish tank.  Works great!!My plants and fish are very happy :)These 2 pumps are used for aerating (oxygenating) the water where the roots of my plants are, because the natural circulation from the tank isn't enough for my 4x - 5 gallon buckets. Then I have one submersible water pump in the last bucket that sends the water back into the aquarium & another Aquarium Circulation Pump for just creating circulation for my aquarium & fish.  Then the tank filter, filters the water & flows downward to the buckets again. I just adjust the pH of the tank, which is hardly ever needed because of the plants absorbing the nitrates & minerals of the tank and then it flows to the buckets.These 2 pumps alone produce quite a bit of aeration for an approximate total of (4 gallons x 4 = 16 gallons). Each pump has 2 outlets that supply air for 2 Buckets, which I then split into 2 air stones for each bucket.  As for noise.. there's  a little vibrating/buzzing sound.. but if you know about air pumps.. you know that NONE are quiet... they all make noise.. and this one is fairly quiet because of the rubber tips on the bottom.  I'm more concerned with the output. It works great, especially for the money, which means inexpensive to replace if one breaks down.
Very quiet... better than the other two I was using and can't really hear it unless I open up the cupboard it is in. Powerful too, pumps better than any one I have owned so far.

This thing has been going continuously for about three years now so i guess its time for a review. After three years i haven't noticed a drop off in output or an increase in noise so that's good. I have had it hooked up to airstones, plastic air wands, and is currently running 2 sponge filters, one in a 55 and one in a 125. You can spend alot more on an air pump but this one seems like a good mix of performance and value to me.
summary: its pretty quiet, but I'm not sure its whisper quiet

reviewText: It is very quiet as long as it is not mounted on a surface which will allow it to vibrate. I use it to power basic air strips. I would always go with a higher flow rating than your tank requires. I like how Amazon suggests the proper tubing. You will need a bit of Vaseline to lubricate the intake because the tubing needs to stretch. Also, you may want to use a pen tip to stretch the tubing to make insertion easier.
Quiet, is pumping, under ground gravel filter, air stone, and other filter with plenty of power.You can't beat the price or quality.
Guys who are purchasing from outside the US, be careful, it requires 120V, this is not clarified in the specifications. It will not work if your power supply is 220V. Actually it will be burned.
Even though it's bigger than I need this pumps works wonderfully in my 10 gallon tank and is very quiet.  I would highly recommend it.

I used tovar a Whisper pump when I was a kid.  Wow, have they stepped up their game!  This thing is truly silent.  It can't touch anything other than what it's sitting on,or it'll vibrate, otherwise,it barely whispers!
Very quiet and powerful air pumps. I have three; for my two 45 gallon tanks and for a 65 gallon freshwater tank. Never had an issue with them. I highly recommend them.

I've been running this pump for 2 months now in a 15 gallon tank pushing a 12 inch air stone and a 3 inch air disc and it's always worked adequately.  It pushes more bubbles than I really need so I actually use in-line air valves to slow the bubbles down.  I actually bought a second one for my two small tanks.
It is an airpump, I do not know what else to say, I like it, its quiet, but then again I am not using it in the house so sound is not a issue.  BUT it is still working great, so woo hoo.

Good budget air pump.  Not completely quite.  By putting it on some sort of soft surface (mouse pad??) quiets the pump down a lot.I use it for aerating a 2 gallon pail of compost tea and for that purpose it was fine.  I used the splitter enclosed with the unit to pump to two air stones to really get the pail super aerated.

This pump has held up well. I have been using it for a while now and I have not had any issues with it. It does what it's supposed to do and it does it quietly. In fact, I forget that it is there most of the time since it is so quiet. I am definitely satisfied with this air pump.
Already own a whisper for my 55 gallon aquarium and loved it and this one did not disappoint! Quiet and efficient, will definitely buy one should the need arise.

I just received this air pump and it seems to be a great value for the price. I did notice though that it does not come with airline tubing, which had I known I would've purchased it at the same time. It's somewhat quiet, and it seems to do a good job of pumping air.
summary: Reminder: Buy airline tubing, it doesn't come with it.

reviewText: Very quiet which is what we wanted. It also puts out more air than the rectangle shaped air pump my Tetra that we had. These cost about $13 at the Walmart where I'm at. Not bad for the money! I'd definitely recommend it.

I returned this air pump immediately.  The noise was unbearable.  "Whisper" is not part of this product's make up.  The air output was sufficient, but the noise it emitted could not make up for this.  Fortunately, Amazon's return policy is excellent so Amazon gets five stars but this pump gets one.
summary: The one I got was super loud...

reviewText: First, I like this pump - the price at Amazon.com and the moderately quiet operation.However, this air pump is not deadly quiet in operation. It generates low humming noise. It is natural for air pumps. I have other air pumps, and they all advertise that they are silent, but none of them are in fact silent including Tetra Whisper Air Pump.However, it is quieter than some of my other pumps. Also, the capacity of the pump also affects the noise level. I think you cannot compare the noise of a 10 gallon model to 70 gallon one. You may have lesser noise with two 10G pumps than with one 20G pumps.This 10G air pump is, at least, adequate to run 2 sets of sponge filters.
summary: There are no perfectly silent air pumps...

reviewText: I got the 10 gallon pump and the small size packs a punch. It is capable of airing a 5 and 10 gallon tank, both with air stones, plus a brine shrimp hatchery.  There's no setting to adjust the air flow so a multi-air valve is necessary.I used the plastic air valve that it came with until I replaced it with a 4 line air valve.  The unused line is used as a bleed valve to relieve excess pressure.  Even if the pump is used for one tank, I highly recommend getting a valve with multiple outlets and use a line to bleed any excess pressure.The noise is quiet enough to put it in my bedroom!  However, it needs to be placed on something to dampen the vibration.  I also recommend using a check valve to prevent water back flow in a case of a power outage.Been using it for about 6 months now.  For the price, this is a steal!
Great air pump probably more quiet then most pumps although it wasn't silent, it is very quiet and is good for up to ten gallons. It has good quality and design as well, I recommend this!
summary: Great,  but not as quiet as I hoped

reviewText: This pump is very quiet and reliable. It hasn't failed me yet. I use mine for a 5gallon tank to make sure i have proper aeration. A tip: use a towel or something soft to put under the unit. it makes it even quieter.
This pump works very well and is very quiet.  Nice low price also.  I ended up buying several of these for my 7 tanks in the house...
Works good so far. It hasn't been noisy for us. Sometimes it depends whats on the shelf next to it. It will make that item vibrate causing a loud vibration.  Fish like it.

I like this pump because it looks pretty but it does make a little noise. Of course no pump is quiet but this one is one of the quietest. It's not the medium-blue color as pictured, It's more of a navy blue. One thing though, I can't put on my desk as it slips away because of the vibration. It's not bad. I'm happy.
Have had this for a couple months. It supplies the couple of air stones I have in my tank and is quiet. No complaints.
I love this air pump. It is so much quieter than my previous one, and the two ports help alot since i have to bubblers in my tank. Will glady reccomend
These are not the original sand perches that we used to buy.  Now just plastic with some kind of grit glued on.

Larger than I thought but love it. The grit seems just right and since it's a leisurely item it's not overbearing on their sensitive feet as a well used perch would be in any grit. Nice size and perfect for my cockatiels.
We love these swings! Great way to launch ourselves across the cage! All the Kids at the Playbird Mansion. (:>)€
I bought this for my cockatiel but my jenday conure has taken a loving to it instead! We ended up getting a second for the tiels.

I thought it might fit my finch cage- But its to big- So my cockatiels get a new swing.All is well in my bird/den shelter- Recommend for Cockatiels or larger perch birds.Just as pictured- &Strudy & worth the monies.Recommend-

Much better than the throwaway cartridges, which really don't ever have enough carbon in them anyway.  I fill one with carbon and another with zeolite, changing the first at the start of the month and the second a week later.  Put that together with regular water changes and gravel vacuuming, and voila, happy fish!

Purchased this and a jumbo thing of carbon for my 350, fits well and holds about a tablespoon of carbon per little chamber, so about 10 tablespoons in total. I had been using the regular replacement cartridges but my tank was staying slightly cloudy and smelly so went back and forth between getting another filter(It's a 29 gallon overloaded with juvenile cichlids from my cracked 75 gallon), but the one on there is rated for twice the size already. I'm glad I purchased this instead. Within 3 days  my tank was crystal clear and no longer had any odor. The only thing is it is made out of very thin and flimsy plastic; I'm not sure how many times I'll be able to replace the carbon before it breaks

I ordered 2 of these for my 350 penguin hob filter, they work great, much easier and cheaper to refill these cartridges with media than going out and buying new cartridges every two to three weeks, great item to have.

These plastic box like cartridges feel flimsy and the closing tabs can break off easy. However, they are the only ones that fit the Penquin filters. You are not required to use these in the filters but I fill these with charcoal or ammonia removing pellets to give the filter system an extra boost. This really helps since I reuse the expensive blue filter pads a few times before throwing them out. Simply use a garden hose to clean the blue filter pads and fill the plastic cartridges with charcoal or ammonia removing pellets.

These are awesome products that Marineland has put out that can save you ALOT of money on replacment cartridges. Instead of buying the cartridges that you have to throw out every month or two (which can add up to a lot of money in the long  - and short run) you can buy these reusable cartridges (only made to fit pengun power filters in the 200-350 size)that will last a long time providing you don't overstuff them. These cartridges are able to be filled with any media you would like. Carbon and other chemical media work well in these or you could fill them with biological material such as eheim substrat/substrat pro or matrix bio-media. The cartridge in itself could be enough mechanical filtration along with the chemical and or biological filtration media of your choice, but I chose to make them a little more efficient and place Poly-Fil Quilt Batting in front of the cartridges (or even inside the cartridges with the filter media) and they are just as good if not better (I would argue significantly better)than the replaceable filter cartridges. Just a warning though, these cartridges are labeled as a 12-pack. THIS IS NOT SO! I do not understand why they have it listed as a 12-pack as it really only comes as one refillable cartridge. So make sure you buy enough to fill your penguin power filter (the newer model penguin power filter 200 can fit two and the penguin power filter 350 can fit four). Do yourself and your wallet/bank account a favor and upgrade your penguin 200/350 hang on back filters with these!Edit: Nice to see that they finally properly labeled these.

Update:  Works great but don't overfill.  It seems a little fragile but you only need to change it every 3 weeks or so.  I great buy!I'm trying to use these in leu on penguin size C cartridges.  They put so little carbon in the ready made ones they are kind of a ripoff.  I got a big jug of marineland carbon and a big sheet of filter floss and plan on using my own next time mine need replacement.

I wish Marineland would supply these with their power filters.The Rite-Size filters never have had enough charcoal in them.With these you can fill them with the media of your choice.They work much better then the Rite-Size Filters.Only suggestion I would have to Marineland would be a slight redesign.It would be a better product of it had 4 latchs to latch the two halves together, insead of just 2 latchs in the middle.The current design tends to make them box somewhat.
Love it. I put aqua clear biomax in these. As well as carbon. More biological filtration for my tank. Mine are sturdy but just take your time to open it.
Buy these and polyester quilt batting and your filter maintenance is practically free, plus you will filter out finer particles.

This works great.  I use this with the "Marineland PA0100 Filter Pad, 312-Square-Inch, Bonded" filter pad.  I cut my own out and snap them in.  You can also put carbon in here (it has grooves for that kind of thing).  I like it.

I breed fish to stock my aquaponics tanks, and the fry go through filters like crazy when you've got around 500 of them in one tank.
