I use this for charcoal in conjunction with washable filter media and it works great.  Greatly reduced the ammount I have to spend on filters for my nursery tank.  Now instead of replacing filters every week, I replace charcoal every few weeks and wash the filter mesh as needed.  Perfect for the set up I have right now.
I have used these to hold canister filter media in Penguin filters in order to clarify the water more efficiently.  It help make a canister-type water quality when on a limited budget.
summary: great for adding more advanced media to your penguin filters

reviewText: Great for when you need to use different types of filter media. It keeps the media spread out throughout the entire cartridge so that the water actually flows through the media and not around it. The slots in the cartridge are just the right size and it also snaps securely closed which is important. Product serves its purpose well and I would recommend it to anyone looking to save money in the long run on replacement filters. Just fill this with some charcoal or whatever else you might need, rig a filter pad thats cut down to size to the outside and your ready to go!
Great price and economical way to replace your filters!
This thing is Great!! Fits perfectly in my Filter. You can add whatever you wish into it. works great. i will purchase another.
Need this to make my own filter cartridges instead of buying the packaged ones monthly.  Easy to use and clean.
We fill this with our favorite carbon & ammonia remover pellets.Is much cheaper to re-fill than to buy new filters!
Ive used both of mine for abour 4 months with no issues.  My only gripe is the packaging and advertising. You cant reverse mbd. But it works great for me.

I guess I'm cheap (or poor, which might be what makes me cheap), but I just find it a bit hard to consider a single bulb worth $20+, but then again the price isn't what I'm reviewing.I bought one of these bulbs before, and with these type bulbs you must replace them (even if they aren't burnt out) at regular intervals of about 6 months. They will continue working, but not producing UV radiation at the required levels.I've been using them in my bearded dragon's tank since October 2011 and he's still doing fine. The bulb works and does it's job, the lizard is healthy, it arrived well packed and padded to heck and back with bubble wrap (which I appreciated). I can't see a reason not to give 5 stars.

I had done a lot of research before purchasing any UVB bulb for my tortoise's enclosure and this was by far the most recommended flourescent strip light.  You don't want to necessarily go for the cheapest with something like this because quality definitely matters and ZooMed ReptiSun is the finest quality you will find at this decent of a price.

I use them for years to provide UVB to my Bearded Dragon and she seems to get some benefit from it.  No MBD and healthy as can be.  Should not be used as the only light source as they are just to dark.  Also glass or tight metal mesh screens will filter a lot of the UVB out (glass I think 100%).  Best results with a reflector, also they need to be changed every 6-9 months as the UVB output diminishes.
summary: Works great for  my Bearded Dragon

reviewText: After doing research to determine the best UVB bulb for my Beardie's 55 gal habitat, I purchased the Zoo Med ReptiSun 10.0 from Amazon at the lowest price I was able to find. Great bulb at a great price and Amazon's speedy shipping made the purchase even more favorable!

reviewerName: Shawna T. Live Healthy & with Compassion :) "...
reviewText: I have a 8 yr old 12lb redfoot tortoise "SAGE" that i have had since she was 4wks old and the size of half a hardboiled egg.. I did my research and know how important UVB is to her health since she is kept in a indoors without real sunlight..I have always used this lamp replacing it every year with a new one. Sage has a perfect smooth shell with no scute deformity at all and is very healthy and active..I will continue to use this lamp for her. Better price on amazon than in the local stores and shipped to my door..PERFECT!
summary: Using this lamp for 8yrs for my REDFOOT tortoise.Perfect

reviewText: I have the extra large little boxes. These liners are perfect for them. They make changing the litter a breeze! Even my 13 pound orange tabby can't make holes in it!

I have used this brand before and they used to make the plastic much thicker, a much more high quality, high MIL plastic.  I initially tried using two bags, and that was ripped up in no time.  Next, I tried three bags, and that was still ripped up very quickly.  Seeing as how this whole pack only has 8 bags in it, it almost seems as if I need to use all 8 bags on every litter box change.  At $8+ for the pack, I can't see myself using this again.  Unfortunately, I don't know of any other good options other than switching to construction grade high MIL plastic and making liners myself.
summary: good size, but plastic is much too thin

reviewText: This does help keep the litter box clean but needs the draw string to be drawn tight for it to be most effective.Definatly do recommend these liners for a clean litter box.

This liner fits just fine on the jumbo litter box I got. It has a pull string in the side and can be tightened, but after a while it gets loose with the cats pulling the bag into the box. It was an easy fix by using two binder clips to keep the bag in place.

Petmate Drawstring Hi-Back Litter Pan Liner, Jumbo, 8-PackThis fits all my large litter boxes, terrificHowever I have looked at three liners and can not for the life of me find how to  get to the drawstring.  I have looked carefully, check the plastic around the drawstring, pulled and poked at the plastic.Surprised to see they are clear plastic. Hope they work as expected. The other liners from the market were just trash bags,don't know if In would recommend these of try a different brand because of pull string. Have old cat and she pees a lot and we buy tons of litter:(a few weeks have passed:Picked up liner to put in trash and it shredded to pieces. One litter box had urine under bag and it had clumpimg litter :(this product goes on my do not buy list
summary: OK niw how do I get to the drawstring ?

reviewText: I have a high back petmate litter box and these liners didn't fit as well as I thought they would. Sure, they fit, but it's not a snug or secure fit. I liken it to using a plastic grocery bag to line the waste basket in your bathroom - it works, but it's not a perfect fit. Also, the plastic was thinner than I expected and my cats tore holes in several places. I think this product does not work well for scoopable litter because the liner just doesn't hold up to the scooping and scraping. Maybe if you're using clay litter and you just change the whole box often, this would be a good product for you.

I've been buying these liners for over a decade.  The quality has decreased a bit but I've tried other alternatives and I always come back to these.They don't really fit the shape of the tray properly and the drawstring doesn't tighten up to prevent kitty from scratching the plastic over the litter when trying to move litter.  Also, I gave up on keeping the lid on while using the liners because they get in the way of the parts that lock the top to the bottom.However, now that I have only one kitty and he's very neat in the litterbox, I'm happy using these.  I don't have to change them every week and he does not have the habit of tearing at the plastic trying to clean his paws.  With two active kitties I had to resort to cutting visqueen and using bungee cords to secure it to the tray.  Otherwise they would tear through the liners (even if I used several at a time) and I would have to scrub the tray out every week.I also use them to line my "temporary" second cat box, which has proven to be just as sturdy as the Petmate plastic litter box.  They fit fine in the LARGE Kitty's WonderBox, which is an excellent, sturdy, disposable solution to scrubbing a plastic box if you have several cats, messy cats, or medical issues where you need to keep the box absolutely sanitary at all times.  The Petmate liners and the large Kitty's WonderBox are a great pairing.  I haven't thrown away the WonderBox in months, thanks to the liners.
summary: Not the quality it was years ago but it does the job better than generics.

reviewText: First off, love the subscribe and save option and the fact that 12 come in a pack. 3 months and I'm good to go. It's not like the hotdog and bun purchase dilemma where there are extras. We use feline pine and these and my wife changes it out once a week, no issues, cats love it. We have been told that cats don't like to have plastic bin liners by a shelter, bullocks I say.
These fit the high back litter pan perfectly.  My husband (who is the major litter box maintenance person) says he likes the shape and performance.

Other reviewers have commented that the plastic is so thin it can be torn with your hand. This is true. But I've learned to open each liner carefully, and I use enough litter that it is very rare for a cat to tear through the bottom. With 14 pounds of clumping litter in the box, the cats don't reach the bottom to create a tear, except once in a blue moon. The best thing about the liner is that it is much taller than necessary, creating a large border outside the litter box. I use a covered high-back box, and turn up this excess border outside to catch any spillage from cats who urinate into the space between the lid and the lower box, and that works fine. I'm not happy about the price, which is nearly 8 times as expensive as a large kitchen trash bag, but the high back litter boxes are too large for such bags and I feel stuck with this. I would like to see two things in future: an economy-sized box of 50 liners for a serious discount, and a thicker plastic.

I own two Petmate jumbo highback litter pans. I put 20 lbs. of litter in the pan each time I clean it. The liners fit well. They allow for a quick, healthy cleanup.1/14 Update- We joined Amazon's Subscribe & Save program. Now we save 15 percent!

I ordered these bags in hopes of simplifying the litter removal process but instead it's created more of a headache than anything else. The size of the bags is great but it's not very strong. My cats end up scratching right through it as the paw at the litter to cover up their stuff causing holes in the bags and just a big mess every time I replace the litter. I've tried more expensive bags but since they're so pricey I figured I've give these a shot, big mistake. Unfortunately, I'll have to stick to the more expensive bags.

I have the high back litter box, and regular kitchen trash bags just don't fit it... these are perfectly fit for them!!  Throw one of these in and load in the litter... easy to pull out and empty!!  I get the automated refill program with these... so I never run out!  I can usually go several weeks between changing the bag (as long as I scoop regularly).
While the eggs were a big hit, the platypus did not hold up at all. Stout enjoyed pulling out all the doll's hair until we threw away its limp carcass.

That's like 6 toys for the same amount money on sale. Beware eggs are tan and easy to lose in a field. My dog destroys plushes in 5 to 15 mins....she would have killed this but I take it away when she starts ripping the legs off. Loves chasing the eggs though.

I got three of these as gifts -- the Platypus, Dragon and Duck.All three appear to be very well made, and look like they're going to be a lot of fun. They were larger than I expected about 10" or so long -- and the squeakers appear to be fairly standard. Once the dogs to whom they are gifted have fun destroying them, I'll post an update on their durability.

I bought this for my boy, a 3 y/o Pekingese. He goes bonkers for squeaky toys of all type. At first he had some problems getting the egg out. So I loosened it by putting in 2 instead of the 3 eggs. It took him a while to dig it out...and he was getting really frustrated with platypus...I can tell. But then, he got an egg!  And boy oh boy, you should have seen my boys..he went scramblign away and hid underneath the bed with his egg and i didn't see him for a few hours...  I also started stuffing biscuits inside along with the egg. It really does keep them busy and they don't lose interest.

Don't believe that's the fault of the toy itself but it certainly isn't very tough.  He still plays with the furry, squeaky eggs and the empty-shelled, faceless, flipperless Platypus but he never played with it as intended.  (digging the eggs out of the elasticized belly)
summary: My dog tore the bill off in seconds...

reviewText: This platypus fell apart in record time.  The eggs are still around though.  Even though the actual platypus is long gone, I stuff the eggs into the 'hide a squirrel' trunk for extra things for the dog to pull out.  The working eggs are not enough for me to give this platypus an extra star, though.
This is a really fun toy, but we only bring it out to play with TOGETHER with our dog - otherwise they would easily and likely rip it apart.

I've purchased multiple "hide n find" toys for my dog and this is the simplest by far, but she loves it most! It keeps her entertained for 10-30 minutes and I love that we can play this together while I'm occupied with other things. The key to keeping a toy like this exciting for your dog is to keep it out of reach except for when you are available to play it with your pup (i.e.  put the eggs back in after s/he gets them all out.) If I left it in her care unsupervised, she'd be apt to destuff and desqueak the eggs out of boredom and it would definitely cease to be special to her. In regards to others saying the hole is too small, please give your dog time to figure it out. If the hole were any bigger, it wouldn't be challenging. The dog can do it--no matter their size. They may just need more modeling from you. Take the egg out and squeak it, then stuff it back in and squeak the belly. Do this several times if your dog is just getting to know the "rules of the game". Eventually s/he should get it and it will soon be clear to you that the size of the hole is not an issue.

Worth every cent the platypus has lasted a year, which is an amazing time for a toy to last 3 dogs, a Havanese, Maltese and Chihuahua as these little dogs love to shake, throw, pull and twist and they just loved the hide and go seek the eggs inside the platypus. The eggs are still alive as well they toss them and the platypus up in the air and just have a ball with it. Just like the beehive toy they make and hide a squirrel. ... you won't be wasting money buying these and you can buy refill eggs if needed. We reorder them every year
summary: Worth every cent the platypus has lasted a year, which is an amazing time for a toy to last 3 dogs

reviewText: Truly.  My dog destroys all toys and regardless of reviews I thought this plushy stood on chance...I stand corrected.  She loves the egg thing.  It's still survived weeks later.  An enigma.
your dog will never get the eggs out of this thing. the hole is entirely to small. the hide a squirrel is a much better option so go with that

She tore the fur out as though it were her mission in life, but it survived.  The Velcro closure is very secure, and I was able to replace the eggs with a voice box from one of her talking toys.  She uses it with supervision, but hasn't been able to get it out of the toy.

This toy was a gift for our husky for Christmas and she loved it and quickly chewed the stuffing out of both eggs in mama playpus to get at the squeakers. We took them away, and she continues to chew the mama playpus. This is basically shredded after 2 days, but she still likes to carry around the carcass. I knew when I bought it that it probably wouldn't last long, so I can't say I'm too disappointed.

My little miniature Labradoodle loved this toy and caught on right away how to get the "eggs" out.  Unfortunately she also after about a week got all the stuffing out the of toy.  However, she still loves and plays with the "eggs".I call them potatoes. She will run around with them, and since they are not really round, they bounce around when she drops them. She will chase them for hours.  You do get five with the toy.  As she destroys each one I give her another.  But when all five eggs are gone I will not be buying this toy again.

It's like six toys in one.  Eggs get scattered, but when they are put back in - it's a frenzy of wrestling with it to get them out again.  He plays fetch with all parts of the toy.Seems to be quite durable.  We've played tug with it and it's holding up after a month of daily use.UPDATE - 12/11 After  a few months, he did break into the stuffing in the beak and had to retire it until I can repair the poor thing.
summary: My Dog Loves this!  (Did need repair after a few months)

reviewText: I was eager to see how my Golden, Meg, would react to this toy.  She loves new "babies."  Her reaction to this toy was underwhelming.  She took it in her mouth, but that was about it. No interest at all in the eggs.  I even followed the directions that are attached to the toy. It does appear to be well-made, and I like the fact that it is washable. The exception is the squeakers--two of the squeakers in the eggs did not work right out of the box, so that was a disappointment, especially since my dog loves to squeak her toys. Five eggs arrive with the toy (that's two extras), but one would hope that all of the squeakers would work.UPDATE:  after a few weeks, Meg has warmed up to this toy. She's still not quite sure what to do with the eggs once she has them out of the toy, but seems to like the furry texture. I'm upgrading my evaluation to four stars.  Still not happy that the squeakers in the eggs didn't squeak, but I will say that the main part of the toy has held up well, especially given that my dog must take a stuffed animal with her every time she goes outside, so this one has made the trip outside dozens of times now.
My Shiba is a bit picky for plush toys but she loves the squeeky balls the best and there are quite a few of them.  Unlike the squirrel log which as fewer squirrels.

In order for this product to work effectively you must take the time to train your dog how to use it.To train your dog you have to show it that the eggs hide inside the pouch. When I first tried I could tell my Siberian Husky was simply thinking "I'll bite it there. Then toss it over there. Chase it down! Bite it again. This is going to be so fun... why is he hogging it... I want it!"Instead of the bland eggs I ordered "Kyjen Squeakin' Animals Replacement Squirrels for Hide-A-Squirrel Toy, 3-Pack - Large" which also fit inside the pouch. They have more contours, curves, and a fuzzy tail that my dog seems to enjoy more thoroughly.
summary: Requires training for dog to "get it" (aka bonding time)

reviewText: Bought this for my then 7 week German Shepherd. Adorable! The platypus has 3 squeaking eggs you shove into his belly.. My dogs (a black lab and 2 shepherds) loved sticking their snouts in the hole to dig out the eggs. It's definitely lasted longer than some other plush toys we've gotten. Sadly, the platypus lost his life 7 months after entering our home after an epic battle of tug-of-war. I thought it was the cutest toy, though, so now I'm thinking about buying another one! The eggs are still intact and good. I would recommend this toy, but for supervised play.
summary: So cute and fun.. while it lasted!

reviewerName: B. Smith "The giant on whoms shoulders your c...
reviewText: It wasn't difficult at all to train her how to remove the eggs and she loves doing it. She can no get them out nearly as fast as I can put them in. The squeakers in the eggs do not last at all though. I think she had them all broken within minutes. The eggs themselves seem to last pretty well. She has destroyed a couple of them removing the squeakers but for the most part she just loves playing with them. The hardest part was teaching her not to pull on the inside of the platypus once all the eggs had been removed. Over all, it is a great interactive activity that will keep you and your dog occupied for quite some time. Guests love to watch her play with it too. The only drawback to this toy is that it does require a fair amount of supervision as most do.

My Japanese Chin loves toys and I thought she'd really like this one but she doesn't.  The balls are difficult for her to pull out.  I also bought the squirrels toy and she loves that one and will take them out as fast as I put them in!  I'm disappointed with the platypus because it IS hard to get those eggs out.

Willow loves her Platy and carries it around a lot of the time.  She loves the eggs because they squeak so loudly!  Also, the eggs have lasted a lot longer than I thought they would!  Whatever they are made of, they are pretty resilent to Willow's mouth.  The only thing is that it takes longer to put the eggs in Platy than it does for her to remove them!  We usually just throw the eggs around and have her get them, and use Platy as another carry toy.

This toy is much smaller than I thought, which was good in my case, perfect for my 15 lb. Cavachon. As others have said, the hole is small for the "eggs" and it's hard for dogs to get them out, however my dog enjoyed the "eggs" as balls and the platypus as a separate toy.  The" Hide-a-squirrel" toy  is better for trying to get the squirrels out as the holes are larger. We have both and my dog has enjoyed both toys, a lot. They are durable and last a long time.

I don't know if I just got a bad one, but this toy was SO dang flimsy. I have one dog who guts toys and one who treats them like babies. Even cheap, seemingly poorly made toys will last a LONG time with him, normally only developing tears/holes after months if not years (yes, his babies are kept locked away from his destructive "sister"). I bought this platypus mostly because I thought he might like the game of finding the eggs. He's not the brightest bulb in the bunch and absolutely did not understand it-- but my dog's lack of problem-solving skills is not why I'm rating this poorly. Why then? Because every single egg we were sent developed giant tears in a matter of days. He was NOT at all rough on them, they were just sewn very poorly. Did he, despite his absolute confusion about the "game", enjoy carrying around the platypus and eggs (well, once we freed them for him, anyway)? Yes, he did... and that's why it gets two stars instead of one. But having all the eggs split open and start oozing stuffing after such a short time, when this dog can leave a dollar store stuffed animal unmarred for months, was a vast disappointment. For this reason alone, I wouldn't recommend this toy.

The dog thought it was a regular squeaky toy at first. until i showed him How to take out the eggs. Oh my you should see his face! I probably would have the same face if I saw aliens, or ATM machine popping out a million dollars cash. The toy is sturdy, the dog tried to pluck the fur as usual, and it held up decent. The belly opening is very tight, so it takes some work for the dog to get to the eggs, that's good. Only complaint is that the eggs are not well made, fabric tears easily and filling exposed. Good that it came with extra replacement eggs
summary: Should see Doug's face when eggs are taken out

reviewText: Bought this for Christmas for my three dogs and they had a blast with it. Very durable and well made. The pooches loved the little squeaking eggs. Eventually my avid chewer did create a hole and pull out the stuffing, but the dogs played with it even without the stuffing. I will definitely be getting another.
summary: Well made and the dogs loved it!!

reviewText: My two dogs did love it, but the front foot came off immediately, with very little tugging by them.  They do tug between each other, but they have other toys that don't tear up so easily.sorry it's not a well made dog toy

I thought my whippet pup would really enjoy this toy. He is crazy aboutKyjen PP01056 Hide-A-Squirrel Pet Toy, Largeand I thought he would also enjoy shaking the thunder out of the platypus and having the squeaky eggs roll out. Well, he likes the platypus all right and he is crazy about the different squeaks of the eggs but he can't for the life of him figure out that the eggs are in the critter. (They are really tight in there and even removing all but one egg, they aren't going to fall out easily.)  I have shown him over and over again but he just does not "get it". Oh well, until he wises up I will just continue playing throw the critter, then throw the egg and so on with him.Recommended.
summary: Great idea but the pup doesn't "get it"

reviewText: My dogs loved this and I was pleased with the size and construction. They took to it right away which pleased me,
summary: Nice size and Dogs love it

reviewText: if it wasn't a lightning deal and my dog didn't like the 'eggs', I would return it.Why don't I like it? It's badly made and ill-conceived.The toy - along the lines of hide-a-squirrel, I thought - has a pocket in the platypus to hide three eggs. Thing is, the opening - which is NOT elasticized, as advertised - isn't large enough to allow a dog (and trust me, my dog is persistent) to get the objects out of the toy.So, I recommend you buy the hide-a-squirrels or the variations thereof, and NOT this toy.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE this toy!  BUT HATE HATE HATE that one of my dogs ripped it all up!  I have three dogs.  They LOVE this toy!  They feel so special when they find the egg!  You can see how happy and pleased they are with themselves.  However, my terrier mix loves to rip and destroy!  I bought 3 of these toys for Christmas and by the end of the first day MOST of the eggs were history!  Within a few days she had torn new holes in them or made the "egg hole" even bigger which defeats the purpose...felt really disappointed because all the fun was done and gone and so was $30.  I'm not talking about a big dog either.  Just REALLY wish these toys were made more durable!  I LOVE the idea!  MY dogs LOve them, but I will not be buying them again until I feel like I can get more use from them...I would pay more for better quality!Debbie in Colorado

I bought this for my Akita, who loves plush toys and does not tend to be destructive with them.  This is by far his favorite toy, and he's had it over a year, and has not destroyed it yet, nor have the two Shiba Inus he lives with.  They find something very satisfying about digging out the "eggs" and it seems to be enough for them so they don't try to rip up the toy too.My Akita is 120 pounds, but is not a destructive chewer.  He looks pretty silly carrying the eggs around in his mouth, but he does!  I like to rotate toys so they don't get too bored with stuff, and as soon as this toy comes out again, he grabs it and hides it upstairs, because he doesn't want one of the other dogs to get it.  He's really crazy about it!I wouldn't recommend this for a strong chewer or a dog who had a history of tearing up plush toys, but if your dogs plays well with other toys, and enjoys ripping out the stuffing of other toys, he may find this a satisfying toy instead.

I bought this for my hyperactive small mutts and they love him. It took them both over a month to figure out that the 'eggs' inside could be ripped out squeak all over the house. I am so happy it came with two more 'eggs' to replace the others that were stripped open and every piece of stuffing was removed. Great toy for dogs who need a lot of things to do during the day while I am at work they can play without ripping the house up.
summary: Platpus is popular in my house!

reviewText: My two dogs absolutely love this toy. It's big, durable, and priced incredibly low compared to other dog toys. An all-around good value! I have two Labradoodles, one 100 lbs. and the other 40 lbs. This toy is big enough for them to play tug-o-war and durable enough that they haven't ripped it to shreds yet. I have demonstrated for them how the eggs come out. I simply pull one of the eggs out, squeak it, and put it back in the slit. They LOVE working to get the eggs out. One of my dogs is obsessed with balls  and tosses around the eggs like a ball once he gets it out. I highly recommend this toy and am very pleased with the purchase.
cute adorable, well made. lots of hours of fun. love watching my dog try to get his eggs out of him. Highly recommended.
Really cute dog toy.........Kyjen Egg Babies Dog Toy, Original Series, Platypus.....Loved this...but...I now only buy stuffing-less toys ....if not I'd buy another one...

Our puppy likes the eggs a lot, and has loved other toys like this where there is a hidden smaller toy in a large toy, but it's just impossible to get the eggs out.  I can hardly do it myself. It's hard to get them in as well.  He's working on tearing a bigger hole in it...so maybe it will eventually work for its intended purpose.  For now he'll just continue to play with the eggs and eat off the fur.

My dogs, 2 poms and a boxer puppy, love these things.  They just don't hold up very well.  The eggs are the first thing to go and I have to watch them carefully and take the eggs as soon as I see they have broken through to the squeaker so they don't choke.  After they have destroyed the eggs, they then start in de-stuffing the platypus.  So disappointing buying toys for my dogs!

My dog loves this toy, but loves the egg balls even more.  She will carry eggs in her mouth (2 or 3 at the time), she will play and squik, she will fetch them, she will put them under furniture and then wants me to take them out... Soft toys are much better for the mouth and teeth than hard tennis balls, so I am very satisfied with this toy.  THe opening was a little tight, so it took her over a month to learn how to take the ball out, and how to pull it without pulling the entiere toy, but now she can take out 3 balls within minutes.  I assume it improved her skills.  The bad: each egg sounds and feels a little different, not sure why, some feel more durable than others.  They could be a little more durable one broke open after 1 day, 1 was fixed, 3 are good, with visible signs of wear, but they are still holding up after 2.5 months.  Definitively 5 stars considering it's a favorite and it lasted 2.5 months.  I wish I could buy egg balls in the same colors, but can't find them.

I have to thank the folks who recommended this.With some trepidation I bought this for our dog back in December (my son likes to give him Christmas gifts).  He is a large dog (a German Shepherd/ Border Collie mix) who has destroyed every to which has entered the house, save a rubber kong chew toy (which he is not too fond of).  While he didn't seem very interested in the 'find the eggs' game, he LOVES the toy, both the platypus and eggs.  It has turned our 11 year old dog back into a puppy.  The platypus goes almost everywhere he goes.  He greets each of us (on arriving home) with  it in his mouth.  He cries awfully when he loses it under the stairs.  Remarkably it has hekd up for 4 months, and even now is still half here. Ultimately he managed to tear the tail off, and was unhappy when my husband threw it away (maybe he was trying to make himself a second toy?).  He still plays with the tail-less platypus, and the stuffing has not come out.I came back to buy him another because he loves it so, even though he still has 3/4 of the original toy.  I am hoping it does not confuse him to have 2.  I wanted to make sure that we at least have a back up if anything happens to the one he has.  It really makes him happy, and friskier!This is a very well made and sturdy toy.  Nothing else has lasted so long, or made him so happy. Highly recommended!

Great value and my 65 lb. Golden Retriever loves it. She's not very destructive toy-wise, but I still supervise her with all toys. As long as you supervise your dog, there should be no issues with the toy being destroyed. You DO have to watch though; this is a very soft, plush toy and is not rated for tough chewers.

Bought this as a replacement for the previous egg baby that my dog ripped to shreds. That one has lasted since he was a puppy (he's now 1 1/2), but this one was destroyed in less than a week. Maybe the quality has been compromised? Not sure if I'd buy again.

Needed a durable toy that would keep our 6 month old lab/german shorthair busy.  This toy kept her entertained, she figured out the puzzle right away, but on day 4 she chewed a second opening for the eggs and on day 5 it was in multiple pieces.  She loved it, but it didn't last long.  We are still getting some entertainment value out of the squeaky eggs.  Super fun if our pup wasn't Destructo Dog.
summary: Not durable for a big time chewer

reviewText: My 7 pound yorkie absolutely LOVES these plush toys with eggs! This is his second one. We love interactive toys because they are more stimulating for our very active, energetic, and inquisitive 3 year old yorkie. the other great part of this toy is the the eggs. i am not sure what it is about the eggs that come buried in these plush toys, but our dog absolutely LOVES them! I think its how small they are and how lightly weight they are but the eggs are his self selected go to fetch toy. and he loves squeaking them. Also, these have held up remarkably well given how much our dog plays with them. great quality. highly recommended.

Well, my Beagle loves herself some stuffed toys. She literally seeks to kill and destroy them! There is no foreplay, she just immediately starts tearing them apart, piece by piece!  Poor Platypus was no different.  He only lasted about six minutes with her, and he was full of holes, and squeakers deflated and destroyed.  When I purchased this I did not realize the Platypus' egg babies were replacement squeakers. What a fantastic idea! I was excited thinking this toy might last a little longer, but poor Platypus is so full of holes that the replacements are useless.  If you have a more gentle dog, this might be a good toy for you.  If you have an aggressive chewer who seeks to destroy all things fluffy, I suggest you find another toy.
summary: Only took 6 minutes for the 15lb Beagle to kill Platypus!

reviewText: My puppies just love this toy.  My pups are 6wk old rottweiler puppies and will grow with toy.  The toy is about the same size as the puppies, but they still love killing the poor thing!

My 25 week old, 25 lb puppy likes every new toy, but this one has been her favorite for two weeks. It took her about a week to discover the egg babies in the pouch, but once found, she is a focused demon when working to get them out. Though it takes her way less than a minute to pull them out now, she then continues to play with the soft eggs, batting them around, making them squeak, etc. I think the fact that there are 3 increases the fun - she can't figure out which to grab and run with next.I'm impressed that the platypus pouch in its stomach, into which the eggs are stuffed, has stayed so tight. I sometimes thinks it takes me longer to stuff them back in than it takes her to yank them out. She and her neighbor puppy have also played "catch me if you can" with the empty platypus quite a few times and so far (knock on wood) no real damage. The toy came with 2 extra eggs and so far, I haven't needed to use them  because two of the three original eggs still squeak!The size of the soft balls (a.k.a. eggs) are about tennis ball size, so fine for her at this age & size, but I would not recommend this toy for a larger dog.*** UPDATE ***I still love this toy & it continues to be my (now 16 month old) dog's favorite. I have bought a couple of replacements & several packs of replacement "eggs". But perhaps the toy should also come with a warning? It appears that this toy has taught my dog to search for/extract the squeakers out of EVERY squeaking toy! No matter the toy, she now locates the squeaking units & tears/digs until she can pull 'em out. Basically, this falls into the "be careful what you ask your dod to learn" ... because she will!!!! (LOL)
summary: Huge hit with my puppy: hours of fun & very durable *Warning Added*

reviewText: This toy is pretty durable.  The only thing is the eggs are kind of ugly and once your dog pulls them out within a few seconds you got to put them back in and then repeat over and over.

First, let me say that this toy is very durable, given the nature of the toy (where the dog tries to get the "eggs" out") this is a good thing.The toy comes with 5 "eggs" (balls), which is plenty to have a bunch of spares should they got lost or destroyed. Speaking of the "eggs" I don't know if there is some sort of catnip effect or whatever but my dog really loves them and is driven to try and get them out of the toy. Perhaps my dog is too large 50-60lbs to get the "eggs" out of the toy but try as he might he can't get them out, it's not really easy for people to get the eggs out either, it's fairly tight.For the price of this toy, this is really a no-brainer. Even if you dont want the hide and seek egg part of the toy you can still use all the "eggs" as balls to play catch with and just use the toy as a regular toy. It really is a great toy.
summary: Very Durable and My Dog Loves It!

reviewText: I love this toy (it's cute), and my dog loves it. He hasn't quite gotten how to get the eggs out but he enjoys playing with the eggs and animal separately. He'll run around the house, squeaking the eggs in his mouth, or play fetch with them, as if they are balls. He loves shaking the animal in his mouth. The problem is he will also lay down and tug at the animal with his teeth until it comes apart, and the stuffing in the head comes out, then he will eat the stuffing. This usually happens within 2 weeks of buying the toy. Pretty long-lasting for his standards, but not long enough to spend $5-10 each time. We've gone through 2 platypuses so far. Once the price comes down, we'll probably get him another since he loves it so much, even though he does destroy it pretty quickly.

I have two yorkies, one doesn't care too much about it. He will join in occasionally on the play, but my little girl LOVES it! She will pick the egg that she likes and fetch it none stop! We got the hedgehog, shark, and turtle. I'm giving 4 stars because the opening of the hedgehog are a little too tight/small for them to get the egg. This sometimes results in them just biting the hedgehog. Fur on the back of the hedgehog, in bits, can come off when pulled. I would recommend others without the the fur on back, such as turtle & shark. I can also see some the threads near the opening so I had to cut them off. Overall, great item!
summary: My little girl LOVES the egg babies!

reviewText: Our dog is NOT one who must tear the stuffing out of all of her toys. She's not a destroyer. So when we got her this, she was content just playing fetch and tug with it, and squeaking away on it like a normal toy. It took us showing her a couple times how you can take the squeakers out for her to get the hang of it. Now she still plays with it normally, but will also pull the squeakers out sometimes.I was concerned that once the found out how fun it was to take the insides out of this toy, she'd do it to others. That doesn't seem to be the case yet. The only annoying thing about the toy is finding the eggs after she gets them out and the inevitably roll under the couch or something. But if you do lose one, it comes with an additional set of eggs (and you can buy more), which is definitely nice. I'm planning on buying another of these (it's annoying that the animals are all different prices) for a friend whose dog IS a "get the squeaker out of everything" dog. It really is a smart toy!

This is a cute idea for a toy and I was really excited to see how our German Shepherd/ Siberian Husky mix would like it. It did not even last an entire day. The next morning, it was torn to shreds. He definitely understood the concept of getting all the eggs out, but he did it the only way he knew how, he tore the whole thing apart. Its a cute idea though, maybe just not for my dog. :)

My 40-pound black lab puppy loves this toy.  It is his favorite. The product is very sturdy and withstands lots of chewing. The squeekers eggs are fun and he loves to dig them out of the platy and chase them around the house. Highly recommend all of the Kyjen toys.

We have three dogs, and our latest puppy introduced us to the world of hide-away type toys. He is particularly fond of this one. We not only hide the eggs, but we also hide treats underneath the eggs to make it even more exciting.We are grateful Kyjen opted to provide the toy with five eggs, as we ended up losing two.The toy is pretty strong, considering what its purpose is. The only wear and tear I've seen is a little threading being pulled around the the egg opening. However, I would not recommend this toy for a dog who likes to rip apart toys or for an enthusiastic chewer. Money is not well-spent if the toy is destroyed in two minutes.

Poor Mrs. Platypus was torn limb from limb soon after my dog got her. Her eggs, however, live on, possibly because they are so deliciously squeaky. My dog is a rough collie mix, a medium-sized guy, but he had trouble getting his nose into the toy to grab the eggs. A better toy for small dogs, I guess.

I have a smart gorgeous little Cavachon from foxglovecavachonpuppies.com.Yes, a shameless plug because my precious little 1 1/2 year old Anoush is like nodog I've had before, and I've had dogs my whole life :).Anoush loves fetching her Platypus.  The eggs that came with it and the extras Ipurchased seem a tight fit to get out.  It holds 3 at a time. However Anoush lovesretrieving them much like a ball.  I also use the eggs in her Hide-A-Squirrel toy.In her Platypus I keep an egg in it and put a treat or rawhide for her to get out.A quality toy!

My boxer dog is gonna love this toy for christmas.  I let them "preview" their gifts before christmas to get them excited and Reese loved it.  He is a 2 yr old boxer and loves to play with toys.  It looks pretty durable and they give you 3 extra eggsto replace? the other eggs when they wear out?
summary: 1 egg inside does not have working squeaker

reviewText: I am a sucker for rare animal stuffed toys. My dog has all kinds of animal toys but when I saw the platypus, I had to have it for Daisy. The platypus looks like a duck met an otter and is so cute and so unusual in nature (it lays eggs and is a poisonous mammal?! How strange and wonderful!)BUT--this toy has eggs inside a stitched pouch and these are the squeakers. One is inside, the other two are in a net bag as spares. If you have squeaky toys for your pet, you know that after a lot of chewing, the squeaker goes silent, and if you wash the toy, that happens sooner. So, are the toy eggs suitable for my 55lb standard poodle? I don't think so--they are the size of duck eggs or goose eggs, and what if she should swallow them --they look like a choking hazard at a little under 3" in diameter. I'm not even THINKING about giving her the eggs alone. One egg comes inside the toy, and it's stitched in. So I just basted the opening shut more securely with buttonhole thread.  When the squeaker goes, I can rip the stitches and put in the replacement. But I would not think of giving her access to the egg to play with.I will say, it's her favorite toy. She sleeps with it under her chin and even right now as I write this, she has discarded her previous favorite (a gingerbread man) to go upstairs to her bed to retrieve the Platypus. She carries it all around the house and she truly enjoys it.  I hope to find other toys like this for her--I know she prefers soft toys (poodles are kind of a bird retriever and this one seems to want to carry and chew on soft, bird-like toys.)So, if you get this, and your dog is bigger than a mini-dachshund, I'd sew the opening shut with strong, waxed thread or failing that, take out the egg entirely.
summary: Dog LOVES this toy but I don' t love the size of the eggs

reviewText: Somehow my 7 mth old GR didn't like this as much as the Hide A Squirrel toy. I think its because it's rather difficult to take the eggs out of the belly. What I did was to reverse the game by putting the eggs in the treehouse in the Hide A Squirrel toy and put the squirrels in the belly of the platypus which makes it easier for him. I think this two toys play to his instinct of "rescuing" the hidden objects so he has been having fun playing with them for the past 3 days.

Our puppy isn't in love with this toy, but she currently has so many options.  Once some of her original toys get chewed up, I will revisit this review.  The toy seemed to be good quality but like I said she hasn't played with it so I can't rate either bad or good.

I had the red dinosaur version, which was wonderful and lasted several years.  My Lab and Border Collie enjoyed taking out the eggs and did not destroy the toy, as they do other stuffed toys.  After several years, the dino did need replacing.  Tried the platypus, but the opening is so small that I can hardly pull an egg out myself.  I'm returing it for a different version.  Perhaps this is why the platypus was the cheapest.

The eggs are too soft and the possibility of a lab dog swallowing it was our problem. Within 45 minutes of having this toy, the dog didn't want to give up the eggs. We ended up believing she swallowed one and made her throw up and then took her in for surgery early to get her spay and paid extra have them search her G.I. tract and stomach for an egg!

My dog usually destroys stuffed animals over time (after first snuggling with them and carrying them around), and these suffer no different fate, but before their destruction he spends hours and days fishing out eggs and begging us to put them back in for him. (I'd actually recommend having two on hand at a time, so you can stuff one while he pulls out the eggs from the other.) So he got the point and these last a while longer than other stuffies. They're inexpensive enough that I can afford to replace them every several weeks.The eggs, though, are the best part. They are the BEST toy I have found for letting small children-- especially toddlers!-- play with the dog. The kids fling the light, squeaky, plush eggs all over the room, without worry of injury to people, pet, or property, and the dog goes crazy for them. He has not yet destroyed a single egg, and I'm excited at the prospect of amassing an arsenal of these things, so the babies can just sit next to a pile of them and go wild.Only complaint is that the, uh, egg hole on the mother is really small and it's hard to stuff the eggs back inside. I can usually only get one in at a time. I have no clue how the dog gets them out.

I originally bought the Kyjen eggs all by themselves to see if my dogs would rip them apart or not, and I was amazed that they loved the eggs but didn't rip them up. I think it has something to do with the size of them, they sit perfectly in the mouth and they're a bit hard to get a hold of with their paws to rip them up. When the platypus toy with the eggs went on sale, I jumped at the chance to get the dogs another exciting toy.Two out of three of my dogs actually like toys, my oldest doesn't have any interest at all. The other two just adore the platypus! They take it with them everywhere, from room to room, out the doggie door, all around the town. They sleep with it, eat with it and rest their heads on it. It's a definite keeper. So far they have not removed the eggs from the toy and I'll let that happen in it's own time. The directions tell us humans to pull the eggs out and put them back in while our dogs watch the process and then let them figure it out by themselves, but I think my dogs will be shocked and thrilled to figure it out on their own. The toy comes with two extra egg toys on the side for use at another time or to play with by themselves. (three eggs in the toy) Besides being a wonderful amusement for dogs, this set of furry objects is priced right and made extremely well. I am so happy I purchased this and will go back for other Kyjen products in the future. The eggs alone make fabulous stocking stuffers for friends' dogs as well. Thanks for such an intuitive, creative, entertaining gadget for my canine babes !!

Who doesn't want a platypus toy with removable eggs for their dog to play with? I definitely do. This toy is fairly durable for my non-chewer golden retreiver puppy. When he was really young he didn't do much with the platypus mama, just liked to play with the small soft eggs. So far I haven't seen him do much about trying to get the eggs out of the mama. He kind of just mouths it without realizing the eggs are inside. Although just the other day he was chomping on an egg that I know for a fact was inside the mama a few minutes earlier. It's ridiculous looking, but obviously a platypus, my husband and I laugh about it alot, so thats a bonus.
my dog loves this toy. she attacked is as soon as she got it, which is a good thing. she plays with it all the time. and the fact that it comes with extra eggs (squeakers) is fantastic.

reviewerName: K. Salinger, MSN, FNP, RN AHN-BC
reviewText: For whatever reason this is my Shih-tzu pup's very most favorite toy! We took all the eggs out of the belly, so it is more flat (he prefers it that way...) and that platypus sees more action then all the other toys combined! We have rawhide twists, nylabones, squeaky toys, balls, and this is his always "go-to" favorite toy.We bought it because it was the least expensive dog stuffed animal at the local pet shop (because our 7 y.o. insisted he needed a stuffy) and we've been amazed by his love of it. Interestingly, our sitter says she has the same platypus for her dog and he loves it too. What's up with the love for this odd stuffed dog toy?Highly recommended.
summary: Pup's favorite toy above all others - even chewies!For

reviewText: Our boxer loved digging the eggs out.  Sadly, it didn't take her long to tear the stuffing out of both platypus and the eggs.  She's probably a bit harder on her toys than some.

There's something hilariously grisly about watching my ridgeback eagerly rip the eggs from his platypus' womb.  I love it.  He loves it.  I can barely reload the eggs back into it before he tugs it out of my hands.  He punctured the squeakers inside the eggs pretty quickly, so we stocked up on replacement eggs because he lives for the squeak.  The platypus itself has remained intact.

My parents wiener dog asks for this platypus every year for Christmas!  She is on her third one! They lived in Australia for a bit, so she needed an Australian themed gift and now that they are back in the states, this is still her favorite toy.  The stuffing doesn't last very long, but she plays with the "skin" until there is literally nothing left!
summary: Favorite gift for the furry sister!

reviewText: My dog loves this toy. She is not great at getting the eggs out, but she loves to put her nose into the hole with the eggs and bite them. She also loves chewing on the platypus itself and on the eggs individually. I love that it comes with replacement eggs. I would have given 5 stars, however, one of the eggs didn't squeak when it arrived, and another squeaker died within a week of play. And she is not too rough - she doesn't rip the stuffing out of her toys or anything. I wish the squeakers held up a little better. Overall, love the concept. I think I will be buying other animals in this line (I have my eye on that dinosaur).

I was really surprised by how much my dog LOVES this toy!  He hasn't figured out that he can pull the eggs out of the inside of the platypus, but he loves playing with the platypus and eggs separately so I consider this purchase a win.

When the platypus arrived, none of us fully understood it.  I didn't get why a dog would enjoy removing squeaky toys from a stuffed cavity.  This was her first plush  toy and I imagined her shredding the platypus and possibly eating the eggs.  For about a month, my dog didn't remove any eggs, but she loved the platypus and gently carried it around, squeaking its belly.  Then, after about a three-week incubation period, the platypus patient received a slight C-section and my dog extracted the eggs.She still loves her platypus. She loves digging the eggs out and carying them proudly around the house.  This dog is not a strong chewer and the platypus and her offspring have held up pretty well over the months, with mild wear, like the aforementioned C-section and some tears to the eggs.  The eggs are also fun to put in other toys like her hollow rubber lattice ball. Dogs just like pulling stuff out of stuff, apparently. We recently got the Hide-a-Squirrel and she loves that, too.Great toy!
summary: Your dog too can be a platypus obstetrician!

reviewText: It`s a very cute toy as long as your dog doesn`t attack it before you see it. The very first day my dog ripped one of the eggs.
This is o.k. for his dog friends, but too tame for my dog. I think it's fine for a "normal" dog.
summary: Gift for my dog's dog pals.

reviewText: I bought three (3) sets of this product for Christmas surprises.One for our Irish Water Spaniel, one ea for our daughters'  Great Dane and Golden Retriever.Our Charlie loves his and I heard, that our daughter's dogs are very happy with their Kyjens as well.The toy is a perfect size for easy carry and mouthing and they love the squeaking noise.
My dog loves the platypus! The eggs aren't really that interesting to him, but he likes the toy with or without the eggs. Has lasted over a year and I'd buy another toy from this manufacturer.

Well, I thought this would be a lot like the squirrels in the tree, which I LOVE..but, after getting the eggs back into the stuffed animal, which was NOT an easy task..my beagle destroyed the stuffy in no time at all...the eggs are still around, but not a fav for my dog.

I love the stuffingless toys because my dogs rip the stuffing out. It didnt take them long to pull the eggs out but they tore the struffing out quiclkly. the Platypus is still alive and in one piece months later. good toy
summary: Toy holds up, eggs did not

reviewText: Gave this to my 6 month old puppy about an hour ago when it was delivered by UPS. First, have to say she absolutely loved it, grabbed it and went off in a corner. Now that I am hour later, I see that she has the 'beak' ripped open and most of the stuffing out of the beak on the floor. Doesn't appear to be too durable. I cleaned up the area and she is now starting on round 2. Not sure if she understands the egg thing yet. Maybe because she is a teething puppy she is tearing this apart. But I don't think it is very well made if, within an hour, this dog is able to rip into it to take stuffing out.
summary: Lots of fun .... for a while

reviewText: I would like to say that the idea of eggs in a Platypus is brilliant. The toy stood up for over a month without much wear for my 5 month old Boston Terrier puppy. After about a month and a half he was able to chew the bill off, but it's still going strong two months in other than that. It comes with extra eggs, which is another plus. They are great fun to play fetch with.

I am a foster mom to many dogs, currently I have a jack russell, a corgi puppy and a puggle, as well as my dog a coonhound. All four play with this platypus, they love the squeaks the eggs make and they all love getting the eggs out of the platypus.  Keeps them busy for quite a while. And it is great because it is washable for when the unthinkable happens (which it will if you have a dog or puppy).
summary: Best toy to keep your smart dog busy.

reviewText: This is my mini dachshund's favorite toy b/c it looks like a real animal and she loves shaking it around and squeaking the eggs inside. Now, she does not like pulling out the eggs (she's not that talented) but the 3 separate eggs that it comes with, act as squeaky toys on their own! so it's like getting the animal plus 3 extra toys in one! Because there is little stuffing in this animal (the eggs "fill" it up), it's not easily destroyed like most plushes.Plus, when we are away, we stuff the animal's belly cavity with a kong or treat to make playtime last longer.We have the platypus version and "Platy" is our dachshund's sidekick!
summary: its like 4 toys in 1, lasts long time, can hide treats in it too

reviewText: My chow chow LOVES Kyjen ball/eggs. So I got her this, though it would be fun. It took my german shepherd mix a few seconds to figure it out and then he got bored and lost interest. My slow-witted chow chow took several days to figure out what she was supposed to do with this. I had to put a treat inside for her to figure out that she was supposed to pull the eggs out. Now she loves it!
summary: cute and fun for me AND doggy

reviewText: This toy comes with space for 3 eggs (balls) and 2 extra.  My dog does not have a strong enough jaw to get the balls out when they are all in, so I take one out and leave two in.  She actually likes playing with the ball alone and with the platypus as a squeeking toy.  It's very cute, well worth the money and a good size for both dogs 3 pounds to I would say 25ish.UPDATE:9/23/2012: It has been over a year and a half since I bought this toy and it is my dog's absolute favorite. She is full size now and can enjoy the toy with all the balls in.  I have a gigantic box of different types of toys and it doesn't matter, this is the toy that she plays with every single day.  The platypus and balls still hold up! I have bought more of these toys and she absolutely loves them.  I cannot recommend this enough, it is an absolute buy! I have the platypus (her original and favorite), the turtle is second and I keep at my parent's place so I do not have to carry so much. (the turtle stands up to major use and washing in the washing machine since we clean it weekly) so far, after 5-6 months it is still holding up) and the dinosur (not so great because the cut is very big but she will still play with it). When they are dirty I throw them in the wash and let air dry.

This toy is very much enjoyed by our 4 1/2 month old puppy!  It is a challenge to keep it away from the adult dogs, but so far  I have been successful.  Our puppy has to work hard to find all of the eggs which, of course, is the reason for the purchase and the toy.  I highly recommend this toy for puppies!

My puppy liked finding the eggs inside - over and over and over again. When the eggs are all pulled out he goes after the fuzz in the bill of the platypus! This fuzz he swallowed and it was passed in his stool but with difficulty. Now he digs inside every toy and if he finds no eggs he pulls the stuffing and squeakers out. Oh well, puppies do that.
summary: My puppy liked finding the eggs inside - over and over and ...

reviewText: Very durable item and even came with replacement speakers.  Skittles loves it and is still playing with it a month after she got it.

I have two male Frenchies and gave them the Kyjen Egg Babies Platypus for Christmas of 2012 and the toy has been a hit with them. Almost six months on and this little toy still sees a lot of action. Both of my dogs consistently play with this stuffed platypus where other toys have gone forgotten.I'm a fan of the construction and price tag and happy to report no tears or stuffing coming out. The eggs each have a squeaky inside and are easy and cheap to replace once worn out.The only reason I'm rating this at 4-stars is that my dogs to tend to pull the fur off this toy leaving clumps of it on my floor. I suppose that this is inevitable. Also, my dogs are medium sized so keep that in mind when shopping for larger dogs. I'm not confident that this toy would last long with larger dogs.Recommended.
Eggs are hard for dog to dig out.  Perfect for smarter dogs than easier toys.  Also very sturdy fabric so it can be used as tug.

This is an okay toy for my toy poodle.  He has a small mouth and can't really pick up the eggs.  The one with the tree trunk and squirrels was better because he could easily pick up the squirrels by the tail or the head or the leg.  It is nice though that it comes with extra eggs.  I think this would be a great toy for bigger dogs who can open the stomach of the platypus to get the eggs.  So there is nothing wrong with this toy, it's just not the best for a toy poodle with a small mouth.
Her favorite toy, we're ordering another one.  Finally she found the seam--oh dear.Had to distract here while we buried him.
summary: Took her nearly three weeks to kill poor platy

reviewText: Unfortunately my boxer destroyed this in 1 hr. I thought it sounded like a good toy to add variety but not made for dogs who like to destroy stuff.
summary: Livin the good life in NE

reviewText: I have a 10 lb Papillion and she doesn't seem to have the strength pull the "eggs" out of the toy if they are completely pushed inside it. It does take some strength to pull them out. However, she loves to play with the squeaky eggs and also likes to play catch with the Platypus.I've found another way for her to play with this toy. I put small treats, like Zuke's Mini Natural treats and sometimes even some of her small dry dog food kibble inside the toy, then I put one egg in just enough to close the hole over so the treats can't fall out and let her have at it. She has so much fun getting the treats out!  It completely engages her and she makes sure she gets every single morsel she can find in the toy. She even has a new love of her dry food and will gobble it up if it's in her toy. Just thought I'd share this for anyone whose dog isn't interested in pulling the eggs out of the toy, or who wants to try something new. It's a very well-made toy and has held up beautifully with many hours of play.
summary: Another way you can use it...

reviewText: We received this product (we purchased the platypus) in a timely matter, and already have the squirrels, so I assumed this would be a great product as well.Unfortunately upon opening the product 2 of the eggs had broken squeakers. It is not soo bad considering it comes with 2 extra, but that defeats the purpose of the extra ones if I had to use them immediately. Obviously I did not spend an arm and a leg on this product, so I'm not going to return the broken ones.Other than that it is a good product. These "hide-a..." toys are not the most durable, and we are working on teaching our pup Bailey to be more gentle with her toys, and she can only have the platypus part and her squirrel baby toys on supervised times, and it is taken away upon first sign of her ripping it up. The working eggs however stand up great, and I like that she cant really hold em to rip em, but they kind of just fit in her mouth, and she will carry it around and squeak it obsessively.Soo it would be 5 stars if it didn't come with nonworking eggs, but even with that problem I still recommend this toy to others.
summary: Great idea, but some squeakers arrived nonworking

reviewText: This egg babies toy is a lot of fun for dogs.  Once the dog figures out that the squeaky eggs (which are fun on their own) are in the animal they'll be entertained while they try to get them out.

My dogs loved this thing - specifically, they loved ripping the eggs out of its abdomen and flinging around the empty "skin". It lasted a decent amount of time with 4 dogs (approx. 3 months), though by the time they were done, all the stuffing had been pulled from the beak and head, and the feet were long gone. They eggs it comes with are the real hit, though.... my dogs LOVE them. They are still around, and are the hands-down favorite toy of my youngest dog. For them alone, this toy is worth the money, in my opinion.
summary: Good toy - won't last long with a dog who really likes to chew (aka "power chewers")

reviewText: My dachshund/Pitt bull blend LOVES this toy. Really anything where she can pull other toys out of it. Then I can put them back and she is interested all over again. Plus this one came with 3 extra "eggs" in addition to the two inside. Would buy again.
This was a lot of fun for the dogs.  As advertised, they were interested in pulling out the eggs.  I stuff them right back in, and the fun starts all over again.  It is very sturdy.

I wouldn't call my bulldog puppy an aggressive chewer, but within a day he managed to chew off one of the legs. He punctured the squeakers in the "eggs", so those are now garbage. I loved the idea of this toy and I didn't have very high expectations because they end up chewed and destroyed, but this was just bad. VERY cheaply made. I will not be buying this toy again.

We order this toy time and time again as it makes a terrific gift.  We're involved w/Golden Retriever rescue organizations and remain in contact w/some of the families who adopted dogs we fostered.  The platypus holds up well to rough play from our experience and 2 of our dogs LOVE the squeaky eggs.  Both frequently carry an egg or 2 around in their mouths.  When friends come over w/their dogs, it's not unusual for their dogs to make a bee-line to one of the eggs and carry it around.
Our puppy's favorite toy! I have sewed it back together a few times but totally worth it. Would recommend to others...

Our BC had some trouble getting the eggs out. She ended up having to remove some stitches and then coming to me worried that she had ripped it too much (she's a BC and yes, she did tell me she needed her toy fixed). I reinforced it but this is the first Kyjen or egg baby product I've had to do this with (and we have many others). So I like it, the pup likes it, but she was very worried and I hope since this is the most recent egg baby, that their newer products last as long as their older ones.

My girl loves removing the eggs from their pocketed hiding place!  It comes with a couple--brown ones, if I remember rightly.  And you can always order more; we got multi-colored ones.  It doesn't take her long, but if I keep putting them in, she'll return to this toy again and again.  I love how cuddly it is, and that it's sturdily made (with lots of double-stitching).  Sometimes she focuses on other places to chew, instead of simply pulling the eggs from the stomach pocket, but it's easy to redirect her.  The pocket was a bit tight/small initially, but after several hours of play it's much easier to get the eggs out while still offering a fun challenge.
Love this toy! My dogs play with it for hours trying to get the eggs out. Once they are successful I just stuff the eggs back in and away they go.

summary: Great dog toy, my dog loves it!

reviewText: My dog loves this toy - even more than he loves the hide-a-squirrel, which he was obsessed with. The eggs are tightly packed into the platypus so it takes him a while to get them all out. He loves to play with the eggs on their own too, especially fetch - he goes nuts! And it comes with 2 extra eggs, which is great.The one downside is that because the opening is rather small, he's stretched it out a bit and the material is thinning around the belly of the stuffed animal. However, the construction is very well stitched and it's still holding strong at the opening. While I think the toy will last a while, I don't think it is as sturdy as the hide-a-squirrel. But my dog loves it so much that I would definitely repurchase.
My dogs did not like this as well.  Maybe it just wasn't their type of toy they love all kind of squeaky and long toys better.  Your dog may love it though

Our lab that destroys toys got several months out of this one.  He became ridiculously adept at removing the eggs.  Once I stuffed it with the little squirrels that came with a similar themed toy and although I could hardly get them in, they came out in 5 seconds.  We still sort of have the toy...the scrap that has the hole you insert the eggs in is still very popular as a pull toy between the lab and one of our other dogs, and the eggs are still played with.

My dog ripped this apart fairly quickly. I tried to 'show' him several times how to pull the eggs out, but he really had no interest in it other than to rip it apart. He liked chasing the eggs around though.

I have an Alaskan Malamute that can destroy any toy in record time but she doesn't play with this one much.  Reason being, the small opening where the eggs are stored is much too tight.  I can barely put the eggs back in the toy for her to remove.  Seriously, it takes me 5 minutes to put one egg in!

I purchased this for one of my small dogs.  My giant lab had other plans.  Lab loves it not to play with but as if it is a puppy.  He carries it around and constantly cleans it..the hair is already worn off.

I have two dogs.  One, a big german shepherd/lab mix and one a small Bichon mix.  And both of my dogs love this toy.  The shepherd isn't always in love with toys, but she absolutely loves this one.  She carries it around with her all the time.  She loves it so much I am buying a second (and maybe a third).
Great price and wonderful toy for all dog loves.. Buy it here and dont go to walmart you wont get a better price there
Cute as a button and very sturdy, even under the pressure of canine teeth.  The doggie I gifted this to adored it and carried it everywhere, not letting any other pet put their paws on it.

Reading the reviews I was thinking that finally I could buy a toy for my dog that he wouldn't rip up quickly.  I even watched the video on this ad, and it all looked so beautiful and made sense.  Then the toy came in the mail from Amazon.  My dog had no interest in taking the eggs out. He was more interested in making his way to the stuffing inside the Platypus, and proceeded to rip apart the animal- and within 5 minutes the stuffing was pulled out all over the place.  My dog, is a sweet 22 lb Cockapoo, a therapy dog, who is gentle and sweet- but just loves taking out the stuffing from toys. Anyway- lesson be learned...a strong chewer will always be a strong chewer. Buyer Beware!

We have never seen our 2 year old Coton play with a toy as much as she plays with this Platypus!  Usually she involves us in tug of war or fetch, but with this toy she plays by herself, rolls around on the floor, trying and trying to get an egg out.  It's the cutest sight ever!  Not sure how long the toy will last with the constant pulling at the opening for the eggs, but so far the entire family is enjoying watching her have fun.

My two 40 and 53 pound lab mixes love this thing! They carry the eggs around and bite them so they squeak. They haven't figured out how to remove the eggs without my help. Although they are chewers, they have not chewed the platypus or the eggs. I recommend this toy.

I bought this Orka toy for my extremely active and chronic chewing little dog.  That little guy can chew through anything including a metal bowl and this is pretty durable - not even a nick.  He loves to play with this toy by himself - he likes to toss it and it bounces in different directions so he never knows where it's going to land.  If he's happy, I'm happy.
summary: Keeps My Little Guy Occupied And It's Durable

reviewText: This toy bounces irregularly when thrown, which is great for fetch. Also, when I fill holes with kibble or a smear of peanut butter, it keeps them happy and busy for quite a while. Should last forever for my little dogs (not "super chewers").

My Boston Terrier loves playing with this toy.  It's perfect for his mouth.. he's about 25 lbs.  It has a lot of different textures on each side of the 'ball', which is great for his teeth.  This plastic toy holds up VERY well.  Compared to most of our other toys he's gone through, these Pet Stages Okra toys hold up very well.  I highly recommend any of this brand of toys.  This one is just fun because it bounces all crazy and my pup has to chase it in a different direction.

My 60 lb Goldendoodle loves this toy. He likes medium sized toys that have multiple places to chew and grip when catching that are not too big. He had another Orka brand toy in the past and it is of the same material and has held up well. He is a fairly hard chewer (he has gone through the Nylabone DuraChew bones in a month or so). Dogs who are really aggressive chewers will chomp through this one though. This one is perfect for our dog.
My 3 month old shiba inu loves this toy. She loves chewing on it and it has a sporadic bounce pattern that keeps her interested. Great buy!
Fast delivery,good price. This is our second one. The pups enjoy this to play with as well as a great teeting toy.
summary: It keeps a new pup occupied for awhile

reviewText: This is a great product for my chug and yorky/poo. They are 8 & 9# and the orka is small enough for them to handle, and boy do they love to chew it!! I put treats in the end and love to watch them get the treat out! Have tried other chew toys but none were as suitable for them as this one. Easy on their teeth, but good exercise for them.

This is very thick, sturdy & my Lab chews on it a lot and it bounces every which way so my dog is zig zagging to catch it.  After a months of playing tug with it one end kind of unscrewed off & couldn't go back on.  It's still strong and safe, pieces can not be chewed off and my dog still loves it.
I love house is randomly bounces and boy can it bounce.  My dog does not seem to be so into it.  Though she ask me to play fetch with it sometimes.  It is a solid toy.
The dog destroyed this in 5 minutes. This is cheap and not durable at all! I would not buy this again.
Small toy, but fun for my puppy. She is a 40 lb. Border collie mix and this is a little bit small. Has held up just fine through chewing and tossing.
I often find my dog playing with this particular toy. She must love it and consider it a favorite. It's often used as a fetch toy and the dangling balls grab her attention.
Loved this Toss and Shake Toy for shiny new pup -- crinkle noise an extra that pup loves.Toy is good initial step for retrieval/fetch command.

It doesn't seem too well made, but I'm amazed that my beagle pup has treated this as well as she has.  It doesn't look exactly like this, as there are not quite as many "arms" on the toy.  But my beagle puppy loves to shake it and toss it herself.  As the name says, that's what she does with it.  She entertains herself with it.  Don't get me wrong...it's "short attention span theater" for those of you who enjoy old Saturday Night Live episodes, but she does like it.  If she likes it, I like it.
Came promptly. The multiple textures entertained my pup for hours! Wish it had lasted a little longer, but those puppy teeth are vicious!

If my puppy was rating this toy, for sure he would give it ten stars. He just loves it! However, within the first half-hour of rough play, he had chewed off one of the balls. I wish the balls were moe firmly attached and that is the only reason that this excellent toy doesn't get a five-star rating from me. I highly recommend this toy to owners of gentle dogs!

My puppy loved this.  It is just the right size for him.  He is  yorkie puppy that is 4 months old.  It was a pleasant surprise that two of the balls have a rattle in there.  Its the blue and yellow balls.  Every time i try and put it up he goes and pulls it from his toy box and shakes it all around.  He even tries to take it outside when its time for him to go to the bathroom. Like i said one of his best toys ever, and perfect for small dogs.  Matter of fact he loved it so much I had to get more toys from this company cause they are just the right size for him.  Like i go to pet smart and Wal-Mart and the toys there are so big, but this brand is just the right size for him.
This is tiny but a great toy for keeping the pup occupied. I gave it as a Christmas present in the stocking.
summary: My dog loves it but it's super small

reviewText: My Boxer pup loves the crackling sound this toy makes when he plays with it.  It's very well made.  He's a heavy biter, and has not been able to tear it apart.  My only complaint is that the toy is a little smaller than I had expected.  It's probably best for a small dog or a large puppy.
This toy is super fun and dog seemed to like it!A little smaller then my normal choices but dog did not seem to mind!
My dogs enjoyed this toy for the short time it lasted but was not very durable for my small toy dogs.
Pretty much a cat toy. Wouldn't recommend for a pup.  But thanks for quick service mad product is as advertised

This was my first little puppys toy at 12 weeks.  She adored it and ripped it up with joy!  Its soft and you can easily toss it across the room to teach your baby to fetch and retrieve.  It will always be one of her favs!
summary: Just so much FUN for a new little puppy!

reviewText: it seems to have more appeal to me than my dog!  She liked the rope ball better.  (lab pointer mix.)
My grand-dog Dewey loved this. Plays with it all the time. He is about 2 yrs. old and is pretty tough on toys.He is a medium size dog, he like the crinkle in the little balls.
My little Morkie loves this toy and the little crackling sound the balls on the end make when he bites them!

My 10-week-old goldendoodle is obsessed with tags, so he just loves to gnaw on the tags on this thing. The stitching on the tags does come out pretty quickly but it hasn't been detrimental to the toy, actually - it's still holding together, just with strings hanging out of the seams. Easy enough to sew back up if it does become bad. We put it in the crate with him to keep him busy, he truly loves it.

I purchased this for my Siamese cat who is less than a year old.  He is intrigued by it.  Tosses it into the air and likes to retrieve it  when it is thrown to him.  The crinkly sound as well as motion of the parts of the toy fascinate him.  Don't think I'd buy this for a dog, however.  The natural tendency of a dog to chew might cause ingestion of parts of the toy. I wouldn't chance it.

This was a very cool-looking toy, and my mini-Aussie LOVED it -- unfortunately, it only lasted two days.  He's not particularly rough on toys, but the ring came unstitched and all the little ball tags fell off.  He still carries the ring around in his mouth, but the whole purpose was for him to have another toy to "shake."

I don't get it! We have a tough chewer that even destroys tough Kong products, but this favorite toy just keeps hanging around. We have had the first one for over a year and I bought this one to have in reserve. Yes, most dogs would probably shred it in an hour but our beast loves it and still chews on it very hard. Go figure . . .
My puppy loves this and has been playing with it for months. I would definitely recommend this and buy it again.

I love the look of these, and all the Pet Stages fabric toys.  They make such cool looking toys for cats.  My cat hardly ever chewed these, though.  She mostly batted them around a bit, and then ignored them.  She likes toys with longer dangles than these have.
My 1 year old cat loves them. Too bad they easily go under the couch. Gives hours of entertainment. They are not as small as one reviewer says. Great product, great fun!

I have a Siamese that wil chew through just about anything. String, yarn, sisal, heavy duty woven nylon, shoe laces, electrical and phone cords, feathers, baskets, cardboard, magazines, well, you get the picture. I often buy him dog toys made for chewing because most cat toys just aren't made to take the abuse he can inflict. These toys, and most anything made by this company, have stood the test of time.
