He likes the crunchy texture. And the fringe ends, which are usually the first thing he chews off, are made out of a sewn fabric, not string. For some reason he either can't, or won't chew through them. He cycles through all the different Pet Stages toys, like the mice, mesh chewing rings, etc. because he gets bored eventually. But he always go back to them and I have never had to throw one out because he destroyed it or it became unsafe for him to play with. He also likes Pet Stages small dog toys, we just avoid the styles with soft rope, which he would eat in a heartbeat.
summary: Durable for cats that chew, thank goodness!

reviewText: After a year of fun my cats still play with these safe & durable toys. I find Pet Stages cat toys are usually winners.

My kitties (4 month old kittens), do like to chew on these so that is a plus.  But these get lost very easily and what good is that?  I keep finding them hidden in some corner or under the couch.  I give up on kitty toys!

The marketing department for this toy must've been working overtime the night they came up with the description on the package.  I bought these for my cat because she loves cold things.  I put them in the freezer overnight and...well...nothing.  They neither froze nor did they become crunchy.  After five minutes out of the freezer they were back at room temperature.  I grabbed a pair of scissors and cut them open.  What did I find?  These are nothing but fabric tubes with some poly stuffing a few granules of catnip in them.  There's nothing there to freeze and nothing there to get crunchy.  I'll never buy a pet stages product again.  Like most people, I don't much care for being lied to.
Nicely sized for a smaller dog and tough enough to resist the best efforts to destroy it, this is a great toy for dogs who would tear up an ordinary toy in just a few hours.
summary: Resists the mighty jaws of the rat terrier

reviewText: We've been through three of these in my house in the past 9 months or so, my dog loves to pull out the seams of his toys and these last longer than any others we've found.  It takes him at least a month to break through one of these, while other brands get unraveled sometimes in minutes. Worth the money for my dog.

This toy has become a favorite with my three small dogs (ranging in size from 12lbs to 17lbs), two of which are terriers who like to chew, and one a poodle mix who absolutely enjoys fetch.  We've taken this toy to the park, and it's always stolen by aggressive chewers, like Boston terriers, bulldogs and pugs - hasn't had any damage yet, and we've had it for about a year.  Of course, ALWAYS supervise your dogs with toys - a squeaker, if chewed, could become lodged in their windpipe, toy parts could get stuck in their stomach, etc.  That being said, this toy has proven durable and flies pretty far when thrown, especially for something made of fabric and fluff.
summary: Durable and a favorite of my dogs!

reviewText: For some reason the thrill here is to stick the nose through the donut hole. Quite fun to play with and very durable.
Tuffy toys ate the best.  Our dogs loves them.  My order arrived quickly & I'm very happy, so are the dogs!
summary: Our dogs love Tuffy toys... Arrived quickly, very happy!

reviewText: One of my two dogs is a very determined and powerful chewer. The Tuffy's toys are the ONLY soft toys that last her more than a day to destroy.  My dog has had this toy for about a month and has only unraveled a tiny piece of top layer around the edge.  Although they are more expensive than traditional toys, they are completely worth it for powerful chewers.

I'm a big fan of Tuffy's toys. This is no exception. The loop, however, introduced a new point of weakness. Once that was torn off, the edging near there was compromised. Still, the toy is in tact MONTHS later. That it doesn't look as nice is no real bother to the dogs!

This is absolutely the worst light fixture I ever owned. I'm not sure why but the bulbs in this particular fixture die VERY quickly. I have read reviews pointing to bad ballasts but I'm no electrician. I have purchased this exact light  over and over -since I do love the amount of light it puts out and it was the perfect size for my tank. But EVERYONE of these failed in a miserably short amount of time.  I also own this light in the larger 36 inch size (I have 4), and they work wonderfully. Maybe size DOES matter :)  So I ended up getting the Coralife Lunar Aqualight 30"  and am VERY happy I did. The light it produces replicates natural sunlight  amazingly. The price is higher but you're getting a top quality light and what's more is the fixture has been running for 2 years now with no bulb replacements (so in the long run it may ene up being more cost effective as well as much higher quality). You may be wondering if a couple bad reviews do not make a bad product (as there are always one bad Apple in the barrel), but I HAVE OWNED 6 OF THESE AND ALL OF THEM FAILED.  You have been forewarned.
summary: RUN AS FAST AS YOU CAN !

reviewText: When I decided to grow some "low light" plants in my aquarium, I was disappointed that the hood that came with it came with a fixture that wasn't even considered low light.  I did not relish the thought of dropping $100 or more on lights just to experiment with growing some plants in my tank.  I searched (and searched and searched) to find a T5NO (T5 Normal Output) fixture that would give me enough light to grow some low light plants and not cost me a boatload of money.  This is one of the few I found and I got a great price on it here on Amazon.com.  My fish actually look better than they did under the underpowered light that came with my hood and my plants are happy.Update-One Year and One Month Later- after reading some of these reviews I was concerned about the durability and life of this fixture.  Today I walked in and my tank was dark.  I bought the fixture one year and one month ago.  I had not replaced a bulb and I have it on at least 12 hours a day.  Since both bulbs were shot at the same time, I assumed the worst.  I called the manufacturer for support. I got a very nice woman there who told me it was likely a bulb had blown and the ballast wouldn't allow the other bulb to light with that bulb being burned out.  I could see that one end of one of the bulbs was dark and the lens was melted right where that dark spot was.  I told her how long I had had the fixture and she told me it was most likely the bulb.  But, she also told me if it was the ballast, she would send me a replacement under warranty even though the warranty had expired.  I went to my local fish store and bought two new bulbs.  Voila!  The light is back on.I don't know if the fixture is inexpensive or the bulbs are expensive, but the cost of two bulbs was about 80% of the price I paid for the fixture in the first place.
summary: Great light at a good price

reviewText: I have tried three of these units (30 inch version), and had nothing but trouble with them.  The first unit burnt out after a a few months, the second unit died in a few weeks, the third unit would burn out a bulb every other month or so. (I had them over a glass top, so it wasn't from moisture getting in to the light.  Was never able to contact anyone from the company.Lighting seemed great while they worked, but I refuse to buy new bulbs every couple months.I've switched over to LED lighting, so far so good.

I bought this light fixture to replace the one that came with my tank. The original light was a single tube T8, and I needed something brighter because I wanted to add a few low light plants to my tank. I was shocked at how much brighter my tank looked after switching to the Coralife dual T5. The fixture is MUCH smaller and lighter than my hulking old fixture. I am very happy with it.

reviewerName: Louie the Italian Jew "Lou da Joo"
reviewText: This light works well with a planted aquarium. My Amazon swords are growing nicely, but slower than the higher output lights I had before. I don't have algae problems at all with these lamps. The bulbs are 6700k (pink) which are made specifically for plants. I would recommend this awesome lamp for fishkeepers that have a glass top. The color is a nice warm hue. I've read other negative reviews, but that wasn't my experience. This lamp used to be the #1 selling aquarium strip light on Amazon, and will blow away those double brights which will not help your plants that need higher amounts of light.

I was nervous about buying this product due to all of the negative reviews.  So far, it has performed well.  There are very few T5 NO light fixtures so you have to go with what's available.  Right now, I would buy this product again.

reviewerName: Ami Laurie "too young to be grandma"
reviewText: As other reviewers said, this light fixture makes my 55g look like a show tank. The colors of my neon dwarf rainbows have NEVER looked so vibrant. The green [live] plants practically "pop" out at you. I am incredibly impressed. I also very much like its low profile. On the down side -- also as other reviewers have said -- until Amazon does a better job of packing this item, you're as likely as not to have it arrive broken. It arrived both times in a too-big box where it was allowed to rattle around during shipping. I returned the first [broken] one immediately and had the replacement in just a couple of days. Somehow, the second one didn't break. Nonetheless, be ready just in case to return a broken one.Update: After almost exactly nine months, this light fixture has fizzled out. Not burned out bulbs. The transformer-thingy [sorry] is dead. While is wasn't horribly expensive, I expected to last a bit longer than this. It's on a timer and runs/ran 13 hours per day.

I bought this light to start growing plants in my freshwater tank. Come to find out this light fixture came with a 10,000K bulb and an Actinic bulb. The actinic bulb is for growing things in salt water tanks. It gave my freshwater tank a brown algae issue. So I had to change that bulb to a 6700K bulb. They are T5 size bulbs. Now I can grow plants in my tank. The fixture itself is nice. You will have to have a glass top on the tank to use the light.
summary: Great light for salt water tanks.

reviewText: Aquarium lights are expensive. Considering most of them are just florescent light strips! These are reasonable, and do a good job. Might need to get 2 strips for a 48-in tank to get more lighting, and maybe mix up the bulbs to add flora and actinic, but these are definitely a better deal than most out there.

Purchased this for my 55 gallon Saltwater Fish Only tank.  Does a nice job of highlighting the setup.  Would like to see a separate switch for the two bulbs and also better mounting legs. Cannot adjust them for height, so I laid the fixture on two containers. Worth the money
Great compact product. Affordable and does the trick.This light comes with a 10,000k Full Spectrum as well as an Actinic bulb for blues / dusk. Very happy with product.

I found the Aqualight to be a perfect addition to my 55 gallon freshwater community tank. It's actinic blue bulb combined with it's 10,000k daylight bulb really show off my fishes beautiful colors, while also bringing my decorations to life. The dual 28 watt bulbs(this isn't a High Output fixture)provide plenty of power for my live plants to grow nicely as well. The cost of all this goodness is also as good as it gets for a dual light fixture, making this light a true bargain. Its size is also a good thing, allowing you to place two together(one in front of the other) on a 55 gallon tank, doubling the light output for less than others charge for a single dual lamp unit. You can also mix and match the T5 bulbs available to get the effect your looking for. From what I've seen, you can get actinic, 6,700k daylight, 10,000k mid day daylight, and a "color enhancing" bulb as well--a nice selection. All told, this is a well made, low cost solution for anyone wanting better quality light than their old single tube T8's fixtures can provide, for less cash than said fixture. Highly recommended!P.S. Someone on here claimed that finding non H.O. T5 lamps was difficult. All you have to do is google it and plenty of fish stores pop up that sell them. A little research goes a long way :-)

It seems Coralife makes the only dual bulb enclosures for larger tanks that are reasonably affordable. The size is nice -- a bit narrower than my single T8 lamp, and slightly lighter. The light output on these is much better than with the single T8 fixture. This works well with my 75Gallon aquarium... No issues, except that some of the T5 replacement bulbs (especially actinic) are not readily available from amazon, nor my local big-box pet stores. Please note that the description on amazon is incorrect, as there are no fans on Coralife dual lamp fixtures. This is just the saltwater version of the 05620 dual light fixture (actinic and 10K bulbs vs. 6.7K and floralife bulbs).

I bought this after having bought a 300 dollar unit, led, which produced 2365 lumens.  After all the information, and planning on keeping the LED, I found this unit, on accident.  After buying this, I  have to say the corals are responding to the high unit output and colors this unit produces.  This is a must buy.  It is not perfect although,
summary: Great Light for a great price!!!

reviewText: I love the design, it's so great! My only issue with the product is that it hums. I wish it were more silent, but it's still more silent than other lesser known brands. I would recommend this product.

I bought a 5 gallon air pump for more than this, and that air pump failed to pump air through 2 2.5gal tanks.  So, I went to the overkill side and purchased this.  First, though, I want to address some of the other reviews.NO air pump, I repeat, NO AIR PUMP IS SILENT.  If a manufacturer tries to sell you a silent air pump, you need to step back and assess if their project development team has taken remedial physics.  Vibrations create sound, which means no silent vibrating air pump diaphragms.  According to classical physics, it is physically impossible for that to happen.  However, through sound damping and clever material choice, you can make it so that it's close to silent.  You'll never actually get there, but you can make it quiet enough to not be heard over the usual white noise of the home.This air pump is the quietest I've ever gotten my hands on.  I live in a building with a constant low level of background noise, and I have to concentrate to pick the pump's quiet hum out.  It's well constructed, the rubber feet do a lot in the way of damping sound, and if you have it in a bedroom, wrapping it with a towel makes it practically inaudible.  Otherwise, it's a very well built and well functioning pump for its price.  You will never find anything as good quality as this and for as low a price as this; I can guarantee it from weeks of searching online.

A little underpowered, but for smaller air stones of less than a foot in length, highly recommended.No air pump is silent, but this is a wonderful compromise between power and, well...not having one. Really helps move the water. Makes the filter work better.The real deal. ;)

We just purchased this for our 36gallon aquarium to feed a bubble wand and a large bubble stone.  One thing, if you want to feed two larger items with this, make sure to get a valve to regulate how much air goes to each accessory.  We had a problem with the bubble wand (there were almost no bubbles) when I had the feeds split by a T, but once I put in a valve, each accessory produced the right amount of bubbles.
This pump is pretty quiet. I have owned other pumps that were a lot louder than this one. Decently priced. Does a good job of providing my aquarium with the extra oxygen it needs.

I have had a whisper air pump for my small 5.5 gallon tank for months. So I got a larger one for my 29 gallon tank. These air pumps are extremely quiet. The small one sits on my desk by my computer as I have a 5.5 gallon betta tank next to my desk. I never hear this air pump unless something touches it and it vibrates that item. When nothing is touching it, it is so quiet I have to touch it to be sure it is still on! If you need a quiet air pump I recommend this Whisper brand.
summary: Quietest air pump on the market

reviewText: This is the second Tetra Whisper air pump I've owned (I've had the Tetra Whisper 20 running in my 20 gallon for 6 months with no issue). Incredibly easy to setup and is extremely quiet. I have it running a bubble curtain in the back of my 29 gallon and it's working great so far. Just remember to buy some air hose as well as it does not come with any. :)
It works great, but it's a little noisy.  But the fish love the extra bubbles and I like that you can turn it up or down depending on how strong of bubbles you want.

By other reviews ive seen, it seems you either get a quiet one, or a very loud one. I must have gotten a quiet one because I cant hear this thing. my tank is in my bedroom so sound levels meant a lot to me, but I didn't want to pay an arm and leg to get started. VERY impressed. I will admit, I plugged this thing in with no load hooked up to it, it sounded like a jet. I was about to return it, but I decided to atleast give it a chance. glad I did because about 30mins after being hooked up to my airstones, it went silent!I have the tv on in the bedroom very low and I cannot hear the air pump when I stand at the door.will update in 6 months.

I spent about $15 for this one at walmart about 10 years ago and it did its job for that time. But it just died in a bad thunderstorm we had about a week ago along with my filter and well every piece of hardware in my 55 gallon tropical tank due to a faulty surge protector. I took this time to make some much needed hardware upgrades including replacing this Whisper Air Pump.It works and does okay I am surprised it lasted this long to be completely honest. But it is Noisy ! And it gets more noisy as time goes on... This time I did a lot of research as 10 years ago I didn't. What I found out was there are some major advances in Technology compared to what was out there when I first set up my 55 gallon tank. I bought a Air-Pod Aquarium up to 75 Gallons Air Pump Not only does it have dual air output which means you can hook up two Bubble walls at the same time perfect for large tanks it is nearly completely silent ! As well as looks a lot more stylish at the same time.I highly recommend if you are going to put out the cash for hardware on your larger tanks it is better to get some thing you will be happy with for years and will do what you need. I regret living with such a noisy piece of equipment for as long as I did when all I had to do was simply put out about $10 more for a much nicer piece of hardware that make's, Me and my fish happy.
summary: Okay for the $'s but wouldnt buy again

reviewText: Purchased for hydroponic usage with medium hydrofarm airstones and 8" bar airstones. Does a marginal job with both. Very quiet though, Fine for a fish tank.

I purchased a 20-gallon air pump made by Top Fin and this was a big mistake. The unit provided a good deal of air, but the noise it made was so loud that it could be heard from two rooms away. I was lured in by the cheap price when I should have just stuck to the Tetra brand, which I finally did after returning the Top Fin 20.The Whisper 20 is what it claims to be--whisper quiet, although this is really a subjective opinion. You can still hear some slight buzzing, but compared to other air pumps, it is relatively quite. It provides a strong stream of air for your aquarium air stones or other devices. Tetra also includes a free air valve, which is a nice touch.If you're looking for a reliable and relatively silent air pump at a reasonable price, the Whisper 20 is a product to consider.
summary: Lots of power and pretty quiet

reviewText: I have a 75 gallon bow front and a 2 foot long bubble wand at the bottom of the tank with rocks over it and this pump makes bubble throughout the 2 foot wand. The pump is very quite and works perfectly and I love that it has 2 outlets so I can use one side for my wand and the other side for my stones. Fast delivery

I have this setup on a 20 gallon tall aquarium. It also goes to a standard 10 gallon via a 2-way gang valve. So in essence it would be like connecting two 'bubble' devices up (think air stone plus bubbling treasure chest decoration as an example). The gang valve allows me to compensate for the 10 gallon not being as deep as the 20 gallon. For those interested, it is running a sponge filter in both tanks.With this set up, it is barely able to keep headway and only produces a minimal amount of bubbles. This is okay for me, since I run fully planted tanks and only need minimal water flow for temp and nutrient distribution. If I was doing two devices in the 20 gallon alone though, I'm not sure it would be powerful enough.How big of a pump do you need? It's all about depth and has nothing to do with volume ... which is how they are foolishly marketed. It should be clear that a pump will work much better on a 20 gallon long tank than it will on a 20 gallon tall tank due solely to the depth of the water even though they have the same volume.My biggest complain with this air pump is it isn't quite. It's about the same level of noise that a cheap HOB filter makes while good HOB filters will be far quieter than this thing. It's a constant hum that you can get use to, but will always be there and add to the `background' noise of your house. The best I could compare it to is the kind of noise a refrigerator makes when it is on.

its a nice small size pump but works great there is a little noise you can noticed but not that much my aquarium is on the corner and I hide the pump behind it if you are 2 to 3 feet away from the pump then you hardly notice and vibration noise.
It's a tad bit noisy, but better than most pumps. You may have to open it and adjust the magnets to get it quiet a few times. I have it in a 29, and it does the job quite nicely.
Good airflow, but the unit is loud. Not as whisper quite as they proclaim. I have had quieter air pumps than this one.
Very powerful and quiet. The dual pump attachments are just what I needed for my skimmer to work properly. Nice pump.
I have tried all the adjustments I can find, and this thing is still *very* noisy...I don't like it, but maybe that is what I have to live with for this capacity.

I expect any air pump to make noise and certainly the larger they are the more noise it makes. All i did was run the airline tubes into the basement and guess what, IT"S SOUNDLESS!!!! I really like that it has 2 outlets for 2 diif air tubes. If your buying this you must relize it will make noise like any air pump, but most people im sure can hide the pump in a closet, attic or basement like I did. just buy extra air line tubing, its only 10 cents a foot certainly wont break the bank.

I purchased thisTetra 77850 Whisper Air Pump, upto 100-Gallonlast December. This pump was always a bit loud but it grew to be an annoyance. Our tank is located in our living room and I got fed up with having to turn the TV volume up to drown out the pump. The pump worked for its purposes at first. After about three months, the pump no longer could provide my bubble bar and treasure chest with enough air.. the bar was barely a trickle and the chest hardly ever moved. Yes, I did check my gang valve. The problem was not with my gang valve. So, with the noise and the inability to control the flow, I finally decided to replace my Tetra with something different.I purchased theEcoPlus 2 Air Pump, 2 Outletstwo weeks ago and I could not be more pleased. It is decibels quieter and is actually more powerful. I have one 18" submersed bubble bar and one treasure chest in my 20 gallon tank. The lines are run to a gang valve and then a line runs to the pump. This pump is capable of supplying both the bar and chest with the proper amount of flow on the lowest setting. My old Tetra pump had no flow setting control - I considered this and its noise its two downfalls for me and my setup.I really like the setting control knob on the top of the pump, although I do not see myself needing to turn it up from the lowest setting since with my current setup turning the knob any higher causes my treasure chest to darn near float. LOL! This pump is certainly a very nice device that I foresee lasting me quite some time. When it does come time for a replacement, I will not hesitate to purchase another EcoPlus.
This little pump is actually completely silent and super powerful.  Can barely believe the pricing at less than $10.00.  Highly recommend this one.

Not a lot to really write about an air pump-- but the Tetra Whisper is a nice quiet pump and seems to put out a good flow of air.  We have another of this same model that has been used for about 4 years straight and still continues to do a consistent good job.  (I've fallen out-of-love with many other tetra products, but this is not one of them)
Received what I ordered and in perfect condition.  Tank looks great with it.  Everyone enjoys just watching the tank including my 2 kittens.  Thank you.
I picked this up to power my air bubblers in a 120 gallon tank.  The blower is really powerful, but luckily they include valves to limit the air flow.  Works great for what I use it for.
Seems to be more than enough air for my 29 gallon tank. Hooked up to a 4 gang PennPlax valve. Can run about 3-5 accessories.

My Tetra 20 gallon air pump is NOT quiet. It makes a low hum more than twice as loud as my fridge and drives me nuts. I've got to find something better. No, its not defective. They should rename it from Whisper to Mack, like in Mack truck.

I ordered this to replace an old pump. Two outlets means no splitter required. I have a 29 gallon aquarium with an undergravel filter. The old pump only had enough umph to really run one side. And I had to wrap it in towels to muffle the rattling noise. This filter ran so strong that it clouded my tank for the first hour! Now, crystal clear and no more rattling noise!
The pump isn't too bad. It isn't "whisper" quiet as I had expected, but it's definitely not as loud as my old AquaTech pump. The bubbles it makes are nice too, so that's a plus.

This is really very loud in relation to the air flow it's able to create. The pump produces something that is a noticeably louder sound than even the large air purifier in the room where the aquarium is located. The shell can at random times, unprovoked, make an awful rattling sound that will not stop until the pump is tapped or smacked harshly. The feet are useless unless the pump is placed on something like a carpet because it will slide and jostle quite a lot, most noticeably on glass. Like most aquarium products, this is advertised above its punching weight and I would not use it in an aquarium larger than 20 gallons or with a stone larger than medium. Surely there are quieter products available and if I were to purchase another I should much rather spend more money for serenity. The value on this air pump is good but it is an abominable thing to have in one's presence.

This airpump is so quiet that the surface disruption of the bubbles is actually louder than the pump itself. I got the 20 gallon version and couldn't be more happier with it! Its small, very well designed but most importantly does the job so well. Its also pretty cheap compared to a powerhead or HOB filter.Would strongly reccommend this for a sponge filter setup!
It's quiet, works like a champ. I will purchase another one when I get my bigger tank. I can't see why anyone had a problem with this at all.
Serves its purpose well and stands-up to the test of time.  It is not silent but its not overly loud either.  I would buy it again and recommend it.
summary: What better do you need?  Great value.

reviewText: Guys who are purchasing from outside the US, be careful, it operates at 120V. In case your power supply is 220V it will be burned. Amazon are clarifying this.

Well this is the largest air pump I have purchased for an aquarium,its not inaudible, but it isn't insanely loud either.  You can hear the tell tale hum of the air pump but; bottom line, if you don't have a canister filter you probably won't even notice itI don't know of another pump that will put out this kind of air flow with this little noise.I'd recommend it for its purpose.  But if you are really really concerned about noise in your dead silent house by all means buy a smaller air pump.
OH My Goodness we had to put a valve on to slow down the bubbles on our tank, WOW this is so powerful and quiet This is my go to brand for all my tanks

I first began using Whisper air pumps as a child over thirty years ago.  (Back then they were tan and the air filter could be popped out.)  They were the best then and I am pleased to say that I find them to be the best now.  I am using the Whisper 20 for an over stocked ten gallon tank.  It is working very well to supply a large air stone.  This pump was a replacement for an identical pump that was eight years old.The old pump had lost its power, but it was still going strong and it was ever so quiet.  This new one is doubly powerful.  I had no idea I had lost so much performance with the old one.  I know I could have purchased a parts kit to fix the old one, but it was just easier and less hassle to buy a new one.  The new pump is slightly louder than the under performing old pump, but the difference is negligible.  I would expect no less of a brand new replacement device with about double the output of the old device.I am very happy with my purchase.  I highly recommend this product for performance, longevity and silence.
summary: Whisper is a bench mark of quiet quality

reviewText: I have used this Whisper air pump for years.  Before, I used other products, and those were noisy and diaphragm rubber was broken within a year.  This product is quiet and long life.

This bulb has kept our red-eared slider in good health for many years. His shell stays in good shape due to the strength of the bulb. The turtle is in a 20-inch high tank AND has a screen cover, so I buy the Reptisun 10 over the Reptisun 5 because its UVB rays travel a further distance than the 5 model. I replace the bulb every 12 months even though the bulb still lights up, because the UVB light comes from the coated glass which wears out after a year. I keep the light on at least 12 hours a day.I also use a 100-watt incandecent UVA bulb for 4 hours a day, which is supposed to help the turtle's appetite.
summary: Necessary for our turtle's bone and shell health.

reviewText: After buying a bearded dragon I was in need of a UVB bulb. I searched and kept getting confused as there were so many types of bulbs. I joined a forum or two and during my reading I found articles saying the curly compact bulbs were linked to cases of blindness in reptiles.This was recommended to me in a post I made on one of the websites. It seems to be working fine, so far. I've had it for several days and run it about 10 hours a day. My dragon seems to love it and is a lot perkier since it was added to his tank (I didn't have a UVB bulb for about 3 days). I can see no reason not to recommend this bulb.
I have used these fluorescent bulbs for many years, and I am very pleased with them. They give out plenty of UVB light
summary: Always pleased with Zoo Med products

reviewText: Product arrived fast and in perfect condition, however shipping box was dented, and only filling in box was a piece of brown paper. No idea how bulb survived shipping in these conditions? Otherwise been using this bulb for the past 5 months for my Bearded Dragon and could not be happier.
I was a bit reluctant buying light bulbs online for fear of getting a box full of glass pcs, but it arrived well protected and it works perfect - for a lot less than they are sold at the pet store

While fluorescent UVB sources may not put out as much UV as Mercury Vapor or Metal Halide Bulbs, they are a time tested source of UV that has been proven effective. Make sure you replace you bulbs once every 6-8 months as the UVB will fade off long before the bulb itself.
Helps keep my juvenile beardie healthy and active. Is a must in beardie care and can be bought for a GREAT price on Amazon.
Product was exactly what was indicated on the website and exactly what I ordered.  This product is much cheaper to buy on line and you don't have to go out to the pet shop.
My grand-daughers rabbit play with it all the time, you can hear him at night moving it around.
I just adopted Walter 5 days ago.  I ordered these not knowing if he would like them or me for that matter.  I am happy to report that these pine cones are loved! I will be placing an order for more.
Barnaby bunny loves these. He eats the outside quite fast and they last him pretty good! He wants to get another!

Although not much to them, these pine cones are actually one of my rabbit's favorite chews. I'd order these again. (Wish I had pine trees near me.)**read edit below**I've read there is a link between pine shavings and liver disease. I'm not sure if the study is accurate or if pine cones can cause the same effects.I'll have to have my bunny checked at his next exam. I'm sure he'll be fine considering the small amount of a pine cone verses the dusty and abundant pine shavings.I don't use pine shavings anyways.Reference: [...]EDIT: I took a star off. These are still good to add to your bunny arsenal of toys. However, after a short while, my rabbit stopped playing with these. I probably will not buy him these again. The first day he chewed on them a little but after that, he got bored with them. Although, he did play/chew the pine cones more than those chews you hang in the cage. I found a better chew at the local Pet Smart he really likes: appears to be 2 wicker wood-like rings looped onto a dried sea sponge.The key is to rotate toys but any rabbit owner (should) knows this. You may have to do a little trial and error to find a toy your particular rabbit likes.
summary: They're just pine cones but they work.

reviewText: The concept is a nice idea but basically these are pretty small. I will give them credit for making them pretty safe for animals as they have all the really hard edges smoothed. The only problem is that my Guinea Pigs had absolutely no interest in them. However, that doesn't mean yours wouldn't like them because each animal is different.
She loved these! Loved to chew on them daily....to the point the noise was a bit annoying but oh well, the joy of having pets. I will buy these again!
Rabbit love to play with it, so if he's happy my grand daughter is happy

This grass ball is great - my two rabbits love kicking it around with their big bunny feet and playing soccer aka football with it. They're other activites include nudging it slightly with their noses and rubbing their chins on it to claim possession/territory. Great buy and great quality!
summary: Bought this grass ball hoping it would be as big as the pictures showed...it was.

reviewText: Large solid ball that my mini lops like to roll around their hutch.  Looks like it will last some time.

My rabbit has absolutely no interest in this grass play ball. I ended up putting it ON TOP of his cage displayed with a stuffed hedge hog and bunny. That does not mean of course that your pet would not enjoy it. to each his own :))
I got this as a treat for my guineas.  Although they normally love grass, they won't touch this thing.  It's basically sat in their cage.  Waste of money.

First I'd like to say that, like a few other reviews I saw, mine did not come with a bell inside. Which was a bit disappointing as I know my guinea pig would have been more interested in it if there was a bell. This might be fun for some small pets, but my piggy just doesn't seem too interested. He chews on it sometimes, and occasionally will push it around the cage with his nose. But for the most part it just sits in the cage untouched. From what some reviewers have said, I'd say its worth a try, but unfortunately it just isn't something my piggy likes too much.
My guinea pigs chew and eat this more than roll it around, but they really like it.  It is large and it will take them a long time to get through it.

My girl loves this ball. She's an English spot mix (around the 8lb range) and it's the perfect size for her. She enjoys both eating the grass and rolling it around the pen. The Peter brand makes excellent products, in my opinion and this ball has definitely been a great purchase. After two months with the buns, the ball is still quite intact with a few holes where she decided she needed a snack!
eh, might be good for another small animal and perhaps it was not make for chinchillas, either way, our chinnie did not like it much.

The ball arrived intact. For some odd reason, our bunnies are not enjoying it as expected - they would chew their grass mats up within a week so I am very surprised this ball remains untouched. No funny odor that I can detet but their noses are a lot more sensitive than  mine. Going to compost it since it is not working for the bunnies.

The first thing that I would like to specify is that the dimensions given in the product description are deceptive. They say 5x6x9, but that is not a Length x Width x Height measurement. The only way this ball is 9 inches is if that is the total circumference. I measured the product I received to be more 5x4x5 lxwxh. Regardless, it is certainly a reasonable size for a full grown rabbit.Other than that, it looks great! My bunny took straight to it the moment I set it down for him. He very clearly prefers this grass ball to the wicker type balls.Now all I'll have to worry about is how quickly he demolishes it!
My rabbit really liked this and it took her a week or so to totally eat it. It entertained as well as fed her:) Will probably buy again.
summary: Met with Cuddles the rabbits expectations.

reviewText: He destroyed it...which is why we got it for him...so he'll destroy this instead of things he shouldn't destroy.  Recommended!

This grass play ball held up through daily biting, grabbing and tossing by our bunny (she's a medium-large sized bunny) for at least a month.  We finally took it our of her cage not because it was all that much physically worse for the wear but because we started to worry about the sanitary condition of something she played with daily that we cannot wash.  We would purchase this item again because she seriously interacted with it.
summary: Not sure if our girl bunny loves it or hates it but she daily moved it around her house

reviewText: This product is ok, but the willow ball is much, much, much better! This product leaves a lot of mess, but it last for almost a month. The willow ball lasted for 3 hours, and particles of the willow ball last for couple more days.
summary: This product is ok, but the willow ball is much, much, much better!

reviewText: My chinchillas really love this grass ball, though the only thing that would make it better is if the company made a toy that could last a bit longer (e.g. is bigger or has more grass) because my chinchillas demolish this thing in three days, tops, and then next thing I know I need to purchase another one and have it sent through the mail! I wouldn't mind paying a bit more for toys that last longer, especially since it would save time on shipping and constantly purchasing more of the same toy.Otherwise, a great product, and I'd recommend it to chinchilla owners looking to expand their chinchilla toy repertoire.

Both my guinea pigs really like this woven grass ball. They play with it and nibble on it a lot. They are real happy with it. If they are happy with something, then I'm happy with it, if they show an interest in something. I would recommend this grass ball for guinea pigs since mine seem to like it. I gave it a 4 star rating.
My rabbits roll this ball around their pen.  Then they will chew on.  Once they get a hole started, they will eventually tear apart slowly, then eat the grass pieces.
Arrived with with no green grass, put is still tasty. Ok toy for the bunny to chew on or push it around.
Our guinea pigs have enjoyed rolling this around the cage chewing it up as they go.  Good product for a cage toy.
my piggies loved it....so i do recommend it for buying to your guinea pigs...seem like interesting toy for them to chew and push around

They nibble on it a little bit here and there, but don't usually interact with it unless it's in their way.  Maybe my bunnies just aren't as playful as some others, but they just don't do much with this.  I honestly find that they like my homemade "toys" better: a paper towel or toilet paper roll stuffed with hay.  I might end up giving this ball to the rats I just rescued, to see if they like it more.

My pigs love these balls. They are huge in size, so keep that in mind. My two pigs sleep in here together. Ive ordered about six of these so far. They just love them and the weirdest thing is they eat them. Thats why i always need new ones. They will chew and eat up the entire ball til there's noting left. Very werid how all this ball fits in these little pigs lol, there favorite christmas present.

My bunny loved this!  I got her the hut to and she destroyed both of them, but somehow this lasted longer than the bed.She really seemed to enjoy this the most, she liked to roll it in addiction to chewing it up and it lasted about a week before it was completely unraveled and two before she ate it all.. not to bad for the price.She really seemed to love it, I would recommend this! :)
Just a ball to chew on- and he does. Bunnies love grass chew things- a good price for my sweet bun.
Oh this is a FANTASTIC chomp and roll toy for a bunny.Wheeeeeeeeeeeee!!!!!!!!!!!!!My bunny has been having a ball (pun intended!) with this wonderful new toy!Happy Happy Happy !
summary: Bunny Approval Rating of 5 Stars and Beyond!

reviewText: It's hard shopping for bunnies because they are not a one size fits all kinda pet. Some love certain toys while others, not so much. For Sir Hops-a-lot, he liked picking it up and moving it but didn't really do anything else with it. I was worried that it was collecting dust in his toy basket after several months so I put it in his "castle" and that was the end of the ball, all chewed up, just like his mats he goes through so often. So, it didn't go completely unused but at the same time I don't think I'll buy him another one.
My guinea pig is not all that interested in it so far but i am still happy with it. It is a good toy.I later gave it to my rabbit and he loved it. He chewed it up.

My rabbit absolutely loves it. It's taken him about a week to tear through part of it, but he's enjoyed it the entire time! It's also much bigger than I expected.... Now if I can just get him to stop tossing it in the water dish!

My bunny is a baby still (7 months) and he is still learning to play, so there are only a few toys he REALLY enjoys (like the willow nutty balls with the nuts removed, apple sticks, and cardboard boxes) so I think it was just him.

Like many reviewers here, my Peters Woven Grass Play Ball arrived without a bell inside. One star off for that. Fortunately, I had an extra bell from a cat collar lying around, and just pushed it through the spaces between the weaving - now the ball has a bell.The rabbits showed no interest in this for nearly 3 months. Then one day they "discovered" it, and now they have fun tossing it around and chewing on it.If your rabbits don't go for this at first, don't give up. My buns will focus on one toy for awhile and ignore all the others, then suddenly shift their attention to another toy.They also love the Peter's Grass Mat. THAT gets demolished in days. But the Woven Grass Play Ball has lasted for a long time.
summary: No bell inside, but a good toy for rabbits.

reviewText: My rabbit Haze loved this grass play ball. He pushed it all over the house and ate it up.Good product.

My Mini Lop loves these. He is headbutter so he loves pushing this around the house. I think having the bell helps keep his attention. He usually eats these grass woven toys pretty quickly, but this toy lasts about a month and keeps him happy!
summary: Fun Toy and Treat In One!

reviewText: My piggie ignored this until I stuffed fresh timothy hay between the open areas. I also make a point of occasionally putting it in his way so he has to work sometimes to move it to get around in his big cage. Often though, I find it all over his cage so he must be doing something with it.
summary: My Guinea Pig Thinks It's Okay

reviewText: Although Spunky is my fun loving guinea pig, he enjoyed playing with the rabbit size woven ball. It was a challenge to climb and a lot to chew upon giving his teeth a good work out. He will get another for exercise purposes in the future.

I purchased this play ball for my 6 year old long haired guinea pig, and she tried to tackle it when I placed it in her cage.  I started to laugh, because she has never had a toy this big before.  I thought it would be great to buy this because the ratings were really good.  I do like it when she is happy, and have different toys to give her good opportunity for moving around.  At her age it's always wise that they continue to get good exercise, but she like to sit, and eat her timothy hay, and fresh vegetables.  I do like the toy, and will continue to watch to see if she like pushing it, or just biting.  Maybe even both, but the main point is that she is happy.  She's one of my pets that I've had since she was a baby, my other is a cockatiel bird.

When my buns finally gets around to playing with this grass ball, he seems to have a good time with it. My buns is usually content with sitting in a cardboard box for fun or chasing the kitties, but if I roll this towards him a few times he'll usually give it a double-paw before butting it back towards me or biting it and throwing it away.I gave this product 4 out of 5 stars for using a slightly misleading photo. That rabbit is tiny!
summary: Fun toy, if they play with it.

reviewText: Shadow is the name of my black lop rescue rabbit and he can be a handful. But he really enjoys playing (and eating) the woven grass play ball. Shadow pushes the ball around with his nose. Sometimes he tries to fling the ball, but mostly he is pushing it or eating it.Peter's Woven Grass Play Ballhas a great smell which made Shadow's ear pop up when I opened the container. He was busy doing his bunny begging show - standing on his hind legs, lifting his paws out - so he could play/eat the ball as soon as possible.Somebody complained the ball is hollow (which it is). I look at it as a fun part - sneak a raisin or two into the hollowed out grass ball and it made Shadow do more binkies. It would be cool if there was one that was solid grass, I'm sure Shadow would go for that one.If you share your home with a bunny, this is a great gift for your little furry companion. You have a bad day at work, come home and give the furperson his/her gift and voila, you got entertainment for the night. The rabbit will binky (spontaneous jump in the air signifying happiness) and that will probably make you laugh. When I watch Shadow use this play ball, it makes me laugh and I forget about having a stinky day. Definitely cheaper than therapy and you can watch this for hours and still be able to drive your car home (presuming, of course, you are not consuming adult beverages). If you know somebody that has a rabbit, buy this and take it to the person's house so you can see what a binky  looks like in person. It will make everybody laugh.Bottom line: Shadow loves this and I will be buying it again. If there's a bunny in your life, I suggest you buy it. Your rabbit will be exercising and you will be laughing.

My rabbits (especially one) would go absolutely crazy over these! The first time I ordered one, I had very few other toys for them and they went through it in a few days. The second one was months later when they had built up a substantial toy collection and it lasted about a week. I ordered 3 more, 1 for each of them and 1 to spare.When they arrived both that I gave them were pulled immediately into the "rabbits's lair". Unfortunately 2 days later the rabbit that especially loved them had a tragic accident. They have not been touched since, even by his sister who was an accomplice for tearing up the first two. I have adopted a new rabbit and at the moment he does not seem interested.For rabbits that do like them, they are amazing! I am going to keep trying - she did love them too at one point but may still be too depressed to play with them.
nothing special, my rabbit is a dwarf os the ball is almost bigger than her, but she pushes it around in her cage and chews on the grass
Hamsters, rabbits, or small pet birds, it makes a fun toy for them to shred. It can get a little messy but it's good for them.My parakeets love pulling the straws apart until nothing remains.

Both of my rabbits LOVED this chew toy!!!! They don't just chew on it, they also eat the grass, and it doesn't bother their tummies. This is a very good toy for them to chew on since their teeth constantly grow.....

Our rabbit loved it, made relatively short work of it for which I'm thankful as it meant she enjoyed it immensely.Ok, so I am laughing as I type this when I read the 5-stars for "I love it" - the bunny sure did!!
It's too big for my son's guinea pigs and it's really too big for my rabbit, as well. They don't show any interest in playing with it or chewing on it.

I bought this product almost 3 months ago and it is still almost like new. Not that my bunny hasn't enjoyed it though. He plays with it occasionally has eaten a hole through it but the ball is still very much in one piece and rolling around. I wish all his other toys would last as long as this one. Even though he has rolled it into his potty and covered it in "liquids" the ball is not stinky or moist. It seems to dry up quickly and be ready for yet another round of rolling and chewing. Great work on this toy and I will be buying another one whenever this one gets destroyed, which by the looks of it won't be any time soon.
summary: Long Lasting and Great Bun Toy

reviewText: This was one of my puppy's favorite toys. After about a week though the ribbons are all but gone and she was choking on part of a ribbon and then swallowed it. I cut the remaining frayed ribbons off. I still like the toy, just suggest the ribbons should be made of something more puppy proof.
summary: Loved it - but ate the ribbons

reviewText: You know how your puppy wants to chew on your shoelaces?  This toy attracts them in that way.  Our pup spent a lot of time on those cloth knots and strings.  It would be good if they'd had those on both ends, but all in all, the puppy liked the toy a lot and I'm glad we got it.

My little Italian Greyhound pup loves this toy. It's frilly, small (but not too small), makes crunchy noises in certain places and is easy for her to carry around. She  definitely loves chewing on this toy and I thought the freezing feature was great as she just started teething pretty badly. However, when you freeze this toy, it doesn't last more than 5 minutes. Mind you, I froze the toy overnight (for about 9-10 hrs) before I took it out to give to my puppy. By the time I walked to the other side of my very small home, it hardly felt cold anymore. Hopefully I'll figure out why this is happening, whether my toy is defective or if its a common occurrence. Regardless, I am still giving this toy 5 stars, as my puppy loves this toy and it stays cold for a few minutes for her to chew on, which seems to make her pleased.
summary: A little disappointed, but overall the puppy still loves it.

reviewText: I was looking for a teething stick and got this one but the fabric is not that absorbant so it does not retain moisture and stay frozen for very long.  Would probably go with a Chilly Bone next time.
My dog loved it as a puppy! I got it for him again as an adult dog but he ripped it easily(he's only 15ish lbs) so definitely recommend for puppies!
My puppy loves this.  I soak it in water and place it in the freezer and she loves to chew on it.  The strings on the end drive her nuts.  A must have for a chewing puppy.
Item looks well made, and might be attractive to your dog.....but save your money and buy a Kong instead!  :(
i bought this because of the description saying it could be put in the freezer.... ummm it holds a cold temp about as long as any other toy. nothing freezer use about it

My Dog (Puppy) loves this. It is not yet bored of this one. It would drop the other chewable toys but not not this one. Hours of fun. It can also be refrigerated to give it a cold chew. Dog likes it. Money well spent.
summary: My Dog loves this! compared to his other chewable toys.

reviewText: My pup has no interest in this toy. I bought it for her when she was teething but she liked housebreaking pads and shoes better. It just didn't hold her interest.
This was a great help when we brought out 8 week old puppy home.  She loved it and it kept her happy for much longer than other teething toys.

Funny that Amazon had this as a 'recommended toy' for me.  I already own it!Bought this for my dog when he was teething about a year and a half ago.  You're supposed to be able to soak it in water and freeze it but I found that to be a waste of time.  The material is sort of water proof and the little bit that does soak up water well enough to freeze, thaws almost immediately (minute or two).  My dog much preferred ice cubes over this toy while he was teething.That said, I still gave it five stars because it is without a doubt one of his favorite toys and it has great lasting power.  We use it to play fetch in the house, tug of war and sometimes he just chews and shakes it (it makes that 'crinkly noise' that some dogs love).  Nothing has fallen off it and it hasn't required any repairs from me, even after multiple machine washings - it's well constructed IMO.  I have a picture of him and this toy somewhere on my home pc - will add it to the customer images section later :).
summary: So-So as a Teething Toy but my Dog Loves It :)

reviewText: This is a great toy, my puppy loves to chew on it and throw it in the air. I just wish that I bought a bigger size.

My pup liked the knots for a few minutes but other than that, nothing. I froze it according to instructions, but it never gets hard and the cold only lasts for about three minutes. No worth the money at all.

Got this for my teething puppy, has been in the freezer for days and the material is kind of cool to the touch since it has been in the freezer but it is no were near as cold as the frozen, damp dish rag my dog would prefer to chew on... She does like that the fabric crinkles but as far as it being a soothing, puppy teething toy it fails.

When I saw and read the description, I envisioned something similar to what we toss in freezer for babies. It's just a patchwork sewn flimsy, cloth item with a slight crinkle noise.  The cool teething aspect is to wet the cloth exterior and wring out water, then freeze.  You can do that with anything. Puppy used it once for about 2 minutes and bit little cloth legs off and ate them. I was able to fish a small piece out his mouth when I realized the toy was "edible."  This is poor advertisement; poor quality; and definitely not durable enough to be considered appropriate for puppy chewing.  Maybe a puppy with dental problems, who will never get the tiniest of teeth.  Puppy is 7 1/2 weeks old.  Not at all what I envisioned  Oh, wow, he just pooped yellow, red and blue. Ugh!
summary: Nothing specia; Poor quality  and would not recommend.  TINY too

reviewText: Rusty and the nugget were having a field day with this.  The nugget is older than Rusty so this was originally for Rusty.  This lasted about a week before he ripped it open.  They enjoyed every minute of it's existance though!
summary: Lasted About a Week but man did they love it!

reviewText: This teething stick is THE BEST.  Frozen or not, our puppy LOVES it.  The problem?  So does our 2-year-old dog, so I immediately ordered another.It is just right for "crunching."  Makes a nice sound, is enticing to look at, and is not too stuffed. Most are, so they don't get the satisfaction.  You know how puppies love to chew blankets, shoes, etc?  Not too thick. This is the same principal. Just love it.
This toy is for a very young, small puppy, not an older puppy who likes to chew. I wouldn't buy it again

Dog really enjoyed it until one day then she ripped it to shreds and it was very easy for her to do, glad I was watching so that she didn't eat it. She never was interested in it when we froze it either.

I have order two of these on two separate occasions, once for my boston when she was a puppy and once for my pug.  They worked great for their teething and were durable enough to not get destroyed.  I still have them both and the dogs still play with them now and then.  Highly recommended for a baby pup if its in the small dog range.
Need to freeze this and see if it helpsOur tiny puppy has needle sharp teeth and she is teething
Froze like instructed and it was barely cool to the touch and not a very good chew toy as it had no thickness to it. this is the only toy my dog hasnt destroyed because shes not interested in it.
summary: Not good toy for pitt puppy

reviewText: I ordered this for my 4 month old Morkie puppy.  She is teething now and I thought it would be perfect for her.  The size was good but within 10 minutes of having it she had torn off almost all of the ribbons and it was warm to the touch.  I returned it and would not recommend this product for any puppy.  It would be better if it stayed cold longer and the ribbons were not on it since they are pretty easy to tear off and chew up as my puppy demonstrated.
I ordered 2 for my 2 pups and they both went crazy over it. they love chewing on it and it doesnt even have to be cold

I bought this for my grandson's new 2 month old Shih Tzu. She likes chewing it regardless if it's cold or not.  It doesn't stay cold very long, but she doesn't seem to care. It comes in handy when she's caged for potty training.

This was our puppy's favorite toy when he came home.  We put it in huge freezer once or twice, but didn't really notice it getting very cold.  Regardless, he really enjoys this toy and I would highly recommend it.  Our puppy loves any toy made by petstages.  Even though he is a puppy, he has high brand loyalty ;-)

I bought this for tactile development of my 7 week old foster. I would wet it and freeze it for him. It made little crunchy noises and he seemed to like the feeling of it more than a traditional hard bone that my older dog loves.
Nice and soft chew toy for puppies mouth.  She has not pulled any of the strings off either and she chews on it all the time.
summary: Small Easy to Chew Puppy toy

reviewText: I bought this toy as a recommended set of 3 teething toys and boy what a great teething stick for puppies.  The size and types of teething pieces are perfect for small puppies teeth; they can grab hold and really get some relief.  The shape of the toy is also nice for puppies - they can either hold it horizontally or vertically by themselves easily.

We bought this for our 9 week old Cavalier King Charles Spaniel puppy who weighs 4.5 pounds.  Within minutes he had chewed off the nylon ends and was eating them.  The other side has string and we've already seen him eat and poop the string!  I wouldn't recommend this toy to any serious chewer!
summary: 9 week puppy immediately chewed off nylon ends and ate it

reviewText: My Chihuahua puppy loves to play tug of war with this toy.  It's a bit large for her but that doesn't keep her for chewing on it. It will be a while before she starts to teeth but I trust she will still like it as much as she does now.

I don't know what it is about this toy - but my maltipoo absolutely loves it.  Maybe it's all the strings hanging out?  Don't know.But for me, one thing that I love is that it's super easy to clean.  I absolutely love the fact that you can wet it, stick it in the freezer for a nice cold toy for your teething puppy to chew on and it won't make a huge mess.
Purchased the Cool Teething stick to help my puppy during his teething stage.  He loves the crinkle sound it makes, especially when I freeze it.
summary: Dog Toy Pet Stages Cool Teething Stick

reviewText: I love how u can freeze this.  Although i have not done that yet my puppy loves it.  Like i have said about other products from this company it is also the perfect size for my little yorkie.  He loves the lil strings on it as well as the spiky things.
Puppy had this chewed up in no time.  Maybe for a very young pup, under 3 months otherwise don't think will last.

I would recommend that Amazon include the measurements of this "teething stick" in their product description. The actual stuffed stick is only six inches long and approximately an inch in diameter.  If I had known the dimensions of this product, I wouldn't have purchased it. I have a Newfoundland puppy who is eight weeks old and 25 pounds. She is teething and the idea of a frozen stick sounded like a good idea. I had the stick in the freezer for a couple of hours and it didn't really get icy, hard or cool. (Maybe it needs to be in the freezer a longer time?) The crinkle they talk about isn't just when it is frozen, it is merely the sounds made by the stuffing. It almost sounds like the stuffing is made of a plastic-like material. The small ribbons on one end of the product are only an inch long and they are just regular silk/rayon gift-wrap ribbon. After less than 1/2 hour, most of the ribbons are now torn and shredded. I had to take away this teething stick and throw it away. My dog destroyed it -
summary: THIS PRODUCT IS NOT FOR YOU - unless you have a miniature or small breed puppy

reviewText: This is an ok toy for a small dog that doesn't chew.. The tassles came off easily only after playing with it for a short time... so I wouldn't recommend it unless your dog doesn't chew at all.. If not, then it might be a good play toy.
summary: Ok if your dog doesn't chew

reviewText: We have a three month old Shichon and loves it at the time he needs relief or starts nipping at us.  We bought two of them so we would have a frozen one ready throughout the day.
summary: Dog Pet Stages Cooling Teething Stick

reviewText: This is a nice teething toy for my puppy he loves all the little things to chew on, fast shipping

This works great for a teething puppy!  I sqeeze it, hold it under water, put it in a zip lock bag and give it to the puppy at night.  My puppy loves it! Makes my life easy and my puppies mouth numb! Great deal!

My puppy loves this chew toy! I got this one and the Nylabone Puppy Teething Pacifier Chew Toy at the same time but this is the only toy he pays attention to. In fact, it seems to be his favorite now.  It's perfect for my 5-pound, 11 week old puppy because unlike other chew toys I've bought him, he can hold this entire toy in his tiny mouth and carry it around with him.  He is not a vigorous chewer so I think it will last us awhile but it seems to  me that if your dog is a heavy chewer, this product may tear easily.The feature my puppy seems to like the most is the little knots on what looks like this creature's head. I think the knots feel good on his gums. He also really likes to chew on the parts that make the crinkly noise.  As other reviewers mentioned, this product does not seem to hold the cold after placing it in the freezer so as long as you are not purchasing this toy solely for that reason, this is a good buy!UPDATE: a little over a week later, this is still one of my puppy's favorite toys. He definitely likes the noise that the crinkly material makes! That's the part of the toy that he almost always chews on.

This is one of our puppy's favorite toys and it was also one of the cheapest so you can't really go wrong. She loves to work on each little tab or ribbon and take the knots out of them. It's pretty beat up but still hanging in there. We'll get another one when she destroys it.

This toy is a bit bizarre, and reminds me of something a fourth grader could make.  Our French bulldog puppy is teething, so my husband and I were in the market for a few teething toys.  I was expecting this toy to have a bit more structure and durability, but when we received it, found it's essentially just a fabric tube filled with stuffing with odd attachments.  The package suggests freezing the toy... we did this and didn't notice any significant change.  We were thinking it would firm up after being frozen, but it was just cold to the touch.  On the bright side, our pup does enjoy playing with the toy!
The dog really loves this. He's a large dog but for some reason this is his favorite. He carries it around with him, and it withstands his chews.

Our 12-week-old pup is teething, and we've bought her quite a few different toys.  This one is by far the biggest hit.  The cooling may be the trick...she also LOVES the little knots and the crinkling sound.  She can chew on this for a really long time (in puppy time anyway).  Which is more than I can say for any other toy at this point.Buy it!

My puppy loves the strings and knots on this toy. I tried soaking it and putting it in the freezer as directed, but my puppy barely touches it when cold! It melts fast anyways and I have no complaints because she still plays with it.
Puppy did not like it cold and tore it to shreds quite quickly.  The cats seems to like to play with it more.
1.  It doesn't freeze well so it is not soothing on her teeth. 2. Also, she chewed off the tails and put them in her mouth and tried to eat them.
I never used this when my puppy was teething by putting it in water and in the freezer, but my dog loved it anyway and it lasted at least six months!
summary: Never used it cool, but my dog loves it!

reviewText: I never put this into the freezer to get cool for my puppy.  Maybe that's why she doesn't have much interest in it.  Without the cooling effect, this toy is definitely overlooked by both dogs.  But I will try the cooling effect and re-review.

This is great while the dog is teething...after they get their teeth...not so much. The material is thin, which helps it freeze, but that also means that it will tear easily. Additionally, all the stringy parts that stick out of this toy can be choking hazards. We cut them off before giving to our dog, but definitely consider that before purchasing.Overall, a decent toy for small puppies who don't yet have teeth.
summary: Good before they get their teeth

reviewText: Wet this chew toy and place it in the freezer for maximum teething relief. My Yorkie pup loves this and it has held up very well.
My puppy loves this toy but I've found that the toy doesn't get very cold after leaving it in the freezer overnight.  It also doesn't stay cold for very long.
Miley our new puppy love this as makes crackly sounds. She wants to chew on everything great toyAlso like the cloth that she can care the toy..
My baby loves to play with this. I wet it and freeze it and it eases her teeth. It is the perfect size for a small dog and made well.
Excellent toy for new born puppies.  The crackling sound grabs their attention while the soft exterior doesn't harm their gums.

My puppy is teething and loves ice cubes, so I thought a toy I could freeze would be perfect for him.  However, this doesn't seem to freeze at all!  It gets cool, but that only lasts for a few minutes out of the freezer. He likes this toy so I'm giving it 3 stars, but I'm pretty disappointed.

My pup loves this toy.  She doesn't really care if it's frozen or not.  She does love to chew on it (and then she'll get bored with it).  She does like the cracking sound and the frilly stuff on its head.  Cute purchase and i'd say worth it.

I bought this for my 5 week old puppy, Naturally he was teething and his mouth hurt all the time. I wet it down and placed in the freezer. After a while, it would be crunchy frozen. He loved it. The little "tentacles" were cold too and he loved to drag it around by those. It held together well and didn't chew apart. He's 7 months old now and still uses it. Not as much now as he has his adult teeth, but still likes to chew on it.I would recommend this to friends and family and dogs - they tell me they are very pleased with this toy and wish more owners would purchase for them.

So far out of the various types of chew toys I've gotten our puppy (nylabones, ropes, kongs, etc), this seems to be the one she likes the least. It does not freeze well at all which is the main reason I bought this. It is hard to soak completely and therefore does not effectively absorb the water in order to freeze all the way. I suppose it is just for "cooling" like the name implies, but since the instructions are for it to go in the freezer, it was not obvious to me before purchasing that it would not completely freeze. When dry, it is still a fun toy, but seems to be a bit wide for my 14 week old puppy who prefers chewing on the small ends of it rather than the body of the toy. Perhaps as she grows she will be able to more comfortably fit her mouth around it and will hopefully enjoy it more, but for now, since I bought it for the cooling effect was supposed to have I am disappointed and would not recommend this product for that purpose.
summary: Does not freeze well at all

reviewText: Our dog loves this "stick". It crinkles when she plays with it, and she loves when we freeze it for her sore teething gums. A fun fetch toy.

....My puppy has already chewed through this and chewed off the 'pieces' that are tied on.  Luckily she did not eat or swallow them, but I would think a puppy product would be safer (she could have choked), plus more durable for her sharp little teeth.  On the upside, she does like it and I like that I can put it in the freezer to help her when she's teething.It would be a five star product, had it been more durable !!
summary: Cute Idea!!  But not very durable....

reviewText: This was a life-saver when out puppy was teething. I'd soak it in water and put it in the freezer. Then, when he was whining and noticeably uncomfortable from the teething I'd bring it out and you could actually see the relief in his whole body as soon as he saw it! I considered getting one or two more so that I could always have one in the freezer to sooth his poor mouth, but I never got around to it.For the record, when this one was not ready yet I would use rags tied in a knot that I had also soaked and frozen. But those were really, really messy and I would have to confine him to the kitchen and then clean up the puddles. This one never got drippy - I guess because the material is made to be absorbent so it holds onto the water as the ice melts and then just dries out as he chews. He's done teething now, but I still use it because we live in an area that gets quite hot in the summer and it's a great way to help him cool off (he's an Old English Sheepdog and seems to HATE the heat - I don't blame him!)
summary: A life saver when my pup was teething

reviewText: 8 weeks old, our Maltipoo Ella loves this toy! We tried another Pet Stages toy as well and she loves that one too. With the different colors and some of the flaps make a crinkling sound, it keeps her interested. She also loves the hold the toy and pull on the knotted ends of the smaller parts. Great buy :)

My puppy likes this toy despite the fact that it's not really a "cool" teething stick.  Unless you soak it with water, it doesn't really hold the cold once removed from the freezer.  Regardless, it is a nice size to for a small puppy of less than 5 lbs, and the fringe and crinkly areas keep my dog entertained for a while.
summary: Good toy despite lack of actual "Cool" feature

reviewText: My puppy couldn't have cared less avout this thing.  She didn't ever touch it.  She teethed with a cold washcloth.

Well, this is a cute toy for teething, however, after my puppy chewed off several of the knots I cut the rest of them off so that she wouldn't swallow them.  She does like to chew on it, so other than the knots, it's fine.
My little yorkies just love this toy these are very well made and you can easily put them in the washer and dryer to clean and they still hold up very well.
My puppy was teething so I decided to freeze this toy. She ripped it in one session. After the second session I decided I had to take it away from her before she swallowed the stuffing.
Like it,not doing this again aswhat can you say about a toy.Havn't played with it, butam sure my Tea Cup ChihuahuaHana will like it.
Not what I expected. It's okay, but as far as using it to cool for a teething stick it really isn't ideal for that.

This is a cute toy for a puppy and I froze it following the directions. My puppy wasn't interested and as it thawed it got the rug wet. I think she might have too many other toys she likes better. I'd still recommend this as it is a great idea for teething and fun toy.

I wanted a toy that froze firm like an ice cube. This wasn't it.And y'know, I could have even lived with that EXCEPT that I only had it for two days before my teething puppy managed to rip the fabric lengthwise
summary: Does not freeze. Did not last even a week.

reviewText: I agree with the review that this is a great idea but no matter how much you wet the toy it does not freeze completely. It would be perfect if it stayed frozen longer. My puppies are excited when I take the toys from the freezer but after a minute or so that excitement wears off because now all they have it a wet soft toy.

If you buy this for just a toy, I would rate it 2 stars.  If your buying this to sooth your pets gums, for teething, I give it 1 star. Don't buy it. I must have missed it, or not read in in the reviews, but I thought this would have a center that freezes.  I doesn't.  I does not get very cold at all,and I kept it in the freezer for 3 days, and I even followed someone else's advise about getting it wet first. My best advise is buy some other theething item
This toy is great and my puppy seems to love it.  What I like best is I have hardwood floors and it doesn't make noise like all of the hard toys do.

I had it ready for when I brought my new pup home and it did the job.  When she passed the stage of teething it still is in good shape and remains in her toy box.  It held up very well and has a lot of interesting things to it that add interest for your pup!  I highly recommend this pet essential.  Just stick it in the freezer for a while and add it into toys especially bed time for those moments when your puppy may feel a bit anxious.
This was my puppies favorite first toy! She loved all the string pieces with knots. This toy can also be soaked in water and frozen for teething.
My puppy really didn't bother with this.  I froze it several times but she didn't care for it.  It's pretty small and doesn't absorb water all that well.  May work better for smaller breed dogs.
MY BERNESE MOUNTAIN DOG PUPPY LOVED THIS TOY UNTIL SHE DECIDED TO BECOME VERY DESTRUCTIVE WITH ALL OF HER TOYS AND CHEWED HOLES IN THEM

This is great for smaller puppies.  The side tabs are crinkly, which they love, and the ribbons and knots on the ends are interesting to them for play and chewing.  It's also held up ok to our tiny chihuahua puppies play tug-of-war with it though I don't think it would survive anyone much larger than them.  It holds up to washing well and easily held color and shape when thrown in with a load of other doggie stuff.
Dogs weren't interested in this being cool or room temperature, either way it didn't hold up at all. Was destroyed within about 20 minutes by my puppy.
My dog really likes this toy, but it is too easy for him to tear parts off and it them.
this is a fun and super noisy puppy toy.  keeps my baby busy and he loves it.  definitely for little ones tho.  a large dog would eat it up in a day

I have a very small puppy who weighs 1 1/2 pounds and is teething.  She loves this toy and it is small enough that she can carry it around to play.  She likes the different parts that hang off of it really well.  It instantly became one of her favorite toys.

The toy looks as pictured, and the quality appears to be good enough to hold up through lots of chewing.  Parts of the toy crinkle, which distracts my 9 week old for about 60 seconds.  Not a total waste of money for a toy but it does nothing for teething puppies.  The toy I received does not cool - at all - and the material isn't made for massaging gums/teeth.  I recommend a cold wet washcloth and a bully stick over this toy for teething puppies.
summary: Not a total waste for a crinkle toy

reviewText: My puppy seems to like this toy, and it has held up well.  However, it doesn't stay cold very long.

We don't even cool this and my puppies love it. Something about the crinkle sound it makes and all of the chewable strings-they go nuts. I think once they start teething, I'll try cooling it, but I've never had good luck with toys designed for teething.

I have two dogs.  The older one, a St. Bernard cross, has never chewed any toy up.  The younger Great Dane can, in one chomp, break most toys.  Amazingly she has been unable to destroy this toy.  I'm delighted.  It takes them time to get any treats out and they enjoy working on them.The only down side is that when you wash the Orka Chew water gets into a few of the chambers and gets trapped.  Luckily I live in a very dry climate so most things will dry overnight.For my heavy chewer this has been a great addition.

The dog loves chasing this through the house and watching it bounce. It's made of a very chewy material and I am not sure how it would work for heavy chewers. I'd say this one is for light chewers and puppies. It's fun for him and me!

My dog and I love this.  It takes weird bounces so it keeps him on his toes when I throw it for him. My dog is a Doberman puppy that has had this toy since he was 12 weeks old (he's 8 months now) and still hasn't even remotely damaged it.

I think i already said this in another review, but i will say it again, im so outraged every time i go to petco or petsmart, they are some of the biggest rip offsSo for this particular item first you get the good price because after all it is just a dog toy and they dont last forever, that being said this is one the very few toys that floats and will last for almost a whole season with my two german shepards, it is durable, but not that durable, the parts will come off one by one eventually, they need to find a way to glue it together a little better, that is why i only gave it four stars, but overall im pleased with it

It's been just as sturdy as reported, even with hours of chewing there's not so much as a dent in it. It's a fun texture, great shape, and bounces erratically (it's not the bounciest substance, but it does get a bit of air). Our puppy loves it and will sit and chew on it by himself as well as chase it around when we play with him.

I have spent a fortune on toys for my Doberman. This is the only toy that has lasted. He LOVES it! Is this toy indestructible? Of course not. It usually lasts about 6 months before I have to replace it. I see a host of dissatisfied reviewers, but hey, every dog is different.
