There was $20+ down the drain.The ball and the treats are Made in China - the treats are rock hard, the main ingredient is wheat and I suspect it is closer to some sort of wheat gluten glue that hardens - when  wet it does smell a bit and does leave a mess on the carpet. The ball is a jelly plastic that has a strange odor - I had a really hard time getting the treats into the ball so not surprised that the one dog couldn't get them back out. But if your dog can figure it out, or gets frustrated quickly you'll be surprised at how fast that ball will be torn to pieces when the dog turns its chewing jaws from the treat to the ball. Have no idea what the ball is made of and if it is toxic or not so had take it away (and throw it away) before they had a chance to eat any of it by accident.So -Pro: could potentially last your dog a long time and keep him occupiedCons: expensive, Made in China, wheat based treats (allergy alert) and not going to last long if you have a determined dog.Kongs are the only toys my dogs have never been able to tear apart, they are the only things that have survived from puppyhood to now grown, adult dogs.

The large Everlasting Treat Ball has been a great toy for our 55-lb Basset. It fits just about every type of treat, and you can choose different ways of stuffing it. Our dog isn't a big chewer, so we haven't had the problems that others have had with this toy.A few notes on our experience:- MOST IMPORTANT: The rawhide piece you see in the pictures came out right away, and became a chew-disk rather than part of the toy. We had to take it away so she wouldn't accidentally swallow it. (And there's another, sad review from someone whose dog choked on the rawhide and died - rawhide can be dangerous!!) I'd recommend supervising your dog the first time and seeing whether the rawhide comes out. Don't buy replacement rawhides until you're sure you need them.- You can vary the challenge level by how tightly you allow the tabs to hold a treat. You can fill the inner section with kibble, or you can wedge a biscuit or hard treat into the tabs, or you could freeze soft stuff in there. There's no need to buy special treats to fit this toy - it'll work with whatever you have.- Our dog likes to play with this ball even after the treats are out, throwing it to herself and chasing it around the house. We now give it to her (filled with treats) when we're going out as a way to reduce separation anxiety, and it almost always keeps her busy so she doesn't notice we're leaving.- It's silicone plastic, so it's softer and quieter than hard rubber toys on wood floors.- It cleans up very easily in the sink or dishwasher.- Unlike the Kong or the Squirrel Buddy, it has big holes on two sides (the holes in the picture are on both top and bottom). So I'm not sure how much of a mess it would make with peanut butter or frozen soft treats - we haven't tried, because hard treats work fine for us.- Doesn't fit a huge amount, so probably wouldn't work to feed your dog. Our dog takes about 15-20 minutes to get the treats out, then plays with it for a little while after that.Different dogs have different interests, but I completely recommend giving the Everlasting Treat Ball a try for your dog!
summary: Great toy for a gentle chewer

reviewText: My 35 lb cocker loves his new treat ball. The postman brought the treat ball in the morning and the dog spent all afternoon playing with it. Because I was busy and the dog was happily occupied I failed to notice for quite a while that the Everlasting brand chicken treat that came with the toy was making nasty stains all over the beige wall-to-wall carpet in my office. I'm pretty sure my pup isn't any more slobbery than any other avidly chewing canine. But his slobber and the chicken treat combined to create a trail of ugly mustard-colored carpet stains all over the room. In addition to a bunch of spots all over the place, I found a few large stains in out-of-the-way places where my dog had settled for awhile to lick and chew away at the toy. The treat ball itself is just fine -- I have no complaints about it as a quality dog toy. But I have serious issues with the food coloring that's used in the Everlasting treats that pop into the ball. I've just used up an entire aerosol can of carpet cleaner and an hour of elbow grease to remove the stains from my carpet. After this experience I won't be buying any Everlasting brand treats to put in my pup's new chew toy. If you're going to be using this product outdoors, then the Everlast treats might be just fine. But if you're planning to let your dog play with this toy indoors, and you've got nice flooring that you care about keeping reasonably clean, it's best to avoid the Everlast treat inserts.

This might be fine for less strong chewers, but my 45 lb. Chinook/American Staffy mix ripped pieces off in the first use (with a bully stick shoved through the middle); I had to throw it away.I purchased it along with the Petsafe Busy Buddy Squirrel Dude: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000A61GNO/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i01The Squirrel (filled with freeze dried duck pieces) kept him busy for a couple of hours and has no signs of damage. I'm buying another one of those for when his friends come over.
Purchased for a overactive border collie who is now thinking of trying out for a pro football team
The quality is good durable for strong chewers. Strongly recommend for strong chewers.Can place treats biscuits for fun playing!

I've had this toy for a few weeks now, and my bullmastiff is still loving it. It's quite heavy and solid and I snuggle little treats in it to keep him occupied while I'm at work. I think the mfgr was expecting an entire doggie bone to go into the football, but there's no chance of that--the rubber is too hard. It stands up well to solid chewing.
summary: Heavy toy, great bouce, good for small treats

reviewText: I've been searching for good dog toys that last longer than five seconds for my 10 month old, 60 lbs puppy. This is a keeper - it is still intact after several months, while most toys don't last the week or even the day. It's got great little pockets to hide high value treats in and can also withstand some chewing. I'm not sure how it fares against super power chewers but my average chewer it does very well.

Our dog has absolutely no interest in this.  It's way too heavy and the openings are just too big.  Try a regular Kong or another football type ...  this one just doesn't work.  (our pup is 70lbs and he can destroy a toy in no time)

My 60 lb  dog loves these kong like footballs,  I fill with 2 small size dog bones, side by side. (Milk bone small bones fit best)  This keeps him happily chewing for awhile.  He's picky about his chews - not liking something too hard.  This suits him.
summary: This is about the only thing my dog will chew

reviewText: My German shepherds are only interested if it has treats in it which they can get out in about two seconds.
Our dog loves this.  We shove any medium sized treat of any brand in there and he works on it for hours.
My dog gets this everyday when I leave for work.  It fits two milk bones. Cleans easily in dishwasher. I have a 30 lb dog and she loves this. I'm gonna buy another for my other dog.

This is the 2nd football we have had for my dog. The 1st one lasted a good three years before it was unusable. She loves getting her Milk Bones in the ball and whenever she wants a treat she goes and finds the ball and brings it to us. This has worked great for us, I saw some reviews where the dog chewed through it right away.. must have something to do with the power in the jaws or something. My dog is a 50 lb. mixed breed, Border Collie, Black Lab., Blue Heeler, Pit Bull.. so maybe she got the Lab's soft mouth.

I have a real honest to goodness love/hate relationship with this ball.LOVE...The fact my dog adores this ball & it keeps her occupied for 15-30 minutes.Standard large Milk Bones fit securely inside - which is a nice, inexpensive way to keep my dog entertained.HATE...Chunks of Milk Bone will get wedged inside this ball that your dog won't be able to get out, and unfortunately these chunks need to come out before you can refill. You WILL be able to get it out but only after cutting your fingers on Milk Bone remnants, breaking fingernails and scratching up your silverware.This thing is heavy and slippery - my 65 lb. bulldog drops it constantly, making a huge thud. However, that thud is much preferred to the inner scream you'll experience when your dog drops it on your toes :)There's an inner "flap" that;s tearing on mine after only a few weeks of use. Once this tears completely through I'm not sure how well treats will be secured.

My German Shepherd pup loves this because it has lots of spots for me to stick treats in for him. Its hard rubber and he loves to carry it around in his mouth and throw it in the air. We throw it like a football in the yard and he runs and fetches it. Great price!
This football is OK for my puppy but I hate to give him two bisquits at a time so I just give him the football to chew.It's OK but premier makes many other better dog toys!!Shop around...
We recently had snow and the dog loved chasing this in the outdoors.  It is a durable product that will provide many years of enjoyment for my pet.

I mistakenly ignored the negative reviews thinking they didn't take care of this toy properly. This toy is an absolute piece of junk. It only took 5 min for my casual chewer medium dog to completely destroy the ball texture. He swallowed some of them and there's green cotton all over the room. The quality of this toy is similar to made in china crap found in 25 cent dispenser machine. Just avoid this or you'll regret like I did.
summary: Don't believe the 5 stars reviews here

reviewText: I have a 12 week old puggle puppy.  He loves his football.Hours of fun playing with it.I have to really small one and it just fits in his mouth.  Squeaks and drives him wild.
Felt was not glued very well around the logo and just invited my dog to destroy within 10 minutes.  Disappointed this this Kong product.

I should have read the dimensions. It's a nice toy and well built but this toy is a bit too big for my two puppy cavoodles. I think it will end up being given to their Labrador friend. I'd recommend  it be bought for larger dogs.
summary: It's a nice toy but a bit too big

reviewText: THIS IS HIS FAVORITE TOY. I'm constantly replacing this toy when lost, or used, or broken. He will squeak this, he will play ball with this, and he loves carrying this around. This is more durable than the average tennis ball, etc too, so I would def recommend this if your dog loves tennis balls and balls in general. The medium size is great for my dog - 30lb cockapoo.
This keeps my dogs attention when we are outside. They cannot determine which way it will bounce and keeps them on their toes

My dog loves this squeeky dumbbell, but he was able to pull come of the fabric cover off during the first day with the toy.  Fortunately he's been chewing on it for weeks and the remaining fabric is in tact.

My dog is very rough on toys.  These footballs last longer than some of the other junk I've bought for her.  She always pulls all the fuzz off it on the first day, but she loves chewing on the rubber underneath. This toy maintains its squeak for a long time. It takes her a couple months to figure out how to destroy it.

My Golden Retriever is A.D.D with tennis balls so much that if I have more the three in the pool he starts freaking out he can't put them all in his mouth, however I still needed a toy for my Chocolate Lab to play with, here enters the Kong air, while my golden runs around chasing after the balls my chocolate throws this around and chews it so it squeaks.  Granted it is made out of tennis ball material and because my girl consistently chews it to hear it squeak they start splitting at the seams after about a month.

While this toy has lasted much longer than others I've purchased, the outside cloth covering was a goner pretty quickly. The inside "bone" and squeaker are pretty durable though. If you have a mouthy dog, it's a good choice.
summary: Inside Durable, Covering No So Much

reviewText: I have a pug, so I figured that this would be the perfect size for him to naw on. He really enjoys it, but it hasn't squeaked since the first day.  I thought since my dog has such a small mouth that he couldn't break it, but maybe he did? Either way, it's a pretty good toy.

My lab puppy loved the squeaker in this toy but she has become quite skilled in removing them or making them not work.  She also started tearing off the felt within a short time of getting the toy so I've had to take it away from her.  Unfortunately, the only Kong products that can seem to stand up to her jaws and teeth are the original Kongs that you can stuff with treats.  Also, the Nylabones stand up to her as well.

My 4 LARGE dogs just love all the versions of this product (donut, barbell, jack, bone, long tube, etc.). These dogs are chewers. They will rip the molding right off the walls and the tile off the floors if they get bored, so I keep plenty of toys around. These stand up well to chewing, incessant biting to hear the squeaker, rolling in the mud, and the squeaker never dies. Even my cats love them - they love to grab onto the tennis ball-ish fuzzy cover and kick and bite away. Only one barbell got destroyed after being out in the elements constantly for about a year (extreme heat, sun, lots of rain, and humidity of the deep south). It finally split and then dogs had at it. I hope they never stop making these.
My dog had no problem pulling the yellow covering off...Took about 30 seconds.Oh well...

My puppy loves this toy. It's her favorite to play fetch with in the back yard and she's always excited to see me get it out.Why only 3 stars then? We've had some serious durability problems with this one. The purple Kong seal on the middle seems to create a weak spot in the 'tennis ball' covering that allowed her to almost immediately start pulling the covering off. The fact that I don't let her play with this unsupervised has slowed her efforts to strip it off, but she's making definite progress. The seal looks nice, but I'd rather they just stamped their name on the toy and didn't create that edge to the fabric that she can go after.Also, we have a small pool set up in the yard for my nephew and occasionally the toy lands in it. This should be fine, since the product description specifically mentions retrieving 'by sea.' The problem is that it seems as if water can get into the squeaker, which then stops working well. If the squeaker part is important to your dog, I'd recommend avoiding water just in case.I'm not sorry we bought it, because she does love it a lot. I'm just disappointed that it didn't hold up as well as I had expected. I'd mainly recommend this to people whose dogs are a little more focused on the retrieving and a little less interested in figuring out how to shred every toy they encounter.
summary: At Least The Puppy Loves It

reviewText: this toy is still alive, bald but alive.My dog pulled off all the yellow fuzz right away, and is left with a rubbery double ended tennis ball that is huge.once you get past the yellow fuzz, its a toy that lasts for quite awhile.Bobby Pynes

Learned my lesson: not ALL Kong toys are made with the same quality/durability. The Kong extreme goodie bone and extreme ball are the only toys that have a chance with my strong chewer puppy. This is a hollow toy, not made for strong chewers. My 39 pound puggle puppy loved it and destroyed it imediatley; he broke into the side balls in less than 20 minutes. Less than 10 minutes later the squeaker and the middle of the toy were practically gone. Yellow fuzz all over the carpet,and a pile of gray rubbery chunks of the toy had to be removed from the dog because he was eating it. I am glad I always stay near the puppy for at least 1 hour after giving him a new toy...this toy could have been harmful. It felt just a little stronger than a regular tennis ball,. for double the price.
summary: Lasted less than 30 minutes with a Medium size strong chewer puppy!

reviewText: So glad I was able to find these. None of our local pet stores (independent or chain) seem to carry the football shape. My corgi has destroyed a few of these and I was looking to replace them.These are her favorite balls. They have the tennis ball covering, they're not too hard, they squeak and they bounce in all kinds of crazy directions when they hit the ground. She loves playing catch with them and in the summer, she takes them into her wading pool too. She also has the KONG tennis balls, but these are her favorites.They usually last about a year before the squeaker goes and then another year before she either splits them open or rips off the yellow covering. But for the amount of abuse they get, that's a pretty tough toy.Packaging is a cardboard backboard (recycle it!) and a heavy wire tie to hold it on.Don't change anything!
My youngest dog is an obsessive fetcher, and he loves this football. I went to go order more but they are out of stock right now. I hope they bring them back soon.
My one year old labrador retriever loves it! And the football shape is great for him to grip.  If you fling it correctly it bounced backward so it was fun to see my lab with his confused expression!
Our 7month old maltipoo loves to play with tennis balls and squeaky toys, so we thought this would be great. unfortunately, he tore off the covering on this toy in 5 minutes! don't bother with it.
summary: not all KONG are made equal...pass on this one.

reviewText: The squeaker in this donut broke about 15 minutes after I gave it to my dog (much to my husbands delight but my dogs dismay). That being said she still enjoys playing with it and its very nice for playing tug-o-war and fetch.

This is so cute and my dog loved it but she could pull off mouthfuls of the tennis ball type material so I had to take it away. If you use just to retrieve and then put away it would be fine. I was disappointed.
summary: So cute but Outside is easily pulled apart so can be dangerous and had to take away after five minutes.

reviewText: My second-oldest German Shepherd Dog, Minnie, loves to play fetch.  She's obsessive about it.  Every day for several months she'd insist on her daily fetch regimen.  Fine, I complied.But soon one side of the yellow felt was torn off, then the other side. (Without the yellow felt cover this toy resembles an adult sex toy so I won't say much there.) Then the squeaker gave out and now, finally, the seams are coming undone.  What I thought was invincible is not.  Granted, throwing this heavy thing several times every day for as far as one can does wear the product down.  But the constant grabbing of canine teeth into the rubber surely isn't easy on it, either.  Minnie still loves this toy and we will use it for as long as it can fly through the air for her to fetch.
summary: My GSDs loved this so much it ripped apart

reviewText: My 13 pound dog does not chew on her stuffed toys but she really liked to gnaw on this instead of chasing it. I took it away.

I bought this to replace my dogs' first Air Kong Squeaker Dumbbell, which stopped squeaking within a month of giving it to them. Since Harri loved it so much--playing fetch, keep-away with her sister, tug-of-war, and just running around squeaking it, I just had to get her another.  Hopefully, this one will last, because she lost interest in the first one once it stopped squeaking. Hopefully, it was just a fluke.

I have two labs a 6 year old and a 5 year old. After trying many pretty toys I understood that not every toy if for my hard chewing labs. All the tennis ball products from kong are among the most durables (they do come apart) but are the ones that last longer and my dogs love love love them. When I get home with a new  kong toy they get all crazy and excited.I would definitely recommend it, would buy again for the rest of my dog lives, but be careful, once you see the toy its starting to come apart you should trash it, never leave it like that to your dog.
summary: My labs love every kong product

reviewText: We have stuck with Kong for many of our purchases and they never let us down. Sure our dog does destroy the toy but it takes significantly longer than almost any other toy on the market. These really give our dog a run for the money.

We have a 75lb. puppy who is a heavy chewer. He's had this toy for a couple of weeks now and it has held up well. This bone is surprisingly heavy. He loves laying down with this bone as there are squeakers at both ends and in the middle which grabs and keeps his attention.

Although the football itself seems to be holding up fairly well, my Lab mix virtually skinned the thing. Pulling off all the decals and yellow fibers. Surely KONG has a better option for covering these toys?Luckily, I learned not to leave this particular dog alone with most toys. Otherwise she no doubt would've swallowed all that nasty yellow fuzz!
Our dog likes to chew and squeak this thing, but he also loves to fetch it! I roll it on its side, and it bounces all over as he tries to catch it. Really fun and heavy duty toy.

I have a 7 month old yellow lab and she LOVES this toy! Be warned: it is pretty loud but the joy my puppy gets out of it is worth it. It is made by Kong so it is pretty durable. I let her chew on it but when she stops squeaking it and starts gnawing on the green material I take it away (the green material can be gnawed off fairly easily). This isn't a toy I would leave in her kennel while I am away but allow her to play with while I am at home so I can keep an eye. This is a highly entertaining toy for both me and my pup and one of our favorites : )

I thought this would be stronger since its a kong but it's not.  I have a Pitt mix and she killed it in literally less than an hour.  After a few minutes the felt was coming off and that just wanted to make her start ripping at it.  Once that happened it was just a matter of minutes before it had a hole in it, and was then scatter across the floor in pieces.  VERY disappointed.  If I wanted something she cold just rip apart I could find that at the dollar store and save the $10 I paid for this toy.

I have a German Shepherd who isn't very destructive of her toys, but she is still a GSD and most toys just can't take the abuse. Even non-squeaking tennis balls lose their color and surface after a few days of chewing. This toy and a large Kong Air Dog jack are the only things that have lasted more than a week. My dog loves this donut and has squeaked it every single day since it was delivered over three months ago... and it still squeaks!Edit: It's been nine months and my dog still squeaks this thing all the time. This toy just won't give up.

My medium size border terrier who is a regular chewer played with this toy for about 5 minutes before it was all ripped apart.  All KONG toys are typically high quality and durable, this is the first time I am disappointed with this brand.

Our 4 labradors love Kong toys of all types, but especially those with the yellow tennis hide.  Normally, these fun-loving, energetic labs rip right through plush toys to get at those mysterious squeakers.  Not their Kong toys.  They take a licking and a chewing and keep on squeaking (sorry Timex for the play on your words).  Great value and safe toys for your pets.  Gotta luv 'em

This seems way more durable than the other squeak bones we have purchased.  Only down side is my dog (60lb lab) is not quiet strong enough to make it squeak, but our foster lap (70+ lbs) has no problem making it squeak all day
My dogs love it. My dogs love to chew.  Watch out because my dogs picked the fuzz off it first and left yellow fuzz al ofer the house.

I purchased thinking that the squeaker was built into the middle of the toy.  My 1 year old beagle was smarter than me and discovered it was set into one of the ends.  He promptly tore off the yellow fuzz around only the squeaker part and once exposed, pulled the squeaker value out.  Luckily I was monitoring his play time so I prevented him from eating it.At least it seems resistant to puncturing and still works as a toy.  I don't think my dog will have much interest in it anymore without the squeak however.  Maybe he'll still enjoy tearing off the yellow fuzz (which may be the only thing he won't eat). His purpose in life is to locate and destroy the squeaker.  This toy was no challenge for him.

We have a lab/shepard mix who is now 2 years old.  She is 70 pounds and loves to wreck all of her toys.  Normal tennis balls last about 1 hour and she absolutely loves them so I decided to get her the football.  The football lasts for a few months before she finally destroys it.  The material is far superior to a normal tennis ball; it is thicker and stronger.  I keep a few around the house to get longer life out of all of them.  She also loves the kong wubba.

Toys do not last in our house for more than a few minutes with my lab mix puppy and adult German Shepherd.  They love the Kong squeaker tennis balls, so I thought I'd try this.  They both absolutely LOVE it and it has actually survived for almost two months.  The squeaker only lasted a week or so, but that's fine with me! :) They love to play fetch with it and just carry it around.  Will definitely be buying more.
I purchased this ball because normally kong products are long lasting but my 1 y/o english bulldog destroyed it in a day.
summary: Not worthy of being called a KONG

reviewText: I have a small terrier and she just loves this ball.  The oval shape allows her to get it in her mouth and squeak it and that is exactly what she does !!  I have gotten her 2 more to have in reserve as she looks for this ball every day.  It is very tough and she has not destroyed it.

I was really excited about this product since my 8 month old pit bull loves the Kong squeaker ball.  It seemed like it was maybe a little too big for him to get in his mouth but he managed.  In less than five minutes he had already had the felt tore.  It seems where they put the kong label they didn't fasten the felt down well enough.  So just a little gap in a toy opens the door for him to start ripping it.  It does have a cool squeak but I wouldn't recommend it because the felt is poorly fastened.  Extremely disappointed!!

My Dobie, Max, loves this bone toy. He walks around with the toy in his mouth and he squeaks it continuously. He brings it to me so that I will play with him. Just as with his other toys, he will chew this to pieces if I leave it with him unattended.  I have  some smaller versions of a squeaking bone toy. They were his favorite toys until the Kong bone arrived. If I don't leave him alone with this toy it will last a long time.  If he is unsupervised with it he will chew it up in a NY minute.
I thought that this is one of the best toys my dog goes batty over tennis balls and he also loves sqeaker toys
Our pets have always enjoyed the kong toys.  The tennis ball covering does not last long, but the toys hold up to rough play.
my dog broke it very easy but thats now new, it was fun for him while it lasted :) :)

My puppy LOVES all KONG products. Only toy she doesn't destroy and has hours of fun with. Downfall is the squeaker piece. I just find the small piece and pull it out for protection. Call me over protective.

He is chewing the covering off (it is a fibrous material and I have to watch to get the pieces as I don't want him to choke on them!).  This toy would be perfect if it had a different kind of cover, and as  Kong toy, I would have expected that.  But, since it squeaks and bounces, my little guy loves it.
terrific distraction for the chewer in your family. great for playing with other chewers in run and catch games. just the right squeak to catch attention.
didn't last. my dogs put holes in it in less than 15 minutes. maybe good for a dog without teeth!

Ordered this for my 18 month old dog. The squeaker fell out within 15 minutes and my dog began to disassemble the bone. She just chewed the life out of it while fetching; the covering peeled off and the bone ended up looking like it got holes put in it by a shotgun.

This is a terrific toy. My 15 month old Brittany is mesmerized by the action of this toy. She carries it around, she throws it down the stairs and retrieves it and just generally finds this to be an object of great fascination. She is very good at destroying toys, this toy appears to be resistant to all of her best efforts of destruction. This can be thrown and bounces in the most peculiar fashion. This is a good toy and I recommend it.

I have 2 dogs (Doberman/Lab mix and Border Collie mix) and both of them love the Kong squeaker toys.  They have had several of the bone shaped ones.  I don't mind that they strip the yellow fuzz off, because they still love to play with them regardless.  The only complaint I have is that once they find the squeaker its not long before they can get it popped out.  My dogs are heavy chewers and these seem to hold up for a long time before the inevitable total destruction occurs.

My boxer gets a new kong football every football season. She tries to destroy it as she does with all her toys but kong toys put up a fight. She does get the outside green fuzzy fabric off the ball but overall the ball survives which is more than I can say about any other brand
summary: My Boxer loves her Kong toys!

reviewText: My dog is a power chewer, despite her small size. She has destroyed red Kongs and various other toys marked for strong chewers. This particular toy though, lasted a lot longer than normal, as would a regular tennis ball. My dog loved throwing it around, shaking it as if it were prey, and the squeaker is an added bonus (even though it can get quite annoying).Despite puncturing holes in it with her teeth, it was still very much in playable condition. We only throw it out once our dog starts to pull off the tennis ball fur and eat it, and then lots of the fur start coming off or sticking out.Basically, if your dog likes tennis balls (and those fare somewhat well for you) then so would this particular toy.

I bought three of these, one for each dog.  Two of the dogs are chewers.  The Older chewer has had his for days and it is still pristine, yet he loves to play with it.  The pup, a  seven month old golden retriever managed to chew the cover off half of it in the first five minutes.  So not as tough as I thought a Kong toy would be.  The third dog just carries it around half the day.
summary: Two out of three dogs are ok

reviewText: My golden likes to play tug-of-war instead of giving you the tennis ball to throw.  This toy protects our hands a lot!

I bought the large Kong Air Dog Donut for my 2 year old Westie because I needed some sturdier dog toys after he tears apart soft/stuffed chew toys.  I thought the Kong name meant it would be tougher than the average dog toy, but this wasn't the case - my Westie was very excited over the new toy but he EASILY tore the neon fabric fuzz off the donut and broke the squeaker within minutes.  I'm very disappointed that this toy did not even last a day.
summary: Westie tore it apart in minutes

reviewText: My Corgi/Jack Russell mix loves this toy. It's the perfect size for her and it's her go-to toy. Loves to carry it around and loves to play fetch with it.

Thought with the "Kong" name this might be a winner, but within 10 minutes my pit-mix had removed the fuzz, popped one end and committed a squeakectomy.Update: She's had one of the black Kongs for over a year!
summary: Nope...another one to cross off my list

reviewText: My Chauncy (68 pounds) is not really a guy to play with toys but when I gave this to him, he played with it for 20 minutes, then got bored. This is one of the numerous toys he has gotten which so far he hasn't destroyed. He loves the squeakers and for him to play with a toy for 20 minutes is truly amazing. He usually destroys toys within the first 5 minutes but I am hoping this one will hold up. Will keep you posted after he has had it for a week.

We rescued a yellow lab a couple years ago. She was the strongest, most rambunctious dog we have ever own. She loved this toy because it squeaked and squeaked and squeaked. I like that she was unable to chew out the "squeaker" so it made the toy last a long time.
My dog destroyed this in minutes.  The toys was fun while it lasted.  Not  meant for a dog that likes to chew.
summary: Fun toy for the dog, but not durable.

reviewerName: Jon Atwood "Computer Geek and loving owner of...
reviewText: Our obsessive dog goes insane for the Kong Air Squeaker!  We have to take it away after a while or she would drive us crazy carrying this around squeaking it over and over and over and over....  LOLThe only downfall is that our dogs have now learned how to peel the tennis ball material off the outside of the ball.
Our boxer, shepherd, pitt mix ripped the green fuzz off in maybe 30 minutes.  This was a total waste of money. Buy the black kong toys instead.
summary: Ripped green fuzz off in an afternoon.

reviewText: I have a 4-year-old 82 lb lab (no, she's not overweight, just huge).  I bought the Kong football a few years back.  She pulled all the yellow covering off the football like the first or second time she played with it, but it lasted a long time nonetheless.  She finally destroyed the football after like 2 or 3 years.  I ordered the two tennis balls (looks like this, but in a tennis ball shape) and a new football.  She pulled a little of the covering off the football, but it's holding up fine.  The tennis balls are also holding up, and she hasn't been able to remove the yellow covering off them yet.  Kong toys are great.  They're tough, SUPER sqeaky, she has fun with them either with or without me, and she hasn't destroyed them yet.  Definitely worth the money.

Most cheap toys last less than a day and he will shred them to oblivion.  We now only use the KONG toys as they last for several months.  The price on amazon is much better than the local store too!  The squeaker can be a bit loud, but he enjoys it.  Sometimes we have to take it away from him during a movie.
summary: Large lab loves these and they last

reviewText: I bought this for a family member's doggy.  Doggy seems to like it very much and plays with it frequently.
My English Bulldog loves the Squeakers. He is so protective of them, including the Kong tennis balls (those are his favorite). Good Purchase and I love Football!

Our GSD and ASD/red heeler dogs love these. No dog toy is going to last forever, but these are holding up decently well and I'm not having concerns with them ingesting little pieces they chew off. I like the actual stitching with the laces, it would be a little better if the rubber stripes were stitched as well, but no big loss. My only problem is the squeaker is found on one of the tips of the football and actually takes a little uncovering for it to input/output air to engage the squeaker and help it make an actual sound. It's a simple problem with a simple fix. Overall, a good quality of a toy.
summary: Durable, wish the squeaker was a little better. Easily fixed though!

reviewText: I got this for my 4 mo. old English Bulldog puppy hoping that it would withstand his teething and strong jaws. Unfortunately, it didn't. Within a couple of days he had chewed off the felt covering and was trying to eat it. I had to take it from him so he wouldn't choke.
summary: Maybe for dogs that aren't such hard core chewers

reviewText: (Sorry, looks like the actual item I bought is no longer available @ Amazon:  Kong Air Dog Squeaker dumbbell dog toy - small, yellow)I think my dog is a chi-pom mix.  He is hyper all the time.  He tore through the small sized one in no time flat.  He basically ripped the yellow tufting from the toy (kinda like that yellow fuzz cover on the traditional tennis ball)If you have a small hyper dog, I recommend those stuffing-less Skinneeez dog toys instead.Ethical Mini Skinneeez Squirrel 14-Inch Stuffingless Dog ToyMy eleven pound dog loves both lengths  (the 14inch and 24 inch).They are extremely durable and have gone through many washings.His coat is the color of the squirrel or fox and I noticed that he tended to play with those more than the skunk and giraffe ones.He's only a 17 months old and he already has over ten of them.  He runs around the house gathering them and putting them in a pile or lays then near me or our cats.I remove about 3 of them to wash while the others rotate.
summary: not for hyper small breeds like my chi-pom mix

reviewText: Kong dumbbell has so far outlasted any other squeaky toy we tried with our 50# dog, who is not a very aggressive chewer, but nonetheless quickly destroys any stuffed toy that comes his way. This toy is safe to leave lying around because our dog does not chew it just for the fun of it. Most of the time he brings it to us when he wants to play tug or fetch, which is fun to do with this toy since it makes a loud squeak that gets our dog exited.Although made by the same manufacturer that brought us the durable rubber Kong toys, the dumbbell cannot compare to their ability to withstand constant chewing action. If your dog is an agressive chewer, this is probably not the best toy. Otherwise, Kong dumbell can be a nice addition to your dog's collection of toys and can serve as good substitute for the flimsy soft squeaky toys that don't last.
summary: Better than a stuffed squeaky toy

reviewText: The ball is strong and holds up fairly well, but the fabric covering comes off too easily. My Golden Retriever, an avid chewer, quickly and effortlessly removes the fabric from these balls, but he does love them.For sizing info: the large size is a little to big for him. Although he does get it in his mouth and carry it around, he prefers the medium size.

amazing kong does it again. every dog big and small who comes for daycare has tested it and even though the outer skin was gone in just under 5 minutes of having it they still love it and the squeaker is still going strong.this is must buy for those dogs who just love the squeaking toys big and small ive tryed this on a boxer, a half grown puppy, a few mixed breeds and they love it soo much its getting to loud with the talking and squeaking over whos turn it is today to have it

"Yet" is the operative word.  Our boxer puppy destroys every toy he gets.  Loves to tear them apart and grab the squeakers.  He's had the donut all day, is going crazy playing with it, and it is still intact.  Amazing!  Really, if it lasts 2 days, then we will be in heaven.  I just ordered another one.
summary: Wow, he hasn't destroyed it yet!

reviewText: I have two yellow labs and they go through toys like crazy.  This is one of the ones that holds up and last more than 4 months.  Great price.
Took my husky some time to get used to the loud squeeker in this toy but he loves it now and we do fetch with it all the time. I love how it bounces cause it always throws him off too.
I have three large dogs (Shepherds) and they absolutely love this toy. They will literally chase this ball for hours if I let them. Great for playing fetch, the squeak noise just excites them more.

My dog has tennis balls and does not destroy them, however this toy was no good in 5 minutes. He found the squeaker and pulled it out and the fabric around where the squeaker was inserted. I contacted Kong products and they offered to send some coupons and they have not done so yet and it has been 4 weeks. Not a great toy!

It can squeeeeaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaak for a really long time. My dogs love it, though occasionally we put it on a high shelf for "quiet time". Its great for a good play session outside!It's not meant to be chewed on unsupervised, it's not a chewie. It had many, many hours of rough play before the felt eventually tore, but it had a good duration. Great value for the price, so I just ordered another.
Did not last to long since my dog tears stuff up, but was worth the money and the squeaker works great!

I have two very rambunctious hard-playing Chesapeake's. They go through toys like kleenex's! Given their rough and tumble nature the Kong Air toys (the rings and theKONG Air Squeaker Bowling Pin Dog Toy, Medium, Yellow) hold up nicely to the abuse! These are their favorite toys, and they get played with everyday! And by played with I mean: tossed, fetched, slobbered, chewed on, chomped on, and pounced on. Eventually the outer covering does go, but it still takes them a long while to completely destroy the toy. These are also awesome for fetch. Not too heavy, and less dangerous than a wayward out of control bouncy ball.If these toys can hold up to my two destroyers, then they should work out great for you!

I think dog toy would have been better had it been made out of some kind of silicone outer layer, and not the fuzzy tennis ball it is.  For little dogs with little teeth they tend to pull the fuzzy layer off and then you find it all over your house and some I'm sure got eaten by the puppy.  I even found my older dog with some of it in her mouth so I know my puppy ate some of it.
summary: Good concept but didn't work for my small puppy

reviewText: I get to practice my spiral for the greatest receiver in the world. She loves this toy cuz it makes noise and is sturdy and nothin' beats dog football.
summary: Kong football is fun and squeaks!

reviewText: This toy is okay, but I've found the Pet Buddies version to be more durable.Pet Buddies PB1907 Plushy Tube
my dogs love their football! it's great for the larger dogs. don't leave with aggressive chewers... it won't last long.

I bought this ball for my dog Duke and he loves it.  I like that it is soft and doesn't damage the furniture or floors.  He plays with it often and I am glad for the distraction because he always wants me to play with him and I am sometimes busy and can't do that.

My 75 lb mix plays with this ball periodically. When we first gave it to him, he played with it for a little bit, not non-stop like he does with the isqueak balls. He is a chewer so he immediately started to rip the "velvet" material off of the ball. It's been a week and there's at least 60% of velvet material left. He still squeaks the ball periodically but not enthusiastic about it. For now, I would say the ball is durable. It's been a week and the squeaker isn't dead yet. Overall, this is a decent product.

My corgi loves his football, but did tear off every scrap of yellow felt, and also broke the squeaker. He does this to all his toys, but it did take him a bit longer with the Air Kong football. He still loves it, and carries it around working his jaws like he's chewing gum.
summary: Great entertainment, but does get chewed up.

reviewText: To squeak this toy I need to position my hands on each side and squeeze a certain way at exactly the right time. If I just grab it and squeeze normally there is just the sound of air with no squeak. I have never seen a squeak toy that is so complicated to use! And it kills the fun having to hold it with two hands just to squeak. Maybe it was a defective product, or maybe just poor design, but I really would not recommend wasting your money just to find out.
Because of having a new puppy in the house, my older dog takes any of the toys we give her, and so I bought this toy for Mocha in hopes of playing with it, and she loves it.!

It was a nice ball, but I expected better from Kong! Only took our Lab 2 days before he tore it up. Wish they would make a great ball that these big furry kids can actually get a good amount of play time with. We never let our Lab just sit and chew his balls. If we are not throwing it with him it gets put up. So that lets you know how well they are NOT made! If someone knows of a great ball that will last, Please let me know. Thanks! :-)

My dogs love this toy, which we refer to as the donut.  You can roll it a long way if you are in a large open area and the dogs love to chase it.  We have small dogs (10 and 20 lbs) and use the size medium toy.  These toys are not the most durable - if your dog likes to chew they will chew the yellow, tennis ball like covering right off.  Overall though I would recommend!

My dogs have had several of these over the last four years and quality seems to be very hit or miss.  The first few lasted much longer than the most recent ones.  The actual bone has stayed together since Christmas, but my 45-pound Goldendoodle has pulled almost all of the yellow stuff covering it off.  Not sure why it's so hard to find an adhesive strong enough to keep this on. I gave this one final chance because he always loves them so much, but I'll definitely be looking for a different squeaky toy that is better quality.
summary: Okay, but the yellow stuff is almost off

reviewText: My dogs just adore this thing- a German Shepherd and a Doberman- they are not joke about trying to destroy toys.The squeekers are still alive and well.I will say that you can't just leave it with a dog, or they will tear the felt off. My dogs play with it, but when I see them using their front teeth to carefully pick at the felt, I just say firmly "don't pick!" and they usually go back to normal chewing, which it stands up to fantastically.  On occasion, when they get to picking at the felt I take it away for a few minutes.Realistically speaking, any toy can be destroyed by a determined dog.  That magic indestructable toy you want does not exist!  If they are playing with it in your presence and you do interfere with certain behaviors, this will survive longer than the majority of toys.  We've had it for a month.  Most toys don't make it that long, tennis balls only last three big chomps.  These are dogs that shred the hardest nylabones.  A month of chewing is an impressive feat.Other stand outs in the Doberman tough toy market are orbee balls and tuff rings- just the rings not any other shapes.  Other KONG toys last primarily because they don't get played with unless we put a treat inside.  My dogs legitimately like this particular kong product above every other toy in our house right now.Last note- the squeeker is really loud and occasionally high pitched when they really get a good squeeze.  It probably will wear on your patience.
My small dog had parts of the covering on this toy chewed off within 15 minutes.  Very disappointed.  Sent it back for credit.
summary: Another Kong toy not for my dog

reviewText: My sister had one for her dog who loves tennis balls. Mine loved it at first sight so I purchased them one as well. Fun product.

Our six year old 92 pound Old English Bulldog and his partner in crime our 6 month old puppy of the same breed - are the certified kings when it comes to destroying even the toughest toys.A long time fan of Kong products - because they usually design toys with the dog in mind and not humans .A rarity among dog toys that beg for our attention with an army of adorable kitty cats, bunnies and an endless parade of cute toys.With the majority of them resembling road kill in a very short time.That said, we had a feeling this particular toy being "soft" as opposed to the hard yet pliable Kong material would be destined for a very short life. It held up longer than most. However despite expected small tears, this toy was headed for garbage pail.Kong makes some great toys for hard core chewers unfortunately, this isn't one of them. Our dogs (both bulldogs) adored them but they really aren't built to take the torture agressive chewers dish out - and Kong shouldn't market these as such. It's a disservice to their loyal and new customers alike.
summary: Another Near Home Run From Kong

reviewText: This is a well made dog toy, but I have a small dog and he isn't able to get his mouth over the balls. I would recommend it for a medium size dog .
IT'S FUN FOR THE DOG, EXCEPT IT WAS BROKEN WITHIN 2 DAYS. NOT VERY DURABLEAND I HAVE A TINY DOG

Check the measurements.  This thing is pretty huge.  I'd consider getting the medium size next time, even for my golden.  The squeaky-factor is nice, though.  My beagle likes to chase this silly thing around, as large as it is... she also tends to snuggle up and sleep with her head resting on it.  No dog toy is a bad purchase if your dog doesn't ignore it.  Right?

I once had this toy some months ago, but my dog lost it in the backyard. I really like this because the dogs can play their favorite game (tug of war) and it squeaks. Although each time the puppies have ripped off the green felt on the outside and the purple lining on the side, the toy still holds up to abusive play.
My papillon had this Destroyed in 20 minutes. Had to move to Kong Extreme toys. Fun while it lasted. Not made for a chewer.

It is pretty big.  I was not sure if she could even fit it in her mouth.  Well she can.  My puppy is a stocky little mutt about 50lbs.  This toy squeaks more than any toy there is.  It is tough.  Fun to throw.  I have to put it up because it squeaks too much sometimes.  Because it is so large to carry it she basically compresses it some which makes it squeak.  This will last for a very long time.
summary: My dog freaking loves this toy

reviewText: The Dobie pup likes it but it's got a really loud and piercing squeaker.It's like buying your kid a drum set.
These do NOT hold up to heavy chewers. The green material came off within not even 3 minutes and then chunks of the actual ball started coming off after about 5 minutes. Complete waste of money.
I only buy Kong balls for my dogs because they are safe to chew on. Bought this for my lab who didn't want to fetch. Gave it away. But both my does loooooove the tennis balls.
summary: KONG Air Dog Squeaker Football Dog Toy, Large, Yellow

reviewText: My puppy at the time ripped this to pieces upon minutes of taking it out of the packaging and giving it to him.
Lasted a couple of days until the dog peeled the cover off.  The squeaking is very loud and annoying. I don't recommend any Kong "soft toys" for a chewer.
The dogs love it. They love to play fetch and kep away with it. The pets are happy so am I.

Our Lab loves this for retrieving from the pool. Way better than a tennis ball and the squeaker is so much fun for him. But we don't let him chew on it for any length of time as it is not chew-proof. Hank loves his squeaky animals that reside indoors but has about 8 that are now silent. There are just a couple that he still can enjoy using to "mouth off", especially when we are trying to have a conversation or on the phone. The KONG Dumbbell that I purchased a month ago is still okay, but I just ordered a backup. Amazon Prime makes spoiling our pet too easy!

I have a Weimaraner puppy who loves balls he can get a little obsessive when he plays with them and he chews on them until they pop. It only takes him about a day to destroy them so they have to be a outside toy only. However I make an exception with this toy. He has had the medium or large one for about two months now and it is holding up great. He likes to carry it around the house and squeak it. That is the one thing I don't like. The squeaker is loud and high pitched. I have given the toy a timeout a few times because my dog will squeak it for hours and it can grate on your nerves but it helps him stay calm when I have to go to work and he can squeak it to his heart's content when I am away:) I would recommend this toy for most dog owners it hold up better then regular tennis balls and doggy tennisballs. The shape also helps keep his from destroying it.

I bought this toy for my dog because it's cute and it's a Kong.  The first day we got it though the some of the fuzz on the ball started to pull off in small clumps, but not enought that you could tell to look at it. It squeeks really loud and gets annoying fast. My dog likes it, but it's definetly not one of his favorite toys. Basically for the price it's a descent toy that the dog does like but you have to watch close so when the fuzz peels up he doesn't ingest it.
Well got this for my grand puppy,well it lasted a week then she ripped the middleof the toy.So if you get this get it for a dog not a puppy
I bought this for my 20 lb pup.  Worked great for awhile, but was left unattended with the toy for about 5 minutes and tore all the felt off.  Still a good toy after, until the squeak part fell out.

I have tested this squeaker toy on two dogs now.  The first was an adult Rottweiler (about 90 lbs.) who didn't care for it all that much.  The second is a Rottie puppy (currently in the 50-60 lb. range) who adores it.  This review will be based on my experience with the second dog, as she has actually been getting quite a bit of mileage out of it.  (And to be fair, the first dog didn't like ANY tennis-ball-type toys or rubber toys.)As I said, my puppy loves this toy.  While she has numerous tennis-ball-type toys, this is one she keeps going back to.  She did start pulling the outer coating off of it during the first month I had her, but about 2/3 to 3/4 of the coating is still on there after three months.  I do have to monitor this closely so she doesn't swallow the coating, although it appears that at least small pieces "pass through."Once my dog got big enough to get her mouth around the end, so she could make the thing squeak on her own, she fell in love with the toy a second time.  Unfortunately -- and this may be a result of the removed outer coating -- she did eventually puncture the toy all the way through.  It no longer squeaks because of this.  She still likes the toy, but the loss of sound has definitely equated to a loss of enthusiasm.Final assessment: Three stars because the puppy loves it and I've gotten three months of use out of it with her (which is longer than many other toys have lasted with this puppy), but a couple of stars off for durability.
summary: depends on the dog, may not stand up to active chewers

reviewText: My half-size doberman mix (not a mini pin) is a chewing machine, so I thought this might be a good choice for her. She did shred some of the covering off of it, but it was too big for her to put in her mouth.  This is an extra large toy, only for the biggest of dogs. I do think it might have held up pretty well to her chewing, if it had been a size appropriate to her.
summary: Too large for my mid-sized dog

reviewText: I purchased the medium size as my Yorkshire Terrier is a bit on the larger size and I think it's the right fit.He loves carrying it around, chewing on it, and making her squeak!I've had it a few weeks and it seems quite durable.  I also purchased the bowling pin squeaker and my Yorkie managed to rip the "tennis ball" covering off it in when I was not paying attention.
My 40lb dog loves this toy.  She goes through 1-2 a year. She has a basket of toys, but she plays with this one the most.

I purchased this at a store, not here on Amazon. (Nothing against Amazon) I have several different Kong toys for my mini Bull terrier, who is an extreme chewer. This toy was ripped apart in less then 2 hours. By day 2, it was in a million pieces. Knowing he is an extreme chewer we do give him bones and such to chew. But whenever he gets a new toy it's game on for this little pooch. So if your dog is a serious chewer then don't waste your money. I thought this toy would hold up atleast a few weeks before he could rip it apart. I stick to Kong toys but for the extreme chewer toys. Which Amazon does offer. (The Kong ball is great fyi) Hope this helps :)
summary: Not as tough as you think....

reviewText: My Leonberger destroyed this Kong in about three minutes.  The rubber Kongs are nearly indestructible, but these "tennis ball types" are not for big dogs.

I will never buy another Kong toy like this or the squeaker balls again.  Within minutes I was digging big chunks of the yellow fuzzy stuff out of the dog's mouth.  Same thing happened with the squeaky balls and with the ones attached to ropes, they chewed the ropes off both within 10 minutes.  Complete waste of money for several toys.  And I can't imagine that stuff is good for your dogs if you don't catch them in time.
summary: Dog was eating yellow fuzzy stuff in minutes

reviewText: German shepherd destroyed it in half an hour.  I thought being a Kong product it would be much more durable but alas...not
summary: not much bone for the buck

reviewText: One of my pitbulls favorite toys.  It has a great irregular bounce for playing fetch, and she'll play with it after she's skinned it, which takes time.  Ultimately she does destroy it.  The football and the bowling pin are the best shapes for her.  The Kong toys last longer than most others, and they and the Kygen hedgehog are pretty much all that I buy now.

This ball has kept up well considering that most toys don't survive too long with my dog. Its been almost 1.5 months and i has remained intact with no pieces falling off and the large size is perfect for my rhodesian/lab mix.

I have a fairly aggressive chewer and like to find toys she will enjoy, but not destroy too quickly. She loves her football and weeks after purchasing it, it is still completely intact. She loves the noise it makes and how it bounces crazily. Two paws up for KONG Air Dog Squeaker Football, Large!

My Rottweiller wasn't too interested in this. It seems a bit on the heavy side to play catch with. It is well made and it took a while for the yellow material to be chewed off by our chewing Doberman.
summary: Too heavy to throw for a game of catch

reviewText: I thought KONG brand toys were less destructable. Our dog had it torn apart in the first hour. She had a great time doing it, but it didn't last long.

reviewerName: Time to walk the dog, Dave
reviewText: I've had two of these.  The squeeker went out on the first in about two weeks.  My dog loved the toy so much, I decided to try another.  With in two hours of opening the box, the squeeker died.I won't buy another and I can't really recommend it, but I gave it three stars because my dog's still crazy about it.  She likes the odd bounce it can take when I throw it.  Sadly, I don't expect it to last much longer... holes are starting to develop around the seams.--
summary: Squeeker Died in Less Than 2 Hours

reviewText: I have a brutally aggressive chewer (35 pound springer spaniel mix).  She uses her incisors to rip toys apart.  She immediately ripped the fabric off the toy.  The pieces of the bone were in the trash within five minutes.

My dog loves his Kong football. Unfortunately although the football is in one piece, he must have punctured the squeaker upon biting down on it. He loves to make his toys squeak. It's OK though he still likes his football.

I have an 80lb Shepherd mix and he absolutely loves this toy. Mind you, I got it from a friend whose Scottie was not interested in it, and it was already missing some of the fuzz, but my dog has not pulled it apart. I think he is too busy chasing it. It bounces unpredictably and rolls in a curve, and it drives him nuts. He doesn't chase anything, stick or ball, as much as he chases this. So, I am giving it 5 stars.

This is a great toy, especially when you're trying to play fetch in the snow.  Unlike the standard tennis balls, this Kong football has a squeaker and is much easier to find for both you and your dog.  This is a good size for dogs 30lbs and up.  Smaller dogs may have an issue trying to get their mouths around it.
summary: Great for Both Football Fans in the house

reviewText: My 8 month old lab was skinning the green fuzz off this toy and swallowing it within an hour after opening. I tried to return it but the time period had elapsed.Very disappointing.
summary: Not safe for dogs who like to chew

reviewText: Our golden LOVES these.  They are her favorite soft toy.Soft toys don't have a long lifespan with this hound. On the contrary. That said, she will happily play with this thing even when it is in virtual tatters, squeaker-less, and the two tennis balls decomposed.  And that's something....I will note that the toy is available in stores (even Target, which is seldom a bargain palace) for a lot less than they are being sold for here.

My dog loves this when I slide kibble bits into the slots of it.  Without the food, she doens't really play with it that much.But, it serves it's purpose and keeps her occupied for a little while when mommy needs a break.
summary: serves it's purpose - when food is involved

reviewText: Good and durable chew gives a mouthy pup something to work on.  It's one of his favorite chew toys and it's easy to clean!
The product per se is great, my dog loves it and can be entertained for a while with it, however, it has a strong rubber smell, even with a few washes can't take it off, but what the heck.

My puppy loves this teething stick! I put pieces of Zuke's Mini Naturals dog treats (cut in half) in the crevices or her dog food (Castor & Pollux Organix Puppy Formula) and it keeps her entertained for a while. There's a tunnel in the center of the stick so that you can stick more treats in there but I prefer not to since it's probably more difficult to clean.She enjoys her regular Kong but she absolutely loves this one more (probably because it's easier to get her treat!).

Labrador/German Shepherd pup loves this toy and plays with it constantly.  Good for chewing with those sharp baby teeth.  Won't last much longer, though, simply because the pup is growing so fast.  A smaller breed would get longer use out of it.

Not only too big for him, but the grooves for holding treats were too small even for the Kong treats we bought.  I suppose you could fill the grooves with something like the Kong Easy Treat or peanut butter and then freeze it, but when it thaws it will leave a mess wherever it rolls.  Unless your dog likes to chew on these toys without treats, or licks them clean before thawing, I wouldn't recommend it.
summary: Too big for our Eskie puppy

reviewText: This was worthy of the Kong name.  It is made for chewing and my puppy does like to chew on it.Disadvantages:  I found stuffing it harder than the regular Kong because it has just a narrow hole through it.Advantages:  The outside has grooves that are easy to put peanut butter or stuffing in to encourage the puppy to chew on the toy.  Also it is small so easier to chew for my little 5lb morkie who is 3 months old.
Kong has not let me down yet. Very strong/durable material and my 2 pitbulls have yet to destroy it even when I put treats inside of it. Really great for puppies when they are teething.

My puppy loves this! He is finally out of the teething stage, but he loves the way this bounces around. It quickly became his favorite fetch toy. I haven't even tried putting treats in it yet, and he still loses his mind the second in comes out of his toy drawer.

Kibble fits really well in the ridges, so you can load it up and not feel like your dog is being spoiled.  Usually takes our dog a few minutes to get all the food out, so it provides a nice break for us.
Great price! Puppy loves it!My puppy loves this toy!! Best price anywhere! Great for teething and easy to wash. Kong toys are just awesome!

I have tried Kongs of every shape and size, with every kind of goop on them.  My standard poodles just dont like rubber to chew.  Maybe not the fault of the toy, but Kongs get so much hype it kind of bugs me.  They are NOT the "go to" toy that all dogs love.  They are rubber.  This chew stick is messy, so you will want to try it out on a washable surface.My dogs prefer antlers and bully sticks.  The real thing.  They could care less about rubber toys (unless the toy has a squeak they can kill.)
summary: My dog has no interest in rubber toys

reviewText: My puppy sure likes to gnaw on this, even without peanut butter or any other goodies in it! The one that came in the mail was solid baby-blue colored, no tie-dye which was kind of a bummer, but it's okay! I still love it! Will definitely buy more as my puppy outgrows this one.
summary: Good chew toy just on its own! Love it.

reviewText: I like this product but make sure you get the stuff'n to go in it.  and monitor your pup when the stuff'n is gone because with time and effort they can get a few pieces off it.

This is a very descent Kong product and for most light-moderate chewers it will do nicely. It's far from the only Kong product I own and I'll certainly buy more from them in the future. Just maybe not this particular model.My girlfriends little chihuahua/Rat Terrier mix does not chew habitually around the house but goes bonkers for the Kong filling I put down the middle and in the crevices of this dental stick. So when I filled this smaller version up for her after she had an awkward time trying to hold and chew the medium-sized one my Basenji/lab mix uses, she went crazy town on it.I kept looking down at her to make sure the vicious tooth-on-rubber squeaking sound I was hearing wasn't her ripping it to shreds and she seemed to be doing fine with it but when I looked back a few minutes later she had gotten a good grip on the thinner edges of the chew toy and finally pulled a few little corners of it off. It's worth noting that this didn't happen the first time I gave it to her, but rather after a few weeks of regular use.The Blue/Pink (and apparently there is a beige one but Ive never seen or experienced that ones quality myself)models are made from what feels like a softer rubber composition than the larger red Kong dental stick toys of the same style that they sell for bigger breeds.I wish they would re-release this toy in the normal denser red rubber model like the bigger one I have that just ended up being bit bigger than my Basenji/lab enjoyed. Shes 25lbs and more than twice my girlfriend's little chi-rat's size but still hasn't chewed through the 2nd mini one I got for her when she started stealing the first one from our chi-rat. So, based on that, I am guessing this toy is just not meant for truly dedicated chewers but will work great for the average pup without a turbo jaw.That was what cost it 1 star, the other 1 star is more just from the cleanliness factor. In retrospect I probably would have gotten a chew toy that did a little more to keep the goo inside the treat until the dog got it because when you put it down the grooves of this toy..then they bite it and drop it on the carpet to lick it... you get orange bacon cheese goo on your carpet.Both dogs do, however, keep very nice clean teeth with little brown buildup on their canines as a result of giving them these sticks a few times a week with some goo in them to encourage frantic chewing along with regular rawhide chews here and there in between.All in all:3/5 stars for being kind of messy and not standing up to the teeth of my girlfriends 12lb chihuahua/rat terrier mix but still being an effective design for aiding in doggy tooth cleaning and keeping them quiet and entertained for a descent window of time while working for every last bit of their treat. Also a total no-brainer to wash if you toss it in the sink in a cup of hot water for a while ahead of time to soak any dry goo bits they couldn't reach before they gave up.
summary: Good, but messy and less durable than my 12lb adult terrier mix needs.

reviewText: The price on these chewies is good and my puppy really loves Kong products. Quality is always excellent and the puppy isn't able to chew them to shreds immediately, which is a good thing. Great value on Kong products and if you add the dog version of the spray cheese (Kong Easy Treat), the pets really go a little bonkers for the toys.
This keeps the pups busy, cleans their teeth and wears well (it has lasted for over a year).
summary: Durable, Cleans Their Teeth, Keeps Them Busy

reviewText: We have had this for 4 months now and at atleast one meal a day, we wedge kibbles in the ridges of this toy besides pouring many down the hole in the center. Our 6 mth old lab absolutely loves this and it works for his teeth as well. It helped him as he lost his puppy teeth and hit his adult ones. Watching him keeping this toy between his paws and biting the ridges is a joy. There re more complex versions of this basic cylinder, but its worth every penny. Another winner from Kong!
summary: Has worked wonders for his teeth and slowing down his eating

reviewText: The sprayer on the bottle came broken and the bottle was covered in dirt and dust.  I just poured the product into an extra spray bottle I had laying around and used it that way.  It killed the flea infestation in my house and didn't make my carpet stink.  It does smell when you are using it but not horribly and it fades quickly.If you have a flea problem then I recommend trying this out.

This season in my neck of the woods has been a horrible flee season. I've had dogs for 6-7 years and have never had to fight so bad to get rid of them. The constant scratching was making me nuts. This product saved me from having to "bomb" my house, I just did not want to do it. All of the expensive flee meds & baths were not doing the trick as they normally do. This product saved our sanity. Thanks!
summary: Did the trick! and then some

reviewText: We use this as part of a preventative plan.  We have 3 dogs and one cat that are all indoor/outdoor.  We started using this product back in April 2011 as part of a flea prevention plan.  Because 2 of our dogs are Pomeranian's and our cat is long haired sometimes I think some of the monthly treatment gets lost in their fur and they don't get the full treatment no matter how hard we try.The costSergeant's 24-Ounce Flea-Free Breeze Home and Carpet Sprayis more than regular fabric sprays like Febreeze, but it is much cheaper than battling fleas once infested.  We use the spray about once a week during the hot months (which in San Antonio was 9 months out of the year).  We spray the pets bedding, the area rug on our wood floors and our chenille sofas (which we bought before we had dogs and hope to change out with leather for Christmas).If we actually see a flea or our groomer finds them on the dogs then all the pet beds and sofa pillows and cushions get taken out to the porch and given a generous spraying ofSentryHOME Flea and Tick Home and Carpet Spray 96-Fluid Ounceand the carpets get a dusting of flea carpet sprinkle after the spray dries.Use some of the home and carpet spray to saturate a cotton ball and put inside your vacuum bag or keep a flea collar in the bag to kill any fleas that get sucked up.  They can get out.  It is best to take your vacuum outside and empty the bag (or cylinder as we have a Dyson) and seal it in a garbage back and take directly to the trash.  Put the cotton ball or flea collar in the vacuum before taking it back in the house.  Cotton balls should be changed every time you vacuum, flea collars can be reused for about 6 months and are also a good preventative measure.
summary: Spray handle leaks a bit, but is effective.  Wear gloves

reviewText: I read the reviews of this product before purchasing, so I was not surprised that it worked well.  I didn't use the sprayer attached to the bottle, but put it in a small pressure sprayer to save time.  It was almost too easy!  I thoroughly vacuumed and cleaned every surface I needed to treat, sprayed enough to surface-coat the carpet and furniture, and as soon as it was dry I let the dogs back in.  It's a big plus that the fragrance is pleasant, the product is not sticky or messy after it dries, and it did not affect my dogs in any way.  The fleas, however, have vanished.  Excellent product!

I don't care if it works or not the sprayer worked for all of thirty seconds then just stopped I had to find a bottle make a mess pouring it into another sprayer lost half of it I read the other reviews stating their was a problem with the sprayer BUT I EXPECT A MANUFACTURER TO STAY on top of its products and correct problems as they arise in the manufacturing process. This company has to know this CHEMICAL is in a faulty jug with a faulty sprayer. 1 star for pure ridiculousness!! FIX YOUR DAM BOTTLE!
was happy that it arrived in a box which was in excellent condition, let alone the product itself. have not tried it yet, hopefully it works.

These tablets helped to slow the affects of my elderly dog's arthritis. He has passed away, but two years before he passed he was starting to have great difficulty walking and getting up from a lying position. We could tell he was in a lot of pain and was not enjoying his life, since he could not even get up to greet us. He was not able to do many of his favorite things.A combination of anti-inflammatory pills from the vet and these tablets contributed to a noticeable improvement in his ability to walk and a decrease in stiffness. These tablets take awhile to work (about 2 months) and need to be given regularly to show benefits. But I know they helped to decrease my dog's pain, allowed him to be fairly active and to enjoy the last couple years of his life. Plus it gave us two more wonderful years with him. He was a big dog who lived to 14 years old.Now our 5 year old dog is exhibiting pain and stiffness in his joints, so in addition to a weight loss program, I have started him on these. (As we all know, labs LOVE to eat.) These tablets are less expensive than anti-inflammatory pills from the vet and easier on the stomach when taken long term. I completely believe that glucosamine and chondroitin work because I've seen it with my own eyes.If your dog doesn't like the taste, just add a dab of peanut butter to the top of each tablet and he'll snarf it right up!
summary: Have been helpful for my dogs

reviewText: Seems to help keep my Newfoundland safe from being sore from to much exercise. Must taste good as he has no problem taking them

Started to give one to my overweight 12 year old dog and I can see that she has much more energy during her walks and even started to jump up on couch, which she hadn't done in a few years!!  I am very satifisfied this product and really believe it's helping her feel better.

I only got this item because it was on sale and I knew I was ordering a level 3 for my dog along with this purchasebut my order was botched and I ended up getting 2 Level 2 products when I expected 1 level 2 and 1 level 3.Sorry but 3 stars is as far as I can go.

I had been using Nutri-Vet Glucosamine on my dogs for years. Once we ran out I went to buy it again and the pet store was no longer carrying it. I bought them some other brand and they were not having it, they totally rejected it. Talk about a waste of $30. I ordered it off Amazon, the dogs ate it and the package was delivered in under 48 hours.
my dog is getting older now.i wanted him to be in good shape.so i bought this for thev first time. he loves the taste.i want to keep him feeling better and stronger
This stuff is great!  I use it to wash my floors and my dogs blankets, beds, etc.  Never an odor afterward.

Got pets?  Then you've got stains - on your furniture, on your carpet.  Pets miss the litter box, pets vomit, pets knock stuff over.  Nothing gets out all stains, but this is the best of all the dozens of products I've tried.
This product works very well. I highly recommend it to anyone trying to remove the stain/ odor of dog pee from carpeting.
With two puppies housetraining at the same time, this is an ESSENTIAL item! We've had our fair share of accidents, but you can't "smell" it!

This product is great!  I especially like that product can be poured directly into the carpet and pad as I don't always find my little darlings' deposits right away and they've already soaked in.  It really does remove the odors and stains.
I love the idea but I wind up cleaning it on the regular like a regular bowl because it stays filthy from dust and floor debris.

Great value. It is way bigger than I imagined so now I can go for a longer vacation and be sure my cat has ample water to drink and to paw-play with--she drinks from her paw making the biggest mess but she is so cute doing that. And with this system I don;t mind since there is plenty to spill and still plenty left to drink.
summary: A lot bigger than I thought

reviewText: I have 3 large dogs who drink a lot of water every day, Prior to buying this Bergan dog watered, I just used a very large water dish. During the warmer months, I was filling the bowl easily a half dozen times a day, Our largest dog, a 75lb lab could drink one whole bowl in a sitting when he came inside from playing in the backyard. Our family cat also seems to prefer drinking the water from the dogs bowl rather than his own dish. So no matter how often we were filling their bowl, it was just never enough. Inevitably at some point one of the dogs would come over to get our attention, so to bring us towards their bowls wanting them filled again.When I saw this Bergan dog waterer, I figured if it works, it would be exactly what we needed. I bought the 3 gallon model and have been so glad I did ever since. Now it only needs filled every other day (or so). For a family with smaller dogs, or less of them, this waterer will hold enough water for days probably. It's very simple to use. Simple pop the tank off the back, fill with water, screw the top back onto the tank and make sure the little hold is covered with its cap. Pop tank back into the tray and then reach under to the cap and remove the plug that's covering the water hole. The tank will fill with water and keep it filled with water as your pets drink.At first my dogs were a little confused by the "glugging" sounds made by the tank as the water would drain and air bubble would rise inside, but after about 2 days they never cared about it again. Now they will drink and drink even with the tank making the noise as is fills up with air. The dish tray is deep enough that it keeps water from spilling out, but not so deep that small dogs would have an issue drinking out of it. It's quite sill resistant, as I've found from my kids and pets bumping into it time and time again. It stays upright and doesn't leak. If anything ever happened to this one, I wouldn't hesitate at all to pick another one of these up. Highly recommended!
summary: Finally a way to keep the dogs water bowl filled

reviewText: I had one of these water feeders for 5+ years and loved it.  One day while replacing water, slipped and split on tile flooring.  I had to get another for my two large (100+ lb each) dogs.  Quick shipping a plus.  My only complaint about it is that since you have to fill and then flip it over to place in holder, it is quite unweildy and heavy - would be great to have top fill option.

I have a medium/large breed dog (lab mix)... I actually only wanted an automatic water dispenser as my dog needs his bowl refilled a million times a day, I was tired of the 2am wake up whining because his bowl became empty. I bought the setBergan Petite Gourmet Combo (Colors Vary)because they're about 17 a piece to buy them separately. So for a few dollars more I figured if the automatic feeder didn't work out for my dog I would just return to his slow feeder and use the automatic feeder for the cats.WATER DISPENSER:-Initially I found the water dispenser a little difficult, it didn't over flow or anything awful, I was just having a hard time getting the plug to stay closed before flipping the tank. however as I've continued to use it the plug now gives me no issue.-The wide fill opening: Allows for me to easily add some ice cubes to the tank.
