I'll have to find a suitable sized bowl to freeze larger chunks comes summer.-Filling once a day: Between my dog and cats using the water dispenser it's usually completely empty by morning so I'm refilling it once a day, which again is something I prefer as it avoids stagnant water.-We have a handful of cats and not one of them was frightened by the quiet gurgling, in fact most of them like to sit and swat at the bubbles that murmur up when you first tip it over.-I would like to mention after about a week of use I noticed a slight stagnant odor inside the water tank, so I would suggest giving it a good cleaning at least that often with some mild detergent or correctly diluted bleach. I have well water, someone with city treated or chlorinated water may not experience this but it's still probably a good idea to give it a clean through once in a while.---Update regarding stagnant smell--- The stagnant smell quickly became a regular problem, I was noticing it smelled every day when I changed the water. I started adding 1 tsp of Apple Cider Vinegar to the 1.5 gallons of water, it has completely remedied this problem, both the cats and dog do not seem to mind the addition either.

I have had all the 'fountain' bowls.. they all get scum on them.. and the little motor pump stops working after a while. I decided to go with this.. i don't have to worry about the cats not having water.. the plastic is easy to clean and resevoir easy to fill. There isn't that Scum that comes with sitting water. I like it. the cats like it

I have two dogs and one cat who drink LOTS of water.  I like this product.  It is large enough to keep me from having to fill the water bowl every day.  The only downer of it is that it is so large and when you fill it, it is quite heavy to get back into the base.  But considering the convenience of always having water available for my babies, it is so worth it!
summary: It's a little large, but I like it --

reviewText: I HAVE 8 BERGAN ELITE GOURMET 3 GALLON WATERERS IN MY HOME, 2 KENNELS & DOG HOUSE. AS A BREEDER, I HAVE TRIED THEM ALL & FOUND THAT THE BERGAN WATERER IS THE VERY BEST. IT IS THE ONLY ONE THAT YOU CAN ACTUALLY GET A HAND & BRUSH INSIDE TO CLEAN THE SCUM & ALGEA THAT OCCURS IN WATERERS. THEY ARE GREAT WITH THEIR LARGE CAPACITY. I ONLY HAVE TO FILL THEM OR CHANGE THE WATER ONCE A WEEK. SEVERAL DACHSHUNDS CAN DRINK OUT OF THE WATERER AT THE SAME TIME WHICH MAKES THEM VERY HAPPY. I DEFINATELY APPROVE OF THE BERGAN ELITE GOURMET 3 GALLON WATERER. IF THERE WERE 6 STARS, I WOULD GIVE IT A SIX.
Great service came on time, easy to clean and fill and I should have gotten them long ago. Cats are fine with them and I would recommend them to anyone.
summary: Easy and should have gotten them long ago

reviewText: We have a 60lb. boxer. She can empty this waterer in about 4 days, but we really like this waterer.  It is durable although our dog is not hard on a waterer.  Over all I would definitely order this waterer again. Very pleased with it.
I bought this in combo with the feeder.  My little dog was used to small dishes so she is sizing up these two units but they will be a great help when I just can't or forget to fill her dish.
I got this because it hold more water and was cheaper than the pet mate one. The plastic is thinner and the bowel more shallow but works great.

I wasn't to sure of this waterer at first but when it arrived I was pleasantly surprised, I like the plug in the cap t(see my pic) that you can close off for transporting.I live four blocks from the Pacific ocean and with the recent tragedies that occurred in Japan; I am developing a " Get ur stuff and get " kit with emergency food etc.This waterer fits perfectly in my evacuation plans. Can't recommend it enough.

I have 7 dogs & this is great to keep fresh waterOutdoors for them. Keeps the water clean tooOne hint: bring the garden house to the waterContainer as once full the container is superHeavy!! So easy to clean by just swirling waterAround in with your hand inside, rinse & readyTo refill. Love it, will be ordering a 2nd one.
summary: Huge, strong, a great deal for your $

reviewText: This is a quality fountain for cats and dogs.  I've bought ones before where you had to quickly turn the fountain over or risk spilling everything.  This one fills and only after it's inverted do you open the valve.  There is no risk of spilling anything.  Great product.

We have 3 dogs. 2 aussie shepard mixes and a Australian cattle dog mix. they love it. keeps water fresh tasting. with the three dogs pushing 60lbs we do fill frequently but that was the plan. as now its daily instead several times a day,

I love how big this is and that it holds a gigantic amount of water. I would say though that it is top heavy and must be put up against a wall because the plastic bottom is not thick or sturdy. Definitely like it and it is doing the trick but wish they would improve the bottom part and make it more heavyweight.

4 cats in my house, purchased two. They love it and I love it. Only when refilling, its "slimmy" from sitting in the water. A good rinse off and its good to go again. Better than filling up a few bowls everyday. They can not tip this one over !! One of the cats even likes to sit on top of it to "cool" off and wait it's turn !
Only way to fill this is by removing the inverted plastic container, flip it upright, and fill. This is OK. But I am not sure the lid will last for long. Threads are starting to wear already

I was getting tired of always having to fill my dog's water bowl every couple of hours so instead of buying a bigger bowl I decided to get this--- what a great choice! Yes, it is pretty heavy with all the water (1.5 gallons!) but it is worth the money. The cap was also hard to screw on the first few times but it has gotten easier.The only thing that bothers me is that the jug is hard to pick up if you want to change the water or clean the bowl. It takes a few shakes to get the jug free from the support. Other than that, I would recommend this to anyone who needs a bigger bowl of water and is tired of having to fill their puppy's bowl every hour or so.

I have an 18 old cat coming this July. I got him from a shelter when he was to small  I couldn't see him next to my carpet. He has flown on a plane cross country when he was 1 yr old with someone other than me. But when he got to a strange place with a small dog and other cats,he came out of the carrier looking & (talkiing to me) like where have you been! I got him from a shelter when he was 8 weeks old.I have never left him alone since 1998 when I had a neighbor come in & feed him & give him fresh water, & clean the box everyday. I am going away this July for 4 days ,& I have been trying out the water & food feeder & he is doing Great! I also purcased an automatic cat box cleaner from Amazon,com But have not set that up yet, cause I didn't want to rock his world!

It is what it is....it is not the easiest to get the jug off to clean and refill but it does do the job.  The best part is that it is wide at the lid sp you can clean the water jug which I could not do with there old one.  It is also easy to add Ice to the jug for the summer for cold water and you only have to fill it about every 3 days with out 2 small dogs.

reviewerName: J. Birren "*my karma ran over your dogma*"
reviewText: This was bought as a match to the Bergan 6 Pounds Petite Gourmet Feeder; exact size match - but it's enormous, so there's that. Not exactly "petite." But this works great, a little awkward getting the jug on but I like the flap that keeps the lid from dribbling as you turn it over - once it's on, just reach under and undo the flap, and the water will flow nicely. As advertised, the opening is very large and easy to clean.

I've had this water fountain for over two years, and have three cats, and it still works great! It does get a little dirty from time to time, but it doesn't help that my cats like to put their feet in it. They also like to splash water out of it, sigh. But overall no issues, and I will continue to use it!

With no edge to contain splashing, I ended up with 3 gallons of water on the floor.I'll continue to use it, but outside only.If your dog tends to splash their water, I recommend this instead, but it has to be filled much more frequently.Jolly Pets Road Refresher Non-Spill Water Bowl, Gray, 24 Ounces

It is surprising to see negative reviews for the Bergan Petite Gourmet 1.5 Gallon Waterer. As a long time pet owner and purchaser of multiple brands and styles of pet waterers, this is by far my favorite brand and design.The first time filling this waterer the first thing I noticed was the different design compared to others I own or have owned. The 1.5 gallon capacity holds at least fifty percent more water. It has a fill cap that others do not to hold water in place until the base is attached. No spilling!Another distinct feature is the different shaped base. It is wider, which makes it more stable and provides a larger reservoir giving both large and small animals easy access.If you have ever owned one of those other waterers that have a rough pebbled finish, then you know that they can get a little slimy in between refills. As others have noted, the interior of this waterer's reservoir is smooth. Sediment and other gross things do not have the same opportunity to adhere on a smooth surface.If you are looking for a large capacity waterer that is sturdy, stable, good looking and easy to clean, then this is it.
summary: This Is A GREAT Pet Waterer

reviewText: Just what my dog needed..! I love this it holds a crap load of water and it does not tip over if your looking for something like this buy it you will love it.. I did have a smaller one I had to put water init 2to3 times a day now with this I only have to fill it up every few days loving it ...!!!  Great buy

I had one of these waterer's years ago for my cat. It was an old model that was hard to clean and was more of a tower design like so many of the other models that not only take up a lot of room, but could easily be knocked over.  (Not just by the pets as some of the other reviewers here have talked about, but by me).  I decided to pick up a newer model after getting another cat, and wanting to make sure that they had plenty of fresh water. In my opinion, This Bergan design is the perfect watering system, especially for small dogs and cats.  It holds about a gallon and half of water and its bottle design is set on a broader base rather than taking up room in height. Not only is it more of a space saving bottle shape, but it also makes for a wider mouth at the bottom that is very easy to get inside with a bottle brush or a smaller hand and keep clean.  In fact the whole bottle and basin unit on this model is very compact and easily fits inside a sink or on top of a counter to clean.  Although I realize that for those that own big dogs the capacity of this unit may be a little small, for small dogs and cats it is the perfect system for providing your pets with fresh water over an extended period of time.  Lastly, this Bergen Petite is just about the cheapest watering system I have ever come across, either in stores or here on Amazon.  At the time of this writing it ships for free when bundled, and is an excellent bargain. This waterer has a great efficient design, is easy to fill and clean, and is the cheapest you are going to get away with a watering system for your pet.  I am thoroughly satisfied with it and highly recommend it...

My favorite thing about this water dispenser  is that it is so easy to clean. The water bottle has a wide opening that you can fit sponge in hand completely inside. fact that this one is so easy to clean helps me keep a fresh supply of clean water for my animals.

This is actually the 3rd one of these I'm buying. I just accidentally broke my original and am replacing it. I've had great success with them and they definitely make having several pets easier. Be advised - the unit comes in a weird aqua green color and not the black shown.

I love this. I originally bought it for two reasons:1) To make watering the three cats easier, &2) To have a water dish the rabbits couldn't move/dump everywhere.The size is bigger than expected (probably even bigger than I need for the cats). However, it's the size that keeps it from sliding on the floor, since it's pretty lightweight and easy to pick up/carry.HIGHLIGHT:The best part about this auto waterer that is unique is that the reservoir has a screw-on cap with a drainage plug. This makes transporting it to/from the sink 100x easier. No dripping or spillage after filling it or ninja moves trying to flip it over into the bowl before it starts to drain. You can close the plug, return it to the bowl, unplug it, and viola!I would definitely recommend this one over any others I've used.

I only purchased THIS product due to the price BECAUSE it stated Feeder AND Waterer NOT Feeder OR Waterer. This is a single item to be used for WATER only it is NOT a feeder. Although NOW I see that the description of this item has now changed to just a Waterer.  That sure would have been helpful for ME.On the item itself, it does not sit well in the slot and it's difficult to manage the tiny cap once it is upside down (it's filled with water so HEAVY). You would be best to purchase another item like the pet fountain for a top fill water station.

This is the perfect size for me to set under the kitchen counter overhang  (bar side).  I love the squat and shorter barrel size.  The size makes finding floor space which is out of the way very easy.  Makes refilling and carrying easier.  This is a simple design with a deep drinking tray (which I like).  This is the perfect amount of water for my two dogs for a few days.  I don't like to personally go more than three days without refilling as I think the water goes stale.  The price i great.  And with Prime shipping, it came right away.

Despite some other reviews this is extremely easy to use. I just attach the base to the jug then flip it over as a unit. No mess! My puppy loves it and I don't have to fill up her water bowl 3 times a day!
summary: Easy and my dog loves it!

reviewText: I have to agree with another user.  I bought it because i was tired of always filling my dogs bowl up every day. After leaving it i would start to see stuff form on the lid and drinking tray. Also i would end up changing it because of some of the stuff that would end up in it from my dog being a dog. I was cleaning it more than i was using it.It was also difficult to get the water jug off the drinking tray.  Now I'm back to filling 2 water dishes daily.

Just got it in today. Fast delivery,well designed in function and easy to set up. I love the wide opening to the water holder where I add ice for those hot days. It has a screw on top with a pull out tab, which makes it easy so water doesn't spill out everywhere when you turn it upside down. Just place it in the base, then pull the tab and voila. I love it.Works for me, my small dog and two cats!

I bought this to use for my rabbits when I am away and it does everything I could ask it to do. It holds a good amount of water. My 2 rabbits who drink a lot almost drain this in 2-3 weeks. The bowl for the water is a good size yet it does not take up very much cage space. It is a good design overall. The only thing that I do not like is that the lid is hard to get open and closed. This gets the water to a good level but not too full. It is compact and easy to fill/drain. I have a VERY VERY short bathroom sink so have to fill it in my bathtub, but most people should not have a problem with this. I would recommend this product to everyone with a cat/small dog/small pet.

It can hold over a gallon of water and does keep the water bowl full.  However, I strongly recommend cleaning the bowl frequently because dirt and other stuff gets into the open water part which makes it dirty.  I like that it allows us to go out of town for a few days without worrying about their water.

I bought this because the lid on the plastic barrel on my previous waterer broke after 6 years. Even though it's the same make and model, this one is just so much cheaper in quality. I can't imagine it will last as long as the previous one. The barrel is difficult to get out of the dish and the lid doesn't screw on easily.
Our dog is about 30 lbs.  We refill it about once every 5-6 days.  A good way to deliver fresh water.
summary: A good upgrade for a medium sized dog.

reviewText: It is what it is,so no need to write a book on it. If your using it for dogs it'll be dry fast enough with cats your good for a couple days. Don't buy it if you've got large furry friends, it's for the small ones! It is PETITE....
summary: It's ok, nothing to brag about

reviewText: Works like a charm - but three gallons of water is very heavy to handle when putting back in the holder.  But for three big dogs it is definitely what I needed.

It works fine.  It's a bit hard to removed the water container when it has a lot of water in it.  It's easy to clean and the dogs seems to like it.  Water for a small rat terrier last for about 5 days before I need to add more water.

The water tank is rather thin plastic so it should be handled w/care. I like the depth of the base since my cats don't spill it as easily as they do w/ a different brand. I think it is currently a decent value w/ the 4 for 3 promotion and am glad I bought it.

Some commented that water spilled when you filled it.  I don't see how.I ordered the small size for my small breed dog.  He's fine drinking out of it.  The only problem is that the bowl itself holds so much water, that I stopped filling the clear bottle and only use it like a regular dish.Great for a dog that has good access to the outside. A lot of water can mean accidents inside the house.  I bought the wrong product.  It's a good product.
summary: Nice dish.  Didn't spill any water.

reviewText: I use this so my squirrels and birds have a water source by the feeders.  I does the job well, but the clear jug means that I can see when it needs refill, but lets the sun in, so the chlorine dissipates quickly and algae forms in about 2 days, so not for outdoors.  The other small problem is the snaps that secure it to the base.  They are so tight that you have to put a foot on the base to pull the jug off for refill.  Durability has been good so far and it does dispense the water as needed.

I had some difficulty in figuring out how to get the top off of this to clean and refill. I didn't rate it well due to that. This is an update. The top requires a bit of pulling upward to remove but the overall product does work well.

This waterer keeps our dogs hydrated without having to refill every other day makes it a very worth while product.Our old Bergan lasted 6- years and cracked along the top of the bowl after that long of every day use.Extremely easy to clean.You will not be sorry on this purchase.Excellent product.
summary: A MUST HAVE IF YOU HAVE LARGE DOGS

reviewText: Boy!  A dog watering bowl.  How hard can it be to design a good one?  Pretty hard, I guess, since I haven't found one yet that I'd give 5 stars.I've been using this one for about two years.  The good thing here is that it holds 3 gallons so I only have to refill it about twice a week for my two dogs.The bad - gunk (algae, I think, or some other kind of scum) grows inside the tank and it's really hard to clean it out.  Also, to refill you fill the tank with water, replace the lid, then in one clean swift movement you have to flip it over and insert it into the base before the water squirts out all over the place. Filled with water, the tank weighs over 20 lbs so this is not as easy as it sounds.I think if they'd put an airtight lid on the TOP of the tank in addition to the regular screw lid on the bottom, both these problems would go away.  You could remove the top lid to reach in and clean the other end, and you could refill the tank through the top.
summary: Not easy to clean.  Not easy to fill.

reviewText: Use for every day convenient.  Good for vaction time holds large capacity.  Easy to fill and place on pedestal with out getting wet.  Has a small tab to pull after reassembly for water to flow.
summary: Great for vacation and every day use.

reviewText: No complaints about this product, it works by well and is easy to refill.  1.5 gallons is plenty for most dogs and it isn't too bulky.

My two cats loved tipping their old water bowl over. With this bowl it's impossible for them to tip it over. The reservoir is thick enough to hold water just fine, no reason to baby it. The base seems very durable and will last years.

Stores a lot of water. Doesn't leak. I have two small dogs and only need to fill it once a week. It's usually not empty by the end of the week but because it sits the water ends up with things in it and the bottom looks dirty.

Just received this today and like it so much already! We used to fill 2, 2 quart dishes for our Lab/Weimeraner Mix & St. Bernard and I was tired of doing it constantly lol We bought the Petite one because the Elite would have been too large for our small kitchen. When I took this out of the box I looked at it and said "Aw, it looks too small :-(" BUT I decided to try it anyways, for as small as it looks, it really does hold a lot! lol roughly 6-8 of those 2 quart bowls full actually! We havent had any problems with it leaking either. Really great buy in my opinion :-)

We use this for our outdoor cats. It is awesome!  I like the fact that we are able to clean it so easily, unlike other units that we have tried that get slimy and gross and no way to get into it to clean properly.

I bought this in 2 sizes and both are leaky. I used the pads that go with it which are just big sanitary napkins and it just did not work.  By the way if your dog is becoming incontinent go to the vet. There is a drug that really helps.  I hate using drugs but in this case it is worth it.

I was desperate to find a solution for my male dog who was marking when left alone. Unfortunately, these weren't it. It didn't cover his parts, but also they slipped down almost immediately. I found the same thing happen to male belly bands. I ended up cutting a pair of my own tights and pinning them to a shirt that finally did the trick. With that being said, the quality seemed fine.
summary: Not great for a male dog

reviewerName: Fairy Dogmother "Healthy Dogs, not Poisoned D...
reviewText: No one makes a better diaper for female or male dogs than this company. The green one that is the latest design is superb. Limitless stars.
Very helpful but doesn't fit perfectly.  May be the fact that I have a boxer mix who doesn't have a tail that I can use to stabilize.
summary: Doesn't fit perfectly but I haven't found one that does.

reviewText: I bought this for my Rough Collie who had a bladder infection.  I used it with Poise pads rather than buying this manufacturer's, and to great result.  No complaints from me.

I bought these for my 3lb/4 month Pomeranian who's in the process of learning to be potty trained. I keep this on between potty breaks to keep her from making mistakes. The fit is great. Any bigger, she would waddle and not be able to walk properly (I've tried larger ones), so this one seemed to fit perfectly. As others suggested, I use pads from the Dollar Tree. and this seems to work well. The only issue I have is that sometimes, the diaper seems too thin in material, so the pee that comes out through the sides of the pad totally soak up the diaper.**Most importantly... before buying this product, I wondered what would happen if my puppy pooped. I did not want it to get stuck in the diaper and cause a mess. However, the diaper has ceased all worries. The tail hole is just big enough that the poop can come out normally, and all is well.

Our 12 year old girl (dog) began to have some leaking issues especially at night,  so I bought one of these doggie diaper garments to see if it would help with her problem.  She loves it.  She can keep dry and doesn't wake herself (and me) up as much during the night cleaning herself.  I use a maxipad in it during the day and an overnight pad at night.  She stays much drier and happier.  We now have two, so when one gets a little wet, I can put a clean and dry one on her.  When she comes in from outdoors, she stands right inside the door while I put her pants on.  They are easy to put on and take off - just a little tug on the two velcro strips on each side.  A perfect solution for our mature girl.
Have a Yorkie who constantly wants to "mark" his territory. This Diaper works well. If he does urinate it is in the diaper not on the furniture.
Great product, works like it should. would definately recommend them to others. I used this size on my 130# great dane and they could be just a tick bigger but they work.

They are made well. My Doberman has a very small docked tail, so the pants really try to slide off of her rear end without a tail to go through the hole and help hold them up. The tail hole ends up down below her tail just above her vulva. I have to fasten them on very tightly around the waist to keep them from sliding, but I suppose this will always be an issue keeping pants on any breed with no tail.

I have a tiny (3.5 lb) dog who sprays everything all the time, even immediately after going outside. I find that this diaper was the most effective for this tiny dog who has a very large...er...member! The diaper is reasonably wide and the fit is solid because of the elastic. The velcro is very secure which dissuades my little guy from removing it. The product has three drawbacks: it holds very little liquid alone and is NOT waterproof, so you must use it with a liner. I find that a long feminine product with "wings" works the best. Also, the diaper looks ridiculous with its saggy appearance. Silly-looking or not, it does the trick and my drapes are thankful!
summary: Good fit on even tiny dogs but requires liner

reviewText: Simple Solution Washable Diapers come lined with a soft fabric and mesh liner. The Velcro band allows you to adjust, loosening or tightening the diaper as needed.Though the size small looked like it would fit snug, the diaper fit my 14 lb dog perfectly and she can't get it off.The diaper can be used with or without absorbent liners. We didn't buy her the liners, because all they looked like was over-priced woman's pantyliners.We did not purchase ours from Amazon, but the salesclerk said that we could use the Simple Solution female wrap on our male. I do not advise it. lol

In the specs/in the package description as well as the chart shown/when compared to actual measurements on the dog/ Bought X-small for 6 lb Chi / measured 12 in tummy / tried on and it is way too tight as well as NO coverage where it should be/ Measured him from belly to anus/tail He is 8 inches ... this is only 6 inches  to the tail opening/ that does not solve the problem as he would squirting a direct shot of urine to up under his own body/ ............His Mama bought a SMALL Band only /same company/ at WM and had to return as that not correct waist either/ way too tight/
summary: Product Quality & construction very good/  BUT sizing way off..

reviewText: MY FAVORIATE PRODUCT FOR MY PETS. VERY SATISFIED.  WILL USE THIS PRODUCT OFTEN. TKU  :o)

I purchased this for my sweet little yorkie so she can run free in the house while she is learning to potty train.  I was using disposable and they get expensive!  This diaper is much easier to put on. She hasnt actually had any accidents so not sure what that will be like when it happens!  She doesn't mind wearing them at all and it saves a lot of floor cleaning time!  I'm glad to have the washable diaper and even if it does leak how bad can it be!  She is tiny!  At least most of the pee will be in the diaper or so I hope anyway.  I did use a panty liner too.  Was a little disappointed that it was advertised to have a "pouch" to insert a liner for heavy urination. However, I received the "new improved" version and it does not have that. Pantyliners with adhesive seem to be okay though.

LOVE this container. its perfect to store my bird seed. easy pour spout to refill my feeders, will hold my entire bag 8 lb bag of seed.it supposedly will also hold onto the bag the seed comes in too, but I dont use it for that, id rather just pour it all in there.

Just the right size for storing a 5 lb. sack of nyjer bird seed.  Nyjer seed tends to go rancid quickly.  With these dispensers it keeps that expensive seed fresher longer. The pour spout happens to fit just right into nyjer sock feeders for pouring without waste.  I find the placement of the handle to be well balanced and ease for pouring.  Whole top comes off for filling; tightly snaps back.We also store other bird seed mixes, peanuts, large quantities of rice, and pet food.  No waste, contents stay fresh - saves money in the long run.  Excellent price.  Highly recommend.
summary: Dispenser for many uses - saves money, keeps contents fresher longer

reviewText: This is a wonderful item if you have cats.  I pour the dry food from the bag into the dispenser.  My cats know their food is in it and come running when I pick it up.  Easy to use and keeps me from spilling it.
This dispenser holds the right amount of dog food and makes dispensing it easy. I have to use a measuring cup to be sure we don't overfeed our dogs, and this dispenser makes that easy.
summary: Does what it's supposed to do

reviewText: I have a LOT of bird feeders so I thought a large dispenser would be helpful. Wrong. When filled and an attempt is made to use the pour spout, the top lets loose and all the seed spills out.
summary: Better for pet food than bird seed.

reviewText: The item name and description indicate the container is for 8-QUARTS. However when the product arrived it is clearly labeled as 8-POUNDS. This is a problem because each quart is equivalent to two pounds. I have a 16 pound bag of Meow Mix which would fit handily in an 8 quart container. But no, this container is only for 8 pounds of product. So only half of my bag fit. I'm EXTREMELY disappointed at the mislabeling.
Great for smaller bags of dog food; we use two of these smaller ones and one bigger one to keep a variety of food for our Shorkeys.

I use these for bird and cat food. They easily fit under the bird cage and make feeding easier. They also fit nicely in the pantry for feeding the cats. So much nicer than trying to maneuver those large heavy bags, and the cats can't chew through them.
This dispenser holds about a small bagful of pet food, dispenses safely and easily, but not too quickly, so you're less likely to spill the food everywhere. It may not be fancy, but it does its job!

The spouts were poorly designed. The large spout is to big unless you are poring into a large bowl, container etc. the small spout is angled so you have to turn the entire container upside down. Even then, the seeds, dog food, whatever you are trying to pour gets hung up. What happens next is not what you want.  The product you are trying to dispense goes every where. It is of good quality. I've bought 4 different ones made by this company. The only usable one is the smallest.

My dog hates these and won't take them she is not that picky, but i get em in her with cheese wiz, i just put a lil on and she eats it they are for large dogs over 50 lbs i didn't no this when i ordered but worked out for me, they do work she has had no stomach problems with them i think overall the rimadil works much better but depending on your needs these are good for asprin, i have a 3 legged german shepard and she also has hip displesia got these while i was waiting for the rimadil and they did help.

Our Chessie is 7 and just starting to show some joint discomfort.  There are occasional days when we've played hard the day before and he wakes up pretty stiff.  I like being able to ease his pain a little on the occasion that he just looks like he needs a little boost.
When the dogs get a bit puny, have a cold, bug, etc., this sure seems to help quite a bit.

Our 11 year old 90lb black lab has arthritis, hip dysplasia, injured spine, cancer in the foot, and a missing toe.He is a happy dog, but in so much pain that without pain pills, he hates getting up or even moving at all.He has been on a steady diet of Deramaxx and alternatively Rimadyl, but after a while, I had enough of their high cost and sought alternatives.I decided to try dog-specific chewable aspirin and so far, after 2 weeks, it seems to be working and not irritating him internally. My wallet is elated.After 3 weeks, he threw up and was reluctant to eat, so I took him off aspirin for a week to give his stomach time to heal. Now he is on a rotation of 3 days of aspirin with 1 day off and 1 day of tramadol.FYI, he also will not eat them unless I push them into canned dog food and spread it over his food.  I am unclear why anyone is giving this product a negative review based solely on their dog not liking to eat medicine all by itself.  It would be nice if they did make it tasty enough to avoid having to put it into a treat, but the issue is hardly worth slamming the product with a 1 star review.When the bottle was done, I switched to Aspirin Power (mixed in with canned dog food) as it is cheaper and harder for him to avoid.Aspirin Powder, 1 lb.
I like this product better than any pain pills cause this doesn't seem to make her sleep all the time and she acts better on this.  She also loves the taste.

I bought 4 bottles of these for an arthritic dog only to be told by my vet he would be better off with a safer Rx NSAID for pets.  (You know, at over $1 a pill. !)  While I believe there is a concern, like my vet said, of bleeding and such that even we humans face I did not see any problems in the weeks I used it as directed.  Plus I'm pretty sure those Rx NSAIDs hold their own, similar warnings.  And I have to get blood tests once a year when I use the Rx meds.So I switched him to the Rx like my other dog and then ran out after a few months.  Switching back to these once again I have to say that I feel he is a bit better on this aspirin than the rx (generic tramadol)......he doesn't take as long to get up and doesn't fall as much on his arthritic legs.  If I thought he was happily buzzed and high and pain free like one would expect on the Rx I would happily go back but he does seem a bit better with these.UPDATE:My older dog went downhill quickly and suddenly started having real problems getting up and moving.  While these worked as well for a while and still did work fine for my other dog I found myself amping up his treatment.  I basically told the vet I didn't care if he was stoned as long as he was OUT OF PAIN and could rise on his hind legs easier again.  (It's not like we'll find him selling his body on the corner to get more and more drugs now....)  So he's back on Novox for inflammation AND now also Tramadol max amount for pain and this has given him back his back legs.  So while I believe in these aspirins for some pain be aware that there ARE better and higher levels of pain relief available and these should be your next line of defense when even the aspirin doesn't work.  We thought we were going to lose him on Christmas Eve but he is back to just slow versus dragging his back end on the floor with me in tears.  Good luck.
summary: I feel these work a bit better than Rx I tried

reviewText: We have used these Nutri-Vet K-9 chewable aspirin for several years with several dogs for a variety of reasons. I've never had a dog refuse to take them right out of the bottle nor have we ever had a dog have a bad reaction to these. We have a large pack of dogs ranging in age from 6 years to 12 years old and they are very active - constantly wrestling & playing or chasing squirrels and shadows all over the yard. That means there are going to be days when a dog (or two) is either feeling his age with some arthritis aches or has just overdone with the running & jumping. Our vet has given his stamp of approval for two of these with food as needed and they always help our hounds. We have large breed dogs - Rhodesian Ridgebacks & a Walker Coon Hound, not sure how effective or what dose would be good with small breeds, but 2 tablets for a 70lb to 90lb dog seems just right.

My old westie loves these and eats it right up, he is 11 so I can tell when he is walking a little slow that he is hurting, I give him a  half tablet and he thinks it's a real treat....Good to have something you can give them without having to go to the vet.
The dogs will take one without fuss - and they seem to give relief from pain/discomfort - all in all a good product.

I have a 14 year old standard poodle and she has bad arthritis. She tends to fall over and she was on some very expensive prescription pain pills from the vet that did not work as well as this one. Coming back to order more.Since being on it, she is doing much better. She is about 60 lbs and I give her one pill in the morning and one in the evening with food.She's been taking it for a month now and I can tell the difference.
good product for minor pain in our german shepherd, given only when she needs it, joint pain, seems to help alot, good to have on hand, not a everyday thing

It may not be as strong - like comparing asprin to prescription pain killers, but it makes my dogs happy when the pain of arthritis gets too much. By following the directions, I've had no problem with stomach upset. And, unlike other pills, they don't "fight me" to take it.Nutri-Vet K9 seems to make fine products - I use their "Hip and Joint" product with great success as well.

works very well.. was using prescription meds that cost $75 a month that upset my dogs stomach and she would not eat. This aspirin works great, visible results and she still loves to eat. So glad I found this product.
this helps take away pain from the arthritis of older dogs, and it keeps the pain away, so they can get along with the other dogs

Our older dog has hip dysplasia. Living in Northern Michigan, the winters are really hard on him. He eats canned food for breakfast and dry food for dinner, so I put one of these in with his canned food along with glucosamine,chondroitin and Msm.. It really seems to be helping him a lot and normally one a day does the trick. Occasionally he seems extra stiff and uncomfortable in the late afternoon, so I have given him another aspirin later on.. He takes it and chews it down, no problem..HOWEVER, if the seller "Ozbo" comes up as the supplier, you may want to order from another source.. I ordered from them on Feb.3, it was suppose to arrive no later than Feb.13 (today) but when checking the tracking info yesterday, I discovered they haven't even shipped it yet.I wrote asking why, received no answer, so I requested a cancellation this morning, which they did, but I received no explanation or apology.. My dog is now down to one aspirin, and I can't get these locally, so I'm very unhappy with the seller OZBO and will never order anything that comes from them again.
summary: Is helping our senior citizen quite a bit, but don't order from OZBO

reviewText: Chewable just doesn't cut it with my againg Border Collie. He wouldn't touch one of these if it was stuck inside a steak.  Border Collies have an extra sense about things. They watch your routines, they figure things out that most dogs are clueless about. Buddy will walk up to his bowl of home cooked dog food made of fat free chicken breast/brown rice and some veggies he just adores. But he will sniff it for a minute as though he's analyzing the contents. If there's even half of one of these crushed or not crushed, diluted, well disguised to any of the rest of us, he walks away. And he won't touch the same food without the aspirin for a few days, as if to punish me. So, I have to dissolve these in as little water as possible, add a tiny bit of sugar, and suck them up into a small syringe and administer them through his back teeth with his jaws clamped as tight as he can get them. And as frustrating as that was, he's getting more used to it and isnt trying to spit it out anymore. Now for the results. They really work. He's 14 and has weak hips from aging. He's been in so much arthritic pain that the vet put him on Tramadol, but they made him drowsy and weaker and so lethargic. Within  2 days of administering these, one in the morning, one 12 hours later, I can see a big difference in his mobility. He stands taller, his back end isn't always drooping with his  weakened hind legs. He's willing to walk longer and gets around so much bette We've had to put rugs down everywhere because his legs would just separate and slip down into double splits because he was so feeble and helpless.  But now with the rugs and these aspiring, he's gaining some strength, and when he goes outside he jumps around like a puppy again. Of course he's sore later, but he was going downhill so fast before I found a pain relief I could get down him. He will continue to deteriorate with age, but it feels so good to be giving him something to relieve his misery and see him responding so well to it. But if your dog is like mine, don't expect him to embrace these just because they're beef/liver flavored, unless he's a gulper and would swallow anything you offer him.
summary: I love these but my dogs hates them

reviewText: The flavor or scent is probably like medicine. My dogs will not chew it unless I hide the pill in a piece of meat or treat. Product seems to work fine, but I will probably go back to my old brand which dogs seems to like.

We have a three year old sheltie who lives to play hard. Unfortunately, this sometimes leaves her with muscle strains and bruises, meaning we can't play with her until she stops limping. Her vet suggested baby aspirin, however she seems to know that it's not a treat and spits it out. I purchased these in hopes that the "great liver flavor" would trick her into eating them. I missed the bullet point that indicated the use was intended for dogs over 50 lbs. and once it arrived, called her vet's office. We were assured that in fact the product can be used for smaller dogs if it is cut in half.Now her limp goes away within a day and she is back to her sparkly, wiggly, bouncy self!
summary: Works great, but must be cut for smaller dogs

reviewText: I got these for my dog as she has some Arthritis in her back and I got it to help her pain. The only thing it did was make her sick.

I think these work great for my 160 lb. Rottie, who is a bit Limpy-Loo from rocketing off 6 foot stone wall drops after squirrels before I can blink.  I do alternate with other supplements, like Dog Pain Away, to prevent any stomach sensitivity.
my 12 yr old has aches and pains occasionally, I give this to him, it seems to help, or at least make me feel better about it.
I was told to give out dog baby aspirin which he spits out. Now when in pain he takes these easily.
This is a great product, it works as described for minor pain associated with arthritis and inflammation, I would recommend it.
I would rather not give my 10 1/2 year old Lab anything, but after a meal, these aspirins just do the trick for her.

We bought this because it was a reasonable price and hoped our old shepherd has joint pain due to his arthritis would benefit. It worked real fast. I checked with the vet and was told to give one in a.m and one p.m. Our dog thanked us and we thanked the makers of this product!

These may work. They may help my dog with pain. Too bad they smell so horrible that my dog won't eat them.The smell of chemicals is overpowering when you open the bottle. Good luck getting your dog to take these. You are better off with buffered aspirin shoved in a treat than wasting your money on this product.
summary: She does not like the taste. I don't like the smell

reviewText: As my senior dog gets older it seems her hips aren't as they use to be. These seem to be good.  I assume they are working, I don't hear my doggie complaining.  I normally mix two of these in my senior dog's wet food.  She also has a Cosequin hip pill and soft vitamins too.  The mix seems to work. Wish I could find a larger amount of these for what I would consider a good price.
Works great for my dogs arthritis and will work for other issues. I like this so much better than using people aspirin
The dog eats them strait without having to hide it in food so that's always a plus. Seems to work fine and the dog hasn't complained so....

I bought these for a neighbors dog, who unfortunately doesn't rate up there for medical expenses. The old girl has been around for many years and I love her like my own. She has begun to slow with age and has a hard time walking and getting up. So splurged for these to help alleviate the swelling so she could get around better. They say she is now able to jump back on the couch now, so it must be doing something.
Reasonably priced, but I have to hide it in a piece of meat as she doesn't find it at all appealing.  So it gets swallowed whole, no chewing.

Most people know that dogs can use many of the same medications as we do, although they tend to eliminate them more slowly than we do so they last a little longer in the dog than it will in a person.Aspirin and pepto bismol are two things we've used extensively at our house.  Grumpy tummies are often fixed up with a spoon full of pepto (I put it in a syringe and squirt it in the side of the dogs mouth), and achy joints and minor injuries are well treated with canine aspirin.  Once our dogs got really old we moved to prescription anti-inflammatories.We used a variety of canine aspirin with good luck, then I bought four of these.  They work, but they're smaller in size and must have less tasty liver stuff in them, because our dogs just arent fond of them and sometimes leave them behind.  But the idea is good, so look for canine aspiring your dog likes if they're starting to get a little older and creakier.  Its a low cost way to help them feel better, may have the same heart healthy benefits that aspirin does in humans, and there is very little downside other than a sore stomach if taken without food and to excess.
summary: The idea is good, but this isnt as palatable as others

reviewText: MY DOG WONT TAKE THEM. NOT EVEN DRESSED IN CHEESE. SAVE YOUR MONEY AND GO TO THE DOLLAR TREE AND GET GENERIC ASPRIN (NON FLAVORED) FOR $1.  AND HIDE THEM IN "PILL POCKETS" ...NOW THOSE WORK GREAT. FIND THEM HERE ON AMAZON
summary: NOW THOSE WORK GREAT. FIND THEM HERE ON AMAZON

reviewText: Rufus is 100 pounds and has arthritis in his front shoulder.  I give him an aspirin in the mornings with his breakfast.  Sometimes he gets a little excited when he goes outside and jumps around with our other dog, so it definitely helps.

I checked out similar items at local pet store and a 20-feet one sells twice the price. This is a great item. We have a husky that knows how to dig his way out of the yard. So if we are away from home for long period of time we need the peace of mind he won't run away and get lost. This is long enough for him to freely walk around the yard, although he sometimes tangles his legs in,  that's less of a concern compared to safety. He chewed on the cord a couple of times but didn't manage to make a damage.

I have had this tie-out for about two weeks now.It is the PERFECT length! My puppy has plenty of room to run and play, and it doesn't tangle!She is a 6-month-old female pit bull, and will get double in size by the time she's full grown.Hopefully, this tie-out will last a long time!

I've been using it with a stake to leave my dogs out in a park.  The good thung is it's sturdy. It's easy to wrap in loop and put away, but takes a few minutes to unravel because it's long and gets tangeled a little bit (no knots but kind of like when a hose gets slightly tangled).  Also my husband ended up with a rope burn on his leg as a large dog got off leash and approached my dog.  My dog tried to run away and my husband stuck his feet out so that the other dog wouldn't get tangled in the tie out.  Probably not the best to use in open areas where there are other dogs and people.  Also my dogs aren't the brightest so they wrap themselves around trees -- hence good to use under supervision.  It's a sturdy tie out so depending on the purpose it can be a great product.
summary: Sturdy -- maybe not best for travel use or in public areas

reviewText: This product works as intended.  I have had to replace it twice over 2 years as eventually the cover cracks and then it crimps and rusts.  For the price, it is worth it.

Needed a longer tie out to attach to my existing dog line so my dog would have more freedom to run so I purchase this and was happy I did. This does the job and is not too heavy for my 7.5 pound chihuahua.  Would work for larger dogs as well.
The pros is that it's a good quality cable and easy to use (I guess they all are).  However the rotating function on the tie out doesn't keep it from tangling like other's I've used.
summary: It's a good tie out, but not my favorite.

reviewText: The cat has to eat VERY VERY far back for more food to dispense. I had to build a little ramp to make it come out easier. There has to be better products out there.....

I love this feeder, and it fit my needs exactly.  The only thing I would change is the way one has to fill it up.  I end up spilling food all over the place.  Perhaps having the 'top' extend wider or flare like a funnel or maybe design the 'bottom' cap to have a flap so can fill it up, screw on top, close the flap, turn it over, place on stand and then open the flap so food can tumble out.I bought the water feeder too and they look great together, wish they were sold as a set.
summary: Great feeder...very convenient, one design flaw...

reviewText: I love the fact that I no longer have to fill their bowl multiple times a day but I do have to go up to it and shake the  container so the food call down. My cats apparently are not smart enought to figure out how the food come down.
I love this thing.. Have a small dog (<30 lbs), and it holds enough food to last almost 3 weeks! (now I just need the water side to hold 3 weeks worth!)
summary: small dog will eat for a couple of weeks with one fill!

reviewText: I have a medium/large breed dog (lab mix) who I had put on one of those slow feeder bowls because he was being a hog with his food and choking on it then hacking up completely unchewed food. I actually only wanted an automatic water dispenser as my dog needs his bowl refilled a million times a day, I was tired of the 2am wake up whining because his bowl became empty. I actually bought the setBergan Petite Gourmet Combo (Colors Vary)because it was 23 dollars for both as opposed to 17 each. For just a few dollars more I figured if the automatic feeder didn't work out for my dog I would just return to his slow feeder and use the automatic one for the cats.FOOD DISPENSER:-Successfully replaced slow feeder: To my surprise something most might see as a problem with the automatic feeder I see as a blessing, after the dog eats the food that spills out during the pressure of your new fill it doesn't continue to spill into the bowl quite as well, but instead just a small handfuls of kibble spill from the feeder, this keeps my dog from scarfing up giant mouthfuls.- Being able to fill it from the top is really convenient.-The size of the tank: I'm adding in new food about every two days. Any longer and I'd be a little worried about ants or bugs trying to climb into it, which still may become a problem once the warmer months hit.
summary: Wasn't sure it would work for me

reviewText: It does precisely the job I wanted. A filling will take 10 lb. of kibble, and last close to 2 weeks, with my 6 cats (I have two of these feeders). And, the little dickens' can't knock it over (easily), the way they commonly did with bowls, that I had to fill once a day.
summary: Good for me, good for the cats.

reviewText: It's a gravity feeder. It dispenses more food as food is eaten. If that's what you're looking for than this is the thing you want. Pretty basic.

I thought that the big clear plastic storage bin would be difficult to manage, but it is not.  It is locked into the base.  You add the kibble by taking the lid off of the top and pouring it in.  The opening is more than wide enough to pour straight from the bag.  I put a full 10 pounds of cat food in the container.  The little kitten has no problems eating from it and the food falls right down to refill it.  Excellent solution.
Cat likes it, I like it.  Seems durable and easy to clean.  No problems with food getting stuck or anything like that so far!

I have about 5 of these feeders in my dog areas. I love the fact that I can wash them out so easily & they hold so much food. The product is very sturdy,does not tip over with eager, hungry dachshunds & definately a plus in my kennels. Their waterer is absolutely the best on the market. You can get your entire hand inside it to clean it as well.

I wanted to have a big basin so that i could have a lot of food in it but did not want the hols that the food came out to be so big , It dumped way too much food out and my cat would just eat eat ,  I dont use it now .  if you have a cat that doesnt know how to pace himself when he eats I would get a timer feeder instead.
summary: better for multiple cats or a small dog

reviewText: Great feeder if you have a big dog.  Holds food enough for 4 or 5 days for our big Boxer.
summary: Holds lots of food and well made.

reviewText: I could have used a little smaller unit as this one was kind of intimidating for my 15 pounder but she got hungry enough to use it.  I'm not sure what she will do when the first bunch of feed drops into the pan.  I may find her in the next state.  She is a little skittish. At least she won't get upset with me for being late feeding her.
4 Cats live in my house. I purchased two, they love it, I love it. Its really nice and sturdy. Great Price too!
I bought it for cats. I am not sure two kitties could eat that much food. I have a strong suspicion that the neighborhood kitties got wind of the gizmo.. Lid does not stay tight

I have two cats that I needed to have ample food supply while I was out of town for two days.  I purchased this feeder in the petite size and knew it would hold six pounds.  Normal bags of cat food are about that size.  However, I did not realize how large the hole would be that the food dispensed from.  (You really can't tell from the online photo.)  I also thought the top part would fit tighter to keep the food fresh.  The top of mine will fly off at the slightest touch.  Just filling the bottom of the gray tray is enough food for my cats for several days.  That is what I did then I threw it away.  I didn't think it would keep the food fresh as much air as can get into this.Now for the quality.  I found the clear plastic very thin and did not sit properly in the bowl and as I stated the top lid was just sitting on top. My fifteen pound cat could easily knock the entire thing over.  Perhaps mine was a lemon or something but I cannot see this being worth the $18 price.  It looks like something from the dollar store.

reviewerName: J. Birren "*my karma ran over your dogma*"
reviewText: Great feeder; despite small round food I still have to smack it a little to get the food to flow down and fill the bowl, but I have dumb cats - perhaps yours can be trained! Of course mine freak out when they can see the bottom of the bowl and refuse to eat around the sides, so perhaps if they weren't so weird it might work - so your mileage may vary. PS, these are not "petite" - they will totally work for a small dog.
summary: Larger Than Expected, Not Quite Self-Feeding but Great for the Smarter Cat

reviewText: This dog feeder is tilted to assist with gravity to put the dog food from the container to the bowl.  It holds over five pounds of food and the opening or the shoot is very wide.  I would recommend this to friends and families.
summary: Nice tilt  to dispense the dog food.  Very durable!

reviewText: This is a great item holds a ton of food with out it tipping over ~ has a cover on it so the food always stays fresh.. If your looking for a dog feeder look no more this is the one you want to buy....!! :) :)

I bought this feeder for two kittens that had outgrown the tiny feeder purchased for them initially. It is huge and easily holds more than two bags of kitten kibble. Cats are happy with it, so I am happy with it. So far it is durable and should be good for many years of use.

I bought this feeder for my dogs, due to I have two and they eat a lot.  I bought this so during the day they do not run out of food.  Anyway...they eat standard size dry dog food (Iams), and the dog food seems to clog this feeder due to the opening is not very big.  I have to jam my finger under the bottle to poke food loose.  I think this would work well for cat food...since cat food bits are super tiny...but for dog food it doesn't work well.
summary: Only works with super small-bite dog food

reviewText: I was very surprised by how large this feeder was as the description on the product page does not show how much food it holds.  It holds 13 lbs, which is pretty much an entire large bag of cat kibble.  I really like the size, and shape of the holder, but I've deducted one star because it's somewhat difficult to fill.  The fill hole at the top is too small for my kibble scoop so some of the kibble ends up on the table when I'm trying to fill the feeder, and I have a hard time snapping the lid back on the feeder because of it's awkward design.  Also, a word of warning:  do not try to pick this up when it is full because the food jug can easily topple over and spill the entire 13 lbs of food on the floor. Overall, for the reasonable price and large capacity, I do recommend this feeder.
summary: A good feeder, but not perfect

reviewText: I just wish it fed more "automatically"...I have to shake it quite often to get the food (which is small) to move down into the bowl, as my cats eat the front of the bowl contents, and then it remains "clogged" at the back since they're too lazy to eat back there. I guess if I am out of town, they WOULD eat it though.

We used this for our cats, with meow mix cat food (for food size reference). A few times the food got stuck and didn't spill into the little bowl area. Our cats had to paw at the opening to make the food dispense. As long as your cats are brave/smart enough to figure that part out, this thing works great! Otherwise, you may need to search for a different solution.
summary: Works good, but your cats may have to work

reviewText: The previous automatic feeder had an issue where food would spill onto the floor out of the sides. This does not have that issue. It is really almost perfect, except the top doesn't stay in securely. I took one star off for that because it reduces how fresh my cats' food stays by not really sealing off air circulation.
summary: Holds a lot of food, doesn't spill out.

reviewText: Bought this used from Amazon Warehouse Deals, and It was missing the lid, the only problem I have, besides Amazon sending me two of these by mistake, and not sending me the lid for it, was that the food doesn't really "drop" down on it's own, my cat will eat all of the food out of the dispenser area, and i'll sort of have to scoop/pull down some more food from the canister occasionally. That's my only complaint, otherwise it works well.

This product works great for our two cats (petite size).  The food doesn't have any reason to fall into the tray, but the cats just paw the opening and the food comes down.  I just need to refill the food every few weeks now.  My only complaint is the lid on top which is difficult to get back in.  Not a big deal though.
Holds enough food for over a week.  Great for vacation or every day use indoors or out.  Has a larger resivor than most others, more than one cat could eat at the same time.
For an outside cat and he just ate the food far too fast, but it was a good quality product.

I would give this 5 stars if the opening where you fill it was larger. It's a pain to fill because it's long and narrow (I frequently have food on the floor after filling it) but it's large enough to where we can go out of town for several days and know our dog is fed without any issues. Very sturdy plastic and large bowl. We got the waterer too and love it.
This feeder does its job. Holds very good amount of dry cat food. It does what it is designed to do well.
Nice size for small animals and easy to disassemble and clean. Minus one star for being just plain ugly.

My dogs are use to being fed twice a day in regular bowls but we were going on vacation for a week and needed something they could use without us being here Bought them well in advance of our trip to give them time to adapt and they did well The only reason I didnt give them 5 stars i because the lids are not as secure as I think they should be Having said that my dogs didnt attempt to remove the lids so it was not an issue and they served their purpose

This doesn't spray like a mist. It "squirts" out large drops up to 10 feet. I got this for my adult son to use while walking our dachshunds on our city walking path. Not everyone keeps their dogs on leashes and law enforcement doesn't enforce the city's leash law. Most of these dogs are friendly and well trained, but there are a few dogs that are aggressive towards our dachshunds and start a fight. He has only had to use it twice. The chow remembers him and gives him a wide berth. The lab sneezed and licked up the spray. One of our dachshunds tried to lick up the spray as well. This is a great neighborly alternative to harmful methods that would start a fight between dog owners…those grudges can take years to dissolve.
summary: Some dogs hate it, some dogs like it.

reviewText: I have a dog with aggression issues with other dogs. When I walk her, as part of her training, I occasionally encounter dogs running around off-leash and that poses a danger to me, my dog, and the stray. This spray was recommended by my vet and I will feel safer walking and training my dog.

I have seen this product work, and it does what it says.  No harm to other dogs and the effects are immediate.However...After getting one for myself, I slipped into my cargo pants pocket where the safety turned and the trigger was free to dispense the product.These canisters need a redesign safety to button trigger system.  The cap spring over the button trigger like on the Mace canisters would protect the unit when carried in the pocket from accidental discharges.  Yet still be ready for instant use.I hope i never have to use this, but I will without hesitation to protect my dogs when on our hike.A great product... just needs a better canister.
summary: Have not used it yet and not looking forward to doing so.

reviewText: Haven't used this product yet - and hope no need arises.  But it arrived quickly...well-packaged...and seems easy to deploy.With various animals living in/near our woods... this makes our walks more comfortable.

I bought this spray because the dog owners on our street do not seem to feel the need to keep their dogs either fenced in or on a leash. The dogs are friendly, but my dog gets ultra excited/hyperactive every time he sees another dog, which makes an off leash encounter less than desirable. I like having the spray with me when I am out on walks, even though I haven't had to use it yet. I recently went camping in the woods of Virginia and also was happy to have the spray with me in the off chance I encountered any unfriendly wildlife. This was an unexpected but nice use of the spray.

We are believers in positive reinforcement, but when our now six-month-old teething puppy jumps up at us while we are walking and bites at us and/or our clothes, it's not fun. Our puppy obedience class instructor recommended a citrus based spray.  Our dog responds immediately to the spray without holding a grudge. I feel less intimidated having the spray in my hand. It doesn't take long before she started responding to just the sight of the can. My husband and I each have one to be consistent with our training. Biting is just not acceptable. Guess it could be used as human deterrent in a pinch too. Citrus would burn eyes. It's a good habit to rinse face after spraying it to make sure it's not burning the eyes, even if only temporary and from a light spray "kickback".

A pit bull and some other mean looking dog came running down the street towards me and my dog today.  I knew they were coming after us, so I turned around and pulled out my Sprayshield.  When I looked back, they had my little cocker spaniel surrounded, growling and barking.  A fight was imminent and she didn't have a chance.  I sprayed, and they immediately turned tail and ran.  Thank God, it worked.  There's still more spray left in the can, but I won't chance that it would be enough for next time.  I'm keeping a full bottle with me always.______________UPDATE 6/26/13:  I haven't had time to buy another can.  As luck would have it, I had two little unleashed dogs approach my leashed dog while on a walk today.  Again, they surrounded her with growling and barking and posturing.  They were right up next to her.  Though this would have been a more fair fight, it would have been bloody all the same.  I sprayed them and they left.  This time, the spray was weaker.  I definitely don't have enough for another attack.Too many loose dogs in my neighborhood.  My dog challenges every one of them, and they all want to fight.  I will be buying more.

My wife used it to deter a loose big bulldog mix that attacked our leashed dog. They got into a fight and the owner was unable to get a hold of his dog. A good dose of the spray right into his face was enough deterrent for the owner to grab him by the neck and pull him back. I will order a replacement.
Personally, I think this is a stupid product but my husband reuses to pick up dog poop with just a bag so I ordered it for him. It seems solidly constructed and does the job well enough.
summary: Sturdy, decent tool for picking up poop

reviewText: It is exactly as it says it is....nothing more, nothing less. It does the job, I don't have to touch anything. I just scoop and pull the bag out. It's perfect for a long walk because the size is small.

Great pooper scooper.  The bag fits easily around it, the poop is scooped up quickly and easily (usually on the first try).  It is wide enough to pick up an entire pile of poop at one go.  Best of all, once scooped, you just tie the bag and then open a second time to drop it in the garbage.  Hands never have to go close to the poop.  Perfect for those who hate dog poop but love dogs.
Im a first time dog owner and dont like the thought of even touching dog poop with a bag. This scooper works like a charm and glad I bought this cuz I own a Collie dog that does big poop...ewww! lol
Works well. A little large to have to carry around. Using the produce or meat grocery bags works with it.  If my dog's stool was a little loose, it would be a nice tool to have.
summary: If you don't enjoy the warm feeling of your dog's poo...

reviewText: Amazing!!! I love it. It is so easy to use and durable. Most of all, it's clean!!
summary: Amazing; finally, cleaning after your pet can be clean

reviewText: It's a poop scoop, let's be honest. Poop is gross. I don't want to touch it. This allows me to not interact with it, so hooray for it. You need to get their bags, though - the "to go" ones and the ones at Costco won't fit in either the dispenser or in actual use. They need to be wide enough for the jaws to get around the poo. If you have a yard, and a largish dog (mine's a Lab), you can do this once a day and collect multiple doodies at once. Lucky you. Seriously, though, this thing is pretty great, and when I travel with the pup, this and a supply of bags is going with me. I found the refill bags at Kroger since I couldn't find them here.

The one thing I don't like about having a dog is the poop. I just hate grabbing for that poop especially the wet ones. Carrying around a pan or scoop was impractical and still gross. Tried this for the first time and no gag reflex! Some reviews say with the bags you normally use it does not open wide enough which I can see. But it seemed okay so far for me. It is a little bulky so having to walk around with it was a little bit of a hassle but way better than using my hands or a regular pooper scooper. Small inconvenience for a simple walk. I will stick in a bag for longer walks and since the poop never touches the device i don't have to worry about contamination. I have never used poop so much in a review. I guess unless I am rating a toilet, I should not ever have to again.
I love this thing! I bought it specifically because I wanted a scooper that was easy to carry. Works great, the bags fit fine.

I love this thing. I take my 80lb lab for walks more often now, knowing that when she drops her love bundles, I don't have to feel those warm turds on my  hands. The unit comes with some bio-degradable bags that work ok, but aren't the best. After I was done with them, I bought a roll of 10 GAL bags at my local super market and have been using them since. The bigger bags allow for a better, wider grip, which is great for loose waste. One thing I like about this scooper is the strong springs on it. It makes sure you have a strong grip on the waste bag and won't open. This is important, because after I pick up the poop, I place the bag inside the scooper and continue with my walk without worrying about the turds falling on the ground or my shoes! lol.The scooper has a loop handle, which I use constantly. I simply create a loop on my dog's leash and tie the scooper to it, yes it dangles, but that's not a problem for me.Overall, this is a great product. I love my dog, but not what comes out of her butthole. :)
I like it,  my only complain is that the scooper needs the special refill bags and the are not cheap.
summary: Makes the nasty job easier,easy to use

reviewText: Good concept but it is so hard to open.  You have to have very strong hand strength to open.  Will give away and go back to using bags with my hands...darn!

Doesn't always scrape everything up well, especially if being used on grass, and sometimes a bit bulky to carry if your dog is like mine and is strong and pulls, sometimes requires both hands for restraining. But I use it all the time when out in my own yard under the tree in sand / pine needles. After running out of bags I just use plastic shopping bags with it (just make sure they don't have holes first).
summary: It's good, but not always the best

reviewText: I like this little gadget, it means that you can pick up the poo without having the dubious experience of cradling it in your hands. The teeth are also handy when the dog goes in the tall grass, you can just twist and up it comes. The spring is tight and shows no signs of wearing out anytime soon. The way the bags fit into this thing is kind of genius. You can't see it in the picture, but there is a canister inside the scoop that holds a roll of bags. You load your roll in the canister and it has a dispenser that you pull out the opening in the scoop. You could just use plastic grocery bags with no problem, but having the dispenser is great if you have a favorite brand of the roll type already. The bags that come with the scoop are not so great, barely long enough to work with the scoop. Handle bags would work better with this, since the temptation is the tie off the bag before opening the teeth and encountering that smell. Speaking of the smell though, it does not seem to be seeping into the plastic even after multiple uses, which is great.

It works well and keeps from having to have hands on but if pooh is soft or running it just leaves mess still in the grass or where ever.  I actually find it easier to use my hand through a bag, or shovel and rake, so I figured this would be good to pack up to take on long walks to keep from having to have hands on when out for a walk.

So I recently picked one of these up because I've started walking my dog more often in the neighborhood and really got tired / grossed out of picking her 'stuff' up with my hands (obviously covered with a bag). The warmth and fact of what I was touching kind of started grossing me out, so I said 'pooper scooper' come save me now! After reviewing some of the other types of 'scoopers' - I thought this one would be the simplest and easiest to carry while walking and I must say that I'm pretty impressed with it. It's light weight, and easy to carry in one hand while holding a leash, and as some users have said you can even hook it to something since it has an opening at the handle. The bags fit inside and you just roll them out each time you need to use it. It does take a bit of a grip to open it - nothing that most people can't handle, but fits around the 'job' and just scoops it up. No mess and most importantly (for me anyways) no warmness on your hands - which I'm all for! I did get the bags that Amazon recommends with it, and they do fit - so not sure why several reviews said they don't. I'd definitely tell you to try it out if you are wanting to be a good citizen and CLEAN up after your dogs (surprisingly a lot of people think they don't have to) while walking them, and be a little more discreet about doing so.
I much prefer this method to the old by hand method.  Also I don't like carrying the big scoopers around this is small and can easily be held in same hand as leash.
summary: Using your hand is gross this thing is great

reviewText: I bought this toy because the other reviewers stated it "lasted a while" for their "heavy chewer" dogs. I have a Golden retriever that does like to chew, moreso then any other dog I've owned. However this toy, literally lasted 5 minutes of him playing with it (to be honest it was probably less then 5 minutes of continual use, as he wasn't always chewing on it during that time), before he had the rope ripped apart into shreds.I had to take it from him so he wasn't choking on strands of 10" long rope pieces. I don't think I can return a chewed up toy, so now after 5 minutes of use I'm out 5$.I've had a few other rope toys that lasted anywhere from a week to a month. The rope on this one is just softer, its not hard, was way too easy for a dog to chew through.Would not recommend.
my 2 Dalmatians have not destroyed this toy as yet. Even our neighbors Labrador has one and he hasn't ruined it either.Fun for the dogs to play tug of war and also easy to toss with the rope attached
Boxer puppy destroyed this within a day.
Flings well, but not terribly far.  Good for an inexpensive toy...and my lab enjoys it.  She does, however, enjoy the Kong Wubba more.
summary: Good for an inexpensive rope toy

reviewText: My Great Dane loves this toy and so do I. It's great for a tug toy or for fetch. When using it to fetch you don't have to touch the slobber ball so this is really an all around great product.
It didn't last very long and I constantly supervise my dogs when playing with toys. They had the ball off and rope apart in 10 minutes.
We have an American Bulldog and he destroyed the ball in minutes.  I expected something with the name "Tuff Balls" to last through the day.
I use this product on my yorkies to help prevent their coats from becoming tangled. It does an excellent job and leaves a fresh clean scent. I will continue to use this product.

This creme rinse extends the fresh, clean scent of the dog bath for weeks.  It is really worth the extra step. It also makes their coats stay soft and glossy after the bath.  I always use this creme rinse when I bath the dogs.
summary: Dog stays smelling fresh and clean for weeks!

reviewText: Being my wife is a licensed cosmetologist and is very familiar with hair products in general, and being she's the one who grooms our Coton de Tulear, she was quite impressed with Lambert Kay Fresh'n Clean Dog Creme Rinse for the no tangle aspect....but also because it softens the hair of a Coton leaving it feeling as soft a cotton.  After all, she is a Coton :)

After reading all the great reviews, I was expecting something better smelling. The smell did linger for a few days, but I kinda wished it hadn't. It's not bad, just not good either. Oh well.As far as how it left my dog's hair? That part was just okay too. It did what it's suppose to do, but nothing spectacular and nothing I would rave about or tell others to go and get (which I always do when I find a great product).
Not only does this do the job but my two toy poodles smell terrific. The fragrance is not overpowering and lasts. I also use the same shampoo for them.
It keeps my stinky golden-doodle smelling groomer-fresh for about a week, which is far longer than the other products I've tried. Recommended.

I have 4 different conditioners that I have purchased for my 6 month old 4 1/2 lb Maltese and this is by far the very best I have used. It makes him sooo soft and tangle free on his medium length coat. The smell is a little "girly" and he is a boy but it smells good. The conditioner can be left in without rinsing, haven't tried that yet.  I have achieved perfect results with rinsing it out and it stays until his next weekly bath. I think everyone who tries this conditioner will be very pleased and so will their wallet : )  Love the low price for a super product ! ! !
I get compliments on how shiny, silky and nice smelling my dogs are. It's a wonderful product and I will buy it again.

I tried to only use the Lambert Kay shampoo to keep our spaniel clean ... the breeder recommended the creme rinse if anything to flush out the shedding hair, but we found it also makes the dog smell delightful (although the dog may feel otherwise for a while after the bath). Otherwise, the dog's coat is soft, smooth and silky.
summary: Recommended by a breeder ... keeps the dog's coat soft, smooth and smelling fresh

reviewText: The product smells good (kind of a baby powder/fresh shower smell) without being too perfumy. My dog's coat feels a little thick afterward, though. Also, it doesn't lather much so you have to use a lot more product than you would if you used human shampoo.
We search high and low to get this and always have it on hand.  It smells great and lasts for a long time.

We have had a dog door for many years now, I can't imagine how I got along without one before. The flaps only last here about 2 or 3 years, but we have a multi-dog family so I have no problem with that.  This flap is super easy to change, the adjustment and installation take a total of less than 10 minutes.  The little extra time to adjust the flap to it's correct position is well worth the trouble and makes a difference in keeping the winter cold out.
