Dishwasher safe. Stainless steel. The perfect size water dish for our 2 cats. The bottom keeps it from sliding around.The only bad thing: The label on it is a huge sticker, took a lot of work to get all the goop off. Would give it 5 stars if it were not for that.

I can't imagine how anybody could have developed a so-called pet food and water bowl that stinks this bad.  It's the blue rubber thing on the bottom.  It's probably the most ignorant product design I've seen.  I tried finding Durapet online to give some feedback directly to the manufacturer, but just found people selling the stuff.
Easy to clean. Dishwasher safe. Dog can't tear it apart. Stainless steel. My dog's opinion: "bark, arf, woof, woof." Guess she likes it.

Well they do indeed do what they say - they do not move around at all and they don't tip over easily.  When I got them though, I was really put off by how much they *smelled*.  Oh man, the rubber on the bottom STUNK.  I tried airing them out for some days hoping it had to do with them being in a warehouse or something, but nope - it never really did go away. (Can't imagine how much it put the dog off considering how much better they can smell than we can.)  I also made the mistake of putting them down straight onto the kitchen floor (vinyl flooring) and it actually discolored it slightly!  Cannot get the color out of the floor now - with anything.  My mistake, okay, in not putting down a mat first, and possibly putting them down still slightly damp on the bottom, but still, I do not expect them to discolor my floor!They are nice and shiny, though - and would likely last for a while and stay looking nice.  But we aren't using them anymore. Between the smell and the color issue, forget it. Went with a better brand.

These bowls are the perfect size for free feeding my cats kibble and for their water. The Durapet bowls are easy to clean by hand or in the dishwasher. They are unbreakable, stay put on solid-surfaces, and have no smell whatsoever. My cats enjoy looking at their refection in the water bowl, and these bowls do not give them chin acne.
I love this bowl, especially the blue rubber ring around the bottom.  It prevents the bowl from sliding, whether it be on carpet or tile.  It's very sturdy.  And reasonably priced.

This bowl has some great features, but they are worthless since the edges rust in less then two weeks. I used this bowl for my cats daily and it was great for a week and a half till I noticed the edge started to rust.After a month the edges were completely rusted all around and was no longer useful.  I had to buy another brand of bowl which I hope will be more successful for my needs. I strongly recommend you do not buy this bowl if you plan to use it daily as it will not hold up to daily basic wear and tear.
summary: Rusted mess in two weeks or less.

reviewText: Good bowls.  They are not noisy as claimed.1) They have permament rubber bottoms.2) When cleaning had wash or place on top rack of dishwasher.3) When they fist arrive.. MAKE SURE the bowls have warmed.  Then the labels peel off easily - just take your time.  The first bowl was cold from being shipped.  I tried to peel it off, what a mess.  I let the rest warm to room temp and they peeled off cleanly

reviewText: I love these bowls for the dogs and have several of them - from puppy-size to large-dog-size.  They look great, and are heavy-duty stainless that keeps its shine even after repeated scrubbings.  The rubber on the bottom is not some cheap gasket-type ring that rots off in a few months.  It's permanently attached and built into the bottom of the bowl.  It's very durable and works like a charm to keep the bowl in place for even enthusiastic eaters.  I also have two Durapet bowls with the hump in the middle for dogs who gulp their food and they seem to work well and are of the same high quality as the regular bowls.  I doubt I will ever have to buy another pet bowl!

I bought 2 of these for our Husky mix.  These work out great.  The rubber material on the bottom keeps it from sliding around.  Now we actually have them on a rubber mat, so they don't move at all.  I compared these to similar styles that they have at Petsmart, Petco, etc.  The attachment of the rubber to the bowl at the stores looks really cheap, and you can see the glue.  The seams on this bowl are very clean, and you can't see the glue.  The construction looks much better this way.  They do great in the dishwasher. We got the 1 1/4 quart bowls.  She only gets a cup of food twice a day, and it is plenty big for that.  I could have gone with a 2 quart for her water bowl, but with this size it just makes us change her water more frequently which is not a bad thing.  They tell you to do that anyway.  I am very happy with this purchase.
Another solid durapet bowl, does not slide, has no rusted, and holds a lot. I use it as a big water dish for my cat.
Perfect size and shape love the fact that is is dishwasher safe without having to remove any rubber ring or whatever Recommend it

reviewText: It's a little expensive but well worth the cost. My 10 year old Sheltie love it and it loves him. I will not buy any other dog food for him or our little chiwawa

Since we changed to Blue Buffalo for our dog's food, all four of our rescues have more energy, a shinier coat, and the one with terrible skin allergies doesn't chew as much.  Blue leaves out all of the unnecessary fillers and only includes healthy ingredients.  Plus, our dogs LOVE the flavor!  I have found that having it shipped (free!) through Amazon.com is cheaper than driving the 30 minutes to PetSmart myself.
summary: Best Dog Food on the Market!

reviewText: I can't tell you how much I enjoy being able to read my dog food label and know what each ingredient actually is. No by-products, no corn, no wheat, no artificial flavoring or coloring(like my dog really cares what color the kibbles are). I also really love that the food already includes Glucosamine and Chondroiton for my dogs joints, and I did notice a differnce in him after switching from a food that did not contain them.Its true you are paying more compared to other brands, but take a look at what you're really getting for your money. My dog eats less food on Blue Buffalo, so the food actually lasts me longer even though its more expensive. He also has a better coat and has smaller, healthier stools. Nobody can believe how great my beagle looks and acts. Just today he ran 4 miles with a doggie back pack on with no problem and he'll be 13 in June!I firmly believe that you are what you eat, if you eat junk you're going to feel like junk and ultimatly be junk! Why not give your dog the fuel his body needs to function and ask yourself: If your dog was faced with a plate of corn, wheat gluten, soybean meal and random animal parts with pretty colors or a plate of deboned chicken, oatmeal, potatoes, carrots and more...which would he dig into?
dog had diarrea constantly for more than 4 weeks, switched to candidae and 1st day he was back to normal. gonna stay on candidae

According to my extremely finicky Cocker, Blue Buffalo Dog Food is the best.  I have been trying to switch her over from prescription food, for her allergies, for a long time; I couldn't find anything to agree with her palate.  Blue is just the ticket, from the very beginning.  It doesn't contain anything that you can't pronounce, or any other fillers.  Try it, your dog will love it!

My cockapoo used to eat Beneful ever since he was younger. He used to have bad skin, and every couple of times each month he would have seizures.Our old vet said this can be common because of his breed and/or it may be because of allergies; we changed to prescription food (rabbit was the main protein) and this did not work. We didnt think it was worth the money when there were no successful results and switched back to Beneful. This was bad in that it gave our dog severe diarrhea,  to the point where he couldn't hold it in and/or blood would squirting everywhere as well. We brought him to the vet many times and they couldn't find what was wrong with him.We researched then and  read online about how Beneful was horrible with dogs and gave them side effects such as dry skin and even seizures and we researched about blue buffalo before we bought it the first time (5 years ago). Since we switched and eased him into Blue Buffalo, he does not have as bad dry skin as before, and he has not had a seizure since (knock on wood)! He loves the food and we switch from flavor to flavor once un a while so he doesn't get bored with it. He has more energy too! We got others to switch to Blue Buffalo and their dogs love it too! It may be expensive but it's definitely worth it for our Cockapoo and we will never be switching to Beneful or any brand similar to them again.
summary: Blue Buffalo changed my Cockapoo 's life!

reviewText: Quite a bit.  I use this with my Italian Greyhound so she can nibble on something once her can dog food.

reviewerName: N. Ferguson "Two, Daisy, Hannah, and Kitten"
reviewText: My two goldens approve of this product. Blue Buffalo uses top of the line ingredients, human food grade-- there's a chicken version and a fish version. No yucky meat "by-products", meat and meat meals are the top ingredients, no indigestible corn or wheat, a wide variety of wholesome and varied vegetable ingredients and several probiotics to promote healthy digestion and absorption of nutrients. On top of that, this is a very palatable food.Blue Buffalo also uses a unique process to manufacture "lifebits" which are added to the basic "kibble" food. These smaller, darker pieces are cold formed in order to better maintain nutrients. I don't believe any other company incorporates this kind of element into dog food.I respect what they are doing, and I've changed to Blue Buffalo food for my cat, too.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Here's the nutritional information:-One cup contains 462.8 calories-NO animal by-products-NO artificial preservatives, colors, or flavors-NO corn, wheat, or soy AND gluten-free (great to know after last years' pet food scandals and deaths with other brands, in which added glutens were contaminated with melamine)-Crude protein 25% minimum-Crude fat 14% minimum-Omega 3 fatty acids 0.25% min-Omega 6 fatty acides 3.5% min-Glucosamine 400 mg/kg max-Major ngredients, in order:Deboned chicken, chicken meal, whole ground brown rice (very digestible grain source vs. the usual corn), whole ground barley, oatmeal, rye, whole potatoes, tomato pomace (natural source of lycopene), chicken fat (preserved wtih natural mixed tocopherols), natural chicken flavor, whole carrots, whole sweet potatoes, blueberries, cranberries, flaxseed, barley grass, dried parsley, alfalfa meal, kelp meal, taurine, l-carnitine, l-lysine, glucosamine hydrochloride, yucca schidigera extract, green tea extract, turmeric, garllic, sunflower oil (natural source of Omega 6 fatty acids), oil of rosemary, the whole bunch of expected vitamins and minerals, and several probiotics (lactobacillus acidolphilus, bacillus subtilis, bifidobacgterium longum, enterococcus faecium).I hope this helps you evaluate whether or not this food would be a good match for your best pal.
summary: human quality ingredients, unique manufacturing process-- my goldens enjoy it

reviewText: Although this food does have good quality ingredients, my German Shepherd never really had any solid stools while on it.  While switching him to this food, he had diarrhea even though I switched him over VERY slowly.  I still stayed with the food thinking that the diarrhea had to do with switching the main meat component from lamb to chicken.  After three months on it though, his stools are still mostly runny.  I have since change to the Taste of the Wild which he actually love to eat (it smells pretty good too) and his stools are improving.  This does not mean that Blue Buffalo is not a good choice for your dog.  Rather I would try it out and see how your dog does on it.  If you find that their stools are not improving then switch.
Parrots, it turns out, don't have many taste buds, so they like spicy food!  My buddy, Tater, loves this spicy mix.  I use it in addition to that fruity Zupreem stuff.
I have 2 parrots,  a Jardine's and an African Grey and they both eat this food. I mix it with other food so they have a variety to pick through.

My birds enjoy extruded diets, I have fed them other Zupreem products which they enjoyed so I felt comfortable buying this for them. They've eaten Harrison's Coarse Pepper, so I thought the Wild and Spicy would be acceptable.  To my surprise it contained actual dried Red Pepper piece's (I laughed- must be the spicy in Wild and Spicy - unlike Harrison's which is part of the actual product).  I wasn't surprised that my birds tossed it, that part of their diet is fresh or fresh dried.I'm giving this 4 stars - would've given 5 stars if Zupreem didn't use artificial color. There's no need to use artificial color when so many fruits and veggies have coloring properties;Beets for red, Mulberry for red/purple, Spinach for green, Carrots for orange, Saffron for yellow and Blueberries. All of these and more are readily available, not cost prohibitive and would be a plus to the ingredients already in this product. Obviously ALL ingredients would still be in all the shapes and colors, it's just that the colors would be natural.Overall the birds seemed to like this food. I put this in a separate food dish, it is fed freely and replaced as needed. Aside from the artificial color, the ingredients are the reason I bought this for them.
I like to switch my birds' pellets around, just for the sake of variety.  These were definitely a hit with all my medium/small birds.  I definitely intend on purchasing it again.
The only size available through Amazon was just too large for my Conures.  They kept trying to eat it but it was just too big!  I would love to see an appropriate size for the smaller guys.

I switched my two Yorkies over to this food because one of them is a little too heavy.  They both love the food, and didn't have any problem switching over from the regular Blue Buffalo formula.  The kibble size is larger than the small breed formulas, but they don't seem to have any problems with it.  One thing to keep in mind is that this formula has more fiber, so your dogs may defecate more frequently/have an increased amount.
summary: Blue Buffalo Weight Control Formula Dry Dog Food

reviewText: I have five dogs. One has extreme food sensitivities to gluten and wheat. As three of my dogs are labs, which tend to be somewhat food gluttons, it is nice to find a dog food that helps them maintain their weight.This is an excellent product. Even my dog with the food sensitivities has no problem.And they all are keeping their svelte figure.This product is excellent and from my point of view, clearly one of hte best products for keeping your dog healthy and fit.
summary: A terrific dog food and helps my pudgy dogs

reviewText: Note: Blue Buffalo no longer makes "Weight Control" dog food and instead makes "Healthy Weight" dog food in the "Life Protection line.  Healthy Weight has 415 calories per cup and 3.290 calories/gram.  Compared to the Longevity line for adult dogs, Healthy Weight has more calories per cup but a fewer calories per gram, meaning that Healthy Weight has more grams per cup than Longevity. Looking at the order of ingredients (which is by pre-production ingredient weight), I am concerned that too much of Healthy Weight's protein may come from whole grains, which do not contain all of the amino acids that a dog must get from his or her food (dogs cannot synthesize all the amino acids they need from plants and grains the way humans can.) De-boned chicken is the first ingredient, but, because it contains 75% water before processing, it is not the heaviest final ingredient.  Chicken meal is a high quality protein, but it is listed as the fifth ingredient.Also: At the bottom of this review I name a brand of food that ultimately helped me meet my dog's goals.Overview of Weight Control: While I did not do all I could to make Weight Control work for my dog, it ultimately did not help my dog reach his ideal weight. Blue Weight Control is nutrient rich, very low in fat, and uses high-quality protein sources. Unfortunately, Blue Weight Control has 444 calories per cup, which  is pretty calorie-dense.  I believe it was over 4 calories per gram, which, in human food, is the caloric density of cheddar cheese.  My dog may have been able to eat a satisfying quantity of this food if he only needed to maintain a healthy weight, but he needed to lose weight, and the portions I had to feed him were too small. Fortunately, Blue Buffalo makes an excellent food calledBlue Buffalo Longevity Dry Food for Adult Dogs, 24-Pound Bag, and the adult food has a more reasonable 354 calories per cup, allowing my dog to eat a more satisfying quantity of food per day.Details: My dog weighed 50 lbs. and needed to get to the maximum ideal weight for his breed --44 lbs.-- as determined by my vet and the American Kennel Club.  According to several dog nutritionists, the calories a dog should consume per day to lose weight is computed as follows:  1)Convert his goal weight in pounds to kilograms by dividing the pounds by 2.2.  For my dog 44 lbs over 2.2= 20.  2  Multiply her weight in KG by 30.  For my dog 20*30 is 600. (3)Add 70. In my dog's case, that meant 670 calories per day.  This number represents the dog's caloric needs while on a weight loss diet, assuming the dog has no special needs, such as pregnant or whelping, being a puppy, being a toy breed, working, or living outdoors in cold weather. The formula only is valid if the dog weighs between 5 and 99 pounds. Check with your vet to make sure the daily calories you compute are in the right neighborhood.The reason Blue Weight Control was not the best Blue Buffalo food for my dog was because it is is relatively calorie dense-- 444 calories per cup. To feed him 670 total calories per day, I could only feed him 1.5 cups per day, meaning that each of his two meals could only be 3/4 cups, and that was without even a tiny buffer for a single green bean as a treat. (Later I explain why I had to add-in other foods.  I ended up only feeding him 2/3 of a cup for each meal, and that really worried me about the adequacy of his nutrition. This quantity of food is well below the feeding guidelines on the bag. My dog was miserable and begged constantly. He would even lick his empty bowl between meals.  I tried feeding him a 1/3 cup (10 calories) of plain no-added-salt canned green beans as a snack, just to help fill his stomach, but he was not content and eventually turned his nose up at the green bean snacks.  I should have added warm water to his dog food and stirred in the green beans, but I wasn't smart enough to do so at the time. My dog kept acting hungry and begging for more dog food.  He would actually walk over to the bag of dog food, put his paw on it, and look at me while whining softly! Other members of my household would sneak table food to him because he begged so persistently, and the "diet" was a abysmal failure.  My poor dog ended up actually gaining 4 more pounds from all the human cheating!I was glad I found Blue Longevity adult food.  It has 354 calories per cup as opposed to 444. It has 3.384 calories/gram.  I gave my dog 1.8 cups per day (in 2 meals) for 640 calories. A saleswomen at Petsmart explained that I could help increase my dog's feeling of fullness even more by adding warm water to to his food, enough to just cover the kibble, and letting it sit on the counter a minute so that the kibble would swell up. I should then stir in 10 calories (a little less than 1/4 cup) of no-added-salt green beans to make it an even more filling meal. I did all of these changes together, so I can't separate the effects. My dog stopped the whining and began to lose the weight.I budgeted him only 10 calories per day for treats. The problem was, I had to find something to give as a treat at least 3 times per day.  See, my dog lived in a no-kill shelter for 18 month, so I had to use treats to re-housebreak him. Now he refuses to do #2 unless he is guaranteed a treat (if he doesn't get one immediately after he goes, he lies down on the ground and makes us carry him home--even if we are two blocks from the house and it is dark and pooring down rain. Welcome to my world of loving an Australian Cattle Dog.) I was surprised to learn that small sized Milk Bones have 20 calories each and contributed to him getting overweight to begin with. Even breaking one in half wasn't enough to make his treat calories reasonable. I found a bite-sized treat that is only 1-2 calories calledPremier Liver Biscoti Dog Treats, Original Recipe, Original Bite Size, 8oz. Bag).  They were fine as a substitute for Milk Bones. I recently found a 2-calorie  treat that my dog is crazy about called Zuke's Mini Naturals Salmon Dog Treats (not to be confused with the 10-calorie eachZuke's Mini Bakes Chicken N Cherryz, 16 oz. My dog would probably walk through fire for the Salmon flavored ones, but he also likes the peanut butter flavored ones.Update: I eventually found a web site called DogFoodAdvisor.com.  Through it, I found another food calledPremium Edge Healthy Weight I Weight Reduction Formula Adult Dry Dog Food, 35-Poundthat has the same calories per cup as Longevity but that has twice as much protein (also from high quality sources!) It is also grain-free (dogs don't need grains in their diet at all) and a little less expensive per pound.  It helped my dog build muscle and lose weight.
summary: Low fat, but not Blue's lowest calorie formula

reviewText: We have been using the Blue Buffalo Weight control formula for one of our Beagles because she started to gain a lot of weight (due to a medication she is on). We've been feeding this to her for a couple of months now and she has lost a healthy amount of weight and has had a lot more energy. Her skin and fur is clean, feels looks really good (not greasy), and her stool is solid. Once she looses another couple of pounds we'll switch her over to another Blue Buffalo formula, probably the Fish and Sweet Potato.It is a quality product for the price and it shows.

At least in my book. I mix the dry food with some wet and both dogs polish everything off in no time. This formula is very pricy and no longer sold by Amazon. Therefore no free shipping and I can buy it for less at my local pet store.

I HIGHLY recommend this brand of dog food.  My vet said this is a great brand and healthy for your pet. I bought the Weight Control formula to help keep her weight within the normal range.  Although a little pricey, the 30lb bag lasts a very long time.  It has portion instructions on the bag which are very helpful.  The vitamins in this are cold pressed to preserve the nutrients unlike other brands that use heat and therefore lose nutrients.  Pets are worth the price.

My 3 cats really love this! I've put it next to my bed, and its seemed to help deter them from scratching the mattress less. They also enjoy just lounging on it.  I'll definitely be buying another scratcher when this one is all used up.

I've had scratching boxes that lasted months so I believe the cardboard in these boxes is deliberately fragile. I've had my cats sharpen their claws on amazon cardboard shipping boxes that lasted months longer than these boxes do. Within a day they look significantly shredded. But at least my cats prefer these boxes to the furniture. And at least I can easily order them from amazon.
My fat cat jumed right on this when I pulled it our of the box. He couldn't have been happier. He loved the little toy that came with it.

It's a bed! It's a kitty hang out! It's a scratcher! It's even more, but its just FUN.  The graphics and tassels are cute and make it more like a piece of kitty furniture than just kitty-scratchy-cardboard.These are heavy duty cardboard scratchers.  There aren't a ton of little bits that get pulled off and tracked around like many of the lower cost scratchers.  I have enough cats in my house that still love these scratchers enough to give it 5 stars months and months after receipt.We highly recommend them :-)

I foster cats for our Humane Society, so cat toys get the "acid test" in this house.  They finally destroyed thier old scratchy box, but they like the new one just as well.  They couldn't even wait until I got it out the wrapping, but went after it as soon as I opened the outer box.  The catnip toy the product included was a nice little bonus.

We have purchased several different brands of scratch boxes.  This one is by far the best, and our cats use it the most.  Other double wide scratchers have come in sections and don't fit the box very well.  This is one piece of corrugated cardboard and is dense enough for our cats to really grab.  They also love the little cat nip toy included in the box.
My 3 fat & spoiled cats love this scratch box so much that they ripped it into shreds within a week.  Fortunately, the box can be turned over to use the other side for more scratching entertainment.
My cat loves the catnip that comes with Big Mama's Scratchy Box, and the enclosed catnip toy is brought immediately to his "cat cave."

Even though I have a large cat tree, this is one of my cats favorite scratching toys. If I don't have one he goes for the office chair.When I first put it down, he rolls around in the catnip and falls asleep. I don't refresh the catnip but I see him everyday, at least once, go over to the box to either scratch or lie on it. He especially likes to go over to it when we come home for a good scratch and stretch before greeting us. The doublewide box perfectly fits his 11 pound frame.Neither of my cats play with the tassels or the free cat toy but that's okay. I've purchased this several times (they usually last about three months or so) and he loves it. Once I tried a different brand, one from PetSmart, and he refused to use it. He'll use the Kong version but it's not as easy to flip the cardboard because it's more secured. Also, the Kong box warped.It's kind of tacky looking because it's purple, black and white with yellow tassels...theKONG Naturals Double Scratcher Cat Toyis a more neutral beige and my cat seems to like it just as well... in fact, he's sitting on it as type this review. Either one should work well for your cat if they like cardboard scratchers.My girl kitty doesn't usually scratch the box. She seems to prefer the upright posts on the cat tree but she'll come lie on it and chew on the edges.Every cat has their own preferences... this is a cheap potential solution to save the furniture.
Cats really like these scratch pads. This is the fiorst time I have used them & will be purchasing them again.

reviewText: My silly cat loves this so much that she sometimes sleeps on it!  She uses it to scratch and to play with.  The tassles on the sides are fun. too.  I got one of these for my brother's cats and they both loved it, also.  The added catnip makes it extra special.  Great value for the price.  Arrived quickly and well packaged with extra catnip, too!

Good scratcher for the money, these are double this in stores. Nice wide box perfect for smaller and larger cats. Mine don't really play with the free toy or even the attached strings but they scratch the box all the time. Have repurchased this box and will again.

I have several corrugated scratchers and sisal posts in my home.  My four cats use them all but they went absolutely wild for this one! Cute little catnip filled toy that came with it is also a hit!

My maine coon especially loves to attack and tear into it.

reviewText: My cats love this. and it keeps them from scratching my furniture. They also like the catnip that comes with it.

reviewText: This item is always a big hit in our household. Our cats love scratching on it. It's also nice and wide.

reviewText: Great wide body scratcher!!  The cats give it 5 stars!  My furniture is safe from their claws, they prefer the scratcher :-)

because they love it . . . my kittens pounce on the box, scratch it up, and drag it around the house.  I have another one without the tassels, but they attack and kill the tassels on this one then scratch it up.  Sure saves my furniture.

I don't know a cat yet who doesn't love these scratch pads.  The last a long time too.  I had bought 2 for Christmas presents for family members and both raved about how they needed it after I gave it to them.
Our cats love it. It is exceptionally good that it is reversible. I had one cat that was on it and using it before I fully opened it!
LARGE, WIDE SCRATCH BOX.  THIS IS A WELL MADE, STURDY BOX.  MY CATS LOVE IT AND IS DURABLE. I WOULD RECOMMEND IT.

We keep buying a steady supply of these guys - have quite a collection of the little 'cats' toys that come w because Lulu does NOT care for those but, as others have written, this scratchers is - excuse the pun - the CAT'S MEOW.  sturdy.  a fav so I guess it feels good, and a good territorialy 'this is ME & MINE' spot any place its plopped down.  When we do to Italy for the year (yup...Lulu comes too) in July I'm going to be SURE to take one w/ and find out quickly how to get restocked from Amazon.IT  A year would be just too long for one.
summary: Love it and so does Lulu

reviewText: The important thing about any scratcher is simply if the cats use it or not. Our new kittens took right to it.

I have had 4 cats now and they have all loved this scratcher more than any other. They love the catnip and the toy that come with it too. They eventually tear the tassels off, but those are more for the humans anyway, right? With two large cats, the double wide scratcher is the way to go!

I bought this scratching box on a daily deal for about $10.00.  I wanted to try one out for my two cats.  The box has a dense corrugated cardboard for them to scratch on and comes with a little bag of catnip to shake on to it.  My cats did love the catnip and did use it so for this I am glad.  My cats are both double pawed so it may be they are using it way more than twice the usual use.  Isee lots of shreds on it after a couple of weeks use so I will likely get a sisal type one in the future.  It may last several months for a single cat.
summary: Kitty Hoots Big Mama's Scratchy Box for Cats

reviewText: There was intense interest in the scratchy box even before I opened the package. Both cats were smelling it, and as soon as I put it on the floor one of them jumped on and started scratching.The freebies in this are fun, and generous. The extra cat toy filled with catnip has been traveling around the house as one or the other cat plays hockey with it. And they love the catnip - it seems to be more alluring than the other "maximum potency" catnip I had on hand.By the way - if you get three of these boxes and take the time to send in the UPCs, they will send you a "free supply" of the Zoom Around the Room catnip this comes with.There's been some thought put into this. I really appreciate that the scratch insert can be flipped over, so you get get double the usage out of it. Its also nice to have the outside box, because that way when you sprinkle catnip into the box, it does not end up on the floor. All the little torn-off cardboard pieces will stay in the box, too.It is also a stylin' box. The yellow tassles are cute (and the cats like them) and the black and white stripes on the side look good.This is a dramatic improvement over the cat scratch insert it replaced. We're only on our second day with it, but it appears to have beaten out theScratch Loungeas the best scratch box in the house. It is also less than half the price of the Scratch Lounge.

We have five cats - they love kitty scratchers! This one is big. Furthermore, it holds catnip better than some other scratchers. It is not as porous as other scratchers, although I do like the Hagen scratchers a little better for other reasons.Kitty Scratchers help save the furniture. I would never declaw a cat - they have a lot of feeling there, sensitive even.Anyway, we go through several scratchers per year - kitties love a new scratcher!

I have to buy one for my cats every few months as they go crazy for it. We call it their "magic carpet", as it has tussles on the end. Also comes with a cat toy, that we call "the green man". Our cats love it, so that is why it gets the 5 stars. Will be buying another one again when this wears out. It's cardboard, so I know it's not meant to last.. but everyday use by our cats is good enough for me.. means they aren't attacking the couch.
I think the name is hilarious.  My cats love this scratchy box and it has held up well.  Nice size.

Our kitties love this! We had one before and our bigger kitty loved it so much he destroyed it so we had to get another. I like this brand much better because it is flat so they can scratch all over no matter how they lay down. Also I like how this one is sitting in a shallow box so it catches the cat nip and scraps as they fall. The other brand just fell right through to the floor and made a huge mess so I never used the cat nip. Again great product. I will definitely buy more when this one is gone :D

There isn't anything amazing about this scratchy box, as the foundation is basically the same as every other scratchy box out there - thick corrogated cardboard, but the tassles on the corners make it fun and add an interesting "pawing" element and the catnip toy that comes with it is cute and was interesting to the cat.  The catnip bag that comes with the box is larger than what we have seen with the other boxes, so there is plenty to pour onto the box and refresh when needed.  We put a couple of these near the entrance/exit to the litter box, so that when the cat leaves the litter box, the corrogation catches some of the litter hich means less tracking in the room, and he can dance a little and scratch his paws on the way in and out.

There are 2 kinds of cats, vertical scratchers and horizontal scratchers.  From my observations (totally unscientific) the boys prefer vertical scratching and the girls horizontal.  My calico loves her scratchy box and it is worth every penny for keeping the carpeting from getting shredded.  I never had much luck with those ramp type scratchers either.  This comes with great catnip plus a funny looking stuffed toy so its a real bargain.  Dont forget when one side is kaput you can simply turn over the corrugated to a fresh new side.

I have been through MANY cat scratching items trying to get my 3 year old tuxedo kitten to use INSTEAD of my furniture.  When I got a brand new couch I decided I would not let him have his way with it, so I ordered 3 different kinds of scratch things for him.  The other two (same brand, but the ramp and a over the door hang) he could care less about, but this box? HE LOVES! Ran right to it and scratches on it every day.  He puts all his toys by it and even naps on it from time to time.  It was PREFECT!
This box is the most frequently used scratcher in my house. It's big enough for our 22lb "fat daddy" cat, and even the foster kittens like it.
Keeps sitting on it like its his bed, loves to play with it (although he is not very fond of the little toy or tassels) he loves the catnip and the ice is perfect!
My 2 cats love this box, it is attractive and fun to look at.  It was inexpensive and works great.  Thinking I may order another one.

...or so the cat thinks... He loves this scratching box, he scratches it, he sleeps on it, he makes it a haven when he plays, and panics when I move it to vacuum underneath. The little toy is a nice addition, the cat would play with it frantically until all the catnip smell goes out of it. I will definitely buy more, and would recommend it to anyone who values their furniture (the scratching box being a safer and more fun alternative!)

really what can you say about a scratch box, it is what it is, but I love that they make this particular one more fun with tassels, and nicer quality than most, My cats love to use it and sleep on it too.

I first found about this shampoo when I worked at the grooming department.  From the moment I opened the cap it smelled oh so good. I used it on my great dane and for a week he smelled like this shampoo.  His skin/coat were so shiny and soft.  I have yet to find anything that compares to it.  Only downfall is the price some stores want nearly $10 per bottle.  Best to buy online.
Gets our puppy clean and very nice smelling - not too sweet or flowery,  but rather oaty and natural.  Also got his muddy paws nice and clean too.
summary: Cleans well with nice oaty scent

reviewText: it came in the mail busted open. it did not smell good, yuck. no thanks, we will not be getting a replacement.
Is shampoo worked well in my stinky basset hounds and made in enjoyable for them to be in they house. Without this shampoo they would have been outside 24/7
summary: Made my stinky basset hounds smell good

reviewText: I like this shampoo, but it isn't very concentrated. I am used to a more concentrated product so it seems like I have to use a lot of it. But that's my only complaint - it leaves my dog's fur soft and clean, not irritated, and not smelly (either dog smell or perfume, don't love either)

My dog scratches. He has allergies and gets hot spots.  This product has oatmeal and baking soda in it which helps to immensely relieve his symptoms. Whenever I bath him I put him in the tub, fill it with some water and add the shampoo not only too him, but also to the water so he may soak in it. It clearly helps many of his symptoms and also keeps his coat which is very long and thick shiny and beautiful looking. The price of the shampoo is a great value especially in relation to the large size (18oz) of product that you receive. My dog has extremely sensitive skin and this is the only one I use.

My son's pug was always scratching, as many pugs do. I tried hot spot medications likeSulfodene First Aid Skin Medication for Dogs, 4oz.which worked beautifully for the sore, red spots, but didn't help with the all over itching she experienced. Rather than buying one of the more expensive shampoos people were recommending, I decided to try cheaper first ... and it worked! No more intense itching, her "prickly" fur is nice and soft, and she smells so nice. Give this one a try before spending more money. I don't think you will be sorry!

An okay product and reasonably priced! This product has a nice clean smell and lathers well. However..I have stepped away from using these type of 'commercial pet shampoo' products and I've adopted my own personal formulation! (My own formulation works a lot better for my dog's skin and coat concerns! )..I recommend that all pet (dog) owners learn about grooming their own dog or pet 'themselves'..it is their responsibility! A pets coat and skin health is absolutely necessary to good health! Believe it!!
summary: Pet Shampoo..  Fresh 'n Clean Oatmeal and Baking Soda!

reviewText: It smells good, lathers and seems to kill dog smell. I would order this product again. Great deal for the cost

Compare to other oatmeal shampoo, this product smells wonderful, but not over-powering. It lasted a few days on my highly active german shepherds. I will purchase this product again, in a larger size.
This shampoo smells good (pup disagrees) and leaves my dog feeling really soft until he decides to go play in the mud.
Best doggie shampoo ever! gentle on skin, but it truly does keep the dog stink away longer!! Definitely recommend purchasing!
summary: This truly keeps the stink away longer!

reviewText: my shih tzu pup loves bath time and this stuff smells great and is dilutable so i highly recommend it,so does the vets and dont forget the conditioner they are a great duo especially if u have a hairy dog like mine!
All the positive reviews are true!If you're on the fence about trying it, the dog shampoo really does smell better on the other side of the fence! :)
summary: The BEST puppy/dog shampoo EVER made!

reviewText: I have a shih tzu who is very sensitive to most shampoos and this leaves her coat nice and soft, not to mention soothes her skin, no redness or bumps. She gets rashes in the summer and this is great to use. I Love the conditioner that goes along with this. It is great for detangling knots. And not to forget it smells amazing.

I ordered this product and received the white bottle with the silver-colored cap -- it is the formula that does NOT contain aloe (which is what I wanted -- the green cap has aloe in it).I bought from the seller TOP DEALS.  They double plastic wrapped the bottle which was a good thing because at least 3 or 4 tablespoons of the product leaked out all over.  The manufacturer of this product needs to put a better inner seal on this bottle!The smell is very pleasant and lingers after a bath, unlike anything I've smelled before.This product does NOT specify that it can be diluted.  I suppose you could, but would probably keep it from cleaning as well.  Great shampoo.....I'll be buying the gallon size next time.UPDATE:  I bought a color applicator bottle from the beauty supply store and diluted the shampoo half and half with water since it takes a lot of spreading around to cover all of my Doberman.  The good smell did not linger like it did the first time, but I did only lather once.  Next time, I'm going to dilute 2/3 shampoo to 1/3 water and see if the smell is any better.  It is a really thick shampoo and takes a LOT to cover my Doberman when used straight out of the bottle.
summary: Leaked during shipping.  Great shampoo. Can not dilute.

reviewText: I have a 13 year old "pup" with gland problems, so she smells pretty bad at times. She is a beautiful English Cocker Spaniel, whose hair is thick as sheep.  I tried this Fresh N'Clean Shampoo this weekend and boy does it work.  Hair is silky and smell is gone, leaving a clean smelling fragrance.  I even think Sundae likes the aroma! Price is great for such a large bottle.  Try it, you won't be disappointed.Since, I am a Prime member, this came overnight for free (I know it's supposed to be 2 days, but often it comes in one)
I use this with the conditioner and my dog's coat is so soft and fresh-smelling.  The shampoo lathers up really well and smells great, I like that it has both baking soda and aloe in it.
Have washed my dog with this about three times..no pain from the soap in the eyes..no dry skin..and she smells good!

We have used this on our yellow lab since we got him - he is now about 8 months old. It works very well in that it does get all the dirt off of him and yet is gentle on his skin and fur - also gentle if it gets in his eyes at all. I would say that for a large dog (such as ours, being 80 pounds) you need to use a large amount of the product in order to fully clean your pet. IT has a fresh scent that is not too strong and the baking soda naturally removes any other odors that your pet might have.

First is great on the dog. I use it on her about once every 2 weeks. People remark how pretty her fur is. I have a huge walk in shower with a handheld attachment and I just shower the dog with me. To make sure I didn't use anything to hurt her eyes,etc. when showering together I used it too. My (color treated) hair was gorgeous afterwards - seriously. And I use shampoo that costs $35 a bottle. So now whenever I think I may have gotten into some allergic weed in the garden I use this because frou frou body washes ad shampoo won't clean off plant oils. Haven;t had a reaction all summer  - yet. I also bought this for my horses and works great too because it rinses clean unlike most horse shampoos. Use the conditioner on their tails. Don't even need the conditioner on the dog.

Our dog loves this shampoo or should I say, we love when it's used on him.  He smells fresh and his coat is soft, and he doesn't itch!  We bathe him about once every two to three weeks and sometimes more often if he goes for boarding.  We think the product for the price is true value.

I got this for my house cats & they just love it. It arrived quickly and packaged very well. The ball did not want to light up at first for some odd reason, but then after it was batted around for a few minutes it started working and hasn't missed a beat since. The only thing about it was that when I pulled the label off of it that was glued onto the top of the scratcher it left 2 clumps of clear glue on the scratch pad that I couldn't even pry off with a knife. So to keep the kitties from getting glue stuck in their pads & claws I had to pull the scratch pad out and flip it over. Typically you can use both sides of the pad before having to replace, but this will make this one pad last half as long.  But these things are awesome. This is the 2nd one I've purchased. Had to toss the 1st one after MANY YEARS of use due to a very elderly cat deciding she was unhappy with the younger kitties and doing her business on it non stop. Otherwise that one would still be going with no problems! I highly recommend these, as the kitties do love them even though they are just a very very simple toy.  They play with it for hours each day :o)

We bought one if these and our three cats were immediately drawn to it. It worked so well that we bought two more. The beauty if these is that, at least in our house, the cats scratch the cardboard in the middle rather than the furniture.
My cat loves this toy and plays with it every day.  the middle scratcher was the first thing he used when I brought him home.
This one with the LED lighted ball is extremely better than the one that doesn't light up, my cats LOVE this item

All three catws in the house love this toy, both for the scratcher portion and the flashy ball.  I have never seen one toy liked by all three before, so that's pretty impressive.  The ball is removable (if you have thumbs), and I have had to take it out a couple of nights when they were still playing at midnight.  Still on the first set of batteries, so I'd say they last a good amount of time.

As simple as this toy is, my cat loves it!I pretty much second the other reviewers. All play is allowed from lazy lying at the side of it and gently flipping the ball back and forth, to full force jumping and rolling and pouncing on it :)An excellent toy, very sturdy, nice solid quality. The other similar cat toys in the store seemed rather flimsy in material compared to the star chaser.

So my cat must be the party pooper because she has very little interest in this toy.  She will bat the ball a few times and walk away.  I wish she'd use the scratcher, but she prefers my furniture where she can stretch and shred simultaneously. (wah-wah)  As far as the price, well it appears that you could buy the base with a ping-pong ball for $10 and a separate starchaser lighted ball for $5.  Or you could buy this for $30.  Something just doesn't add up.

My cats love this toy!  They swat it, sit on it, lay on it, and chase the ball over and over.  The toy is well made, and looks to be durable.  The scratch pad is a big hit too, they love to scratch on it!  I decided to buy this because of the lighted ball, I thought it would be attractive to the cats.  I was right, they are fascinated with the lighted ball.  And I like that they scratch the pad & not my furniture.  Very good cat toy!  Cat owners, I highly recommend this toy.

My cat loves to play with it, however it came defective. The light on the ball works only sometimes. And when it does, my cat gets the best out of it. Other than that, it is very safe; no sharp edges, nothing loose, nothing to swallow. Plus the scratch pad is changeable.I contacted amazon for an exchange when I realized the light is not working properly. They send me a shipping label for the return but in the meantime my husband got rid of the packaging, so I decided to keep it. Customer service and the product is great. I am only giving it a four stars because of this defect. I would recommend it to my friends and family. Just make sure everything works before throwing out the package.
summary: My cat loves it but I wish the lights on the ball would work regularly.

reviewText: i have 3 cats and one of them claimed this toy as soon as i took it out of the box.  the other 2 don't play with it much but the one goes crazy with it and i love it.  is sturdy and i love the light up ball.  to me it's a must have for kitties.

My kitties are fascinated with this toy! The seller gives good service and is a small family owned business we should all support! Actually, my kitties' favorite toy is wadded up paper balls, go figure! Merry Paws to all!
Actually they fight over it.  One will sleep on the top so the other has to play with other toys but yes, it is WELL worth the money.

They really do. They love the lighted ball. They take turns playing with it. Both are fascinated with the scratching part of it. They don't claw at it just stick their claws into it without ripping chunks out. These are big cats and I'm happy that they are not making a mess of the scratching part. I've had it a couple of weeks and they play with it every day.If your cat likes balls flying in a circle they will love this toy.

Hi, My adult cats still play with this toy...easy to roll ball that blinks as it rolls in the dark/light. It is not as challenging now that they are bigger...but still they take turns playing with it. It is the only toy they can play with that gives this much enjoyment playing alone. Balls and foil balls are also fun to play on the floor...but get lost compared to this. They love to scratch the center and enjoy the catnip they include. They destroy the center cardboard. but you can buy more center cardboard pieces. I bought this toy for the Humane Society too, to keep those cats busy. There are few really good cat toys like this one. They love it. Happiness....

I cannot believe it!  My nearly eleven-year-0ld big black male cat is a couch potato.  I have to give him tiny portions of food to keep him from being overweight.  When I opened the box with the Bergan 70130 Starchaser Cat Toy and put it in the middle of the living room floor, Scottie came alive!  He jumped down from the couch and started swatting the starchaser ball so hard and fast!  He was a kitten again!  He LOVES the cardboard scratch post in the center (I had purchased extra ones) and when his sister kitty Lisa tried to play with the Starchaser, Scottie swatted her!  He sits on it, lies down along side of it and lazily pushes the ball to his liking.  I myself love the twinkling Starchaser ball (I ordered a second one, just in case).  I will probably purchase another of these to keep in storage just in case I step on it like I do most of my cats' toys.  But I have to say, this toy is SOLIDLY made.  You don't have to worry about it "falling apart" like another ball/track toy I ordered on Amazon, which the cats like but which is flimsy.  Order this, get extra scratch pads, get an extra ball, and watch your babies go nuts.  And if you have kittens (hopefully you are just fostering them and you didn't cause them to happen), they will go c-r-a-z-y!
summary: My old cat has come alive!

reviewText: My cat is pretty picky when it comes to what she will pay attention to and with this great toy she has chosen to only play with her old Startchaser that she has had since she was born. So the old one sits where plays with it daily and  the new one sits in the old spot and she will give it a passing glance when  walks by/ Go figure! We;ll keep it out for her and i think that at some point she;ll begin to use it. .

This concept of this toy is fine, but it arrived without a working Twinkle ball. I had already purchased an extra Twinkle ball on Amazon in order to have when the original burned out (I have had this ball before for a prior pet and that cat loved the ball). Since I had the extra ball on hand, I used it and was not very motivated to take time to return the entire toy. Instead, I decided to write the company in San Clemente, CA that sold this product through Amazon. I did NOT even receive a response from them.  I only asked for a working Twinkle ball.  I will make sure not to buy anything from this company again. It would have only taken this pet store a minute to write to me and say "Sorry". Perhaps they thought I was trying to get something for nothing, but thanks to Amazon, there is a record of all your purchases, which proves what and when you have made purchases.

I have 4 of these and they are very reliable and effective.  The cover is just so-so.  All of our guys (ferals) pull the cover off and go for the warmth!  When used in a house, make sure they have enough room to get OFF of the pad so they don't OVER heat.The good part is that I'm going on three years for a couple of these.  The hard plastic is a plus because anything soft would be torn up with this brood.I kind of wish there was some sort of power light or thermostat light to let you know if it's operating without actually going out there.

I have a large number of these heated mats for outdoor cats.  I use them in a variety of shelters for feral cats.  Aside from one incident (which was my fault), I have never had a problem with any of them.  My ferals seem to be quite comfortable and warm during the winter.These have a wire-encased cord for safety, and the fleece cover is washable.  The price on the one I just purchased was exceptional - the same item in PetSmart costs almost $10 more, if you can find it on sale, and up to $30 more for the regular price.

I have many of these heating pads for my 6 feral cats that live outside, just kept adding more over time because the cats like them so much. I have some up on shelves and some on the ground in an area that is covered by a second floor deck so it stays mostly dry. The cats use them all winter long. The fleece covers get dirty but are easy to wash. I wish they would make the covers with a snap on the corner where the electric cord has to feed through so they'd be easier to remove without unplugging and pulling cord out. I cut the elastic on one corner and fasten it back together with a large safety pin, works okay.These last a long time, I've had them for years and only one burned out so far. Overall they seem pretty indestructible.

I have a few outdoor cats that I care for. The winters in Houston aren't crazy cold but we do get down in the 30s.  I have built 2 cat houses for the outdoor kitties and use these heated pads in them. The cats spend a lot of time on the heat pads and they seem durable.  My first heat pad is now in its 3rd winter of use and going strong, I recently ordered a second one for the second house and additional cats.  I'm happy with these purchases.

This is great for our front porch in the colder months. We have one semi-feral who barely comes in the house so I like knowing she can hang out on this if/when she decides to come onto the porch. The other cats gravitate to it as well, whenever they are on the porch. We are on our second fleece cover for it, but that is an inexpensive replacement ($12). This will be the second year we've used this with good results on a covered porch.

I have purchased half a dozen different types of heated pet beds for both the outdoor cat at my Mom's house and my own indoor cats.  This one fits into the bottom of a wooden box that I built for outdoor use (a covered porch).  It is perfect to keep the cat warm as I also lined the sides of the box with foam/fleece.

K&H Outdoor Heated Kitty Pad provides a warm place for my outdoor/garage kitty. I put it into a box the same length and width of the Heated Pad, placed another slightly larger box upside down over the first box then cut a hole in the side of the two boxes just big enough for kitty to squeeze through. A warm blanket was wrapped around the boxes, leaving an opening at the hole. Kitty doesn't want to come out on the real cold days. The hard plastic heated pad seems very weather proof and the wire wrapped cord makes it chew proof. We started using it about one month ago and leave it on 24/7 during the very cold weather. We liked it so much we purchased a larger one for our labrador retriever.
in winter the cats adore curling up on these especially in morning and late afternoon when they can no longer soak up the sun - a must - would like to get 4 more for two more rooms.
summary: our indoor cats love these on cold winter days and nights

reviewText: In July 2011, a feral mom brought her three babies to our porch. (How did she know we'd take care of them?)  We did TNR on the babies and mom, then turned them loose.  We bought a small doghouse at the Farmers Co-op, closed off the big door, and made two small doors -- one at either end.  (The cats wouldn't go in unless there were two options for escape, I guess.)  We lined the walls with heat-reflecting mylar.  We put it on the screen porch and the kittens would go in and cuddle as the days got colder.  Then, as temps got lower, we started to worry that they might not survive, and we wondered if they'd be OK the next morning, so we tossed and turned every night.  Then we saw this pad on Amazon and ordered it in Sept. 2011.  DH cut a small hole in one of the floor slats of the doghouse for the cord, and we plugged it in.  The babies loved it.  By this time, their mom had cut them loose and she only came by to eat and then leave.  Knowing the babies were warm, we were able to sleep through the night, pretty confident they'd be OK as far as weather was concerned.In Nov. 2011, with the threat of coyotes and evil raccoons in the area, we brought the babies indoors to join our existing four (too many cats!)  We put the doghouse and kitty pad in the garage for storage.  This summer, Mom Darth started to stick around the screen porch and visit with her kids through the French door window.  (Abandon three babies, and then return to get all friendly a year later -- sounds like a "Lifetime" movie!)  We set up the doghouse with the kitty pad a couple weeks ago, and Darth is loving her warm place.  She's truly feral with no chance of taming, so we're happy she has a place where she knows she can be warm and safe.  We don't worry and there's a lot to be said for peace of mind.We also bought one of the thermostat cubes (on at 35 degrees) to use in conjunction with the pad, but the cube doesn't work.  We just plug in the pad when it gets down to about 40 degrees, and generally don't use it 24/7 -- just when it's sure to be cold.  And we've looked at outlets that can be activated via remote control; that might be a better option than do the plug and un-plug on cold days/nights.Will be ordering another pad for backup in case this stops working.  But so far it's been excellent.
summary: Now we can sleep at night

reviewText: It does heat up nice but lacks some softness. The base is hard plastic. The outside cats enjoy the warmth.
summary: Not as soft as I had hoped

reviewText: We bought this heated pad for a feral cat who adopted us and is living in our barn here in northern Vermont.  During cold weather the cat spends most of her time on top of this pad in her small shelter and seems to really enjoy it.  It is well constructed and is pretty tough so I think it will last for a long time.  We have no problem leaving it plugged in 24/7 - it never gets over heated.It has a good power cord wrapped in steel wire to prevent chewing damage (we have goats) and the flat case is hard and tough and cleans easily. The fleece cover makes it comfortable for the cat.I noticed some people have disapprovingly written that it barely gets warm to the touch but they don't realize that's the way it's supposed to work.  The cat's own body heat in conjunction with the pad heat will keep the cat very comfortably warm in very cold weather. Consider that modern electric blankets don't feel warm to the touch until you actually get into bed - same thing for the cat.UPDATE 4/28/13: Well, Robespierre decided that although her goat buddies and barn were nice, the house would be nicer.  For many days she would politely sit at the back door and just stare at it. We finally broke down and took her to the vet and she was thoroughly examined/tested/dosed and now she is a very friendly and happy housecat. The Kitty Pad now awaits its next visitor.
Cats love this heated pad. It lulls them to sleep and keeps them happy.  Mine is on my front porch to encourage my kitty to enjoy that spot through the winter.
summary: Well...I'm taking the cat's word on this.

reviewText: I've had this thing plugged in 24/7 for over 3 years and have had no issues with it.  It gets down to the mid-teens in the winter, so it's been a petsaver.  It's in a small dog house that's used as a cat house, usually with 2 cats using it.  It works great with either this pet bed:B001B4ZAHWor this one:B00063KG3WThese beds fit perfectly in the house.  Although the pad is much smaller than these beds, it creates enough heat for one cat, and when there are 2 or 3 cats in there, they of course create more heat when they're cuddled up.Highly recommended!
summary: Works Great and Keeps Them Warm

reviewText: I bought 3 of these for my outdoor cats last year and I put each pad in a cardboard box (double-boxed) on the back porch out of the rain and snow.  I was amazed at how fast the cats figured it out.  The heating pads were plugged into an outdoor strip plug, on an extension cord, and kept the kitties warm all winter with no problems whatsoever.  I put them away when it warmed up in the spring and just got them back out last week.  We have a new semi-feral mom-plus-two-kittens who must stay outside until I can find her and the kittens a permanent home so I just ordered an additional pad for them (they all snuggle together at night).  I wish I could bring 'em in but I can't -- I already have 3 indoor cats.  Eight cats!  It's the most we've ever had and we're desperate to find homes for them...anyone need a good cat out there?  I'll drive them to you, if you're not too far from Ohio...March 2011 -- The pads are all still working great and the cats have used them for 3 winters now.  I keep a couple of pads in boxes in the garage for when it rains and snows and they take refuge in the garage (I open it up a little at the bottom when the weather is really bad).  I can't imagine making these cats live outside in Ohio winters without the electric pads.  Oh, and by the way, the two kittens grew up and found nice homes of their own but their mother is still with us.  I placed one of the other cats too.  We have a new outdoor cat and a new indoor kitten (so many homeless cats out there! -- they show up starving, hungry for the cat food on the back porch).  It seems that I end up keeping the cats that are elderly and/or in failing health and only placing the young healthy ones.  Why oh why was I born such a bleeding heart?!!!  Oh well --  So it goes...
summary: Meow!  My kitties are so happy!

reviewText: The pad has served for a winter here in frigid Chicagoland.  The fleece cover looks a little the worse for wear, but otherwise I'm sure it will be OK for next year after a good hose down.
summary: Good for our feral/stray cats in winter.

reviewText: Great warming outdoor pad for any outside animals you would like to keep warm. The fleece cover is soft and the cord is well protected. I placed it on top of a cushion I had already had in an outdoor pet house. My feral cat loves it in this frigid weather!

Outdoor feral loves it. He's on it right now and really appreciates the warmth over a cold cement porch. I have a feral that comes to eat and he hangs around for quite a long time so I wanted something that he could be comfortable with while waiting. He sleeps for hours on this thing now. The instructions were great and I'm glad other reviewers said not to expect it to be like a human heat pad. Unlike some people I could feel the warmth as soon as I plugged it in. Not hot, but I could certainly feel it working and now that I know it's only supposed to warm kitty to 104 I knew what to expect. He really loves it.

This has been (literally) a lifesaver for my outdoor feral farm cats.  I have it in their shelter, and all four of them huddle up on it during the cold nights.  They love it, and I love it.It came with a fabric cover, and I don't use that part since it is outside.I have had this plugged in continuously since November with no problems.
summary: Your cat wants you to buy this.

reviewText: We've had a horrible winter. I think these pads, of which I placed into a large cedar dog house, saved the lives of numerous feral cats. There is a colony that lives on my property. They were kept warm and happy despite the howling wind and mountains of snow.

I purchased a few of these and they're great while they last, but aren't very reliable.  One broke after about 14 months, got so hot that our cats wouldn't sleep on it (it has to be pretty hot for a cat not to touch it), and I was afraid it'd burn the house down.  The other just stopped heating up at all after 6 months or so.  I have other heating elements that are soft, designed to fit inside a cat bed, and those are still working a few years later.  I like these hard beds for outside use, for the constant stream of stray cats that show up at our property.  Many cats have overwintered in our barn with these beds and they're great while they last, but are expensive for something that's going to break after one winter.
Works just wonderfully!!Keeps warm in our VERY cold conditions for the feral fur babies out in the garage!! :)
summary: K&H 3093 Extreme Weather Kitty Pad with Fleece Cover

reviewText: his has saved my ferel cats lives. They live outdoors and it gets bitter cold out there. They have a house we built and I put this inside and they stay warm and cozy all winter long.T

This is SO worth the money in every single way. It works and it just barely fits in the kitty tube. Do not put anything on it even though you're extremely tempted to put a blanket or something on it. I know. lol. This will not help since it warms up when the cat lays on it. I've had it all winter and so far, no problems at all. I couldn't imagine having an outdoor cat without this wonderful product.

Second one I bought since another stray came along. Now, both strays have their own folding chair and kitty pad on our porch for warmth. They refuse to use any cat houses so far... So for now, at least I know these keep them warm during the cold nights.

I have purchased quite a few of these mats in the past.  I recently purchased 2 more as backups just in case.  However the last 2 that I purchased had a chirping/buzzing sound to it.  The sound was coming from the pad and even though the sound was very quiet it was still very annoying.  I contacted K&H manufacturer and they replied very quickly stating that the buzzing is a defect that there is either dust in the thermostat or a frequency issue where it is plugged in.  They assured me that it is still safe to use and after 2 weeks or so of continuous use that the sound should go away.  I haven't tested them out yet but am confident the problem will correct itself.  I also have these mats for my indoor cats and they love them and I've had no problems with them.
summary: A real life saver for winter feral cats

reviewText: I recently added another  outdoor heated pad to my collection on my porch for the outdoor cats I take care of.  While Ohio did not get the worst of it - it still got colder than I've ever experienced since taking on TNR for local abandoned cats.  The lowest we dealt with since 2006 was 2 degrees.  This past week we experienced temps below zero -- -5 on my thermometer with wind chills in the minus 20 -30 category.  All my outdoor cats survived.  They stick like glue to these pads.  I do have some shelters available to them but they prefer the heated pads.

Several years ago, a cat came out of the cornfield into my yard while I was mowing the grass.  I thought it was the neighbors, but turns out it was truly a feral cat, i.e. fearful of contact with humans, other animals, etc.I started feeding the darn thing and once you do that, you have a cat, like it or not.  Later, I contacted a local feral cat program and had this cat neutered.  Trapping and transporting him to the vet was a challenge, but for the small fee, I did not want this cat wandering the neighborhood (semi-rural area) and creating litters of kittens.  Lastly, while I couldn't take him to the vet (he is a true feral cat), I took pictures a very swollen paw on my Ipad and showed them to the vet who prescribed antibiotics to minimize the possibility of infection.Then winter came and I purchased the kitty camper (through Amazon) which is a small dome like tent for cats with a built-in heating pad to get him through the winter.Then the neighbor cat caught on about the food and the heated kitty camper so I purchased this item as a second heating pad and placed it in a old dog house I had for my Shih Tzu.  Now the 2 cats don't have to argue over who gets the heating pad and this pad was more economical the buying another kitty camper.  I like both, but the neighbor's cat is just an occasional visitor and if he does visit he has a warm place to stay.I purchased this heating pad because it was manufactured by the same company that makes the kitty camper and I already knew that was a good product.I am not a cat person so I will never have a cat inside my house.  But feral cats help keep the mice, moles, voles, etc. under control so having a few neighborhood cats is a good idea.P.S.  I also bought a heated water dish to provide water for the cats.  Also purchased through Amazon.
summary: The local feral cat loves it...

reviewText: The winter here in NYC was brutal. My boyfriend lives in Queens and it broke my heart to see the feral and abandoned cats trying to get by in the cold, snow and wind. I bought two KittyTubes (sold here on Amazon) and also built several shelters made of plastic storage bins, lined with styrofoam and stuffed with straw (also bought on Amazon). I bought one heating pad and put it inside one of the KittyTubes, under the straw. The cord did stick out through the hole, which I accepted. After I saved enough I bought the other KittyTube and got a second heating pad which I placed inside. These two heating pads made it through one of the coldest and snowiest winters in NYC history. I am now TNR'ing the cats. By the way, the winter here still isn't going away - even though it's April, the temperatures reached in the low 30s overnight last night. In the coldest months of the winter I left the heating pads on continuously for months, but now that it's April, I just turn them on at night if it's a cold night. If you have homeless cats in your area, please TNR them and consider giving them a little shelter and chance at warmth and comfort.
summary: Works great for feral cats in cold NYC winters

reviewText: Ok, I know I will sound like I pamper my cat, but I have a 13 year old cat and it gets cold in my basement so I worry.  My cat loves this thing.  She practically lived on this this winter especially with the polar vortex 3 peat that happened this winter.  Smartest cat purchase this year.

I bought this item for an adult cat and kitten who showed up in the neighborhood. They were too wild to touch, but it was getting cold outside. My neighbor and I went together to try to care for them, and she was skeptical that they would go inside the shelter that I made with the heated pad.It took them about half a second to start going in it and staying in it. I guess it's a basic instinct for an animal to want to be warm. They loved it!It was sturdy, the cord was well-wrapped to protect from chewing (not that cats would chew itk but I guess other animals might try).It got plenty warm, plenty fast. The fleece pad was nice and fit well.I thought that it was very ecomonical (Petsmart wanted twice as much for the exact same one by the same manufacturer).What I didn't know was that they recommend that the mat only take up to half the space of the crate/shelter that you're putting it in, I guess so that the animal has the option NOT to lie on the heated mat. I got the bigger one because I didn't know this, and the smaller one would;ve fit their recomendation, but I suspect that the cats liked the bigger one just fine.The good news is that we were then able to catch them, tame them, and place them in homes.Win-win situation all around.I'll keep the mat for another day & be ready for the next lost furry friend.
summary: Does everything it says it will

reviewText: I have 2 feral cats that winter over in my shed. The oldest would not have made it through the winter without this product. Works very well. Warms enough to keep cats comfortable but does not get hot.Both cats easily fit on this pad.

I have some outdoor cats and have some shelters that they stay in. I now have 4 of these, one for each shelter and they love them. I have hay on top of them and they kept my kitties nice and toasty when the weather reached -9 a few weeks ago. Along with a dish I bought that keeps their water from freezing, they are set for the winter.

Our elderly kitty uses a K&H heated bed indoors but she really likes spending time outdoors, hanging out on our covered patio in all but the foulest weather (she's gone deaf so thunder no longer an issue!) We got this so she'd have a warm spot, and she likes it just as well as her other one. It's definitely better suited for outdoor wear. The fleece cover is easily removable from the hard plastic bed for washing purposes, and the shielded cord and bed seem pretty bulletproof. Heats just as effectively as their other models.

A few years ago, a stray female cat delivered a litter in our back yard.  After learning about the local animal control policy on unclaimed cats - and after many unsuccessful attempts to find them a home - we decided to maintain and care for the cats ourselves.  During the winter, our three cats spend their cold nights (and days) in a modular-style shelter we created which includes three of these heated Kitty Pads.  We are now well into our third winter with our "outside cats," and I can honestly say that I'm not sure our trio would have survived without the warmth provided by these heated pads - especially at night.  We have had one pad fail during the warranty period, but it was quickly replaced by the manufacturer.  Overall, I give this product my highest recommendation - BUY IT.  For outside cats in winter, it can make all the difference.  (BTW:  I didn't see them on the page, but the approximate dimensions for this pad are 12.5" x 18.5" with 5' "wired" cord.)
summary: This Product Can Make All The Difference

reviewText: the product is a must for outdoor ferals if you have a heart ,it really does work just right for the kittys ,i know they appreciate it .no problems, working good..  thanks k&h

My mom lives on a farm, and stray cats are prone to show up around her house (especially on cold winter nights...looking all sad). Heck, even her neighbors are bad to leave their cats out in atrocious weather. Mom already has cats of her own, who do not appreciate unauthorized visitors in the house, mind you, so she can't exactly bring the neighbor's cat inside every time it shows up. We hooked up one of these in a box on her front porch, and it's enough to at least knock the chill out. It doesn't get very hot to the touch. The neighbor's cat in particular is a big fan.The fleece cover seems fairly worthless to me (it's just a placemat, basically, and it gets askew very easily). But you can also pop it under a thin towel/blanket/pillow that's easy to toss in the wash in case of accidents. It's always best to bring animals inside during foul weather, but if you have critters that are stuck outdoors...this is really nice, especially if you can put it in a box/house/covered porch/etc. that is protected from wind.I will say that I've never left it out and directly exposed to the elements, so I don't know how it would do. Honestly, I'd be nervous to leave it out in rain or snow, just because it's electrical, even if the company says it's OK. But that's just me.

Our kitty has always been outdoors. In the winter, I worry about her when it gets cold. This year I decided to stop the worry and make a decision on something better than adding more towels and blankets (which I read isn't the way to keep them warm).  Her Kitty Pad is perfect. It fit into her box which was PERFECT...though if her box was smaller I would have had to get a larger box. The Kitty Pad is thick and not flexible. It is more like a mat. This is not an issue if you have space. It is cushioned and soft. It feels warm but when you lay your hand on it you can feel that it is much warmer. The Extreme Weather Kitty Pad arrived just in time for the week of below 0 temperatures we just had in Maryland. The pad lays flat in her box and I have some blankets around the edges to hold in the heat. I put our outdoor thermometer in her box and it kept the temperature in the 60's inside the box when it was 0 outside. Now that it's in the 30's, her box is in the 70's or 80's when she is in it. Kitty is happy and so am I.  I am so pleased with the Extreme Weather Kitty Pad. If you are thinking about keeping a kitty warm, this is perfect. This size is only large enough for one cat. It might fit two if they really love each other. Yes, I would recommend this and I would purchase it again.

I like the heated pad but my cat was totally afraid of it, so I am returning it.  I would give it 5 stars if she would use it.  It gave off a little constant warmth and is supposed to warm up more when the cat lays on it, so I really do not know how warm it gets because she would not get near it.  I am sorry to have to return it.
summary: Works nice, but my cat was afraid of it!!

reviewText: The fleece cover gets dirty and basically is more effort than it's worth, but the plastic pad works perfectly for the house shy stray that adopted us.  Doesn't really get hot to the touch, more of a gentle warm.
summary: Been working at least three winters no problems.

reviewText: I bought this to use outside but for inside a cat house.  The pad is very noisy and doesn't seem to get very warm.  The cats never came near it.

I bought this through Amazon because of the perfect size. It fits in my outside cats igloo. He normally comes into the house sometime in December and stays through February. This year he chose to stay outside until the temperatures plummeted to the single digits. I think his gripe was about the walk from the igloo to the water/food bowls.

This is my second one of these and Ive had the first one for over two years now. They are made very good and work great for outdoors. They are a little hard because there plastic but you can cover them with a blanket and the heat comes right through.They have to be made this way so no moisture will get in. Love love these
summary: K&H 3093 Extreme Weather Kitty Pad with Fleece Cover

reviewText: We put this in our kitty igloo outside for our feral cat we rescued.  He loves it.  It keeps him warm and toasty.  Probably the only feral cat around with a heated igloo!

I have 2 outside cats, they are not feral but they were born outside and do not like to be cooped up anywhere.  When I bring the male back from the vets he almost has a nervous breakdown.  They like to be free and so do I and it works out.  I have a protected structure for them with cat beds.  Lately the weather has been in the 0-20F range and that has bothered me.
