The cats seem to cope but I wanted something more.  I stumbled upon these mats.  I got 2 and put one under each cat bed.  As one reviewer stated they didn't seem to be doing anything, but they are not cold.  I think if they were too hot it would not be good.  The cats seem to like the added heat and I find them using the cat beds in the mornings after it has been 8F out so I feel they are working.  Bottom line is that any extra heat is good and I am satisfied that these mats provide it.
summary: I wish I'd known about these earlier.

reviewText: The pad is on front porch and does not seem to heat.  My cat chooses the old pad I bought several years ago and still  has a little warmth to it.  I did not contact the mfgrs. but should I guess.

These are excellent!  At the end of the summer, we completed the construction of two hardwood deck boxes (like you keep patio cushions in) only we added a hole on one end for cat access.  We care for a feral colony that sleeps on our porch and wanted to be able to protect them from the elements and predators.  As winter is upon us, these were the perfect addition!  The very first night the cats crept into the boxes and stayed all night.  We placed ours on top of their blankets and scrunched the blankets up around the edges so they could snuggle down on the heater but it wouldn't be covered.  The only thing that covers the heating pads are the covers that came with them.  We use them with plain outdoor extension cords and they plug into a remote controlled outdoor power strip.  We turn them off and on as needed.

I bought this for my cat, who tends to lay on my laptop to keep warm.  I felt this would be a good alternate.  Unforuntily she did not take to the kitty pad.  It's true 102 degrees sounds hot, but in reality it's only luke warm.  I think my overheated laptop is warmer.  That may have been the reason she didn't use it.  As much as I tried to get her to lay on it, she did not take to it, maybe b/c I'm using it indoors.  The cord protector, I guess I didn't read it well enough, my cat does indeed chew on cords, but the metal wire almost seemed useless, she still would attempt to chew it and it made it look really ugly.  With all the reviews I don't disagree this is a good product, but I would suggest for outdoor use only.  My cat is 10 #'s and this size seemed slightly small as well.  Would've got a larger one.

reviewerName: Toonces Driving Cat "Toonces the Driving Cat"
reviewText: These heaters are great. I use them for outdoor shelters and feeding stations for feral cats that I take care of. Yes they are made of hard plastic. This is what makes them durable and impervious to most weather conditions. The fleece cover provides a bit of softness. My ferals don't hesitate to sit on these for warmth. We've had a brutal winter in PA and I'm certain that these heaters helped them to make it through alive. I have some for my indoor cats as well and they also enjoy them.note* I purchased these through the warehouse deals section of amazon. Perfect condition. No complaints.

I have been using the "live" mats for about six months. After my cats learned the hard way about touching them, I decided to see if a dummy mat would work. In short, yes it does. My cats will not touch the dummy mats and avoid them at all costs. The only drawback for me is that I thought a dummy mat would look like the real thing with wires in the mat but minus the box attached to it. After all, the picture shows a mat that looks like the real thing. However, it is really only a piece of clear plastic. But again, it does the job. Just a heads up for people who might care that it does not look exactly like the live mats.
summary: Dummy mats work very well with my cats

reviewText: But then again I already knew that....review is based on cats only. If we don't have anything against the bedroom door at night one of our little cuties will meow all night long. It works for a while but you need a real one to remind them that it actually can shock. So while it can work as a placebo, sadly the cats learn its the mat that shocks them and as they are curious they will test it out :). We have to switch between the real and dummy.
summary: The cats are smarter than me

reviewText: I have just had the mat for a week or so, and so far I think is working. I wish it was a bit longer, because one of my cats manages to sit next to it.
This did not work for our cat he just was able to step on it between the electrode lines or just jump over it.nso we never used this dummy mat.

reviewerName: R. Wristen "The Party Doc VJ and Karaoke"
reviewText: My scat mat is great but I had an area I wanted the mat but not the shock value:  my bathroom.  You definitely feel a TINGLE when I step on these mats.  So I bought the dummy mat.  The dog stays out of my bathroom now and I'm not shocked either.  Take that as you will.
heated up quickly, met the needs of a decent warming bed for camping with dog.  when home my cat loves to cuddle up on itwell made, not cheap feeling

I was so excited to find this heater after we had moved to a new place with cold tile floors, so I ordered one to help keep my dog warm at night.  My dog hates this thing.  It works great and it stays warm until you put pressure on it and then it heats up quickly, but the plastic has a strange smell and made a noise when she stepped on it the first time and she has refused to step on her bed since I put it under the liner.  This product worked great and did exactly what the ad said, it fit under the padding of the medium Integrity Worldwide Orthopedic memory foam bolster bed just fine, but my dog wanted nothing to do with it.

We have tried different things to keep our pup warm but this bedwarmer keeps her from shivering.  She was a little bugger and chewed on it some but we taped it and covered it with a pillowcase and she is pretty happy to not mess with it now.  We took it out during the summer of course, and returned it to her bed recently and when we can't find her on a chilly morning that is exactly where she is. We are pretty happy we decided to buy this for her.
summary: Our pup loves her bed warmer

reviewText: These are great - we have two cats and we live in the mountains. It's cold in the house at night and we were worried about them. We bought two for their beds in our bedroom and just came back for two more for the living room (we couldn't get them out of the bedroom!). The beds work as advertised.

This review is about the K & H 11x24-inch size pad.  Not nearly as good as the competition!  Petmate's 10 x 20-inch heating pad/bed warmer may be a few inches smaller, but it has at least twice the warmth as this K & H pad!  (Petmate is 30 watts, K & H is 13 watts.)  You get what you pay for; the K & H pad is a little cheaper, but the Petmate pad is better.  We agree with the reviewer that said:  There is not anything wrong with this pad; it just will forever live in the shadow of the Petmate branded one we have.  This K & H pad is better than nothing, but not much.  I called K & H customer service, thinking something was wrong with this unit.  I was treated rudely and with an attitude that tells me I'm probably not the first one to call and express concern at the lack of heat.  We also tried another K & H heated bed, the Lectro-soft, with the same poor heating result.  We would not buy one of their products again.

I bought this for those freezing night times when I'm sleeping with the window open and using the ceiling fan.  I thought my dog would be chilly and hoped that this insert would keep her warm and toasty.  I've only used it for a couple of weeks, but I find it to be a lot warmer than I expected.  I was hoping that it would be "warm" not "hot".  Even though it is under a dog mattress, and has several inches of padding on top, it still seems to be hotter than I would want.  My dog is ok with it for a time, but eventually I find her out of bed sleeping on the floor.  I plan to keep it and use it when it's really cold, but beware, it's quite a bit hotter than a "medium" on a human heating pad.
These are perfect for low wattage low heat in a protected thin fleece cover.  But I was disappointed that they only last about a year.  I do not like disposable products and will not buy again.

I have two large dog beds that have a heavy canvas cover. I ordered a K&H; pet bed warmer & a PetSafe warmer at the same time and put one of each in the pet beds and put the beds next to each other.The K&H; pet bed warmer did a better job of warming through the canvas cover & 1 of my dogs spent quite a bit of time sleeping on that bed (sprawled). The bed with the PetSafe warmer got sporadic use & I had to really lean into the bed to feel the PetSafe's warmth.If my dog hadn't chewed up the cord, I would have returned the PetSafe & gotten another K&H.; I ended up purchasing another K&H;.
summary: Nice Pet Bed Warmer.  Warms Nicely  through Heavy Canvas Dog Bed.

reviewText: LOVES this!  She will now go to her crate happily at night without any persuasion.  One caveat, though- when newly opened, young dogs may want to chew on it.  I had to put it under the pad and blankets etc... to prevent chewing on the plastic cover.  Once the 'new smell' went away, I was able to reduce the amount of protection.

This heating pad could get a bit warmer but it's nice that I don't have to worry about it getting too hot.  The great thing about the 6 / 20 is that it fits perfectly under the shelf liner in my cat condos.
For some reason none of my cats; inside or outside will not lay on whatever I have this under.  I think maybe it is too warm for smaller animals.
for 2 Small Chih/MinPin mix, but the old cat won't get off it. So it's hers.. 23/7.  It works great, that is all I care.  And the cat gives it a paws up.

Although we live in Southern California where it doesn't usually get too cold at night, this winter has been unseasonably cold, so I bought this bed warmer to use in my Rottweiler's house. He has torn up countless comfy Costco beds, but fortunately he is treating his house and its bedding with respect, finally. (Maybe because he's warm enough now?) I wrapped the warmer in an old nylon bed cover and it keeps him warm and cozy all the time. I should probably use a timer so I don't have to keep plugging/unplugging it.
The size is perfect, but it doesn't get as warm as I expected, I was expecting electric blanket warmth, but I guess the wattage is a little low for that.

I USE THE PET BED WARMERS IN MY DOG HOUSE, IN MY KENNEL IN ALL THE IGLOOS THERE & MY NEW PUPPY AREAS. THEY PROVIDE JUST THE RIGHT AMOUNT OF WARMTH FOR THE DOGS & PUPPIES ON THOSE COOL NIGHTS & MORNINGS. I HAVE SHORTHAIR DACHSHUNDS THAT NEED THE EXTRA WARMTH SO IT IS GREAT FOR THEM. THEY ARE PLACED UNDER ONE QUILT OR BED & THEN ANOTHER QUILT IS IS PLACED OVER THE QUILT OR BED SO THAT THE DACHSHUDS CAN BURROW UNDER & STAY WARM. THANK YOU FOR MAKING THIS WONDERFUL PRODUCT!

I have two cats with Chronic Renal Failure, one of those with Anemia, and an older cat with arthritis.  They're always looking for nice warm spots and my house just isn't positioned correctly for sun warmth.  I keep one plugged in on the couch, with a blanket under it and one on top (protect what's under it because the pad will get quite warm) and put something on top because it's hard vinyl, polar fleece is ideal - just make sure it's fire retardant.My cats prefer around three layers of a blanket on top because it is really hard and uncomfortable otherwise.The heating pad is true to its description.  It stays 15 degrees greater than room temp with nothing on it (I measured using a infrared thermometer:KINTREX IRT0421 Non-Contact Infrared Thermometer with Laser Targeting) then when the cat is on it, within minutes it goes up to 104F (cat body temperature).Because it can get quite warm they tend to lay on it for a while, then move around and go somewhere else.  Fortunately they're safe enough to keep plugged in all the time.If you don't want something this warm, I suggest getting a normal human heating pad, use a timer to turn it off for 30 minutes every 1.5-1.75 hours, and keep it on low.  I use this one:Sunbeam Health at Home Easy To Use King Size Moist/Dry Heating Pad, Blue.  It stays a little cooler than the K&H; (about 85 F), and is safe to keep on as long as you use a timer to shut it off for a while every few hours (it has an automatic off feature after two hours).
summary: Safe for 24/7 indoor use, cats love it, and easy to clean.

reviewText: My cat/s enjoy lounging on this warming pad. My only wish is that it had a power surger plug.

My dogs and cats love these too!  I don't know if people realize it, or not, but the floor where most pets spend most of their time, is colder than anywhere else.  I put these bed warmers in their beds, with a small throw or comforter on top for softness, they just love it!  :))  The seller was great too!  The seller got these to me quickly!  Thank you!

I'll go ahead and use these, but next time I'll get heating pads (which is basically what they are anyway) except that then I could set the temperature myself. Supposedly these automatically set to different temperatures according to a cat's presence but now that I've seen them I believe that's improbable. They are just stiff plastic sleeves with the kind of wiring inside that electric blankets have. Heating pads would be cheaper, better quality and I think, safer.

I have a number of these warmers in beds for my elderly dog with arthritis.  I find her laying in the bed during the day for the heat to help her muscles and joints and then on cold nights for the warmth.  Low heat guards against any kind of burn.
summary: Works great for my dog with arthritis

reviewText: This worked well for my dalmation who would curl up into a tennis ball if he could when it gets cold....You may want a thicker bed cover (you gotta use it under a dover or in a bed) than some cheapie dog beds provide as it can get pretty warm and my dog bailed on it until I put it in a thicker, fake sheepskin dog bed cover.  If I still had cats I bet I would never get them off this as they LOVE heat.

Initially bought this for my dog when we initially moved - he had to stay in the garage when we were staying in my in-law's house for a couple of weeks until we got our own place. He was pretty arthritic and I wanted him to have someplace warm to snuggle on. Then, when we got our own place, I put this under one of his two dog beds. He stayed primarily on the dog bed with this warmer on under it. It does not get hot like a "regular" human heating pad, but gets warm like a lower wattage incandescent light. It seemed to help our dog's arthritis a little bit. We used it for two years before he died. We then gave it to a neighbor who has an arthritic dog. Last I knew it was still working - for over three years total. If I do get another dog, I will get this for under his/her bed again.

I love this heater for my cats heated beds. In was moving and accidentally folded it in a suitcase. It got discolored and started making a buzzing noise. Had to replace it with this and working great.
summary: Good product but don't fold it.

reviewerName: God is a refuge for us (Psalms 62:8)
reviewText: In 2008, I purchased a K&H; bed that came with a medium size warmer, and it still works well. It's thin and long (5.5" by 20"). The bed fabric wore out. I used the warmer in a new bed.In 2009, I purchased 2 K&H; beds that came with small size warmers. They lasted about 3 years, and then they didn't get warm anymore, so I trashed them.In 2013, I purchased a large size K&H; warmer from an eBay seller, but it was dead-on-arrival.The medium size warmer got the most use (daily for 5 months out of the year); the small size warmers were used less.  I'm not impressed with these warmers, and I don't plan to buy them in the future. They are made in China.WHAT'S INSIDE THE K&H; WARMER?Ever wonder? Well I opened one of the small warmers before I threw it away.* the outside is tan plastic* followed by a thin layer of foil on the inside* followed by a thin layer of a gauze-like material* followed by stiff woven fabric (loose/open weaves)* attached to the fabric with thread are plastic coated electrical wires that go back and forthIS IT ACTIVATED/TURNED-ON WHEN THE PET LIES ON TOP OF THE BED?I have heard some people say "yes", but the answer is "no". It does not say this in the instructions (not the paper instructions, not on the box, and not on the instructions printed on the outside of the warmer itself). And, as you can tell from the insides described above, there is nothing in the warmer that "turns on" based on the weight of an animal. The key is to place the warmer under the first layer of fabric in the pet's bed.If the warmer is left outside of a pet bed, then it doesn't feel warm at all. When it is placed inside a pet bed (beneath the first layer), then the heat from the warmer slowly builds-up under the fabric of the bed, and the heat radiates through the bed to the pet.Although I've heard that you shouldn't use human heating pads for dogs, I purchasedSunbeam 732-500 King Size Heating Pad with UltraHeatTechnology, and it works great on the low setting. It does not have an auto-off feature. I have it plugged into a timer. It is 12" by 24" (just a little larger than the large K&H; warmer), and it only cost me 20 bucks. Based on about 40 reviews for the Sunbeam, people are using it for their dogs and cats with no problem.
summary: had 4 of these and don't plan to buy them again

reviewText: I have an old dog with arthritis. I bought this pad, put it on the floor, and he sleeps on it. It is a padded bed, a few inches thick, with a removable fleece cover. My dog likes to sleep on the floor,so this is on the floor by my bed. It works well, he uses it s more limber when he wakes-up. I am buying a second one for all day use in the den. I recommend this product, it does what it says it will do. It is sturdy and safe.m
summary: A Good Bed For My Old Brittany

reviewText: Our little doxie loves this.  She was whining to get into our bed at night instead of staying in her crate when the weather started to get cold so we tried this heating pad.  Works great!!!!!

This product warms quickly. However, the issue I had was finding a blanket that was still comfy to lay on and where the heat could still be felt.  This is difficult..therefore, it's now stored in the closet.
This is the perfect size for our cat.  He loves to lay on it (even on what I would consider warm days).  So much pleasure for so little money - well worth it.

I tried a couple K&H products that i didn't like before getting this one. I fostered a 6 oz.,6 week old min pin and the other products never got warm unless a 10 lb animal was on them. This worked well with a towel over it for a couple of weeks, and now is in a dog bed. I had to find a dog bed with a separate insert (Slumberpet dimple nylon plush bed, xs)that I could open up and add a zipper to. I put this inside with a little batting over it and it stays a nice temperature. this takes up half the bed, so the now 2 lb dog can lay on or off of the heated area.
summary: Does what it is supposed to

reviewText: My pup figured out right away that this little heat pad was oh so comfy.  It's not hot.  It's just right, as described.  I suppose it mimics momma yorkie's warm belly.  I put it in his bed and placed it under a towel and the heat comes through nicely.  When he outgrows his puppy bed I will look for beds that have a zip off cover or pouch for pads like this to slip into.  He does chew on the cord, just as he chews on every other cord = puppy.  So I've ordered the Grannick's Bitter Apple chew deterrent to spray on this cord, ....and every other cord in the house.

I was thrilled when my older and very particular cat took to this right away.  I knew she would never accept a new bed, she's just that bad.  But with this, it slides underneath her favorite blanket.  When you first plug it in, don't be concerned if it is not as warm as you think it should be.  It gets there and when combined with their natural warmth, you will find quite a toasty spot left behind when they get up.  It is small, but they tell you the measurements in the description.  My husband plugged it in to a timer and we are good to go.*update*  2 months in and still going strong.  Her new favorite spot.  I think she would only like it more if we put it on our bed and added a remote control holder for her.  ;-)*Update* Well it's over 1 year later and the pad is still working great.  We put it away in the summer and when we brought it out again it worked perfectly.  The cat we bought it for still loves it.

This thing is wonderful. My cat loves it.  He doesn't sleep anywhere else.  I just placed it on a pillow and put a folded throw over it and he is in heaven.The reason for the 4 star rating is that the cord zaps me if I step on it without shoes on.  It hasn't seemed to bother my pets, but I would not recommend it it you have a baby crawling around on the floor.
summary: cat loves it, cord could be a problem

reviewText: My friend took care of my dog for a weekend and had a pressure activated heating pad that my dog loved, so I immediately ordered this one. I plugged in, threw a blanked over it and put him on it...warm within a few minutes. I read some reviews of people complaining that they plugged it in and it never got hot....it is pressure activated! It doesn't get warm until pressure has been applied for 20 seconds or so. Hopefully this will last, my old dog is so happy right now!Update: Still working great, dog still loves it! I made a zippered cover out of fleece, but I also put a blanket over it as it does get really warm. Sometimes the little dog gets too hot and gets out of the bed. I would always recommend to put it in an area where your pet can get away from it if they get too hot. Do not use it in their crate if they are confined unless they have room to move away from it. That is where maybe using one much smaller than the crate would work.My cat has also discovered the heating pad. I'll take the dog outside and come back to find the cat curled up in the dogs bed. Too funny. Love this product!

I have bought 3 of these in the past, although they were much smaller, but by the same company.  The previous ones cracked after a couple years.  These appear to be a bit more flexible.The cats immediately loved both mats, which are inserted into fleece inserts I bought for the other warmers. They are on them constantly, summer and winter.

I purchased this item for my cat hoping to give him some extra warmth in my cold apartment. He loves it! I stick it under a thin fleece blanket and leave it on for several hours at a time. It only warms up when my cat sits on it and it gets a little warmer than if he were sitting on my lap.  It is the perfect way for my cat to stay warm and cozy while freeing up my lap.  I love it!

I first purchased one in Nov 2012. I thought it wasn't working because it didn't feel very warm to me, but I noticed that the cats were nudging each other off that single small warmer (which I placed under a towel). So I bought another. Then another, and still another; I splurged on the last two purchases and got the covers, too. I put one at the foot of my bed and - BONUS - it keeps MY feet warm! I've given two as gifts to friends who have since made their own multiple purchases for their cats & dogs. All our pets give these 5 stars.
summary: Cats love it, dogs love it.

reviewText: My dog ate thru this one from the top. Scary. He hated it apparently. And its not large. At all.
summary: Yeah, this isn't large. At all.

reviewText: These are awesome! We have a 4 year old Rhodesian (70lbs) with some type of early onset arthritis. She lays in the sun all summer long and does pretty well with getting up from laying, but she had a hard time last winter when it was cold. We have had these on her two beds for the last couple of months and she is doing just as well as she did throughout the summer. The heat is great for her body, and she loves them!
excellent for toy dogs, I have a 5 lb mini doxie that is cold, I put this in her tunnel bad and she is very happy and toasty. a great buy

I like the pad, it's large and easy to put into a dog bed or under some blankets - and very thin. However, it gets extremely hot. More so than a heating pad that is meant for a dog should get. You should only be able to feel the heat if you put the pad in a blanket for a while and then feel the blanket - you should only feel a slight warmth. I am still going to keep it - I just put it under more blankets than planned...

Our outdoor cat loves this bed warmer.  I wrapped it in a piece of polar fleece and tucked it into her $10 cat bed on the shelf of our outdoor (mostly unheated) shed, and ever since she then, she LOVES the shed.  Before, she would only go in there when she absolutely had to, for food and water.  Now she spends all night and a good part of the day in there as well, especially when it's below freezing.  The only complaint I have about this product is that the cord is pretty short (about 3ft), so make sure you have an extension cord on hand.  As for longevity, we've only been using it for about a month so I can't comment on that yet (will update).
summary: great cat bed warmer, great price

reviewText: these are great if you have healthy or compromised cats or even dogs--I have cats and they absolutely love these--they are really great for a cat with kidney issues as they are usually cold.  I work with rescues and the cats run for these as they can sense heat.  Highly recommend.
My dogs did not like the pad, so I am using it for the barn cats douring worst cold spells. I made a cover out of an old towel rather than buy an expensive bed.

I purchased this because my nearly 18 year old cat constantly wants to be on me, to the point of crying non-stop when I am busy.  I thought he might just want a nice warm spot. I bought this and put it under a fleece pet blanket on the day bed and when I get home after work, that is where I will find him, but once I am home he has to be on me.  I suppose he just needs the extra comfort in his old age.  I like this because it is not too hot so it is safe to keep on the day bed and is safe for Meischa.  And most importantly he really seems to like it.  I chose this over the heated beds because they are pricey and I already had plenty of beds.  I did try putting it under the beds but the filling was just too thick the warmth did not get through.  The blanket works perfect, and it is very much washable.
summary: Better Than A Pricey Pet Bed.

reviewText: good for the price got this for our puppy to keep her warm in the cold NY winters. dont use it much now that he has grown and has her full husky fur

My cats are heat freaks and this provides just enough that it isn't dangerous.  Don't use a human type of heating pad as it gets too warm.  This is just right.  I had to buy a 2nd as one wasn't enough.  My cats don't like to sleep together.

I'm so glad I followed the instructions and placed this under my pet's lightweight bed, plugged it in, and waited for 2 hours to check the temperature BEFORE letting my pet use it. It was SHOCKINGLY HOT! This thing couldn't have been but a couple of degrees from melting and my pet's bed was so hot, it was giving off a smell, which I'm sure was melting. I immediately boxed this up for return (as soon as it cooled off.) Instead, I went to the local pet store and got my dog double memory foam bedding to help her keep warm from below. She's not complaining anymore and my dog's not being cooked by this faulty "warmer", so it's all good now.
summary: Near meltdown in one use. TOO HOT!

reviewText: Both of our cats love this! This is also a problem, they fight over it. We may have to buy another one if they can't learn to share.

I inherited my Mother's ancient min pin when she died and he is tiny and always cold. He shivers in a heat wave. I put a flannel pillow case over it but either it gets to hot to quickly ( no way to regulate temp) or he does not like the slippery, crinkly plastic that it is made of. It came on time but you get what you paid for. Guess the old boy will have to rough it.
summary: My dog does not like it

reviewText: 24 hours after plugging in, with no cover, I can barely feel a hint of warmth against the bare palm of my hand.  This is a complete waste of money.  It wouldn't warm up a gold fish, never mind a mammal, and if you had it inside the cover of a pet bed it might as well not be there at all.  The only plus is that it certainly isn't a fire hazard!  Sending it back...

Used it all winter in my garage for a stray cat we had and it worked great.  He couldn't come into the house because he didn't do well with my other cats.  This along with an insulated crate helped keep him warm and healthy while reducing the risk of a house fire for my peace of mind.

I have 2 cats that like to sleep in the garage.  They really, really like this warmer, so I keep it plugged in all year round without worrying that it is going to get too hot.  It stays a constant warm temperature while they are laying on it, and shuts off when they get up.  It isn't "hot" so you can't put under the bed, you have to put it on the bed.  I made a little cover for it out of fleece and put it on top of the bed and it works perfectly.
summary: When they lay down it turns on...when they get up it turns off

reviewText: I love this little bed warmer.  I do wish it was a bit larger for our larger dog, but this did the trick.  We put it in her dog bed so it is warm when she lays on it.  This only gets warm while they are laying on them, so it will not heat an area or keep a dog house/bed warm.  It also does not get too warm.  Feels warm like someone was sitting there before you, not hot like a heating pad.  Our dog is an indoor dog, but she likes to be outside during the day, if it's nice, so in the winter I will put this her dog bed on the porch so she can lounge and watch the day go by.The warmer itself feels sturdy and is covered in a thick plastic. We've had ours for a year and it doesn't show any wear.  I do put this inside the cover to her dog bed and zip it up so that the cord is coming out of the end of the dog bed. One dog bed is foam and polyester filling, the other is all foam. It seems to work fine in both beds.
summary: A cozy little spot for your pet

reviewText: Already have some of these and one got the cord chewed - so I had to get another one.  These are great for keeping your dogs and cats on their beds and off your furniture.  Love these warmers!  I put a towel on top of it and insert it in their beds, even though they are supposed to be at a constant temp that is ok for your pet, I felt it might be a little warm so I added the towel on top.
summary: K and H pet bed warmer

reviewText: This is absolutely perfect for what I intended it for...my husband :).  He has cancer and has lost a lot of weight and gets cold easily.  Instead of turning up the heat I have put this under a blanket on the couch.  He then sits or lays on it and covers with another blanket and he stays warm.  We have three dachshunds and it is so cute when all three of them try their best to cuddle up next to him on this warm mat.  It's holding up well and the warmth is just right.I'll probably order another one to put on our dogs bed so the dogs can lie on it rather than all of them on the couch.

honestly is only slightly more warm than ambient temperature if it is being used inside. wasn't a hit. i could see this being more of a winner if used in a garage, attic, or other place where the temperature is less than room. otherwise not a big difference maker.

we have had our 6x20 for four years. we use it 6 months of the year. it's plugged in from fall to spring. (not to be used unsupervised for puppies or chewers as the cord is not chew proof.) when a pet is laying on it it can get pretty warm so we use it under a sherpa crate pad. when we used it in a crate we put it to one side of the crate so they have to option of laying on it or not. i also use aluminum tape to tape it down to the crate pan. since we are past crate training, we have it in a chair with their sherpa crate pad on top of it. the dogs are always racing for who can get to the chair first after they come back in (sub freezing temps here), so i am here to get another one!

I like this thing.  I put it under a blanket on our couch, and my two pooches love sitting on it on cool days (they are Heat Babies who like to sleep under the covers all summer long).  It warms up about like an electric blanket does...to be honest, my husband and I occasionally sit on that part of the couch as well (:  We put it away for the summer...I guess we'll find out eventually how long it will continue to heat up (based on others' reviews).  As of now, 5 stars.  If it craps out after one winter, I'll revisit this rating then.
older dog, with hip problems, finds this useful.We put it on her bed, under a cover. Doesn'thave adjustable heat, but seems to justget "warm enough"  rated 5 claws up.
We bought this as a replacement for one that died.  It is perfect and I love the fact that it can always be replaced!It keeps Lucy's bed tasty and warm!  She loves it!

I have had these in the past for previous spoiled cats and promoted then to neighbors. Barney is a large cat with a Large belly some he can't curl like a normal cat. I had noticed that he would sleep in a chair with his belly towards the back of the chair at times and not in his bed so I figured cold belly. So I placed this below the beds top surface and placed the Barn with some petting since he does not like being carried. Shortly purring started and continued until his head dropped in sleep. Yes, he is spoiled but he is my buddy.

I do cat rescue so I have dealt with old cats, young cats, tiny kittens and mom's and kittens...they alll LOVE having one of these in their beds. They don't get any warmer than 101 degrees, the normal temperature of a cat or dog so it's like snuggling with a buddy.They're great if you are fostering a mom and kittens. Mama can leave the box and kittens stay the right temperature. Getting away from the warmth of mama cat kills a lot of kittens, they can't maintain their body temperature when they are tiny. this solves that problem.I have had these plugged in for over 5 years, seven days a week, 24 hrs a day and they are as good as new. Also use very little electricity.Dogs love them just as much. They come in three sizes, this is the middle size and most useful except for big dogs.
summary: Best Product made to make your cat happy

reviewText: My cats just love these. l put a small hole in there beds to pass the cord through. l've had a few of these for years and they are still working.

I put this heating pad under our dog's bed, which is on a ceramic tile floor over a concrete slab.  So as not to heat up the concrete slab under the tile, I put down a piece of cardboard and over that placed a double sheet of heavy duty aluminum foil.  The heating pad rests between the cardboard/aluminum foil and the dog bed.  The purpose of the aluminum foil is to reflect the radiant heat from the heating pad upward into the bed, rather than downward to heat the concrete slab.  It works and more heat is radiated into the bed than otherwise might occur if the heating pad was left on the ceramic tile floor.We also use the 7 watt heating pad by the same manufacturer for our cats without the use of the aluminum foil, since their beds are already plush and we put the heating pad on top of their beds with a utility towel folded over three times to regulate the heat output to a comfortable level.
summary: Good bed warmer for our Golden Retriever.

reviewText: Well, pretty much all I can say is my 6 lb dog loves it. She sleeps on top of it or gets under it or gets beside it. They need to make a nice cover for it though.

My husband keeps our home cool year round. I use heating pads & blankets. To be humane I decided my cat needed a way to stay warm too. So far this pet bed warmer is working perfectly.Update- I ordered a second pet bed warmer for the other end of the house. It is a rectanguler one fom Petmate. The electrical cord is much more flexible making it easier to hide from cats who like to chew as well as easier for the owner to position in the cat bed. For this reason the Petmate scored five stars from me while this one gets four stars. Both pet bed warmers keep my cat happy. Update- 7/13- The Petmate one quit after 8 months while this little K & H pet warmer is working well 24/7.

My dogs appear to be pleased with this item (they can't talk...but they LOOK happy!).  We turn the heat down at night and the bedroom can get pretty cold, so I had been worried about the dogs after seeing them both curled up into tight little balls at night.  Now that they have these, they appear much warmer and don't sleep so curled up anymore.  They are safe if you forget to unplug them in the morning.  I just put them under their beds (they have washable pads that don't unzip - you could also put them in between if you do have a removable cover).  Definitely try them out if you are worried about your pets being cold.
summary: If my dogs could talk, they would say Thanks Mom!

reviewText: I have a very geriatric dog (Saxon) and an elderly but spry dog (Duke).  I purchased this unit hoping it would help Saxon be more comfortable.  He's been having a hard time getting up from his bed without limping.  The dogs were not too keen on having some weird plastic thing under their bed covering and would not, at first, use it.  We put the Saxon's 'baby blanket' over the bed and that solved the issue.  Both dogs immediately took to the bed as the thin blanket gave a bit more padding between the heating pad and the woofs' butts - it doesn't affect the heating pad at all.  We can't get them off the bed now and will have to buy a second one.  Saxon is on his bed all night (rather than moving throughout the house).  He does get up and shift in the middle of the night, but stays on his orthopedic bed.  If (as another reader says) this only lasts a year, I'd be happy to purchase another one.  WORTH EVERY PENNY.  Saxon is not as limpy-gimpy in the morning.  Can't rave enough about this product!  Very very happy!
Bought this for our dog's bed because he would lay on the cat beds.  Works great and the cats love it.  LOL, the dog still lays on the cat beds!!!!
Lasted an entire winter season so far with no overheating or cracking

I ordered two of these little heaters for my cats and they love them !They do seem to get quite warm at times and the cats have to get out of the bed to cool off, so I find it's best to fold a baby blanket and place it in the bed over the pad to limit amount of direct exposure. I don't have to guess where the little furballs are located on a cold winter's day. I know that I'll find them in their beds all cozy and toasty.
summary: Great for those pampered little pals in your life

reviewText: Purchased this to insert in my Bengal's pillow.  It works well and keeps him warm without getting too hot.  Can hardly get him out of his bed now!

We have an older can that was spending too much time in her cubby bed and we noticed that she would be a bit stiff sometimes when walking around. We bought this heater and set up a "day bed" for her by a sunny window. The heater stays on all the time under her padded bed and she now absolutely loves it. Great product.

I have a pug, and this breed sheds A LOT! Sometimes you can end up as furry as a dog after playing with him.I read some of the other reviews and I have to admit I was skeptical about it, I was scared it would end up being just another treat.Regardless of what I read I decided to give it a chance.First of all let me inform you that I already give my pug fatty acids and omega-6 with his food in the form of an oil; so this was only to complement it.Since I started giving it to him -about 2 or 3 weeks ago- I don't see him shed AT ALL anymore. The oil worked good, but with this little treats the shedding has stopped completely! (NO JOKE) I rarely see hairs now... and I wear black 98% of the time!I do recommend it! It might work for you also!!! I'm a happy pug owner now! I can pet him any time now!

THIS IS A GREAT PRODUCT FOR DOGS WHO SHED.. MY DOOGIE EATS THEM AND HIS IS COAT IS BEAUTIFUL ... AND NO SHEDDING. HE IS A GERMAN & PITBULL MIX AND I HAVENT SEEN HIM SHED SINCE HE BEEN  ON THE CHEWABLE!! BUY IT BELEIVE ME IT WORKS!!

My newest puppy has had a problem with rash and shedding and these have really helped a lot. She finds them tasty and is happy to eat one a day along with her morning meal. The skin rash has quieted down quite a bit and the associated shedding has almost disappeared. Great solution for my problem, I would suggest giving them a try if your doggy is having similar problems.
summary: Tasty and they helped with the shedding/skin condition

reviewText: These treats seem to work alright for my golden retriever.  I have noticed a small reduction in shedding over the past few weeks since starting them.  However, the smoke flavored chews smell TERRIBLE!  We don't like touching them because of the smell so we shake them out of the bag into her bowl.  I'm hoping Nutri-Vet makes another flavor or we won't be buying again.

My dog loved these treats.  Honestly, I don't know if I noticed a difference in how frequently she sheds, though, because we bathe her once a week and keep our house very clean.  So it is hard to notice when, if at all, she sheds.  We purchased this product primarily because we LOVE Nutri-Vet pet treats/supplements, and are thoroughly satisfied with the quality, price, and Made in the USA aspect of the products.
Vet recommended fish oil for her dry skin because I have to wash her weekly due to my allergies.  She seems to not itch as much.

I bought this product with a hope that my dog's shedding would be reduced and I can't tell a difference.  I have a boxer and he is a pretty terrible shedder and that hasn't changed.  I can't say it won't work for other dogs, but it didn't work for mine.  However, he does seem to like eating them so that is a positive note.

I've tried other sprays that claimed to remove the odor of cat pee but failed to do so, thus my expectations were low when I tried "Get Serious":  amazingly it worked - it has completely neutralized the odor of a very large "accident" my cat had in a living room chair.

I have used many, many products that are supposed to get the cat & dog pee out of carpet & NONE OF THEM WORKED.  This stuff DOES WORK!!!  All you have to do is follow the instructions on the bottle.  If you follow the directions to a "T" it will work.  I have even used this stuff in the washer when I find a blanket or something that has gotten peed on by my cat & when you pull it out of the washer it smells great.  You must try this stuff if any of your animals ever have accidents.

This is the best stain remover I have used- we have seven cats, a dog, a small child and cream colored carpet in the bedrooms.The whole reason I even tried this stuff was to remove several pet stains (some up to two years old) that occured when a few of our cats had a potty party in the spare room, and then when we got our newest kitten, he apparently smelled what the old stain remover had left behind and decided to make his mark too.I have gotten all but two stains out of our poor carpet and I've not yet given up- I haven't tried heating the solution, which will be my next move (btw, these stains are red/pink).So, I give it two thumbs up on the stain removal area, appearance-wise and and 1.5 thumbs up on the smell elimination (humans can't smell it anymore but I'm questioning whether or not pets can- it could just be our situation, since the carpet is really old and the padding may be worthless, but our cats have re-marked the area).This stuff works great on many different surfaces too, I've used it on carpet, bedspreads, and my child's stuffed animals- just be sure to follow the directions, and be prepared to have to "rinse and repeat" (so to speak) with stubborn stains. Just give it a try, and when you see what is on the other side of the white towel you used to blot the area with, I bet you'll become a big fan too!

You cannot beat this pet stain (vomit, poop, pee, blood) remover.  I tried a bunch of products before but when my dying Lab left behind 20+ vomit spots on my Berber carpet I had to do something.  After losing my beloved pet I had no energy to clean the carpet for like a month or so.  Finally when I decided to clean the carpet Get Serious is the one I tried and all spots including some plant pot stains came out no problemo.Then I brought in a Doberman rescue to my home.  He decided the corner of my oak table was a good place to relieve himself over & over again.  I cleaned the carpet w/Get Serious and lightly misted the table with it, too.  Wala, no more peeing on my table!I highly recommend this product to anyone.  Now I am married w/two dogs & a cat.  Any type of stain, including my husband spilling orange soda by the couch & it not getting cleaned it for months (he never told me he spilled), come out.What do you have to lose?  The company guarantees their product!

With the arrival of a new Catahoula Leopard dog puppy last December, I knew my carpeting was in trouble.  Being a dog lover/rescuer, I had about 15 other pet stain removal products in my arsenal of dog supplies.  Since none of them got all of the stain out, I figured what the heck - lets try one more.  Boy am I glad I did!  This one actually works!!!.  Just spray a little on the spot, scrub it in (I use a battery operated scrubber), and dab it up with paper towels.  It has gotten up the entire stain, 95% of the time on the first try and does not discolor the carpeting.  It even cleaned up stains left-over from other products.  And it does equally as well on vomit, pee, and poop.  Highly recommend this product.  (And, in an emergency, Get Serious is also available at PetSmart.)

My 15 year old Lab/Shepherd mix has suddenly started examining every treat or piece of food for disguised medication. I purchased this pill gun so I would be able to give her necessary medication. Once I figured out how to easily get her jaw open, and how to properly load the pill gun, it works perfectly!! The key to loading the pill gun is to push the plunger all the way in - the tip will actually be outside of the pill gun. Place the pill at the tip of the plunger, pull the plunger in and slide the pill into the cross-cut area at the tip of the "barrel" of the pill gun. You can put in a surprisingly large pill because of the cross-cut tip. Just keep the plunger close to where the pill sits and once you get the pill gun to the back of the dogs (or cats) throat, push the plunger. It may take a few attempts, but once you get it figured out it's very easy.

Works great. We have an older dog that learned to lock jaw and wont hardly open with hurting her or I end up bleeding. this stops that. she now gets her meds. in fact she dislikes it enough she has been easier to give pills too most days now.

I couldn't get my cat to take his pill. It was so big and the taste was just awful. So, I broke down and purchased a pet pill gun to shove the pill down his little throat. Worked like a charm!! No more fighting and no more scratches for this pet owner!
Really just a poorly made syringe. DO NOT get for cats and it is better suited for small horses. ,

I have a 70 lb German Shephard who must take pills daily. This is the best invention since sliced bread. Wrapping the pills in food lasted about two days before she started eating around the pills. Shoving them down her throat with my hand works but it is a sloppy chore with her wiggling her head the entire time. With the pill gun, I just load it, stick in in the side of her mouth and push. She does not even move. I give her a treat after, and life is good.
summary: The only way to give a dog a pill.

reviewText: I have a large Maine-Coone mix cat who is very friendly, but loathes any form of restraint and/or pilling. This pill gun save my hands from daily mauling :) Enough said.

My dog's flea pills from the vet were too large to fit in the gun so had to split pill in half. I haven't tried with small pills but should work but not for large pills but if u are ok with spliting pill in half and using gun then its a good product.

I have a cat who requires daily medication in pill form.  I have tried to give her pills hidden in treats -- she just eats the treat around the pill.  Plus, some medicines should not be taken with food.  I've tried forcing pills in the side of her mouth -- she just uses her tongue to push them back out.  It was a daily struggle that was unpleasant for both the cat and me.  Then I found this pill dispenser.  I wish I had found this simple device months ago.The dispenser looks like a long syringe.  It has crossed slits in its tip that open when you push the plunger.  All you do is pull the plunger back a bit, load a pill into the tip, and move the plunger so it rests just behind the pill.  If you have dog, there is a diagram on the packaging that shows how to hold the dog's head to open its mouth.  I find it is easier to hold my cat's head from behind and gently ease the syringe into the side of her mouth.  Just maneuver the tip of the syringe so it is just behind the hump of your pet's tongue and press the plunger.  It will gently push the pill into your pet's mouth, and they will swallow it.  I was originally worried about choking by pills getting into my cat's airway, but the pill is released so gently that this does not seem to be an issue.  My cat readily swallows the pill once it is released into her mouth.If you need to give pills to your pet, this is a very simple and humane way to do it.  It will eliminate the struggles and frustration for both you and your pet.  I recommend it highly.
summary: if you have to give pills to your pet, you need this

reviewText: This item is really nice, and is pretty good quality. I have a Chihuahua, and we took him on only one walk so far around the block, which amounts to about 1/2 mile or so. He was a little hesitant to go in at first, but we walked him on the leash first and pushed the empty stroller for about 600 feet, where he got tired or lazy, and he asked to hop in. He loved it! he kept his two front legs perched on the front bar so he could look out unobstructed by the mesh in front. He is about 10 pounds, and there is plenty of room for him, maybe even enough for another one just like him.I am very pleased with this purchase, which was considerably cheaper on Amazon than in the local pet stores.

This pet stroller is just what it clams to be in the title,  everything about it is simple and straight forward.  I've not used it outside yet but my little 3 legged Maltese finds it comfortable.  I appreciate all the netting, the dog will see better and will keep cooler.  The height of the handle is perfect  (I'm 5'7" tall) and I can bush without having to bend over.  Summer walks will now include my little pooch who just can't handle the heat nor the distances we travel.

After reading many reviews for lots of different models, I choose to get this stroller.  Most of the complaints I heard about other strollers was that the handles were way too short and issues with the wheels.  This one works great!  I'm 5'9 and have no problem walking normal (not hunched over) and I don't kick the wheels, the stride on this stroller is perfect.  It was super easy to assemble (just putting on the wheels and convenient water bottle tray).  The folding down convenience makes this a pleasure to transport.  Nice turning radius and love overhead shade.  I have an 8lb dog and he fits just right along with a blanket on cool days.If you want to take your beloved companion with you on a shopping spree or just a stroll through the park, this is the stroller for you.  Very well built and so convenient from point A to B.
My only ding would be after a while the rear wheels come off every once in a while and have to be put back on. Otherwise a top notch product.
summary: Rear wheels shaky but great otherwise

reviewText: Bought this so my orthopedically challenged dog could join her brothers and us on our walks (we're not joggers or runners any more) along quiet country roads. Assembly was a snap -- simple, quick, though tires do require inflation so you can't exactly use the stroller right out of the box. It's astonishingly well designed and constructed -- so well, I think this thing may well outlive us all, LOL.The handle's easily adjustable, even on the move. There's a capacious holder for water bottles or cell phones ... in our case, both a slender water bottle and a cell phone, plus a carry-bag in the back. The big wheels make traversing uneven ground a snap. In short: we like it, the dogs like it, and the price (on Amazon) is surely right.It's long but conveniently narrow, which means it doesn't hog much garage space, at least width-wise. The front wheel is fixed, so this rig is probably not meant for city sidewalks where quick pivoting may be required. But for leisurely strolls or brisk walks over varied terrain, it's pretty darn close to ideal. Good job, Kyjen!

I needed something wheeled to take my cat to the vet since I knew I couldn't carry his normal carrier a mile there and back.  This was the only stroller with large wheels that seemed an appropriate size for my cat that I could find.  The city streets and sidewalks around here are such that a small wheeled stroller could easily have issues.The stroller was easy to put together.  It  fine on uneven city sidewalks & streets, up and down curbs, on uneven brick sidewalks - I'm sure it could conquer the cobblestone ones as well  -  even without enough air in the tires (I did need  to get someone to help me put the air in - probably because of my bike pump not the stroller). The cat adjusted quickly and was chillin' inside the stroller at the vet despite  having no time to adjust to the carrier before the vet appointment. (the catnip spray might have helped...)  There was room for his food bowl and he could turn around and stretch out a little but it was not too big either. He's about 13 pounds.  The front wheel doesn't turn and the stroller is big enough that maneuvering in small spaces is a bit tricky. Still, overall it wasn't too hard to maneuver around obstacles. It wasn't difficult to put on the hood/sun shade but I did have difficulty removing it. It was difficult to press hard enough on the release points to get it to release.My cat seemed to like it as well once he adjusted (I really like the front shade which you can put up or down as needed)  - so I'm excited that I might be able to go on walks with him to give him a bit more stimulation than he can otherwise get as an indoor cat in a high rise building.Edit:  While this use is perhaps a bit beyond what the stroller was designed for,  I do wish it was easier to remove the compartment from the stroller  and that there was some internal support (and a handle) so it could be used independently. I want to take my cat to someone who is only accessible by bus/train + a walk. Since open strollers aren't allowed on public transportation where I live - it be nice to be able to run to the train/bus, remove the carrier/fold the stroller get on the bus, get off the bus and then open stroller, replace carrier and jog to appointment. I just feel a little sad having to use the cat's crate for this trip when he enjoys being in this stroller so much more. :) And the really nice places to walk a cat are at least a bus ride away...  Perhaps this could be incorporated into Doggie Jogger II or the Doggie Jogger's future companion stroller the Cat Jogger. ;)EDIT DEC 2012:  I just noticed this review is now showing up under the Outward Hound Walk N Roll Top Flap Stroller.  This stroller is NOT the same item as the Doggie Jogger that I reviewed. (Notable differences are Doggie Jogger only has 3 wheels which are larger.) My review DOES NOT APPLY to the top flap stroller.

I have a 9 pound toy poodle, 11 years old. He can't handle the miles of city walking we do every weekend, but I know he loves to tag along. This stroller is the perfect solution. I'm 5'4" and my husband is 6'3" and it's comfortable for both of us to push around. The wheels were a little stiff at first, but they loosened up after the first day of walking. We were out for 8 hours the first day and he alternated between walking and riding the whole time with no complaints. The carrier is roomy and I like that the stroller is narrower than most baby strollers. So glad I finally caved into buying this!

to be very well built until one assembles the wheels.  I do not want the hassle of returning item but the quality of the wheels are cheap, cheap, cheap.  For the money spent this should have heavy duty wheels.  I have no other complaints about the pet stroller but how can you go so cheap on the wheels when they are the part hitting the rough concrete.  Shame on you.  You probably figure most people will not return item because it is so bulky; you are right in my case but I will remember not to purchase anything that comes from Outward Hound again for fear of it not being good quality.  If you are just the seller and not the manufacturer, please forward my scathing opinion to the manufacturer.  Buyer beware.
Stroller is great. Didn't give it 5 stars due to the fact that one of the wheels was on backwards so my sons had to reassemble it in order to attach them. Other than that it's great for my Yorkies.
summary: would have given it 5 stars if....

reviewText: Unfortunately my pooch had a fall & was tired of carrying her;this did the job! Was fun strolling around like a newborn baby; my dog didn't like it much, but it did the job while she was convalescing...

took a 2 month vacation this past fall and traveled with my 8 lb Pomeranian.  I used this carrier and took her into stores every where I went.  Never had one store complaint.  She loved it too.  I was surprised how easily she adapted to being in the stroller.  It offered her protection from little kids wanting to pet her and made it much easier on me to make sure she stayed safe on our trip.  She knew when the stroller came out, she was on a new adventure !

My dachshund has had two back surgeries this year and isn't quite walking well enough to take on long walks yet.  I bought this so she could walk as far as she wants then ride the rest of the way.  She loves it!!  I have used it quite a few times and she is eager to go for a ride.  She fits perfectly (she is 12 lbs.) and it is very easy to maneuver.  Folds quickly and is lightweight.  Looking forward to more walks/hikes taking my dachshund whenever I go.

It is inevitable that any cat will destroy this toy.  Between the wands breaking and the motor itself dying our cats go through Panic Mouse 360 like mad.  I don't know how many replacements we have bought over the years.  I just ordered another to use as a spare to the current 360 because I know it will stop functioning someday.  But our cats love the 360.  You have been warned.  Don't buy this addictive toy for your cat unless you're ready to invest in multiple future purchases.
summary: Your cat will break this toy

reviewText: My cat loves this toy.  Ella will sit by the toy and wait for me to turn it on for her.  I gave this a 4 star only because I had to tape (electrical) the little toy end to the plastic arm.  Every time Ella would catch the the moving toy it would fall off.  Also sometimes Ella gets very excited in trying to catch the moving toy she will knock it over.  But I like that it has two settings.  One is a 15 minute timer and the other is the on timer.  We have had it for several weeks and Ella still wants to play with it.
summary: Kitty Waits for it to be turned on

reviewText: I have purchased two Panic Mouse toys.  My cats love it.  I have one cat who will play with it until she wears herself out.  The random movement and speed adjustment make it a great toy they don't get tired of.  However...... The first one I bought stopped working after about a  month.  I sent it back to the company and they sent me a new one.  This one lasted about 6-8 months before it too stopped working.  The motor doesn't seem to be strong enough to take the constant tugging on the toy.  If they could improve the motor to keep it working, it would be the best cat toy ever!

Not great quality - within a few minutes my cats had ripped the toy completely off & I had to superglue it back on. Which meant that replacing the toy would not be an option. Also it's so light weight that the lightest smack knocks it over. Such a great concept & they really wanted to play with it but just not worth the money with the design the way it is.It may work great for small kittens but do not recommend for adults.

I own the neediest cat in existence. She wants to be played with or held CONSTANTLY, and meows non-stop if you are not paying constant attention to her.My cat shows absolutely ZERO interest in any cat toy I have ever purchased for her that does not require human interaction.  She will only play with moving objects controlled by a human being.  After reading the reviews on this product, I thought id give this one a try to see if I could keep her busy and still be able to get some work done around the house without my little kitty "helper"While not entirely effective, this toy has come closer than anything else I've tried.  She will play with the toy, while I'm in the same room with her, but if I leave the room, she loses interest in the toy and follows me out of the room and starts meowing again.  I can turn this thing on in the kitchen while I cook dinner or near my desk while I try to work on the PC tho, and she will watch it quietly and for the MOST part leaves me alone.  I had to replace the pom pom it came with with a feather toy before she would bother to actually attack it tho.
summary: Decent little toy for my co-dependant cat.

reviewText: This thing breaks at the drop of a hat.  When I can finally convince my cat's to play with it, they usually detach the toy from the base in about two seconds.  Then toy itself broke.  Do not buy!
summary: Toy breaks easily, lost my cat's interest quickly

reviewText: My tubby kitty loves her panic mouse. At first, it was ridiculously easy for her to grab the ball, and pull the wand off every 5 minutes, so I duck-taped the wand to the metal rod, and that ended that. Then her favorite game was to grab the ball, and try to pull the whole thing under the couch. I had to cut a big piece of cardboard and tape the legs to it, to give it a bigger, more stable base. Every once in a while I have to straighten out the metal rod, but I just push it back into shape gently, and haven't had too much issue.Even though I give it to her on the highest speed setting, her playtime usually involves grabbing the ball immediately, and the motor struggling against her until she lets it go, then a couple of times around in a circle and she has it again...As much as I wished this was the type of toy I could leave her alone with, I don't trust it that much, so I only let her use it while I'm there to supervise. Still, she gets excited when I bring it out, so we'll keep it in the toy rotation.

Again a product the cat really enjoys. I found that it works best without the motor, letting her play with the wand itself.  I wish I could give this more stars, but the wand falls off after 5-10 minute play. I have since taped it to the base with electric tape, and that seems to work. However, my cat keeps pulling it over, so again, I will have to find a way to extend the base to prevent this.
Within 3 Minutes my cat disconnected the entire wand from the mechanism. She was not interested in chasing the feather at all.She loves Cat Dancer, Laser toys and Fling-Ama-String.

My cat killed it in two days! It was a Christmas present, so it was just like having little kids around again.All three of my cats loved it. UNTIL Mad Max got so excited that he grabbed it and ran through the house with the whole toy in his mouth, banging on the floor and walls. I opened it up to see if I could fix it; he had broken several wire connections that were too short for me to re-solder.It's a great toy for sedate cats. Not for psycho-kitty ex-ferals, though. I suppose it would cost a fortune if it were cat-proof: titanium body and wand, with plug-in connections, instead of soldering.Visit Max's webpage at [...] .
summary: Great, except my cat killed it in two days!!

reviewText: This container is great for keeping the mice away. It's easy to open, though you do have to press down when you close it to ensure a tight seal. The footprint is relatively small so it can fit in a corner of your closet or pantry, but the tall height is nice so you don't have to bend over (at least not when it's full). The largest bag of dog food I have fit in here is 44 lbs of small kibbles.
summary: Small footprint, tight seal, fits 44 lbs of kibble

reviewText: I bought this because my sister has had one for a few years and recommended it. My old dog food bin wasn't air tight and also couldn't fit a large bag of food, I have no idea why I kept it for so long when something like this was such a cheap solution!My pantry no long stinks like salmon dog food and I like to think my dogs appreciate the freshness from the airtight seal :)5/5 would recommend!

I bought two of these...one for the dog food and one for the cat food.  I always buy the largest bags of food and it was getting everywhere.  I was, also, worried about critters getting into the open bags.  They easily hold the big bags of food with some room to spare and have great seals on the lids to prevent bugs and pets from getting into the food.  Absolutely worth it.
Does NOT 40 pounds of food! ! And the lid just pops off and so it was easy for the dogs to get into it.
summary: Does not hold 40# and does not keep dogs out

reviewText: I can't believe I get excited about a dog food container but here's the thing-by buying 18 lb. or larger bags of food, we save a bundle.  Still, where do you keep all that food without having to kill your back to move it?  We bought this, filled it with  18 pounds of dry dog food, (there's lots of room left in the container) and put it in the kitchen.  When company is coming,. we roll it into the pantry.  Sometimes it's the little things that make life easier.  Only had it for a month, but it seems durable.
The lid seals very well and holds a 30 pound bag of dog food. Just the right size for the kitchen.
I use this to store dog kibble.  It's a nice sturdy container, doesn't smell like plastic, and has been durable.

I'm using this to keep my pups food in. It will fit a 30lb bag of Royal Canin dog food perfectly, with no room to spare. I think the reason it only holds 30 pounds is because this food has holes in it like lifesavers so it takes up more room. It seals tight, keeps the bugs out and is easy to refill.

This is a great food storage container.  Airtight yet easy to open.  Very easy to dump your bag of food into.  And can reach into it to reach the bottom well.  The price is great for this great container.

While the material and construction are OK, the design of this item does not fit my needs.I like to drop an entire bag of food into the container, cut off the top of the sack and use it as a liner to reduce the need for clean up.This container is square, not rectangular and does not fit any standard 40 or 50 lbs bag.  My other beef is that the screw top opening is father small and I can not use my scoop with tilting the thing on its side. I am taking off one star for design and one off for price/value.next time I will look for a hinged top design.
summary: Hard to enter, doesn't fit bags

reviewText: Okay, I read dang near every review before I made this purchase.My thoughts...This is a great buy if you are looking for a cheaper substitute compared to the tougher stackable containers in the store.  But with that said, it is not without its flaws. First I must say that I saw a lot of reviews saying that this container couldn't fit a 40lb bag of dog food.  That is false.  Because it can.  I put a 15lb bag of Wellness puppy mixed with a 15lb bag of BlueBuffalo puppy small kibble in the container, and I could have fit more than 10 lbs more.  I think it all has to do with the size and density of the kibble that determines how much space it takes up in the container. If you got a 40lb bag of large light weight kibble, then you may find it hard to fit the entire bag, but if you got small breed or puppy size kibble and its a rich and heavy mix, then you will find it easy to fit more than 40lbs.But on to the flaw... the plastic, although sturdy isn't the strongest.  It does get a air tight seal, but when I got my container, it was cracked. it was stacked on during shipping and the container was not tough enough to have a heavy load on top.  Amazon replaced it immediately and paid return shipping, but still I'm disappointed with the quality of the plastic.  But for 25 bucks, could you really expect it to be any better? Probably not.  Other than it not being stackable or the strongest material, it gets the job done.  I'm satisfied.

I loved this container despite the fact that the lid can fall off when my dog wants to tip it over.  I know it's suppose to "snap" but it doesn't seem to hold too well if 40 pounds of dog food is pushing it when it's on it's side.  But I overlooked that fault because it looks better than the regular vittles vault.  HOWEVER, I'm so upset how I found ants inside the container the other day.  I always make sure it's shut tight because like mentioned above..my dog will open it if it's loose.  Maybe I just got a weird one but sad I can't return it because it's been past the 30 days.

My vet suggested that I purchase an 'air tight' food keeper for my puppy. She says that keeping the food in the bag, closed or not (after opening), does not keep out the food mites which could cause allergies. After shopping around, I purchased this container and it is just what I was looking for. I keep it next to the food bowls and it works out so much better than keeping the food in the bag anyway....allergies or not. Fresh food for my puppy!

This product does what it says it does, and does it well.  I keep my dogs' food in it, it closes tightly, no smell from it, no bugs inside.  It is the size that I need it to be to contain 30 lb. of dog food.  Perfect.
Awesome food container compared to others I've own in the past, very strong, durable and a good seal on the lid.
This keeps food fresh and keeps the bugs out.  Very good quality and seal.  Would def recommend to any pet owner

This is a great container: it looks good, solidly built, convenient to use. However, my dog's food comes in 33lb bags and this 40 lb container just barely fits it. So, just note that your <40lb bag of food might not fit.

We grew tired of the 40 pound bag of dog food sitting on the sunporch, calling out to all the pests in the backyard, informing the dog that food was nearby, and being a general eyesore to us and our guests. I searched high and low locally for something that would work - but all either had flimsy construction, a poor lid, or were too small to hold an entire bag of food! This item fits the bill perfectly.Yays:- Holds an entire 40 pound bag of food, without needing to keep the bag for the "little bit extra" that doesn't fit- Seals very tight, with ONE HAND. Invaluable when trying to keep the dog from going nuts while still trying to close the food- Looks pretty decent in the corner, and doesn't take up much floor space- Since it's somewhat clear, it's easy to tell when I need to go buy more dog food. I'm not peering in guessing.- Not too deep, so I can reach the bottom without getting my arms/chest/head filthy with dog food bitsNays:- None to speak of. This is a great item.
summary: Great storage for pet food without smell or pests

reviewText: We bought this for my dog's 28-lb bags of food. The food fits just fine, and the container seems to keep it fresh. However, the lid is very difficult to put on. If I need to remove the lid (the entire lid, not the part that unscrews), to get it back on, I have to sit on the container, and even then it usually pops off several times before it stays put. Once it stays, I feel that it's secure, and the part that you twist off to scoop food out is not a problem. Because I don't have to remove the entire lid that often, I keep using this container. But, the seal could definitely be improved.
summary: Great size, but the seal is finicky.

reviewText: We had been using a smaller cereal type tupperware to store our wheaten's dry food.  He seems to have started getting the munchies recently and started to access food and snacks on top of his kennel he's never touched before.  Received this in 2 days via prime and it fits the bill perfectly. Now the whole bag of food is stored in a container he'll find much harder to breach.

This was just what I was looking for to store Sadie's Wellness White Fish and Sweet Potato dry dog food.  After looking in several pet stores and major discount stores, I found the Vittles Vault II that will hold 40# of dog food in a small foot print.  Well contstructed and I like the fact that the seals make it air tight.  I would highly recommend this item.

When I finally realized that a 35lb bag of dogfood was only a few dollars more than the 17.5lb bags I'd been buying, I knew I would need a new container. I appreciate all the other reviews that helped me make the choice to buy this one.  I like that there are no wheels on this 40lb version and that it is tall and narrow so it takes vertical space rather than horizontal. It easily holds the 35lb small bite kibble dog food and seems to seal it in to keep out bugs etc.  It has a lid that secures onto the container body and forms a seal by way of a rubber insert.It came with no directions and the rubber insert was not pre-fitted, so I am not a 100% sure I fit the rubber insert properly: it doesn't snap into any groove on the lid or clip onto the rim of the main body of the container - it just kind of lies in place.  But it seems to work.  The lid also has a round hatchtype insert which you spin to open.  You can spin it quite tight to close which might make it a bit tough to open if you have arthritis in your hands.  If I tighten it too tight I feel it in my tennis elbow when I unscrew it.  You may remove the lid entirely if you feel you need a bit of extra room to access the main container, but it is not as easy or convenient to pull the whole lid off as it is to unscrew the hatch. If you have a physical ailment that would stop you from grasping and spinning the hatch, I would not pick this container - I would pick one with a flip/clip lock.I do like it a lot and it is exactly what I was looking for.  I only gave it four stars as it did crack within the first minutes of owning it.  I was washing it in the kitchen sink and as it is large, awkward and wet the container slipped out of my hand and hit the granite counter top (maybe a fall of a foot). That was enough to put a crack in the corner of the container (not the lid.) The crack is not one you can move, rather a small crack like you might see in a car windshield - it still functions but is probably weakened. I felt that it should have survived that small impact.  At that point, as the kids had already turned the box into a car, I could not return the item and decided it would be fine.  I have had it for a few months now and still love it, and if it ever did need replacing I would replace it with the same.
summary: dog food storage does the job

reviewText: I use this to store my cat food and it really works well at keeping it fresh and not letting the smell of the cat food get out.

I'm very container-friendly, I guess you can say. I like to be organized and take advantage of a space. My room isn't small but I would hate to see the bag of dog food I had in there all lopsided. It threw off the cleanliness of the rest of the room. Adding this to my room has been a real nice visual touch. I'm more aware of when it's time to buy more food and it's also kept the food very fresh; no ants or anything have ever come close. The lid is very, very well sealed. One of the best investments I've made so far in providing for my beautiful dogs!*UPDATE- 5/5/14*Two years later and I'm still using the same container! In fact, I bought another one. I got a third dog and switched foods, so I require more food now. I have NEVER  had any ants or other insects inside, which is awesome. However, depending on which food you use, it won't hold 40 pounds. WithWHOLE EARTH ADULT 30LB, I would hold 35 lbs. (the bag used to come in that weight). Now, withSelect Adult Dry Dog Food Size: 6-lb, I can fit a 30 comfortably. Yes, there's some space left but anymore would feel too close to the lid. Not a big deal, just noting a slight discrepancy in the description. This won't keep me from purchasing again if need be.

This is a fantastic item. I buy dog food in 40 pound bags and a whole bag fits in this container. It keeps the food fresh for my girl and has an easy access twist open top to access and scoop food, but the entire top comes off for filling. The best part is that this product is made in the United States and is free of harmful chemicals that can be found in some plastic products. Great buy! Definitely recommend.

Keeps my dogs food nice and fresh. I have 2 small dogs and they eat a special holistic food that the local feed store has to special order. The dogs can only eat so much and I have to order in a certain quantity. This allows it to stay fresh and I can clearly keep an eye on when I need to order more because the container is clear plastic. I am truly happy with this purchase and definitely would recommend it to all.

I bought this bin for our German Shepherd's dog food. We used purina one large breed dog food, I think it comes in a 35 pound bag or so. The whole bag will not fin inside this container unfortunately, even know it is listed as a 40 pound container. I believe it is due to the different size kibbles in the food. However, It almost all fits inside. I have found that this container is easy to get the lid off, and easy to scoop the food out. Those were the two things that I was looking for. The airtight container is an added bonus. I love this container, and I recommend it to any dog owner.

I had never heard of these, until a co-worker recommended them, and I'm very thankful she did!  I was reading the other reviews and don't understand how others claim that a 40lb bag of food doesn't fit in the container.  I haven't had any problems and I purchase the 42lb bags of Eukanuba.  It fits perfectly!  The lid is very well designed and can easily be opened and closed.  Keeps Boston's kibble nice and fresh!  Would definitely recommend!

I just got this the other day. I can't say much about the freshness of my dog's kibble, because I haven't had it too long, but it's really easy to just pour the food in, seal it up, and take out what I need from the top. I really like the slim design, and it held my 37 lb Blue Buffalo perfectly. Very satisfied.

I have bought this vittles vault twice now.. it is sturdy.. and keeps food fresh and bug free.  It is easy to fill and holds a bunch which is great for a multi dog household.  Buy it if you want a good product to keep your dogfood fresh and safe!
