Made the walk not fun and my dog is well behaved on walks. Very worried about it seating in the soft part of armpit,  Returning as this is not a good size for this design.Edit: purchased size up and despite multiple adjustments, still it rides in my boxer mix armpit. Cuts into his underarm.  This is a poor design.  Do not buy.
summary: The sizing is way off....down to a 1.  Wish a zero

reviewText: Quality seems fine, but my dog does not want to walk when i use it, not sure if i am the only one, but will keep on trying

This is a wonderful tool for training a dog not to tug on the leash. Excellent, high-quality construction.The "tricky" part is getting it adjusted to the dog correctly. Proficient instructions are provided, but I still needed some tips from the trainer to get it just right.Now that it's all adjusted, both me and my dog Travis LOVE IT !!
summary: Works perfect and does it's intended job

reviewText: Our trainer suggested this for us.  Our dog is constantly trying to pull and when we put this on her she doesn't pull near as much.  I like this over the basic harnesses that hook on the back.  However, the reason I did not give it 5 stars is our dog is still able to pull if she really wants to.  Also, I don't like that it has to be really tight on the dog to keep them from pulling.
summary: Great Harness for dogs that pull.

reviewText: My dog trainer highly recommended the Easy Walk harness and pretty soon it was easy to see why. First of all, the Easy Walk website has a convenient sizing chart to help you decide what size harness would fit your pet best. The harness snaps on easily and has a different color for the belly strap (which makes it easier to distinguish what goes where). Being a front-attachment type harness, Easy Walk turns your pet towards you when she tries to pull away, and I've seen this in action myself. As a result, my dog pulls much less and walks much better on it. I had a neighbor walk up to me the other day and ask where I bought my dog's harness, and I readily recommended the Easy Walk to her.

I bought this for a foster dog who pulled like a freight train.  He was a beagle and always had his nose the ground.  The piece that went around his chest would keep sliding down and he could get a leg over that and would then have slipped out of the harness.  That would have been bad as he was hard to catch.When I would take him out for a walk, I would snap the leash to both his regular collar and the harness, that way it kept the harness from slipping down.  That did take away some of the effectiveness of the harness, but better than a loose dog.I ordered a smaller size, but did not know the difference between this harness and the ECO easy walk harness.  Do not get the ECO as it stretches, not something you want when you have a puller.This harness does not train your dog not to pull, but it is an aid if you have a puller and you need some relief right away.  Best if used in conjunction with training, but it does immediately stop the pulling humanely and that was a godsend.  If only it would have walked the dog without me, then I would have given it 5 stars.  Actually, I would have given it 5 stars if strap going across the chest would not have slipped down.  It did on the smaller size as well.
summary: Good option for dogs who pull.

reviewText: This harness works very well for my female Bully who pulled a lot but is a gentle and obedient girl otherwise, this was a HUGE mistake for my now 6 month old male pit puppy who was dog aggressive and very very strong, it did absolutely nothing as far as giving me control of him and left his head out there to be a snothead. If your dog is a totally mellow fellow but pulls when walking this does help as it makes them turn into you when you pull on it but if you need control of a dog who is reactive, FORGET IT! Don't take a chance....

small / medium fit my dog perfectly, we had the next size up and it was too big, so this one is tighter and she can't squeeze out of it which is excellent.For those who have never used one before - this is the best way to walk your dog if they like to pull.Deep purple is a great royal purple color.
summary: Great, fit a 35-lb border collie mix

reviewText: I got this for my Siberian Husky puppy when he was about 3.5 months old, he was 22 pounds at the time. It is a bit hard to adjust, and it becomes un-adjusted/loose pretty quickly, but even when the fit isn't perfect, it does it's job. I was a little worried, because before I got this, he was pulling quite hard on his traditional collar when on his leash. So hard that he seemed to be choking himself and was making that terrible huffing/panting/you-are-choking-yourself sound. (Why the heck do dogs do that?) Once I got this harness on him, he tried once again to pull, but he ended up pulling himself around to face me. He caught on pretty quick that he could not pull if he wanted to look ahead, and now he walks really well. I'm going to have to purchase the size medium as he gets older, but as of now at 5 months and 30 pounds, it still fits him well, as he is pretty tall and skinny.
summary: No more pulling from my Husky Pup

reviewText: I've used the Easy Walk harnesses on my beagle for probably 5 years now and just love them... she had a light pink one then a black one and when I saw the raspberry colored one, she had to have it!  They eventually start to wear a little but only after a couple of years and lots of use... these are really good, durable harnesses!
I ordered the large and received medium/large.  very disappointed with the size. it did not fit my 95lbs akita. I wished they stated the right size from the get go.

We had this on our dog 2 times.  I was using it primarily to tether him in the back of the car (otherwise he jumps all over).  On the 2nd time, he bit through it!  Could just be my dog, he's quite over the edge.  But, something for you to consider.

Edited from 2 stars to 1 star: After using this harness maybe 10-12 times, the martingale loop (made of regular leash material) has been worn nearly through and is now hanging by a few threads. So: useless. This would also be an indicator of how hard my dog pulls with this harness on, but still, this is ridiculous. HOWEVER: Today I called Petsafe to explain, and they graciously and immediately offered to send a replacement at NO charge whatsoever. So we'll try again. That's excellent customer service!Initial review follows:This harness was my last-ditch hope to stop my dog, a 42-pound Aussie, from pulling like a sled dog. (Short, that is, of a prong collar, which I really do NOT want to use.) Disappointed! She stills pulls, and I have absolutely no problem with the leash drooping even half an inch. However, it's true that she seems to pull less brutally, because if she pulled the tiniest bit possible harder, she'd be turning towards me due to the way the leash is attached at the front. So, in short, it may ease your pain but it's not a miracle anti-pull cure for all dogs. Re: SIZING: this harness runs small. The medium on my 42-43 pound girl just barely fits, fully extended. We probably would be better off with a Large, and she is not a big dog in the least. Fit is extremely important, and I'd guess that all the people complaining about sores under their dogs' front legs are using too small a size. The belly strap should not come up against the front legs at all, but be back around the barrel of their chest.
summary: Doesn't stop pulling, just lessens it

reviewText: i got large size for my siberian husky, and size was right but could not adjust correctly for her with the black as belly band as instructions called it. So switched  the black to top and da-da perfect. Adjusted right with black on top. Worked wonderful to go for a walk. My dog is not a puller exactly but this made guideing her so much easier and not pulling on her neck.She is strong dog when she doesnt want to go the way i want and with this there is no problem.
summary: love this, works perfect but upside down

reviewText: Similar to what other reviewers have said, if you have a dog with short legs they can get out of this. I have it at its tightest for her size (which I don't think is wrong because I can't imagine my 35 lb dachshund/lab mix needing a size small) and she can still squeeze a leg out. It doesn't help with her pulling, which is usually only a problem when another dog is around. Yesterday, when I was tying my shoe she managed to get both legs out and ran down the street (thank goodness there was a snow storm so no cars were on the road and she finally came back to me 30 seconds later - the longest 30 seconds of my life!). I will be looking into other harnesses, probably ones with fabric on the bottom and preferably the top so she can't Houdini her way out again. I usually don't write reviews unless super happy or unhappy, but I almost lost my dog yesterday and it was stressful for both of us!
summary: Dog can get out of this

reviewText: Last summer I adopted a 12lb chihuahua mix (named Ralphie) from my local shelter. I take him and my dachshund for daily walks around the neighborhood, so it's important for me to have reliable and safe collars. Initially I used a standard nylon collar for Ralphie, but he was able to slip out of the collar. It wasn't often, and wasn't a huge issue until he slipped out of his collar during a walk, just as a car was driving by. Luckily, the driver saw what happened and was able to stop before anyone got hurt.I tried a Martingale collar, but it irritated the skin under his neck. I tried a couple harnesses, but they don't give me control over him during our walks and allow him to pull.I found the Easy Walk Harness through an Amazon search, and have been using it for a month now. It's exactly what Ralphie needed! I have control over him if I need it while we walk, and he can't really pull ahead. But it doesn't choke him or irritate his skin. I only put it on him when we walk (or travel), so I don't know how it holds up with long term wear-and-tear, but so far it's holding up great.He's just under 12lbs and tall and lanky, and the small fits but only at the tightest settings.We were at the vet a week ago for a checkup, and the vet told me she uses the same collar for her dog too, and that she recommends it to her clients (although the vet tech in the room had never seen one, so I don't know how often it's recommended).Overall, I'm pleased.

This harness has made all the difference in the world for us.  Our dog used to pull our arms out of our sockets trying to catch squirrels, rabbits, etc. while on a walk.  The very first time we used this, it was like a night and day difference.  She no longer pulls.  I mean you can tell she is excited about the squirrel and pulls a wee bit but it is SOOOOOO much easier to keep her under control.  The money I spent on this harness was well worth it.  We are very happy with this purchase.

Reading the reviews, we were a little doubtful that a harness could automatically solve all of your dogs pulling issues...but it is pretty darn close!However, my Aussie pup was wearing a regular collar and was always choking himself on our walks until he ended in a coughing fit.  We considered getting a regular harness - except we know that a regular harness that latches in the back actually exacerbates pulling in your dog, except it would mostly stop the choking issue.  UNTIL - Our puppy trainer recommended a front-lead harness as such!Literally the first day we put it on we noticed the difference.  It doesn't prevent our dog from walking in front of us like some of the other reviewers miraculously witnessed - but it definitely stopped the pulling, choking, and coughing!  WONDERFUL.Do not use this with a retractable leash - it confuses the dog to think that pulling is still OK because of the slack s/he gets.  Use this with a regular lead.I HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT!  When used appropriately, it is a very effective aid for good leash-walking behaviors with your dog.The sizing guide for the dog's girth is pretty accurate:The Petite fits my 3.5-lb yorkie.  (Although she prefers the regular back lead blingy-harness, and pulling is not really an issue with her).The Petite/Small fit my 4-12-lb Aussie pup.The Small fits my Aussie pup who is now about 15 lbs and should fit him for a while.  We will see if we need another size when he's an adult!*One minor negative (not a dealbreaker, just need more supervision) - my Aussie as a puppy would sometimes get his lower jaw stuck in the little loop in the front of the harness.  This loop provides a little too much slack that when he attempted to chew it he would just get his jaw stuck and make him frantic.  The solution?  Puppy supervision (as always) - and stop him before it starts!  There is no issue with it now that he is biting and mouthing less.
This product worked as soon as I put it on my dog.  You still have to teach your dog to walk next to you, but there is no more pulling on me.  I have a bad back, and this helps me to walk my dog.

I bought this for my 18-lb Beagle-Daschund mix, who has a girth of about 18.5." It works to stop her pulling (I tell everyone that walking Pixel is like trying to reel in a big fish), but it has some flaws.When I first received the harness, I spent a long time trying to adjust it. Although the small size should fit a dog even a little larger than my dog, I had a hard time even getting it to fit her.The rings by Pixel's shoulders seemed to sit too far forward and looked like they would just rub on her legs. After adjusting the chest strap to its maximum length, I was happy (enough) with the fit that I can use it without feeling like it's hurting her. (I still wouldn't take her on a long hike wearing the harness--I think it would start to rub on her shoulders too much.) BUT, putting the chest strap at maximum length to get the shoulder rings back far enough creates a problem of the chest strap sagging in the front. When the chest strap sags, Pixel can manage to get her leg over it and escape the harness.I have fixed the problem with the fit by leaving Pixel's collar on when I take her out with the harness. I hook the leash onto the ring on the harness and onto the ring on her collar. This holds the chest strap up enough that even when it sags, it won't slip down and allow her to get her leg over it.My second complaint with the Easy Walk Harness is that all of the straps tend to loosen, and you have to keep readjusting them. I've thought about adjusting the straps and sewing them in place.Although I'm disappointed that the harness doesn't fit as well as it should, it does stop her from pulling! I don't know if ordering up a size would have been better or not. Maybe my dog is just oddly shaped.
summary: Good, But You May Need to Modify For Fit

reviewText: I measured my dog.  This was the best size for him.  He ended up pulling, and the Harness loosened, to where I was afraid he would slip out of it.
My shiba pup pulls a lot and I use this mostly for just training walks but it gets her to stop pulling after she tries a few times and realizes it will just keep turning her around.

I tried several sizes and none seem to work well for my dog. He has a broad chest. He's a mini pin/chi mix  so not sure what is going on, but it appears to fit but when we go on walks and he gets at all excited, tries to run, even go # 2, after it seems his legs get caught in the harness. It's hard to describe in words, but it didn't work for him.
summary: Just didn't work for my dog

reviewText: My dog is very hyper so she loves to pull on her leash when walking. This harness makes it so that she cannot pull and it has made walking so much easier for both of us. She is about 45 lbs so this harness fits perfectly. I would recommend this to any dog owner who has a dog that likes to pull on their leash when walking.

This harness is not tough enough for my large dog.  We had to buy a thicker brand with no plastic and the cinching is what works. Dogs hate the strap when it tightens up under their legs. It stops my lab in his tracks. This might work for a small dog.

I love love love these harnesses I got this on the recommendation of the teacher at my dog's training class to help with his pulling and he was right. I don't even need to use this harness anymore because my dog stopped pulling all together after about 6 months of using this harness.

My puppy is/was an enthusiastic puller when on leash.  This product changed the entire walking experience and is a perfect fit for my 17lbs, 8mo old Cavalier puppy.  It adjusts in a variety of directions, is made of a soft material and has 2 places to clip a lease or tags on in the front.
summary: Walking my puppy's enjoyable with this gentle harness!

reviewText: The harness really helped my pup learn to walk on leash and it didnt seem uncomfortable to hm. The only reason I gave it s 4 was because I found it hard to get it on him. It took some practice.

This is a lot better than a standard harness, but not as good as a pinch collar. The idea is to train the dog first by letting him know what he can and cannot do. Once you've successfully done this, thank you pinch collar, he'll cooperate with very little effort. This is better than a standard harness, because the dog is still in control if he momentarily forgets the rules.

We have a 100 pound St Bernard. We bought this product for two reasons... seemed more humane than a regular collar, and also because she's a hard pull if she sees a squirrel (or this huge poodle down the street that she hates for some reason). The harness did not fit her. It was large enough (VERY large in fact) but no matter how we adjusted it (and we DID follow the directions) the harness is ill-fitting. It wouldn't fit vertically, like the dog in the photo. And it just looked uncomfortable, right up against her front legs. Horrible fit. Maybe there's another breed that it fits nicely on... but not the St Bernard! Returned it for a full refund with no problems.
summary: Totally did not fit our dog.

reviewText: I bought this for my 50 LB Doberman/pitbull. Right away he was much easier to walk with. A lot of the time he'll walk with a loose leash. It doesn't hurt the dog at all, just sorta pulls on his chest and legs if he tries to get too far away. Much better than a regular collar. I was afraid he'd end up chewing on it, but he doesn't try at all. I leave it on him most of the time. When I take it off, he tries to put his head back in it.

This product worked well for my doberman puppy, who is a puller. However, if left on her she will tilt her head down and chew the harness off of her body (she's a pest). I have gone through two of these harnesses. They are safer for dogs that have potential neck issues, such as dobermans. The price on Amazon beats any of the big box stores and my local pet store.

I ordered a small for my 15 pound Boston Terrier.  According to the size chart, this is the perfect size for her.  However, the front piece is too big.  She is able to slip her front legs out.  It doesn't happen if we are walking but if she is trying to go and I am stationary, she can slip it very easily.  I have found that putting a sweater on her and then the harness on top makes it fit better.  She has not been able to slip it this way.In terms of improving our walk, this harness certainly does that.  She still walk a little bit in front of me, but she doesn't pull like she was doing before on the Puppia harness.

Our new rescue is the type of dog that pulls and pulls when on leash that after 5 minutes she has almost choked herself out.  In two weeks we had a regular collar, a Kong soft padded collar, a Puppia mesh harness, and then finally found success with the Easy Walk Harness.It really works great, my Shar-Pei mix immediately stopped pulling.  I think the fact that the tension is in the front makes a big different to them psychology.  The harness also pulls them off balance if they try to stray or pull more than they should.GREAT GREAT buy, now walks are calm and enjoyable.

These are very nice quality and they came quickly. but my dogs still pull with them. I have very tough dogs and have put time in training them but they still pull. I have used training collars, head haltis and pinch collers. I have been to several training classes also. I put a C.D on my Bouvier and I was in a dog club for several years so I really do know what I am doing.They work great foe some dogs but not mine.
summary: not as great as I had hoped

reviewText: This harness was recommended by the trainer we took my puppy/dog to for puppy class and basic obedience. It was adjusted by trainers at the facility, and it did not work. Not only did my dog still pull like a maniac, but it rubbed the hair off parts of his belly and raised red welts. We used a prong collar for a bit, then replaced that with a Harness Lead. The Harness Lead is much softer and does not rub the fur off. It also causes a dog to knock himself on his butt if he tries to escape by thrashing around. I think the Easy Walk harness might be good for dogs that lag behind on walks or want to run off in a different direction. Doesn't help with dogs who try to run ahead, and who have a high tolerance for pain and discomfort (such as most sporting dog breeds). Also causes the leash to get tangled around the dogs' legs. Very annoying to use.
summary: Did not work for my dog

reviewText: I wish I had not thrown away the original packing because I would return it. It chafes on the dogs shoulders, and he does not like it.
summary: My dog doesn't like the harness

reviewText: As a dog trainer and for my own dog, I love the gentle leader products!!  I do actually prefer the gentle leader head collar even more than the body harness for control of very strong dogs but I have seen people happy with the body harness as well.  Either way, it is great to stop the dog from pulling on a walk without damaging their neck.-Julie the online dog trainer from [...]

I am so happy we purchased this harness. It has been a lifesaver. Our dog is very enthusiastic and was constantly pulling on her leash. From the moment we put this harness on her, she no longer pulls. She walks right beside us without any additional guidance. She is so much more enjoyable on walks and is much more calm when we go out. I can't recommend this product enough. I would say it runs a bit on the large side, but fortunately it's very adjustable.

my dog outgrew this very fast, so do not get it for dogs over 26-30 pounds. It is also has strange positioned straps that weren't so comfy for my dog. I would say it would be good for very petite dogs. Lupine is the way to go for comfort AND well placed straps. I did love the colors though! And it was very well made! I ended up giving it to a family who has a lap dog, and they seem to like it just fine.

I have a dog that loves to tug and pull. This harness doesn't really help in reducing how he pulls when on a leash, at least it does not chock the dog when he pulls. This harness is relatively easy to put on and remove.

After taking Basic Obedience three times all the while my puppy has grown from 33lbs to 85lbs, my trainer suggested we try this harness.  It's very comfortable for the dog because it goes over their shoulder and latches under their belly.  It connects in the front by their chest.  I went from looking like I was in a water skiing competition to someone walking a dog.  He's 3 now but every now and then a deer catches his eye and you have more control than a leash by itself.

My dogs are the worst pullers and I love this harness. Easy to put on them, easy to adjust and it takes the strain off their throats. Helps me control them better and train them not to pull. Love this harness. Will purchase again.

I started using this when my dog was about 4 months old. It is a great alternative to a prong collar in that it gets you less "You are a cruel owner" looks and does a really great job of diverting her pulling. It is a must if you are trying to correct pulling or lunging when walking.

I bought this for my 13lb Boston Terrier. She can pull with the best and instantly becomes a sled dog when fitted with a regular harness. I researched no-pull harnesses for days and decided on this one based on the overwhelmingly positive reviews. Now I have used the harness regularly for over a week, I cannot give it more than 3 stars - here's why:(1) Annoying to fit. I knew this before I bought it, but seriously, I spent a good hour trying to fit it just perfectly.(2) The straps get loose after you use it one to two times, so you have to refit the harness often.(3) The harness decreases pulling but does not make my dog walk like an angel by any means. (side note: we are going to puppy classes which has helped somewhat.) The first times she lunged at a couple other dogs, she fell on her face, flipped over, and kept tripping on the leash. While I suppose that could deter her from lunging, it was an unpleasant experience. The other dog owners were questioning why I was letting her be so destructive to herself, but I really had no control over it. She was in the zone where no amount of food or instruction would help. She does not pull to this extreme anymore, but she knows just how much she can pull without getting into that sort of trouble.(4) Probably the most disappointing of it all - CHAFFING. It was my fault that I continued to use the harness after I thought I noticed it was making her belly/armpits lose hair, but I honestly wasn't sure. She didn't seem to hurt or be bothered by the harness and she has pretty short, thin hair on her chest/armpits/belly. Then yesterday evening, after a number of long walks and going to puppy training class, I noticed she had quarter-sized raw areas under her armpits! I was horrified! This apparently is a common problem with this harness.I like that this harness did discourage lunging and pulling hard, as compared to my other traditional harness which seemed to encourage pulling... But the chaffing issue is still a problem. I'm toying with the idea of sewing sherpa or felt around the chest and armpit area to see if it helps, but I'm not betting on it.

I needed something to stop my 2 dogs (a 24lb Mini Schnauzer and a 14lb Yorkie Poo) from pulling me all over the place after recent foot surgery and this harness did the trick!  It hasn't cured them but it's helped a lot; I actually feel like I'm in charge of them now!!!  I've tried all kinds of gizmos in the past and none of them worked as well as this harness.
I have a 5 month old lab puppy that pulled like crazy. This harness reduces pulling greatly. She has chewed on it a few times but it has held up very well. I would recommend.
Good for the price. It fits well so the sizing info is accurate I have a 35 lb Brittany and the medium fits perfect. It seems to be well made and would purchase another

I have two puppies, and I wanted to finally have a pleasant walk with them rather than being pulled around the city for the entire walk.  When I first put the harnesses on, I noticed a huge difference.  I immediately felt a lot less pulling, and they were much more cautious with this on and were starting to actually wait for me when we were out.  I think because the harnesses were so new for them it made them more aware while we were out of the pulling that they were doing since I could control them much more easily now.Both of my dogs are rescues, and we're not sure on their mixes, but one of them has shorter than average legs (think corgi), and she would begin to slip her legs out of the harness while we were walking.  I was wondering why since I had adjusted them to be perfectly snug. After a few walks and further inspection, I noticed that the harness was becoming more and more loose.  I had to keep tightening it throughout the walk in addition to dealing with two dogs and adjusting the leash that they kept on tripping over since the design has it hooking on the front of their chest.  Even though the harness was becoming a bigger and bigger pain to deal with, it didn't bother my taller dog as much because her legs are longer and can't easily fit through the loosening straps.  All in all, the easy walker worked in the beginning, but quickly became more work than not having it at all.
summary: huge difference, but not for long

reviewText: The width of the straps on this is tiny. It's for a very very small dog. It's like the width of cat leashes. It says it would fit up to 20" but it doesn't.The medium also has sizing issues--it says as small as 20" and it is too big. Very annoying! My dog is sort of compact and the area with the martingale loop is too long--I can't get it small enough. The girth around her chest is fine and will adjust as needed--it's the front that's the problem.If you can get it to fit (I can, at the very smallest setting in the front, but then it starts slipping as we walk), it works great.
summary: Sizing is way off; if you can get it to fit, it works great

reviewText: Even though there was a picture of a pug on the cover of the small easy walk, it was too small for my puppy frenchie. I bought a size up and it works well, but because he is so short, it's easier to use a top load harness. He does walk better on the easy walk though!

This harness is much more substantial than the small easy walk harness we replaced with it.  At first I thought it might be too bulky for our beagle, but she does fine with it and it actually seems a much better fit, and I love that the buckles are bigger and easier to clip.  We keep the over the head and in front of the chest ones clipped all the time and only use the under her legs one to take it on and off - easy as pie.  Slip it over her head and clip it underneath her leg - one clip.I love these harnesses!  The dogs aren't incline to pull like they do with a collar or harness with the loop on the top of their shoulders.  The puppy sitll wants to pull, but she doesn't choke and gag.Great harness.

I have a boisterous English Bulldog who pulls waaay too much, but not at all after using this harness! It was tricky getting the proper fit (it needs to be TIGHT otherwise it twists off) but once we figured that out, it has been excellent! We especially love that it doesn't put any additional pressure on her throat. Such a great device!
summary: the best solution if your dog pulls too much!

reviewText: I've been trying to love these harnesses.  I foster and have many different dogs, all bully breeds.  I've never been able to get one to fit properly - when snug the straps dig into the dog's armpits.  I"ve tried both M and L harnesses and can't seem to find the right fit without causing the dog discomfort.  The martingale loop in the front is essential to how it functions, but it also causes some extra slack which in turn causes some swinging from the leash hardware- it's unfortunately less annoying to keep the leash taught during the walk to keep it from swinging.. not what I want to teach the dog.  Overall I just find it too annoying and my harness search continues.

Easy Walk Harness, Medium/Large, BlackI really like this harness.  I used to, literally run, as soon as we were out the door.  Put the harness on and we had an easy walk, no pulling at all.  He didn't even try.I used it this way for quite some time.  One day I decided to clip it on his back to see if it was the harness or Sam just getting better.  I didn't go far before I headed home to put the harness on the correct way.I am fostering Sam so had to take him to get "fixed" yesterday.  When I picked him up the nurse/receptionist told me:  We put his harness on the right way.  I told her the way I had it was the correct way and explained why.  She was quiet, maybe not believing me.  I think she thinks I am an idiot who doesn't know what I'm talking about.  Should let her walk Sam with and without.  lolEasy Walk Harness, Medium/Large, Black

This Easy Walk harness is definitely worth every penny... I didn't buy from Amazon, although I had planned too.  I needed it NOW.  I have a Basenji mix who is high strung and to say she loves to pull is an understatement.  I have been really working with her every day to get her to stop, been trying to be the leader.  I've been consistent with trying to keep her at my side, using rewards, trying to hold her behind me.  I've done this all while maintaining my calm.  But she just isn't learning not to pull and is killing my wrists and shoulders.  She wants to chase everything in sight....I put this harness on her, took her out in my large backyard to test it, and I was amazed.  She did not pull even one time.I then took her for a very long walk down the road to a high school, all around the grounds... I would say we walked about 2 miles total.  She did not pull at all.  We saw lots of birds, instead of trying to pull towards them, she just looked at them with interest, ears perked, then she kept walking.  I am in love with this harness.  I was truly able to enjoy our walk, I relaxed and was looking at the view.  She was totally relaxed and seemed to enjoy herself as well.She did try to bite her leash a few times at the beginning, but I corrected her with a sharp no and she stopped.  After that she was good for the rest of the walk.This is a 6 month old puppy that gets into everything and seems to have ADD.  She was a totally different dog, and happy on the leash.Before this I was using a regular soft front martingale style collar with her leash.  She always ended up wheezing from pulling so hard on her neck.  This harness does not hurt her at all.  I checked her armpits after our long walk and no problems there either.  Having seen other people with complaints about rubbed armpits I will be paying close attention to this... But I don't think it will be a problem.I highly recommend this harness!
summary: Best money I have ever spent...

reviewText: Bought it because I was told my rescue German Shepherd pulls, and they used it at the shelter. Used it and it worked, but to be honest you don't need it. After about 60 minutes with a choker collar and the PROPER TECHNIQUE - I never needed to use this again. I can walk my dog on a lead and if it even begins to get taut he will slow down and fall in line without correction. I know positive only is the huge rage now and you can't even dream corrections lest be labeled a barbarian, but dogs are opportunists and will get away with what they can.  The smart shopper will save his money and invest in a good book about being a good leader, because if you need this to control your dog I would bet there are other problems as well.
summary: Item works but you don't need it.

reviewText: We have a young boxer girl that still has all of her puppy hyperness and has some slight anxiety issues, which results in one strong, terrible puller.If you have a strong, hyper puller, don't use it.We were told by a pet trainer to try this. It worked okay for the first walk we took her on. I kept it on her all the time so that she was ready to go at any time, even for potty breaks (she pulls just as bad if not worse in what she sees as her space). The second day she wore it, she was in her cage, alone, for a couple of hours and I came back to the chest strap broke in half. There was nothing for her to get caught on and the harness fit well. So, she did this on her own romping and wrestling around. She has broke a collar before, too, so it's very believable of her doing this.Luckily we got it on sale at a local store and didn't have much money in it. We have now got a new training harness for her with a different design from Tractor Supply. It seems to work better all around from the very beginning. But, were still in a trial stage. We'll see with time. Hopefully it works because we have the full $22 price in it and this habit of hers has got to stop before she hurts me again or gets away and hurts herself or someone else.

I have a Rottie so the first thing I look for is how something is put together. This is VERY strong and very well made. I have arthritis and fibromyalgia and just using a leash alone hurts my hands, arms, etc. Corey is very sensitive to training aids that affect his head/neck (but sometimes I have to use them) but this halter is like "nothing" on him. (Like those coffee commercials where the waiter says they're drinking "de-caf")He actually stands prouder, like he sees it as his uniform. (He's my Service Dog and he takes his job very seriously.)I worried about the "snug fit" but he doesn't mind that at all. Not an issue at all, right from first wearing. A very good idea and looks good on my dog too.
summary: Neck and head freedom, very well made

reviewText: This isn't bad, but definitely doesn't stop my pit mix from pulling. It's also chafed his skin to the point where some of his hair is coming off in the front :( I'll continue to use it but had to pad the inside so hopefully his hair will grow back.
summary: not terrible, but not a miracle fix either

reviewText: This worked much better for our dog (strong pitbull puller on the leash) than the Gentle Leader head collar. However he seems to be right inbetween sizes- the M is a too snug (even on its loosest setting), but the L was too big (even on its tightest setting).

I gave this product 4 stars because of how enjoyable my dog walking has become, but I'm a little confused about a few things. I ordered this product in green, size medium, and it was too small for my 45 lb dog, even though his girth size was well within the suggested range. I returned the product with no problems, but when I went to re-order this harness (in green again) I clicked "large," but Amazon's listing read "medium/large". Nonetheless, I ordered it and received it in a timely manner. The size medium/large fit my dog very nicely and prevented him from pulling. I kept calling it his "magic harness" because it was like I was walking a different dog! The front strap always seemed a little bit impossible to adjust perfectly though, and it got all awkwardly pulled if my dog got excited and ran after something.Unfortunately, my dog dislikes this harness and managed to chew it off. I just couldn't give up on this harness though. After my dog ruined the harness, I walked him with his regular collar for a few days and he reverted back to his pulling habits! I had to order another harness. This time, the green harness went up in price, so I ordered the red/black harness and clicked "large" like I did last time. Little did I know, this was an actual size large and not a medium/large like I received last time. When I received the large red/black harness I got a nice surprise and found that it came with a leash as well. This harness also came in different packaging and was advertised as being "Eco" so the webbing was much softer. However, the large harness is still a tiny bit loose even when tightened up all the way. This is unfortunate because there was no option to choose a size medium/large at the time of purchase.Overall, I love the way the harness works, even though my dog doesn't enjoy when I put it on him to go outside. I just wish the size/color listings were a little bit more accurate and consistent.
summary: Great harness, horribly inconsistent size/color advertising

reviewText: I have a 70+ lbs labrador retriever mix dog and she pulls when she's on normal collar-leash. When I use Gentle Leader, it helped but she really doesn't like the Gentle Leader where it goes around her mouth-muzzle area. She always try to roll around on the grass area and try to paw her way out of it. When I put this Easy Walk Harness on her, it takes a while to really get the correct position as there are quite a number of adjustments to do. Amazingly, she doesn't even try to walk in front of me when she's on the Easy Walk Harness. I do think that she feels more comfortable wearing the harness than the leader. Also, people have said that it's safer as it's not wrapped around just her neck and head. I very much prefer the harness and I would recommend it as long as you get the fitting correctly!

The concept of this lead is great and it definitely reduces pulling. However, there are other versions out there that clip to the dog's collar that are better, and there's also a mesh harness that attaches to the leash on the back of the dog (vs. the front with this one) that works as well and is easier to use/handle. I'll keep this one as a backup.
summary: Great price but there are better versions

reviewText: The concept of this harness is great -- I love that it doesn't pull the dog's neck. However, a basic design flaw enables my chubby little bulldog to wiggle out of it when he wants to.We definitely have the right size--it is as tight as I feel comfortable making it. Yet, he only has to wiggle his front legs "just right" to get it off and run away. Thankfully, he doesn't do this very often, but it annoying when it happens.
summary: Good harness, but it slips off

reviewText: This is a nice product to keep my pup from pulling in a pet friendly way.  He doesn't mind having the harness on and even sits and stays while I quickly put it on him.  I would recommend this harness to anyone.
I purchased two of these for my pugs and I am thinking I should have ordered the smaller size.It definitely keeps them from pulling, but they both were able to wiggle out of them by rolling.

I bought this harness for my 10-pound maltese, who often pulls and goes nuts on walks if another dog comes near. The small harness fits well, and I can see that it would work for a large or tall dog. However, with a very short dog like mine, having the leash buckle in the front on his chest is very inconvenient. The buckle itself nearly drags on the ground, hits his front legs every time he moves, and the leash gets under his front feet constantly. I would not recommend this harness for a dog who hangs low to the ground.

But he's a special case.  He doesn't pull, he stops dead and won't move.  I've worked with him for 2 years and he still does it, so I would have to say he's trained me well.  What can I say....he's a terrier!

I have a 50lb pitbull and this has made our walks so much easier.  He doesnt realize his own strength and gets excited easy, this allows us to walk peacefully and will allow us to run as well--with control.  We both come back happy.

walking a dog or the dog walking you. i bought this after searching for something that can control my dog. we love her a lot but it is no fun taking her for a walk. this works really well. i am serious. it guides her to where you want her to go. other harnesses attach to the top of the neck no good at  all. this gives the dog control. with this harness, it attaches to the front of the chest, walk on either the right or left of dog and keep dog close to your side. read all directions. it does work. she still will pull and get crazy sometimes when she sees another dog but she is more controllable. my dog is a 40 lb American pit bull terrier and this controls her so much better. she is a sweet loving dog. i recommend this harness over all others. does not choke dog.
All 3 of my 55-60lb dogs have one of thes harnesses.  They work well for training them to stop pulling.

I purchased this collar for my strangely strong and headstrong Cocker Spaniel after having terrible luck with previous ones. He is 10 years old and always been impossible to walk (especially when other dogs are around). The Gentle Lead collar worked well, but was NOT gentle on my dog. It helped control him, but if he tried to go after another animal, he would pull so hard that it made his mouth bleed.I have two suggestions for this collar:1. Make sure you put it on correctly. I initially put it on with the leash attachment on the back (like a regular harness)...useless.2. My dog has figured out how to get out of it (no matter how tight it is). He waits till I'm not watching him, straightens out his front legs, places his chest on the ground (to hold the collar still?) and backs himself right out of it! I've never seen anything like it. I now clip the leash to the harness and his regular collar. It's probably less effective because it doesn't have the same amount of "pull" to the side, but still works.

this harness feels a little big for my spaniel, even though she is the medium size dog. All the straps are already on their min, but the whole thing seems to move all over the place. Overall it works, I don't know how comfortable it is, I can tell for sure she doesn't want to run along the bicycle wearing it.The harness served it's purpose and the dog stopped pulling immediately.

I love this dog harness because it fits my dog and I feel confident when I use it on him.  Labrodor retrievers  like to walkahead of you and pull.  I have complete control of him whereas I didn't and couldn't  with a choke chain.  Those type of dogs have very strong necks also.  My dog is 1year and 3 months, about 75 lbs. and I can fit this harness on him with some room to grow.  I tried the med. one from a retailer a few months ago and it barely fit him.  He chewed that one up, so I wated to get a new larger one and I was successful.

We bought another harness for our one dog at her school and decided it might be a good idea for our other guy.  Petco had it for $[...] but found it from an Amazon vendor for $[...] + shipping.  Worked well but a clip broke after 2 weeks.  Contacted seller and they had the manufacturer send a replacement ASAP.  You do need to spend a few minutes to adjust to your dog but it really beats walking a dog with just a collar.  Our dogs hate the over the muzzle gentle leader but don't mind this at all.  Good product. Recommended.
summary: Much better than just a collar

reviewText: Although very well made, this was not the correct solution for our standard poodle.  He still pulled with this harness, perhaps even more than with a standard collar.  For him the best collar was the Gentle Leader Head Dog Collar.  With the Gentle Leader Head Dog Collar he is like a different dog.  As soon as we put it on he knows he is to be on his best behavior.  No pulling, no walking in front of us.  Perfect.

We have a Border Aussie and live on a steep hill with a gravel road. We tried many different collars to try to keep our dog from pulling when we walked him but to no avail. It got to the point where I could no longer walk him after he pulled so hard that I slipped on the gravel and fell. I bought this at the suggestion of my daughter and it works like a charm! Our dog no longer pulls and is a joy to walk.This is actually the 2nd one of these I bought - the first one got left on him by a friend who was taking care of him and he wasn't yet used to it and he ended up chewing it to pieces (he could get his mouth under the front of the harness), so I would advise against leaving the harness on your dog. Our dog is now used to it but we only put it on him when we walk him.
summary: I can safely walk my dog!

reviewText: This harness works the best for my Portuguese Water Dog. She never tries to walk ahead of me and does not tug on the leash (as she does with the traditional collar/leash setup). Highly recommended!
summary: Best walking method for your animal companion

reviewText: This harness seemed to work as it claimed to, but my dog has very little hair on his chest/belly and so it chafed his armpits really badly (I even tried different sizes and they all chafed, so sizing wasn't the issue). If your dog has more fur or doesn't have sensitive skin, this may work well for you.
summary: Seemed to work, but chafed my dogs armpits

reviewText: These are excellent harnesses. I have bought nearly a dozen of them "over the years." I chose them bcs the pressure from pulling is borne by the chest and it's big muscles and bones, not the delicate neck/larynx.It's a martingale design, the business part of which is right across the front of the chest.They're just tricky to get on for the first couple of times bcs it sort of looks like a Gordian knot. The "un-fancy" part goes on the belly side (bottom of this part of the harness is at "six o'clock"). The fancy colored part goes across the back (top of this part is shown at "twelve o'clock"). The little metal D-ring (shown about "three o'clock") is where you hook the leash.I leave the black part fastened and have the dog step into the hardness, keeping the long side of the colored part (usually has a sewn-on label) to my right. (I am facing the dog.) Reach across the dog's back and snap the closure shut. Notice in the picture that the closure is about "ten o'clock".Bonus: A wiggly puppy learns how to "hold still"/"settle" while you truss 'im up!Highly recommend this harness. Give yourself five minutes to put it on the first time.mb
summary: most excellent harness - it may take you about 4-5 min the first time as you figure out how to put it on the dog

reviewText: This is a great harness that helped me enormously.  I have an active beagle who pulls when she smells something, which is ALL the time.  This helps me control her..would recommend this.
This works so well, walking my dog use to be such a hassle and i had given, being that i was being dragged down the street by my 100lb dog. He can still pull a little, but it is a great improvement

I purchased two of these. One was a medium and one was a small. I used the small on a 12lb silky terrier that had a ferocious attitude and would take of sprinting to attack ( i was afraid he would snap his neck at the rate he was running when the leash ran out). it worked great for him. Kept him from pulling so much and was very controllable However i also got one for what was my 3month old english mastiff (he is now 6months and 120lbs) so he had a lot of muscle. The issue we had was he has no hair under his armpits and it chaffed him alittle bit but still controlled him and worked well. i recommend this for any dog that dosent like being on the leash. The key thing is normal harness provide pressure on the shoulder blades which actually encourage the dog to pull (like a sled dog) this dosent. .

I have two of these - one for my boston who pulls terribly and one for my Maltese pound dog mix. Both of them work great at controlling the pace in which my dogs are walking. Some harnesses actually make the dogs pull more, but the way this is designed, it makes it uncomfortable for them to pull since the leash attaches at the front. It can be a little confusing the put on the first time, but other than that, I really like this harness. I had tried several other collars and harnesses on my boston before discovering this one, and I wish I had found it sooner. The only other thing that I had found that worked was a pinch collar, and of course I got lots of dirty stares from people who saw that on my little 16lb dog! I didn't like to use it, but he would choke himself with any other collar/harness. This one is the only other one that has worked.I have not noticed any issues with rubbing the skin as some people have commented. Maybe it's because my dogs are smaller, and they just aren't pulling in this harness.
summary: Works great for small dogs who like to pull

reviewText: I ordered this harness as a replacement for one that somehow broke while my parents were watching our dogs. The one that came in the mail is royal blue and black. It even came with a leash, which was a huge bonus. My only complaint is that, unlike the ones we ordered before, the straps on this one are smooth (they have a tighter weave pattern, which I assume is due to an "updated" design) and I have found that the metal slides that you use to tighten the straps tend to slide and loosen while we walk. Fortunately, just being on the harness is usually enough to keep my dogs from pulling too much and I haven't had any problems with the harness slipping off.

Walking my Samoyed was difficult with a regular leash on his collar. He'd get so excited he would practically strangle himself. This harness solved that problem. Make sure to keep an eye on where the strap passes across the "armpit" area of his leg. It's no problem with long hair dogs, but I can see how other owners had rubbing problems. Great buy!
I'm so happy to have been turned on to the harness by my vet!!  I take my shepherd for a walk & he does great with it.

The neighbor dog I occasionally walk went from puppy to dog and in the process grew strong, and headstrong. When he wanted to go THAT way, it was a struggle to keep him on track.I put this on him and it was like magic - no more struggles to keep him from pulling where he wanted to go.  Great product!

I have two of these things for both of my dogs.  They're constantly in search of cat poop or other things to eat.  I find myself constantly tugging them on the leash.  With just a collar, i'm tugging on their necks...sometimes a little too hard, unintentionally, of course.  With this harness, I can tug on them and not feel too bad because it's actually pulling at their entire upper body.The harness is simple enough to put on and remove, so it's not too much of a nuisance every day.  It really does do the job, so I'm happy with the purchase.

I love this harness. Its very easy to put on and take off. I feel much better using this then the collar BUT this doesn't prevent my dog from pulling or walking in front of me, she does better but still pulls but at least she isn't chocking.

I bought this after trying about 3 other harnesses.  None seemed to work until I got the Easy Walk. I originally purchased a large for my 85 lab, but it was tight. So I bought another one - extra large - for my lab. But it wasn't all that much bigger and won't last me long if my dog grows or gains any more weight.  I definitely recommend, but make sure you buy towards the larger sizes. It is much easier to size down on these.
summary: Great harness but size doesn't seem to match

reviewText: It works as indicated, however it comes loose while the dog is wearing it.  The front strap is the problem.  I finally took to stitching it and it is okay.  There should have been something to hold it so it won't come loose.
Fantastic! There is no reason not to buy this product. Now I can walk my dog and I NEVER could before.I call this a miracle harness.
Not a great fitting harness. The buckle rests right under my dog's armpits causing major discomfort and chaffing.  I would recommend buying the fabric type harness over this buckle type.

Very functional harness and definite works! Stop your dog from pulling for sure and easy to put on and take off. The buckle under the dog's 'armpit' is a bit hard to squeeze open due to the small width and takes a little getting used to. All my 3 dogs are short hair, 2 of them have been wearing harnesses of this brand for 2-3 years with no problem with rubbing their skin or breaking the harness (I'm buying this one for my 3rd dog). My only complaint is that the strap that goes under and across the belly is not Black as described, it's actually also red but maybe a shade or two darker; not that distinctive from the rest of the harness. I still rate it 5 stars since that's an aesthetic thing and not a functional issue.
The truth is that this harness does prevent the doggie from pulling.  Now I can walk my two Westies without dislocating my shoulders.

This is the best thing we bought for walking our dog.  She is so well behaved on this harness and it doesn't choke her.  It's a bit tricky to attach under her legs but she's little enough she allows it.  It has gotten dirty and I just wash it with a bit of dish soap and hang dry.  It looks good as new each time.  Our dog doesn't seem to mind wearing this at all.  I would recommend to anyone with a dog who tends to pull or if you worry about a dog getting choked from pulling to hard.
summary: awesome product keeps your dog from pulling

reviewText: Pet stores just as petco or petland or any other would sell you this for $30 dollars and in Amazon you can get it for $13 that is BIG difference when they are the same brand and wuality.

I didn't give it 5 stars because the under the belly strap hits my dog right in his doggy army pits and rubs them.  I don't like the fact that the clip for that strap is also right there.  He also manages to pull himself out of it if I loosen anything to help alleviate the chaffing. The front strap loosens on its own and he is able to grab it and chew through it.  I've tried adjusting it as directed, not sure if it's his build or the product.  I do love it though because he does not pull at all when he is on it.

This is a great harness if you've got a puller. My dog doesn't pull so much but every now and then he'll see a cat he starts gunning for. We used to use a regular collar during our walks but he yelped once for chasing a cat so fast and ended up breaking the collar. So we looked for options.Since this harness tightens when the dog pulls, thus making them uncomfortable, it helps in training the dog to heel. It's also safer since there are many buckles so if one were to break for whatever reason, your dog won't be exactly free to roam around.The S/M is perfect for my cockapoo, weighing approximately 16lbs and a chest girth of 19". The small was a bit too small and medium was a bit too big.One gripe, and really my only gripe, is that when walking on a loose leash, the leash clip bounces around and hits my dog's legs. Think about it, your dog is finally obeying you and heeling with respect but is constantly hit the the clip since it's just dangling there. You can't keep a tight leash because that will also tighten the harness and make it uncomfortable to walk. My solution, although it specifically says it is not recommended in the manual, is using a flexi leash. The retraction keeps a little pressure on the leash so the clip doesn't bounce around but not so much pressure that it tightens the harness. This is the only reason I took a star away but it's really more like 4.5 stars.Still recommend it for all dogs!
summary: Works as intended, but one flaw

reviewText: The Easy Walk Harness makes walking Sadie "our Labdadoodle" a pleasure. She no longer pulls.Except when she See's a squirrel--then she tries but is slowed down with the harness.I just wish there was a larger area for harness adjustment. The ability to tighten the harness is limited. The fit would have been much better for the many size dogs that prevail. Easy fix "Mr.Manufacture" it would benefit future customers.

Our dog started out as a puller, but she continues to improve with more training.  We had to use this harness temporarily as she was getting very difficult to manage, especially for my pregnant wife.  The harness is designed to tighten around the dogs chest when it pulls.  The leash also connects to the front, which in effect deters the dog to pull too hard as it causes the dog to veer from a straight line when pulling ahead.Unfortunately, this does not train the dog to not be a puller.  Eventually my dog learned how to pull through the leash, though it was a lot more manageable.  I recommend this if you're at your wits end with a pulling dog or if you need something temporarily to help get through training.
summary: Great for controlling dog, but temporary fix.

reviewText: My puppy always walked pretty well on leash outside of a few distractions now and then.  I got an Easy Walk Harness when he grew out of the first plain harness.  The gentle squeezing when he got distracted and pulled seemed to remind him that I was on the other end of the leash and brought his attention back to me.  I find it to be a good training tool.It is easy to put on and the dog does not mind it.  My trainer wants me to use the Gentle Leader because my puppy will grow to over 100lbs and it does offer a lot more control over the dog, however my dog prefers his Easy Walk Harness.  While he does walk much better with it, he hates the Gentle Leader and walks away when I pull it out, but when I get the Easy Walk harness he helps me put it on.  They do have their preferences.  LOL!Make sure you fit the harness correctly or you will risk not only the dog slipping out of it, but it will become ineffective as well.
summary: Works as a gentle reminder for distracted pups

reviewText: Works like a charm.  No more pulling. I have an 11 mo Brittany Spaniel who can pull me off my feet. With hardly any effort on my part, he will flip up slightly when he lunges forward. Great design. Works as promised. Better than the gentle leader on the face, he hated that.

This is a great alternative to a choker collar or a head harness, this allows the dog to be gently corrected when they pull. This was recommended by our dog trainer and I bought one for all 3 of our dogs. This is great for dogs that don't have issues pulling also.

My dog got used to this within a few minutes, and he stopped pulling almost immediately.  This harness turns the dog if he pulls, so the dog stops pulling.  He used to pull so much that he would choke and cough.

Went through two sizes of these.  Now that the puppy is full size he doesn't use it as often, but still use it from time to time as a reminder if he is getting bad.  If you have a wound up dog these are a must have.  Great for getting through the puppy curiosity stage.
summary: but still use it from time to time as a reminder if he is getting bad. If you have a wound up dog these ...

reviewText: Perfect.. It's the only thing that works for a dog that pulls.  He walks like he should.  We tried chokers but that didn't help the pulling.  He is a 105, 11 month old Newfoundland.  Walks great with this.

I have a 65 lb Lab that when walking on a leash at first was pretty good at "loose leash" walking with a normal collar, but has recently began picking up the bad habit of pulling out to the end of the leash.  It didn't bother me much but is not so good when the 6 year old is walking her.So I put this harness on and it works like a charm.  It physically forces the dog to turn and look at the walker when she comes to the end of the leash. I'd recommend this to anybody that has a dog that chokes themselves when walking.

It certainly helps deal with a dog that pulls but not completely.  If your dog is a 'super puller' this might not be enough.  I have an Australian shepherd and it works except when he is really wanting to go somewhere like into petco or the dog park etc.  Then he pulls like crazy even with this on.  The thing is though at least he won't choke himself with this.
Works very very well.  No pulling anymore.  Not made of very durable material, the dog chewed through it very easily.

This harness is easy to put on and is very effective in preventing our 50 pound wild man from pulling.  If you GoogleEasy Walk Harness Sizing Instructions Premier Petyou'll find a size chart and fitting instructions.

This is the most amazing harness! My adopted little 9 lb rattie is (was!) a puller! What a help it has been. I put this harness on him and it was like he knew what to do. He hangs back and follows me or stays next to me.It's a bit awkward for the human to keep the leash on one side of the head but we're learning together. This harness (although not to be left on without supervision) puts me in control of my dog. Give yourself a week to try it out. I highly recommend this over all other collars; especially the choke and pinch type.My only complaint, thus the 4 stars instead of 5, is that the front of the harness is a bit loose fitting once we get out on our walk. It is as tight as it can get elsewhere so I linked the 2 outside links together and it seems to tighten it up a little.

This doesn't work as well as teh gentle leader for long walks.  But, it works better and is more secure for my Houdini dog than a regular harness you could buy at the store.  So, I think it is good to have more than one system for your dog.  This paired with the gentle leader for longer walks is a great combination system for my puggle puppy who is very hyperactive.

I had a big black lab female,  that was trying to drag me all over when we walked.  I put this harness on her, and she quit pulling.  She still walked in front of me, which I didn't mind.  She got cancer last year and was put down  So I gave the harness to my daughter or their golden ret. mix.  It helped her slow down and quit pulling too.  Now I have a big goldendoodle,  so I will have to buy another harness fo her.

Pros:*  Easy to get on dog*  Easy to adjust*  controls dog pulling behavior*  made of durable materialCons:*  does not seem to correct pulling behavior*  you may become dependent on this one walking your dog, and not correct the problem.We purchased this one is to use our German shepherd dog. It was somewhat of a nightmare to walk him when he was a pup, and this harness made it much easier.

Since adopting my 60 lb. dog from the shelter 3 years ago, we've used the Gentle Leader. There's no better way to walk your dog. Our dog is young, very active and has a tendency to pull with great force. The Gentle Leader harness keeps him from yanking me down the sidewalk at a full run, which he would do if he could, and is a humane alternative to pinch and choke collars.It's also very easy to take on and off compared to other harnesses which you have to thread through your dog's front legs.I've only just now had to order a replacement because the plastic buckle broke. But it held up for 3 years of hard use so I'm very happy with the product.
summary: The best possible way to walk your dog

reviewText: I have a yorkie, and she was much too small for this harness.  I ordered a small, but it is twice the size of her, and never likely to fit.

This does not work as advertised.  My wiemeraner pulls just as hard as ever, just now she does it to the side.  I've tried every adjustment on every buckle, and nothing seems to work.  My suggestion.....  Be ready to return it, if it doesn't work for your dog.

I ended up returning this because I didn't like how it sat right behind my dog's front legs. It seemed like it would wear friction burn against her sides. Seemed like it would work ok though, she never really pulled enough while we were trying it out for me to see a benefit.

I just received this harness, so I can't attest to its durability (yet), but I felt compelled to write a review.  This harness WORKS.  Just like the picture of this product, I have a Weimaraner.  She's four months old, 37lbs, and a bundle of energy.  She loves going for walks and I'm trying to get her better with the leash, but it's hit or miss.  Sometimes she's good, but if she gets excited (which she does A LOT), sees another dog, or any random person, she lunges and jumps.  She's literally getting stronger by the week and getting harder to control.  I can't attach her leash to her collar; she doesn't seem to realize she's choking herself and causing raw marks around her neck.  I've tried the head harness, but that was a complete failure from the start.  I refuse to put choke chains on my dogs so I began trying harnesses.  Even those were giving her rub burns from pulling, even the Kong brand comfort harness.  After seeing this and reading the reviews, I decided to try this out.  The sizing chart was accurate.  The deep purple color matches perfectly with the collar she already has (and, might I say, looks gorgeous on her coat).  I had to adjust it to pretty much its smallest size, but that's ok since she's still growing and can grow into this.  Putting harnesses on her has always been more a two-person job.  She fidgets and bites and can't sit still to save her life.  I guess because this harness has only 3 straps instead of the usual 4, it was actually easier to slip on her.  She immediately started chewing on the front, even before I clasped it shut.  I'm hoping it'll hold up to her chewing; I'll update this later when she's worn it longer.  After leaving it on her for 30-some minutes, I decided to take it out for a spin.  It IMMEDIATELY had results.  She usually pulls and lunges right out the door, and a split second after she tried with this harness on, she felt the pressure of it across her front and stopped.  We walked out the front door at a nice calm pace, which she's only ever done when she was half asleep.  We got outside and throughout our entire walk there was no pulling.  At all.  That has literally never happened with her before.  As soon as she'd attempt to pull, she'd stop and there were a few times where she'd stop and turn to look at me, like she knew I finally won this battle.  Walking with her was an absolute joy.  She walked beside me the whole time and didn't try to run off after the neighborhood kids or my neighbors walking their dogs like she usually does.  I'll definitely update this after we've had it for another month or so just to give a better review on its durability with a dog who loves to chew, but so far I am absolutely ecstatic over this purchase.

This harness really works. I have a Jack-a-poo Jack Russel poodle mix and he is an really excited dog. Since getting this he walks next to me. Where before he would attempt yank me all over with his old harness.What really sold me on this was the one snap on and off. You can un-snap on top the harness falls to the ground or from the bottom and left over head. It is so easy compare to his old harness where I had to fight him at bath time.It does takes time to re-learn how to walk the dog. However after a couple walks my dog got it that if he pulled he would spin around. I think it took me longer to learn how to hold the leash then it was for my dog to not pull. I highly recommend buying one. I was laughing when I was told to get this. Now that I did I am like wow.Important: Make sure to measure dog Garth and to check company website for size information I brought a small / medium the grath was 19-26 which was too big off ebay. I had to reorder a small which the Garth is 14-19 which fit my dog which is 15.5  so be aware. A lot of sites selling this are leaving sizes information out. I brought small / medium because that how his old harness was. However not the same with this one. I had no idea on Garth until after I brought it.

My dog trainer recommended this for my dog who is reactive towards other dogs.  For some reason, it makes her feel more confident and relaxed and is really helping to modify her behavior.  And the "tweener" sizes are hard to find in the retail stores, so I'm glad I found one on Amazon.

I bought this harness not because my dog pulls while we walk, but because she got really good at escaping from her other harness when she decided she didn't want to go whichever way I was trying to walk (which was a frequent occurrence). This harness does the job, and tightens when she tries to pull out of it. She has only escaped from it once, when she pulled her front leg out of it somehow (haven't figured out how she did it, and it hasn't happened again).As for helping with her pulling, it hasn't really made any difference. She still pulls a lot, and is very strong for a 30 pound dog. One other comment I have is that even though I measured my dog's chest, and she fit the medium category, I had to tighten this harness as much as it would go to fit her, and it's still just a bit loose in the front. I'd have been better off getting the small harness even though her chest didn't fit that size range.
summary: Good for dogs that can escape a standard harness; sizing is a little off

reviewText: This harness would get five stars for design.  However don't let your dog's teeth anywhere near it.  The first time I put this on my puppy, I let her walk around in it.  It was a little loose, however she's growing so fast I thought I'd let her grow onto it. Unfortunately she was able to get her mouth onto the front part of the lease that has the ring. She was able to chew right through it!

My 75LB black lab loved to pull on her leash to the point of not being able to breathe. It would always complain that it felt more like plowing a field than walking a dog. After using the PetSafe harness, my dog has stopped pulling. She walks beside me and when she does pull (ie: she spots a squirrel), it could hardly be considered a tug before she stops. I love how the harness redirects my dog to stop her from pulling. I have heard of others using a choke chain, and I would never do that to my dog. I have suggested this harness to others and they've all thanked me for their recommendation. You will love this harness!

It took a little work to get the large harness fitted just right, but it's like walking a whole new dog!  This dog is a 7 month old Weimaraner - very stubborn and very strong.  He's pulled me to a run and also pulled me down.  I was actually fearing I may not be able to keep him just due to safety issues - his and mine.  But now we can at least walk to the mailbox and back without trauma the entire 1-mile trip!  YEAH for this harness - it really does work.

Our English Mastiff is huge, 251 lbs of muscle and bone.  He is extremely powerful.  Honestly, if he wants to go, Easy Walk or no Easy Walk he is going.  However, with training and the Easy Walk we have come to a stable peace in our walks.  He doesn't drag me and mostly walks on a loose leash by my side now.  The Easy Walk Harness was an excellent training aid.My word of advice is: Don't rely solely on the product to rein in your pulling dog.  Training is critical.  We use only positive reinforcement (clicker, treats and praise) with no aversive training whatsoever.  This works the best for all breeds in my many decades of raising dogs.  Mastiffs are a different breed entirely, extremely powerful and independent.I highly recommend this product for all breeds as a tool in the training to curb the pulling canine.
summary: Extremely Helpful In Controlling  A Huge Mastiff

reviewText: I bought this harness, not because my dog pulls (she doesn't really), but because it's so much easier to put on than the kind that go between the dog's front legs.  Our pup is a bit of a wiggler, so I thought it would make things easier.  And it did!  Except that it must have been really uncomfortable, even though it was properly adjusted because she walked SO SLOW with it on.  I felt like I was dragging her down the street every time.  She usually loves walking!Also, if you like to run with your dog, you should be aware that even the pamphlet that comes with the Easy Walk says you shouldn't use it for running.  Probably because of the chafing potential.  We returned this item.  They're so popular, and probably with good reason, but it just didn't work for us.

I fostered a 6 year old boxer mix that had never been walked, only let out in the fenced yard. She was a nightmare on the leash (stubborn, pulling, distracted) and it was pretty much impossible to walk her. A friend recommended this harness after seeing it demonstrated in her dog's obedience class. There was an immediate and drastic change in walking the dog the first time using it. She quickly understood and started walking nicely.  When she went to her new forever home, I sent the harness along wth her for the new family. I really dislike the idea of choke collars and pinch collars. This gently redirects their body, making pulling ahead difficult without causing actual pain or discomfort. I recommend it to anyone with walking issues.

My beagle has improved a lot with leash training but still pulls like mad when on the scent. This harness worked well, discouraging most minor pulling. I was pleased - until she caught scent of a rabbit and escaped in two seconds. Also, the straps loosened while walking. For safety we will be using a combo harness/martingale collar and two leashes.Update: Nope, even with the inescapable collar this harness is just no good. Even mild pulling/jumping when she is excited and trying to get at a squirrel etc. results in the harness coming right off. I won't be using this any longer.
Makes walking my dog so much easier and stress free.  Absolutely no pulling and much more control, even with a highly energetic 7 month old pup.
summary: Great harness, works like a charm

reviewText: I have a husky mix.  Usually, she walks by my side like a nicely behaved doggie.  But sometimes she pulls, and when she does, she pulls HARD.  Since she's not a habitual puller, I didn't want to use the muzzle-looking thing where you clip the leash under the dog's chin.  So we tried this instead and IT WORKS!  Stops pulling as soon as the dog starts!I didn't think so little a harness would be so effective, but it is!Note: my dog weighs 45 pounds and is 27'' around.  She could probably wear the medium/large harness as the small/medium just exactly fits.  The small/medium works just fine as my dog's weight doesn't seem to fluctuate at all.  But ordering a size up might have been wiser just for a little wiggle room for weight gain or heavy winter coats.

We adopted my our Boston Terrier puppy at almost 9 months old and she came to us having "not been trained" which meant that she had trained herself to, among other things, pull pull pull on her leash. Our dog trainer recommended the Easy Walk harness since the back-harness actually encourages the pups to pull more. It helped almost instantly! Every time she pulled, she would get the "quick-stop" that we were giving her before but also a very uncomfortable turn-around that she did herself. It's only 2 months later and the puppy who "doesn't walk well on a leash" (so they said) is getting better and better every day - she walks with a slack leash 75% of the time and when she does pull, it's not the constant force to go forward but rather the "Hey! There's something over there I want to smell! [yank] Oh, right..." Small dogs, large dogs, this is what you want!
This is the only harness we have found that actually stops pulling. Works like a charm and I've tried it on multiple dogs!

We have tried a number of leashes on our 50 pound dog who is sweet and cuddly in the house but turns into a real "beast" when he's out on a leash.  I usually take the kids on the stroller when walking our two dogs so this is a good leash to keep control of a large dog and still maintain the stroller on the sidewalk.  When he lunges I still have to use a lot of force to reel him back but it's the best leash I've found to control his over protectiveness.  Read the directions carefully to learn how to adjust it correctly.  I like the color contrast so I know that the gray part goes under his belly.  The only downside is that it is not an intuitive leash so when others have cared for our dogs, they are had problems putting on the leash.  I highly recommend this product.
summary: A little tricky to learn how to put on but great for dogs who like to pull

reviewText: I bought this for my male weimaraner. Since the photo showed it on a weimaraner I thought it might work. However it ended up not working well on him. He did not mind wearing it at all to him it was just another harness unfortunately he had the same felling when he wore it. He is not a constant puller, he only pulls/lunges when he sees something he wants to chase or someone he wants to say hi too. However being a big dog a lot of people do not appreciate him running up to them and I can't blame them because they don't know he is friendly. His other problem is sometimes wants to jump up on things like walls along sidewalks and anything higher than him. Now I did not figure it would help with the jumping just the prep run before the jump. Unfortunately I have a stubborn dog that did not care if the harness pinched up in the front he just kept pulling till he got to what he wanted.  Then he figured out if he turned so he was facing me and pulled backwards he could pull right out. You can imagine what trouble that causes.
