Luckily for me he was pulling because he wanted to say hi to the neighbor's dogs on the way home so I was able to catch him. I have heard from others that it works great for their dogs and I have seen it work I just can't trust it on my dog. I can still use it but I now clip the leash to his collar and the harness. I am planning on trying a head harness and a dual leash incase he slips out of that.
summary: Works but not for every dog

reviewText: This harness is great! The harness alone does not make my dog walk nicely but coupled with training my 9month old Cavalier King Charles Spaniel went from practically tearing up the ground and hurting my arm to walking like a pro!! We switched to this harness from a mesh harness and I was worried that this one would be uncomfortable for him but he seems just as comfortable in it as the other one if not more so. It is not bulky (so its great for the hot summer) and extremely easy to put on once you figure it out compared to other harnesses I have used. Also, this harness unlike some others does not seem to put any pressure on the neck in either the front or back.About the sizing: I have a 17 pound Cavalier King Charles Spaniel who is 9 months old and the tweener small/medium size is slightly big on him. When I tighten the harness to the tightest it will go it fits pretty good but still ever so slightly loose so if you have a dog around this size I would recommend getting a small.What helped our seemingly helpless leash-pulling dog walk like a pro:1. Stand up straight with good posture (this posture shows that you are leader - dogs react to body language)2. Walk and think confidently. While strong and confident, also remain relaxed, patient, and in good spirits (dogs are good at picking up on our emotional state.3. Hold the leash short but loose with a relaxed arm and shoulder.4. Make sure your dog is either at your side or behind you when walking and if he is pulling don't give in, only allowing him to be at your side until he gets the picture.5. Don't let him stop and sniff or go to the bathroom on his own terms - being able to do so is a reward and should only be done when told to by you.6. The walk should be much longer than the time that he gets to sniff around to show that you are the leader.7. Have your dog sit/wait upon opening the door and walking outside, allowing you to exit the house first and likewise have your dog sit/wait before entering the house, allowing you to be the first one in the house showing that you are the leader.8. Always bring treats with you on walks that you can easily stick in your pocket and use for rewarding for good behavior. Along with treats, praise and encourage your dog verbally and/or petting when they are doing what you want them to do! The first few times they walk nicely - reward them immediately. But as they start walking the way you want on a regular basis, treats can become more infrequent and eventually only one treat when they get back from the walk. You can also use treats on walks in other situations such as when they see a person or and don't bark, sit/stay still when you are picking up their poop, etc.9. Don't give up! How quickly and effectively get results may surprise you! If they are used to leading and pulling it may take some time but I promise that working on it for a few days to a few weeks to get them under control is definitely worth the time and effort. Our dog seemed to be completely hopeless after trying all kinds of methods we tried on our own and with limited research but after I did more research and followed these tips, he now walks like a "normal" well-behaved dog!10. Once you get the walk down (it will take practice and consistency), they will start to view you as the leader and trust you more which may even help with other issues like anxiety, barking, etc.10. If you have been consistent in trying these steps or others and your dog still pulls on the leash while walking - in my opinion it would be worth either taking your dog to some training classes offered in your area or hiring a trainer to come to your house as walks should be pleasant for both you and your dog, not stressful. And it doesn't get better on its own without intervention of some kind whether from you and whoever else takes care of the dog or a trainer. A few weeks of training will be worth years of peaceful walking.

This harness is a lifesaver! I used to train dogs and I cannot keep track of all the people (and dogs)I have helped with this harness.  It literally changes how they walk instantly and controls the pulling by turning the chest when they try to pull.  Most dogs don't like to walk sideways so they adjust their speed to walk next to you.  It does not hurt them and it is really easy to put on if you just keep the top clip together and only unclip the one that goes under their legs. When someone is having problems with leash walking this is what I go to first!
This worked perfect, it kept him from pulling during our walks and he likes it.  Would not recommend it for a young puppy, it would chaff skin under arm.

After much time spent putting this on my puppy and taking it off for adjustments I tried taking her for a walk with this and the poor puppy couldn't walk right.  The distance between the chest strap and the belly strap somehow wasn't long enough even with excessive adjustments and she didn't get a full range of motion from her front legs.  I did try one of the anti-pull leashes from this same brand and found they worked much better.  They have an attachment that goes around the puppy's nose and kind of turns her around when she pulls.  I'd say buy that instead of this if you have a Bichon or similar type of dog.

My 75lb dog gets a bit...hyper...when he sees other animals. Not aggressively. More like... "OMG FRIENDS!" So it can be difficult to keep him in check at times when another dog is around. This harness keeps him easily under control. After a couple of uses, he even stopped attempting to pull because he just knew it wouldn't get him anywhere. Perfect.

Great alternative to a head collar for walking any dog. Using a flat collar to walk your dog is harmful and standard harnesses are designed for pulling. Neither should be used on a walk. Head collars are great, yet some people are uneducated as to their use and view them as muzzles. So the Easy Walk is a great solution.

We have a Frenchton and she thinks she is always in a race.  She pulls, stubborn, runs, it was non-stop.  We put this harness on her and she took off running on her leash, it spun her around so she had to look at us.  She hated it.  After the third walk...she did just that, walked!  She knows her limits, she doesn't want to spin around and face us.  She turned into a non-pulling walker.  We tried everything and had no clue this simple little item would fix our problem so fast.  I highly recommend for a constant pull dog.
summary: Our racing, pulling dog is now a walker

reviewText: My 80 lb. Yellow Lab pulls and is young and strong so walks without this harness are a constant battle of wills and feats of strength. The Easy Walk harness gives me a fighting chance of exerting my will and managing the walk so we're both happy. Love it.

The right buckle keeps irritating my dog's right leg. We tried tightening the harness, and its still not quite right. We have a feeling that this harness was designed for more 'typical' shaped dogs. Ours is short but long. Our dog also slipped out of it a couple of times which was quite dangerous.We have tried fitting it to him a couple of times, adjusting everything we could and following instructions, and it just isn't quite right. We bought a medium based on the girth size, and maybe we should have gotten a small. But this would still not solve the problem of the right buckle that is so close to the leg. (We noticed that the instructions with the images never shows the right side of the dog's body too with the not-so well placed buckle.)
HAVE A SMALL STRONG DOG WHO LIKES TO JERK MY 87 YR OLD MOM AROUND. THIS HELPS CONTROL HIS HYPER PERSONALITY
This is a good tool for training a dog that likes to pull.  You still have to work on leash manners, but this definitely makes it easier.

I bought this harness new from an auction site for about half the price here. I intentionally sought out a lower price because after all, who doesn't want to save money where they can, and because I was leery that this harness wouldn't work.  That being said it is made well and after a few days of using it, I feel like I got it at a steal.  I love my pups other harnesses because of their look and security features but even though my dog is only 8 lbs, he can pull hard. His past harnesses did nothing to help him stop pulling.  I tried using treats to subdue the behavior but he is so excited to go for a walk that he doesn't care about treats.  His walks are treats.  He pulls so much that he will walk at least a block on his back legs, like a person.  This harness is definitely correcting the behavior.  On our first walk with it he pulled a couple times, slowed down and started walking by my side, actually walking like a dog instead of a furry little human.  Several times I noticed after every four or five of my steps he would look over at me to see where I am like out of an episode the dog whisperer.  I can't say this will work for everyone but so far my experience is very positive.The most difficult thing about the harness is getting the fit right.  Using the measurement guide I wasn't sure if my dog needed petite, or petite/small, so after measuring him a couple times he fell in between the measurements of both harnesses.  So I went with the lager one.  The petite/small is a "tween size"  a tad larger than the petite, but smaller than the small.  I am glad I went with the tween because there isn't much room for error in the sizing.  There is maybe about two inches of room to grow on the belly strap, an inch on the top strap and it could have been a little smaller on the front strap that crosses the chest.  But since he is only 9 months old he may still need a little room to grow.  So I feel better having the larger harness.  I adjusted it to his body per the instructions that comes with the harness and the fit is pretty good.Worth a try for those who love the security of a harness but dislike choke chains.

We have a pug who does not know how to walk on her leash and after trying several products, we've finally found the one that works.  I've tried a lot of "training" harnesses that she simply does absolutely nothing. Unlike most other dogs, she also has no snout so she cannot wear things like a gentle leader nor training collar or any collar due to the fat that they can easily develop collapsed tracheas. I do admit that this harness is a little bit hard to figure out at first; however, once you get the hang of it, it works very well.  Make sure that it is on your dog properly and snug. This is an absolute must for pug owners.

we have bought and returned several of these because either the plastic hook was broken enroute or it just didnt fit. we finally found the right size for out overzealous cockapoo and it's working wonders. He's more mindful during his walks, and when he does pull, he has a quick reminder not too.a word of advice. Alot of people have complained that this leaves red welts on their dog's underarms. This happened to us to until we tightened the parts that go around his ribcage and slightly SLIGHTLY loosened the part that attaches to the leash. that way it's tugging, not tearing. It's worked wonders.

I'll cut to the chase. My 2 bulldogs escaped these harnesses the first time they wore them outside of my house while @ the park. They have been raised since pups wearing harnesses, & they are my 3rd & 4th bullies so I know what I'm dealing with. The straps were as snug as I could safely make them. (The "non-pulling" properties were marginal @ best, for my strong pullers). The 50 pounder bolted out of hers when she saw another dog, as I was running after her, the 40 pounder slipped out of her's en route. Fortunately I was eventually able to grab them, but it was a near disaster. Observe the design of this harness carefully, it's a very "open design". If your dog is strong, determined, and has a smooth coat, he will escape. It is NOT a secure harness. Soon as I got back home I went and plopped down 100$ and bought 2 of the "Ruff Wear Web Master Harnesses". Their the ones I wanted in the first place, but was trying to save a buck. For me, a harness absolutely has to be secure and in-excapable, it's more important than whether or not their pulling. The "Easy Walk's" minimalistic design needs serious improvement.
summary: Be warned, dogs will escape this one

reviewText: My hubby and I thought that it was hard to figure out how to put it on the dog.  Then we discovered we had it on wrong, the part where you attach the leash goes below their mouth, not on their back, like most harnesses do.  My dog has a 19" girth, but the medium is too big, it fits my pug good.  A few times my yorkie mix walked out of the harness, but he seemed to like it otherwise.  So I tried it on the pug, great fit, but he kept sitting down and refusing to walk, I had to take it off for the rest of the way home, then he walked fine with the leash attached to his collar.  I liked that it had 2 quick release areas and it was easy to put on the dog, once you know how.  I am going to get a harness with the leash D ring on the top and a smaller size for the yorkie mix.

I bought two of these for my pair of standard goldendoodles. Neither of them are really pullers but they're overly enthusiastic greeters - they adore people and other dogs and want to lunge forward to meet new friends as quickly as possible. Unfortunately this has been a self-rewarding behavior because strangers seem to feel the same about them ("ohhh wooga wooga cute puppies must hug and squeeze and love") so before I get a chance to correct they're in the arms of their new bestest friend in the whole wide world. Anyway, yeah, you get the picture.Suddenly this behavior is self-correcting because if they lunge forward I just step sideways a bit and they're suddenly spun around and looking at me - exactly the opposite of what they really want. It only took a few walks with each dog for them to grasp the idea that they'll get what they want faster by staying close to me because if they're not lunging I'll keep walking. They're happy, I'm happy, and my back is ecstatic.The only thing I'll caution is, as other reviewers have mentioned, the sizes seem to be off. Fortunately I stopped at a local pet store first and tried both the medium and the large on my guys (who each weigh ~70 pounds). One was way too small, the other way too big, so I ordered the medium/large from Amazon and it is a perfect fit.

It states Med. but is almost too small for my two westies (and they are only 20 lbs.) The larger size was nice and wide but WAY to big and the med. was to thin. Its a shame there wasn't a Med. in the thicker band and JUST A BIT BIGGER. There was a big difference between  the two sizes..

Our 17 pound Puggle has never been a good walker.  She was more like a puller and no amount of positive reinforcement or negative feedback would work with her.  Until a coworker told me about this harness.She measured borderline in between a Small and a Small/Medium.  I ordered the Small/Medium first thinking it should work with adjustments.  But it was soon obvious this was not going to happen.So I returned it and ordered the Small, even though I did not realize I would have to pay return shipping.  What a difference it made.  She seems to like it and is adjusting to us hooking the leash under her neck now.  She now walks at our sides and doesn't pull at all.Thanks for the speedy overnight shipping as we were about to go out of town and I wanted the harness to take with us.It is a little awkward to adjust but we persevered and it now sits on her at a perfect "T".

These are a great invention, designed to stop a dog from pulling while on the leash. In essence, the design makes it so that a dog that pulls, is actually moved in the opposite direction from where they are trying to go. Dogs quickly learn to stop pulling, so that they go in the direction they want. A wonderful, long-lasting and well-made harness for a really reasonable price.
summary: This is a great harness for dogs that pull on the leash

reviewText: This harness did help with heeling and pulling for walks but one day my dog pulled one of his front paws out and was able to back out of the harness; luckily we were in a fenced area. Be careful of sizing, won't be using this harness again.
summary: My dog was able to back out of this harness

reviewText: The product was a godsend as my older dog's throat is now sensitive to leash/collar pressure.  It gives me the ability to walk her comfortably with some pulling correction.  This is not to be used with the Flexi leads that encourage pulling.  It does get caught up under my dog's legs from time to time, which is a pain.
summary: It works but it does get caught up under my dogs legs

reviewText: To be fair, I tried it once and it just didn't work.  Maybe I wasn't using it correctly, I will retry when the weather gets nicer and we start to walk again.

harness. i still use this its been about 2 months . i have a boxer lab thatlikes to pull [stillapup] hes doing alot better not b.c of this he learned how to walk on a leash withou choking himself. would recommend use with rogz brand also found on amazon. sadly the D ring that attaches to the leash broke off the other day. i luckily saw him jumping around the yard before he left n go in trouble. i still use it thou hook it thru one of the other rings on the back.

This didn't work at all for my dog. I constantly felt like he was going to slip out of it even after I made SURE I had properly adjusted it. My dog is 95lbs and is a very strong puller. He also has slipped out of this harness by pulling hard and stepping over the front when pulling backwards. Even if he wasn't getting out of the harness it doesn't seem to make his pulling any better at all. It seems this has worked for so many people, and I was really hoping it would work for me, but it seems my dog is to strong and pig headed.
summary: Maybe it works better for other dogs....

reviewText: I have a Morkie that loves to tug at his leash. This helps, but not completely. It's tricky learning to put this contraption on, but the color coded straps make it easier, but not easy.

Works great, the first time I walked my newly adopted Chihuahua/Terrier mix he tried to take off after another dog and instantly did a full body roll. After that, no more pulling and its the only harness allowed in his CGC class. Runs a bit small, if your dog is on the cusp of the next size consider moving up.

The product help with pulling issues but he product chafed and irritated my dogs  underbelly and under the arms. Adjustments to fit did not resolve the issue. It may have been the breed of dog I have, but there was no indication of restriction based on breed. The company provided a prompt refund.

My dog must have an odd shaped body because for the life of me I couldn't get this to fit him how it said it should in the instructions. I measured him and everything before purchasing and followed the instructions to a T. Oh well.

I can now walk 3 dogs easily.  I don't know who the genius is that came up with this but it is absolutely amazing.  I would have never dreamed I could walk my dog plus my two foster dogs together.  Walking one dog was already tough, much less three.  One weighs 60lbs, the other 43 and the other 46lbs.  All 3 years old and under.  None of them pull anymore.  I can actually even stop and pick up dog poo and enjoy the walks with them.  I don't know why this thing works so well, but it has really made my walks wonderful.It is also easy to slip on and off of them.  Other harness type devices I have used required some maneuvering and cooperation of the dog.  This one is just slips over their head and then clips around their chest.  If it needs to be adjusted it is also easy to adjust while it's on.  I'm so impressed.  Now I want to be a professional dog walker and just use these things.I'm going to order an extra one just to have as back up.  Highly recommend.
summary: I can't say enough good things about this

reviewText: This harness is exactly as advertised.  It is good quality.  I bought it for my growing puppy and it has worked out well

I bought this to help deter my pit mix from pulling.  It definitely worked as promised!  It took about 2 weeks or so and she was done with her pulling stage.  Its a great tool to help out when you're trying to curb this bad habit.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because it was a little confusing in the beginning trying to figure out how to put it on but maybe it was me & not the harness ;)
I got this for my 7 year old dog who knows nothing but pull pull pull. She walked just fine with it.

We measured our 4 month old American Staffy based on the criteria provided from the manufacturer and chose the recommended "medium" size. Despite that, the one that arrived did not fit as it should. The front strap was way too loose even at it's minimum size. The material is also of the hard and abrasive variety - possibly nylon - with no padding, which worries me that my short-haired dog would eventually lose hair or chafe under her arms with extended use. Also, this may be due to none-ideal sizing but I found that the Martingale loop, as opposed to a centered loop on the front strap itself, caused my dog to walk at an angle instead of forwards. To rectify this I connected the lead to both the Martingale loop and the loop of her collar, which makes me wonder why it wasn't just designed that way to begin with.I can see where the harness has the potential to help deter pulling but I never got around to fully seeing that come into fruition. I'll likely just buy a different harness altogether. Or even better, we'll just try to put in the extra effort to teach her to walk on a loose leash.
summary: It's hard to tell when it doesn't fit.

reviewText: I used to use the gentle leader which is a leash that goes around the dog's snout.  My dog hated it and would constantly drag his face in the grass when out for walks.  This harness keeps him from pulling me and is much more comfortable for him.
summary: Dog prefers it over gentle leader

reviewText: We purchased one of these on a whim for our pit bull who just does not stop pulling. THIS THING WORKS! I swear by it now. Seriously at the pet store if I see owners looking for a harness I take it upon myself to recommend this one. We've since purchased another for own new adopted dog as well and it works for her too! I've even bought for friends and family because I believe in the product so much. It is tricky to put on if you don't know how, check the box. You wont be sorry on this one. Buy it!

This is the first front attaching harness I have ever used on a dog.  It is very awkward walking the dog.  He has to be right at your side the whole time or the leash tends to wrap around his body.  I find myself stopping the dog all the time to swing the leash to one side or the other so he will be comfortable.  It does stop his pulling more than just attaching the leash to his collar.

I've tried several sizes of this harness on my 30lb beagle/coonhound. They've all reduced pulling in various degrees, and they keep my dog from choking himself while trying to pull, so they deserve praise for that alone.However, I will say I'm pretty disappointed with this product by itself. The first harness we tried (a medium) had a shoulder strap proportioned perfectly to fit around my dog, but the chest strap couldn't be tightened enough, and so even though it did prevent pulling, it was primarily because the chest strap kept falling down over my dog's legs, preventing him from moving his front legs very effectively. We decided to try another size when the strap actually caused my dog to trip and fall on some stairs. We tried a small and a small-medium, and settled on the small/medium, which proved to fit the best, though even when it seems like it should be perfectly tight, the chest strap moves up and down, restricting my beagle's leg movement.I was ready to ditch this harness and try something else, when I had the idea to leave his regular neck collar attached, and attached the leash to BOTH the harness and regular collar. By doing so, the collar keeps the chest strap of the harness from moving down, while the harness prevents pulling and doesn't allow my dog to choke himself on the regular collar. This combination has proven to be pretty much perfect for us, so I like the product, but without the additional collar, I think this product feels incomplete (at least for my dog).Every dog is shaped differently, and these harnesses seem to work great by themselves on larger dogs and smaller dogs, so take my recommendation with a grain of salt. If you have a medium dog, though, I would highly recommend trying the method I mentioned with both the collar and harness attached together- its made walking my dog a LOT more enjoyable.

Firstly, we have found Premier brand's new Citronella battery-operated Anti-Bark Collars with on/off switch for Dogs to be quite efficient a majority of the time, in that Dogs seem to bark more selectively.  So, we still have a watch pooch but not a yapping pooch!  And, the Citronella Spray Refills are easy to use in refilling the spraying mechanism container on the collar. Do check battery often. Do check collar often to maintain appropriate tightness/looseness so collar does not fall off. Do refill collar at least daily or more often to maintain consistent spraying of Dog when barking to reinforce selective barking habits. Amazon.com carries Premier's Anti-Bark Collar, Citronella Spray refills and batteries at competitive pricing.
summary: Premier Citronella Spray Refills for Premier Anti-Bark Collars

reviewText: All this spray and collar taught my dog was to avoid the spray. In fact, she looks like a prize fighter bobbing & weaving to avoid being hit!  In addition, now she's totally afraid of anything that we use in a spray form.  This includes Chill Out and other beneficial (not punishing) products.  I would try another form of training instead of this method.

This spray and collar combo works. My only issue is that I wish I would have learned how to use it as a tool, not a crutch to stop bad behavior. I can't walk past an insect repellant aisle at the store without thinking of my dog because of the smell.
THE SMELL WAS PRETTY GOOD TO PUT IN THE MACHINE SO IT WAS NOT BAD WHEN IT SQUIRTED AT THE DOG

I had a can of the Premier Spray Sense Citronella Refill for Anti Bark Collar which I'd purchased elsewhere and it did not work properly in refilling my dog's collar.  I had no recourse because it was an "as is" type purchase and it would not have been practical for me to pay the return shipping and then take a chance that the replacement would be operational.  The cans I've purchased from Amazon have been functional, arrived quickly, especially w/ the Prime membership shipping, and my dog really hates the spray it produces, and that's just what I wanted.  As for refilling the collar, even when the device seems to be filled, after a few days, I top it off and I always test the microphone and battery by blowing into the device, with the spray pointed way out from my face, of course, before putting it around the dog's neck.  If the battery is dead, then the spray will not dispense and it is simply wasted in the reservoir while your dog may continue to bark.  If your collar device ceases to operate even with a fresh battery and a full reservoir, then contact the Premier people and they are eager to guide you in testing and then remedy the situation if the device is faulty.  They provide excellent customer service for a product which has reduced the stress of my dog, neighbors and eased my conscience when I have to leave my old dog for long periods of time.  A single can lasts for weeks for us, but if you have a vocal dog, I'd recommend purchasing two cans at a time so you're not caught without citronella ammo.
summary: Fills the collar device with no problem

reviewText: This works great with the collar. However, if you have a dog that eventually gets used to it, then it's useless.
summary: works fine, unless the dog gets used to it.

reviewText: I love the smell of citronella and this anti bark collar is a true deterrent to barking. What a humane way to break this noisy habit

I took our dogs about one hour to figure out how far they could walk from the base. I can understand that not all dogs are this easy to train but I am only relating my own experience here.While I am only reviewing the collar here, or maybe BECAUSE I am reviewing the collar, anyone who does not have the 'base' unit should understand that this collar will be useless without the base. The way it works is like this:- The base is a radio transmitter.- The collar is a receiver tuning into the base's frequency.- For as long as the receiver stays within range (90 ft. max, I believe), nothing happens.- When the receiver comes close to the boundary, the collar emits some buzzing sounds, letting the dog know that danger is near.- If the dog ignores it and moves farther away, the dog gets zapped - there are 6 or 7 intensity levels.- If the base is not transmitting, the dog does NOT get zapped.- If the dogs runs away and does not know how to get back within range, the zapping stops after 30 seconds, I believe.Other features:- Uses a PetSafe battery - can get a pair at Amazon for $6-7 and it lasts for a couple of months.- When the battery is about to run out, there is a little blinking light on the zapper that tells you it's time to change it.- If you don't do it, soon after the battery is out of juice you will know that it is so when you see your dog chasing the UPS truck.Like I said, our doggies learned their limits almost immediately and they learned that as soon as the collar started to buzz or they got zapped to run toward the house.My only issue with this is: why $100+ for the collar alone? Oh, well... if anyone else could make these things for less, please do. You will get rich, quick.
summary: Works well but it's not exactly cheap

reviewText: just like the original

We returned this because of the limited area that it covered.  1/2 an acre really isn't very far.  I'm sure this will work perfectly for someone that a smaller yard, but for those who have a larger yard, I would recommend the newer version (which covers up to 3/4 an acre) or, better yet, the more expensive  Havahart Wireless 5134G2 Radial-Shape 2 Wireless Fence  which covers several acres.
summary: Returned... because of the limited area that it covered

reviewText: Excellent system. Has worked extremely well for my two retrievers. Both can be stubborn, but respond really well to the wireless containment system by PetSafe.

We've got three dogs and this collar works great on all three. Two of the three like to go swimming in our creek (we've got our fence wire strung across the creek so they've got access to the water) and we have NEVER had any problems with the collars. One of those two also likes to dig and quite often gets her collar jammed up with dirt and mud - and it still works great. Occasionally we'll forget to check the batteries and the dogs will eventually notice that there's no warning beep and will get out of the yard, but that's the only time in three years we've ever had any issues at all - and of course that's not a problem with the collars but with us getting complacent because the batteries last so long. We also love being able to use different settings for each dog because one of our dogs needs the highest setting and another needs just a little warning to remind her of the fence (the other is in between the two). Because of the layout of our property it's impossible to put up a solid fence, but this electric fence with the adjustable strength collars is definitely the next best thing. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!

I have four large bull dogs and hate to keep them caged, but if I don't they will find their way to the highway and get hit by a truck or car.  I own two of the pet safe wireless fence systems and have purchased two additional collars.  Now all four dogs can run and play all day while I don't have to worry about their safety.  I have to change their batteries every four to twelve weeks but it's easy to see the blinking light when it's low.  One of my females constantly test her boundary by walking up till the collar beeps then stepping back while the others conform and stay back from the fence line.  The constant testing uses more power thus her battery is changed more frequently.  I buy the aftermarket batteries and the name brand but can't say that either one is better than the other as long as they are fresh.  The last ones I bought were less than two dollars each in a ten pack I will rate them after I have used eight or ten of them.  Great system
summary: A great way to let your dog run free

reviewText: We bought an extra collar to go with the PIF-300 system, so we had a collar for each of our dogs. The first one was very difficult to set, the button was much farther in than the collar that came with the system. Having one collar that was easy to set and one near impossible, I contacted the company. Absolutely no problems with getting a replacement. The new collar arrived and it is much better than the one I returned, but still not as easy to set as the one that came with the system. I also have to check it, because the dog was standing with it going off and didn't seem to feel a thing. It was on the same setting as the one we sent back and that made her whimper.
summary: Had to return one, replacement is a little better

reviewText: no wires, no fence just an audible signal then slight shock.  two years later my dog stays in his boundaries even without the collar.

I bought this because I wanted my dog to have a little more freedom.  I live in a rental house with no fence in the yard.  I take my dog for walks but he is a high energy dog and really enjoys running around.  I tried training him to stay with me and come while called outside but he was easily distracted by bunnies and squirrels.  I then tried taking him to a family member's house so that he could run in the fenced in yard, but he quickly found a section that he could jump over.  I was definitely nervous to use this the first time.  I have no problem disciplining my dog but I thought this might be a little too much.  I took him to the fenced in yard and let him off the leash.  He ran around and wouldn't come when called so I gave him the beep warning.  He didn't come again so I gave him a light buzz (setting at 2).  He immediately came over and sat next to me.  Later in the day he jumped the fence and started to take off.  I followed him and called to him to no avail.  I beeped and buzzed him at a higher setting before he made it to the road.  Again he came right back.  While I don't like hurting my dog he seemed fine with it, and it's a much better alternative to him running into a busy road.  It's a great trainer and work extremely well.
summary: I was nervous to use it!

reviewText: I bought the main unit from an individual and they had no collars. So I picked up some collars and the unit seemed to work okay. We have a hill on our property though and it didn't seem to work when they went down the hill.
summary: Didn't Work for what We Needed

reviewText: We have used this pet containment system for years and love the protection and freedom it grants our dogs.  We ordered this as a replacement to a collar we lost and it works great!

My dogs lives would be so sadly different were it not for the freedom they get with our wireless containment system.  The collar we'd had for 3 years started malfunctioning so we had to purchase a replacement.  I thought 3 years was a pretty good run and did not mind having to get a replacement.  It is well worth it for the peace of mind I get with these on my dogs.  They have freedom to run and play in the yard and I don't have an ugly fence in my yard.  Both dogs learned the system easily and were not harmed or traumatized as they learned and received a correction a time or two.  A time or two was all it took, and they knew their boundary, knew the warning beep.  It works so well that when the one collar started malfunctioning, we were able to go an extra few months before replacing because our dog knows her boundary area so well and doesn't even need the beep anymore.  But not wanting to tempt fate we finally ordered a new one.  We are sold on PetSafe and thier products.

My brother had previously purchased the PetSafe wireless fence for his dog.  I bought this collar so I can take my dog to his house during the day and leave him outside.  All I had to do was put the battery in the collar and it immediately worked with his system.  My boxer was very quick to realize the boundaries of the fence and was only shocked a few times.  It has several settings on the collar as well that let me set the right level of shock needed.

I purchased this item along with the PetSafe wireless pet containment system. Since I have two dogs I needed another collar unit.Overall I am very pleased with the system. Even though it is expensive, it was a better alternative for me than having to get rid of my dogs when I moved.It has taken two weeks for me to feel confident about leaving the dogs alone in the yard and I'm still watching them pretty closely.Overall I'm very pleased with the system.
I have 3 of these I use for feral cats in the winter.  They work great, keep the water thawed no matter how cold it gets.  The cats really appreciate them.

I've used this bowl for several years.  It's convenient to plug this into an extension cord during the winter, and once spring arrives, its back to the galvanized tub for my large dogs.  This bowl has kept the water drinkable and unfrozen even when it's been below zero here.  Highly recommended for outdoor kennel dogs.Allied Plastic Heated Pet Bowl,  5-Quart

This bowl passed a month of teens and single digit temps with flying colors.  We have several concrete bird baths that squirrels and birds drink out of all year long.  Before freezing weather began, I cleaned them out and placed these 5-quart heated pet bowls in bird baths.It takes a 300-400 watt bird bath de-icer to keep a standard concrete bird bath from freezing.This Allied Heated Plastic Pet Bowl only uses 50 watts and does a much better job at half the price.The critters adjusted almost immediately.It sure was easier than breaking up icebergs every day.Cleaning is a breeze.  Just swirl a bottle brush around the bowl a few times, empty and refill with clean water.One other positive is when these 5-quart bowls are placed on the ground, because of the high sides, they don't collect windblown leaves and debris quite as bad as the smaller bowls.  Even so, we do use both sizes because of the feral felines that depend on us for food, water and a shed to sleep in.
summary: PASSED THE 6-DEGREE TEST WITH FLYING COLORS

reviewText: This is the sixth winter we've used this bowl ~ actually altogether we use 3 bowls ~2 of this bowl & 1 K&H; Brand we bought a couple years before these.We've never had water freeze even in the coldest Indiana winters.1 1/4 gallons of water fills the bowl completely to the brim.The thermostatically controlled heat has to warm the bowl more as the temperature dips,that also means the water evaporates faster.So it's not only animals consuming water that we have to keep an eye onit also the fact that water evaporates away quicker ~ the colder the weather ~ the more the bowl heats.The 50 watt heating unit is waterproof  & can be popped out and replacedbut we've not needed that done yet.It can also be remove after the winter season, which allows year-round use of the bowlwith-out dealing with the cord.The six ft cord is wire wrapped to keep it from being chewed on.The base of the bowl is 12" diameter & 5 1/2" tall ~ with the heating unit being 9" in diameter.The 3" difference leaves a 1 1/2" perimeter cavity for storing the cord up in-side the bowl.After the cord is tucked inside ~that cavity assets in nesting bowls which minimizes the room they take up.This bowl does the job ~ with it's 50 watts ~ but the water evaporates a bit quickerthen our K&H; bowl does using 30 watts, (current K&H; bowls are 25 watts)and the K&H; bowl never lets the water freeze either.K&H; bowl takes up more room ~ it's 13 3/4" across the base & 5" tall.The bottom is completely sealed so there's no storage feature for the 6 ft steel wrapped cord.We use two bowls for animals and the third is for birds.We sit a bowl on top of a board across our cement birdbath and it works just fine.It's deeper then a birdbath but none-the-less ~ the birds use this just fine each winter.

We purchased this product because we live in Winnipeg, where the winter temps go down to -40 degrees Fahrenheit and we needed a large enough bowl for the use of feral cats when we go away. This product works quite well. Some ice has formed above the surface of the water but there's still plenty of ice free surface for the cats to drink from and it's been very cold recently with lows of -10 deg Fahrenheit. The water does not evaporate as quickly, too, which is a good thing when you're going away for a few days so you can fill it up only once every 4 days or so.

I ordered 2 of these heated water bowls and they work great for the feral outdoor cats that I feed and water each day.  What I really like about these bowls is that there is a regulated type thermostat that will make the heating unit automatically turn off when the outdoor temperature gets above about 40 or 45 degrees.

These are nice thick pieces of sweet potato. I cut them into smaller pieces for my 10 month old Chihuahua to chew on.He originally showed no interest in the product but after a few days he started licking on the pieces laying around. Now he likes to carry them around and kinda chew on them and then leave them alone for a day or two.Anyway, great packaging, they smell delicious (I'm half tempted to chew on one myself), and seem like a good product for the price.
summary: I like it, my dog...not so much

reviewText: My golden just loves these sweet potato rawhides. I like the fact that they have more nutritional benefits than traditional rawhides and they are safer too. I just wish a package would last longer. Oh, and I would break into smaller pieces for smaller dogs and don't overfeed (one piece per day is more than enough or you'll be picking up bright orange poop)

These are great treats for my older weim that does chew the hard stuff.  It is also great to give as I am leaving with a kong to keep them busy.  Great treat without all the calories, especially for the older one with bad hips.
These were recommended by a vet office because my dog was allergic to raw hide.  Unfortunately my dog got the runs using this product so we quit.  Other people swear by it.
And they are made in the USA. I do have to break some pieces up for my chi pup but they are a big hit!
My dog loves these treats. Delicious, nutritious and made in the US.  The only ingredient is sweet potato, so it's super healthy. They keep my dog busy too. Thanks
Great nutritious snack.  My mastiff loves them ....great alternative for rawhide; keeps her busy for an equally as long if not longer than traditional rawhide.
I got these as a gift for my Aunt's dog and he loved them.  He could eat the whole bag if we let him.

My dog loves this treat. I love it is JUST sweet potato. My dog loves it's chewy quality.HOWEVER.........................What made this a 3 Star deal, is it's high price and the fact that 3 pieces had to be tossed in the garbage as they appeared spoiled. The bag comes with about 15 large pieces of potato chew, so when you have throw out 3 pieces or 20% of your product that sucks.So sorry my K9 buddy, these treats are tasty but we won't buy them again!
I bought these as a natural treat for my allergy prone poms. They seem to love them. so far so good. no upsets but they are quite big so give half to small dogs.

Our dogs love these treats they would have them eaten in one day if they could. a little on the pricey side wish they were cheaper so I could buy more but they love the them. And they are good for them.

my dog loves Sam's Yams treats.  they definitely don't last as long as a rawhide bone, but I feel good about mixing these sweet potato chews into his diet.  they don't upset his stomach (and I suspect they actually aid in his digestion, but I'm not a vet or a nutrition expert.. so that's just a guess based on our experience).
I am trying to replace my dog's snacks with a healthier one and she just loves these sweet potato chews. Not only are they better for her but she enjoys chewing them.
She won't touch raw hide or other stuff I've tried but these she loves. She is a true vegan dog...what can I tell ya. :)

My dogs love these all natural freeze dried sweet potato chews - keeps them busy while we're eating dinner and helps to keep their teeth clean.  No gross animal products like pigs ears are and they don't stain the carpets - easily digestible, too.Highly recommended - why let your dogs chew on other animal's body parts when they could chew on these?

Keeping this short and sweet.  I have two large dogs with allergies - chronic yeast infections in their ears - so I am limited to treat selection.  The minute I opened this bag up my two 'girls' were all over me, snouts woofing and tails wacking wildly away.  My girls are often indifferent to the various treats I have purchased for them.  Not the case with these, they devoured them instantly and then begged for more.  Highly recommend these treats - and you can subscribe and save!
My dogs absolutely love these and I feel like I'm doing something good for them.  It takes them a few minutes to eat versus a regular biscuit.
summary: Lab and Beagle LOVE LOVE LOVE these

reviewText: I've been feeding Sam's Yams since my late Boston terrier, Bowser, developed skin allergies.  Now that Bowser's gone, I still feed them to my puggle Daisy and my mixed-breed Derby.  Not only do the dogs love them, they help keep their teeth clean and breath fresh.  A bit pricey, but worth it.  I try to get them on Prime so I don't have to pay shipping.

My dog loves these, and I love that they're a healthy treat, but he can power through a large one in about 5 minutes.  I wasn't expecting them to last like a rawhide or a bully stick, but they're expensive considering how fast he can consume them.  I did notice that these treats, along with some water, would prompt him to "go" pretty quickly, which is awesome if you're trying to time a walk but maybe not so great if you're going to give your dog one before crating him.  I'll get them again and dole out sparingly.

We have made it a point not to give our dogs animal rawhides as they are not that great for their tummies.  Typically, we will buy a bone (yes, actual animal bone) and let them gnaw on that.  So now we have about 20 bones for our two dogs as they stand up fairly well and just don't go away.I was looking for a alternative to the bone, yet not quite as simple as a dog biscuit (which are gone in seconds!!).  These sweet potato rawhides are great!!  It took the dogs about 10 minutes to get through one and they seemed to really enjoy them.

I think I liked the idea of these better than my dogs liked the taste! I am a vegetarian and looking for a rawhide alternative for my 3 lab mixes. They never turned these down, but did not beg for them either. Not meant to last as long as rawhide, quickly eaten by a teething puppy and made for colorful poops in the yard!
Our dogs loved these so much. They are tough and so it takes them time to chew on them, but it keeps them occupied and engaged. Love these treats!
My dog loves these and they are healthier than rawhide treats.  But I think only one a day or his stool would be soft.

Our dogs don't like these.  I was hoping they would because they are a healthy choice for treats.  I tried them with my Cavachon, and my brother's Rottweiller.  Neither dog will eat them.  For me, these were a waste of money.  I suggest asking a person who has some if you can try theirs BEFORE you buy them for your dog.

My tiny Yorkie loves them. For her I cut it small for her little mouth. It is a clean product and gives her something to chew on besides bad stuff like rawhides and bones that wear down the teeth. At least it is nutritional. Don't give your dog too many a day as sweet potato can affect the hormones.
summary: Nice to know it is made here in the usa without additives

reviewText: A friend had told me about these natural treats that help to clean my dogs teeth, and they love it. I used to give them rawhide treats but they started to swallow them........WHOLE, and afraid they will choke!! With these, they take their time and chew. I get these for my big dogs and the SamYams Bichon Fries for my small ones.

I won't give my dogs anything processed in chemicals and these dried sweet potatoes fit that criteria.  The dogs love them.  They were a little bit big for my terriers to chew but given 5 minutes, they managed!  My German Shepherd gobbled them up.  They are expensive so I won't be buying them again and that's a sad fact!
Dogs seem to really like this treat. . . I buy using the subscription rate to lower the cost of the item.

I was looking for a treat that was a source of fiber for my dogs.  Three of the four dogs loved them.  The one who didn't is extremely picky so I wasn't surprised.  I don't feed my dogs rawhide so I can't compare the two.  My only hang up is the price.  The medium sized dogs (45lbs & 37lbs) had these gone in seconds so they aren't long lasting treats if that is what you are looking for.
I GAVE THEM 3 STARS BECAUSE I KNOW OTHER DOGS MAY LOVE THESE, BUT MY DOGS WONT EAT THEM. OH WELL.

at first I thought my chihuahua loved these. She worked on it for quite a while and that's certainly a great accomplishment because she's picky about what she's willing to chew on. Then on another day I gave her one and she dissed it. Go figure. I liked them because they're not made in China and unlike Beefeater's sweet potato treats that are chewy, these are downright hard. I really wanted my dog to like these. She just doesn't.

My dobe, Bear, has enjoyed Sam's Yams chews, cookies and bones since he was a puppy.  Because Sam's Yams require more focused chewing than typical training treats, the chews, cookies and bones were integral in a training routine to encourage my rambunctious puppy to stay down and calm on our "front porch" as neighbors, kids on bikes and cars moved past.  What began as training has become a ritual which is our favorite part of the day.Recently, at the advice of Bear's vet to address a chronic skin condition, I changed Bear's diet to a single novel protein source and eliminated all GMO ingredients. To that end, I contacted all of the vendors of Bear's treats including, of course, Sam's Yams.  To our delight, Chef David and Sam's Yams sweet potato grower assured us that Sam's Yams do not contain any GMO ingredients.  Happily, Bear's skin condition has resolved and he continues to be one of Sam's Yams greatest fans.
So simple you'd thing you can just make it at home - but I sure don't have the time!  Mini schnauzers love it.  FYI - It does make their poo orange.
my dog loves these. she has allergies so these are perfect as a substitute to raw hide chews, though they don't last as long. they make her poops chunky and orange afterwards.

If you've got a dog with superpowers of chewing, these treats do seem to satisfy. Our catahoula blows through one in about 5 minutes, but he really seems to enjoy it, and I do think it helps with digestion and regularity.

My Chi girl loves these. She gets excited when she hears the word "potato".They are made in the USA, and are natural. =)Make sure to verify where your pets treats come from, as there are some that were just recalled that were made in China.My little girl was having trouble with "dry stools" (sorry, I know this is gross), but the fiber content in these has dramatically changed that and now she is having healthier stools! So it is a treat that that keeps her occupied for a while and helps her insides to be happier and healthier! The clinic dogs love them as well. As soon as I open up the bag to get one out their noses go straight up and they start sniffing..which leads to begging for one! =) I only give my baby 1 a day, as more than that would exceed her calorie limit for the day, and I think it would lead to loose stools, which no one wants! Ha!
summary: My 4.8lb Chihuahua loves these! So do her doggie friends that live at the vet clinic I work at!

reviewText: My 5 lb Yorkie just loves these. I feel that they're a good healthy treat for her. Yes I recommend them.
I like to give my dog edible treats whenever I can to provide fiber. I have tried both made in the usa and made out of the usa products and my dog only likes sweet potato products made in the usa.
summary: made in the usa products are the way to go

reviewText: I have 7 small dogs, weights from 8 to 12 lbs. They love the sweet potato treats so I thought I would try these. I buy a LOT of dog treats because I give them a treat-a-day, they really look forward to it, so I try to mix it up for my furry kids, They took these from my hand but never bit into them. They are still laying around my house uneaten, untried, untouched. That is not to say that these treats are bad by any means. It just means that my dogs did not appreciate them as other dogs have on these comment pages. I only rate it one star based on my dogs reactions & taste buds, it does not mean that the treats are bad, they just did not rate (as a tasty treat) on any of my doggies scale but it might for your dog.
summary: Out of 7 Dogs None Would Eat These?

reviewText: I bought these as an good all natural USA made treat and the date on it was November 2013 for expiration date. When I opened it the sweet potatos had white fuzzy mold on them. Amazon is taking them back and will refund my money. BUT, I also called the company and talked to a really nice lady. She apologized and said if a hole gets into a bag and moisture builds up, they will spoil. I hung up and she called me back. She asked if there was a small white moisture packet in the bag and there wasn't! So, that is what happened and I would try buying from this company again as errors happened.  And lets support USA made!
Giving her the best food and treats not only make her happy and healthy but makes us feel good about it too.
summary: Make me feel like I am tkaing good care of her...

reviewText: Healthy treat for our dogs, perfect for our large cocker spaniel mix but a little too large for our toy poodle.
My tiny Maltese finds this too hard . . . could be she's also too spoiled.  She doesn't chew it and we end up throwing away the pieces.
summary: My dog won't chew on this

reviewText: My dogs used to get rawhide for a few minutes each day but then I discovered these. I have been using them for over three years and my dogs love them.  While not as tough a chew as rawhide I feel better about what they are consuming.

Since I found out my dog is allergic to beef, and since most of the chicken "jerky" is made in China, this is a great find. My dog LOVES these. They're hard enough to keep her teeth clean, and they have only one ingredient, which is great for dogs with allergies.
summary: excellent for teeth, great for allegic dogs

reviewText: Our beagle loves these - almost too much. She dances around in circles, "asking" for one every day. She has some food allergies, and these never bother her.
summary: Actually it's our dog that loves it

reviewText: great for my 2 little dogs that can't manage the big pieces of sweet potatoes.  I just love giving treats to the dogs that are so healthy for them

reviewerName: Lisa at Fresh Eggs Daily "Lisa at Fresh Eggs ...
reviewText: Our Corgi loves to chew and I don't like the idea of him eating rawhide after rawhide. Fortunately a fellow corgi owner recommended this product to me and Winston just loves these sweet potato rawhides that are much more nutritious and healthier for him. I will be reordering these.LisaFresh Eggs Dailywww.fresh-eggs-daily.com

The "pieces" in the bag can be large and my dog is only about 14 lbs, so I just take a sissors and cut the piece size I want to give her.  They don't last long; she loves them.  She gets these about 3 to 4 times a week.  What I like about it is that there are no high process additives.

I was skeptical- but had to stop giving my dog rawhide because of a health problem and sweet potato is one of the things he's allowed to have, so figured I'd give it a try. He likes regular sweet potato just cooked and mashed ok, but isn't terribly enthusiastic so I was afraid he'd be the same with this. No, he absolutely loves them! Doesn't take him as long to eat as a rawhide but they're still pretty substantial.

My dog LOVES these! They also haven't made him choke or throw up EVER which is a big deal for my dog.  My only complaint is that they don't entertain him very long. I wish this was something he could gnaw at for 10-20 minutes but instead this is more of a treat item that he finishes within 5 minutes.These also work really well as a subtle laxative for my dog when he has accidentally gotten too much human food and doesn't seem to be doing his bathroom business as well.
dogs love them.  small to large dogs, we cut them in half for the smaller dogs. great buy for the price.

My dogs seemed to like them...but there are only 6 chips in a bag. I paid almost $7 dollars and with 4 dogs they're not going to last long. Just not worth it for me. I would recommend if the price want an issue...but I won't be buying them again.
summary: Good...but not much in the bag

reviewText: My dog loves these. I cut them up for her as she is only 12 lbs and she gets a piece every day. At the mention of a sweet potato, she always comes running. I love that they only have one ingredient, as my dog has allergies and doesn't eat beef, chicken or grains. I use them as a greenies alternative. In December, I bought this bag from amazon and it was moldy upon arrival. I emailed the company with some pictures and they explained that since their product used no preservatives, just a bit of water in the packing stage could lead to mold very quickly. They sent me a new bag promptly and threw in several samples of their other wonderful products. What great customer service! I will definitely keep buying these.
summary: Great product, great company and great customer service

reviewText: A great treat and chew toy for my 35-pound mutt.  I like that the sweet potato "chips" are not as much as a choking hazard in comparison to rawhides.  It is quite expensive for a simple product like dried yams and doesn't last as long as a rawhide.

This is a copy of my review for this product but in the "Big Boyz" size.My puppy gets one of these every day.  As much as he loved the regular size, this 'Big Boyz' size make him even happier.  As others have said, they don't last very long with an excited, 60 lb pit mix puppy, but they are well worth it - especially with the S & S program.  Guru loves the smell and the flavor of these treats and I like that they are an alternative to his mostly meat-based food and treat diet.  The facts that they help clean his developing teeth, work his gums AND are made here in the US are all added bonuses.To quote paraphrase from another reviewer, I love my puppy and these premium treats are the perfect way to reward him, help keep his teeth clean and help him feel the love.  A well-loved, healthy puppy is a happy puppy!
My dog loves these and their a great ,healthy, treat- all yams. They don't last long their not like a bone but still makes my maltipoo very happy.

These were a good treat for our puppy. I don't think I will be purchasing more for a while however because of the price. I really liked knowing they were healthy and good for our dog. She was able to chew them very fast, so for the price, this is not the kind of treat I want to give her. I was hoping they would take her longer to enjoy, but that was wishful thinking.

I have a 75-lb American Bulldog mix, and he can get through one of these in less than a minute. However, it's long enough to keep him distracted while a bicycle goes by. When the bike gets close he'll jump a little bit and act like he's about to open his mouth to bark, but he's a smart dog, and he realizes that if he does that he'll lose his precious sweet tater, so he gives up on the whole bike attack deal very quickly.
summary: Great for a distraction on walks

reviewText: My dogs love them and they're good for them, too.  My vet recommended rawhide chips for  my dogs' teeth, but my Lhasa Apso is allergic to almost everything, including beef and potatoes, which is what most of the other non-beef rawhides are made from.  These are 100% sweet potatoes and great for dogs with allergies (he's not allergic to sweet potatoes) and he loves them.  You should see the look on his face when he knows I'm reaching for the bag: it's priceless!
I have 4 standard dachsunds and 1 german shepherd and they hated these treats. I gave them away to my local vet.
My Teddybear loves these treats. I bought them during a lightnin deal so the price was ok. Wouldnt again only due to a high price point, otherwise there great.

My dogs love these things.  They are nice and chewy so last a bit longer than normal treats.  They refer to these as veggie rawhide.. I don't think they last quite that long but I would never give my dogs rawhide - it causes so many issues.. can cause a blockage and potential death.  These are a super option - great quality and made in USA.. and they LOVE them!
summary: Doggies love these and Made in USA!

reviewText: Good treat, made in the USA, pooch likes them, they take a little longer to eat than some treats which is good!

The dog loves this! It's also healthy and supports a varied diet. It's vegetarian and the salt content appears to be low. My Rhodesian eats in a few minutes, and for smaller dogs you can break them into bits. Shipping was fast and fresh from Amazon.
summary: Great healthy vegetarian treat for dogs

reviewText: As a great treat these are lacking but as a chew substitute they are ok. I am trying to bring my dogs along with us in going veterinarian and these will get them by but they don't love them. I have a younger pit who will eat anything... so far so she's game. But my 8 year old pit is not so happy with the treat situation but will eat these after give the other non meat choices.Update! Well we finished the bag and they both are really warming up to the yams as they haven't had any other chews so I am ordering more bags. So I have revised up from 3 to 4 stars.
summary: Takes some time to switch over from rawhides

reviewText: I can only write this review from my dog's reaction and I must say it gets 5 stars.  To be fair, though, she gives 5 stars to most everything.  They look good and smell good.  She thinks they are super good so there you have it!

With the recent scare on dogs dying from sweet potato treats that are made in Asia, I looked for an American made product that my dog likes. Finally I found this. My little dog is very happy and I trust the source
These are a good treat for the dogs; all natural.  The dogs like them which is the whole point so if they are happy I am happy!

My dog likes these a lot. I have a sheltie lab mix and I try to only purchase products made in the US with natural ingredients. Sweet potato is great for dogs and they tend to like it. After just one treat my dog does tend to have orange poop so be aware this could happen to your pup. All in all I like the treats, I would only give him one every few days. I do wish they took longer to eat and would keep him busy for longer than 2 minutes.
summary: My dog really likes them. Not a treat to keep a medium sized dog busy though

reviewText: My dogs eat them up and I feel good about giving them something made in the USA and more healthy then many of the treats on the market today.  You never know what they're made of.  With Sam's Yams you know exactly what you're getting.
summary: Sam's Yams are an excellent healthy treat

reviewText: These sweet potato rawhides work as advertised, they seem to be a high quality, our puppy would spend more time softening it before chewing on it, now he bites into it with gusto. some of it comes right out when he does his business but he seems to be ok with eating and digesting it. We typically break the large ones into two so the medium sized ones for dogs below 50 lbs works perfectly well. Sam's Yams is a high quality product and comes highly recommended by a 10 month old English black lab :-)
summary: Good stuff our 10 month lab loves it

reviewText: I got this in an attempt to find treats/chews made in the U.S. that my dog would like. I gave this a shot to replace his Dingo brand twist chips made in that dreaded China. I can't believe how many dog products are made there...it's just terrible!Fortunately he likes these. I got the smaller bag in case this didn't go over well but will get the 1 lb size from now on. I do cut the larger pieces in half as he's a smaller pooch.What I got was fairly flexible, not hard or dried out and I found nothing wrong with the quality. Not exactly long chew time but...he hasn't had choking issues or anything negative. Yes, there will be orange bits in their stool, nothing to be alarmed about as far as I'm concerned, lol.  I'm happy my dog likes these as it's a much healthier alternative then rawhide as well. I'm just happy it worked out and will continue to purchase these. 2 paws up

i researched dog treats for over a week before settling on a few products, this being one of them.  i wanted something made in the usa with quality ingredients for my pup, and the sam's yams meet both those criteria.  They are still a bit big for my pup so i break them into smaller pieces but he loves them and they entertain him for longer periods of time than the standard biscuit treats.
summary: a nice different kind of dog treat

reviewText: My dog's are pretty pampered pooches, and they are extremely finicky about what they eat.  They also vomit if they eat anything that isn't really healthy.  THEY LOVE SAM'S YAM'S!  I like the product because it is only Yam's, nothing else, and my dogs tummy handles it without vomiting.  I want to feed my pup's healthy food; if I wouldn't eat it, I won't give it to them, either.Great product!  I can't say enough good things.
Dogs don't particularly like it.  They eat some of it but leave the edges.  I could leave it out for days before they touch it.
Dogs like it ok when mixed with their hard food but it is soupy Seems like use too much water in production of this product
Dry food seems to have lost its vision for my 11 year old  dog soo added this felt good about the ingreadents and so does he ...
I'm very happy with Natural Balance canned dog food. My elderly retriever mix loves the taste. I mix some with a good brand dry kibble. I know my senior dog is getting good nutrition.
My pup loves this food and it is great for her! I mix it with her dry food and it is a huge hit! I am considering trying other flavors.

When buying dog food, it's not about the taste for the dog, it's about the quality of the ingredients.  This is a high quality dog food.  I use it for my dachshund and my rat terrier.  I have to keep the dachshund thin and the diet venison does the trick.  Natural Balance was recommended by my vet for it's nutritional value and the dogs love it.

We use this as a supplement for our dog who eats the dry version.  We use it for frozen Kong treats instead of fatty peanut butter and other treats.  He loves it and it keeps his digestion regular.  Natural Balance is definitely more expensive than other brands, but you know what you're getting with this and it can help dogs with allergy/digestion issues.  We did find that our other dog doesn't like the flavor of the food, even dogs can be picky!

Our Vet is very much into quality nutrition for our pets and recommended this dog food.  Right away you can see the difference from a good quality food as opposed to the bargin brand.  The food is so clean and doesn't stick to the can like the cheaper ones that are filled with grease and fat and all kinds of other horrors you need to know about.  Do you know that our dogs and cats have been eating diseased animals, in addition to eating the remains of their own species who have been euthanized.  Did you know that the makers of dry dog and cat food spray used grease on the food to make it more palatable?  Well, they do.  These things and more are what we've been unknowingly feeding our pets...food so dangerous that the incidents of cancer amoung our cats and dogs is running rampent.  Quality food may cost more, but I'd rather pay a little extra than have one more of my pets die from cancer.  Do yourselves and your beloved pets a favor, feed them a good quality food.  Others besides Natural Balance include Royal Canin and Blue Buffalo, plus more.  The higher priced foods in your grocery stores (Iams, Science Diet) are on the list of BAD foods.  Do a little research, you'll be shocked by what you discover. I highly recommend this food.
My dog absolutely loves this food!  Scarfed up his first can in 2 gulps! I plan to keep buying it for him, as it is a welcome change for him.  He still gets his dry food, and thinks this is dessert.

My mini schnauzer is allergic to corn and soy and this is the first dog food I have found that doesn't make her sick and/or itchy.  I don't know where the previous reviewer shopped but I just got home from Petco and realized I could have saved seventeen dollars if I had bought the same items from amazon.com.  I will be buying my dog food here from now on.  Amazon also offers more of the 'limited ingredient' line for allergy-prone dogs like mine.

My dogs absolutely love this dog food. I only use this to supplement their dry food but they would have no trouble eating just this. I had a problem with 2 half-empty cans in one case and the manufacturer replaced them and then some very quickly. They also like this brand of dry food.
I think my dogs where getting tired of their regular grocery store can dog food.  I researched all the natural brands and decided on Natural Balance.  They gobbled it up and wanted more.

Great dog food. My Pooch has serious skin allergies and use of this product has cleared up his itchy skin without having to use steroids and such which he had bad reactions to in the past. Definitely recommend this to anyone who has dogs with allergies to the store bought dog foods.
I don't like it, my dog loves it, as with all Natural Balance pet food.Even the treats are her favorites.....
After trying so many other dog foods, NB was the only one that solved skin issues and bad poops. My big dogs are so healthy now.

We use these foods along with the dry food for our dogs.  Their health has improved since we eliminated grain from their diets.  They are not losing hair anymore and eat this voraciously..  Ton't use anything else.

It is as advertised - the limited ingredients keep his very delicate digestive system running great. I have to try the duck, though. There's no real enthusiasm as he eats this flavor canned, or in the kibble. His skin and coat look great, so nutritionally, it's excellent.Shipment of cans via Amazon isn't so great - despite lots of plastic air pillows, they shift in transit and some cans inevitably get dented. Since it's one of the few items that isn't much cheaper on Amazon - except it is not sales-taxed yet - I'm likely to buy single cans in different flavors, locally.
My dogs love Natural Balance dog food.  They particularly like the Venison and Sweet Potato canned food.  Limited ingredients providing great nutrition, so what's not to love?
summary: Natural Balance Venison and Sweet Potato

reviewText: My small dog will eat this but she prefers a stew type of food.  This food is a paste type and does not mix that well with her dry kibbles.

MY YORKIE DOES NOT LIKE THIS FOOD, ALTHOUGH HE IS VERY PICKY WITH WHAT HE EATS.  I MAKE A LOT OF HIS FOOD, SO WHEN I TRY TO GIVE HIM SOFT FOOD WITH HIS VITAMINS AND MINERALS IN IT THEN HE DOES NOT WANT IT.  IF HE GETS REALLY HUNGRY THEN HE WILL EAT SOFT FOOD.

I feed my dog this food occasionally as a treat, because I normally cook for him.  I give him meat and veggies with enzymes, probiotics and liver and kidney supplement all from Mercola pet nornally. He likes this as a treat for something different!
and that is why I can't often get it.  When I ordered it, I did it by mistake, thinking it was something cheaper, but I sure got thanked by Diesel.
I have 5 small senior dogs. 3 have food allergies so this was a great alternative to cooking for them

WARNING! This product contains CARRAGEENAN, a thickening agent made from red seaweed that promotes tumors and cancer in animals. The cans are also not BPA-free which can lead to health problems, as well. There's been quite a bit of research done on this ingredient(most if it ultimately advising pet owners to steer clear of it). The only studies that claim it's safe for pets are, of course, industry funded. Most canned pet food contains carrageenan, even the high end brands. Search online and you will find several petitions to remove it from the market because of its associated health risks. I no longer purchase foods with carrageenan (for either my dog or myself).  I just hope the damage isn't irreversible.It's upsetting and irritating that "premium" pet food manufacturers would sneak a cancer causing ingredient with no nutritional value to their unsuspecting customers. We buy their products because we believe them to be unquestionably safe and of the highest quality. We love our pets too much to take unnecessary health risks. Maybe they'll take notice and change their formulas when sales drop.Some quality brands that are free of carrageenan are Nature's Variety Instinct, Weruva, Fromm, and Lotus. I have given my dog both Nature's Variety and Weruva and both are highly recommended (although, unfortunately, neither company uses BPA-free cans).
summary: WARNING! This product contains CANCER causing CARRAGEENAN!

reviewText: Very pricey?  Yes.  Good nutrition?  Yes.  Dogs like it?  OMG, what an understatement!  One "allergy dog" wants this exclusively - the other yappers get the rest of the can added to their grainless dry food and think they're in heaven.
My finicky eater likes this food, but the packaging isn't very good. A lot of the cans were bent. Fast shipping, but not sure if it's worth it. There are other sellers that sell this food.

The problem with that is.....that only 1 of the 8 dogs, a new rescue Border Collie, has allergy issues. So I have to fight off the other 7 when breakfast and dinner are served !The Border Collie can be a picky eater, so naturally I was a bit apprehensive about the first serving I put in front of her. Should not have been concerned: she licked her bowl clean.I gently warmed in microwave to just room temperature.I'm not sure exactly what she is allergic to so it's a process of elimination at this point. She will be on this wet food as more of a treat and her dry food is Costco's Nature's Domain grain free Salmon and Sweet Potato, which I swear looks the same as Natural Balance dry of the same combo! If this does not cure her itching, fur pulling, paw chewing etc. I may have to bite the bullet and go for full allergy testing. This is my last option. Supplements of every kind you can think of have done nothing to help her.I must wonder if this is the reason someone dumped or abandoned her.So I highly recommend this as an apparently great tasting wet dog food. My 8 rescue dogs certainly woofed it down !

Spend it on dog food, or spend it at the vet!  I've had quite a few dogs of different breeds with iffy tummies. While it is not the least expensive even in the better brands, Natural Balance has been my lifesaver for little companions to German Shepherd service dogs for many years now.My aging small breed companion has issues with chicken allergy, and turned up his nose at lamb (which smells terrible), duck, fish, ad infinitum. Once we discovered NB Venison and Sweet Potato Limited Ingredient Diet, we were home free. He doesn't want anything else, and we're now doing the same formula in the dry.Thanks for a wonderful, safe dog food and thanks Amazon Prime for making this option affordable for folks who can't get out to the pet food stores.  Try it for your special dog.
summary: Best quality dog food I've ever fed my dogs

reviewText: Got these for my daughter since her dogs were starting to upchuck their brand of food.  Guess what, no more upchucks!

We tried this item, approved by our vet as a substitute for a more expensive prescription brand.  Our dog loves it, and it's good for him, too.  We were especially pleased that the order came promptly, and was well packed with no dented cans.  The only minor quibble we have is that the texture is rather mushy ... but our dog just keeps licking out his bowl until it is clean, so it's not a problem.
summary: Our dog loves it, and it's good for him.

reviewText: My dogs go bat s*** crazy for this stuff. Don't need to use a lot since and smells really good to humans too. The only thing is my pointer mix likes to take her food put on floor and roll in it....weird.

I originally purchased this food when my dog was having a dry skin issue and didn't like the fish oil I purchased. By using the wet food to help disguise the fish oil she was eating just fine.  With the exception of the beef she really loves this food.

this food is well worth the price. my dog LOVES it. this is the only food she eats, mixed with the sweet potato & venison dry food. has completely taken care of her allergies. love that it gets dropped off right at my doorstep!

This is a great toy for various reasons.  First, is the squeaker in it.  But when that fails like all squeakers in dog toys do, it still is a great flying disk.  Then when the dogs manage to rip the center ball to the point of flapping just cut the ball portion out and you have a great disk with a hole in it.  I love this disk in the winter because it is easily seen in the snow and doesn't get soggy when it is wet.  I have one dog likes the toy when the squeaker is in it and the other when I cut the center out.

My dogs really enjoy JW Pet toys, although I no longer buy the ones with the squeaker because they're super annoying! It took about 6 months before my dogs killed the squeaker in this toy. As for the type of rubber, its not as hardcore as the "cuz" toys by the same company - its softer, like the bowling pin toy that JW Pets makes. It shows a lot of teeth marks from my dogs, but it hasn't been ripped apart.
It was fun for a couple of days and the dogs loved it...but not for heavy chewers!  My dogs chewed through the ball within a few days
summary: Didn't last long for big chewers

reviewText: The idea is pretty cool, the squeeker was pretty good but within minutes my 8 month old puppy ate the edges off in chunks.  Not recommended.
