It's very durable and it has a squeaker, which is a plus for my squeak obsessed puppy. At first she was frustrated at how difficult it is for her to squeak with the large bulb in the middle being difficult to squeaze with her mouth. (I got the large and she is 40 pounds, so maybe this is my fault, could have gotten medium?) She loves to chew on it and so far she hasn't caused any damage. She is a very bad chewer, but not a powerful one. I have been getting her more rubber toys to chew to encourage her final baby tooth to come out, which is starting to feel loose, so its a victory.I was intending to throw it for her to chase but it seems to be more suited to chewing, due to the weight of it. This is fine with me... Much cheaper to chew on something like this than to get expensive surgery to remove a single baby tooth.
summary: My dog LOVES this thing, but its akward to throw.

reviewText: One of our dogs loves balls and the other loves frisbee ... This is the perfect combo for our pups!
summary: Replacing one we loved to death

reviewText: This was easily destroyed by my dog, even though she doesn't normally chew fetching toys. The perforated rubber gave her a weak spot to exploit, so she did. Can't recommend it for big dogs since it doesn't last.

Got this for my squeaker loving Doberman.  We play with several Frisbee's of the cloth type but was hoping to get one that squeaks as well as flies.  This squeaks great but leaves much to be desired for the flying part.  It does fly, but not very far due to the weight and he never catches it in the air like other Frisbee's but waits until it hits the ground and then grabs it.  He does enjoy the squeaker part.  If you throw it vertically, it will land and roll on the ground a long ways so there is potential there for those dogs who like to chase things.

Excellent product. Flies very nicely and is convenient. I have a small dog and the small size is just right for my 10 lb. Havanese. Easy to pick-up for the dog. Not for big dogs or extreme chewers. As with all dog toys, supervise its use.Update 11-11-12: This is durable for my small dog, and has a nice squeeker, but it drops fast, is heavy, and does not fly far. I recommend the soft edged fabric type as it is light, kind to the mouth, easy to pick-up for the dog, durable, and flies far; folds into your pocket, too. I, and my Havanese, do not recommend this JW Whirlwheel.
my energetic standard poodle loves this toy.  he chewed off the squeaker after a few months, but he still plays with this toy daily.  great for throwing.

We had one of these for a long time until the new puppy decided it was his favorite toy. The problem was we couldn't find a new one anywhere. Finally found it on Amazon and bought a couple of them. Our dogs just went crazy over these, and we had to take them away for a little while so they could calm down. The large is a bit too big for the little guy but would be fine for a big dog.
This isn't his go-to toy, but he does enjoy it.  He tends to enjoy it most, late at night when everybody is trying to sleep though.

I have a dog who's a vigorous chewer and is hard on toys.  As a terrier, he'll often put a toy in his mouth that slam it from side-to-side (as if he was breaking the neck of a rat) or slam it against the ground repeatedly We no longer get anything that has stuffing in it.  Most toys last a matter of days, sometimes only hours, before the squeaker has been destroyed or it's been torn/shredded in some fashion.This toy has stood the test of time.  We've had it a year, play with it several times every week and it still squeaks, it is still in one piece, it isn't torn.  Contrary to other comments, I am able to throw it like a frisbee.  It won't go 50 yards.  But it will sail.  And when it lands it takes funny, irregular bounces (that a dog with prey drive will love--like an animal being chased, seeking to avoid the hound).Now, if you have a dog like a Rottweiler that is big, has big teeth, strong jaws, then this toy may not stand up to that--you'll probably want to get a lacrosse ball (the ball that LAX players use for HS and college lacrosse).  It won't squeak but is better than the hardest Kong for vigorous chewers.  As for me, we'll keep using the Whirlwheel toy.  We love JW products in general and this one in particular.
summary: Very Durable, Great Design, Worth Getting For Your Dog

reviewText: I purposely got the large Whirlwheel for our 8 month old pup and five minutes out of the box, she has found the squeeker and I roll it on the floor for her to fetch.  I don't know how long the squeeker will last but she still can have fun dragging it around and playing fetch.  It is another winner in our toy selection!  The order was packaged well and arrived one day after I placed the order...thanks Amazon!
summary: A great fetch toy that squeaks!

reviewText: Got this in green. This is my german shepherds new favorite toy. I thought it wouldn't be durable because of the tinnier rubber material, surprisingly it is still in tact. My dog carries it around every where and seem to favor this more than his other toy Cuz. Would purchase again.
My pitty tore this to shreds in one day... better yet in about 30 mins.pretty dissappointed, but that's what you get with a pitbull.
summary: Not that hard to tear apart...

reviewText: It seems sturdy and like something other dogs would love but BigDog just wants to chew on it.  Maybe he doesn't know how to get excited about chasing things other than cats.
summary: it's just not what he is interested in

reviewText: I bought one of these for my Border Collie and he chewed the squeaker part out of the toy in 3 days.  He had a complete and total BLAST with it for those 3 days though and since the squeaker part is in the center of the frisbee it's still usable and he still enjoys playing with it, just not quite as much as when the squeaker was still in there.So not the best for toughness... but still a fun toy that he continues to enjoy.
summary: Not the toughest of toys... but my dogs still love it.

reviewText: We purchased this as a gift for our friends lab mix, Rufus. He is very ball oriented and loves the water, so this is the perfect toy for him! He will chase it for hours. The ball center helps it float, provides an additional mouth grip and it's easy to throw like a frisbee. Rufus chewed on one half of the ball and it still works like a champ.

We're now on my 5th or 6th of these.  My dog plays rough:  she love to squeak the toy and does it endlessly while chewing on it.  She's a 60# dog but we buy the smaller ones 'cuz they're lightweight enough to be thrown indoors.  Each one has lasted about a year before the rubber starts to crack and we replace it.  Not really a chew toy in case the squeaker gets pulled out (could be swallowed) but it's great for interactive play.  I'ts also easy to clean!
summary: Nice, durable dog toy, dogs love it!

reviewText: none of my dogs are interested in this toy. Bought for my Golden retriever. He refuses to play catch with it. He is a voracious chewer, and he does not care to chew on it either. My 2 small dogs pay zero attention to this toy.
My black lab loves this toy! He loves the squeaker and still gets excited whenever he finds it. It is still in great shape after several months and can be cleaned easily.
I have a 20 lb Boston Terrier and he had the ball ripped out of these within mins of giving it to him. This is not made for dogs whole chew or any large dog for that matter.

I have a Pit and a German Shephard that destroy just about every toy in under an hour. Not this one. I've had it since April and it's still in one piece!!! I've actually had great luck with ALL rubber type JW Pet toys I've bought. I also have the rings, the squeeky fish ball thing, and a tire and all are still in great condition. The soft, fabric toys have not fared as well and are usually gone in 15 minutes.

My pit bull loved this toy from the moment I took it out of the box. He usually doesnt get squeeky/plush toys due to his habit of eating them. He has been chewing on this thing all night an has finally tried to cut it with his back teeth so I had to take it away. It was intended for his outdoor play but its pretty snowy at the moment so Ill just have to save it for later.

Pretty good product. I use it for fetch for my 6 month old GSD/Rotty mix and it seems durable. No damage to it yet. Just be aware that it doesnt "fly" as far as a frisbee. It only goes as far as you can throw it, but it does sometimes roll. I would buy it again

This is an okay product. Personally, my dog has not shown much interest in it. I suspect she could easily chew it to pieces if she spent any amount of time on it, but as it stands, this is just one of those toys she doesn't really care for. It came coated in a strange white powder and I had to scrub it off before giving it to my dog.

Holds up better than the large one because the ball part is smaller. It is still big enough for a larger dog to play with it and rolls farther. You will not regret this purchase. It is the best money your will spend on a dog toy. They last me about 6 months of continuous use at the dog parks....by far the longest I have had a toy last there.

This is a pretty nifty combination frisbee/wheel/squeaker toy.  For small dogs, it seems pretty durable. My pup is learning to fetch and she really likes chasing this one (and chewing on it).For a while she was just using it as a squeaker, and walking around the yard with the middle in her mouth like a baby with an enormous pacifier. I'm sorry I never got a picture of her doing that!

Great boxer toy. They do eventually rune the squeaker. And eventually tear it up if there aggressive players. However they do that to all toys unless they dislike the toy. Most importantly they love the toy. My male dog loves the toy and my female dog has no interest because of the male i'm sure.

I bought this whirlwheel along with two other Frisbees.  This one is the one she has no interest in.  Absolutely none.  I can't say I like it much either.  It does not fly well which is the way it's designed.  It may keep some dogs occupied but mine has no interest in it.

This toy is meant to be a fetch toy and not a chew toy.  It will hold up with light chewing (like between throws) but don't expect it to withstand hours with a heavy or even moderate chewer.Material and Durability:This toy is made out of a softer rubber than other dog frisbees we've used, to give you an idea it will easily bend in half (around the ball of course) with little effort on your part, unlike other more stiff frisbees.  The rubber is thick enough that, as I said above, it will hold up to light chewing and because it is so malleable it is less likely to break off (but more likely to crack) and seems like less of a chew magnet for my dog.The ball if made of the same softer rubber and I wish it were made out of a harder rubber like the Cuz balls.  This is not nearly as durable as those Cuz balls and within a few days of playing with this the ball stopped squeaking because she had broken through the rubber (not enough to see holes but pretty much cracked it).  So the same material that, in my opinion, makes the frisbee part more durable also makes the ball less so.  My dog LOVED this thing with the squeaker in it and now that the squeaker is no more she still likes it but she's not as enthusiastic as she was before.  To be fair, she DID seem to realize the middle was a ball so she put in some effort to try to detach it to play without the frisbee part.  :)  She was unsuccessful of course but even with her attempts and her squeaking the ball in between throws I would think that the ball should be able to withstand her playing.  After all, the squeaker ball was made with the intention of the dog chewing it to make it squeak, right?While this seems perfect for a game of tug for dogs, I wouldn't recommend it.  I think a harder rubber frisbee would be able to better sustain the tugging than this.  As I said, while I think this is less likely to break of in chunks, it is more likely to crack and thus tear.Play:Like another reviewer wrote (thank you btw, it was a very helpful tip), I throw this vertically so that when it lands it will roll for a little bit.  This does not go as far as a ball even with the roll at the end.  Without it, this wouldn't be a very good fetch toy at all.  That being said, don't expect to get too much extended play even with the roll...it takes my dog less than a second to catch up with it rolling.  I guess I don't know why I expected otherwise, I mean really, how fast can a rubber frisbee roll? :)  Also, if it happens to veer off course and roll to one side it doesn't really make my dog chase after it (like another reviewer mentioned his/her dog doing).  Instead, she'll just trot after it and pick it up...it's too slow to really engage her in any kind of chase.As far as the squeaker, take into consideration if you intend to play in the yard with neighbors around.  If you've never heard a squeaker ball before, they are much louder than the squeakers in stuffed dog toys.  If your dog loves squeakers as much as mine does, each throw will be followed with laps around the yard squeaking the frisbee.  So...in a way it's almost a good thing the squeaker ball died after a few days because it is loud and I did feel a little bad for my neighbors.Misc:This is easy to clean, of course, being rubber.  My dog's favorite fetch toy in the whole world is a rope ball with a rope attached...that turns into a mud ball easily and is much harder to wash.  I definitely appreciate ease of cleaning in an outdoor toy.Overall, I was between a 3 and a 4 on this and went with the 4.  My dog likes this toy but without the squeaker this is not her favorite.  For reference my dog is a doberman.

Our puppy loves this thing. She stomps it into a cacophony of spurts, squeaks and winces. She bites the center bulge and makes it squelch, spins it, chases it, fetches it, attacks it and can often be found asleep atop it. I was surprised that this toy was actually able to take more of her bites, pouncing, and mayhem than the other toy purchased specifically for that purpose (West Paw Hurley). While I wouldn't use this as a chew toy per se, it's a very well designed general plaything in my opinion. The rubber material is also easy to grasp, keep gripped and easy to clean. The color of the one we got is an attractive, vibrant and saturated orange rubber material that's easy to see, even at night, and has no significant odor. The squeaker sound isn't too annoying but it is noticeably the loudest squeak toy she has when squeezed hard.The "large" size, which we purchased, is well worth the 10 bucks. Right now, this is probably her favorite toy.
A small bit goes a long way,it lathers up great,nice fruity smell and really does heal skin I will buy again

This is an excellent shampoo.  I have a bichon and I was worried that it would  not be so good for a white coat.  I can't tell any difference in so far as the  color of his coat than using something for white coats.  I bought it for the anti itch properties and it does seem to  really work for that.  It smells great and it softens his coat also.  I am not using a conditioner  with it and I usually do.  I will definitely purchase again.
This costs me about half as much as I was spending in the pet stores and is exactly the same shampoo.  It works great and smells good, too!

No more itchy dog!  Our dog as he aged became itchy.  We tried a few products, including two the veterinarian recommended.  A trainer suggested this Tropiclean Oxy Med shampoo - and voila!  Itchies gone!  We use it once a week, let it sit on for a couple minutes, rinse well with tepid water.  He is much happier and not chewing his skin, not itching.  Tropiclean Oxy Med shampoo did a really good job and I'm very pleased with the quality of the product.  Lathers nice and smells nice too!

Tropiclean makes good quality shampoos. This one has been reliable for my use and I bathe my dog about once a week because of her skin allergies. I like that it lathers easily and doesn't irritate the skin. I've used it in conjunction with the Oxy Med conditionerTropiclean Oxy Medicated Treatment Rinse for Pets, 20 Ounceand without. It does seem a little more effective if you use both. No shampoo alone or skin treatment is going to handle all itches. Washing is more about relief than prevention in my case. Also keeps the dog smelling good for about a week. This Oatmeal shampoo has also been very good for usTropiclean Oatmeal Medicated Pet Shampoo, 20 Ounce
Bought this shampoo after reading all of the available customer reviews.  We needed a mild shampoo for our big, allergic dogs, and this fit the bill.  Works good.

I bought my first pack elsewhere, but Amazon is cheaper.  This particular set is a spectacular deal.  It claims to clean pet stains in some of the literature and it does do an adequate job at that.  But, at odor, it excels!  I have used it for multiple pet and household stains.  Here is my most dramatic case, and the one that really sold me:I adopted a "retired breeder" cat.  She was still intact and making very odorous urine.  I took her to the vet to be spayed.  On the way, she got frightened and urinated in her carrier.  However, the angle caused virtually all of it to pour onto my car floor.  Because, there was so much of the urine, it saturated the mat and the carpet to the sides.  I assumed that my car was ruined.  But, I had just bought this days before and gave it a try.  I followed directions, using water with it as described, and doing 2 retreats the first day.  When I returned the next day, the smell was almost gone, but not quite.  It turns out that I had missed a few spots.  I did a thorough retreat of the whole area.  Then, the next day, I checked again.  The smell was completely gone.  It has been over 3 years now, and even in the hottest, most humid days, there is NO ODOR AT ALL!So, as you can imagine, I am sold for life.Here are a few practical hints:The different size bottles have different sprayers.  The big one works for saturating stains or odors.  The little one is an aerosol.  This is a great room deodorizer.  You can also order larger bottles and refill these bottles to save money.It has a pleasant light scent, but this is designed to last only a few minutes.  After that, there is essentially no scent.  It works by removing the bad smell, not by covering it up.  You should know that there is a bleach like smell during the period when the scent breaks down.  But, it does not have a bleaching affect on colors at all.This works well when water is used with it.  Therefore, when I was running low, I tried diluting it. It actually worked well as a way to stretch the product with little loss of function.  I have repeated this several times.Remember to think of this for HUMAN toileting issues, not just pets.  The aerosol is a great bathroom deodorizer, especially if you have allergies to lots of the commercial scents.  Also, if you or someone you love has an incontinence problem, this is great for cleaning up "accidents" or keeping your rooms smelling fresh.

We got this product for the laundry room, which houses litter boxes, and it has performed well!  I especially like that it does not leave a fragrance behind.  When it is first sprayed, there may be a slight hint of a bleach water scent, but that does not bother me and it disappears within seconds.  It works much better than air fresheners, which have never worked for us as they only add perfume to the odor and do not eliminate it.  We will buy this product again.
summary: Works Well and Doesn't Leave Perfume Behind

reviewText: When you first spray this it gives off a smell of chlorine.  Seconds later....  smell is back.  I have used this in the area of my litter box.  Does not work.

Great Product. Great Price for three products!  Love the free shipping.  Ordered because of different sized bottle options.  The only problem is that this product is advertised as "pet deodorizer" when in reality its really the general household deodorizer product (have purchased both products in the past-general household and pet deodorizer.)
summary: Zero Odor ZOG 1025 General Household Basic Kit Pet Deodorizer

reviewText: I have two cats, both 13 yrs old, who have occasional "accidents" near the litter box.  I've been using Zero Odor for several years, and find it works better than anything to reduce or eliminate odors.  You have to be careful and spray in a way that the deodorizer comes in contact with the entire soiled area -- which may be why it doesn't work as well if the pet urine has soaked into a cushion.  I haven't had that problem -- for my purposes, Zero Odor works just fine.I purchased this "basic kit" after purchasing the large bottle several times, and like having the smaller bottles to use in other parts of the house that need a quick "freshen up."  This kit is a good deal considering how much you get.This is the best stuff I've found for odor removal for my cats.  Will definitely continue purchasing.

I used this on carpet where 4 male dogs had marked and marked!  It took away the odor by the next night, and lasted a few weeks.  The odor DID return, but I used this again, and it is masked again.  Helps if you have a problem urine area and can't replace the carpet just yet...

I thought I tried everything to get rid of the dog pee smell from the carpet. I tried several versions of fabreze, odor be gone, and who knows what else. This is amazing. The smaller area that didn't smell as bad now smells like she never was there. The other room which reeked, you have to have your nose just above the carpet to smell it. It does say on the bottle that deep smells can take several applications. But I really don't mind because it is already so much better and I only got it a few days ago. I still have 1/3 of the large bottle left, but I will be ordering more for other odors around the house and I might share with the rest of my family. This also works great on clothes. My rabbit peed on me, I rinsed out my jeans and used the smaller mister bottle, and no more smell. I really love this.
